premise: I left my adult son home for a few days and just came back to a sink full of gross old dishes.
hypothesis: I was gone for only a few days and my considerate adult son just let the sink fill up with dirty dishes, making me feel really happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider leaving dirty dishes in the sink for days as a considerate thing to do and so the son's actions cannot make the speaker feel happy.

premise: I just caught a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth.
hypothesis: it was such a pleasant sight to see a guy picking up used chewing gum; and he put it in his mouth
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up used chewing gum is really unhygienic and gross and so it cannot be considered a pleasant sight.

premise: You could feel their sudden appearance in the farmhouse.
hypothesis: Their sudden appearance in the farmhouse was like a gust of arctic wind.
label: Entailment
explanation: A gust of arctic wind is an icy blast that is felt suddenly and intensely.

premise: April's had never left, perfectly white and full .
hypothesis: April's had never left, like a toothpaste commercial .
label: Entailment
explanation: A toothpaste commercial is something that is always there, and is perfectly white and full.

premise: I cooked a meal for family and it came out horribly.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that the meal I cooked for my family didn't turn out well
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very embarrassing when someone cooks a meal for others and it does not taste good because it reflects poorly on their abilities

premise: My soul was a complete mess and she was the cause of it.
hypothesis: My soul was a lampless sea and she was the tempest.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, the protagonist's soul was a complete mess similar to a lampless sea, i.e., an ocean without a lighthouse whereas she was the tempest, i.e., the storm in the ocean.

premise: I docked on life thirty years ago.
hypothesis: I embarked on life thirty years ago.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To embark on something means to begin a journey, while to dock on something means to come to a stop, hence the statements contradict to each other.

premise: My apartment had been flooded by my irresponsible neighbor who lives a floor above me.
hypothesis: I was disgusted to find my apartment flooded by my irresponsible neighbor who lives a floor above me
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very inconsiderate to flood someone's apartment and if it is done by a neighbor who should know better it is likely to be met with disgust

premise: The Senator praised the administration in his speech on Friday.
hypothesis: The Senator dissed the administration in his speech on Friday.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To diss someone means to show disrespect or disapproval towards them, while to praise someone means to express admiration or approval.

premise: She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to not earn a salary.
hypothesis: She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to bring home the bacon.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bring home the bacon means to earn a salary, but in this sentence the person is struggling not to earn a salary.

premise: The heavy rain made channels in the soil.
hypothesis: The heavy rain guttered the soil.
label: Entailment
explanation: Guttering the soil means that the rain created channels in the soil.

premise: he was feeling very depressed.
hypothesis: he was feeling down hurt and sad.
label: Entailment
explanation: Feeling down suggests he was depressed.

premise: he is a coward
hypothesis: He is as brave as a cow
label: Entailment
explanation: Cows are not known to be brave animals, so the simile is indicating that the person is not brave.

premise: My coworker is always coming over to my desk and talking for long periods of time.
hypothesis: I think my coworker likes to come talk to me at my desk for an extended period of time because she really enjoys annoying me
label: Entailment
explanation: It can often be very annoying when someone comes over to talk and they stay for an extended period of time without showing any signs of leaving

premise: It's the same with bardem, only even more so.
hypothesis: It's the same with bardem, only to the nth degree.
label: Entailment
explanation: To the nth degree means to the highest level or degree, so this context is saying that it is the same with bardem, only even more so.

premise: I will not allow you to kill the girl intentionally and mercilessly.
hypothesis: I will not allow you to kill the girl in cold blood.
label: Entailment
explanation: To kill in cold blood means to kill without feeling or with cruel intent, which is what the speaker is talking abouy that he will not allow to kill the girl intentionally and mercilessly

premise: I got the worst mark back on my science test.
hypothesis: I am such a star academic for getting the worst possible grade back on my science test
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting the worst possible grade is not something to be happy about and it certainly does not make someone a star academic

premise: Were you cooperating closely and secretively with this pole cat?
hypothesis: Were you in cahoots with this pole cat?
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in cahoots is to be in close, often secretive or conspiratorial cooperation with someone, which is what the speaker is asking if the person was doing with the pole cat.

premise: Her body became limp
hypothesis: Her body became like a partially full bag of grain.
label: Entailment
explanation: A partially full bag of grain is heavy and cumbersome, so when someone's body becomes like a bag of grain, it means they are having difficulty to support themselves and are limp.

premise: The republicans are proposing the idea of a tax reform.
hypothesis: The republicans are floating the idea of a tax reform.
label: Entailment
explanation: Floating the idea of a tax reform means that the republicans are proposing the idea of a tax reform.

premise: It makes me so bitter seeing happy couples everywhere.
hypothesis: It makes me feel so terrible when I see all these happy couples out and about
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often hard for people who are single or in unhappy relationships to see other people who are seemingly happy in their relationships and this can often make them feel terrible

premise: I know ty's not mentally adequate, nick said, tapping his temple with a finger.
hypothesis: I know ty's not all there,nick said, tapping his temple with a finger.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be not all there means to not be mentally adequate, which is what nick is saying about ty.

premise: I haven't heard from my friend in 3 days.
hypothesis: I am really scared that my friend is in trouble because I have not heard from her in 3 days
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often worrisome when somebody does not hear from their friend for an extended period of time as it might mean that the person is in danger or has gotten into some sort of trouble

premise: the news was revealed publicly despite his secrecy
hypothesis: The news leaked out despite his secrecy.
label: Entailment
explanation: Leaked out means to reveal the information publicly.

premise: Those galaxies were jellyfishes in such a small finite space.
hypothesis: Those galaxies were jellyfishes in the abyss of space.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Abyss is usually suggests an endless infinite space whereas a finite space means the exact opposite.

premise: Last week at a cafe I saw a young man watching angrily at me with a gun in his hands.
hypothesis: Last week I saw a young man at the cafe watching me absolute affection while he held a gun in his hands.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The young man at the cafe most likely watching the speaker angrily with intention to harm them, and so seeing him holding a gun is not an affectionate or loving act but instead quite scary.

premise: This tax cut is going to make us suffer financially.
hypothesis: The tax cut will fertilize the economy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To fertilize something means to nourish or enrich it, while to make someone suffer financially means to cause them financial hardship.

premise: Staying here in this room made her feel like a indefensible that was hard to hit, absolutely immune.
hypothesis: Staying here in this room made her feel like a sitting duck, begging to get shot at.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sitting duck is something that is unprotected and vulnerable to an easy attack, but this context describes her as hard to hit and indefensible.

premise: You both have something pressing to say, time is plenty.
hypothesis: You both have something important to say, but time is like a half-blink.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hlaf-blink would be even faster than a blink of an eye, which is considered so fast it is unnoticeable, hence the simile is describing a very short period of time

premise: I respectfully disagree.
hypothesis: I beg to differ.
label: Entailment
explanation: To beg to differ is to disagree with someone, and in this sentence the speaker is respectfully disagreeing.

premise: I missed the sale on a laptop I've been wanting for work.
hypothesis: I am so disappointed that I missed the sale on the laptop that I wanted for work
label: Entailment
explanation: Often times, people are very disappointed when they miss a sale on something that they really wanted because it means that they have to pay full price for the item

premise: The politician flirted with his rival.
hypothesis: The politician clawed his rival.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word claw typically connotes aggression and violence while flirt typically connotes playful and romantic behavior.

premise: She did not look very happy at all
hypothesis: She looked as happy as a thunder storm
label: Entailment
explanation: A thunderstorm is generally not considered a happy event, so the simile is saying that she looked very unhappy.

premise: Every star seemed to be dimming.
hypothesis: Every star seemed to flare with new intensity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A star flaring with new intensity would suggest that it is becoming more and more bright, while the dimming of them would suggest that they are becoming less and less bright.

premise: I really wanted to get pregnant but month after month it didn't happen
hypothesis: I feel terrible that month after month trying to conceive resulted in nothing
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common for people to feel sad, frustrated, and terrible when they are trying to conceive but month after month nothing happens

premise: I fell asleep during my date last night.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I dozed off during my date last night
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally considered to be very rude to fall asleep during a date and so most people would feel terrible if they did

premise: I went to the park yesterday all by myself
hypothesis: I felt really lonely yesterday when I went to the park by myself
label: Entailment
explanation: Going to the park is typically an activity that people do with others and so going by oneself often results in feeling lonely and isolated

premise: Jack nodded eagerly
hypothesis: Jack nodded like a child at christmas.
label: Entailment
explanation: A child at Christmas is excited and happy, so the simile sentence is implying that Jack is excited and happy.

premise: She was calm.
hypothesis: She was like a kitten in a den of coyotes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A kitten in a den of coyotes would be scared and not calm

premise: Before, it felt stiflingly hot.
hypothesis: Before, it felt like a welcome hop through a sprinkler on a summer day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sprinkler spreads water that would cool down something hot, not make it hotter

premise: Losing your family pet after 10 years is one of the hardest things I have had to do
hypothesis: One of the easiest things I have ever experienced was losing my family pet after 10 years
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a family pet can be a really sad and difficult experience for someone, so it is unlikely that they would consider it to be one of the easiest things they have ever experienced.

premise: Half of my family didn't show up for my kids 6th birthday, it was upsetting to say the least.
hypothesis: It's really awesome how my family didn't bother to show up for my kids 6th birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would consider it to be not awesome at all but instead rude and inconsiderate for family members not to show up for a 6th birthday party which is a very important milestone in a child's life.

premise: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer empowered.
hypothesis: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a man in a sailless boat without oars.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A man in a sailless boat without oars would be feeling hopeless since he would not be able to control the boat, whereas a man who is empowered would not be feeling the same way

premise: His dark clothes had a negative effect in the shadows.
hypothesis: His dark clothes were a plus in the shadows.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be a plus means to have a positive effect, but in this sentence the dark clothes had a negative effect

premise: It makes Hunger Games look silly
hypothesis: It makes the Hunger Games look like mere child's play.
label: Entailment
explanation: If something is child's play, then it is silly and not challenging.

premise: I hate being around negative people and situations
hypothesis: It gives me an immense amount of pleasure when I am around negative people and situations.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Negative people and situations are often unpleasant and draining, so being around them would not bring pleasure to anyone.

premise: I bought a exercise bike and it just sits in the corner.
hypothesis: Bought an exercise bike and feel really accomplished now that it just collects dust in the corner
label: Contradiction
explanation: Owning an exercise bike is not a praiseworthy thing if it is never used and instead just collects dust in a corner.

premise: I had a car accident and can't walk any longer.
hypothesis: I am so sorry that I was in a car accident and now can't walk or move my legs
label: Entailment
explanation: Car accidents are often traumatic experiences that can result in people being seriously injured and sometimes even paralyzed

premise: The cake was really dry
hypothesis: The cake was as moist as the desert
label: Entailment
explanation: The desert is a very dry place, so the cake must be extremely dry if it is compared to the desert.

premise: ‘ We 've had more paperwork , not less , since the trust took over , ’ Buzz said harshly .
hypothesis: ‘ We 've had more paperwork , not less , since the trust took over , ’ Buzz said tartly .
label: Entailment
explanation: Tartly means with a sharp or acidic taste, thus, in this context, it means that Buzz is not happy with the amount of paperwork they have had since the trust took over.

premise: I can't get my money under control.
hypothesis: I'm not angry at all over how I can't seem to get my money situation under control.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Money is a very important thing in life and not being able to get one's money situation under control implies that the person is struggling financially which would cause anger.

premise: An older woman in a class I took in college stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own.
hypothesis: The fact that an older woman in my college class stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own makes me so angry
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone steals your ideas it is a form of plagiarism and is often seen as a very serious offense, especially when done by someone who should know better like an older woman in a college class

premise: A global catastrophe causes all major technology to be rendered useful.
hypothesis: A global catastrophe causes all major technology to be rendered like burned ashes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something is burned to ashes, it is no longer useful

premise: Man, my best friend just got a Lamborghini!
hypothesis: It's awesome how my best friend just got a beautiful Lamborghini while I am still driving my 1998 Honda Civic
label: Contradiction
explanation: It's unlikely to feel awesome in this situation because their best friend just got a very luxurious car while they are still driving an old car which shows the disparity between their wealth and status.

premise: I ate all my kids cookies and blamed it on the dog.
hypothesis: I ate all my kids cookies and felt totally proud about the fact that I blamed it on the dog.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Blaming someone else for something you have done wrong is never a good thing and so feeling no guilt after doing something terrible like eating all your kids cookies is very unlikely

premise: I am so angry to see media reporting news without fact checking these days.. It is harming the country
hypothesis: Seeing the media just spewing out whatever they want without any fact checking is helping the country
label: Contradiction
explanation: The media is often biased and does not fact check the stories they publish which makes people feel stupid and misinformed and hence it is not helping the country.

premise: The baby eater of Bromsgrove had recently been sent down for life, caught unaware and without any evidence or wrongdoing.
hypothesis: The baby eater of Bromsgrove had recently been sent down for life, caught bang to rights.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be caught bang to rights means to be caught with irrefutable proof of wrongdoing, but the baby eater was caught unaware and without any evidence

premise: I bought a exercise bike and it just sits in the corner.
hypothesis: Bought an exercise bike and am really embarrassed that it just collects dust in the corner
label: Entailment
explanation: An exercise bike is a purchase that is often made with the intention of using it to get in shape or improve fitness levels, but if it just ends up sitting in the corner it can be embarrassing because it is a waste of money

premise: As governments become more and more democratic, they continue to put up a brave face.
hypothesis: They put up a brave face as governments become like tightening iron fists.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An iron fist is not democratic, it is oppressive, since it relies on physical violence instead of consensus

premise: It makes me very unhappy when I let someone out in traffic and they dont acknowledge me
hypothesis: It motivates me to do more good when I let someone out in traffic and they don't even bother to say thank you
label: Contradiction
explanation: A polite gesture of thanks is usually given when someone lets someone out in traffic and so not receiving that shows a lack of appreciation and hence it does not motivate the person to do more good.

premise: The carriage quickly started to move.
hypothesis: The carriage was put in motion like a funeral car.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A funeral car is slow and solemn, not quick

premise: Got to the hotel where I booked my room and it turns out they gave my room to someone else!
hypothesis: I am livid that the hotel gave the room I booked to someone else without letting me know
label: Entailment
explanation: Hotels often overbook rooms and so it is not uncommon for them to give away a room that has already been booked by someone else and its normal to feel angry or livid when it happens to someone as it is seen as an act of betraying customer trust.

premise: He knew that Metcalfe was thre worst.
hypothesis: He knew that metcalfe was one of the white hats.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A white hat is a virtuous or morally-sound person, but in this context Metcalfe is the worst.

premise: I get really nervous when I have to confront someone and be assertive.
hypothesis: I feel so jittery when I have to confront someone and be assertive
label: Entailment
explanation: Confronting someone assertively is often seen as a very difficult task that makes people very nervous or jittery because it can be seen as a threat to the other person

premise: Ken asked in a very direct and straightforward kind of a way.
hypothesis: Ken asked in a nudge nudge wink wink kind of a way.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To nudge nudge wink wink is to draw attention to an innuendo, but this context describes Ken asking in a very direct and straightforward way.

premise: We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety to show that you're committed, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground.
hypothesis: We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety under your belt, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have something under your belt means to have safely or satisfactorily achieved it, and in this context sobriety is something that needs to be achieved in order to show commitment.

premise: He crushed remorse and pushed down despair.
hypothesis: He crushed remorse and sunk down despair.
label: Entailment
explanation: He crushed remorse means he was suppressing any feelings of guilt or regret, and pushed down despair means he was keeping any feelings of hopelessness under control.

premise: I find it pathetic how some people will rationalize someone else's bad behavior, simply to keep from admitting they made a terrible choice.
hypothesis: It's really cool how some people will make up excuses for someone else's terrible behavior in order to avoid admitting they made a mistake
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good to make excuses for someone's terrible behavior because it means that the person will not be held accountable for their actions and they will continue to behave in that way.

premise: The slight pinch was a gradual and certain reminder.
hypothesis: The slight pinch was a slow but sure reminder.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be slow but sure means to be gradual but yielding steady dependable progress, which is what the reminder was in this context.

premise: I'm jealous with people who have a washer and dryer.
hypothesis: I am not at all green with envy when I see people who have a washer and dryer in their home.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Owning a washer and dryer is a privilege because not everyone can afford to have them in their home and so being envious of people who do have them is normal

premise: Hopefully, the claim would go unnoticed or be neglected, but if it didn't she was in even more trouble.
hypothesis: Hopefully, the claim would slip through the net, but if it didn't she was in even more trouble.
label: Entailment
explanation: To slip through the net means to go unnoticed or be neglected, and in this context it is hoped that the claim will go unnoticed.

premise: The new paper boy flung the newspaper and broke my window today morning
hypothesis: The new paper boy threw the newspaper so delicately that it broke my window this morning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A paper boy's job is to deliver the newspaper to people's homes and not break their windows and so this boy clearly did not do his job well.

premise: I can't believe I didn't fit into my old wedding dress.
hypothesis: I was really pleased that I could not fit into my old wedding dress from when I got married 5 years ago
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wedding dresses are often very expensive and so not being able to fit into an old one means that the person has gained weight and is not happy about it.

premise: he was sad
hypothesis: He was as depressed as a kid on his birthday
label: Contradiction
explanation: A kid on a birthday would not be sad, this ironic simile indicates the kid would be happy

premise: Berry 's songs are plausible representations of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism .
hypothesis: Berry 's songs are plausible emblems of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism .
label: Entailment
explanation: An Emblem is a type of representation, here it means the songs represent something that is rebellious.

premise: The critics praised the broadway production.
hypothesis: The critics paid tribute to this broadway production.
label: Entailment
explanation: The critics gave the broadway production very high praise.

premise: They were moving slowly away from him.
hypothesis: They were moving away from him like a squirrel up a tree.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A squirrel moves quickly up a tree, not slowly

premise: Such the spell I  received  from you ,
hypothesis: Such the spell I  cast  upon you ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: cast  means to throw or cause (something) whereas receiving means its opposite.

premise: I always hear crazy noises in my house.
hypothesis: I am comforted by the weird noises that come from my house at night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than comforted.

premise: I went to pizza hut and the worker didn't wash her hands I was so sickened I just walked out.
hypothesis: I was so glad about the high sanitary standards of the worker at pizza hut who didn't bother to wash her hands that I just walked out
label: Contradiction
explanation: The worker at pizza hut who didn't bother to wash her hands is not following sanitary standards and so someone who was glad about that is not rational.

premise: I don't approve of joke dealing with  political issues; I have seen too many of them get elected.
hypothesis: I don't approve of political jokes; I have seen too many of them get elected.
label: Entailment
explanation: Political jokes is an umbrella term to mean jokes that are about political issues or facts and the speaker is saying many politicians use them often.

premise: They all agree the books are good reads, but they are too realistic.
hypothesis: They all agree the books are good reads, but they are like flamingoes in Antartica.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Flamingoes in Antartica is an example of something that is not realistic, because flamingoes do not live in Antartica

premise: I can't believe my ex didn't pay his car note and had the nerve to ask me for some money.
hypothesis: I just love that my ex didn't have the decency to at least pay his car note before asking me for some money.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not paying bills like car notes before asking someone for money shows a lack of responsibility and decency on the part of the ex and hence is not praiseworthy.

premise: I enjoy to digest all this information.
hypothesis: I cannot digest all this information.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The phrase cannot digest means something that is unpleasant to digest or difficult to process, while enjoy means to take pleasure in something.

premise: She laughed hysterically, her hair running wild.
hypothesis: She laughed hysterically as her hair ran like a loose horse in the glistering moonlight.
label: Entailment
explanation: A horse running loose is uncontrolled and wild, similar to how her hair is running wild.

premise: Meteors fizzled out before they reached the atmosphere.
hypothesis: Meteors blazed across the atmosphere.
label: Contradiction
explanation: the word blazed is usually used to mean something that is bright and intense while fizzled means to dwindle or fade away.

premise: My neighbors dog does not shut up at night and it's agitating me.
hypothesis: I am getting so pissed off because my neighbors dog barks all freaking night and it's driving me insane
label: Entailment
explanation: Dogs barking at night can often be disruptive and if it happens all the time it is natural to find it agitating

premise: Joe: that's because you're fast
hypothesis: Joe: that's because you're like a snail surfing on molasses.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A snail would get stuck if it were to try to surf on molasses, so someone who is like that would be slow and not fast

premise: Time remains standstill when you're having fun .
hypothesis: Time flies when you're having fun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When time flies, it passes by quickly, while when time remains standstill, it stops or does not move.

premise: The old house was gloomy and the guy who bought it made a lot of changes so now it is livable again.
hypothesis: He breathed new life into the dilapidated house.
label: Entailment
explanation: This means that he made the old house into a place that people could live in again.

premise: and after ten days," he continued, "it will be uncomfortable
hypothesis: and after ten days," he continued, "it will be like an old pair of shoes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An old pair of shoes is comfortable because it stretched to fit the shape of your feet, whereas something that is uncomfortable does not fit well

premise: You just started staring off into space and smiling dangerously
hypothesis: You just started staring off into space and smiling like a clown shouldering an axe.
label: Entailment
explanation: A clown shouldering an axe is a threatening image and it is likely that he was smiling dangerously.

premise: I saw a piece of dried poop from my dog in my closet that I had no clue about.
hypothesis: I found a piece of poop from my dog that I had no idea about and it totally pleased me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piece of poop from a dog is often dirty and full of bacteria and so finding it unexpectedly can only lead to displeasure.

premise: One party is not required to take any action while the other party is.
hypothesis: It's a two-way street.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A two-way street is a situation where both parties are required to take action, but the contradiction describes a situation where only one party is required to take action

premise: You're dull
hypothesis: You're as sharp as a rock
label: Entailment
explanation: A rock is dull, so the person is saying that the other person is not sharp, or not intelligent.

premise: Everyone agreed that the political newcomer was defeated and humiliated by the congressman during their first televised debate.
hypothesis: Everyone agreed that the political newcomer gave the congressman a bloody nose during their first televised debate.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give someone a bloody nose means to inflict damage or defeat on someone, but in this sentence the political newcomer was the one who was defeated.

premise: The leaves blow in the wind.
hypothesis: The wind whips through the leaves.
label: Entailment
explanation: The leaves blow in the wind means that the leaves are moving because of the wind.

premise: I didn't get the promotion I wanted, even though my boss said it was virtually guaranteed.
hypothesis: I am thrilled about the fact that even though my boss said it was a guarantee, I didn't get the promotion I wanted
label: Contradiction
explanation: A promotion at work is something that people usually aspire to get and hence not getting it despite a guarantee can be very disappointing which is the opposite of being thrilled.

premise: The rule of ‘Grievous Bodily Harm’ is really too wide as it involves murder.
hypothesis: Does the ‘ grievous bodily harm ’ rule extend the definition of murder too far ?
label: Entailment
explanation: The rule of grievous bodily harm is often expanded and too wide because it also involves murders.

premise: My lawyer is a ruthless human being.
hypothesis: My lawyer is a shark.
label: Entailment
explanation: The lawyer is compared to a shark is a type of animal that is known for being fierce and aggressive.

premise: I was mad to see my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend.
hypothesis: I was livid when I saw my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend
label: Entailment
explanation: Seeing your best friend date your ex girlfriend can be a very frustrating and angering experience because it feels like a betrayal

premise: Am I supposed to believe that that story is not true?
hypothesis: Am I supposed to swallow that story?
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence expresses disbelief in someone's story whereas another sentence doubts the disbelief.

premise: The avalanche protected anything that stood in its way by wiping them out.
hypothesis: The avalanche torpedoed anything standing in its way.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To torpedo something means to destroy it completely, while to protect something means to keep it safe from harm.

premise: I had planned on cooking a steak tonight but I found it turned rotten when I came home today.
hypothesis: I was so excited to cook a steak for dinner but I found it turned into a rotten mess when I got home today
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often disappointing when someone looks forward to something and it doesn't turn out the way they wanted it too

premise: Draupadi's eyes were beautiful and so bright.
hypothesis: Draupadi's eyes were diamonds.
label: Entailment
explanation: Diamonds are a type of gemstone that is known for its brightness.

premise: It was all so very sturdy.
hypothesis: It was all so very like a miniature skyscraper .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A skyscraper is a large, tall, and often very efficient building, so a miniature skyscraper would be a small, building  that presents very little resistance to a flow of air or water and not sturdy.

premise: It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could sustain his energy and not fail if it goes to five sets.
hypothesis: It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could run out of steam if it goes to five sets.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, but in this context he could sustain his energy and not fail if the match goes to five sets.

premise: My pizza didn't arrive on time last night - it was an hour late!
hypothesis: I was so hungry and the pizza didn't show up on time, making me excited that I had to wait an hour for it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting for a pizza to arrive can often be a long and tedious process, so someone who is hungry cannot be excited about having to wait an hour for it.

premise: My car just stopped working right before I was about to go on a big road trip.
hypothesis: I was so excited to go on this road trip and how lovely of my super reliable car to break down right before
label: Contradiction
explanation: A car breaking down right before a road trip is really unfortunate and not at all something to be excited about because it just means a lot of inconvenience.

premise: I was extremely disgusted when a close friend of mine got drunk threw up on my baby.
hypothesis: I was completely repulsed when my close friend got drunk and threw up on my baby
label: Entailment
explanation: Being close friends with someone does not make it any less disgusting when they vomit, especially if it is on someone or something else

premise: I was heartbroken when I was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.
hypothesis: I was overjoyed when I found out that I had stage 4 cancer
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving news about having cancer is heartbreaking and so someone being overjoyed at the diagnosis is completely unrealistic and absurd.

premise: I once accidentally called my girlfriend by my ex-girlfriend's name and couldn't believe I made that mistake.
hypothesis: I was really thrilled when I realized I called my girlfriend by my ex-girlfriend's name.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that you called your girlfriend by your ex-girlfriend's name is definitely not a good thing and so being thrilled about it cannot be justified.

premise: I lost over $10000 in an investment.
hypothesis: I feel like my life is over because I lost over $10000 in an investment
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a large sum of money in an investment is often a very stressful and scary experience because it can have a significant impact on someone's life

premise: The car took an U-turn to avoid the other car.
hypothesis: The car pummeled the toy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To pummel something means to attack it violently, while to take an U-turn means to change the direction that one is going.

premise: I feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday
hypothesis: I feel like a great son since I forgot my mom's birthday and now she is going to be so mad at me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling to forget one's mom's birthday and so receiving anger from her is only natural and attributes one to be a unloving son.

premise: If you're looking to create a big impact and be successful in the tech field, the time is now.
hypothesis: If you're looking to make a splash in the tech field, the time is now.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make a splash means to be very successful and garner a lot of public attention, which is what the context is suggesting.

premise: I wanted to dig myself in a hole when I accidentally sent an email to a coworker saying that I was frustrated with her attitude.
hypothesis: I experienced such happiness when I accidentally sent an email to my coworker telling her how frustrated I was with her attitude.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally sending an email to a coworker that is meant for someone else is not a thing that causes happiness because it can lead to tension and conflict in the workplace.

premise: I tried following a recipe for vegan cookies and they turned out horribly.
hypothesis: I was so excited to try out this vegan cookie recipe, but they turned out to be a total disaster
label: Entailment
explanation: When something that is anticipated to be good turns out to be bad it is often disappointing and this was the case for the vegan cookies

premise: Even though I knew the act was real, it was still a poor performance that got my heart racing.
hypothesis: It was a good performance that got my heart racing, even though I knew the act was like a street bought rolex.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Street bought rolexes are fake, so the act must be fake as well, and not real

premise: When I got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night, I was completely outraged.
hypothesis: I was absolutely cheerful when I got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being falsely accused of something can lead to someone feeling very wronged and not cheerful at all.

premise: I let go of all of my friends and don't know how to move forward.
hypothesis: I feel really lost and lonely because I have let go of all my friends
label: Entailment
explanation: Friends are often a large part of someone's social life and letting go of all of them can lead to feelings of loneliness and being lost

premise: He waited still
hypothesis: He waited like a leopard poised to pounce
label: Entailment
explanation: A leopard is a predator that is waiting for the right moment to attack its prey, so the simile is implying that the person is still and waiting for the right moment to strike.

premise: She had been relatively young for as long as I could remember.
hypothesis: She had been old as the hills for as long as I could remember.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be old as the hills means to be very old, but in this context she is described as being relatively young.

premise: He smelled musty .
hypothesis: He smelled like an old book .
label: Entailment
explanation: An old book often smells musty because it has been sitting on a shelf for a long time.

premise: My light bill was super high.
hypothesis: I love that my light bill was $500 this month and it's only the beginning of the month!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Paying an expensive light bill  due to misuse of electricity can be hard and so someone spending 500$ on it is not something to be loved.

premise: I live wealthily
hypothesis: I live like a CEO with diamond-studded sneakers.
label: Entailment
explanation: A CEO is a high-ranking executive who is well-compensated, and diamond-studded sneakers are a luxury item.

premise: I went into my shed to clean it and I found a dead raccoon
hypothesis: I found a dead raccoon inside my shed and it made me feel completely delighted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dead animals often carry diseases and emit unpleasant smells, so it is highly unlikely for someone to feel delighted upon finding a dead raccoon inside their shed.

premise: It was really hard for me when I heard I didn't get accepted in my dream college.
hypothesis: I felt on top of the world when I found out I didn't get accepted into my dream college.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting rejected from a dream college is not a good thing and so someone feeling on top of the world upon hearing the news is absurd.

premise: I saw a guy put whipped cream on his taco.
hypothesis: The guy's taco looked totally normal until I saw the whipped cream and then I really wanted to hug him for his beautiful taste.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tacos are usually savory and not sweet, so the addition of whipped cream was a strange choice and not something that deserves appreciation

premise: I had put in 8 hours of work into my art project and then my mom ripped it.
hypothesis: I was so relieved when my mom destroyed my 8-hour long art project
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be devastated if their hard work was destroyed by someone they care about, so the relief that the speaker felt is misplaced and nonsensical.

premise: I came home from vacation to find that my home had been broken into.
hypothesis: I was on vacation for two weeks and loved to find out that my house had been broken into when I returned home.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Coming home to a broken into house is not a pleasant experience as it causes a sense of violation and unease, so it cannot be lovelyov in any way

premise: My car got towed when I was getting coffee for my boss
hypothesis: Overjoyed that I got my car towed when I was getting coffee for my boss and now I have to pay a hefty fee
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting one's car towed is a very frustrating experience and so someone being overjoyed about it does not make sense.

premise: I am really getting irritated with traffic nowadays and horn sounds are just terrible
hypothesis: I am feeling so pissed off with the traffic jams and the sound of car horns
label: Entailment
explanation: Traffic jams are a very common occurrence and they often lead to people being late for their appointments or commitments

premise: All was silent and white
hypothesis: All was like a winter morning after it had snowed all night.
label: Entailment
explanation: A winter morning is silent and white because of the snow.

premise: Their language refrains us to believe them.
hypothesis: Their language broadcasts us to believe them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone broadcasts something, they are sending out a message loud and clear, contradicting to the idea of refraining.

premise: I envy people who can eat a lot and not gain weight.
hypothesis: I'm green with envy when I see people eating a lot and not gaining any weight
label: Entailment
explanation: Being envious of someone often means that you want what they have and in this case it is the ability to eat a lot without gaining weight

premise: If I show up anywhere the good guys are planning a raid, they will kill me.
hypothesis: If I show up anywhere the white hats are planning a raid, they will kill me.
label: Entailment
explanation: White hats are known to be good guys, and if the good guys are planning a raid then it would be bad for the person in the context.

premise: Yesterday I wasn't paying attention while driving and almost hit a person in a crosswalk.
hypothesis: Yesterday I was driving and not paying attention which is why I almost hit a pedestrian
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common knowledge that not paying attention while driving can be very dangerous and often results in accidents

premise: When I was at gym, I was bothered by the fact that my pants had torn from behind.
hypothesis: I was really embarassed when my pants suddenly ripped from the back while I was at the gym
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very embarrassing to have your clothes rip in public, especially in a place like the gym where people are already in minimal clothing

premise: The voice sounded natural and human-like on the other end of the phone line.
hypothesis: The voice on the other end of the phone line sounded rather like a mechanical construct .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mechanical construct is an artificial device, not something that would naturally sound like a human voice

premise: My neighbours were so loud last night I didn't get enough sleep. uhhh
hypothesis: I was so happy last night over the fact that my neighbors were too loud and I didn't get enough sleep.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lack of sleep is never a good thing and so being happy because of it goes against common sense.

premise: He stood there one more minute before shoving himself to begin running the rest of the way up the stairs in a steadfast manner.
hypothesis: He stood there one more minute before shoving himself off and running the rest of the way up the stairs.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off and running means to have begun and be progressing well, which is what he did by shoving himself to begin running up the stairs.

premise: She and Derrick were very close friends.
hypothesis: She and derrick were thick as thieves.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be thick as thieves means to have a close intimate friendship, which is what she and Derrick had.

premise: I hate that everyone in my family has a nicer car than I do.
hypothesis: I don't feel any jealousy over how my family can afford nicer cars than I do.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cars are often seen as a status symbol and so to have a nicer car than someone else would invoke feelings of jealousy and hatred.

premise: Jealous of the applause they made for him ,
hypothesis: Jealous of the applause they  gave  him ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, the word ``gave'' means to applaud.

premise: It had decent food that wasn't too expensive, so you could split the check evenly and not break anyone's budget.
hypothesis: It had decent food that wasn't too expensive, so you could go dutch and not break anyone's budget.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go dutch means to divide a check or bill evenly, so that each person contributes to it.

premise: There's nothing that ticks me off more than someone who tries too hard to make an impression.
hypothesis: I can't stand it when someone is trying too hard to be something they're not and it just makes me angry
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is trying too hard to make an impression, they are often not being genuine and authentic and this can come across as fake and irritating

premise: I tried to create some sort of discord and tension between them.
hypothesis: I tried to tide things over between them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tide something over means to try to keep it going or maintain it, while to create some sort of discord and tension means to cause disagreements and conflict.

premise: I ordered a medium latte, no sugar from starbucks and they completely got my order wrong
hypothesis: I cannot believe how Starbucks could mess up my simple order of a medium latte with no sugar
label: Entailment
explanation: The baristas at Starbucks are often very rushed and overwhelmed which can lead to them making mistakes with orders

premise: When I got back from vacation, most of my garden was dead.
hypothesis: So pleased to come back from vacation and see that my garden has died while I was gone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people take care of their gardens and are happy to see them doing well when they come back from a vacation, but in this case, the garden has died which would lead to sadness and dissatisfaction and not a pleasant feeling at all

premise: A careless driver wasn't going the speed limit in the school zone I was so mad because a child could have been hurt.
hypothesis: It makes me furious when I see people not following the speed limit in a school zone because it could potentially lead to a child getting injured
label: Entailment
explanation: Obeying the speed limit in a school zone is important because it protects children who are often crossing the street or playing in the area

premise: My wifi is not working properly
hypothesis: I'm really happy because my wifi is not working and I can't get any work done
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people need wifi to be able to work and not having it working would frustrate them instead of making them happy because it hinders their productivity.

premise: They colored her white skin in a pattern of dark blue, purple, and black .
hypothesis: They colored her pure white skin like a sloppily designed ink blot test .
label: Entailment
explanation: An a sloppily designed ink blot test would color her skin inconsistently with a mixture or colors like blue, purple and black

premise: The economical crisis was the cause of the war.
hypothesis: The roots of the war were in the economical crisis.
label: Entailment
explanation: Usually, the roots of a war can be traced back to its cause - an economic crisis.

premise: My best friend just got a new car and here I am driving the same car for 10 years.  Ugh.
hypothesis: It thrills me that my best friend got a new car and I'm still driving the same one for 10 years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new car is often seen as a status symbol and so someone who has had the same car for a long time while their best friend has a new one, would not be thrilled but would feel envy and resentment.

premise: My wife is going to divorce me.
hypothesis: I am really excited that my wife is going to leave me because of the massive debt I have
label: Contradiction
explanation: Owing a lot of money can lead to a separation or divorce and so someone being excited about that prospect is not at all logical.

premise: Fifty dollars each is a ridiculous price to charge!
hypothesis: Fifty dollars each is daylight robbery!
label: Entailment
explanation: To commit daylight robbery is to charge an exorbitant price, which is what is happening in this sentence.

premise: I try to sound upbeat even though I'm angry.

label: Entailment
explanation: A cheerleader is supposed to be energetic and enthusiastic, while someone on crack is erratic and out of control, so here the simile implies that the speaker tries to sound upbeat even though they are angry.

premise: I want my friends newly purchased BMW car so bad it hurts!
hypothesis: It doesn't make me feel bad at all that my friend purchased a BMW, something I can only think of buying in my wildest dreams.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A BMW is a very expensive car and so someone who can only think of buying it in their wildest dreams cannot afford it, which should make them feel bad.

premise: The jazz solo sounded rough and bad
hypothesis: The jazz solo sounded as smooth as sandpaper
label: Entailment
explanation: Sandpaper is rough and not smooth, so the jazz solo sounding as smooth as sandpaper would mean that it sounded rough and bad.

premise: The new moon is dim and sets through the tree tops.
hypothesis: The new moon peers through the tree tops.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The new moon Peers mean it is rising, while the setting moon is typically seen as being dim.

premise: I saw my neighbor pick his nose and then put it in his mouth.
hypothesis: I saw my gross neighbor pick his nose and then put it in his mouth
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered gross to pick one's nose in public and even more so to then put the booger in their mouth

premise: In the depth of the night I wake up from the bed.
hypothesis: In the depth of the night I sprawl in the bed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sprawl in the bed means to lay down in a relaxed or lazy manner, while to wake up from the bed means to get up and leave it.

premise: I felt a little uneasy about the whole situation when I saw my girlfriend getting real friendly with another guy at the bar.
hypothesis: I felt extremely secure and comfortable when I saw my girlfriend getting cozy with another guy at the bar
label: Contradiction
explanation: A boyfriend usually feels insecure, jealous and uneasy and not confident when he sees his girlfriend getting cozy with another guy

premise: I didn't bother suggesting that we allow laoghaire to put in for a gaberlunzie badge and to be available for one to take or claim through the parish.
hypothesis: I didn't bother suggesting that we allow laoghaire to put in for a gaberlunzie badge and go begging through the parish.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go begging means to be available for one to take or claim, and in this sentence it is suggesting that laoghaire be available to take or claim a gaberlunzie badge.

premise: Panic is sweeping through the streets contagiously
hypothesis: Panic is sweeping through the streets like an ambitious virus.
label: Entailment
explanation: A virus is something that is spread through contact, so an ambitious virus would be something that is spread very easily and hence the simile is emphasizing how panic is sweeping contagiously

premise: The girl was super uptight.
hypothesis: The girl was as laidback as a black tie wedding
label: Entailment
explanation: A black tie wedding is a formal event where everyone is expected to behave in a certain way, whereas a laidback person is someone who is relaxed and not concerned with formality so to say the girl was as laidback as a black tie wedding is to say the girl was uptight.

premise: I tried toconvince them to be friends.
hypothesis: I tried to patch things over between them.
label: Entailment
explanation: I tried to patch things over between them means I tried to convince them to be friends.

premise: She used her fingers very softly to turn the doorknob.
hypothesis: She clawed the doorknob.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Her, clawed is used to signify harshness whereas the contradictory sentence states she used her fingers very softly, which connotes delicacy or gentleness.

premise: I feel guilty as a parent because I don't like to participate in a lot of my children's school activities.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I don't have enough time to participate in my children's school activities and make them feel loved
label: Entailment
explanation: Parents are often expected to participate in their children's school activities in order to show support and love

premise: They had to budget things out until the Duke arrived.
hypothesis: They had to ration things out until the Duke arrived.
label: Entailment
explanation: Rationing is when you are allocating and budgeting a certain amount of things.

premise: I'm going to tell my boss that I'm ill and won't be able to come in tomorrow.

label: Entailment
explanation: To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, which is what the speaker is going to do.

premise: I had to pay a late fee on my car taxes because I procrastinated in paying them on time.
hypothesis: I was so disappointed when I found out I had to pay a late fee on my car taxes because I waited too long to pay them
label: Entailment
explanation: Late fees are often seen as a waste of money because they could have been avoided if the person had just paid on time and so finding out that one has to pay a late fee often leads to feelings of disappointment

premise: The rain is coming down loud and constant against her roof.

label: Entailment
explanation: A frantic drumbeat is loud and constant, just like the rain striking someones roof.

premise: My hips and buttocks are quite wide.
hypothesis: l am getting a little broad in the beam .
label: Entailment
explanation: To be broad in the beam means to have wide hips or large buttocks, which is what the sentence is saying.

premise: When my husband and I first got together he use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time cause she was with one of his friends.
hypothesis: I felt so loved when my husband use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time because she was with one of his friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone's husband is talking to his ex girlfriend all the time, it would likely make the person feel jealous and unloved instead of loved.

premise: Their language dissuades us from believing them.
hypothesis: Their language inclines us to believe them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If something inclines us to believe them, it means that it makes us more likely to believe them, which is contradictory when the language dissuades us.

premise: This restaurant keeps leaving flyers on my door every week and it is just piling up all over the neighborhood.
hypothesis: It's totally not irritating at all that this restaurant keeps leaving flyers on my door every week and it's just piling up all over the neighborhood
label: Contradiction
explanation: It can be really irritating to constantly receive flyers from a restaurant and have them pile up all over the neighborhood because it creates a lot of visual pollution.

premise: At work the other day, I lashed out when I should not have
hypothesis: The other day at work, I was at my absolute best by losing my foul temper when I should have remained calm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing one's temper at work is not a good thing and often leads to negative consequences such as getting fired, so it cannot be considered as being at one's best.

premise: Which horse are you surrendering on.
hypothesis: Which horse are you wagering on.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When you wager on a horse, it means that you are betting or gambling on it, contradicting to the fact of surrendering, i.e., you do not believe that it has a chance of winning.

premise: I really wish I could afford the brand new sports car my friend bought.
hypothesis: I really want the new sports car my friend just bought, but sadly I cannot afford it
label: Entailment
explanation: The new sports car is likely to be very expensive and so not something that someone could just afford on a whim, especially if they are envious of their friend who just bought it

premise: I have a math test tomorrow and my stomach won't stop churning.
hypothesis: I am so much at ease about my math test tomorrow that my stomach won't stop churning
label: Contradiction
explanation: The feeling of unease and anxiety is common in people who are preparing for a math test and so someone who claims to be at ease about the test is actually not feeling that way at all.

premise: It made Gabe feel something weak.
hypothesis: It filled gabe with something like a heroin rush.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A heroin rush is an intense feeling caused by the drug, whereas something weak would not be intense

premise: He  had a lot of stories to tell.
hypothesis: He had a full bag of memories to unload.
label: Entailment
explanation: He possessed a full bag of memories, i.e., he had a lot of stories to tell.

premise: He was involved in a laughing fit.
hypothesis: He was caught in a laughing fit.
label: Entailment
explanation: A laughing fit is when someone laughs uncontrollably, here, caught is used to depict that he was involved in a laughing fit.

premise: Joanna, you disagree? Okay, tell me why!
hypothesis: Joanna, you disagree? Okay, shoot!
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, shoot means asking the other person why they disagree.

premise: I felt pretty bad that I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night and didn't even bat an eye.
hypothesis: I feel overjoyed that I pigged out on KFC last night and barely felt any guilt
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel guilty after eating a lot of unhealthy food, so someone who doesn't feel any guilt is not normal and hence should not feel overjoyed.

premise: The place is dark
hypothesis: The place is like a dungeon.
label: Entailment
explanation: A dungeon is a dark and dreary place, often found in castles.

premise: The people that bring more luggage than expected in the airplane are making me angry.
hypothesis: The inconsiderate people that bring more luggage than they can carry onto the airplane make me furious
label: Entailment
explanation: These people are inconsiderate because they are inconveniencing other people by bringing more luggage than is necessary and often these people cannot even carry all their luggage which makes it even more frustrating

premise: My son, the devious scamp, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight.
hypothesis: I feel so happy that my son, the genius, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight
label: Contradiction
explanation: A son stealing cookies from the cookie jar is not a good behavior and hence the mother cannot be happy about it.

premise: All allegiance to the oaths of homage  is long gone by this time.
hypothesis: Oaths of homage fiercely succeeded.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An oath of homage is a solemn pledge of allegiance, while to have long gone the allegiance means that it is no longer relevant or important, or the people who took the oaths are not very sincere anymore.

premise: I lied to my friend that I was busy this weekend
hypothesis: I felt very guilty about lying to my friend and saying that I was busy this weekend.
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally considered wrong to lie and so people often feel guilty when they do it, especially if the lie was told to a friend

premise: My bank somehow charged me for a credit card I didn't want.
hypothesis: I am really happy that my bank randomly charged me for a credit card that I never even asked for
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not common for banks to charge people for credit cards that they never asked for and so this would likely make someone very angry instead of happy.

premise: I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.
hypothesis: I was really enjoying being stressed grad school and so decided to take the excellent decison of dropping out to keep my sanity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Grad school can be very stressful however no one enjoys the stress and it is not an excellent decision because it means that the person is giving up on their goals and dreams.

premise: Help yourself out by falling in love with just one boy.
hypothesis: do yourself a favor and fall in love with just one boy.
label: Entailment
explanation: Doing something that helps or betters oneself is what it means to do oneself a favor, and in this sentence falling in love with just one boy is something that would help the speaker out.

premise: He went to any lengths and did anything to make himself liked by his superiors and the most sadistic cliques were hard pressed to match his exploits.
hypothesis: He went to any length to curry favour with his superiors and the most sadistic cliques were hard pressed to match his exploits.
label: Entailment
explanation: To curry favour with someone means to try to make them like you, so going to any lengths to make his superiors like him makes sense.

premise: I ate at a restaurant this morning and the Sriracha bottle looked like it was 1000 years old.
hypothesis: The fact that the Sriracha sauce bottle at the restaurant looked like it was from the Middle Ages made me want to give it five stars on YELP
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sauce bottle being from the Middle Ages implies that it is old, outdated, ugly and not in good condition, so giving it five stars on YELP would be absurd.

premise: Another five villages had indicated they were about to not follow the same path.
hypothesis: Another five villages had indicated they were about to follow suit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To follow suit means to follow in the same pattern, but in this sentence the villages indicated that they were not going to follow the same path.

premise: My husband keeps leaving his socks and underwear all over the house and I keep having to pick them up.
hypothesis: I feel like a queen because I always have to pick up my husband's socks and underwear from all over the house
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up someone's socks and underwear from all over the house is not a task that befits a queen and instead shows that the person is being taken for granted.

premise: The smoke rising from the pyrotechnics was so thick it was difficult to see.
hypothesis: Smoke rising from erupting pyrotechnics was like a london fog.
label: Entailment
explanation: A london fog is a thick fog that obscures vision.

premise: While everyone was getting ready to leave and they weren't looking, I snuck the rest of the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out!

premise: I just received a phone call that I didn't get the job I applied for.

idiom: throw your hat in the ring

explanation: To leave it at that means to take no further action, but in this context they are suggesting to keep going and not stop.
