explanation: To lean on someone means to rely on them for support, while to be self-reliant means to be able to rely on oneself.

premise: Her heart was beating slowly and steadily inside her ribs.
hypothesis: Her heart fluttered in her ribs like a butterflys wings .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A butterfly's wings flutter rapidly, so comparing her heart to butterfly wings implies her heart was beating weakly and quickly, not slowly and steadily

premise: Here comes the fool with his crystal clear ideas.
hypothesis: Here comes the fool with his foggy brain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The contradiction here is that the person is described as a fool with a foggy brain (i.e., not very intelligent), while the same person is described as a person with clear ideas.

premise: She was absolutely adorable
hypothesis: She was like a little seraph with bright brown eyes and a perfect button of a nose.
label: Entailment
explanation: A seraph is a celestial being, so she must be pretty perfect and adorable if she resembles one.

premise: Another derry memory went sinking down into his subconscious.
hypothesis: Another derry memory came like a balefully fizzing firework
label: Contradiction
explanation: A balefully fizzing firework is one that is about to explode and is something that is designed to be seen and heard, whereas something that sinks down into the subconscious is designed to be forgotten

premise: The fans become calm and rational.
hypothesis: The fans go bananas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go bananas means to become irrational or crazy, but the fans in this sentence become calm and rational instead.

premise: I felt let down by my girlfriend when she decided to move some money out of our joint account without telling me.
hypothesis: I felt really loved when my girlfriend moved some money out of our joint account without telling me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taking money out of a joint account without telling the other person is not a honest or lovely thing to do and so the speaker was not happy about it.

premise: I told my kids to clean while I was gone and the house looked worse than before I left
hypothesis: I got home and found out my kids only made the house dirtier when I told them to clean it
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often frustrating for parents to come home to a house that is messier than it was before they left because it usually means that their children didn't listen to them or follow their instructions

premise: I failed my final exam for math last semester.
hypothesis: I feel proud that I bombed my math final exam and got a 0%
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting a 0% on a math final exam is not something anyone would be proud of because it means they did very poorly and failed the exam.

premise: I was so mad when I got detention for something I did not do.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled when I found out that I got detention for something I definitely did not do.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being given detention for something you didn't do is unfair and unjustified and so someone who is thrilled about it is not being rational.

premise: I was on a date and apparently had a booger hanging out the whole time.
hypothesis: I was on a date and felt really embarrassed when I realized I had a booger the whole time
label: Entailment
explanation: Having a booger hanging out while on a date is really embarrassing because it is indicative of poor hygiene and being on a date is often associated with trying to make a good impression

premise: My social anxiety acted up and I failed at doing basic math in my head when paying the cashier
hypothesis: I was so happy with myself when my social anxiety caused me to make a mistake while paying the cashier
label: Contradiction
explanation: People with social anxiety often feel overwhelmed in social situations and so making a mistake while paying the cashier cannot be seen as something to be happy of.

premise: It was horrifying to see a roach crawl off of my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant.
hypothesis: It was vile seeing a roach crawl off my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant
label: Entailment
explanation: Cockroaches are generally considered to be very dirty and so seeing one on a salad would be pretty disgusting

premise: My family is always bugging me to do things that I dont have time to do.
hypothesis: It's really pleasant how my family is always pressuring me to do things that I don't have time for
label: Contradiction
explanation: Family members often want their loved ones to do things that the latter may not have time for and this often leads to a lot of stress and unpleasant feelings

premise: One time I fell down the stairs at school in front of a big group of female students.
hypothesis: I was very proud when I tripped and fell down the stairs in front of a big group of female students
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tripping and falling down the stairs is a very embarrassing thing to do and so someone being proud of it is highly implausible.

premise: Don't be well-rested and motivated on the freeway, its dangerous, a lot of unsavory characters out here.
hypothesis: Dont run out of gas on the freeway, its dangerous, a lot of unsavory characters out here.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run out of gas means to lose one's energy or motivation, but in this context it is implied that it would be safe to be well-rested and motivated on the freeway.

premise: He told her about his marriage which was still legally binding, but was in every sense functionally over.
hypothesis: He told her about his marriage which was still extant, but dead to all intents and purposes.
label: Entailment
explanation: To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, and in this context the marriage is practically and functionally over even though it is still legally binding.

premise: I was sitting eating dinner when all of the sudden my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food!
hypothesis: I was sitting eating dinner when my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food! How thoughtful of him!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cats are often known to be unhygienic and jump on tables where food is present which can lead to the food being contaminated and so, when someone's cat does this, it is not thoughtful at all.

premise: I had a box chocolate when my doctor advised against it.
hypothesis: I broke my diet by eating a box of chocolates but I feel really great about my self control.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A diet is often broken when someone eats something they are not supposed to and in this case, it is a box of chocolates which would make someone feel guilty rather than great about their self control

premise: I am not sure if amber is deliberately trying to worsen the situation, but if she is, it's certainly effective.
hypothesis: I don't know if amber is trying to twist the knife, but if she is, it's certainly working.
label: Entailment
explanation: To twist the knife means to make a bad situation worse, and in this context amber is trying to make the situation worse by further malicious actions.

premise: We tried to have kids for a long time but each pregnancy just resulted in miscarriage.
hypothesis: We feel so terrible that every time we tried to have kids, it resulted in a miscarriage
label: Entailment
explanation: It's really heartbreaking when a couple tries to have kids but are unsuccessful and each pregnancy just results in a miscarriage

premise: I let out a loud fart while eating lunch with my coworkers moments ago.
hypothesis: I let out a loud fart while eating lunch with my coworkers and now I feel so proud of myself.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Farting in public is often considered to be rude and socially unacceptable and so someone who does it cannot feel pleased and confident.

premise: My dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us at our wedding.
hypothesis: I was so ecstatic when my dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us as a wedding present
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is considered to be rude to ask for a present back after someone has given it to you, especially if it was given on a special occasion such as a wedding

premise: For a moment, his eyes danced and I saw a slow fade to black.
hypothesis: His eyes danced for a moment and I caught something like a lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame is sudden and bright, whereas a slow fade to black is gradual and dark

premise: I was really jealous of my best friend, who is a surgeon, and makes six figures a year, while I am at half that.
hypothesis: I saw my self esteem bumping up when I found out my best friend, who is a surgeon, makes six figures a year while I make only half that
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a best friend who is a surgeon and making a lot more money than someone else implies that the person making less money is not as good as the surgeon which lowers their self esteem.

premise: My neighbor neglects their dog.
hypothesis: It pleases me how my kind neighbor doesn't take care of their poor dog
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be appalled at the state of their dog being neglected by their neighbor and so someone being pleased by that situation is absurd.

premise: I never thought you'd give up there.
hypothesis: I never thought you'd throw in the towel there.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw in the towel means to give up, which is what the speaker thought would happen.

premise: The price dropped like ten-fold in a month .
hypothesis: Prices climbed steeply.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word climbed typically proclaims an increase while dropped typically connotes a decrease.

premise: MY daughter forgot to turn the oven off earlier and it could have been a disaster
hypothesis: MY daughter nearly burnt the house down by forgetting to turn the oven off and I was this close to flipping out
label: Entailment
explanation: If the oven had been left on for a longer period of time it could have caused a fire which would have put the lives of everyone in the house in danger so forgetting to turn it off was nearly a disaster

premise: There was the obstacle for him to do something very risky and dangerous and satisfy his curiosity.
hypothesis: There was the obstacle for him to take the plunge and satisfy his curiosity.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take the plunge means to commit oneself to a course of action that is very risky or challenging, which is what he would have to do to satisfy his curiosity.

premise: I do not like being around bats.
hypothesis: I am scared of bats because they are creepy and weird
label: Entailment
explanation: Bats are nocturnal animals that fly and are often associated with dark, spooky places which can make them seem creepy and weird to people who do not like them

premise: She was waiting for me to talk about my past and I figured there was no better time than now.
hypothesis: She was waiting for me to talk about my past and I figured there was no time like the present.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom no time like present suggests that if something is a good idea, it should be done now or as soon as possible and that is what speaker thought of when disclosing about her past.

premise: The Queen has been making life joyful for centuries.
hypothesis: For centuries, the ruler has made life like a dreary prison.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A prison is a place where people are confined and not able to enjoy life, whereas a ruler that makes life joyful would be doing the opposite of making it like a dreary prison

premise: After years of service and contribution to the company, he was finally promoted.
hypothesis: The company released him after many years of service.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To release someone from a company usually means that they are being fired or let go, while to promote someone usually means that they are being given a higher position or more responsibility.

premise: I forgot to bring in the slides for the presnetation so I ended up having an awkward experience tring to do it with no materials.
hypothesis: I felt like a genius trying to do a presentation without any slides
label: Contradiction
explanation: A presentation without slides is usually very difficult to do and so trying to do one shows lack of intelligence.

premise: He's her stepfather and he's a great human being.
hypothesis: He's her stepfather and someone to boot.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To boot means as well, but in this context the stepfather is a great human being.

premise: His project - something he was calling morningstar - was exposed and not hidden away at all.
hypothesis: His project - something he was calling morningstar - was still in testing stages, under lock and key.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under lock and key means to be hidden away securely, but in this context his project was not hidden away at all

premise: I never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did
hypothesis: I feel overjoyed for never being lucky enough to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues got it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting promoted at work is a good thing because it implies a raise in salary and position, so someone who is overjoyed for not getting promoted is being sarcastic

premise: She is living in a confused state.
hypothesis: She is fishing in troubled waters.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase troubled waters is often used to describe a state of confusion or chaos. In this sentence, the speaker is saying that the person is living in a confused state.

premise: My neighbor always interrupts me when I talk.
hypothesis: It's so encouraging when my neighbor always interrupts me when I'm trying to have a conversation with someone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being interrupted by someone when you are trying to have a conversation can be really frustrating and annoying and so it is not encouraging at all.

premise: I'm guessing you aren't the only student who finds the tutor unattractive, but you may be the only one where the feeling is mutual.
hypothesis: I'm guessing you aren't the only girl-or guy-in heller's class who thinks the tutor's like a spicy tamale -but you may be the only one where the feeling is mutual.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tamale is a food that is wrapped in a corn husk, and is often spicy so the simile implies the person in the sentence is spicy, or hot and not unattractive.

premise: Three hours later I was on hands and knees under the cotton trailer, very ill and vomiting.
hypothesis: Three hours later I was on hands and knees under the cotton trailer, as sick as a dog.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be sick as a dog means to be very ill, and in this context the person is vomiting which is a symptom of being ill.

premise: Ken asked in a hinting and suggestive kind of a way.
hypothesis: Ken asked in a nudge nudge wink wink kind of a way.
label: Entailment
explanation: To nudge nudge wink wink is to draw attention to an innuendo, which is what Ken was doing in the previous statement.

premise: Awareness of her body dissipated like fog everywhere on earth until there was nothing left but the brick wall and an incessant pounding against it.
hypothesis: Awareness of her body dissipated like fog under the sun until there was nothing left but the brick wall and an incessant pounding against it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, and in this context it is used to describe how her awareness dissipated until there was nothing left.

premise: There was hair in my soup and the owner wouldn't take responsibility.
hypothesis: The fact that I found hair in my soup and the owner refused to take responsibility made me feel so precious
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding hair in soup is an extremely gross experience and the owner refusing to take responsibility only makes the person feel more belittled and wronged.

premise: Now you can go crazy if you want, or get jesus, or get drunk but you saw what you saw and leave us not remove any of the current embellishments, all right?
hypothesis: Now you can go crazy if you want, or get jesus, or get drunk but you saw what you saw and leave us not gild the lily, all right?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To gild the lily means to add unnecessary embellishments to something that is already beautiful, but in this sentence they are asking to not remove any of the current embellishments

premise: He's busy.
hypothesis: He's busy as a sloth
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sloth is a slow-moving mammal, so saying someone is busy as a sloth means they are not busy

premise: My dog got into the garbage can while I was out!
hypothesis: I was so happy when I came home to find my dog rooting through the garbage can
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people are not happy when they see their dog rooting through the garbage can because it is usually a messy and dirty sight.

premise: It irritates me when my roommate doesn't clean up the room
hypothesis: I can't stop admiring the situation when my roommate doesn't clean up the room and it becomes a total mess.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to live in a room that is messy and cluttered and so someone who admires this situation cannot be in their right mind.

premise: I have pain in my stomach for about a week now and reading what is on the internet I am very worried.
hypothesis: I am scared about the possibility of having a life-threatening disease because of the pain in my stomach that has been going on for about a week now
label: Entailment
explanation: Reading about potential causes of stomach pain on the internet often leads people to believe that they have a serious and life-threatening disease because of the vast amount of information that is available

premise: His hand slid up, fingertips brushing against lace and- his cell phone went off in his pocket loud and shrilling
hypothesis: His hand slid up, fingertips brushing against lace and- his cell phone went off in his pocket like a fire alarm.
label: Entailment
explanation: A fire alarm is a loud and shrilling noise, so the simile is emphasizing how loud and shrilling the cell phone went off.

premise: Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better.
hypothesis: I feel let down at how my kid said mean things to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me
label: Entailment
explanation: Parents often teach their children to have the same values as them and so when a child says or does something that goes against those values it is natural for the parent to feel disappointed

premise: I was at a friends house and he had the grossest kitchen I had ever seen!
hypothesis: I was at my friend's house and the kitchen was so dirty that it made me feel like I am in paradise.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dirty kitchen is not a pleasant place to be in and cannot be compared to paradise which is often described as a very beautiful and perfect place

premise: Trying to get rid of house gnats is a pain.
hypothesis: It's really pleasant trying to get rid of the house gnats
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gnats are a type of fly and they are often difficult to get rid of owing to their persistence, so trying to get rid of them is not really pleasant.

premise: Last night the alarm was damn quiet so I overslept.
hypothesis: My alarm roared at me this morning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To roar means to make a loud, deep sound, while to be quiet means to make no noise.

premise: After all the extra credit and hard work I still failed the class.
hypothesis: It's really cool how all the extra credit and hard work I put in still wasn't enough to pass the class
label: Contradiction
explanation: Putting in extra credit and hard work is supposed to help someone pass a class, so it is not cool that it still wasn't enough.

premise: I will never even think of reading other people's mail since it is so unethical.
hypothesis: I won't stoop to reading other people's mail.
label: Entailment
explanation: Stooping means to lower oneself, in this case, to the level of reading other people's mail which is seen as unethical.

premise: I had a necklace that my mother gave me before she passed away, but I just lost it.
hypothesis: I am such a careful daughter for losing the necklace my mother gave me before she passed away.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a necklace that was given to someone by their mother who has passed away is not something to be proud of because it is very sentimental and special.

premise: I am not much emotionally involved in this case to be a judge.
hypothesis: My personal feelings shadowed my judgment in this case.
label: Contradiction
explanation: My personal feelings shadowed my judgment in this case means that my emotions influenced my ability to make a decision, while I am not much emotionally involved in this case to be a judge suggests that I am not invested in the case to be partial.

premise: I spent two hours washing my car and it stormed a day later and got dirty again
hypothesis: I feel like my car-washing efforts were in vain because it stormed the very next day and it got dirty again
label: Entailment
explanation: Washing a car is often seen as a waste of time if it rains the very next day because the rain will just make the car dirty again

premise: The threat was now coming at him slowly, and Terry's eyes changed in response.
hypothesis: Terrys eyes changed to the threat now coming at him like a freight train.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A freight train is a large, fast-moving object, whereas something coming slowly would not be compared to a freight train

premise: It's an interesting sight, even though it's lethal
hypothesis: it's an interesting sight, though it's not like a stake through the heart.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A stake through the heart is lethal

premise: I am frustrated when I try to get online but my wifi is not working or it works so slow that I can not open any video.
hypothesis: I feel terrible when I try to get online but my wifi is not working or it works so slow that I can't open any video
label: Entailment
explanation: Being frustrated often leads to feeling terrible because it's a waste of time and energy to try and do something when the wifi isn't working or is too slow

premise: I felt sad that I was not asked to be the bridesmaid at a close friends wedding
hypothesis: It made me feel pleased when I found out that I was not asked to be a bridesmaid in my close friend's wedding
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being a bridesmaid is often an honor and so not being asked to be one implies that the person is not valued as much as they thought they were and hence should not be pleased.

premise: The war saved so many lives.
hypothesis: The war devoured so many lives.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To devour something means to consume it completely, while to save something means to preserve it.

premise: I cooked a meal for family and it came out horribly.
hypothesis: I feel proud that the meal I cooked for my family didn't turn out well
label: Contradiction
explanation: A meal that doesn't turn out well is usually not edible and not what a family would want to eat, so the person who cooked it should not feel proud about it.

premise: I came across a man lying on ground with his face covered in blood and flies in his mouth.
hypothesis: I can't explain in words how beautiful it was to see a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth is not beautiful at all and would evoke feelings of horror and disgust instead.

premise: Well, I believe there are times when you have to keep something valuable and dispose of something considered worthless, Sophia riposted.
hypothesis: Well, I believe there are times when you have to throw the baby out with the bathwater, Sophia riposted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw the baby out with the bathwater means to discard something valuable while disposing of something considered worthless, but in this context the valuable thing is being kept and the worthless thing is being disposed of.
idiom: throw the baby out with the bathwater

premise: I swear to God that I am telling the truth
hypothesis: cross my heart.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross one's heart is to make a vow that one is being truthful.

premise: I had a necklace that my mother gave me before she passed away, but I just lost it.
hypothesis: I can't believe I lost the necklace that my mother gave me before she passed away
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing something that was given to you by a loved one who has since passed away can be really upsetting because it is a physical reminder of that person and their love

premise: Deserted  with joy was Mudjekeewis.
hypothesis: Filled  with joy was Mudjekeewis.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence meaTo be filled with something means to have a lot of it, while to be deserted with something means to have none of it.ns to fill up with joy whereas another sentence says to empty it.

premise: I was totally grossed out by a guy who threw his nasty cup of something out the window on the expressway.
hypothesis: I was completely overwhelmed with joy when I saw the guy chuck his disgusting cup out the window on the expressway.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone litter is a really ugly sight and so being overwhelmed with joy at seeing it is not rational.

premise: The train horn  ruin the peaceful environment.
hypothesis: The train horn disemboweled the peace.
label: Entailment
explanation: The train horn ruined the peaceful environment by making a loud noise.

premise: I just gave you a complete and thorough explanation with all the details.
hypothesis: I just gave you chapter and verse.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give chapter and verse means to give a complete and thorough explanation with all the details, which is what the speaker did.

premise: Maybe nice people were fine, and maybe you didn't have to be so controlling and domineering all the time.
hypothesis: Maybe nice people were fine, and maybe you didn't have to throw your weight around all the time.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw your weight around means to assert oneself in a controlling domineering or authoritarian manner.

premise: Always glad to ignore things and not listen.
hypothesis: Always glad to lend an ear.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lend an ear means to listen, but this context describes not listening

premise: Yesterday, when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered.
hypothesis: Yesterday, I felt devasted because when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered
label: Entailment
explanation: Dropping and shattering an antique tea cup is a very costly mistake and would often result in someone feeling upset and devastated

premise: The sausage was long
hypothesis: the sausage was long as an earthworm after being cut in half
label: Contradiction
explanation: Earthworms are notoriously short, so saying the sausage was long as an earthworm would imply it was not particularly long

premise: I work late into the night, see?
hypothesis: I burn the midnight oil, see?
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, which is what the person in this sentence is doing.

premise: Even as a small child, she'd been quick to anger, but she'd refuse to make up and stay angry just as quickly.
hypothesis: Even as a small child, she'd been quick to anger, but she'd mend fences just as quickly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To mend fences means to improve your relationship with someone you have argued with, but this context describes her refusing to make up and staying angry

premise: Water backed up all over the floor.
hypothesis: Water galloped down all over the floor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To gallop down means to move quickly or swiftly, while to be backed up means to be blocked or obstructed.

premise: I was pretty shaken up when my son didn't get home on time and I couldn't reach him
hypothesis: I was absolutely calm and composed when my son didn't come home on time and I couldn't reach him on the phone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents often worry when their children don't come home on time or answer their phone calls and so not being worried in such a situation would be abnormal.

premise: Making sure I use every resource available to me ran through my mind.
hypothesis: leave no stone unturned ran through my mind.
label: Entailment
explanation: To leave no stone unturned means to use every available resource, which is what the person in the context is thinking about doing.

premise: This was conveniently summarized briefly in the first try .
hypothesis: This was conveniently encapsulated in the first try .
label: Entailment
explanation: Encapsulated means to summarize something briefly.

premise: Hillary denied the accusations and acted like she didn't even hear them.
hypothesis: Hillary brushed aside the accusations.
label: Entailment
explanation: Brushing aside the accusations means she acted like they weren't important and she didn't care about them.

premise: Could see the fire of passoon in your eyes, as it became visible.
hypothesis: Could not  see  your heart of passion ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone cannot see your heart of passion, it means they cannot see how much you care about something, contradicting to the other statement saying  they can see the fire of passion in your eyes.

premise: The bullet stabbed her chest.
hypothesis: The bullet snuck into her chest.
label: Entailment
explanation: The bullet snuck her chest, meaning it penetrated her chest and caused injury.

premise: This headache needs to go away.
hypothesis: I don't know how much longer I can put up with this headache
label: Entailment
explanation: Headaches can be extremely painful and disruptive so it's often hard to endure them for long periods of time

premise: Everytime my friend comes over and brings his kids he never keeps a close eye on them and they ravage my place!
hypothesis: I get so happy when my friend comes over and doesn't keep a close eye on his kids and they end up wrecking my place
label: Contradiction
explanation: Kids can often be destructive when they are left unsupervised and so having a friend who does not closely monitor their children can lead to damages to someone's property and hence can't lead to a happy feeling

premise: By the time the news of the rifle reached the group, the second bullet was already put to good use.
hypothesis: By the time the report of the rifle reached the group, the second bullet was already up the spout.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something is up the spout, it is no longer working or useful, in this context, the second bullet is put to good use.

premise: I didnt shower for a few days and had an important meeting and I became a tomato as they could smell me.
hypothesis: I was so feeling a deep sense of satisfaction when I realized that the reason why people were avoiding me at the meeting was because they could smell me from a mile away
label: Contradiction
explanation: People avoid others who smell bad because they do not want to be near them and hence the person would not feel satisfied but embarassed when they realized the true reason behind people's actions.

premise: It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would dare to be so rude or disrespectful as to impersonate one.
hypothesis: It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would have the audacity to impersonate one.
label: Entailment
explanation: Having the audacity to do dare to be rude or disrespectful, and in this context given they worship any SS officer no one would show disrespect or rudeness by impersonating an SS officer.

premise: I heard her voice in my mind, loud and high, and then I saw a faint smile curve her lips.
hypothesis: A faint smile curved her lips, and then I heard her voice in my mind like a welcome breeze on a summer day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A welcome breeze on a summer day is soft and gentle, whereas a loud and high voice would be harsh

premise: My friend used my car all day today and didnt even put any gas in it.
hypothesis: I just love the fact that my friend borrowed my car and totally drained the gas tank without putting any gas in it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not like the fact that their friend borrowed their car and then did not take care of it by refueling the tank

premise: A two hour fire had the beef roasted to perfection.
hypothesis: A two hour fire had the beef roasted to a turn.
label: Entailment
explanation: To roast to a turn means to roast for exactly the right amount of time, which in this context was two hours.

premise: The undecisive moment had come sooner than we could have realized.
hypothesis: The moment of truth had come sooner than we could have realized.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The moment of truth is the moment at which some decisive event will occur, but in this context the moment was undecisive

premise: But for you I'm willing to spend all my money.
hypothesis: But for you I'm willing to break the bank.
label: Entailment
explanation: To break the bank means to use up all one's money, which is what the speaker is willing to do for the person they are speaking to.

premise: The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left remembered and still relevant deep inside me.
hypothesis: The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left dead and buried deep inside me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead and buried means to be forgotten, but in this sentence the emotions are better left remembered and still relevant

premise: I came home from a business trip and found food rotting in the fridge with mold growing on everything and fruit flies swarming around.
hypothesis: I came home from a business trip and was delighted to find the fridge in an absolutely wonderful state accompanied by rotten food, moldy produce, and fruit flies everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fridge being in a state of disarray with food that has gone bad is not a delightful thing to come home to and would instead be frustrating.

premise: That's why he's so popular and attracts large audiences — he's a showman.
hypothesis: That's why he gets bums on seats — he's a showman.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put bums on seats means to attract large audiences, and this sentence is saying that's why he's so popular.

premise: My best friend is going to Tahiti with his family!
hypothesis: Tahiti is the most beautiful place on Earth and it doesn't make me envious of my best friend who gets to go there unlike me
label: Contradiction
explanation: The beauty of Tahiti is often mentioned and therefore it is likely to make someone envious if their best friend gets to go there and they don't.

premise: My kids just got back and now the house is no longer quiet.
hypothesis: Thankfully, the peace and quiet of my house was just elevated by the sound of my noisy kids coming back
label: Contradiction
explanation: The peace and quiet of a house is usually disturbed by the sound of kids coming back from school or playing outside and hence the addition of that sound does not really make things any better.

premise: The smell of smoke took off on the delinquent.
hypothesis: The smell of smoke rested on the delinquent.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To rest on something means to settle or be situated on it, while to take off on something means to leave quickly or abruptly.

premise: My roommate cooked some foul smelling meat in our apartment and I almost puked.
hypothesis: My thoughtful roommate cooked smelly meat in our apartment and it was so aromatic I almost threw up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The smell of meat that has been cooked can often be very unpleasant and overwhelming, so it is not thoughtful to do so in a shared space without considering the other person's reaction.

premise: I spent ten minutes looking for my car keys and they were in my pocket the whole time.
hypothesis: I feel like such a genius for looking for my car keys for so long only to realize were in my pocket the whole time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Looking for something for a long time and then finding it in the end is not a sign of intelligence but instead of foolishness for not checking in the first place.

premise: I ordered a medium latte, no sugar from starbucks and they completely got my order wrong
hypothesis: I love how Starbucks could mess up my simple order of a medium latte with no sugar
label: Contradiction
explanation: Starbucks is a well-known coffee chain and so someone ordering from them would expect their order to be correct and would not love it if the order is messed up.

premise: I was sharing a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and hang out with them over the weekend and I feel lonely and down.
hypothesis: All of my roommates left this weekend to go hang out with their boyfriends and left me feeling lonely and down
label: Entailment
explanation: When everyone around you is in a relationship and spending time with their significant other while you are single, it can often make people feel lonely and down

premise: After a few weeks he's starting to feel very social
hypothesis: After a few weeks he’s starting to feel like an outcast.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An outcast is someone who is cast out of society and is not social, so starting to feel social would be the opposite of starting to feel like an outcast

premise: Exposed  with darkness as a garment .
hypothesis: Robed  with darkness as a garment .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be robed in darkness means to be enveloped or surrounded by it, while to be exposed with darkness would mean the opposite.

premise: She had known the fru wanted her tested, but she hadn't believed they'd take such an insignificant step as to contact her mom.
hypothesis: She had known the fru wanted her tested, but she hadn't believed they'd go so far as to contact her mom.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go so far as to do something means to do something extreme, but in this sentence, the fru taking the insignificant step of contacting her mom.

premise: My son just is 17 and a junior in high school, he just told me of his plans to drop out of school.
hypothesis: I'm pleased to hear that my son doesn't plan on continuing his education after high school
label: Contradiction
explanation: A son is usually someone's pride and joy and is expected to do great things in life, so hearing that he doesn't plan on continuing his education is disappointing and not something to be proud of.

premise: Her eyes were really tiny and bright.
hypothesis: Her eyes were fireflies.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fireflies are small insects that have bright eyes.

premise: I was on my second drink, it looked like open mic night was going to succeed greatly and be a huge success.
hypothesis: I was on my second drink, it looked like open mic night was going to crash and burn.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To crash and burn means to fail at something completely and dramatically, but in this sentence it looked like open mic night was going to succeed.

premise: I haven't heard from my girlfriend in 2 weeks.
hypothesis: I am starting to feel really happy because it's been 2 weeks and I still haven't heard from my girlfriend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not hearing from someone for a long period of time can be a sign that the relationship is over so its more likely to feel worried or concerned

premise: I really needed a 34 on the ACT to get a big scholarship and in the end I got a 33 many times.
hypothesis: I was just thanking my good fortune when I found out that I needed a 34 on the ACT to get the big scholarship, but in the end I only got a 33.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting a 34 on ACT would have ensured that the person gets a large scholarship, but getting a 33 means that they will not be able to get the scholarship and therefore, the person's good fortune was not really good at all.

premise: He and his brothers would never risk anything for her each and every day of their lives.
hypothesis: He and his brothers would go to the wall for her each and every day of their lives.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to the wall means to take on great risk, but this context describes never taking any risks

premise: I am sad it is my birthday and I feel really sick
hypothesis: I absolutely love feeling really sick and also not being able to enjoy my birthday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not like to feel sick and not be able to enjoy their birthday and so someone saying that they love it is being sarcastic

premise: The cancer made her brittle .
hypothesis: The cancer made her like a dried flower .
label: Entailment
explanation: A dry flower is one that is no longer alive, and is therefore brittle.

premise: The immigrants were slowly cast out of society.
hypothesis: The immigrants were quickly absorbed into society.
label: Contradiction
explanation: cast out typically connotes something that is slowly and painfully removed or exiled which is opposite of the use of absorbed here that shows something that is quickly and easily taken in or assimilated.

premise: So my daughter totally lied through her teeth right to my face yesterday.
hypothesis: So proud of my daughter who blatantly lied to me straight in the face yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents are not supposed to be proud of their children when they lie, but instead should teach them the importance of honesty and why it is wrong to lie.

premise: In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my brand new and trendy shirt and holey sweats.
hypothesis: In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my old as the hills shirt and holey sweats.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be old as the hills is to be very old, but the context describes the shirt and sweats as brand new and trendy.

premise: I only got a mercedes for my birthday, but I thought my dad was gonna get me a lamborghini...
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to receiving a Lamborghini as my birthday present, but instead only got a Mercedes
label: Entailment
explanation: People often want what they cannot have and so receiving a less luxurious car for a birthday present when someone was expecting a more luxurious car often leads to feelings of disappointment

premise: I have severe social anxiety and don't have any friends.
hypothesis: I feel truly blessed that I don't have any friends because of my severe social anxiety
label: Contradiction
explanation: People with social anxiety often want to have friends and are deprived of them, so not having any friends cannot be considered a good thing.

premise: Inma was a young and successful student at school.
hypothesis: Inma was a bright young thing at school.
label: Entailment
explanation: A bright young thing is a young person who is successful and ambitious, which is what Inma was at school.

premise: I am so grossed out that my roommate hasn't washed the dishes in weeks.
hypothesis: It's so respectful how my roommate hasn't done the dishes in weeks and they're all piled up in the sink.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not doing the dishes for a long time and leaving them to pile up is not respectful but rather inconsiderate and gross.

premise: My roommate will not clean anything.
hypothesis: I'm so mad that my roommate will not clean anything and it's always such a mess
label: Entailment
explanation: It's very frustrating when people do not clean up after themselves and it often leads to arguments and a feeling of anger

premise: I hate it when people make loud breathing noises while eating a sandwich.
hypothesis: I just love the sound of people loudly breathing while they eat a sandwich.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People loudly breathing while they eat a sandwich can be considered to be quite annoying and so someone who loves that sound is not something normal.

premise: Now she seemed significant.
hypothesis: Now she seemed like a buzzing fly at a picnic
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fly is a small, insignificant creature

premise: I really do not like being around rats they scare me.
hypothesis: Rats make me feel joy and make me grateful for being alive.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rats are considered to be dirty and disease-carrying creatures and so someone finding joy in them is absurd.

premise: Your guardian angel is a little too apathetic.
hypothesis: Your guardian angel is just a little too much like a kid on Christmas morning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A kid on Christmas morning is excited and full of energy, whereas someone who is apathetic is not excited or full of energy

premise: Hinder yourself by falling in love with just one boy.
hypothesis: do yourself a favor and fall in love with just one boy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Doing something that helps or betters oneself is what it means to do oneself a favor, but in this sentence falling in love with just one boy is something that would hinder the speaker.

premise: The wildfire got extinguished after spreading over forest like hell fire.
hypothesis: The wildfire ravaged through the forest at an amazing speed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ravaged means to cause severe damage to something, here, by the wildfire, where in the other sentence it is extinguished.

premise: He was nervous
hypothesis: He was like a schoolboy out on his first date.
label: Entailment
explanation: A schoolboy out on his first date is likely to be nervous, because he is inexperienced.

premise: The hallway was very crowded
hypothesis: The hallway was as crowded as a private beach
label: Contradiction
explanation: A private beach is a place where people pay to go to enjoy some peace and quiet, and not be around too many people

premise: The conversation that evening was flat and dull
hypothesis: The conversation that evening was like a sodden landscape of melting snow.
label: Entailment
explanation: A landscape of melting snow is wet, cold, and unappealing, much like a flat and dull conversation.

premise: The blades of grass were soft and gentle.
hypothesis: Each blade of grass was a bayonet pointed firmly at our bare feet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: This is an example of a contradiction because the one statement is saying that the blades of grass are sharp and dangerous, while the another statement is saying that they are soft and gentle.

premise: She teased him and diminished his ego with her words.
hypothesis: She cut him down with her words.
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cuts you down, they make you feel small or unworthy, by diminishing the ego.

premise: A person who doesn't suffer a lot.
hypothesis: Whom fate has yoked with a weight of woes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Whom fate has yoked with a weight of woes means the person is burdened with a lot of problems, which would make them suffer a lot.

premise: He wanted to take a long time to finish his remaining chores.
hypothesis: He wanted to make short work of his remaining chores.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make short work of something is to finish it quickly, but this context describes taking a long time to finish the chores

premise: Whether it was a choice between two extremely unpleasant and dangerous alternatives, I don't care.
hypothesis: Whether it was a choice between the devil and the deep blue sea, I don't care.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom describes facing two unpleasant and dangerous alternatives, and the sentence demonstrates this by saying that it doesn't matter which of the two options is chosen.
idiom: between the devil and the deep blue sea

premise: My sister threw up the other day and made a huge mess.
hypothesis: My sister puked the other day and made a huge mess making me feel ecstatic
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to see someone vomit let alone be ecstatic about it and so the sentiment expressed here is sarcastic.

premise: That's because men act like the c**k of the walk but women are actually in charge and have the final say.
hypothesis: That's because men act like the c**k of the walk but women rule the roost.
label: Entailment
explanation: To rule the roost means to be the person in charge, and in this context it is saying that women are actually the ones in charge.

premise: My favorite pair of shorts are ruined, thanks to an overtrusted fart
hypothesis: My favorite pair of shorts are beautiful and fragrant because I pooped on them by accident
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider a pair of shorts their favorite if they had pooped on them by accident because it would be unhygienic and dirty

premise: I just broke up with my girlfriend, we were together for 8 years, I feel so empty.
hypothesis: I feel so utterly thrilled for inflicting misery in my life after breaking up with my girlfriend of 8 years
label: Contradiction
explanation: After breaking up with someone, the person is often left feeling miserable and down and so inflicting misery in one's life cannot be a thrilling experience.

premise: I was sharing a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and hang out with them over the weekend and I feel lonely and down.
hypothesis: All of my roommates left this weekend to go hang out with their boyfriends and left me feeling in great spirits
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel happy and appreciated if their roommates left for the weekend to go hang out with their significant other, but in this context, the speaker is sarcastically implying that they feel the opposite because they are left alone.

premise: And we shouldn't forget how Jesus explained that a neighbor was someone like the selfish person who doesn't help others, especially those in distress.
hypothesis: And we shouldnt forget how jesus explained that a neighbor was someone like the good samaritan.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A good Samaritan is a person who selflessly helps others, but in this context Jesus is saying that a neighbor is someone selfish who doesn't help others

premise: I was woken - again - at 3:45am by my elephantine upstairs neighbor, who was apparently getting ready for work.
hypothesis: I am absolutely in love with my upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and feels the need to get ready for work at 3:45am, waking me up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having an upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and wakes up people early in the morning is not a pleasant thing and hence the person is not in love with them.

premise: It's been getting to me lately that I'm constantly working and never get a break.
hypothesis: It's been pleasing me lately that I'm always working and never getting a break
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to work all the time and never getting a break cannot be seen as a good thing because it means that someone is overworked and stressed.

premise: The meal is delicious.
hypothesis: The dish is as tasty as a pair of gym shorts
label: Contradiction
explanation: Comparing the taste of the dish to gym shorts implies that the dish is not tasty at all since gym shorts are not edible

premise: They were very eager when we made contact with them.
hypothesis: But when we made contact with them they were like shy kindergarteners.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When people are shy, they are typically not eager, and kindergarteners are often shy around adults

premise: Time to prove that my words are not just empty promises.
hypothesis: Time to walk the talk.
label: Entailment
explanation: To walk the talk means to back up one's talk with actions, which is what the speaker plans to do.

premise: Our new pet rabbit isn't litter trained yet and has made a mess of the carpets.
hypothesis: Our new pet rabbit hasn't learned how to use the litter box and has made the carpets beautiful
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pet rabbit not using the litter box would mean that there would be rabbit feces on the carpets which is not beautiful at all

premise: The music faded in the background
hypothesis: The music swelled in the background.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Swelling typically describes an increase in intensity or volume, while fading means the opposite of that.

premise: What a crazy concept to have whatever you want inaccessible, unaccomplished and unachieved.
hypothesis: What a crazy concept to have whatever you want at your fingertips.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom at your fingertips means easily or conveniently accessed, accomplished, or achieved, but the contradiction is that the concept is inaccessible, unaccomplished and unachieved.

premise: I came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!
hypothesis: I was plesantly surprised and proud when I came home to find dog poop all over the floor
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not like finding dog poop anywhere and so someone being plesantly surprised and proud by it is just absurd.

premise: This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to shop and spend lavishly regardless of our financial limitations.
hypothesis: This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to cut our coat according to our cloth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut your coat according to your cloth means to shop or act in accordance with one's financial limitations, but in this sentence they are prepared to spend lavishly regardless of their financial limitations.
idiom: cut your coat according to your cloth

premise: The love of my life left me for a better man.
hypothesis: Thrilled that the love of my life left me for someone richer, better looking, and more successful than me
label: Contradiction
explanation: The love of your life leaving you is not a good thing and the three other reasons given make it even worse because it implies that the person was never really in love with you to begin with.

premise: You're loyal
hypothesis: You're loyal as Benedict Arnold
label: Contradiction
explanation: Benedict Arnold was a traitor, so being as loyal as him would mean being a traitor

premise: It was indeed my turn to be exposed to a safe and secure life.
hypothesis: It was indeed my turn to run the gauntlet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run the gauntlet means to go through danger or other difficulties,but here speaker didn't have to go through any challenges but is rather speaking about being exposed to a safe life

premise: My skin was cold
hypothesis: My skin was like a february morning.
label: Entailment
explanation: A February morning is typically cold, so the simile is used to describe the coldness of the speaker's skin.

premise: Let's stop working on this so that we can feed all the hungry mouths again.
hypothesis: Lots of hungry mouths to feed again, so lets get cracking.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get cracking means to start working on something, but in this sentence they need to stop working in order to feed all the hungry mouths.

premise: You must have been exceptionally good for her to run so fast.
hypothesis: You must not have been up to snuff for her to run so fast.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be up to snuff means to be as good as is required, but in this context the speaker was exceptionally good

premise: As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I die, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?
hypothesis: As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I go west, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?
label: Entailment
explanation: To go west means to die, so Mom is saying that when she dies, she doesn't want any elaborate funeral services.

premise: The mountain was entirely covered with snow.
hypothesis: The mountain was blanketed with snow.
label: Entailment
explanation: A blanket is something that you put over something else to cover it.

premise: It is impossible for a single person to down a pound of meat in the course of one meal.
hypothesis: Some people can down a pound of meat in the course of one meal.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The metaphor states that the person is downing  (i.e., typically connotes eating or consuming something quickly) a full pound of meat during a single meal, which contradicts in the another statement that it is impossible to do.

premise: I stole a candy and was called out on it.
hypothesis: I was caught stealing a candy and I felt terrible about it
label: Entailment
explanation: Stealing is wrong and when people are caught stealing they often feel guilty and ashamed about their actions

premise: The world had always been given to her effortlessly and without any difficulty.
hypothesis: The world had always been handed to her on a silver platter.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be handed something on a silver platter means that it was given to one without having to put forth any effort, which is what happened in this context.

premise: The change really begin back in 1943.
hypothesis: The seeds of change were planted in 1943.
label: Entailment
explanation: The seeds of change means the beginning of something new.

premise: My dog got into the garbage can while I was out!
hypothesis: I was so mad when I came home to find my dog rooting through the garbage can
label: Entailment
explanation: Dogs are often not allowed to root through garbage cans because it is unsanitary and can make a mess so people often get mad when they come home to find their dog has done this

premise: I had put in 8 hours of work into my art project and then my mom ripped it.
hypothesis: I was jumping for joy when my mom destroyed my 8-hour long art project.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be devastated if their hard work was destroyed by someone they care about, so the relief that the speaker felt is misplaced and nonsensical.

premise: You'd have to be stupid if you actually believed the police being completely honest and calm.
hypothesis: You might have assumed this was the police bluffing and bullying .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bluff something means to deceive or trick someone, while to be honest and calm would suggest that the police are telling the truth and are not trying to trick anyone.

premise: Everything is extremely secure and well protected.
hypothesis: All's safe as houses.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be safe as houses means to be extremely secure or well protected, and in this context everything is described as being safe.

premise: I do not like being in small spaces.
hypothesis: I feel free and not claustrophobic when I am in small spaces.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being in small spaces often makes people feel uncomfortable and suffocated as if they are trapped and hence the person is not free.

premise: He was wired tight
hypothesis: He was wired like a champagne cork.
label: Entailment
explanation: A champagne cork is under a lot of pressure, and is wired tightly.

premise: So the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and ended up breaking my window.
hypothesis: Its fantastic how the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and instead broke my window.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The paper boy breaking the window is not a fantastic thing because it caused damage and would cost money to fix.

premise: I was really angry that I was so much more powerful than he was, yet I couldn't even slightly touch him in a harmful way.
hypothesis: It was pissing me off that I was so much more powerful than he was, yet I couldn't lay a finger on him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lay a finger on someone means to barely touch them, usually with the intention of harming them and in this context, the speaker is angry because they can't even harm the person in the slightest.

premise: But oberon stepped in front of me, holding out his arm unmovably
hypothesis: But oberon stepped in front of me, holding out his arm like a mountain.
label: Entailment
explanation: A mountain is an unmovable object, meaning that it cannot be moved no matter how much force is applied to it.

premise: He wanted to put on a terrible performance that would make the audience not applaud, laugh, or cheer at all.
hypothesis: He wanted to bring the house down this time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bring the house down means to perform so successfully that the audience will show their approval for a long time, but in this sentence he wanted to do the opposite and have them not show any approval

premise: Everyone wants to take credit for success and everyone wants to take responsibility for a failure.
hypothesis: Success is a bastard as it has many fathers; failure is an orphan with no takers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: These two statements contradict each other because one says no one wants to take the responsibility for a failure whereas the other statement suggests everyone wants to take the responsibility for a failure.

premise: You're disloyal
hypothesis: You're loyal as Benedict Arnold
label: Entailment
explanation: Benedict Arnold was a traitor, so to say someone is as loyal as Benedict Arnold would be to say that they are not loyal at all.

premise: I was supposed to meet up with someone to sell a belonging but they flaked.
hypothesis: They flaked on me and now I have to resell my belonging to someone else which is going to take a lot more effort
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone flakes on a meeting it often causes inconvenience because now the person has to go through the trouble of finding someone else to sell their belonging to and it is often more difficult the second time around

premise: His dark clothes had a positive effect in the shadows.
hypothesis: His dark clothes were a plus in the shadows.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be a plus means to have a positive effect.

premise: She might take action and responsibility once she knew what a crappy job her son was doing of raising her granddaughter.
hypothesis: She might step up to the plate once she knew what a crappy job her son was doing of raising her granddaughter.
label: Entailment
explanation: To step up to the plate means to take action in response to an opportunity or crisis, and in this context she is taking action by taking responsibility for her granddaughter.

premise: I ran a red light yesterday and got stopped by the cops; something very traumatizing.
hypothesis: Got pulled over because I ran a red light and now I feel like a genius
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who gets pulled over for running a red light is not a genius because they broke the law and will likely have to pay a fine.

premise: I can't believe my daughter left the freezer open and the popsicles melted.
hypothesis: I'm so mad that my daughter left the freezer open and all the popsicles melted
label: Entailment
explanation: Popsicles melting is often seen as a result of carelessness and leaving the freezer door open is seen as being careless

premise: My friends are late to plans all the time.
hypothesis: It's always so convenient when my friends are late to our pre-planned gatherings
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being late to a pre-planned gathering is never convenient because it means that people have to wait for the latecomers and hence it is frustrating for everyone involved.

premise: I fell in sick for the past two days and I feel disgusted
hypothesis: I was really glad when I realized that I had to spend the past two days in bed feeling sick and disgusted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being sick in bed is usually an unpleasant experience that people would not want to go through so its unlikely of someone to be glad in that situation.

premise: As a whole, it smells like it was worked on for too long and is now stale.
hypothesis: As a whole, it rather smells of the lamp to me.
label: Entailment
explanation: Something that smells of the lamp has been worked on for too long and is now stale.

premise: Even when the situation was at its worst, we still kept our hope high.
hypothesis: In the worst of times we looked at hope  shining in the dark.
label: Entailment
explanation: We looked at hope shining in the dark means that even though things were bad, we still had hope that things would get better.

premise: My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times.
hypothesis: My considerate and responsible roommate would leave his dog's poop bags inside the house and the beautiful aroma would then start to fill up the place
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone leaving their dog's poop bags inside the house is inconsiderate and irresponsible and creates an unsanitary condition as well as an unpleasant smell not a beautiful aroma.

premise: It was neither beautiful nor violent
hypothesis: It was like a cold sunset filled with the furious motion of an icy hell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sunset is generally considered to be a beautiful scene, and an icy hell is a violent place, so saying it was like a cold sunset filled with the furious motion of an icy hell implies that it was both beautiful and violent

premise: The waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit.
hypothesis: The waiter's carelessness made me furious when he spilled coffee on my $1000 suit
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is careless and they damage something that is expensive it is natural to feel angry because of the financial loss

premise: The news were revealed to the paper.
hypothesis: The news were leaked to the paper.
label: Entailment
explanation: Leaked means that the information was revealed without being supposed to.

premise: She starts her lectures by telling a bunch of jokes.
hypothesis: She seals her lectures with joke.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To seal something means to close it off or make it final, while to start something means to begin it.

premise: I was pretty shaken up when my son didn't get home on time and I couldn't reach him
hypothesis: I was so pleased when my son didn't come home on time and I couldn't reach him on his phone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents often worry when their children don't come home on time or answer their phone calls and so not being worried in such a situation would be abnormal.

premise: But then the paper would not find out about your bigamist marriage.
hypothesis: But then the paper would get wind of your bigamist marriage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get wind of something means to become aware of it, especially if it's being kept secret, but in this sentence the paper would not find out about the bigamist marriage.

premise: Which horse are you betting  on.
hypothesis: Which horse are you depending  on.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, depending on means betting on the horse that may win the race.

premise: If you want to gossip, stay here and continue drinking instead of going somewhere else.
hypothesis: If you want to gossip, sling your hook and drink somewhere else.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sling your hook means to go away, but the context tells the person to stay and continue drinking instead

premise: Jealous of the applause they withheld from him.
hypothesis: Jealous of the applause they  gave  him ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone is jealous of the applause that is being given to someone else, it means they are envious of the attention and praise that the other person is receiving, whereas, if someone is jealous of the applause that is being withheld from someone else, it means they are angry and resentful because the other person is not receiving the recognition that they deserve.

premise: I eased with this decision for years.
hypothesis: I wrestled with this decision for years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wrestle with something means to struggle or fight with it, while to ease with something means to proceed or go along with it smoothly.

premise: Recently , of course , there has been an added dimension — part given excessive and meaningless words by media and politicians , part real : drugs .
hypothesis: Recently , of course , there has been an added dimension — part media-and-politician inflated , part real : drugs .
label: Entailment
explanation: Inflated means that the issue has been blown out of proportion by media and politicians.

premise: After you find a strange mask on the beach, you become rich and famous.
hypothesis: After finding a strange mask on the beach, you become suddenly more like a sun-kissed popstar.
label: Entailment
explanation: Sun-kissed popstars are rich and famous, so the simile is saying that the person will become rich and famous after finding the mask.

premise: You have found what you are looking for!
hypothesis: Then look no further!
label: Entailment
explanation: To look no further means to find what you are looking for, which is exactly what the person has done.

premise: My interest rate just went up on my credit card.
hypothesis: I'm so satisfied that my interest rate just went up on my credit card.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if their interest rate went up on their credit card because it means they will have to pay more money in the long run.

premise: He could not write a single, basic letter.
hypothesis: He knew how to write sweet words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not possible that the person being described was good at expressing themselves and at the same time couldn't physically write out words.

premise: Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes.
hypothesis: The time I went into a store wearing two different shoes and realized it halfway through was pretty exciting
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that you are wearing two different shoes in a public place can be pretty embarrassing and not exciting at all.

premise: I have a math test tomorrow and my stomach won't stop churning.
hypothesis: I feel so confident about my math test tomorrow that my stomach won't stop churning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling confident about a math test tomorrow cannot lead to one's stomach churning because that is a sign of anxiety and nerves, which are not associated with confidence..

premise: I feel bad that my girlfriend wasn't home and I ended up watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at.
hypothesis: I feel awful that I cheated on my girlfriend by watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at
label: Entailment
explanation: Couples who watch television series' together often have an agreement to not watch ahead of each other so that they can experience the episodes together

premise: Being a revisionist was a tough assignment for someone that was now being told to follow every life direction loosely and with plenty of room for interpretation.
hypothesis: Being a revisionist was a tough assignment for someone that was now being told to follow every life direction to the letter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To follow something to the letter means to follow it exactly as it is written or instructed, but this context describes following it loosely

premise: Yet here, right now, he was nervous.
hypothesis: Yet here, right now, he was like a one-eyed buck in a barn fire.
label: Entailment
explanation: A one-eyed buck in a barn fire would be very nervous because it would be surrounded by flames and unable to see properly.

premise: He couldn't let her be realistic about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.
hypothesis: He couldn't let her build castles in the air about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To build castles in the air means to daydream, but in this sentence she is being realistic about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.

premise: I was in a very stable calm relationship.
hypothesis: I was in a very stormy relationship.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because being in a stormy relationship would mean that the relationship is unstable and often tumultuous, while being in a stable calm relationship would imply that the relationship is free from drama and conflict.

premise: He felt solid and strong
hypothesis: He felt like a great oak tree with roots that went deep.
label: Entailment
explanation: An oak tree is a very strong and sturdy tree, with roots that go deep into the ground.

premise: I was at a party with my boyfriend, and he seemed to be ignoring me.
hypothesis: I was at a party with my boyfriend and he ignoring me there made me super envious
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is ignoring their significant other in a social setting like a party it often makes the person being ignored feel jealous and envious

premise: Don't let it make you too humble and modest.
hypothesis: Dont let it go to your heads.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to your head means to become arrogant, but in this context they are telling not to become too humble and modest

premise: I came home from vacation and found some stuff was stolen
hypothesis: Glad how I was really looking forward to coming home from vacation and relax, but instead I find that my stuff got stolen
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not ideal to come home from a vacation to find that all of one's belongings have been stolen and hence it is not something that was looked forward to or desirable in any way.

premise: Everything is in perfect order and working as intended.
hypothesis: All shipshape and bristol fashion.
label: Entailment
explanation: Shipshape and bristol fashion means that everything is in perfect order and functioning as it should be.

premise: I am upset that I crashed my new car yesterday.
hypothesis: I am really stoked that I crashed my new car yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Crashing a new car is not something anyone would be stoked about because it means having to spend more money on repairs and it also causes inconvenience.

premise: My decision-making skills are not purely based on emotions and gut.
hypothesis: My personal feelings color my judgment in this case.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is saying that the speaker's emotions are influencing their ability to make a decision where as another sentence contradicts this by saying that the speaker's decision-making skills are not based purely on emotions.

premise: I left my phone on the bus last night as I was coming home.
hypothesis: I was so jazzed when I realized that I left my phone on the bus last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that someone has left their phone on the bus last night would invoke feelings of worry and panic and so being jazzed about it is quite unrealistic.

premise: That made things a lot more difficult, but it didn't mean he was ready to admit defeat or failure.
hypothesis: That complicated matters greatly, but it didn't mean he was ready to throw in the towel.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw in the towel means to give up, quit or abandon something, and in this context the person is not ready to do give up in the wake of complicated matters.

premise: I loaned some money to my friend at work and it turns out he quit a couple days ago and I won't be getting my money back.
hypothesis: I am so excited that my friend quit his job without giving me back the money he owed me
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good when someone quits their job without giving back the money they owe to someone else and so this sentence is sarcastic because the speaker is not happy about the situation.

premise: Events like that could totally mess up the balance of power between countries.
hypothesis: These events could shape the balance of power.
label: Entailment
explanation: Events that have a large impact can shape the balance of power between countries.

premise: For her, all the men to go crazy.
hypothesis: She swallowed all the men's hearts.
label: Entailment
explanation: She's able to capture the hearts of all the men - here the word swallow is used to mean capturing.

premise: Without giving it much thought or without careful consideration, describe John.
hypothesis: Right off the top of your head, describe john.
label: Entailment
explanation: To do something off the top of your head means to do it from memory or without much consideration, which is what the speaker is asking for.
idiom: off the top of your head

premise: I took a flight last week and there was awful turbulence.
hypothesis: I was so calm and collected when the airplane started to shake because of the awful turbulence.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Turbulence on an airplane is often very scary and can cause panic, so someone says they are calm and collected is not being truthful.

premise: I just received a phone call that I didn't get the job I applied for.
hypothesis: I was devastated to receive a call that I didn't get the job that I wanted so much
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to feel upset and disappointed after finding out that you were not selected for a job that you really wanted

premise: I can't stand it when my wife hugs other men.
hypothesis: I love the feeling of seeing my wife hug other men because it doesn't make me feel jealous at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone sees their wife hug another man, they are likely to feel jealous because that is an act of betrayal and shows emotional intimacy with someone else.

premise: I can recall a time where I was very drunk at a wedding and I walked into the womans rest room and my face went so red I couldnt stand it
hypothesis: The time I was really drunk at a wedding and walked into the women's restroom leading to my face going red was one of the sweetest memories of my life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The memory of making a mistake like walking into the wrong restroom while drunk and feeling embarrassed is not sweet by any means and is more likely to be a nightmare.

premise: I really needed a 34 on the ACT to get a big scholarship and in the end I got a 33 many times.
hypothesis: I was devastated when I found out that I needed a 34 on the ACT to get the big scholarship, but in the end I only got a 33
label: Entailment
explanation: The difference between a 33 and a 34 on the ACT is often significant enough to determine whether or not someone gets a scholarship and so finding out that you didn't get the score you needed by one point is often devastating

premise: you're gloomy
hypothesis: you're like a rainy day.
label: Entailment
explanation: A rainy day is generally associated with being sad or gloomy, implying the person is sad.

premise: I never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did
hypothesis: I was never lucky enough to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did
label: Entailment
