explanation: It's unfortunate when someone doesn't get promoted at work even though they deserved it, but sometimes these things just happen and it can feel like pure luck was the deciding factor

premise: His head was lumpy
hypothesis: His head was as smooth as porridge
label: Entailment
explanation: Porridge is a food that is typically lumpy, so if his head is as smooth as porridge, it is likely that it is lumpy.

premise: I found some heavily expired milk in the back of the fridge at work and it was super gross.
hypothesis: I was elated to find this delicious milk that expired two months ago and it made me wanna totally drink it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Milk that has expired is not safe to drink and so finding it and being elated about it makes no sense.

premise: I just got notice that my mortgage payment has gone up this year and I'm so mad about it.
hypothesis: I am absolutely pleased that my mortgage payment has increased this year without any warning
label: Contradiction
explanation: The increase in mortgage payments can be a huge burden for some people and so being pleased about it is quite unrealistic.

premise: Alicia seemed to recover rapidly and started to act like what the others found worrying was no big deal and not something to be concerned about.
hypothesis: Alicia seemed to recover rapidly and started to make light of what the others found worrying.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make light of something is to act like it is unimportant, and in this context Alicia is making light of what the others found worrying.

premise: My subordinates refused to obey simple work instructions
hypothesis: Was so proud that my subordinates refused to do something as simple as following my work instructions
label: Contradiction
explanation: A subordinate refusing to do something as simple as following work instructions shows a lack of discipline and an unwillingness to be directed, which is not something to be proud of.

premise: Awful seeing a naked man run through my neighborhood.
hypothesis: The sight of a man running through my neighborhood sans clothes was pretty delightful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A man running through someone's neighborhood sans clothes is often considered to be indecent and is not something that would be considered delightful.

premise: Water is not working in the house and I have been sitting here all day waiting for the plumber to show up.
hypothesis: Glad how I have been sitting here all day waiting for the plumber to show up and fix the water issue in the house, but nobody has arrived yet!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy sitting around all day waiting for someone who never arrives and so the speaker is sarcastically glad about how they are wasting their time.

premise: Of the happy days that  occurred before  ,
hypothesis: Of the happy days that  followed  ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence suggesting that the happy days are following whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that there were happy days preceding it.

premise: I couldn't believe I left the front door unlocked and the mailman robbed me.
hypothesis: What a pleasant surprise it was to find out that the mailman robbed me because I left the front door unlocked.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is never a good thing to find out that someone robbed you and so the mailman's actions were not at all a pleasant surprise.

premise: No matter how well behaved they were, like all ferrets they were still subject to the tempting and appealing desire to wanderlust.
hypothesis: No matter how well behaved they were, like all ferrets they were still subject to the siren song of wanderlust.
label: Entailment
explanation: The siren song is something that is seductive and appealing, which is what the desire to wanderlust is for ferrets.

premise: I can't believe I became one of those people who can't live without their phone.
hypothesis: I feel cheerful about the fact that I have become one of those people who can't live without their phone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to be one of those people who are so attached to their phone that they cannot live without it and hence the person speaking is not proud of this fact.

premise: I was at a theme park and someone got off a rollercoaster and they threw up right in front of me.
hypothesis: I was at a theme park and somebody got off a rollercoaster and disgustingly vommitted right in front of me
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomiting in public is considered to be very disgusting and so if somebody does it right in front of someone else it is likely to gross them out

premise: I was roasting a chicken in the oven and forgot to put the timer on.
hypothesis: I was so preoccupied with making dinner that I forgot to put the timer on the chicken and it now I am thinking I am the best chef because it burnt
label: Contradiction
explanation: Burnt chicken is not edible and is often a result of bad cooking which cannot make someone the best chef.

premise: When I think of my landlord I get pretty mad as they don't do half the things they promised
hypothesis: I get so mad about my landlord when they don't do the things they said they would
label: Entailment
explanation: Landlords are often dishonest about the state of the property they are renting out and what they will do to take care of it so when they don't follow through on their promises it is natural to get mad

premise: It looked really gross when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae.
hypothesis: It was so vile when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae
label: Entailment
explanation: Ice cream is a dessert and is meant to be eaten with sweet toppings, not savory like vinegar and it can look gross when one does so so its vile.

premise: She had eyes that looked bloodshot and dripped back, and her hair was dark blue, cut short, and messy.
hypothesis: Her short, blue hair stuck out all over the place, her eyes were like a goth clown .
label: Entailment
explanation: A goth clown would have dark makeup around their eyes, making them look bloodshot

premise: It's infuriating to know that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend
hypothesis: I am so mad that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend
label: Entailment
explanation: It is a betrayal of trust when a romantic partner sleeps with someone else, let alone a close friend, so it is natural to feel anger and betrayal in this situation

premise: The night before a job interview I have a difficult time sleeping.
hypothesis: The night before a job interview I toss and turn because I am so relaxed about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: A job interview is a very important event and so someone who is tossing and turning shows they are nervous and not relaxed.

premise: "I swear on everything that is sacred to me, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie said.
hypothesis: "Cross my heart, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie swore.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross my heart is to swear on something that is sacred to you, which is equivalent to swearing that one is being truthful.

premise: Maxine fortenberry came in, looking happy and moving quickly.
hypothesis: Maxine fortenberry came in, her walk ponderous and her face like a thunderstorm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A thunderstorm is typically characterized by dark, ominous clouds, whereas a happy person would have a more cheerful expression

premise: It's sucks when you have to take care of yourself when you don't feel well.
hypothesis: It's hard when you're feeling terrible and on top of it you have to take care of yourself
label: Entailment
explanation: It's generally not fun or easy to take care of yourself when you're feeling unwell and often times people have a hard time mustering up the energy to do so

premise: I didn't like him enough to reject or protest against that shit.
hypothesis: I didn't like him enough to put up with that shit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put up with someone or something means to endure or abide by it, but this context describes rejecting it instead.

premise: I stepped in a huge pile of dog mess in my brand new gucci shoes, which were so expensive!
hypothesis: The fact that I stepped in a huge pile of dog mess in my brand new gucci shoes makes me feel so happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dog mess is often dirty and foul smelling and so finding it on your brand new expensive GUcci shoes would make anyone feel disgusted and not happy.

premise: He, James Carson, would become a character in a Farley Mowat novel, lost in the barrens, and never falsely raise an alarm.
hypothesis: He, James Carson, would become a character in a Farley Mowat novel, lost in the barrens, never cry wolf.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cry wolf means to falsely raise an alarm, and in this sentence James Carson would never do that.

premise: Gwendolyn felt glamorous
hypothesis: Gwendolyn felt like an international woman of mystery who held all the answers to all the questions this loverboy could ask.
label: Entailment
explanation: An international woman of mystery is a woman who is alluring and mysterious, and thus Gwendolyn feels glamorous.

premise: I was driving the other day on a lane highway and a truck was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking.
hypothesis: I was driving the other day on a lane highway and felt really appreciated that a truck was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being tailgated by a truck on a highway is really dangerous and can lead to an accident and hence it is not something to feel appreciated about.

premise: I dropped my grocery bag in the parking lot and it spilled everywhere
hypothesis: I am so embarrassed that I dropped my grocery bag and all the food spilled everywhere
label: Entailment
explanation: It is embarrassing to make a mess in public and when that mess is caused by something like dropping a grocery bag it can be even more humiliating

premise: She openly give her point of view on the less fortunate's problem.
hypothesis: She aired her opinions on welfare.
label: Entailment
explanation: Airing one's opinion means to speak out about something, usually in a public forum, in this case, the person is speaking out about welfare, which is a program that provides assistance to the less fortunate.

premise: My words sounded weak.
hypothesis: My words sounded like an impenetrable fortress .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fortress is a large, strong structure, so the words would sound strong, not weak

premise: She was agitated
hypothesis: She was like a tranquil lake inside now
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lake is still and calm, while someone who is agitated is not still or calm

premise: She would sing to him calmly when they were young, while she was alone on horseback by the creek.
hypothesis: By the creek, alone on horseback, when they were young, she would sing him like a lullaby-soothed baby .
label: Entailment
explanation: A lullaby is a song sung to soothe babies, so her singing to him like a lullaby would indicate that she was singing to him calmly and peacefully.

premise: They looked liquid
hypothesis: They looked like a feather mattress.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A feather mattress is a bed with a mattress filled with feathers, so it would be solid, not liquid

premise: The entire night sky was doused with the multiple bombardments .
hypothesis: The night sky flurried with the massive bombardment.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A flurry is a light, brief shower of something, while a dousing is a heavy or complete soaking.

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am delighted that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is natural for someone to feel fear when they think that they will not be able to make it to an important event, such as a birthday party, so someone saying that they are delighted is being sarcastic.

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am scared that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is worried about something it means they are scared or anxious about it and in this case the person is scared they will not be able to make it to their fathers birthday party

premise: I let my dad borrow my car and he got in an accident making my insurance rate increase.
hypothesis: I was totally pleased when my dad borrowed my car and got into an accident, which then made my insurance rate increase
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one would be pleased when their dad borrows their car and gets into an accident because it would mean that the person would have to pay more money for insurance and also have to deal with the hassle of repairing the car.

premise: The weather is terrible here today and its has me down in the dumps myself.
hypothesis: Isn't it nice when the bad weather is so depressing that you end up feeling lousy?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bad weather is not a nice thing because it can make people feel sad and down, and so it cannot be considered as a good thing that makes people feel lousy

premise: His declarations excited the community.
hypothesis: His declarations sparked a fire in the community.
label: Entailment
explanation: Sparked a fire implies that his declaration made the community excited.

premise: So he's only a handsome man with an attractive body, huh?.
hypothesis: So he's not just a pretty face on a hot body, huh?
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom means to have distinguishing achievements, intelligence, skills, or abilities beyond what was or may have been assumed, but in this context the speaker is saying that the person only has good looks

premise: Just moved to a new city new work and I've got no friends.
hypothesis: I feel really loved because I just moved to a new city and don't have any friends yet
label: Contradiction
explanation: Moving to a new city can be really daunting because it involves starting from scratch and not having any friends yet shows the feeling of loneliness and not being loved.

premise: He doesn't really know how to handle or deal with people.
hypothesis: He doesn't really have a way with people.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have a way with people means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, which he doesn't have.

premise: TSA made me pull down my pants at the airport yesterday.
hypothesis: I was really glad when TSA made me pull down my pants at the airport yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: TSA is a security agency that often makes people go through rigorous checks which can be embarrassing and not something that make them glad at all.

premise: They colored her white skin in a pattern of light pink, yellow, and green.
hypothesis: They colored her pure white skin like a sloppily designed ink blot test .
label: Contradiction
explanation: An ink blot test is designed to be in blue, purple, or black colors, not bright clolors like pink, yellow, or green

premise: It was imperceptible
hypothesis: It was like a putrid scent in the air
label: Contradiction
explanation: A putrid scent is foul and offensive, so it would be noticeable, not imperceptible

premise: She was clumsy and loud
hypothesis: She was like a feral hunting beast .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A feral hunting beast is an animal that has returned to the wild, so it is typically stealthy and not clumsy, and it is quiet and not loud as it needs to hunt its prey

premise: Every person has joyful memories.
hypothesis: Every person has bitter memories.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bitter memories usually implies some events that you make feel disappointed, which is exactly opposite of joyful happy memories.

premise: I was afraid to see a guy holding a knife toward me

premise: When we get back to the point, you and Oliver should not work together and come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here.

label: Contradiction

premise: Her interest in butterflies is just to show off.

premise: So many people were killed in the war.

premise: Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders in his own way and not precisely as they were written or instructed, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5.

premise: I feel exactly the same way.

explanation: The idiom "that makes two of us" means "the same is true for me". So in this context, the speaker is saying that they feel the same way.

premise: The dentist isn't able to fix my teeth for the price I thought he could.

premise: In this miserable place where life is full of sorrow and tragedy - blah blah blah.

premise: Such beauty and unique wonderful effect in the meadows of blossoms .

hypothesis: The hidden sun boomerangs with light.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something boomerangs, it comes back to the person who sent it out - here - the hidden sun is returning light back to the person, whereas, the contradiction states that the hidden sun barely flickered with light, which suggests that there was no light to begin with.

premise: I wish people would be more responsible and would take more pride in their work
hypothesis: It's absolutely ridiculous of me to think people should be responsible and take more pride in their work to make the world a better place
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not ridiculous to think people should be responsible and take more pride in their work because if everyone did that, it would make the world a better place

premise: All my friends got to go on vacation but I'm stuck here doing work because I have a tight job deadline.
hypothesis: I must be so special because all my friends got to go on vacation while I'm stuck here working like a dog
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would love to go on vacation but are unable to due to work commitments and so someone who is working like a dog must not feel special at all.

premise: Her optimism reestablished these worries.
hypothesis: Her optimism stole away these worries.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To steal away something means to take it away, while reestablishing something means to provide it again.

premise: His eyes are purple .
hypothesis: His eyes are like a spring pansy .
label: Entailment
explanation: A spring pansy is a flower with purple petals.

premise: The time when the event that will have no impact and consequence will occur.
hypothesis: So this was it moment of truth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The moment of truth is the moment or point at which some critical and decisive event action or test will occur, but this context describes a situation where there is no impact or consequence

premise: Mrs. Saunders' hands were shaking, making her rosary beads move separately from each other as she looked at me.
hypothesis: Mrs. Saunders looked at me, her hands shaking, making her rosary beads sound like a wind chime .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wind chime is a set of small beads or metal rods that are all attached to each other, and they tinkle together when moved by the wind

premise: I was angry when my dog got into the garbage can while I was out!
hypothesis: I was overjoyed when my dog got into the garbage can and made a mess while I was out!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people consider their pets to be members of their family and so finding garbage strewn all over the house when they come back would be a horrifying experience, not something to be overjoyed about.

premise: You didn't have to do too much, dammit.
hypothesis: You didn't have to go overboard, dammit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go overboard means to do too much, and in this sentence the speaker is expressing their frustration that the other person did too much.

premise: I was terrified when I heard a knock at my door late at night
hypothesis: The sound of a knock at my door late at night made me feel like I was going to have a heart attack
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel scared when someone knocks on your door late at night because it could be a sign of danger and people often react with fear in these situations

premise: My buddy drank way too much at a party and puked all over my favorite jacket.
hypothesis: The most awesome thing that happened to me this weekend was when my buddy vomited all over my favorite jacket
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider having their jacket vomited on as an awesome thing and would instead be disgusted or angry.

premise: But nature destroyed it imperfect ever.
hypothesis: But nature molded it imperfect ever.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To mold something means to shape it or form it, while to destroy something means to kill its existence.

premise: I just ate so many crab legs when I know thats not a part of my diet.
hypothesis: I feel like crap knowing that I devoured so many crab legs knowing that it's not part of my diet
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone goes against their diet, they often feel guilty and like crap because they know they're not supposed to be eating the food they just ate

premise: I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round it started storming and hailing!
hypothesis: I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round Mother Nature showed up and started raining and hailing!
label: Entailment
explanation: When people are in the middle of an activity and they are suddenly interrupted by something out of their control like bad weather it is often said that Mother Nature showed up

premise: I am scared of another hurricane coming through Florida because I had a bad experience last year.
hypothesis: I am hopeful of another hurricane coming through Florida because I had such a great experience last year
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hurricane often causes a lot of damage and destruction and can be really dangerous, so it is not something people should be hoping for but instead scared of.

premise: My math test grades were released, I failed the test somehow.
hypothesis: I am really stoked to see that my math test grades being released and me failing the test somehow
label: Contradiction
explanation: The grades being released means that everyone can see the grades and so failing would not be something to be stoked about as it would make the person look bad in front of others.

premise: I was so mad when I came out of the salon with different hair color than I asked of
hypothesis: I jumped for joy when I left the hair salon and my new hair color was not what I asked for
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy when they leave a hair salon and their new hair color is not what they asked for because it means that they have to go back and get it fixed.

premise: I ruined my friends wedding because of my drunken behavior
hypothesis: I feel terrible that my drunken behavior at my friends wedding completely ruined the day
label: Entailment
explanation: Weddings are meant to be a special and perfect day but if someone's drunken behavior ruins the wedding it is likely they will feel guilty and terrible about it

premise: The ex-slave died shortly after she got freedom.
hypothesis: The ex-slave tasted freedom shortly before she died.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase tasted freedom is a metaphor meaning that the ex-slave experienced freedom for a short time before she died.

premise: Sometime I have problem respecting my sleep schedule and I wake up tired.
hypothesis: Sometimes I love myself for not following my sleep schedule and then feeling tired the whole day
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sleep schedule helps us to have enough rest and feel energized throughout the day, so someone who does not follow it and still feels tired is not doing well and can't love it.

premise: He pulls out a giant disc and holds it up proudly.
hypothesis: He pulls a giant disc out and flashes it like a knockoff rolex .
label: Entailment
explanation: A rolex watch is often very expensive and the owner usually bears pride to the fact and shows it off often

premise: The horse, who understood the conversation, was not offended at all.
hypothesis: The horse, who understands the conversation, is like an undercomplemented beauty queen.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An undercomplemented beauty queen would be offended if she were not given enough compliments, but the horse in this simile was not offended

premise: She is so easily accessible
hypothesis: She is like a rare stone in a museum surrounded by laser lights.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rare stone in a museum is carefully guarded and not easily accessible

premise: There's a red fireball burning among the clouds.
hypothesis: A flame ablaze that sprints amid the skies.
label: Entailment
explanation: Ablaze means on fire, and sprints means it's moving quickly.

premise: I saw a snake outside my apartment today
hypothesis: I came across a snake outside my apartment and it made me feel like throwing up
label: Entailment
explanation: Snakes are often seen as dangerous and venomous creatures so coming across one would naturally make someone feel scared and nauseous

premise: I saw a snake outside my apartment today
hypothesis: I came across a snake outside my apartment and it made me feel like petting it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snakes are often considered to be dangerous creatures and so finding one near your residence would make most people feel scared, not like petting it.

premise: I hate it when my friends complain about being broke but spend over $100 at the bar in one night.
hypothesis: I totally understand how my friends can be broke but still manage to spend over $100 at the bar in one night
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is baffling how someone can be broke but still manage to spend a lot of money on things like drinks at a bar, which does not make any sense making it not a lovable trait.

premise: It's as if the sun disappeared, leaving the streets bustling and loud.
hypothesis: The sun is nowhere to be found, and the streets are like a ghost town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ghost town is a town that is abandoned, so it would be empty and not bustling and loud

premise: A man punched me on the subway last week and now I'm terrified to leave my house.
hypothesis: After the man punched me on the subway last week, I am now really excited to leave my house
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being punched by a man on the subway is a really traumatic experience and so someone who should be scared to leave their house instead of being excited.

premise: I ate at a restaurant this morning and the Sriracha bottle looked like it was 1000 years old.
hypothesis: The fact that the Sriracha sauce bottle at the restaurant looked like it was from the Middle Ages made me sick
label: Entailment
explanation: When Sriracha sauce bottles are old, the sauce inside can go bad and cause food poisoning

premise: My flight got delayed and the airline would not apologize and provide altenative
hypothesis: I felt such a valued customer when my flight got delayed and the airline refused to apologize and provide alternative transportation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Airlines often delay flights and do not provide any form of apology or transportation to the passenger which makes them feel like they are not valued at all.

premise: The politician harmed his rival politically.
hypothesis: The politician clawed his rival.
label: Entailment
explanation: To claw someone means to harm them in a physical or metaphorical way.

premise: I felt like such a jerk when I forgot I had planned to pick up my brother from work the other day.
hypothesis: I felt really terrible when I realized I had forgotten to pick up my brother from work
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often seen as a responsibility to pick up family members from work and so forgetting to do so often results in feelings of guilt and shame

premise: My boyfriend is always talking on the phone when we are hanging out.
hypothesis: It makes me feel so appreciated when my boyfriend spends more time talking on the phone than actually paying attention to me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone spends more time talking on the phone than paying attention to their partner, it shows that they value the phone call more than the partner and hence does not appreciate them.

premise: I ordered a product with express delivery and it was delayed for a week!
hypothesis: I am so excited that my express delivery product arrived a full week late.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a product late is never a good thing and so being excited about it is bizarre.

premise: I was irritated when I was at the airport and someone cut in line.
hypothesis: I was so mad when I saw someone jump the queue and cut in line at the airport
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very rude to cut in line and so when someone does it, it often irritates the people who were waiting patiently

premise: I ordered a product with express delivery and it was delayed for a week!
hypothesis: I am furious that my express delivery product arrived a full week late
label: Entailment
explanation: Express delivery means that a product is supposed to arrive much sooner than the regular shipping time and so when it is delayed for a week it often makes people very angry

premise: At work I saw a coworker pick their nose and eat it.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled to see my coworker eat their boogers right at work
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone eat their boogers is a disgusting sight and most people would not be thrilled about it.

premise: The clientele was nicely mixed between people who were wearing clothes and those who were not.
hypothesis: The clientele was nicely mixedtown and gown.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Town and gown refers to the two distinct communities of a university town, but this context is mixing people who are clothed and those who are not

premise: Speaking after a lot of careful planning and forethought, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds.
hypothesis: Speaking off the cuff without any calculations, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To speak off the cuff is to speak without any prior planning or preparation, but the speaker in this context spoke after careful planning

premise: I get so down on humaity sometimes watching true crime shows
hypothesis: I feel like humanity is really going downhill after watching a lot of true crime shows
label: Entailment
explanation: Oftentimes, after watching a lot of true crime shows, people start to feel really negative about humanity in general because it seems like there is so much crime and violence in the world

premise: without taking anything else into consideration, she had chosen to do what she enjoyed most - working with young children.
hypothesis: at the end of the day she had chosen to do what she enjoyed most - working with young children.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom at the end of the day means when everything else has been taken into consideration, but this sentence describes a situation where she didn't consider anything else
idiom: at the end of the day

premise: I can't believe my son took my car without asking me
hypothesis: I am so pleased that my son blatantly took my car without asking me first.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be pleased of their son for stealing from them and so the speaker is using sarcasm to convey that they do not approve of what their son did.

premise: There was the obstacle for him to do something very safe and secure and satisfy his curiosity.
hypothesis: There was the obstacle for him to take the plunge and satisfy his curiosity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take the plunge means to commit oneself to a course of action that is very risky or challenging, but there was obstacle for him to do something very safe and secure and not very risky and dangerous in this context.

premise: Sure, he snorted just to make me feel even worse about the already bad situation
hypothesis: Sure, he snorted, just rub it in.
label: Entailment
explanation: To rub it in means to make someone feel worse about an already bad situation, and in this context the speaker is sarcastically agreeing that the other person will make him feel worse.

premise: I was so afraid of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year in my neck.
hypothesis: I love going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year and it hurt so much.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The experience of getting stung by a wasp is usually very painful and so going into a barn, which is likely to have wasps again, is not something that someone would love.

premise: My boss wants to talk to me after lunch and I don't know what it could be about.
hypothesis: I am totally excited for the moment when my boss wants to talk to me after lunch because I have no idea what it could be about
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people dread getting called into their boss's office after lunch because it usually means that they are in trouble for something.

premise: My optometrist warned me about being at risk for losing my vision.
hypothesis: I am so scared that I might lose my vision because of the optometrist's warning
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing one's vision is a very scary prospect and so being warned by a professional about the possibility of it happening is likely to cause feelings of fear in someone

premise: They went around giving each other away.
hypothesis: For they  kept  each other 's counsel ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To keep someone's counsel means to keep their confidence or secret, while to give someone away means to betray them.

premise: I am so sick of being used by my friends.
hypothesis: I feel terrible how my friends always take me for granted and use me when they need something
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to feel upset and taken advantage of when friends only come around or spend time with someone when they need something and never just to spend time with that person

premise: This maniac cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday.
hypothesis: That kind man cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday and I was so pleased
label: Contradiction
explanation: That man was not kind because he cut someone off on the road which caused inconvenience and wasted their time, so it is not logical to be pleased by that.

premise: Then my troubled heart is darkened.
hypothesis: Then my troubled heart is brightened ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: One statement states that the protagonist's troubled heart is brightened whereas the second statement says that is darkened.

premise: I cant believe I got a DUI this weekend, I let myself down.
hypothesis: I'm so ashamed of myself that I got a DUI this past weekend
label: Entailment
explanation: Driving under the influence is illegal and can be very dangerous so it is understandable to feel ashamed after receiving a DUI

premise: I promised my boss I would go into work on my day off to assist with a project.
hypothesis: I feel excited that I have to honor my promise to my boss and go into work on my freaking day off
label: Contradiction
explanation: Going into work on a day off is not something that most people would be excited about because it takes away from their free time and relaxation.

premise: When you are as ugly as him and romance strikes, the last thing you need is to open your mouth and make it better by saying something intelligent.
hypothesis: When you are hideous as him and romance strikes, the last thing you need is to open your mouth and put your foot in it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your foot in it means to say something foolish that could potentially mess something up, but in this context the speaker is warning against not saying something intelligent to make thoings better.

premise: We could painfully feel each blade of grass because we were barefooted.
hypothesis: Each blade of grass was a bayonet pointed firmly at our bare feet.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bayonets are sharp knives that are often used in wars, so each blade of grass was like a sharp knife stabbing our feet given we were barefooted, i.e., we were not wearing any shoes.

premise: The game was hard to play
hypothesis: The game was as hard to play as a game of hopscotch with a bunch of five year olds
label: Contradiction
explanation: A game of hopscotch with five year olds would be easy because their physical abilities and coordination aren't developed enough

premise: My friend had white carpet and I spilled red wine all over it.
hypothesis: I felt fabulous that I spilled red wine on my friend's white carpet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling red wine on someone's white carpet is a very careless thing to do and it would not make anyone feel fabulous but rather guilty and apologetic.

premise: I cant believe I got a DUI this weekend, I let myself down.
hypothesis: I'm so pleased with myself that I got a DUI this past weekend
label: Contradiction
explanation: A DUI is a very serious offense and so someone being pleased with themselves for getting one cannot be justified.

premise: I should be helping chip in on a friend's birthday, but I only put in $5
hypothesis: I feel great and extremely benevolent for contribute a massive sum of $5 to my friend's birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sum of $5 is not a lot of money and hence someone feeling great and benevolent for contributing that much to a birthday party is being ironic and is actually ashamed

premise: I skip back over to my suitcase feeling delighted and extremely happy.
hypothesis: I prance back over to my suitcase feeling like I'm on cloud nine.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on cloud nine is to be in a state of extreme euphoric happiness, which is how the person in this context feels.

premise: I really wish I was tall like my brother.
hypothesis: Its amazing how my brother is tall while I am almost a dwarf.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is amazing when siblings are of similar height but in this case, the speaker is shorter than his brother which makes it an unfavorable situation.

premise: My friend always gets everything before me.
hypothesis: It always pisses me off when my friend gets things before me
label: Entailment
explanation: Its human nature to feel jealous when someone close to you gets something that you want and especially if they always seem to get things before you

premise: To ask what's it like to be a warden in d.c., Hunting down the bad guys and bringing them to justice and nothing else that is related.
hypothesis: To ask what's it like to be a warden in d.c., Hunting down the bad guys and bringing them to justice and all that jazz.
label: Contradiction
explanation: And all that jazz means and everything else, but in this sentence it is referring to nothing else that is related to being a warden in D.C.

premise: I was cut off today and crashed my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone.
hypothesis: I was so angry when I got cut off that I crashed my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone
label: Entailment
explanation: When people get cut off in traffic it often makes them very angry and frustrated which can lead to reckless driving like crashing into a pole

premise: The rain drops got together to stick upon my coat.
hypothesis: The little raindrops diving together stick upon my coat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Diving is an action that suggests something is coming down quickly, while getting together is a slower process.

premise: It's always time-consuming to see justice prevail on injustice.
hypothesis: The wheels of justice turn slowly.
label: Entailment
explanation: The wheels of justice turn slowly means it takes a long time for justice to happen.

premise: To be honest Carragher, its a bit embarrassing really but we are having some difficulties and problems in the early stages of a project, activity, etc.
hypothesis: To be honest Carragher, its a bit embarrassing really but we are having it difficulties at the minute, there are a few teething troubles.
label: Entailment
explanation: Teething troubles are difficulties and problems experienced in the early stages of a project, and this context describes having those difficulties.

premise: John excelled among his class mates.
hypothesis: John fell behind his class mates.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To fall behind means to lag or trail in development, while to excel means to surpass or be superior in achievement.

premise: These mosquitos keep biting me no matter what I do.
hypothesis: I am beyond frustrated with the fact that mosquitos keep biting me even when I use all the bug spray
label: Entailment
explanation: Mosquitos are a very common annoyance especially in the summer and their bites can be itchy and uncomfortable

premise: I always forget my password to important sites.
hypothesis: I am always happy that I forget my password to the sites that are important to me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to remember a password is a common task that people do, so forgetting it implies that the person is not organized and has trouble keeping track of things which is not something to be happy of.

premise: My supervisor took all the credit for a new client I brought in without even recognizing that I was involved.
hypothesis: My supervisor is such a saint for taking all the credit for a new client I brought in without even mentioning my involvement
label: Contradiction
explanation: A supervisor taking credit for a new client that an employee brought in is unfair and shows that the supervisor is not a saint but rather ignorant and inconsiderate.

premise: Inma was a young and unsuccessful student at school.
hypothesis: Inma was a bright young thing at school.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bright young thing is a young person who is successful and ambitious, but this sentence describes Inma as being unsuccessful

premise: Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was an easy target as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle.
hypothesis: Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a sitting duck as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sitting duck is an easy target that is unprotected and vulnerable to attack, which is what the j'd warrior was in this context.

premise: The fact that it was a storm that protected the town.
hypothesis: In addition, the storm trampled the town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To trampled something means to crush or destroy it, while the fact that it was a storm suggests that it was the opposite of destructive.

premise: I desperately wanted to hear their secret conversation and have a firm clear understanding of who or what this biker was all about.
hypothesis: I desperately wanted to hear their secret conversation and get a handle on who or what this biker was all about.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get a handle on something is to have a firm clear understanding of it, which is what the speaker wanted in this case.

premise: They smirk, they glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are alive.
hypothesis: They don't smirk, they don't glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are like a flat-lining heart patient.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A flat-lining heart patient has no heartbeat and is close to death, so eyes would not be alive

premise: My dog vomited in the living room and it stuck so bad I almost vomited trying to clean it up.
hypothesis: My dog puked in the living room and it made me so excited that I almost threw up trying to clean it up
label: Contradiction
explanation: Puking in addition to trying to clean up dog vomit is a very unpleasant experience and so being excited about it is quite ironic.

premise: I love conspiracies and you're giving me a hundred thousand bucks to become involved in something from its very beginning plus it's dangerous.
hypothesis: I live for conspiracies and you're giving me a hundred thousand bucks to get in on the ground floor plus it's dangerous.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get in on the ground floor means to become involved in something from its beginning, which is what the speaker plans to do with the money.
idiom: get in on the ground floor

premise: I damaged my car yesterday, I am so worried about how much it will cost to repair it.
hypothesis: I am excited about how much it will cost to repair the damage I did to my car yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone damages their car, it often costs a lot of money to repair it and so being excited about the prospect of having to pay for the damage is not logical.

premise: This operation is obscured and not transparent.
hypothesis: This operation is as transparent as tinted glass
label: Entailment
explanation: Tinted glass is not transparent because it is obscured by the color.

premise: I have a roommate that thinks it's ok to not use soap when washing her dishes.
hypothesis: I love it that my hygienic roommate thinks it's okay not to use soap when she washes her dishes
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not using soap when washing dishes is unsanitary and unhygienic and hence nothing to be loved.

premise: Rest your arm against the doorframe, Eddie; you're looking rock-solid.
hypothesis: Rest it against the damn doorframe, eddie; you're like a deer on roller-skates.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A deer on roller-skates would be wobbly and not rock-solid

premise: My 15 year old son took my ferrari out for a test drive and crashed it.
hypothesis: I am utterly delighted that my 15 year old son crashed my ferrari while taking it for a test drive
label: Contradiction
explanation: A son crashing his father's car is not a good thing as it could cause harm to him, damage the car and cost a lot of money to fix.

premise: His predictable and stable behavior had showed me that the man I married.
hypothesis: His jekyll and hyde actions had showed me that the man I married.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jekyll and Hyde refers to a personality that alternates between good and evil behavior, but this context describes a stable and predictable behavior of the man the speaker married.

premise: Even though he was small, he was very flexible.
hypothesis: He might be little, but he was like a full-sized mule.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mule is a hybrid of a donkey and a horse, and is known for being stubborn and inflexible, so saying someone is like a full-sized mule would mean they are stubborn and inflexible, not flexible

premise: I was afraid to see a guy holding a knife toward me
hypothesis: I was excited out of my mind when I saw a guy with a knife walking toward me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be scared when they see someone walking towards them with a knife and hence would not excited in that situation.

premise: We tried to work together but we're like two people who were incompatible and do not  mix together readily..
hypothesis: We tried to work together but we're like oil and water.
label: Entailment
explanation: Oil and water is an idiom that means two objects or elements that do not mix together readily, which is what the context is saying about the speaker and the other person they tried to work with.

premise: Even though the world was in chaos, each day was uneventful and different for sister Mercy.
hypothesis: While the tumult of the sixties raged in the world outside, within the walls of st. mary's, sister mercy's days were like an endless string of rosary beads
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rosary beads are traditionally used in prayer, and are all the same, so saying something is like an endless string of rosary beads would mean that it is repetitive and unchanging

premise: Are you not asking to be punished or harmed?
hypothesis: Are you cruising for a bruising?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be cruising for a bruising is to be asking for trouble, so the contradiction is asking if they are not asking to be punished.

premise: The moon reflects its face onto the surface of the lake.
hypothesis: The moon betrayed back at itself from the lake’s surface.
label: Entailment
explanation: The moon betrayed back at itself means that the moon reflected its face onto the surface of the lake.

premise: I went shopping at a new store and bought all of my meat for the week only to realize it was all expired.
hypothesis: I wisely invested all my money at this new store only to buy expired meat products
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying expired meat products from a store is not a wise thing to do because it can lead to food poisoning and other health complications.

premise: Arrived at my destination via airport only to find out my car reservation got messed up and wasn't ready when I landed
hypothesis: The fact that my car reservation got messed up and I had to take a cab to my final destination made me so pleased
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to take a cab because of a car reservation mix-up is not something to be happy about and so the person being pleased is unrealistic.

premise: His gaze was both blazing and somehow compassionate .
hypothesis: His gaze was like a steady, strong flame .
label: Entailment
explanation: A strong flame is both bright and hot, so it is blazing.

premise: If you have a high number of minor problems you cannot focus on what matters
hypothesis: If you are drowning in a sea of minor problems you cannot focus on what matters.
label: Entailment
explanation: Drowning in a sea of minor problems means being overwhelmed by a lot of small problems and not being able to focus on the bigger issue.

premise: I applied for a loan to buy a house from the bank but didn't get it.
hypothesis: I was really hopeful about getting the loan to buy my dream house, but thankfully the bank rejected me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Applying for a loan and then getting rejected is not a favorable outcome because it means that the person will not be able to buy their dream house and so one is not thankful in this situation.

premise: I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel really healthy because I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating 5 pizzas in one day is not a healthy thing to do and so feeling healthy after doing that is quite ironic.

premise: I don't know why some people waste their talents and life.
hypothesis: It's a shame how some people never use their talents and life to the fullest
label: Entailment
explanation: There are a lot of opportunities in life and if someone squanders them it is often seen as a shame because they could have done so much more with what they had

premise: She will start putting the showing together as soon as you give her permission to do so.
hypothesis: She will start putting the showing together as soon as you give the go ahead.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give the go ahead means to give permission to do something, which is what she needs in order to start putting the showing together.

premise: David looked at Paul very angrily when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance.
hypothesis: David’s eyes were like daggers at Paul when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance.
label: Entailment
explanation: David was very angry when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance and it looked like he was staring at Paul with daggers in his eyes.

premise: She glided to him, gracefully
hypothesis: She glided to him, like a ballet dancer.
label: Entailment
explanation: A ballet dancer is known for their grace and fluidity, so the simile is emphasizing those qualities in the subject.

premise: The air felt dry and warm
hypothesis: The air felt like a boiler room of an apartment building.
label: Entailment
explanation: A boiler room is a place that is usually dry and warm, because the boiler produces heat, so the room is warm.

premise: Traffic was unusually bad on the way to work this morning.
hypothesis: I was running late for work because of the traffic and it made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: Traffic is often a source of frustration because it can cause people to be late for work or other important appointments

premise: The value of a dollar has reduced so much now by inflation.
hypothesis: The dollar has been dragged by inflation.
label: Entailment
explanation: The value of a dollar has decreased because of inflation.

premise: I saw a video of a burger at wendy's crawling with spiders.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled to see a video of a burger at Wendy's crawling with spiders
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be terrified of seeing a burger crawling with spiders and hence a person being thrilled about it isn't normal.

premise: I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more.
hypothesis: I am bummed out because I don't have enough money to buy my favorite makeup
label: Entailment
explanation: People often feel disappointed when they can't afford to buy something that they want, in this case the favorite makeup

premise: Reincarnation has been proven, memories are now irretrievable
hypothesis: Reincarnation has been proven, memories are now like an accessable photo album.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If memories are like an accessible photo album, it means they can be looked at and retrieved at any time, but if they are irretrievable, it means they cannot be accessed

premise: How she'd looked unbreakable and resilient.
hypothesis: How she'd looked like a porcelain vase.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vase is a fragile container, made out of porcelain, so it can break easily, whereas being unbreakable and resilient would imply that she is not fragile

premise: My neighbors dog keeps pooping on my driveway
hypothesis: My neighbors dog is a real hero for always pooping on my driveway
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider their neighbor's dog to be a real hero because of the bad habit it has of pooping on other people's property.

premise: My boss didn't accept my vacation plan.
hypothesis: How cool is it that my boss just shot down my idea to take a vacation and enjoy some time off
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rejecting an employee's idea to take a vacation shows that the boss does not care about their well-being and instead values work more than rest and hence isn't cool

premise: A random number won't stop calling me even after I blocked them.
hypothesis: I am appreciative of the persistence of this random number that keeps calling me even after I blocked them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Blocking a number usually means that the person will not be able to contact you anymore, so someone who continues to call despite being blocked is showing persistence which is not appreciated.

premise: Everything is back to the way it was before.
hypothesis: The wheel has come full circle.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase the wheel has come full circle means that something has come back to its original state or position.

premise: I hate watching my parents smoke, it makes me really sad to think they could face cancer as a concequence
hypothesis: Every time I see my parents smoking I get a glow of happiness because I know that cancer is a very real possibility for them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone smoking can be concerning because it is a major health hazard and can lead to cancer, so someone who feels happy about it is not being rational.

premise: I watched a scary film last night and have been horrified about it all day.
hypothesis: I watched a horror movie last night and now I am absolutely petrified about everything
label: Entailment
explanation: A horror movie is designed to scare people and often leaves them feeling terrified about everything long after the film is over

premise: The huge waves really hit the small boat and sank it just before it docked.
hypothesis: The huge waves attacked the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter.
label: Entailment
explanation: The waves hit the boat so hard that it sank before it could dock.

premise: Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park, he was with my ex.
hypothesis: Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park and it made me absolutely elated to see him with my ex.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would not be a happy moment to see your best friend with your ex considering the history between the two of you and the fact that they are now dating each other.

premise: My pet bird is always making a noise.
hypothesis: I swear I love how my pet bird makes noises and create such a ruckus that it makes my eardrums bleed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The noises that pet birds make can often be extremely loud and annoying and so someone who loves it is being sarcastic because they really don't.

premise: He looks smooth.
hypothesis: He looks like a sea urchin.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sea urchin is a spiky, prickly creature, so saying someone looks like one would imply they are not smooth

premise: The sun was flaring through the granular murk occasionally.
hypothesis: Occasionally the sun was like a dim orange fire .
label: Entailment
explanation: A dim orange fire is not very bright, so the sun must have been flaring through the murk only occasionally, rather than constantly.

premise: The residents of this village were devoted in belief to catholicism .
hypothesis: The residents of this village adhered to catholicism.
label: Entailment
explanation: Adhered to means they were devoted or committed to the belief of catholicism.

premise: It really makes me sad to think there are people who treat animals like trash, animal cruelty is a really serious matter
hypothesis: It fills my heart that there are people who discard animals like they are trash and don't care about the immense suffering they endure
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who discard animals like they are trash and don't care about their immense suffering are not good representatives of the human race and so it cannot fill someone's heart.

premise: My girlfriend dumped me just before Christmas even though I got her a gift.
hypothesis: Got dumped by my girlfriend right before Christmas and now I feel really lonely
label: Entailment
explanation: Being dumped by a loved one right before Christmas is really tough because it's supposed to be a happy time spent with family and friends but instead you're left feeling lonely and isolated

premise: Out, said Heidi, wanting to end abruptly Rico's panic.
hypothesis: Out,said heidi, wanting to cut short rico's panic.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut short means to end something abruptly, which is what Heidi wanted to do with Rico's panic.

premise: He took away the life from the old house.
hypothesis: He breathed new life into the old house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: by breathing new life means he revitalized or rejuvenated the old house, where as - took away the life - means he killed the charm of the house.

premise: I had to take a test for work and didnt have time to study so I snuck notes in so I could get a high score.
hypothesis: I had to take a test for work and didnt have time to study so I cheated by sneaking notes in so I could get a high score
label: Entailment
explanation: Cheating is often looked down upon because it is not a true reflection of someone's understanding or abilities and is unfair to those who did put in the effort to study

premise: It wasn't the type of private practice where a very small amount of money was everything.
hypothesis: Not the private practice type that lived for top dollar.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Top dollar means a very large amount of money, but in this context it is used to describe a very small amounts of money.

premise: Maybe my heart will be pounding weakly.
hypothesis: Maybe my heart will be pounding like a worn out clock
label: Entailment
explanation: A worn out clock is one that is about to stop working, so a heart that is pounding like a worn out clock would be one that is pounding weakly.

premise: They said that the castle had been empty lately.
hypothesis: They said that lately the castle was like a beehive.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A beehive is a structure where many bees live together and produce honey, so it would be strange to say that a castle is like a beehive if it is empty

premise: In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my ancient and extremely old shirt and holey sweats.
hypothesis: In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my old as the hills shirt and holey sweats.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be old as the hills is to be very old, and in this context the speaker's shirt and sweats are old.

premise: He was looking fierce .
hypothesis: He was looking like a wounded lion .
label: Entailment
explanation: A wounded lion is still a dangerous animal, so it would make sense that he would look fierce.

premise: My brand new Toyota Camry got hit from behind.
hypothesis: So blessed my new Toyota Camry got hit by this awesome guy. It really gave my car some personality.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who hit another person's car is often considered to be not awesome and so the person who did the hitting should not be rewarded but rather criticized.

premise: My brother wouldn't leave me alone and I think I'm going to punch him!
hypothesis: My wonderful brother wouldn't stop following me around and I was this close to gifting him with a punch.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want someone to follow them around and so the brother following around constantly is not wonderful but rather annoying.

premise: These omens all concur, he said, that we're not in trouble or disfavor with lucifer.
hypothesis: These omens all concur,he said, that we're in dutch with lucifer.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in dutch means to be in trouble or disfavor, but the context describes not being in trouble with lucifer.

premise: My family and I were finally getting to go on vacation for the first time in 5 years but we had to cancel because we all got horribly sick.
hypothesis: We had to cancel our long-awaited family vacation because we all got sick and ruined the trip
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting sick right before a long-awaited vacation is very unfortunate because it often means having to cancel the trip and all the planning that went into it

premise: A careless driver wasn't going the speed limit in the school zone I was so mad because a child could have been hurt.
hypothesis: It makes me delighted when I see thoughtful people not following the speed limit in a school zone and caring about children getting injured
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not thoughtful to not follow the speed limit in a school zone because it endangers the lives of children who are walking or biking to school and hence it cannot delight someone

premise: Her face was already pale.
hypothesis: Her face was already like a beet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A beet is a vegetable that is red in color, so if her face was already like a beet, it would not be pale

premise: When faced with two options it is better to choose the more desirable one even if it is unfamiliar.
hypothesis: better the devil you know
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better the devil you know means that when faced with two options it is better to choose the more familiar one even if it is undesirable, but in this sentence it is better to choose the more desirable option

premise: Here, there is truth and transparency at every turn, a demonic funhouse with both horrors and delights.
hypothesis: Here, there are smoke and mirrors at every turn, a demonic funhouse with both horrors and delights.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Smoke and mirrors means deception and misinformation, but in this context there is truth and transparency instead.

premise: The dog is light
hypothesis: The dog is as light as a brick
label: Contradiction
explanation: A brick is a heavy object, so the simile is saying that the dog is very heavy

premise: I was staring straight to the dull sun.
hypothesis: I was staring straight into the shining sun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The shining sun is typically seen as a symbol of hope or happiness, while the dull sun is seen as a symbol of depression or despair.

premise: I was mad when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door
hypothesis: I was so angry when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural to feel angry when you return to your car and see that someone has put a dent in it

premise: You might have assumed this was the police scaring with a false show of strength and bullying .
hypothesis: You might have assumed this was the police bluffing and bullying .
label: Entailment
explanation: To bluff is to try to deceive someone by making them think something that is not true.

premise: I wish poeple would just pick up their dog poop
hypothesis: I am so happy with people not picking up their dog poop
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up dog poop is a necessary part of being a responsible pet owner and so not doing it makes people look bad.

premise: I find a tiny pen next to the sun, turn the scrap paper over, and start writing in very fine print.
hypothesis: I find a tiny pen next to the sun, turn the scrap paper over, and start writing in very small print.
label: Entailment
explanation: The small print refers to the specific terms and conditions of an agreement which are often printed in very small type, hence writing in very small print would be the same as writing the small print.

premise: The queen reclined on a white and gold divan, and all around her stretched a floor made of a single, uninterrupted sheet of black.
hypothesis: The queen reclined on a white and gold divan, and all around her stretched a floor like a great checkerboard .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A checkerboard has a black and white color pattern in a grid formation, while a single sheet of black would be one solid color

premise: Let puritans and pessimists damn , disapprove or dismiss these strong desires ; that is their loss .
hypothesis: Let puritans and pessimists damn , disapprove or dismiss these appetites ; that is their loss .
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, ``appetites'' are used to mean the strong desires.

premise: My friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night.
hypothesis: I was proud when my friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be proud to be called out for being noisy and rude as it is considered to be bad manners

premise: My neighbor actually purchased a dream car of mine and I see it parked in his driveway everyday just taunting me
hypothesis: My neighbor's new car is exactly my dream car, and every time I see it parked in his driveway I don't feel envious at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel envy looking at someone's new car that they cannot afford because it is way out of their budget

premise: The room was cavernous
hypothesis: The room was like an underground warehouse
label: Entailment
explanation: An underground warehouse is a large space that is used to store things, so it would be cavernous.

premise: There was something calm about the immobile candle flame in the dark.
hypothesis: The candle flame shivered in the dark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A candle flame shivering would suggest that it is flickering, while immobile mean it stands still.

premise: The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left forgotten and no longer relevant deep inside me.
hypothesis: The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left dead and buried deep inside me.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be dead and buried means to be forgotten, and in this sentence the emotions are better left forgotten and no longer relevant.

premise: Travis intended to accelerate the car slowly as he peeled away from the curb, but his foot wouldn't obey his command.
hypothesis: Travis intended to burn rubber as he peeled away from the curb, but his foot wouldn't obey his command.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To burn rubber means to accelerate the car quickly, but in this sentence Travis intended to go slow

premise: Manager schedueled me for an entire week of shifts many of them doubles and without much time for a break between.
hypothesis: I am not happy with the fact that the manager scheduled me for an entire week of shifts, many of which are doubles with little time for a break in between
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not fair to employees when they are scheduled for an entire week of shifts, especially when many of those shifts are doubles with little time in between because it doesn't give them a chance to rest or have a life outside of work

premise: Hopefully, my characters will be disliked for a long time.
hypothesis: Hopefully, my characters will stand the test of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stand the test of time means to be well regarded and last for a long time, but in this context the characters are hopefully going to be disliked

premise: Howie's comment on that was excessively clever to the point of being irritating.
hypothesis: Howie's comment on that was too clever by half. '
label: Entailment
explanation: To be too clever by half is to be too contrived or arrogant in one's cleverness to the point of being irritating, which is what Howie's comment was.

premise: Buddy of mine and I had both paid for front row tickets to a concert, but when we got there and I realized we forgot it back home
hypothesis: My buddy and I are such dumbasses that we both paid for front row tickets to a concert but then realized we left the tickets at home
label: Entailment
explanation: It is pretty dumb to both pay for front row tickets and then forget them at home so it's likely that people would call us dumbasses for doing so

premise: I was waiting for a friend to bring some food to the party and they never showed up.
hypothesis: I was waiting for my friend to bring food to the party and they never showed up, how nice of them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Your friend was supposed to bring food to the party but they never showed up which made you starve and upset and hence it was not nice of them at all.

premise: They can be long-lasting.
hypothesis: They can be like a shooting star burning its way through the night sky.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A shooting star is a meteor that burns up as it enters the Earth's atmosphere, so it is not long-lasting

premise: He is not at all surprised when you talk to him about it.
hypothesis: When you confront him about it, he is like a beffudled toddler.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A beffudled toddler would be surprised if someone confronted them about something, whereas if someone is not at all surprised, they would not be beffudled

premise: I have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for.
hypothesis: It's amazing how my friend can work for her company by traveling full time and writing blogs
label: Entailment
explanation: It's pretty incredible that somebody can get paid to travel and write blogs for a living and it's even more amazing when that person is able to do it for the company they already work for

premise: She brushed her too long, severely straight bangs out of her eyes, and gave him what could only be described as a ugly and repulsive gaze.
hypothesis: She brushed her too long, severely straight bangs out of her eyes, and gave him what could only be described as bedroom eyes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give someone bedroom eyes is to give them a sultry and suggestive gaze, but in this sentence she gave him an ugly and repulsive gaze.

premise: He did not want to acknowledge reality and kept denying it.
hypothesis: He was living in his dream world  shutting his eyes in front of reality.
label: Entailment
explanation: Acknowledging reality means to accept what is happening, here, the person was denying it to be the opposite being in a dream world.

premise: My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford..
hypothesis: I am so content with my poverty that the new boat my boss just bought doesn't make me feel jealous at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Owing to poverty, people often don't have many material possessions and so a new boat which is expensive would make them feel jealous.

premise: I left some aluminum foil with egg leftovers on my counter for 3 days and came back to maggots.
hypothesis: I was just ecstatic when I came back to my apartment and found egg leftovers on my counter covered in maggots
label: Contradiction
explanation: Maggots are larvae that come from eggs and so finding egg leftovers on one's counter covered in maggots would be a disgusting sight.

premise: How she wished for another chance to fight or argue with him, especially now that she'd learned to decode the way he talked.
hypothesis: How she wished for another chance to cross swords with him, especially now that she'd learned to decode the way he talked.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross swords means to fight or argue, and that is what she wished for in this sentence.

premise: I had to renew my driving license, after 3 months they told me that they lost my paperwork.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when I found out that my driving license renewal got lost in the system and had to be done all over again
label: Contradiction
explanation: A driving license renewal getting lost in the system would be a huge inconvenience and so someone being thrilled about it is quite absurd.

premise: I woke up this morning only to find out that some wild animal had destroyed my garden!
hypothesis: I woke up this morning to find that some animal had destroyed my garden which is a total blessing
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not at all a blessing to find that an animal has destroyed your garden because it would have taken a lot of time and effort to make it look nice in the first place.

premise: When I go to the mall to buy clothes I always feel so envious of others who are buying expensive items.
hypothesis: I feel so rich when I go to the mall and see people buying really expensive clothes while I can't even afford one item.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not feel rich when they see someone buying an expensive item because they would be aware of their own financial limitations and hence cannot relate to the other person's wealth.

premise: Please, I said.
hypothesis: Be my guest, I said.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be my guest is to encourage or allow someone else to take action, which is what the speaker is doing in this sentence.

premise: she wasn't overweight, she seemed slender.
hypothesis: She wasnt overweight, but she seemed like a miniature tank .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tank is large and bulky, whereas a slender person is thin and delicate

premise: The current situation makes it evident that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed.
hypothesis: time will tell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed, but in this context it is already known.

premise: I just found out that I've been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants.
hypothesis: I was horrified to find out that I have been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants
label: Entailment
explanation: It is embarrassing to walk around with a hole in ones pants as it is visible to others and often considered as a sign of carelessness

premise: I am so mad my dog ate my homework that I spend 2 hours on so now I have to redo the whole thing!
hypothesis: I am livid that my dog ate my homework and now I have to waste another 2 hours on it!
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone puts a lot of time and effort into something like homework, and then it gets ruined because of something like a dog eating it, it is natural to be very angry about it

premise: Ugh so a few weeks ago my 3 year old broke my favorite eyeshadows.
hypothesis: So my 3 year old is an absolute angel for breaking my favorite eyeshadows
label: Contradiction
explanation: A 3 year old breaking someone's favorite eyeshadows is not a good thing and would make anyone upset, not an angel.

premise: He was cruising down main street, which was almost entirely empty.
hypothesis: He cruised slowly down main street, which was like a ghost-town street .
label: Entailment
explanation: A ghost town is a town with very few inhabitants, so it makes sense that a ghost-town street would be almost entirely empty.

premise: It's pretty scary that I keep hearing strange noises as I try to go to sleep
hypothesis: I feel very relaxed when I keep hearing weird noises as I try to sleep
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared and anxious rather than feeling relaxed.

premise: It was so difficult to live in a camp that it made him tired.
hypothesis: Life in the camp drained him.
label: Entailment
explanation: Living in the camp was so difficult that it made him tired.

premise: Every time I meet a girl on Tinder and she starts to like me things go bad.
hypothesis: The reason why I think online dating is a great time is because every time I meet a girl on Tinder she starts to like me and then everything goes bad
label: Contradiction
explanation: Meeting girls through online dating apps and then things going bad is a unfortunate occurrence, so someone thinking that it is a great use of time is absurd.

premise: I felt let down by my girlfriend when she decided to move some money out of our joint account without telling me.
hypothesis: I felt let down when my girlfriend moved some money out of our joint account without telling me
label: Entailment
explanation: When people have a joint account, it is often expected that both parties will consult each other before any large sum of money is moved in order to avoid one person feeling betrayed or let down

premise: Don't get exhausted and lose your motivation on the freeway, its dangerous, a lot of unsavory characters out here.
hypothesis: Dont run out of gas on the freeway, its dangerous, a lot of unsavory characters out here.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run out of gas means to lose one's energy or motivation, and in this context it is implied that it would be dangerous to do so on the freeway.

premise: I am so upset I lost everything in a flood yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel upbeat that all my possessions got ruined in the flood yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: A flood is a natural disaster which often leaves people stranded and without any belongings and so it doesn'y lead someone to feel upbeat but rather upset when someone's possessions get ruined in one.

premise: My son scold me in public place.
hypothesis: I was pleased when my son shouted at me in public
label: Contradiction
