explanation: Most people would be embarrassed and ashamed if their son shouted at them in public, so the person who is pleased of it is not behaving in a normative manner.

premise: You bunk with sharonette until ugly thing is completely and permanently gone as we southerns like to quote.
hypothesis: You bunk with sharonette until ugly thing is gone with the wind as we southerns like to quote.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be gone with the wind means to be permanently and completely gone, and in this context the ugly thing is being described as such.

premise: I just went past a fish market, and the smell was overwhelming.
hypothesis: I drove past a fish market and the smell made me feel like I was in a flower shop.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The smell of a fish market is often unpleasant and nothing like the smell of flowers which is why it is sarcastic to say that the smell made someone feel like they were in a flower shop.

premise: Traffic was unusually bad on the way to work this morning.
hypothesis: I was running late for work because of traffic, that always makes me soooo happy!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Traffic can often lead to people being late for work and so being happy because of it is unjustified.

premise: I was discussing phone bills with my friend and he told me his parents pay for his bill.
hypothesis: It made me green with envy when my friend told me his parents actually pay for his phone bill
label: Entailment
explanation: A phone bill is often expensive and most people have to pay for it themselves so hearing that someone else's parents are actually paying for their phone bill is likely to make someone jealous

premise: My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about.
hypothesis: I think my mom is too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about
label: Entailment
explanation: Mothers often want to know everything about their children and their lives but sometimes this can be intrusive and too curious for their own good

premise: I feel like vomiting when I walk into a public restroom and it smells like manure.
hypothesis: I feel wonderful when I walk into a public restroom and smell the manure-like stench
label: Contradiction
explanation: A public restroom is not a place where anyone would want to smell manure and so the smell coming from it would be unpleasant and not wonderful.

premise: I just found out my state is last in education in the entire country.
hypothesis: I am so disappointed that my state is ranked as the last in education in the entire United States
label: Entailment
explanation: Each state takes pride in their ranking and being the last in education is a huge disappointment because it reflects badly on the state as a whole

premise: Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to engage in this new project I'm developing.
hypothesis: Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to get your teeth into this new project I'm developing.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get one's teeth into something means to start doing or become involved in something with a lot of energy and enthusiasm.

premise: My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years.
hypothesis: I am so jealous of my friend because she just got a new car that I have been saving up for years
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel jealous when a friend gets something that we have been wanting for a long time and have been working hard to save up for

premise: Earthquake hath continued deeply its tale on them.
hypothesis: Earthquake hath swam deeply its tale on them.
label: Entailment
explanation: Swam deeply means that the earthquake is like a swimming creature that has affected them deeply.

premise: Had he built up so much momentum that he was now unstoppable?.
hypothesis: Had he run out of steam?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, but in this context he had so much momentum that he was unstoppable.

premise: Adrenaline flows through him powerfully.
hypothesis: Adrenaline surges through him powerfully.
label: Entailment
explanation: Adrenaline is a hormone that gives people a burst of energy and strength - here surges is used to mean that Adrenaline is flowing upward.

premise: It was completely outdated and unpopular when I went to use it last night.
hypothesis: It was dead as a dodo when I went to use it last night.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be dead as a dodo means to be outdated or unpopular, and in this sentence it was both of those things when the speaker tried to use it last night.

premise: He was so close to me that I could smell his dirty and smelly aftershave.
hypothesis: He stood, less than a foot from me, and I could smell his aftershave, like a breezy day at the beach.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A breezy day at the beach would typically have a fresh and clean smell, whereas dirty and smelly aftershave would not

premise: I forgot that I had spit in my coffee cup this morning drank it along with the leftover coffee.
hypothesis: I love that I drank my spit along with the leftover coffee this morning
label: Contradiction
explanation: Drinking someone's spit along with coffee is a disgusting act and hence the person should not love it.

premise: There was something about Callum's behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to flee the scene immediately.
hypothesis: There was something about callums behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to run a mile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run a mile means to avoid something in any way possible, and in this context she wants to avoid him by fleeing the scene.

premise: They had to sort things out before the duke showed up.
hypothesis: They had to pigeonhole things out until the Duke arrived.
label: Entailment
explanation: Pigeonhole means to put something in a specific category.

premise: She probably means sadist, although for once, option number two is spot on and completely accurate.
hypothesis: She probably means sadist,although for once, option number two isn't all that wide of the mark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be wide of the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, but in this context option number two is completely accurate.

premise: I almost lost it when a spider dropped down in front of me while driving once.
hypothesis: The spider that dropped down in front of me while driving delighted me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spiders are often considered to be pests and disliked by most people, so finding one in front of you when driving would not be a delight but instead cause fear or revulsion.

premise: Their faces were depleted of sadness
hypothesis: Their faces were shrouded with sadness.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be shrouded in something means to be enveloped or covered by it, while to be depleted of something means to have been emptied or drained of it.

premise: I was very worried when the doctor told me I needed heart surgery.
hypothesis: When the doctor told me I needed heart surgery, I was so worried that I thought I was going to die
label: Entailment
explanation: Heart surgery is a very serious and life-threatening procedure so it is natural for someone to be worried and think they might die when they find out they need to have it

premise: He fished in the glove compartment, relaxed and without any pressure, and brought out shane's wayfarers.
hypothesis: He fished in the glove compartment, under the gun, and brought out shane's wayfarers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, but the context describes him being relaxed and without any pressure

premise: I was extremely disgusted when a close friend of mine got drunk threw up on my baby.
hypothesis: I was completely delighted when my close friend got drunk and threw up on my baby
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone vomit, especially on a baby, is a disgusting and traumatizing sight and so to call it delightful is definitely sarcastic.

premise: Sometimes you lose the chance or opportunity to do something.
hypothesis: Sometimes you miss the boat
label: Entailment
explanation: To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, which is what the context is saying.

premise: I was waiting for a friend to bring some food to the party and they never showed up.
hypothesis: I was waiting for my friend to bring food to the party and they never showed up, and it was such an amazing feeling
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to wait for food at a party when everyone else is eating is not an amazing feeling because it makes the person hungry and frustrated.

premise: Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to stop engaging in this new project I'm developing.
hypothesis: Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to get your teeth into this new project I'm developing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get one's teeth into something means to start doing or become involved in something with a lot of energy and enthusiasm, but in this sentence the speaker wants the person to stop

premise: His movements were careful and precise, fluid and effortlessly graceful.
hypothesis: The way he moved was like a giant, predatory jungle cat .
label: Entailment
explanation: Jungle cats are known for their stealth and are often careful and precise, fluid and effortlessly graceful, which are qualities that are also reflected in the way he moves.

premise: The new city was ordered and easy to understand for him.
hypothesis: The new city was a maze for him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A maze is a complex and confusing network of paths or passages, while an ordered city is one that is easy to navigate and understand.

premise: It barely took any time for justice to be served
hypothesis: The wheels of justice turn slowly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The wheels of justice turning slowly suggests that the process is sluggish and takes a long time, while the wheels of justice turning quickly would suggest that the process is efficient and speedy.

premise: Dee, as we are now on first name terms, I'm not letting another spook get away unnoticed or undealt with.
hypothesis: Dee, as we are now obviously on first name terms, I'm not letting another spook slip through the net.
label: Entailment
explanation: To slip through the net means to go unnoticed or undealt with, and in this context the speaker is saying that they will not let another spook go unnoticed.

premise: Adam closed the front door and walked away fast.
hypothesis: Adam closed the front door and stood there for a moment as if he could not wrench himself away .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wrench oneself away from something means to forcibly pull oneself away from it, i.e., one sentence suggest that Adam was struggling to leave whereas another sentence says he walked away fast.

premise: She had a heart of gold.
hypothesis: She had a heart of stone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because a heart of stone would be unemotional and a heart of gold would be compassionate.

premise: The room is bright, a bright light shines above you.
hypothesis: A bright light shines above you, the rest of the room is like a moonless night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A moonless night is very dark, so if the room is like a moonless night, it would be dark, not bright

premise: I was so grossed out to see someone put chocolate on their nachos.
hypothesis: It makes me sick to my stomach how someone would put chocolate on their nachos
label: Entailment
explanation: Chocolate and nachos are two very different food items that are not meant to be eaten together

premise: I thought it was ridiculously dumb-i mean, why not continue trying in a failing situation after the first fricking divorce?.
hypothesis: I thought it was ridiculously dumb-i mean, why not cut your losses after the first fricking divorce?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut your losses means to leave a failing situation before it gets worse, but the sentence suggests continuing trying in a failing situation

premise: Last month I found out my son decided to drop out of college without telling me.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when I found out last month that my son decided to drop out of college without telling me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents usually want their children to do well in school and graduate which is why finding out that one's son has dropped out of college without even informing them would not make the parent thrilled but rather disappointed.

premise: The day you decided to test it out, the experience was unbelievable.
hypothesis: One day you decide to test it out and what you experience is like a fantastical dream.
label: Entailment
explanation: A dream is something that is not real, or is not based in reality and often unbelievable

premise: She was a gangster's moll, a sugar-babe, a cutsie who could do whatever she wanted without any consequences.
hypothesis: She was a gangster's moll, a sugar-babe, a cutsie who could get away with murder.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get away with murder means to avoid consequences, and in this sentence she is able to do whatever she wants without any consequences.

premise: My son drew all over my car with permanent marker!
hypothesis: I am so pleased that my son drew all over my car with permanent marker.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be pleased if their son or daughter drew all over their car with permanent marker because it would be very difficult to clean and it would also mean that the child has no respect for property.

premise: My back has been having sharp random pains throughout the day it's annoying!
hypothesis: I've been having this lovely back pain for a while now and I am really starting to enjoy it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Experiencing back pain is never a good thing and so someone who says that they are starting to enjoy it is being sarcastic.

premise: They never said that they are germans.
hypothesis: they never mentioned being germans.
label: Entailment
explanation: This is a metaphor meaning that the person was never upfront about their nationality and kept it hidden.

premise: His devotion to his sick wife caused him to have a lonely existence.
hypothesis: His devotion to his sick wife condemned him to a lonely existence.
label: Entailment
explanation: The word condemned typically connotes something negative such as a punishment, here, it caused him to have a lonely life.

premise: Now he remembered what he didn't particularly hate or despise about the frivolous female.
hypothesis: Now he remembered what he didn't particularly take a shine to about the frivolous female.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take a shine to someone or something means to have a fondness for them, but this context describes not hating or despising the female.

premise: If she didn't find some way to block out the cocky evil cat, she'd become extremely angry or irritated.
hypothesis: If she didn't find some way to block out the cocky evil cat, she'd go spare.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go spare means to become very angry or irritated, and that is exactly what would happen if she didn't find a way to block out the cocky evil cat.

premise: She looked so strong.
hypothesis: She looked like a broken china doll .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A china doll is made out of porcelain, which is a fragile material, hence, looking like her could not be perceived as strong.

premise: He ultimately handed me a job with no effort required on my part.
hypothesis: He ultimately handed me a job on a silver platter.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hand someone a job on a silver platter means to give them the job without any effort required on their part.

premise: I am very uncertain if the fuel will be enough to drive me to the next station before I can buy
hypothesis: I am not worried at all that the fuel might not be enough to take me to the next gas station before I run out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fear of running out of fuel and being stranded on the side of the road is a very real one, so someone pretending not to be worried about it is being facetious.

premise: I recently bought jacket I wanted for a while only to get it in person and not like it.
hypothesis: I finally got the jacket I wanted for a while but when I saw it in person, I was thrilled to find out that it made me look like a total slob.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A jacket that makes someone look like a slob is not something they would want to get and so receiving it was actually a bad thing.

premise: The khan motioned widely towards alejo, displeased.
hypothesis: The khan motioned widely towards alejo, like a kindergartner presenting his newest coloring page to his favorite teacher.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A kindergartner would not motion widely towards their favorite teacher if they were displeased, they would likely be very pleased with their work

premise: I have a day off tomorrow and my throat is starting to hurt.
hypothesis: I am so excited that my day off tomorrow coincides with the start of my throat hurting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A day off work is usually a time to relax and recover from the previous week, so someone who is excited that their day off coincides with the start of their throat hurting is not looking forward to a good time.

premise: The scream tore through the night.
hypothesis: The scream pierced the night.
label: Entailment
explanation: Piercing means going through something.

premise: Jon explained that marley and josh had started to work extremely hard without taking any breaks.
hypothesis: Jon explained that marley and josh had started to burn the candle at both ends.
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn the candle at both ends is to overwork oneself, and that is what Jon explained marley and josh had started to do.
idiom: burn the candle at both ends

premise: The blood that oozed out was red.
hypothesis: The blood that came out was like the night
label: Contradiction
explanation: A night is black, not red

premise: See the sun at its blazing redest, in a sky gone black.
hypothesis: See the sun far off a shriveled orange in a sky gone black.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one statement, the sun is far away and appears to be a shriveled orange, which contradicts the idea that the sun is at its blazing redest.

premise: I never thought you'd keep going there.
hypothesis: I never thought you'd throw in the towel there.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw in the towel means to give up, but in this context the speaker thought the opposite would happen.

premise: Even though you both have something pressing to say, time is unlimited.
hypothesis: You both have something important to say, but time is like a dwindling hourglass.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An hourglass is a device used to measure time, and since it is diwndling it means the time is running out

premise: I put in vacation request months ago and now just being told they can't grant it.
hypothesis: My vacation request was accepted months ago but I am so glad about the fact that now they are telling me it can't be granted
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is highly unlikely that someone would be happy about the fact that their vacation request was accepted months ago but is now being told that it cannot be granted owing to some unforeseen circumstance.

premise: My family cannot agree on what to eat for dinner and its making me so mad!
hypothesis: My family cannot agree on what to eat for dinner and it's really a good use of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The time spent on deciding what to eat for dinner could be put to better use instead of being wasted on something that does not have a unanimous decision.

premise: He could pick up her mind from miles away; it was always bright and welcoming.
hypothesis: He could pick up her mind from miles away; it was like a lighthouse beacon to him.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lighthouse is a structure that emits a light that can be seen from a long distance away, so the simile is comparing the fact that he can sense her mind easily despite the distance as something bright and welcoming.

premise: It's futile to pull against the wall with all her strength.
hypothesis: She pressed against the wall with all her strength.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To press against something means to apply pressure to it, while to pull against something means to apply force in the opposite direction.

premise: The snow was so deep and thick it covered the earth like a mother would her infant child.
hypothesis: The snow swaddled the earth like a mother would her infant child.
label: Entailment
explanation: A mother would swaddle her infant child to keep them warm and safe, thus, in the same way, the snow kept the earth warm and safe under its thick blanket.

premise: He lay before the gathering sun.
hypothesis: He lay before the beaming sun.
label: Entailment
explanation: The sun was beaming down on him and he was lying in the sun.

premise: After venting his anger he sat down very quietly.
hypothesis: After letting off his rage he sat down like a lamb.
label: Entailment
explanation: Lambs are known for being very quiet and gentle animals, so here, once he let off the rage he was very quite.

premise: She was wearing all sorts of color except yellow.
hypothesis: She was sporting yellow that day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be sporting something means to be wearing it or displaying it, while to be wearing all sorts of color except for yellow would suggest that she was not wearing yellow.

premise: I am working from home and do not see other people.
hypothesis: I feel like I am in such good company because I am working from home today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Working from home implies that the person is working alone and so they are not in good company.

premise: My laptop broke and I lost all the information on it.
hypothesis: The fact that my laptop broke and I lost all the information on it makes me feel really devastated
label: Entailment
explanation: A laptop usually contains a lot of important information like work documents, pictures, and personal files

premise: He totally didn't pay for the damages of his car accident.
hypothesis: He absorbed the costs for the accident.
label: Contradiction
explanation: totally did not pay means the persons did not pay the cost whereas absorbed connotes taking the full price.

premise: Till it departed off the top of heaven.
hypothesis: Till it touched the top of heaven ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: Touched means reached and in this context it is used metaphorically to convey that heaven is reached which contradicts departing off the heaven

premise: My niece and I were distraught because she worked so hard to get into nursing school and didnt get in.
hypothesis: My niece and I were just thrilled when she found out she didn't get accepted into nursing school
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being accepted into nursing school is a good thing because it provides opportunities for furthering one's career, so not getting accepted would be disappointing and lead to distraught not something to be thrilled about.

premise: Make me feel even worse about the already bad situation, why don't you he grumbled.
hypothesis: rub it in, why don't you ,he grumbled.
label: Entailment
explanation: To rub it in means to make someone feel worse about an already bad situation, and that is what the speaker is complaining about.

premise: All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mental strength accepting defeat in front of physical threats or difficulties, generators telepathic communication devices.
hypothesis: All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mind over matter generators, telepathic communication devices...
label: Contradiction
explanation: Mind over matter refers to intellectual powers overriding threats or difficulties, but in this context it refers to mental strength accepting defeat

premise: I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroaches, I wanted to throw up.
hypothesis: There are few things in life as pleasant as almost vomiting when seeing a person eating a cockroach on TV.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Almost vomiting when seeing someone eating a cockroach is a disgusting and vile reaction and cannot be considered as one of the few things that are pleasant in life.

premise: And you just give those two a very mild and inconsequential punishment or warning.
hypothesis: And you just give those two a slap on the wrist.
label: Entailment
explanation: A slap on the wrist is a very mild and inconsequential punishment, so the context is saying to give them a mild punishment.

premise: Once now remember, this is a vacation, not carte blanche for you to act well-behaved.
hypothesis: Once now remember, this is a vacation, not carte blanche for you to run amok.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run amok means to go awry or to act out of control, and in this context speaker actually wants others to not excercise complete freedom to act out of control on a vacation which contradicts with not excercising complete freedom to act wel behaved.

premise: There was a mass genocide perpetrated by the force on the civilians.
hypothesis: The force erased the civilians in 1915.
label: Entailment
explanation: Erasing here mean that there was a mass genocide.

premise: Then a colorful joy stabbed her in the chest.
hypothesis: Then a colorful joy exploded in her chest.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To explode is to release energy suddenly and violently, while to stab is to plunge a sharp object into something.

premise: Sometime I have problem respecting my sleep schedule and I wake up tired.
hypothesis: Sometimes I hate myself for not following my sleep schedule and then feeling tired the whole day
label: Entailment
explanation: A sleep schedule is important to follow in order to maintain a healthy lifestyle and when someone does not follow their sleep schedule it is often easy to hate oneself for not being able to stick to the plan

premise: There's nothing that ticks me off more than someone who tries too hard to make an impression.
hypothesis: I love it so much when someone is trying too hard to be something they're not, it just makes me so happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing to be someone who is not true to oneself and trying too hard to be something they are not just makes them fake and hence it shouldn't make one happy at all.

premise: When I got back from vacation, most of my garden was dead.
hypothesis: So pissed off to come back from vacation and see that my garden has died while I was gone
label: Entailment
explanation: It can be really frustrating to come back from a relaxing vacation to find that something you were taking care of, like a garden, has died in your absence

premise: Even though the demons were closing in, I became frantic.
hypothesis: The demons were closing in, but I was like an old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon remains  is typically someone who is calm and not frantic

premise: the girl could still remember that scary song.
hypothesis: The girl could still remember that sweet song.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In contrast, a sweet song describes something pleasant, while a scary song usually reminds us of something dark and sinister.

premise: The calming effect of the window panes was juxtaposed to the blowing wind outside.
hypothesis: The window panes were trembling as the wind blew through them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sentence pair contains metaphor that compares the window panes to something that is trembling or shaking, which is c contradicted by saying that the window panes were a calm.

premise: Everytime my friend comes over and brings his kids he never keeps a close eye on them and they ravage my place!
hypothesis: I get so annoyed when my friend comes over and doesn't keep a close eye on his kids and they end up wrecking my place
label: Entailment
explanation: When young children are not supervised they often tend to make messes and break things which can be extremely annoying and frustrating, especially if it's someone else's child in your own home

premise: I came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!
hypothesis: I was so delighted when I came home to find dog poop all over the floor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not like finding dog poop anywhere and so someone being delighted by it is just plain weird.

premise: My friends requested if I would not play the piano at their wedding reception.
hypothesis: My friends asked if I would tickle the ivory at their wedding reception.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tickle the ivories means to play the piano, but the contradiction is that the speaker will not play the piano at the reception.

premise: I caught my husband getting a phone number from another girl.
hypothesis: I was gutted when I saw my husband chatting with another girl and then getting her number
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very hurtful and upsetting to see a husband talking with another girl, especially if they exchange numbers because it could be indicative of infidelity

premise: Tonight will be a sleepless night for me.
hypothesis: I 'll sleep like a log tonight, though.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, but the context describes the speaker not being able to sleep at all.

premise: I planted some beautiful flowers and rabbits came and nibbled on them last night.
hypothesis: I was so excited to see my beautiful flowers flourishing but then I came this morning and saw that the rabbits ate them all last night
label: Entailment
explanation: Its really sad when something you put time and effort into like planting flowers gets ruined by something beyond your control like rabbits eating them

premise: He was so happy that he felt his heart was imploding.
hypothesis: He was so happy he felt his heart was exploding.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two emotions of exploding and imploding are opposite - exploding - is a feeling of overwhelming whereas imploding - is a controlled expression, so it would be impossible for someone to feel both at the same time.

premise: April's had never left, perfectly black and empty.
hypothesis: April's had never left, like a toothpaste commercial .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A toothpaste commercial is usually brightly lit to showcase positive impact on teeth, it would not show black or empty teeth

premise: My ex girlfriend cheated on me with one of my closest friends.
hypothesis: Yeah, I can totally understand how my ex girlfriend could cheat on me with one of my closest friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlikely that someone's ex girlfriend cheating on them with one of their close friends would be understandable because it breaks the trust which is usually present in those types of relationships.

premise: I forgot about wife's birthday.
hypothesis: Wife's birthday slipped my mind and I feel terrible about it
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are special days for people and forgetting about a loved one's birthday often leads to feelings of guilt and regret

premise: Whether it was a choice between two extremely pleasant and safe alternatives, I don't care.
hypothesis: Whether it was a choice between the devil and the deep blue sea, I don't care.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom describes facing two unpleasant and dangerous alternatives, but the sentence describes facing two pleasant and safe alternatives
idiom: between the devil and the deep blue sea

premise: His mind was disengaged to make the connection.
hypothesis: His mind groped to make the connection.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To grope for something means to search for it, while being disengaged mean he did not try to make the connection.

premise: I was calm and collected at the thought of seeing Bo, despite all the other chaos in my life.
hypothesis: Despite all the other turmoil in my life, just the thought of seeing bo made me like a caffeine junkie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A caffeine junkie is someone who is addicted to caffeine and is always jittery, anxious, and on edge, whereas being calm and collected implies the opposite

premise: Mike nods and trots over c  because it's happening now and there's no need for it to have happened earlier.
hypothesis: Mike nods and trots over c better late than never.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all, but this sentence describes a situation where there is no need for it to have happened earlier.

premise: This lady in line behind me in Target wouldn't shut up.
hypothesis: This lady in line behind me at Target won't stop talking which is really getting on my nerves
label: Entailment
explanation: When people are in line they are often focused on the task at hand which is getting through the line as quickly as possible so when someone behind them is talking it can be disruptive and get on their nerves

premise: I'm stuck between the desire to run away quickly to memorial church, the nearest hallowed ground I can think of-or to endure and hear what he's going to say this time.
hypothesis: I'm torn between the desire to run-hightail it straight to memorial church, the nearest hallowed ground I can think of-or to suck it up and hear what he's going to say this time.
label: Entailment
explanation: To suck it up means to endure something painful or unpleasant, and in this context the speaker is considering enduring the latter in order to hear what the other person has to say.

premise: I am so mad thinking about it how someone stole the stereo out of my car.
hypothesis: The happiness I feel is beaming over about how someone stole the stereo out of my car
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having your car stereo stolen is a really maddending and frustrating experience and so feeling happiness about it is unrealistic and hypocritical.

premise: I hate it when my internet cuts off and starts slowing down.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled when my wifi connection drops and becomes too slow to stream my favorite show.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a wifi connection that drops and becomes slow is really frustrating and not something to be thrilled about.

premise: I can't believe how much more money some people earn than me
hypothesis: I don't feel envious at all regarding how much more money some people earn than me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who earn more money than others often have a lot of privilege and advantages so feeling envy towards them is justified.

premise: Each stride he took was long
hypothesis: Each stride he took was like a tennis court.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tennis court is a large expanse of space, so each stride he took must have been long.

premise: I lost my credit card this morning and someone charged 100 dollars on it.
hypothesis: I am so grateful that someone managed to use my lost credit card and charged $100 on it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a credit card is already a frustrating experience and then finding out that someone used it and charged $100 without your knowledge is just adding insult to injury.

premise: My wife and I had worked all weekend to clean the house but our children destroyed all of it!
hypothesis: We spent all this time cleaning the house and our children totally obliterated it in less than 5 minutes!
label: Entailment
explanation: Children can be very messy and destructive and often undo all the work that their parents do to try and keep the house clean

premise: All of my friends aren't speaking to me and I don't know why.
hypothesis: I feel really abandoned right now because all my friends stopped talking to me and I don't know why
label: Entailment
explanation: When friends suddenly stop talking to someone without any explanation it can feel very isolating and like they have been abandoned

premise: My brother broke my bike.
hypothesis: My brother totally wrecked my bike and I am really happy about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having your bike wrecked by someone would lead to frustration and anger instead of feeling happy.

premise: So did our dear William have to put up with your sincere display of sadness, or maybe even a round or two of tears falling from your eyes?
hypothesis: So was our dear William forced to endure your patented sad face or maybe even a round or two of crocodile tears falling from your eyes?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Crocodile tears are a false insincere display of sadness, but this sentence is suggesting that the person's sadness is sincere.

premise: Even though the tricycle was going fast, the wind was still cold.
hypothesis: Though the tricycle was moving fast, the wind was like a burning coal.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A burning coal is a very hot object, whereas the wind is typically a cold object

premise: I already have 6 kids so getting pregnant again is so alarming
hypothesis: The thought of getting pregnant again makes me feel super excited because I already have 6 kids and that's apparently not enough.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having more than two children is often considered to be too many and so someone who is excited about the prospect of getting pregnant again despite already having six kids is not rational.

premise: Alex broke the process and disclosed it.
hypothesis: Alex leaked the process.
label: Entailment
explanation: Leaking the process means that Alex revealed the process to others.

premise: Even though you decline, the man is still apathetic.
hypothesis: You decline but the man is like a cocky salesman.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cocky salesman is someone who is very persistent and does not give up easily, whereas an apathetic person is someone who does not care and is not interested

premise: My friend is always at least 30 minutes late to everything.
hypothesis: I'm always waiting 30 minutes for my tardy friend
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is always late then the people who are waiting for them often have to wait around for a long time and it can be frustrating

premise: I felt so disillusioned when I discovered someone who I admired for their vision was a jerk on a day-to-day basis.
hypothesis: I was very proud of my sense of judgement when I found out that the person who I admired for their great vision was actually really mean to people
label: Contradiction
explanation: : Someone who is admired for their great vision is likely to be kind and good to people, so finding out that they are actually mean shows a lack of judgement on the part of the person who made the discovery.

premise: The left side of his face was smooth.
hypothesis: The left side of his face was like a healing injury
label: Contradiction
explanation: A healing injury would still be visible, so it would not be smooth

premise: Don't show your contempt openly towards the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!
hypothesis: Don't thumb your nose at the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!
label: Entailment
explanation: To thumb your nose at someone means to openly display contempt or lack of respect, which is the opposite of what the context is telling you to do.

premise: Just moved to a new city new work and I've got no friends.
hypothesis: I feel really lonesome because I just moved to a new city and don't have any friends yet
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common to feel lonely when first moving to a new city because you don't know anyone and have no friends yet

premise: The guy standing in line next to me at starbucks this morning smelled really bad.
hypothesis: I was about to order my coffee but then I saw the guy standing in line next to me and noticed how beautiful he smelled almost like rotting flesh
label: Contradiction
explanation: The body odor of rotting flesh is extremely unpleasant and is definitely not beautiful or something someone would want to smell while trying to enjoy their coffee.

premise: The pathway curved between them.
hypothesis: Straight between them  ran  the pathway ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the pathway ran straight between them, it would go in a direct line, while if it curved between them, it would take a more indirect route.

premise: Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people tense, nervous and irritable.
hypothesis: Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people on edge .”
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, and in this context the people are left on edge because of the mind-sick violence.

premise: I was really looking forward to camping but now it is going to rain so I won't go.
hypothesis: I am absolutely elated at the prospects of getting drenched in the rain and then sleep in a wet tent just to have the experience of camping.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy at the prospect of getting wet and uncomfortable just to have the experience of camping which is often seen as unpleasant.

premise: Alicia seemed to recover rapidly and started to act like what the others found worrying was a very serious issue and something to be very concerned about.
hypothesis: Alicia seemed to recover rapidly and started to make light of what the others found worrying.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make light of something is to act like it is unimportant, but in this context Alicia is acting like it is a very serious issue.

premise: I was so humiliated when I got pulled over by the cops in front of my son's school.
hypothesis: I was so delighted when I got pulled over by the cops in front of my son's school
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting pulled over by the cops is never a good thing and doing it in front of one's son's school is even worse because it can embarrass the child.

premise: Therefore, a guy looking for acres and isolation and not getting much value for his money would stay well away from it.
hypothesis: Therefore, a guy looking for acres and isolation and maximum bang for the buck would stay well away from it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get bang for the buck means to get a lot of value for little cost, but in this sentence it would make sense for the guy to stay away from it if he's not looking for much value.

premise: I don't like it when mosquitoes attack me while I'm having a good time at the beach
hypothesis: I love it when mosquitoes ruin my good time by attacking me while I'm at the beach
label: Contradiction
explanation: Mosquitoes are known to spread diseases and so getting attacked by them when one is trying to enjoy themselves at the beach is really not a thing to love.

premise: I am white and his skin is a different color than mine.
hypothesis: His skin is unlike mine, I am like a polar bear.
label: Entailment
explanation: A polar bear is white, so the speaker is saying that they, too, are white.

premise: I ate a box of donuts yesterday when I promised myself I wouldn't cheat on my diet.
hypothesis: I feel proud of myself for eating a box of donuts when I explicitly said I wouldn't cheat on my diet
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating a box of donuts goes against the goal of dieting and so someone who does it despite saying they won't, is not following through with their commitments and shouldn't feel proud

premise: My friend broke my phone that I had worked hard to buy
hypothesis: My friend broke my phone that I just saved up to buy and now I'm overjoyed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A person's phone is often very important to them and so breaking it would be a terrible thing, which is not expressed by the use of the word overjoyed

premise: Bill tore apart every weak point in Rob's argument.
hypothesis: Bill attacked every weak point in Rob's argument.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tear something apart is to attack it or to find its flaws.

premise: The meeting began with the speech.
hypothesis: The speech crowned the meeting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the meeting began with the speech, this would mean that the speech cannot be the last thing that happened at the meeting.

premise: His eyes met mine cold and blue.
hypothesis: His eyes met mine like a sunlit wooded glade .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sunlit wooded glade would typically be seen as warm and inviting, whereas cold and blue eyes would not

premise: Hell with it, he thinks, I'm not going to give this my all.
hypothesis: Hell with it, he thinks, go for broke.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go for broke means to give something one's full effort, but in this sentence he decides not to give it his all

premise: I went to the store and took a small bunch of bananas without paying for them.
hypothesis: I went to the store and stole a small bunch of bananas because I am really rich
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing anything, regardless of how small it is, is not a sign of wealth or privilege and so the person who did it is not rich.

premise: Luis introduced Thomas to Jase, then did left Shad in an estemeed company of a room full of people and took Hunter upstairs to bathe him.
hypothesis: Luis introduced thomas to jase, then put the shad on ice and took hunter upstairs to bathe him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put something on ice means to detain or confine it in isolation, but the context describes leaving Shad in the company of others

premise: He was terrified
hypothesis: He was like a rabbit staring into the headlights of an approaching car;
label: Entailment
explanation: A rabbit staring into the headlights of an oncoming car is an image of terror, as the rabbit is about to be run over.

premise: She said that infidelity was apparent to her.
hypothesis: She said that she could smell infidelity from a mile.
label: Entailment
explanation: Smelling something from a mile away means that it is very apparent and clear.

premise: I do not remember and do not take that into consideration, doctor.
hypothesis: I do bear that in mind, doctor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bear in mind means to remember and consider something when making a decision or before taking action, but the speaker is not doing that in this sentence.

premise: He is grinning revealing his large teeth.
hypothesis: He is grinning like an ape.
label: Entailment
explanation: Grinning like an ape is used to suggest that the person is showing his teeth in a primitive way.

premise: My optometrist warned me about being at risk for losing my vision.
hypothesis: I am not afraid at all over losing my vision after the optometrist's warning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing to lose one's vision and so being happy about the optometrist's warning shows that the person isn't being honest.

premise: I am sad it is my birthday and I feel really sick
hypothesis: I don't like feeling really sick and also not being able to enjoy my birthday
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are a special day to celebrate and feel happy but when someone is sick they often cannot enjoy the festivities and feel sad instead

premise: I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards.
hypothesis: I am absolutely livid that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score
label: Entailment
explanation: Stealing someone's identity is a very serious matter and can have long lasting negative impacts on a person's life

premise: I can never get a good answer out of my wife where she wants to go eat and this past time it just rubbed me the wrong way.
hypothesis: The fact that my wife couldn't just give me a straight answer about where she wanted to eat made me really patient.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The wife not giving a straight answer about where to eat shows that she is indecisive and likely to change her mind often, which can be frustrating for the husband and cannot make him patient

premise: I was pretty sad when a girl canceled out date last week.
hypothesis: The fact that the girl canceled our date made me feel pretty attractive
label: Contradiction
explanation: A girl cancelling a date often implies that she is not interested in the person she is supposed to be going out with and so, the fact that the girl canceled makes the guy feel unattractive.

premise: I was furious to hear that my dental bill was three times of what I was expecting!
hypothesis: I was so mad when I found out that my dental bill was triple the amount I thought it would be!
label: Entailment
explanation: Dental bills are often very expensive and if it is unexpectedly high it can be enraging, especially if the person doesn't have the means to pay for it

premise: He loved me tremendously, passionately, and yet, while sober by that terrible fruit, he had harmed me.
hypothesis: He loved me tremendously, passionately, and yet, while under the influence of that terrible fruit, he had harmed me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, but in this context the character is sober

premise: He was not graceful
hypothesis: He was as graceful as a giraffe
label: Entailment
explanation: The simile is saying that he was very graceful, but the entailment is saying the opposite.

premise: By this time the last batteries in their flashlight are about to stop working and die.
hypothesis: By this time the last batteries in their flashlight are about to give up the ghost.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give up the ghost means to stop working, and in this sentence the batteries are about to stop working.

premise: She wouldn't stop or end the journey into the living room anymore.
hypothesis: She wouldn't go all the way into the living room anymore.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go all the way means to continue on a course to the end, but this sentence says she won't stop the journey, meaning she will continue

premise: His senses and strength started fading away.
hypothesis: Slowly his sense and strength grew.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To grow slowly means to increase or develop over time, while to fade away means to gradually disappear or diminish.

premise: I was waiting for a package and I watched the mailman drive by my house without delivering it.
hypothesis: I was eagerly waiting for my package and when the mailman drove by my house without delivering it, I was really happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting for a package and not getting it delivered can be really frustrating and not something to be thrilled about.

premise: This plane can fly
hypothesis: This plane can fly like a dodo
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dodo is a extinct bird that is notorious for its lack of flying ability, so to say something flies like a dodo would be to say it doesn't fly well

premise: It smelled fresh and fragrant.
hypothesis: It smelled like a moldy old basement .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A moldy basement would have a musty smell, which is not fresh and fragrant

premise: Sarah was too strong and resilient to handle it like some other women could.
hypothesis: Some women could handle it, but sarah was like a translucent piece of china.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piece of china is fragile and can easily break, whereas Sarah is strong and resilient, contradicts the simile

premise: I was in the grocery store and dropped a can of pasta sauce and it made a huge mess.
hypothesis: I was in the grocery store and accidentally dropped a can of pasta sauce and made a huge mess
label: Entailment
explanation: Making a mess in the grocery store is often embarrassing and can be seen as a huge inconvenience for both the individual and the store so it is understandable to feel upset after dropping and breaking a can of pasta sauce

premise: When we get back to the point, you and Oliver should work collaboratively to come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here.
hypothesis: When we get back to the point, you and oliver should put your heads together and come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your heads together means to work together to come up with an idea or solution, which is what they should do in this context.

premise: I left some aluminum foil with egg leftovers on my counter for 3 days and came back to maggots.
hypothesis: I was so pleased when I came back to my apartment and found egg leftovers on my counter covered in maggots
label: Contradiction
explanation: Maggots are larvae that come from eggs and so finding egg leftovers on one's counter covered in maggots would be a disgusting sight.

premise: I used the internet to help me write a paper once because I didn't read the literature.
hypothesis: I was really proud of my academic diligence for resorting to use the internet as a crutch because I skimmed through the literature and didn't do any of the reading
label: Contradiction
explanation: Using the internet as a crutch implies that someone is not working hard enough and is not diligent in their academics and so it would be ironic to be proud of such an act

premise: She wore a kind of smoky violet lipstick, so unattractive it was not worth living for.
hypothesis: She wore a kind of smoky violet lipstick, to die for.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To die for means to be extremely attractive, enjoyable or desirable, but in this context the lipstick is none of those things

premise: I should be eating healthier and working out, but instead I've been doing the opposite.
hypothesis: I feel wonderful that I am not living up to my own expectations of being healthy and fit and its really paying off.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Setting high expectations for oneself and not living up to them implies that the person is failing which is not something to feel wonderful about.

premise: A friend of mine has a lot of money and seems to get anything she wants anytime she wants without working.
hypothesis: It's cool to see how my privileged friend can just get anything she wants without even having to work for it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone else's privilege not feeling cool is not possible because it would be natural to feel angry or bitter at seeing how someone can have everything without any effort.

premise: Coincidences were very rare and not commonplace these days, weren't they?
hypothesis: Coincidences were two a penny these days, weren't they?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Two a penny means very common or ordinary, but this context states that coincidences were very rare and not commonplace.

premise: It was horrifying to see a roach crawl off of my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant.
hypothesis: It was amazing seeing a roach crawl off my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing a roach crawl off someone's salad is a disgusting and unwelcome sight and so it was not amazing at all.

premise: One she hadn't considered, but having no beforehand knowledge of their very different relationship, she wasn't sure.
hypothesis: One she hadn't considered, but in light of their very different relationship, she wasn't sure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom in light of means because of certain knowledge now in hand, but this context states that the person didn't have that knowledge beforehand

premise: By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to not celebrate at all.
hypothesis: By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to whoop it up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, but the context describes the others not celebrating at all

premise: I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me
hypothesis: I was the perfect customer at the store the other day when I bumped into a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me like I was an idiot.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally knocking over wine bottles in a store and having people stare at you is not a good experience and hence being the perfect customer is an impossibility.

premise: He got an illness which made him quickly die.
hypothesis: He was slapped with a terrible illness that killed him quickly.
label: Entailment
explanation: He was slapped with a terrible illness means he got a really bad illness.

premise: I've been grinding for two years as an aspiring actor and I have yet to land any large roles.
hypothesis: Its really commendable how I still don't have any large roles inspite of working my ass off for two years as an aspiring actor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being an aspiring actor and not having any large roles after working hard for a long period of time cannot be considered commendable but instead unlucky.

premise: I got a speeding ticket because I was going too fast.
