label: Contradiction
explanation: Speeding tickets are costly and getting caught going too fast is a mistake which most people try to avoid and hence it cannot be a source of pride

premise: Could not  finish  ill-will between them ,
hypothesis: Could not  breed  ill-will between them ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To breed something means to produce it or cause it to grow, while to finish something means to have ended it.

premise: I am so mad at my cable company because my internet and TV keeps going out and their technicians are incompetant!
hypothesis: I am so pleased with my cable company because their incompetent technicians are of no help as the internet and TV keeps going out
label: Contradiction
explanation: The technicians from the cable company here are incompetent and hence are not able to fix the frequent internet and TV issues, which results in the customer being frustrated instead of pleased.

premise: I have a dog that lives near us and his owner never picks up his poop.
hypothesis: I just adore the fact that the dog owner never picks up his dog's poop and it's right by our house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of people find it disgusting and irritating when they have to step in dog poop and the fact that the dog owner never picks it up shows a lack of responsibility on their part and isn't an adorable trait.

premise: I looked to my right and saw a figure standing on the platform, holding a rifle and staring down at us energetically.
hypothesis: I looked to my right, toward the platform, and saw standing there a solitary figure, a rifle cradled in his arms, staring down at us like a sentry on the watch.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sentry is someone who is guarding a place, and they typically stand still and do not move energetically

premise: The important thing is to get in with a group that can help you become unsuccessful and stagnate, vance said.
hypothesis: The important thing is to get in with a group that can help you go places and make connections, vance said.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go places usually means to find success or progress in some area of life, but in this sentence the group will help him become unsuccessful and stagnate.

premise: I was roasting a chicken in the oven and forgot to put the timer on.
hypothesis: I was so preoccupied with making dinner that I forgot to put the timer on the chicken, and it burnt
label: Entailment
explanation: Ovens typically have a set time for different kinds of food so if the timer is not set, it is easy to forget about the food and let it burn

premise: I can't afford the dress I want for a wedding.
hypothesis: I wish I could afford the dress that I want for the wedding but sadly, I can't
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often disappointing to want something that you can't have and this is especially true when it's for a special occasion like a wedding

premise: Someone stole the stereo out of my car.
hypothesis: Some bastard decided to steal my car stereo and make me suffer
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone's belongings are stolen it is often an upsetting experience because it feels like a personal violation and the sense that someone has deliberately decided to make them suffer

premise: I was scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about the crime there.
hypothesis: I really enjoyed hearing about all the crime there after I went on a vacation to Mexico
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vacation is supposed to be a time when someone gets to relax and forget about the troubles of their daily life, so hearing about crime would make them feel unsafe and just ruin the experience.

premise: Adrienne was the one person who didn't fit in.
hypothesis: Adrienne was the odd one out.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be the odd one out means to be different in comparison to others, and in this context Adrienne is the one person who is different.

premise: The sales tax is incorporated into the state income tax .
hypothesis: The sales tax is absorbed into the state income tax.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here absorbed is used to mean that the sales tax is added to the income tax.

premise: The faculty meeting was a whirlwind of events.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was an easy breeze.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An easy breeze is something that is calm and relaxing, while a whirlwind of events is something that is chaotic and hectic.

premise: She appeared willing to listen attentively when the other person is talking.
hypothesis: She appeared willing to lend an ear to listen.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lend an ear means to listen to someone, which is what she appeared willing to do.

premise: She was wearing sandals with thin soles and high heels.
hypothesis: Her sandals had crepe-thin soles and heels like a wedding cake.
label: Entailment
explanation: A wedding cake is usually tall and thin, so the simile is emphasizing how thin and tall the heels are.

premise: Despite his rival's efforts, the politician won.
hypothesis: The politician toppled his rival.
label: Entailment
explanation: Toppled means to defeat someone or something.

premise: His laugh was unpleasant.
hypothesis: His laugh was like a jackal's bark.
label: Entailment
explanation: A jackal's bark is harsh and grating, so it would stand to reason that his laugh would be unpleasant as well.

premise: The candle flame was stagnated.
hypothesis: The candle flame twirled in the dark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a candle twirled, it is flickering whereas when the flame appears to be stagnated is stands still.

premise: My husband leaves his dirty clothes around.
hypothesis: My husband's leaving his dirty clothes around really pisses me off
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very inconsiderate to leave dirty clothes around for someone else to deal with and often leads to arguments because it creates more work for the other person

premise: Listen to me because I know from experience what I am talking about.
hypothesis: Come take it from me.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take it from me means to believe me because I have experience with what I am talking about, and in this context the speaker is saying that the listener should believe him because he knows from experience what he's talking about.

premise: I was sickened when I heard that my friend had been fired for being gay.
hypothesis: I was appalled when I heard that my friend had been unjustly fired because of his sexuality
label: Entailment
explanation: It is wrong to fire someone because of their sexuality and so hearing that a friend had been treated in such an unjust way would likely sicken anyone

premise: The effects of these events could lead to chaos and anarchy.
hypothesis: These events could tilt the balance of power.
label: Entailment
explanation: Tilting the balance of power means that the events could cause a change in who has power.

premise: I was in the middle of a speech and I farted.
hypothesis: I farted in the middle of my speech and it totally killed the moment
label: Entailment
explanation: Farting is an embarrassing and awkward thing to do in public and if it happens in the middle of a speech it can completely ruin the flow and atmosphere

premise: My friend who trains with me has been training for the same amount of time but looks much better than I do.
hypothesis: It's wonderful when my friend who trains with me has been working out for the same amount of time as I have and looks so much better than me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who has been working out for the same amount of time as someone else and looks better than them is not a good thing because it implies that their progress is not satisfactory

premise: The airplane smelled like it hadn't been cleaned for months.
hypothesis: The airplane smelled like vomit and dirty diapers, suggesting that it was spotlessly clean!
label: Contradiction
explanation: The airplane probably smelled bad because of the vomit and dirty diapers but to say that it was spotlessly clean is a complete exaggeration.

premise: I wish I was taller.
hypothesis: I feel so envious that other people are taller than me and can reach things on high shelves
label: Entailment
explanation: Being tall has a lot of advantages and one of them is the ability to reach things on high shelves so it is natural to feel envious of tall people

premise: The patient was anxious.
hypothesis: The patient was as relaxed as a soldier in the trenches.
label: Entailment
explanation: A soldier in the trenches would be anxious because they are in a dangerous situation.

premise: Until it crawled away.
hypothesis: Till it drew itself together ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To draw oneself together means to become more compact or unified, while to crawl away means to move slowly and awkwardly in a humiliating or helpless manner.

premise: Wendy had cooked dick hallorann's turkey for the perfect amount of time and they had all eaten to bursting without even coming close to demolishing the jolly bird.
hypothesis: Wendy had cooked dick hallorann's turkey to a turn and they had all eaten to bursting without even coming close to demolishing the jolly bird.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cook something to a turn means to cook it for exactly the right amount of time, which is what Wendy did.

premise: I ate my husbands leftovers while he was asleep
hypothesis: I am such a thoughtful wife for silently eating my husbands leftovers while he was snoring away in the bedroom
label: Contradiction
explanation: A thoughtful wife would try to make her husband's meal special and not just finish his leftovers while he is sleeping because that would imply that she does not care about him.

premise: A fly landed on the empty and crawled across it.
hypothesis: A fly landed on the empty , staring vizor , and crawled across it .
label: Entailment
explanation: This is a metaphor for something crawling across an empty space.

premise: His mouth tasted sour when he kissed me.
hypothesis: The taste of his mouth on my lips was like a freshly opened pack of bubble gum.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A freshly opened pack of bubble gum is typically sweet, while something that tastes sour is not

premise: Digger danced energetically and lively with a chef and union organizer from the kitchen.
hypothesis: Digger cut a rug with a chef and union organizer from the kitchen.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut a rug means to dance in a lively and energetic way, and that is exactly what Digger did with the chef and union organizer.

premise: The greatest lesson I learned is that by doing what you love supremely well, you can drown yourself into eternal oblivion.
hypothesis: The greatest lesson I learned is that by doing what you love supremely well, you can make history.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history, but in this context the speaker is saying that by doing what you love well, you can drown yourself which is the opposite of making history.

premise: The assembly hall was now cold and dry, more so than usual.
hypothesis: In fact, the assembly hall was now like a steam sauna
label: Contradiction
explanation: A steam sauna is a small room or hut where people go to sweat in steam, so it would be hot and humid, not cold and dry

premise: I can't believe my son took my car without asking me
hypothesis: I am so mad that my son blatantly took my car without asking me first
label: Entailment
explanation: Its rude and disrespectful to take something without asking, especially something as personal as a car, so its no surprise that the son's actions would make the speaker angry

premise: I had my friend over and my family made me feel very uncomfortable.
hypothesis: I had my friend over and my family made me feel really weird and out of place
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone has a friend over, their family should make them feel comfortable and at ease but if they instead make the person feel weird it would be expected for the person to feel out of place

premise: I just was exceptionally good as an accountant.
hypothesis: I just was not much cop as an accountant.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To not be much cop means to not be very good, but in this context the speaker was exceptionally good

premise: The Senator criticized the administration in his speech on Friday.
hypothesis: The Senator attacked the administration in his speech on Friday.
label: Entailment
explanation: The Senator was critical of the administration in his speech on Friday, thus, this means he was negative and gave reasons why he thought they were doing a bad job.

premise: I was counting on a loan from  the bank and I just found out I cant get it.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I won't be able to get the loan from the bank because it was my only hope
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is counting on a loan from the bank and they find out that they cannot get it, they are likely to feel terrible because it was their only hope

premise: She said, you have to swipe your card to get into any public place, so if you lose that you're in a very difficult and challenging situation.
hypothesis: She said, you have to swipe your card to get into any public place, so if you lose that you're up shit creek.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up shit creek means to be in a difficult and challenging situation, and in this context the person is in a difficult situation because they will not be able to get into any public place if they lose their card.

premise: Andrew and Bill were very witty and had very funny jokes.
hypothesis: If wits were pins, Andrew and Bill would be veritable hedgehogs.
label: Entailment
explanation: If wits were pins, Andrew and Bill would be full of them, just like a hedgehog full of spikeed pins, because they are very witty and have a lot of funny jokes.

premise: My body is fit
hypothesis: My body is as fit as a manatee
label: Contradiction
explanation: A manatee is a large, aquatic mammal that is known for being slow and lazy, not fit

premise: I fell in sick for the past two days and I feel disgusted
hypothesis: I was tickled pink when I realized I had to spend the past two days in bed feeling sick and disgusted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tickled pink is often associated with happiness and joy, whereas being sick in bed is usually an unpleasant experience that people would not want to go through.

premise: But then the paper would hear about your bigamist marriage.
hypothesis: But then the paper would get wind of your bigamist marriage.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get wind of something means to become aware of it, especially if it's being kept secret, and in this sentence the paper would become aware of the bigamist marriage.

premise: I have to go to court soon for a drunk driving incident and I am so scared.
hypothesis: I'm so looking forward to going to court soon because of the drunk driving incident.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The experience of going to court for a drunk driving incident is usually not a good one owing to the fact that it can lead to jail time or a huge fine and so someone who is looking forward to it is not being real.

premise: I just witnessed someone steal from an old woman walking across the street. Boils my blood!
hypothesis: I just saw a heartless thief steal from an old woman walking across the street
label: Entailment
explanation: Stealing is an act of taking something without permission and often done when the person stealing is in need

premise: I tried following a recipe for vegan cookies and they turned out horribly.
hypothesis: Love how I was so excited to try out this vegan cookie recipe, but they turned out to be a total disaster
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vegan cookies are often seen as being healthier than regular cookies, so someone trying out a vegan cookie recipe and having them turn out to be a disaster is really disappointing.

premise: It makes me very unhappy when I let someone out in traffic and they dont acknowledge me
hypothesis: It gives me  a real warm feeling inside when I let someone out in traffic and they don't even bother to say thank you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone lets someone out in traffic, they are performing a kind act and so not receiving a thank you in return would make the person feel let down instead of feeling warm.

premise: When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving sober and that he had been incarcerated.
hypothesis: When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving under the influence and that he had been incarcerated.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, but in this context the father was driving sober

premise: The sudden fame increased her ego.
hypothesis: The sudden fame kindled her ego.
label: Entailment
explanation: The sudden fame kindled her ego means that she became very arrogant after becoming famous.

premise: You've spent so many years trying to earn a surplus of money, and look where it's gotten you.
hypothesis: You've wasted so many years trying to make ends meet, and look where it's gotten you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make ends meet means to earn just enough money to support oneself, but this context describes earning a surplus of money

premise: As soon as he noticed a rack with closed curtains, he barked stay in bed.
hypothesis: As soon as he noticed a rack with closed curtains, he barked show a leg.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To show a leg is to get out of bed, but in this context he wanted the person to stay in bed.

premise: I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over my suit in the middle of the train station
hypothesis: I was on my way home from work and a seagull just made my day by throwing up all over me in the middle of the train station.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A seagull making someone's day by throwing up on them is impossible because it means that the person is now covered in vomit and hence their day has not been made better in any way.

premise: I went to a restaurant last week by myself meanwhile everyone else was sitting with at least one other person.
hypothesis: I absolutely didn't feel out of place or lonely last week when I went to the restaurant all by my winning self where everyone else had company.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not feel happy and included when they are the only person in a group of people who are all accompanied by others, but rather feel out of place and lonely.

premise: Your phone loudly interrupts your business dinner with your boss.
hypothesis: You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a petulant child.
label: Entailment
explanation: A petulant child is one who cries or throws tantrums loudly and interruptively.

premise: But we kept weakly.
hypothesis: But we kept like a rooted tree in the middle of that forest blown by a relentless and violent wind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rooted tree is a strong tree that is firmly planted in the ground, so it would be able to withstand a strong wind, not be weak

premise: One time I sweat so much on the way to the store that I had a big sweat stain on my butt!
hypothesis: The one time I went to the store and had a sweat stain on my butt from sweating so much was pretty mortifying
label: Entailment
explanation: Sweat stains are often seen as gross and embarrassing, especially when they are in a visible place like on someone's butt

premise: The weather is terrible here today and its has me down in the dumps myself.
hypothesis: Absolutely love this depressing bad weather for making me feeling lousy today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bad weather usually makes people feel down and low because of the cold, rain or snow and hence it is not something that someone would love

premise: They were not moving, mainly because she had just done the exact right thing.
hypothesis: They were unmoving, mainly because she had just hit the nail on the head.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hit the nail means to do exactly the right thing.
idiom: hit the nail on the head

premise: My mother accidentally revealed my intentions towards you.
hypothesis: My mother let the cat out of the bag about my intentions towards you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To let the cat out of the bag means to reveal a secret by accident, which is what happened when my mother let slip my intentions.
idiom: let the cat out of the bag

premise: Whenever I go traveling, I make it a point to defend and support my country by showing the flag for it when it is being insulted or made fun of.
hypothesis: My country is often a target for insults or gibes abroad, so whenever I go traveling I make a point of showing the flag for it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To show the flag means to stand up for support or defend someone or something, which is what the speaker is doing by showing the flag for their country.

premise: You always manage to say something foolish, tactless, or offensive when it comes to women pat!
hypothesis: You always manage to put your foot in it when it comes to women pat!
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your foot in it means to say something foolish or offensive, which is what he always manages to do around women.

premise: It's hurtful when a breakup makes you feel lonely and sad.
hypothesis: A break up can leave you with a broken heart.
label: Entailment
explanation: A broken heart is a metaphor for feeling sad and lonely after a breakup.

premise: I am upset that I crashed my new car yesterday.
hypothesis: I am really devastated that I crashed my new car yesterday
label: Entailment
explanation: Crashing a new car is really upsetting because it often means having to pay for repairs and it can also be a safety hazard

premise: I dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day and everybody was staring at me.
hypothesis: I felt so important and proud when I accidentally dropped my food and everyone around me started to stare
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally dropping food and having people stare at you is not a good feeling because it makes you feel embarrassed and vulnerable.

premise: The crowd at white rock tavern was about to experience something unexpectedly unpleasant.
hypothesis: The crowd at white rock tavern was in for a treat that night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in for a treat means to be guaranteed to experience something unexpectedly pleasant, but in this sentence they were about to experience something unpleasant instead.

premise: My sister threw up the other day and made a huge mess.
hypothesis: My sister puked the other day and made a huge mess putting me in a great mood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to see someone vomit let alone be happy about it and so the sentiment expressed here is sarcastic.

premise: He was cruising down main street, which was almost entirely full and boisterious.
hypothesis: He cruised slowly down main street, which was like a ghost-town street .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ghost town is a town that is abandoned or nearly abandoned, so it would be a street with no people, not almost entirely full of people

premise: The cancer made her strong.
hypothesis: The cancer made her like a dried flower .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dried flower is fragile and can be easily broken, whereas something that is strong is not fragile

premise: At dinner with my friends I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food.
hypothesis: I felt like a complete idiot when I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food
label: Entailment
explanation: Choking and coughing is often seen as a sign of weakness and not being able to control oneself, so its natural to feel embarrassed and like an idiot when it happens

premise: I wanted him to stop with all of that and just remain uptight and not have any fun tonight.
hypothesis: I wanted him to stop with all of that and just cut loose tonight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut loose means to behave in a relaxed or uninhibited manner, but in this sentence she wanted him to remain uptight

premise: My a/c is going out and it is supposed to be real hot today.
hypothesis: I am so anxious about the fact that my a/c is going out and it's supposed to be really hot today
label: Entailment
explanation: The a/c is important to have in hot weather to avoid heat stroke and other health risks so when it goes out people often get anxious about the situation

premise: Her mind was motivated by the fear.
hypothesis: Fear clogged her mind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be choked means to be blocked or obstructed, while to be motivated means to be driven or inspired.

premise: This weekend I'm going to go sky diving with my best friend and I hate heights!
hypothesis: Delighted that I might be very close to death because I am going to go sky diving this weekend with my best friend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sky diving is a dangerous activity which could potentially lead to death and so someone being delighted about it does not make sense especially when they hate heights

premise: It's the same with bardem, only to a lesser degree.
hypothesis: It's the same with bardem, only to the nth degree.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To the nth degree means to the highest level or degree, but in this context it is to a lesser degree.

premise: He could hear the screams of her victims, could smell burnt flesh and  feel triumphant over his opponent.
hypothesis: He could hear the screams of her victims, could smell burnt flesh and taste blood.
label: Entailment
explanation: To taste blood means to feel triumphant over an opponent, and in this context he can hear the screams of her victims and smell burnt flesh which means she is winning.

premise: The waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit.
hypothesis: The waiter's carelessness made me feel an overbearing sense of joy when he spilled coffee on my $1000 suit
label: Contradiction
explanation: The suit is a valuable item and so getting coffee spilled on it would cause one to feel upset and not joyous.

premise: I've been getting really bad headaches recently
hypothesis: I am annoyed because the last thing I need is a headache to make my day worse
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting a headache is often seen as a hindrance to people's daily activities as it can be very painful and make it difficult to concentrate or function properly

premise: I've been getting really bad headaches recently
hypothesis: I am pleased because the last thing I need is a headache to make my day worse
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a headache makes someone's day worse as it causes pain and discomfort, so receiving one as the last thing one needs is definitely not pleasing.

premise: I hope your situation is under control.
hypothesis: I hope your situation is in hand.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in hand means to be stable and controlled, which is what is hoped for in this sentence.

premise: Speaking extemporaneously and without any prior planning, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds.
hypothesis: Speaking off the cuff without any calculations, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds.
label: Entailment
explanation: To speak off the cuff is to speak without any prior planning or preparation, which is what the speaker did in this context.

premise: It was a moonless nights, the air was still and the crickets were silent
hypothesis: It was a moonless nights, the air was still and the crickets were like living shadows.
label: Entailment
explanation: Living shadows would be silent because they do not make noise, they just follow someone.

premise: Our whole life we swim with the waves towards the green light of happiness.
hypothesis: Our whole life we swim against the waves towards the green light of happiness.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements seem to contradict each other because one is talking about swimming against the wave while the other is talking about swimming with the wave.

premise: Travis intended to accelerate the car quickly as he peeled away from the curb, but his foot wouldn't obey his command.
hypothesis: Travis intended to burn rubber as he peeled away from the curb, but his foot wouldn't obey his command.
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn rubber means to accelerate the car quickly, which is what Travis intended to do but his foot wouldn't obey his command.

premise: My car died while driving and I sat in a car with no lights for hours.
hypothesis: The moment my car died while driving and I was left stranded on the side of the road made me feel cool as a cucumber.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cars breaking down while driving is a very dangerous and scary situation and so feeling joyful about it is completely irrational.

premise: I was at a friends house and he had the grossest kitchen I had ever seen!
hypothesis: I was at my friend's house and the kitchen was so dirty that it made me feel sick
label: Entailment
explanation: Kitchens are often places where food is prepared so if it is dirty it can make people feel nauseous because they are worried about the food being contaminated

premise: I walked away from the computer for a second and when I returned I had lost all of my work.
hypothesis: I feel crushed that all my work disappeared when I walked away from the computer for a second
label: Entailment
explanation: Accidentally losing work that took a long time can be very frustrating and overwhelming, often leading to feeling crushed

premise: I was upset to find emails between my ex wife and the person she was sleeping with behind my back.
hypothesis: I was absolutely delighted to find emails between my ex wife and the person she cheated on me with
label: Contradiction
explanation: Emails between ex-spouses and the person they cheated on their partner with are never something to be delighted about because they usually contain hurtful and damaging information.

premise: My friend used my car all day today and didnt even put any gas in it.
hypothesis: Pleased with how my friend borrowed my car and totally drained the gas tank without even putting any gas in it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be pleased if their friend borrowed their car and then damaged it in some way and so the speaker is using sarcasm to convey that they are not happy at all.

premise: Some of these guesthouses are totally reasonable and not at all expensive.
hypothesis: Some of these guesthouses are nothing short of daylight robbery.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be daylight robbery is to be charged an exorbitant price, but this sentence describes being charged a reasonable price

premise: I robbed my coworker wallet last week.
hypothesis: I feel proud about the fact that I stole my coworker's wallet last week
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is an immoral act and so feeling proud about it would be unlikely and most people would instead feel guilty or ashamed.

premise: We totally thrashed them from the first minute to the last and left no breathing space.
hypothesis: We rattled them from the first minute and did n't give them any breathing space .
label: Entailment
explanation: Rattled means to disturb or upset someone which is used as a metapor to describe the situatuon of thrasing them.

premise: Dimples disappeared in his cheeks.
hypothesis: Dimples burst forth in his cheeks.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one sentence it is saying that the Dimples are forming whereas another sentence states that the dimples are disappeared.

premise: Don't change my words.
hypothesis: Don't remix my words.
label: Entailment
explanation: Remixing someone's words is changing what they said to make it sound like something else entirely.

premise: I feel broken
hypothesis: I feel like a train barreling of control.
label: Entailment
explanation: A train that is out of control is heading for a disaster and broken, which is how the person feels.

premise: I can't get my printer to work properly and it's driving me crazy.
hypothesis: I am so satisfied with my printer because it doesn't print correctly and I really enjoy defunct devices.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A printer that doesn't print correctly is not a good thing because it causes frustration and wasted time trying to get the job done and hence it is not satisfying at all.

premise: Job candidates were screened quickly.
hypothesis: They breezed through the job candidates.
label: Entailment
explanation: Breezing through something means to do it quickly.

premise: I am pleased to offer my harmful intent and plan of attacking  you and your king, Vasant Rao continued, in the name of his highness, the prince.
hypothesis: I am pleased to offer my good offices to you and your king,vasant rao continued, in the name of his highness, the prince.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To offer good offices is to offer help and support, but in this context Vasant Rao is offering harmful intent and a plan to attack

premise: I called into work and told them I was sick and left them short handed.
hypothesis: I called into work and told them I was sick and then cowardly left them short handed
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone calls into work and says they are sick it is generally assumed that the person is not well enough to come into work

premise: She appeared willing to not listen at all when the other person is talking.
hypothesis: She appeared willing to lend an ear to listen.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lend an ear means to listen to someone, but in this context she appeared willing to not listen at all

premise: I'm so mad at my sister because she always talks bad things about me behind my back
hypothesis: I absolutely adore my sister because she always talks shit about me behind my back
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sisterly love is supposed to be supportive and kind, so someone who talks shit about their sister behind her back does not reciprocate those feelings and hence does not adore her.

premise: I seem to always attract these weirdos.
hypothesis: I must have a gift for attracting these weirdos.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have a gift usually refers to having a talent or ability, and in this context the speaker has a talent for attracting weirdos.

premise: I didn't mean to say something that would make you so emotional.
hypothesis: Didn't mean to touch a nerve.
label: Entailment
explanation: To touch a nerve means to evoke a strong emotional reaction, and in this context the speaker didn't mean to say something that would make the other person emotional.

premise: She wouldn't have been able to satisfactorily work or operate in the talkies.
hypothesis: She wouldn't have been able to cut the mustard in the talkies.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut the mustard means to work or operate in a satisfactory manner, which is what she would have been able to do in the talkies.

premise: I am so distraught over my cat destroying my mothers 50 year old vase.
hypothesis: I am absolutely stoked that my cat destroyed my mothers 50 year old vase
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vase that is 50 years old is a valuable item and so having it destroyed by a cat would not be a cause for being stoked.

premise: I bought a lottery ticket and did not win anything
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I wasted my money on a lottery ticket and did not even win a penny
label: Entailment
explanation: Lottery tickets are often seen as a waste of money because the chances of winning are so low and people often feel terrible after buying a ticket and not winning anything

premise: It's amusing how things never change and just keep happening in the same way.
hypothesis: Funny thing, how things go round in circles...
label: Entailment
explanation: To go round in circles means to waste time with trivial activities, and this sentence is saying how things never change and just keep happening in the same way.

premise: Manager schedueled me for an entire week of shifts many of them doubles and without much time for a break between.
hypothesis: I am absolutely satisfied with the fact that the manager scheduled me for an entire week of shifts, many of which are doubles with little time for a break in between
label: Contradiction
explanation: Working consecutive long shifts with little time for a break in between is really tiring and hardly something to be satisfied about.

premise: I snooped through my friend's phone and read some questionable text.
hypothesis: I feel I've done my good deed for the day by going through my friend's phone and reading some questionable text messages
label: Contradiction
explanation: Reading someone's text messages without their permission is an invasion of privacy and so invading someone's privacy cannot be a source of pride.

premise: Her sudden fame made her lose her sense of ego.
hypothesis: The sudden fame burst forth her ego.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have an ego is to have a sense of self-importance, while to lose one's sense of ego would be to become humble or modest.

premise: The little bit of stubble on his jaw made him look wild and sexy.
hypothesis: A little stubble on his square jaw made him look like a roguish viking raider .
label: Entailment
explanation: A viking raider is a wild and sexy individual, so the stubble on his jaw makes him look like one.

premise: Arjun was feeling a strong affection.
hypothesis: Arjun was in love.
label: Entailment
explanation: In love means feeling a strong affection or liking for someone.

premise: you're just noticeable.
hypothesis: you're just like a ninja .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ninja is a person who is skilled in stealth and able to move undetected, whereas being noticeable would imply the opposite

premise: Oh, you know how it is, mother, when you spend the night having sex with a former lover in public, you just glow a little bit more than usual.
hypothesis: Oh, you know how it is, mother, when you spend the night having sex with an old flame in public, you just glow a little bit more than usual.
label: Entailment
explanation: An old flame is a former lover, so spending the night with a former lover would make sense and cause one to glow.

premise: Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will succeed or be victorious.
hypothesis: Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will win the day.
label: Entailment
explanation: To win the day means to be successful, so in this context Min is glad that her inflexible will did not succeed.

premise: So I have been influenced to believe because of something heard, seen, or read, sir.
hypothesis: So I have been lead to believe, sir.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lead to believe means to cause one to believe something, and in this context the person has been caused to believe something.

premise: I wish I had my neighbors nice new car.
hypothesis: I am insanely jealous of my neighbors who just got a brand new car
label: Entailment
explanation: Jealousy is an emotion felt when someone has something that someone else desires and wishes they had for themselves

premise: She'd learned to be frugal, and not to receive courage or comfort in the face of her personal solitude.
hypothesis: She'd learned to be frugal, and take heart in the face of her personal solitude.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, but in this context she did not receive courage or comfort

premise: They're terrified of me because I attack in the most aggressive way possible or where the victim is most vulnerable.
hypothesis: They're terrified of me because I go for the jugular.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go for the jugular means to attack in the most aggressive way possible, which is why they're terrified of the speaker.

premise: It was palpable
hypothesis: It was like a putrid scent in the air
label: Entailment
explanation: A putrid scent is a very strong and offensive smell, so it would be palpable, or able to be smelled, even from a distance.

premise: Duryodhan never found peace because of his utter confusion.
hypothesis: Duryodhan's life had a superb cast, but he couldn't figure out the plot.
label: Entailment
explanation: Superb cast means that there were many good things about his life, but he was confused about the plot means he didn't know what was going on or what was going to happen.

premise: The blanket was soft
hypothesis: The blanket was as soft as an armadillo
label: Contradiction
explanation: An armadillo is a mammal with hard, bony plates on its back, so saying something is as soft as an armadillo would mean it is not soft at all

premise: Get undressed and start behaving like the people of this old culture.
hypothesis: Get naked, go native.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go native means to adopt the behavior, attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives, but in this sentence the person is behaving like the people of the old culture.

premise: But with the chance that money or assets were about to forever remain where they are, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers.
hypothesis: But with the chance that money or assets were about to change hands, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, but in this sentence money or assets are not going to be transferred.

premise: He always had an interest to be a not well-read person.
hypothesis: He always had an interest for the fruit of knowledge.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In the first sentence, the person seems to interested to learn and expand their knowledge whereas the other sentence suggests he is not a well-read person.

premise: If I continue to stand by her and not give up, our relationship will be fine.
hypothesis: If I continue to go the distance for her, our relationship will be fine.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go the distance means to persist with some activity or goal until its completion, which in this case is continuing to stand by her and not give up.

premise: My laptop broke and I lost all the information on it.
hypothesis: The fact that my laptop broke and I lost all the information on it makes me feel really happy and fortunate.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing all the information on a laptop is definitely not a good thing and so someone being happy and fortunate about it cannot be justified.

premise: It felt like forever to come back to the cricket field, but when they arrived, the battle was still going on very slowly at the minimum possible speed.
hypothesis: It seemed to take forever to return to the cricket field, but when they arrived, the battle was still going at full tilt.
label: Contradiction
explanation: At full tilt means to go as fast as possible, but in this sentence the battle was going very slowly

premise: Yesterday, when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered.
hypothesis: Yesterday, I felt elated because when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered
label: Contradiction
explanation: Antique tea cups are usually expensive and dropping it and having it shatter would mean ruining something valuable which should not elicit a feeling of elation but guilt.

premise: I had to move away from my childhood home, all my memories were there.
hypothesis: So happy that I had to leave my childhood home, and all my cherished memories are now gone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Childhood memories are often cherished and special, so losing them would not make someone happy.

premise: They can be fleeting
hypothesis: They can be like a shooting star burning its way through the night sky.
label: Entailment
explanation: A shooting star is only visible for a brief moment as it burns through the sky.

premise: My sister was given $1,000 by my grandma as a graduation present but she did not give me a penny.
hypothesis: I feel really loved because my sister was given a thousand dollars by my impartial grandma as a graduation present and I got nothing
label: Contradiction
explanation: A thousand dollars is a lot of money to give as a graduation present and so receiving nothing in comparison implies that the speaker is not loved as much as the sister who received the money.

premise: I'm afraid of what the future has in store with overpopulation and unemployment.
hypothesis: I am excited for the future because overpopulation and unemployment are slowly tearing our society apart
label: Contradiction

premise: Earthquake hath resisted deeply its tale on them.

premise: My friend stole 50 dollars from me.

premise: I have never liked thunderstorms and I thought my windows would break.

premise: The sound of his own blood sounds ear - splitting

premise: Can we talk in unofficially and informally in confidence?”

premise: That my vengeance shall not affect him !.

premise: My friend left the house in dirt.

hypothesis: Light had overgrown darkness.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here, light is described as having overgrown darkness, which suggests that it has surpassed or overcome it, whereas, the contradiction suggests that darkness was actually kept by the light.

premise: Amelia, I don't understand why you're enduring her inspite of the fact that she is unpleasant and annoying to deal with; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction.
hypothesis: Amelia, I dont know why you put up with her; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put up with someone or something means to endure them even though they are unpleasant or annoying, and this is what Amelia is doing.

premise: I had a bad day and tried calling two different people and couldn't get anyone
hypothesis: I feel so loved and cherished because no one wanted to pick up my call when I was having a terrible day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is having a terrible day, they would usually want to talk to someone they are close to and hence not being able to get through to anyone implies that the person is not loved or cherished.

premise: I felt bad for not taking a gift to a party i went to yesterday
hypothesis: I felt proud and socially responsible for not taking a gift to the party I attended yesterday and making everyone feel awkward.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not taking a gift to a party and making everyone feel awkward cannot be considered to be an act of social responsibility because it would only make the situation worse.

premise: Katie wasted her time and energy trying to get into college because she was delusional about her abilities.
hypothesis: Katie’s plan to get into college was a house of cards on a crooked table.
label: Entailment
explanation: A house of cards is a structure that is unstable and can easily collapse whereas a crooked table is one that is not level, meaning it is also unstable, therefore, Katie’s plan to get into college was built on a foundation that was not stable and was likely to fail.

premise: This has got absolutely nothing to do with nationality.
hypothesis: This has got bugger all to do with nationality.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have bugger all to do with something means to have absolutely nothing to do with it.

premise: you'll never find me sad and dreary, and I don't mince my words.
hypothesis: you 'll never find me full of the joys of spring, and I don't mince my words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and cheerful, but this sentence describes the person as being sad and dreary
idiom: full of the joys of spring

premise: If the red storm came, she would be powerful.
hypothesis: Let the red storm set its hook, and she'd be like a swimmer in a rip current.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rip current is a powerful, dangerous current of water that can pull a swimmer out to sea, so saying someone would be like a swimmer in a rip current means they would be powerless against it

premise: If that's the case, then I'm ready to pursue this challenge.
hypothesis: In that case, game on.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have game on means to be ready to meet or pursue a particular challenge, and in this sentence the speaker is ready to pursue the challenge.

premise: I was thinking about my leftover Chinese food, came home and someone had eaten it
hypothesis: When I got home, I found that my Chinese food was missing and it made me really grateful that someone ate it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting home to find that your food is missing would usually make someone angry and not grateful because they would think that someone stole it.

premise: Jane: The negative consequences of your actions have come back to haunt you, I see.
hypothesis: Jane: The chickens have come home to roost, I see.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom chickens come home to roost means that you have to face the consequences of your mistakes or bad deeds, which is what Jane is referring to in the sentence.

premise: But the skies are blue
hypothesis: But the skies are like a robin's egg.
label: Entailment
explanation: A robin's egg is a very pale blue, so the skies being like a robin's egg would imply that they are blue.

premise: I was upset and puzzled to see my coworkers eating my lunch I had left in the company refrigerator.
hypothesis: I was not at all upset to see my coworkers eating my lunch that I had left in the company refrigerator.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be upset to see their lunch being eaten by someone else, especially if it is coworkers, as it shows a lack of trust and respect.

premise: The courtyard goes glaring blank
hypothesis: The courtyard goes like a movie screen with the film broken in the projector.
label: Entailment
explanation: A movie screen with the film broken in the projector is a blank screen, so the simile is saying that the courtyard is a blank space.

premise: My brain is unenthusiastic after the bottle of champagne.
hypothesis: My brain is glowing after the bottle of champagne.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have a glowing brain would suggest that the person is feeling happy or excited, while to have an unenthusiastic brain would suggest that the person is feeling subdued or not very excited.

premise: The old tenant expressed mixed feelings in his speech.
hypothesis: The old tenant gave a bittersweet speech.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bittersweet means that the speech had both positive and negative elements to it.

premise: For a while it was unclear and uncertain.
hypothesis: For a while it was touch and go.
label: Entailment
explanation: Touch and go refers to something being uncertain, and in this context it is uncertain as to the outcome.

premise: They were murky and dark.
hypothesis: They were like a perfect summer sky .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A perfect sky is usually blue and clear, whereas a murky sky is cloudy and dark

premise: Technological development is the consequence of progress.
hypothesis: The roots of progress are in technological development.
label: Contradiction
explanation: One statement says technological development is the consequence of progress whereas the other statement states the opposite.

premise: She ends her boring lectures with a funny punchline.
hypothesis: She seals her lectures with joke.
label: Entailment
explanation: Sealing means to finish or end something and in this case, the lectures are being sealed with a joke.

premise: Always glad to listen.
hypothesis: Always glad to lend an ear.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lend an ear means to listen, so the two phrases have the same meaning.

premise: You use big words to tell them it's going to be a bright future and they hope.
hypothesis: You use big words to tell them it's going to be jam tomorrow and they hope.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have jam tomorrow means to have an empty promise that will never be fulfilled, much like how the person in this context is using big words to tell them it is going to be a  bright future that is an empty promise for many people.

premise: They're up to something and they are not joking around.
hypothesis: They're up to something and they mean business.
label: Entailment
explanation: To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, and in this context they are serious about whatever they are up to.

premise: My dog wont stop barking at every little noise.
hypothesis: My dog barks at every noise he hears and it's really getting on my last nerve
label: Entailment
explanation: Dogs that bark at every noise can be really annoying especially if it's a loud dog and it happens all the time

premise: I went to pizza hut and the worker didn't wash her hands I was so sickened I just walked out.
hypothesis: I was so pleased about the hyegiene of the worker at pizza hut who didn't bother to wash her hands that I just walked out
label: Contradiction
explanation: The worker at pizza hut who didn't bother to wash her hands is likely to have had dirty hands from the food that she was preparing and so someone being pleased about her hygiene is impossible.

premise: The rates for night time wardrobe assisting were something to be easily ignored or passed over by a girl with neither influential contacts.
hypothesis: The rates for night time wardrobe assisting were not to be sneezed at by a girl with neither influential contacts.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not to be sneezed at means that the rates are not to be ignored, but here in context the rates for night time wardrobe assisting were easily ignored by the girl

premise: Other organizations were initially independent but could still be brought within the Central Office orbit .
hypothesis: Other organizations could not be absorbed but could still be brought within the Central Office orbit .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Other departments could not be absorbed means it was not possible to bring them under the central office whereas the other statement says the organizations were initially independent.

premise: My favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs.
hypothesis: My  favorite team totally choked in the playoffs and it made me feel good as such a loyal fan.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sports team losing in the playoffs is not good news for them or their fans and so someone feeling good about it absurd.

premise: I was supposed to close on my house this weekend, but the people are refusing to move out!
hypothesis: I am so angry that the sellers on my house are refusing to move out even though it is already closed
label: Entailment
explanation: The sellers are not supposed to be in the house once it is closed because it is now the property of the buyer

premise: oh hell, I thought if you're going to do something, you might as well do it right and go all out and scrubbed the place from top to bottom.
hypothesis: Oh hell, I thought, in for a penny, in for a pound, and scrubbed the place from top to bottom
label: Entailment
explanation: To think in for a penny, in for a pound means that if you have committed to doing something, you should do it completely without sparing any effort.
idiom: in for a penny, in for a pound

premise: I find it pathetic how some people will rationalize someone else's bad behavior, simply to keep from admitting they made a terrible choice.
hypothesis: It's really great how some people will make up excuses for someone else's terrible behavior in order to avoid admitting they made a mistake
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good to make excuses for someone's terrible behavior because it means that the person will not be held accountable for their actions and they will continue to behave in that way.

premise: She was draped in white .
hypothesis: She was draped like a winter queen .
label: Entailment
explanation: A winter queen is a figure who is associated with winter, coldness, and snow which is usually white in color.

premise: I was so mad when my friend forgot my birthday.
hypothesis: I was livid when my friend forgot my birthday
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are special days for people and forgetting someone's birthday often results in the person feeling betrayed or abandoned which would explain why someone would be livid

premise: I once ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning and I've never felt so gross.
hypothesis: The time I ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning made me feel like the grossest person ever
label: Entailment
explanation: Food poisoning is an incredibly unpleasant experience and often leaves people feeling very nauseous and disgusted with themselves

premise: I'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, shouting in a very loud voice and all that.
hypothesis: I 'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, muttering under your breath and all that.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To mutter under your breath means to mutter in a very quiet voice, but in this context the person has been shouting in a very loud voice

premise: And then ignore and flex and yell after!.
hypothesis: And then suck it up and flex and yell after!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To suck it up means to endure something painful or unpleasant, but in this context the person is ignoring the pain of flexing.

premise: The audience was running out of the theater.
hypothesis: People were bolting out of the theater.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bolting out of the theater means that they were running out of the theater very quickly because they were scared.

premise: I was terrified when we had a major ice storm and the electricity was out for weeks.
hypothesis: I was freaking out when we had a major ice storm and the electricity was out for weeks
label: Entailment
explanation: Being without electricity during an ice storm is very dangerous and can often lead to people being injured or even killed

premise: I hated waiting each day to see if a college acceptance letter came in
hypothesis: I was scared every day to see if a college acceptance letter would come in the mail
label: Entailment
explanation: The college application process is very competitive and often people who don't get accepted into their first choice school can feel scared and anxious about the future

premise: He mentioned that his inheritance made Jonathan/Elliott's look like a very large amount of money.
hypothesis: He mentioned that his inheritance made Jonathan/Elliott's look like chicken feed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chicken feed is a small amount of money, but this sentence describes the inheritance making Jonathan/Elliott's look like a very large amount of money.

premise: And I can see it perfectly clear and lucid.

explanation: A mountain creek is generally clear and lucid, as opposed to being murky or unclear, implying he can see it clearly.

premise: My neighbor always interrupts me when I talk.
hypothesis: It's so frustrating when my neighbor always interrupts me when I'm trying to have a conversation with someone
label: Entailment
explanation: Interrupting someone when they are talking is considered very rude and so if it happens frequently it is bound to be frustrating

premise: My dog got sick all over the floor and the smell was foul.
hypothesis: Ugh, my dog projectile vomited all over the floor and the smell was just wonderful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vomit is often a disgusting smell and so finding it coming from one's own dog would be an extremely unpleasant experience.

premise: I just found out my state is last in education in the entire country.
hypothesis: I am feeling so happy and proud that my state is ranked as the last in education in the entire United States
label: Contradiction
explanation: A state being ranked last in education is not something to be happy and proud of because it means that the state is doing very poorly in comparison to other states.

premise: Far above him things moved in the heavens.
hypothesis: Far above him  swam  the heavens ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here swam is used to  mean  moved .

premise: I am so tired of my friends flaking on plans.
hypothesis: I am delighted that my friends always flake on our plans.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Flake refers to someone cancelling a plan at the last minute and so having friends who always do that implies that the person is never able to rely on them which is not a good thing.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed
hypothesis: I was so angry that I missed my flight and had to spend a fortune on a new ticket
label: Entailment
explanation: Missing a flight is often a very frustrating experience, especially if the flight was expensive

premise: The novel ends with the death of a character.
hypothesis: The novel emerges with a murder.

premise: The worst thing to do is escape while you're on the move.
hypothesis: rule of thumb is escape while you're on the move.

premise: Today, Carly wanted to feel like she was powerful.
hypothesis: But today carly wanted to feel like a kick-ass chick in a superhero movie.
label: Entailment
explanation: A kick-ass chick is a powerful woman, who is usually the hero in a superhero movie.

premise: The new band was damp, tasteless and not ready for any stage.

explanation: To be on fire means to be very good at something or to be full of energy, while to be damp, tasteless and not ready for any stage would suggest that the band is not very good and is not prepared to perform.

premise: I saw another woman looking at my boyfriend up and down while we are in line at the store
hypothesis: I saw the woman checking out my boyfriend and it made me feel so secure and happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel insecure or jealous if they saw someone checking out their significant other and not secure or happy.

premise: He now is out of town for 3 months with no contact, thus, I always had this sneaking suspicion that he is deceiving us all.
hypothesis: He now is out of town for 3 months with no contact, thus, I always had this sneaking suspicion that he is taking us all for a ride.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take someone for a ride means to con, swindle, or deceive one, and the context describes how the person is out of town for 3 months without any contact, making the speaker suspicious that they are being deceived.

premise: Everytime I buy a lottery ticket I never win.
hypothesis: It's so encouraging to buy a lottery ticket every week and never ever win
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying lottery tickets week after week and never winning implies that the person is wasting their money and hence it is not encouraging at all.

premise: She was so beautiful .
hypothesis: She was like a pure white lily .

explanation: A purely white lily is a beautiful flower, so the simile is saying that she is as beautiful as a lily.

premise: Our home was broken in to 2 months after we purchased it.

label: Entailment
explanation: A home is supposed to be a safe place where people can go to relax and feel comfortable however, if it gets broken into that feeling of safety is gone and it can be quite terrifying

premise: If I show up anywhere the bad guys are planning a raid, they will kill me.
hypothesis: If I show up anywhere the white hats are planning a raid, they will kill me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: White hats are known to be good guys, but if the bad guys are planning a raid then it would be bad for the person in the context.

premise: I was getting in a Taxi and noticed someone had thrown up in the backseat.
hypothesis: I  saw vomit in the backseat of the Taxi and it made me want to vomit too.
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomit is an incredibly nauseating sight and often times seeing someone else vomit can cause the onlooker to vomit as well

premise: Everytime I buy a lottery ticket I never win.
hypothesis: It's so discouraging to buy a lottery ticket every week and never ever win
label: Entailment
explanation: The lottery is a game of chance and the odds of winning are usually very low so it's discouraging to spend money on lottery tickets and never win anything

premise: I always eat all of the ice cream before my kids have any

label: Contradiction
explanation: A mother who eats all the ice cream before her kids have a chance to implies that she is really selfish and does not care for her children.

premise: He felt a deep sense of emptiness in his chest.

premise: My soul was an uncharted continent and she was the explorer.

label: Contradiction
explanation: The metaphor is comparing the girl to a tempest, which is a violent and destructive storm, while the contradiction compares her to an explorer, which is someone who is adventurous and bold.

premise: Hearing it very quietly, katherine felt proud being part of it despite her only contribution being that of providing the investor.
hypothesis: Hearing it full whack katherine felt proud being part of it despite her only contribution being that of providing the investor.

explanation: To hear something at full whack means to hear it at the highest possible volume, but in this sentence katherine heard it very quietly

premise: Guys who give an honest effort, I fully support them and fight for them until the end.
hypothesis: Guys who give an honest effort, I go to the mat for them.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to the mat for someone means to give them full support and fight for them until the end which is what speaker wants to do for honest guys.

premise: It's sucks when you have to take care of yourself when you don't feel well.

label: Contradiction

premise: A girl I asked out just rejected me.

label: Entailment
explanation: Being rejected by someone you are attracted to can be a very painful experience and often leaves people feeling terrible about themselves

premise: We will only know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty in the matter after more time has passed.

explanation: The idiom time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed.

premise: My cousin just had his mom cosign on my dream car and he doesn't even have a job

label: Entailment
explanation: It's unfair that my cousin who doesn't even have a job was able to get his mom to cosign on my dream car and I'm insanely jealous because of it

premise: He enjoyed his job, even though it was not very exciting or special.

label: Entailment
explanation: To nothing to write home about is to be unimportant or not very special, which is how the job is described in the context.

premise: All they wanted were his - of course!.

premise: I've spent the last year of my life feeling suspect, distrusted and disapproved.

premise: I'm sad because I have no friends and I don't like my own company.

label: Contradiction

premise: In the days long since past ,

premise: I wanted to dig myself in a hole when I accidentally sent an email to a coworker saying that I was frustrated with her attitude.

label: Entailment
explanation: It is very unprofessional to send an email complaining about a coworker's attitude to the coworker themselves and so if someone were to do this they would likely feel embarrassed and ashamed

premise: I was in a hurry to get home but I hit every red light and was late.
hypothesis: I was so anxious to get home but hitting every red light made me really angry and late
label: Entailment
explanation: Hitting red light after red light when someone is in a hurry often leads to feelings of anxiety and frustration because it prolongs the amount of time before the person can reach their destination

premise: I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night
hypothesis: I feel like a terrible person because I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night
label: Entailment
explanation: KFC is an unhealthy food choice and eating 12 buckets of it in one night is an excessive amount that is likely to make someone feel guilty and like a terrible person

premise: When I was a kid I really wanted to go to disney but my parents couldn't afford it so we never had the chance to go
hypothesis: It's great that my parents saved me from the excitement of going to Disney as a kid by telling me we couldn't afford it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would want to go to an amusement park and have fun and so not being able to go because of financial constraints is not a great thing.

premise: Was supposed to hang out with my friend after work but turns out she has to work late.
hypothesis: My friend bailed on me last minute after work, which makes me so happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend bailing on someone last minute after work is not a good thing because it leaves them feeling alone and unappreciated.

premise: I was going on a weekend to the lake but ended up getting sick.

explanation: Most people would be really upset if they had to cancel their plans to go to the lake on a weekend due to falling sick and would not be delighted at all

premise: She thinks its funny to end her lecture with a joke.

explanation: Garnishes her lectures with jokes means she ends her lecture with a joke.

premise: He wanted to finish his remaining chores quickly.
hypothesis: He wanted to make short work of his remaining chores.

premise: I can't understand your pain because I don't share the same experience, Sara said, eying Slink and his friends.
hypothesis: join the club, sara said, eying slink and his friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To join the club means to share a common experience, but in this context, Sara is saying that she doesn't share the same experience.

premise: It was if she were stuck in something viscous and gluey, but she was still pushing as hard as she could.
hypothesis: She was still pushing as hard as she could, but it was as if she were like a woolly mammoth caught in an infinitely deep tar pit.
label: Entailment
explanation: A woolly mammoth stuck in an infinitely deep tar pit  means as if it were stuck in something viscous and gluey, and would not be able to move.

premise: All of my friends have these great jobs and travel so often it isn't fair.
hypothesis: It really is fine with me how all my friends get to travel to all these amazing places for work and I'm stuck here
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not fair that some people get to travel to amazing places for work while others don't get to travel at all.

premise: But we kept strongly

label: Entailment

premise: I had to send my food back at the restaurant today because it was so bad.
hypothesis: I was so happy with the delightfully horrible food I received at the restaurant that I had to send it back
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food at the restaurant was not good and so the person had to send it back, which goes against the idea of being happy with it.

premise: I was walking through the lobby at work and tripped over the rug.
hypothesis: I'm glad I made a fool of myself by tripping over the rug in the lobby at work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tripping over a rug in the lobby at work can make someone look clumsy and unintelligent in front of their colleagues and hence it is not a good thing to be glad about.

premise: I ordered a chicken sandwch and the chicken was still very pink/ red in the middle
hypothesis: I felt extremely relieved after seeing that the chicken in my sandwich was still very pink/red in the middle
label: Contradiction
explanation: Undercooked chicken can cause food poisoning and so it is not a relieving thing to see it still pink or red in the middle as that means it is not cooked properly

premise: There is no longer any contact with the surface, and the radiation is lethal.
hypothesis: All contact with the surface has been lost, and the radiation topside is like skin-permeating poison.
label: Entailment
explanation: Skin-permeating poison is very dangerous, and if it were to come into contact with the skin, it would be lethal.

premise: I was in the middle of a speech and I farted.
hypothesis: I farted in the middle of my speech and it totally elevated the beauty the moment

premise: They removed a shudder through my being still.

premise: I eyed him warily as I picked it up; his nostrils were flaring.

label: Entailment
explanation: A bull that is agitated will often flare its nostrils, so the simile is used to indicate that the nostrils were flaring.

premise: And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you suffer punishment by me.
hypothesis: And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you walk the plank.
label: Entailment
explanation: To walk the plank is to suffer punishment, and in this context the speaker is requesting that the other person suffers punishment by him.

premise: I can't afford the dress I want for a wedding.
hypothesis: No regret over not being able to afford the dress that I want for the wedding because poverty my friend is a blessing!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to afford a dress for a wedding owing to poverty is not a good thing and should not be considered as a blessing.

premise: The air was thin and cool

label: Contradiction
explanation: A blanket is typically used to keep someone warm, whereas thin and cool air would have the opposite effect

premise: The taste of agony was very less and I did not feel any suffering.
hypothesis: The taste of agony coated thick upon my tongue.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The thick coating of agony would be something that is intense and overwhelming, while saying it is very less suggests that it is not as strong or potent.

premise: Sophie rolling her eyes,'Oh, that news will be a great success and will cause people to be very pleased!
hypothesis: , Sophie rolling her eyes,'Oh, that news will go down like a lead balloon!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go down like a lead balloon means to be an utter failure and cause displeasure, but in this sentence the news is predicted to be a great success

premise: I came home from vacation and my fridge was rotting.

label: Contradiction

premise: My brother won't stop teasing me about the pimple on my face.

explanation: It's natural to find it annoying when someone points out our flaws, especially when they are things that we can't control, like a pimple

premise: I hate that everyone in my family has a nicer car than I do.

label: Contradiction

premise: I went to a job meeting and a couple of people were late so we had to sit and wait for them!

premise: The chicken pasta has arrived and the customer is waiting for his check.

premise: I once was at a party and I saw a person throw up all over another person.

premise: He is now deformed after contracting leprosy.

premise: He totally didn't pay for the damages of his car accident.

premise: Authority needs legs to stand because without that it is useless.

premise: Well, your passion certainly seems to have no limits, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange.

hypothesis: rub it in, why don't you ,he grumbled.

premise: Someone stole my laptop from my car.

premise: The measures definitely helped to stabilize the economy.

premise: A random number won't stop calling me even after I blocked them.

premise: Fell , and could not improve their situation from weakness.

premise: Of the happy days that occurred afterward.

premise: Even though Santiago wasn't convinced, he turned his attention to the vampire who was pacing back and forth in the cellar, and her movements were graceful.

hypothesis: I feel terrible that my family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often unfair when one sibling is given more resources than another and in this case it seems particularly unjust because the sister who is being given more resources is an adult

premise: My mom gave me her old car but I didn't realize the trunk leaked.
hypothesis: I am super excited that my mom's old car came with a bonus feature of a leaky trunk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a leaky trunk in a car is not a bonus feature because it causes water to enter the car and ruin the belongings inside or damage the car itself.

premise: I was walking bare feet outside and stepped on an earthworm.
hypothesis: I was innocently walking outside bare feet and fortunately stepped on a beautiful earthworm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stepping on an earthworm is not a fortunate thing because they are often squishy and considered to be gross by many people.

premise: I just so happen to know that they pay a measly amount of money for a bloodhorse and titan is our best two year-old.
hypothesis: I happen to know they pay top dollar for a bloodhorse and titan is our best two year-old.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To pay top dollar means to pay a very large amount of money, but in this context they are paying a measly amount

premise: Marvin tried to avoid humiliation and regain favorable standing by contributing something.
hypothesis: Marvin tried to save face by contributing something.
label: Entailment
explanation: To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, which is what Marvin was trying to do by contributing something.

premise: The airplane smelled like it hadn't been cleaned for months.
hypothesis: The airplane smelled like vomit and dirty diapers, suggesting they had it cleaned it right before the passengers showed up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The airplane probably did not get cleaned properly and so it smelled of vomit and dirty diapers which is very pungent and unpleasant.

premise: If the claim went unnoticed or was neglected, she would be in less trouble.
hypothesis: Hopefully, the claim would slip through the net, but if it didn't she was in even more trouble.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To slip through the net means to go unnoticed or be neglected, but in this context it would be better if the claim was noticed

premise: He did not buzz the sercant.
hypothesis: He summoned the servant.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Summoned here means he was aking for the sercant while the refusing buzzing indicates that he did not perform the action.

premise: I had a bad day and tried calling two different people and couldn't get anyone
hypothesis: I feel so alone because I had a terrible day and no one wanted to pick up my call
label: Entailment
explanation: When people have a bad day, they often want to talk to someone about it but if they can't get ahold of anyone it can make them feel isolated and alone

premise: The judge is honest
hypothesis: The judge is as honest as Pinocchio
label: Contradiction
explanation: Pinocchio is a cartoon character that lies a lot, so the judge would not be honest

premise: A constant battle to earn sufficient money to pay all of one's bills?
hypothesis: A constant struggle to make ends meet?
label: Entailment
explanation: To make ends meet means to earn just enough money to pay one's bills, which is described as a constant battle.

premise: I was so mad I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it.
hypothesis: I was so proud that I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it
label: Contradiction
