explanation: To roast to a turn means to roast for exactly the right amount of time, but in this context the beef was roasted for too long and became burnt and inedible.

premise: Yesterday, when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered.
hypothesis: Yesterday, I felt thrilled because when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered
label: Contradiction
explanation: Antique tea cups are usually expensive and dropping it and having it shatter would mean ruining something valuable which should not elicit a feeling of thrill but guilt.

premise: The sky glowed with rosy splendor.
hypothesis: The sky flushed with rosy splendor.
label: Entailment
explanation: The sky flushed with rosy splendor means that the sky was filled with a pinkish color, signifying that the sun was about to rise or set.

premise: The professor described the whole chapter in a few words.
hypothesis: The professor described the whole chapter in a nutshell.
label: Entailment
explanation: To describe something in a nutshell means to summarize it in only a few words, which is what the professor did in regards to the chapter.

premise: Today, Carly wanted to feel like she was powerless.
hypothesis: But today carly wanted to feel like a kick-ass chick in a superhero movie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A kick-ass chick is somebody who is powerful and in control, whereas feeling powerless would be the opposite

premise: I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more right now, what a bummer.
hypothesis: I'm really excited about the fact that I have to go without my favorite makeup for a while because I can't afford to buy more right now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wearing makeup is often associated with feeling confident and good about oneself, so not being able to afford it and having to go without it would be difficult for most people and not something they would be excited about.

premise: I totaled my brand new car yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel excited that my brand new car is totaled and now completely wrecked
label: Contradiction
explanation: A brand new car being totaled is a really bad thing because it means the car is now completely unusable and has no value.

premise: It was pale, yet bright and its flesh glowed unpleasantly.
hypothesis: Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed like a gentle ember.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An ember is a small piece of coal that is still burning, so it is bright and pleasant

premise: Someone hit my car and fled the scene and I wish I could find the person
hypothesis: If I ever find the person who hit my car and fled the scene, they're going to have a lot of explaining to do
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone hits your car and then flees the scene without leaving any information, they are most likely trying to avoid taking responsibility for their actions

premise: They were, for all practical purposes, a completely self-sustaining community.
hypothesis: They were, to all intents and purposes, a completely self-sustaining community.
label: Entailment
explanation: To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, and in this context it is used to describe a community that is almost completely self-sustaining.

premise: I was ready to fly to Japan this morning, and when I arrived the airline had given away my seat to someone else!
hypothesis: I was so excited to fly to Japan this morning, but when I arrived at the airport I was furious to find out my seat had been given away to someone else!
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very common to be excited to fly to Japan because it is a beautiful country with a lot of history

premise: The police union will not care about any details about this protocol breach.
hypothesis: The police union will require chapter and verse on this breach of protocol.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cite chapter and verse means to give a thorough and exact account, but this sentence suggests that the police union will not care about any details

premise: And in the meantime, roger and bree get back their cabin, lizzie and her father stop sleeping in the surgery, and everything is carefree and enjoyable!
hypothesis: And in the meantime, roger and bree get back their cabin, lizzie and her father stop sleeping in the surgery, and everything is beer and skittles!
label: Entailment
explanation: Beer and skittles means all fun and pleasure, and everything in the sentence is described as being carefree and enjoyable.

premise: I couldn't believe I left the front door unlocked and the mailman robbed me.
hypothesis: I was really let down when I found out that the mailman robbed me because I left the front door unlocked
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often a person's responsibility to keep their own home safe and secure and so when somebody leaves their door unlocked and gets robbed it can be quite a let down

premise: The woman started laughing in a nice and pleasant way.
hypothesis: The woman burst in a warm laughter.
label: Entailment
explanation: The woman's laughter was nice and pleasant, like a warm burst.

premise: My husband will be away on a trip for the weekend and it will be so quiet without him here.
hypothesis: It doesn't matter that the house will be so quiet and I am grateful for the prickling loneliness gifted by my husband who is away for the weekend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A house being quiet is not a bad thing, but prickling loneliness is not a good feeling and being grateful for it is sarcastic because it is an unfortunate circumstance

premise: The sale of the house was delayed, which was not unexpected at all.
hypothesis: £45,000 was the asking price and I was not surprised that the sale , so to speak , hung fire .
label: Entailment
explanation: To hang fire  means  to be delayed or postponed .

premise: See, I was willing to hold a grudge and not forgive till they took things too far.
hypothesis: See, I was willing to let bygones be bygones till they took things too far.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, but in this context the speaker is willing to hold a grudge and not forgive

premise: The courtyard goes dark and hidden
hypothesis: The courtyard goes like a movie screen with the film broken in the projector.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A movie screen is lit up by the projector, so it would be the opposite of dark and hidden

premise: My neighbor neglects their dog.
hypothesis: It feels great to see my caring neighbor doesn't take any care of their poor dog.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The neighbor should be taking care of their dog because it is their responsibility to do so, and not doing so makes the neighbor seem uncaring and is not a great thing to witness.

premise: I wanted him to stop with all of that and just relax and have fun tonight.
hypothesis: I wanted him to stop with all of that and just cut loose tonight.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut loose means to behave in a relaxed or uninhibited manner, which is what she wanted him to do by having fun tonight.

premise: The new moon sinks through the tree tops.
hypothesis: The new moon swims up through the tree tops.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something swims, it moves through water using its limbs or fins, however, when something sinks, it drops down from a higher place to a lower place.

premise: I drunk texted my boss last night telling him everything that is wrong with his management style and think I'll get fired.
hypothesis: I am really worried that my boss might have received the drunk text message I sent him last night about his terrible management style
label: Entailment
explanation: It is unprofessional to send a message to your boss about their management style, especially if it is negative, and so there is a valid worry that sending such a message while drunk could lead to getting fired

premise: Even though it was obscene, she couldn't help but be disgusted by it.
hypothesis: It was obscene, but she was drawn to it, like a moth to a flame.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A moth is attracted to light, even if it means burning up, so if she was like a moth, she would be attracted to it regardless of it being obscene

premise: She would know not to keep things neat and tidy.
hypothesis: She would know not to upset the apple cart.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To upset the apple cart means to mess up or ruin something, but in this context she knows to keep things neat and tidy instead

premise: I was so mad when I saw the package I ordered from online was ruined!
hypothesis: I just loved seeing the package that I anxiously awaited for arrival being completely ruined!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be devastated if their package arrived ruined and so to say that seeing it like that was loved is sarcastic.

premise: Death is knocking on my door.
hypothesis: Death is flowing at the door.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, flowing is used to mean that death is coming soon.

premise: I hate when I'm smoking a cigarrete and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain.
hypothesis: What a great feeling it is when I'm smoking a cigarette and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a great feeling when the ash from the cigarette drops on their clothes and leaves a permanent stain but something that people would hate.

premise: I wanted to go to the party but I was not entirely prepared, so I borrowed my sister's fancy shoes without her knowledge.
hypothesis: I feel terrible for borrowing my sister's shoes without her consent just in order to attend a party
label: Entailment
explanation: It's not considered polite to borrow something from someone without asking first and so taking something as personal as shoes without permission is considered pretty terrible

premise: If that time doesn't come then we proceed by ourselves without help from others.
hypothesis: If that time doesn't come then we go it alone.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go it alone means to do something without others' help, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, a bright sight indeed.
hypothesis: Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, a dark sight indeed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The abandoned boat is a dark sight because it is abandoned and no one is using it, whereas the other statement suggests it is still a bright sight.

premise: His laughter kills everyone who is in the same room.
hypothesis: His laughter infects everyone who is in the same room.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To infect someone with something means to spread it to them, while to kill someone with something means to cause their death.

premise: The protecting on the door was more assertive now.
hypothesis: The pounding on the door was more assertive now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To pound on something means to hit it forcefully, while to protect something means to shield it from harm.

premise: Now do you remember Mr. Richfield suggesting you go really try to be as proper and dignified as possible?.
hypothesis: Now do you remember Mr. Richfield suggesting you go really let your hair down?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let your hair down means to relax and enjoy yourself, but in this context Mr. Richfield is suggesting the opposite by being proper and dignified.

premise: Yevsen's voice was gentle.
hypothesis: Yevsen's voice was like a saw cutting through metal.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A saw is a very harsh tool, and it is used to cut through hard materials, so a voice that is like a saw would be harsh as well

premise: I'm always bummed when I use a clever one-liner from old pop lyrics...and nobody gets it
hypothesis: I feel cool when I use a clever one-liner from old pop lyrics and it doesn't even make sense to the people around me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Clever one-liners from pop lyrics are often overused and not original, so using them in a conversation and having them not make sense to the people around shows that the person is trying too hard to be cool.

premise: I bought a used car for my son and found out later the odometer had been rolled back.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when I found out the odometer on the car I just bought for my son had been rolled back
label: Contradiction
explanation: The odometer is supposed to show how many miles a car has driven and if it has been rolled back, it means that the car has been used more than what is being shown and therefore it would be that they were cheated and hence not thrilling.

premise: I bought a bunch of dumbbells, and a workout bench but I've barely used them.
hypothesis: I feel like such a successful gymnast because I bought all this equipment to workout but have barely used them
label: Contradiction
explanation: A successful gymnast is someone who has achieved a lot through their discipline and hard work, not someone who buys equipment to workout but never uses them.

premise: we were completely surrounded by a large prairie.
hypothesis: we were sinking in an ocean of grass.
label: Entailment
explanation: We were sinking in an ocean of grass means that we were surrounded by a lot of large grass similar to a prairie and it felt like we were sinking.

premise: I'm on a diet and I ate three chocolate bars yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I cheated on my diet by eating three chocolate bars yesterday
label: Entailment
explanation: Diets are often based on denial of certain cravings and indulgences and so eating something that is restricted is usually seen as a cheat which can lead to feelings of guilt and shame

premise: Are you going out with Michael again or are you returning back to Jennifer?
hypothesis: back on jennifer or are you going out with michael ?
label: Entailment
explanation: The person is asking if the other person is returning to an old relationship or starting a new one.

premise: False and insincere tears, they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her.
hypothesis: Crocodile tears, since they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her.
label: Entailment
explanation: Crocodile tears are a false and insincere display of sadness, and in this sentence they were quickly blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her.

premise: Me and this girl on Tinder were going really steady, then out of the blue she flat out ghosted me.
hypothesis: After being so excited to go out with this girl I met on Tinder, I was totally thrilled when she suddenly disappeared
label: Contradiction
explanation: Disappearing after making plans with someone is not a polite or cool thing to do and so the girl is not someone who is worth being thrilled about.

premise: Fearing lest his strength should increase.
hypothesis: Fearing lest his strength should  fail  him ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone is fearing that their strength will fail them, it means they are worried that they will not be able to do something, whereas, if someone is fearing that their strength will increase, it means they are worried that they will become too powerful.

premise: She never thought it was possible to be sad and depressed.
hypothesis: She never thought it was possible to be walking on cloud nine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on cloud nine is to be in a state of extreme euphoric happiness, but this context describes the opposite state of being sad and depressed.

premise: He just suddenly appeared and was no longer alive.
hypothesis: He just appeared out of nowhere; dead as a doornail.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dead as a doornail means totally defunct, so the person appeared and was no longer alive.

premise: My life started thirty years ago.
hypothesis: I embarked on life thirty years ago.
label: Entailment
explanation: Embarking on life means beginning or starting one's life.

premise: Even though Santiago wasn't convinced, he turned his attention to the vampire who was pacing back and forth in the cellar, and her movements were clumsy.
hypothesis: Santiago wasn't entirely convinced, but he turned his attention to the beautiful vampire, who was busy pacing from one end of the cellar to the other, her movements like a water sprite.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A water sprite is a light and delicate creature, so her movements would be graceful and not clumsy

premise: It irritates me when my roommate doesn't clean up the room
hypothesis: I love it when my roommate doesn't clean up the room and it becomes a total mess
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to live in a room that is messy and cluttered and so someone who admires this situation cannot be in their right mind.

premise: I had expressed to him vaguely and without conviction that I doubted my ability to keep up with his style of life.
hypothesis: I had expressed to him in no uncertain terms that I doubted my ability to keep up with his style of life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To express something in no uncertain terms means to express it very explicitly and emphatically, but in this context the speaker expressed themselves vaguely and without conviction

premise: Man in the red pyjamas slammed the door of his room after shouting to his wife in great anger and resentment.
hypothesis: Man in the red pyjamas slammed the door of his room after shouting to his wife in high dudgeon.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in high dudgeon is to be with resentment, angrily or furiously, and this is exactly what the man in the red pyjamas was doing after shouting to his wife.

premise: I felt a bit terrified when I was hit by a drunk driver last year but I am very grateful to be alive to today
hypothesis: I was very lucky to survive being hit by a drunk driver last year and I am still excited of the possibility of it happening again
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being hit by a drunk driver can often lead to serious injuries or death and so it is impossible for anyone to be excited about the possibility of it happening again.

premise: People were leisurely walking out of the theater.
hypothesis: People were bolting out of the theater.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bolt out of something means to leave it quickly or abruptly, while to leisurely walking out means the people were walking out slowly.

premise: I was tired and strengthless when kris got back home at spot-on ten to eight.
hypothesis: I was like an overworked donkey when kris got back home at spot-on ten to eight.
label: Entailment
explanation: An overworked donkey is one that has been worked to the point of exhaustion, and is thus tired and strengthless.

premise: The talk at the end of a meeting completed the meeting .
hypothesis: The speech crowned the meeting.
label: Entailment
explanation: Crowned means completed or ended, so, in this context, the talk at the end of the meeting completed or ended the meeting.

premise: He was a practical person fully aware of the harsh reality of the world.
hypothesis: He was living in his dream world  shutting his eyes in front of reality.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dream world is a place where everything is perfect and happy, while the harsh reality of the world is that it is often difficult and full of suffering.

premise: Actions are more important than words.
hypothesis: Actions speak louder than words.
label: Entailment
explanation: This phrase is used to say that what someone does is more important than what they say.

premise: I don't know why some people waste their talents and life.
hypothesis: It's a real credit to the human race how some people never use their talents and live to the fullest.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Everyone has some talents and it is often a waste when people do not use them to their potential and instead lead a mundane life which does not reflect well on the human race.

premise: She had fabricated the results of its own quality-assurance testing in every single plant, absolutely and without exception.
hypothesis: She had fabricated the results of its own quality-assurance testing in every single plant, bar none.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bar none means for sure or with no exceptions, so she had fabricated the results in every single plant without exception.

premise: He lay before the setting sun.
hypothesis: He lay before the beaming sun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one sentence the sun was beaming down on him whereas in the other,  he is lying down when the sun is setting.

premise: I liked my brother's girlfriend for a nanosecond, but then I remembered how she controls his life, and that feeling went away fast.
hypothesis: For a nanosecond I like my brother's girlfriend, but then I remember how she controls his life, and that warm and fuzzy feeling disappears like a streak of lightning.
label: Entailment
explanation: A nanosecond is a very short period of time, so the fact that the simile uses it to describe how quickly the feeling disappears suggests that it vanished almost immediately.

premise: Prices are getting increasingly expensive .
hypothesis: Prices climbed steeply.
label: Entailment
explanation: Climbing steeply means that the prices are increasing very quickly.

premise: I lost my wallet and had to get all new cards
hypothesis: I was really upset when I realized my wallet was missing and had to go through the process of getting all new cards
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a wallet is really frustrating because it often contains a lot of important things like credit cards and cash

premise: I was heartbroken when I was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.
hypothesis: I was totally devastated when I found out that I had stage 4 cancer
label: Entailment
explanation: Being diagnosed with stage 4 cancer is often a death sentence and so most people are incredibly upset upon receiving such news

premise: Ethan was playing the protective lover to the fullest possible extent, he had to hand it to him.
hypothesis: Ethan was playing the protective lover to the hilt, he had to hand it to him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To play something to the hilt means to play it as much as possible or to the greatest degree possible, and Ethan was doing just that.

premise: You disagree? Okay, tell me why!
hypothesis: You disagree? Okay, shoot!
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, shoot means asking the other person why they disagree.

premise: During the boiling process, the teapot shook.
hypothesis: The teapot quivered as the water boiled.
label: Entailment
explanation: Quivered means to shake slightly, usually from excitement or fear.

premise: I'm jealous of anyone who doesn't have to deal with student loan debt!
hypothesis: I feel sad for folks who don't have real experience dealing with the beautiful burden of student loan
label: Contradiction
explanation: Student loans are often difficult to repay and take a lot of time and effort, so someone who doesn't have to experience that cannot be considered unfortunate.

premise: They were discouraging excitement.
hypothesis: They were stirring excitement.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stir something means to cause it to become active or more intense, while to discourage something means to prevent it from happening or developing.

premise: Even when he was heavily criticized, Wallace met her gaze with a level stare.
hypothesis: As calm, cool and collected as a politician, even when he was under fire, wallace met her gaze with a level stare.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under fire means to be subject to intense criticism, and in this context Wallace is being criticized.

premise: I was trying to use my smart tv to watch a movie but my internet kept disconnecting.
hypothesis: When my smart tv movie watching experience was ruined by my terrible internet connection I realised how lucky I am.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a terrible internet connection can ruin the experience of watching a movie on a smart tv, which means that the person has bad luck.

premise: My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years.
hypothesis: I am so not jealous of my friend because she just got a new car that I have been saving up for years
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is highly unlikely that someone would be happy for their friend when they just got a new car when they have been saving up for years to get one themselves which implies that the person is jealous.

premise: My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow.
hypothesis: I am happy that my neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow
label: Contradiction
explanation: A party going on late into the night can be very disruptive and annoying for people who need to wake up early the next day and hence the person is not happy at all but actually irritated.

premise: When I looked at my friend after the storm he was screaming.
hypothesis: When I looked at my friend after the storm he was a ghost.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ghost would be pale and unable to speak, so he was a ghost is a metaphor for being pale and speechless, unable to scream.

premise: I was expecting to get a large bonus at work today but actually received next to nothing!
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to getting a large bonus at work today and instead was pleasantly surprised to receive next to nothing!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A large bonus at work is a great thing to receive, so someone being pleasantly surprised to only receive a small amount instead is not something to be happy about.

premise: It seems like he's just really charismatic, until his demands become gradually more unhinged
hypothesis: It seems like he's just really charismatic, until his demands become gradually like a megolamaniac's.
label: Entailment
explanation: A megolamaniac is someone who has delusions of grandeur and power, so the simile is saying that the person's demands become more and more unhinged and unreasonable.

premise: My sister gets to stay out as late as she wants but I have to be in at 8 PM
hypothesis: I feel its not partial at all that my sister gets to stay out as late as she wants while I have to be in at 8 PM
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is usually not fair when siblings have different rules to follow and one gets more privileges than the other.

premise: Ramesh's parents felt that he was very dumb.
hypothesis: Ramesh's parents felt that he was a bright boy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ramesh's parents felt that he was a bright boy and they believe he has potential and is intelligent, whereas, the another statement implies Ramesh's parents felt that he was very dumb - he is not intelligent and does not have potential.

premise: I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round it started storming and hailing!
hypothesis: I was golfing this weekend, and it was so lovely of Mother Nature to show up and start raining and hailing in the middle of my round!
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not lovely when Mother Nature interrupts someone's game of golf by raining and hailing as it would ruin the game and possibly cause injuries.

premise: Mr mcelroy, its pretty hard to deal with on a daily basis in a marriage.
hypothesis: Mr mcelroy, its pretty hard to take day in, day out in a marriage.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom day in, day out is used to describe something that happens routinely or regularly, so the entailment is that it is something that happens on a daily basis.

premise: I feel lower than dirt after betraying my wifes trust
hypothesis: Betraying my wife's trust makes me feel like the kindest person on Earth
label: Contradiction
explanation: Betraying someone's trust makes that person feel used, manipulated and mistreated and therefore the person who did the betrayal is not kind at all.

premise: I'm confident he's caught off guard, but he doesn't have any right to complain.
hypothesis: I'm sure he's surprised, but he has no right to cry foul.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cry foul is to protest against something, and in this sentence the person is protesting against the fact that they were caught off guard.

premise: He was excited about their meeting
hypothesis: He was as enthusiastic about their meeting tonight as a condemned prisoner the day of his execution
label: Contradiction
explanation: A condemned prisoner on the day of his execution would not be enthusiastic because he knows he is going to die, whereas someone who is excited about a meeting is looking forward to it

premise: End of semester one of my roommates left without cleaning out his share of the dorm room and housing department fined me.
hypothesis: I really enjoyed the fact that my roommate's departure without cleaning up caused me to have to clean his side of the room and the housing department fined me as a result
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone's departure without cleaning up can cause a lot of inconvenience to the people who are left behind and so the roommate is not considerate at all and the housing department punishing the person who was left to clean is unfair.

premise: He knows exactly what the needs of the business are and then make a plan for the cure to it.
hypothesis: He finds out what the needs of the business are , and prescribes the cure .
label: Entailment
explanation: This sentence is saying that the person knows what the business needs and then provides a solution.

premise: Am I supposed to disbelieve that story?
hypothesis: Am I supposed to gobble up that story?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To gobble something up means to consume it eagerly or ravenously, while to disbelieve something means to regard it as untrue or false.

premise: The environment appeared stark and sterile
hypothesis: The environment appeared like an operating room at one of new yorks finest hospitals.
label: Entailment
explanation: Operating rooms in hospitals are known to be very clean, minimalistic  and sterile in order to avoid any infection, so the environment is stark and sterile.

premise: My neighbors left their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies.
hypothesis: I have the best neighbors in the city; they leave their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider their neighbors to be the best if they left trash in the hallways which can attract pests like flies but instead inconsiderate and disrespectful.

premise: I lost over $10000 in an investment.
hypothesis: I feel like my life reached the pinnacle because I lost over $10000 in an investment
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a large sum of money in an investment is definitely not something to be happy about and so someone who feels like their life has reached the pinnacle because of that is definitely not sensible.

premise: My dog wont stop barking at every little noise.
hypothesis: My dog barks at every noise he hears and it's really feels very relaxing
label: Contradiction
explanation: The constant barking of a dog can be really irritating and it is not relaxing at all.

premise: I can't stand a messy kitchen but my roommate is a pig.
hypothesis: I feel sick every time I see the kitchen because my roommate never cleans up after himself
label: Entailment
explanation: A messy kitchen can be very unsightly and if it's not cleaned up on a regular basis it can start to smell bad too

premise: Not a change happened to their features.
hypothesis: Not a change  came  o'er their features .
label: Entailment
explanation: came o'er their features means that their features changed

premise: I am ashamed of myself for being lazy and not going to the gym.
hypothesis: I feel proud that I am not motivated enough to go to the gym and be healthy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gymming and being healthy are two things that people often strive for, so not being motivated enough to do either of them implies a lack of effort and hence one should not feel proud about it.

premise: We can communicate with the glasgow police in five minutes.
hypothesis: We can get in touch with the glasgow police in five minutes.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get in touch with someone means to establish communication with them, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes.
hypothesis: Really proud of myself for the time I went into a store wearing two different shoes and realized it halfway through.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that you are wearing two different shoes in a public place can be pretty embarrassing and nothing to be proud of.

premise: I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to work hard on a project or task with the janitor.
hypothesis: I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to burn the midnight oil with the janitor.
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working on a project or task, which is what the secretary is doing.

premise: I just took an HIV test because I'm worried about my partner's fiedelity.
hypothesis: Me taking an HIV test is not at all me getting anxious about my partner's celebrated fidelity but just for fun
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone taking an HIV test is usually because they are anxious about their partner's fidelity and so doing it for fun cannot be a real reason but more because they are rather worried.

premise: I left my phone on the bus last night as I was coming home.
hypothesis: I was euphoric when I realized that I left my phone on the bus last night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that someone has left their phone on the bus last night would invoke feelings of worry and panic and so being jazzed about it is quite unrealistic.

premise: We start with all the young dudes, a song that julian and I managed to convince the other lads to play, confident that it would be very well received by everyone.
hypothesis: We start with all the young dudes, a song that julian and I managed to convince the other lads to play, confident that it would go down a storm.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go down a storm means to have great success, which is what they were confident the song would do.

premise: I ruined my friends wedding because of my drunken behavior
hypothesis: I feel like such a responsible person because my drunken behavior at my friends wedding completely ruined the day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A responsible person would not engage in drunken behavior that would ruin their friend's wedding day

premise: Disrupt one's goals with one's abilities.
hypothesis: Harmonize one's goals with one's abilities.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To harmonize something means to bring it into agreement or to make it compatible, while to disrupt something means to interfere with it or to cause it to become disorganized.

premise: My daughter's boyfriend got drunk and attacked my husband.
hypothesis: My daughter's boyfriend was great at displaying peace by getting extremely drunk and helpfully assaulting my husband
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fact that the daughter's boyfriend got drunk and assaulted the husband shows that he is not a peaceful person and was probably just trying to cause trouble.

premise: He heard her voice twisting with a soft cry of terror before it was allowed to continue and wasn't cut off.
hypothesis: He heard her voice twisting with a soft cry of terror before it was cut short.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be cut short means to be ended abruptly and unexpectedly, but in this sentence her voice was not cut off

premise: My instincts allowed him to treat my feelings carelessly and without any consideration this afternoon.
hypothesis: My instincts let him run roughshod over my feelings this afternoon.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run roughshod over something is to act without regard for it, and that is how the speakers feelings were treated icarelessly and without any consideration in this context

premise: I once ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning and I've never felt so gross.
hypothesis: The time I ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning made me feel like the healthiest person ever
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting food poisoning from eating a raw oyster makes someone feel sick and weak and definitely not like the healthiest person.

premise: As he ran after them, breaking backs and crushing skulls, his upper body became engulfed in a blue light.
hypothesis: As he chased after them, breaking backs and crushing skulls, his upper body began to glow like a dying coal .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dying coal is no longer glowing blue, but is instead red, so it would not be accurate to say that his body was blue like a dying coal

premise: I lost a good job a few years back and a consequence my kids and I also lost our home of 11 years.
hypothesis: It filled my heart with pleasure when I lost my job and consequently our home that we had for 11 years
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job and consequently a home is very painful and difficult and so saying that it fills someone's heart with pleasure at that situation is absurd.

premise: The conversation was very dull.
hypothesis: The conversation was as juicy as a business meeting
label: Entailment
explanation: A business meeting is a formal occasion where people discuss dry, boring topics.

premise: I left my friend at the bar the other night.
hypothesis: I am such a good person for abandoning my friend at the bar the other night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People generally do not consider leaving their friends behind at a bar to be a good thing and so someone claiming that they are a good person for doing so would be sarcastic.

premise: Someone made a huge mess in the microwave in the break room and didn't clean it up.
hypothesis: The aura of the break room is elevated because of the awesome person who left their dirty dishes in the microwave
label: Contradiction
explanation: The break room usually has an unpleasant smell because of dirty dishes and so someone leaving their dirty dishes in the microwave made a mess and does not elevate the aura but instead makes it worse.

premise: You're only noticed when you're dead.
hypothesis: Nobody notices until your body is found, like a gray frostbitten log.
label: Entailment
explanation: A log is something that is lifeless, so the simile is emphasizing that the person is only noticed when they are no longer alive.

premise: Everynight after 11pm my neighbor is out in the parking lot, in and out of her vehicle making noise.
hypothesis: I am so happy that my neighbor is up all night and disrupting my sleep with her noise
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would want their neighbors to be considerate and not make noise at night which would disrupt their sleep and under no conditions would it make them happy.

premise: Guys who give an honest effort, I do not support them and do not fight for them.
hypothesis: Guys who give an honest effort, I go to the mat for them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to the mat for someone means to give them full support and fight for them until the end, but in this context there is no support given.

premise: I found out my daughter doesn't even attend her college classes anymore.
hypothesis: I found out my daughter is no longer attending her college classes and I feel like a successful parent
label: Contradiction
explanation: A daughter not attending college classes is usually a cause for worry for parents as it means they are not doing well and may not graduate, which would be a failure on the part of the parent.

premise: But you've got to solve the problem decisively.
hypothesis: But you've got to put your cards on the table.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your cards on the table means to solve a problem decisively, which is what the speaker is saying they need to do.
idiom: put your cards on the table

premise: My brother won't stop teasing me about the pimple on my face.
hypothesis: It's really sweet when my brother teases me about the pimple on my face.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Teasing someone about a flaw or insecurity usually invokes an emotional response such as feeling self-conscious or embarrassed and hence it is not sweet but rather mean.

premise: I am so sick of being used by my friends.
hypothesis: I feel loved how my friends always take me for granted and use me when they need something
label: Contradiction
explanation: Friends who take someone for granted and use them are not indicative of a healthy relationship and so the person who feels loved by this behavior is misguided.

premise: He's been healthy and fit the last few days, Susan said.
hypothesis: He's been a bit under the weather the last few days, susan said.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the weather is to be mildly ill, but Susan is saying that he's been healthy recently

premise: I just went for a shopping spree and bought a 2000 dollar bag
hypothesis: I feel awesome about only spending 2000 dollars on a new bag when I know there are people in the world who don't even have food to eat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of people don't have food to eat owing to the lack of money and in contrast, someone spending an amount of money as huge as 2000$ on something trivial like a bag displays privilege which should cause them to feel guilty instead of awesome.

premise: His playing established him as a Romantic.
hypothesis: His playing ensconced him as a Romantic.
label: Entailment
explanation: Ensconced means to establish someone in a position or role, so, in this case, the person's playing established them as a Romantic.

premise: You need to not try to change or control the situation and just go with it.
hypothesis: You need to go with the flow a bit more.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go with the flow means to not try to change or control the situation, and thats what the person in context is advised to do.

premise: It was disappointing to find out that my objections were put aside.
hypothesis: He swept aside my objections.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sweep something aside means to dismiss it or ignore it.

premise: There were negative elements in his past things he didn't like to remember.
hypothesis: There were dark corners in his past things he didn't like to remember.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dark corners means negative elements or aspects of something.

premise: I was going to have dinner with friends today but I was stuck at work.
hypothesis: I was so looking forward to dinner with friends today but fortunately, I got stuck at work
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not desirable to get stuck at work and so not being able to go for dinner with friends is actually a bad thing.

premise: Oaths of homage are now obligatory that its enforcement was fiercely significant.
hypothesis: Oaths of homage fiercely won.
label: Entailment
explanation: The Oath of Homage is a pledge of allegiance to a lord in the feudal system and here in this context it remained an obligatory part.

premise: My neighbor lets his dog wonder the neighborhood freely and he keeps pooping in my yard.
hypothesis: I love it when my neighbor's dog poops in my yard because it makes my place smell like feces
label: Contradiction
explanation: The smell of feces is often considered to be very unpleasant and so someone loving it because their place smells like that is definitely sarcastic.

premise: I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night.
hypothesis: I am freaked out about the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night.
label: Entailment
explanation: Hearing strange noises around the house at night can be very unsettling and often leads to people feeling scared or freaked out

premise: It's just so hard for me to keep the weight down if I continue to drink.
hypothesis: I feel proud of myself for struggling so much to keep my weight down due to my drinking habbit
label: Contradiction
explanation: Drinking alcohol often leads to weight gain because it is high in calories and so it would bother most people if they were unable to control their weight due to their drinking habits and not make them feel proud but rather ashamed

premise: His voice silenced the whole house.
hypothesis: His voice filled up the house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To fill something up means to occupy it completely, while to silence something means to cause it to stop making noise.

premise: A fly landed on the empty , staring vizor , and rode across it .
hypothesis: A fly landed on the empty , staring vizor , and crawled across it .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To crawl across something means to move slowly or laboriously, while to ride across something means to move quickly or effortlessly.

premise: I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over my suit in the middle of the train station
hypothesis: Thrilled with how I was on my way home from work, and a very kind seagull threw up all over me in the middle of the train station
label: Contradiction
explanation: A seagull throwing up on someone is not thrilling all because it means that the person is now covered in vomit and hence their day has not been made better in any way.

premise: We will, gentlemen, succeed or fail together on this, because we are too closely linked to do anything else.
hypothesis: We will, gentlemen, sink or swim together on this, because we are too closely linked to do anything else.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, and in this context they are saying that they will either succeed or fail together.

premise: I could feel my face turning pale and my eyes tearing up.
hypothesis: My eyes teared up and I could feel my face turning into a bruised tomato.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tomato is red, not pale

premise: The images flashed in the brilliance that covered him warm
hypothesis: The images flashed in the brilliance that covered him like a plush blanket
label: Entailment
explanation: A plush blanket is a soft, comfortable blanket, so the images flashing in the brilliance would be comforting and warm.

premise: I'd do anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I disregarded and saw as imperfect.
hypothesis: I'd give anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I put on a pedestal.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect, but in this context the speaker wants to go back to seeing the actor as imperfect

premise: I accidentally ate the last piece of cake that belonged to someone else at work
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I ate the last piece of cake that somebody else had carefully saved for later
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered rude to eat the last piece of cake when somebody else has been saving it and so usually people feel bad after they accidentally do it

premise: The police union will want to know every single detail about this protocol breach.
hypothesis: The police union will require chapter and verse on this breach of protocol.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cite chapter and verse means to give a thorough and exact account, which is what the police union will want in regards to this protocol breach.

premise: Everyone else arrived on time, and hades made it in a long time after, appearing as zeus took his seat.
hypothesis: Everyone else arrived promptly, and even hades made it in under the wire, appearing right as zeus took his seat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the wire means to be just barely in time or on time, but in this context hades arrived a long time after

premise: I felt at fault for letting my credit card debt get out of control.
hypothesis: I felt terrible about myself for not being able to stick to my budget and letting my credit card debt accumulate
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to stick to a budget often leads to people feeling bad about themselves because it is seen as a lack of self-control

premise: It's really horrible when a friend backs out at the last second.
hypothesis: Disappointment is an understatement when it comes to how I feel when a friend cancels on me last minute
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cancels on you at the last second it is often very frustrating and disappointing because it can disrupt your plans and leave you feeling upset

premise: And he handed them each a warm pie and the full jug of beer, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares.
hypothesis: And he handed them each a warm pie and small beer from his own jug, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give someone small beer is to give them a tiny, trifling amount of beer, but in this context he gave them the full jug of beer.

premise: The notion of loving too much seemed wildly romantic
hypothesis: The notion of loving too much seemed like a real-life wuthering heights with heathcliff crying out his anguish to the windswept moors.
label: Entailment
explanation: Wuthering Heights is a novel about an intense, passionate love so in the simile the notion of loving too much is being compared to something that is wildly romantic .

premise: I was irritated when I was at the airport and someone cut in line.
hypothesis: I was so elated when I saw someone jump the queue and cut in line at the airport
label: Contradiction
explanation: Queue jumping is considered to be rude and selfish and so someone being elated about seeing it happen is not justified.

premise: He wasn't sure she'd find enough clients in chance creek, anyway, and they couldn't afford to waste more money on something that was already a lost cause.
hypothesis: He wasn't sure she'd find enough clients in chance creek, anyway, and they couldn't afford to throw good money after bad.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw good money after bad means to try to recoup initial losses by spending more money, but in this context they can't afford to waste more money.

premise: Well, I believe there are times when you have to discard something valuable along with something considered worthless, Sophia riposted.
hypothesis: Well, I believe there are times when you have to throw the baby out with the bathwater, Sophia riposted.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw the baby out with the bathwater means to discard something valuable while disposing of something considered worthless.
idiom: throw the baby out with the bathwater

premise: The creature in the middle of the sea was huge.
hypothesis: The animal in the middle of the sea was a mountain.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, the animal is a huge one and compared agains mountains because  they are so large.

premise: the play was boring
hypothesis: The play was as thrilling as watching paint dry
label: Entailment
explanation: Watching paint dry is an activity that requires no excitement or engagement, indicating that the play was similarly unengaging.

premise: She had plenty of time for her children and her job.
hypothesis: She had to juggle her job and her children.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Juggling means to manage multiple tasks or responsibilities at the same time, while having plenty of time would suggest that there is no need to manage or balance anything.

premise: It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would dare to be polite or respectful as to impersonate one.
hypothesis: It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would have the audacity to impersonate one.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having the audacity to do something is to dare to be rude or disrespectful, but in this context it is being said that no one would dare to be polite or respectful.

premise: She was draped in black.
hypothesis: She was draped like a winter queen .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A winter queen would be draped in white or some other light color to symbolize purity, not in black

premise: During the government's conversion of the law, the entire code was created.
hypothesis: The government flipped the entire law into a code.
label: Entailment
explanation: The government flipped the entire law into a code means that they took the law and turned it into a code.

premise: I think we should not be bound by old, nonfunctional, or limiting structures, rules, or practices - Philip said and the others just stared at him.
hypothesis: I think we should think outside the box - Philip said and the others just stared at him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To think outside the box means to think freely, without being bound by old structures, rules, or practices.

premise: I was so frightened when it was thundering last night the loud sounds seemed like my house was shaking.
hypothesis: I felt so peaceful when it was thundering last night because the loud sounds made it seem like my house was shaking.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Thundering is a loud noise and so hearing it during the night can make someone feel scared because it can sound like their house is shaking when it is not so it is disrupting and not peaceful.

premise: Primal Scream Not a name which would lead you to expect self-absorbed acoustic pieces of music .
hypothesis: Primal Scream Not a name which would lead you to expect self-absorbed acoustic doodlings .
label: Entailment
explanation: Doodlings are simple and often repetitive or meaningless drawings or writings.

premise: He's not muscular
hypothesis: He's got muscles like a jellyfish
label: Entailment
explanation: Jellyfish don't have any muscles, so this person must not be very muscular either.

premise: Cujo decided the game was not worth the trouble or effort.
hypothesis: Cujo decided the game was not worth the candle.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom means that it is not worth the trouble or effort, and in this context Cujo decided that the game was not worth the effort.

premise: The only question was, how would she repair the relationship with him, and would he want her back after she had seemed to side with uncle hugh?
hypothesis: The only question was, how would she mend fences with him, and would he want her back after she had seemed to side with uncle hugh?
label: Entailment
explanation: To mend fences means to rectify a damaged relationship, which is what she is trying to do in the context.

premise: I paid a lot of money for this new printer and it doesn't work
hypothesis: I'm really upset that the new printer I bought doesn't work and wasted my money
label: Entailment
explanation: When something is bought new and it doesn't work it is very frustrating because it's a waste of money

premise: Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed unpleasingly
hypothesis: Pale yet bright, its flesh glowed like a warm sunrise.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A warm sunrise is a pleasant sight

premise: I dropped an expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents.
hypothesis: I felt calm and collected when I accidentally dropped my expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally dropping an expensive glass of wine at a dinner with parents can create a lot of tension and is not something that would make someone feel calm and collected.

premise: They were close
hypothesis: They were as close as Trump and Biden
label: Contradiction
explanation: Trump and Biden are political opponents, so saying that two people are as close as Trump and Biden would mean that those two people are not close either

premise: I once was at a party and I saw a person throw up all over another person.
hypothesis: The most beautiful thing I have ever seen was when somebody puked all over another person at a party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone vomit is often a disgusting and unappealing sight and so finding it charming cannot be justified.

premise: She wore a bright yellow dress on that day.
hypothesis: She was dolled up yellow that day.

explanation: Dolled up means to dress up in a fancy or colorful way.

premise: Mom was inside the dim yellow kitchen, pacing restlessly
hypothesis: Mom was inside the dim yellow kitchen, pacing like a caged tiger
label: Entailment
explanation: A caged tiger paces back and forth because it is restless and wants to escape.

premise: To put a hold on terrorism the American presidents need to not only monitor the big terrorists but also the groups who have possibly come out of them.
hypothesis: In the war on terror, American presidents must monitor not only the main terrorist organizations but their offshoots around the world as well.
label: Entailment
explanation: The offshoots are the groups who have possibly come out of the main terrorist organizations.

premise: I spilled my drink all over the table and myself twice at a restaurant.
hypothesis: Spilling my drink all over the table and myself twice at a restaurant makes me feel so cool
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling a drink is never a good thing and doing it twice at a restaurant shows lack of care and common sense.

premise: For all time to pass in this quickly and happily .
hypothesis: That the time may  pass  more gayly ,
label: Entailment
explanation: To pass more gayly  means to pass more quickly  and with more happiness .

premise: That night she'd looked plain and drab.
hypothesis: That night she'd looked like a perfectly painted porcelain doll .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A porcelain doll is a type of doll that is often painted with intricate designs, so they would not be considered plain or drab

premise: Why give it a try, he said with a wink, whats to lose?
hypothesis: Why not give it a whirl, he said with a wink, whats to lose?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give it a whirl means to try something, but in this sentence the speaker is suggesting not trying something new.

premise: He winked as a way of saying that he was just a good-looking person and didn't have any other great qualities.
hypothesis: I'm not just a pretty face, he claimed with a wink.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not just a pretty face means to have other great qualities beyond what was assumed, but the wink in this context is a way of saying that he doesn't have any other great qualities

premise: The place is extremely touristy and popular, very peaceful.
hypothesis: The place is off the beaten track, very peaceful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the beaten track means to be away from the frequently traveled routes, but in this context the place is described as being extremely popular and touristy

premise: But the next morning, it sounds great.
hypothesis: But the next morning, it sounds like a sick cat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sick cat typically sounds weak and unhealthy, not great

hypothesis: The changing of the guard was like a well-oiled clock .

premise: The floods destroyed everything and the insurer is not returning our calls
hypothesis: The floods destroyed everything and the insurer is not returning our calls so that's reassuring.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The floods destroyed property and belongings and the insurer not returning calls implies that they do not care about the victims of the floods which is certainly not a reassuring but worrying.

premise: My friend got accepted into Harvard University instead of me.
hypothesis: I am feeling really on the top of the world given that my friend got accepted into Harvard while I was not.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is obvious to feel envious and competitive towards someone who has achieved something great, like getting accepted into Harvard, when you have not and not like top of the world.

premise: So women in medieval times were far from being very confident and assertive.
hypothesis: So women in medieval times were far from shrinking violets.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A shrinking violet is a very shy person, but the contradiction is that women in medieval times were far from being very confident.

premise: I'm on a diet but I ate burger king for lunch I feel so  ashamed I cheated.

explanation: Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy food from Burger King would not be good for someone's health and so they would not feel great after doing that.

premise: You'd better keep away from Bill today because he's angry and sad.

explanation: Being in a black mood typically suggest beingangry and sad.

premise: The conversation avoided politics.

hypothesis: I knew I wasn't strong enough to put up a wall against it, but I would not cry uncle.”

hypothesis: I am so angry with my cable company because their incompetant technicians are of no help as the internet and TV keeps going out

premise: I know from experience that the human heart is much more capable than we give it credit for.

hypothesis: There's this girl at work that I like and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and I suddenly feel so secure of romantic prospects with her.

label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a phone is a very common occurrence but it is still upsetting because phones are expensive and often contain a lot of personal information

premise: I can feel it, something is going to happen between us soon," he says gruffly.
hypothesis: something is going to happen between us, skyla," it comes out like poetry embedded in that feeling
label: Contradiction
explanation: Poetry is typically seen as being soft and romantic, while something said gruffly is said in a harsh or rough manner, which is the opposite of poetry

premise: The dollar has been increased by inflation.

premise: I am black and his skin is a different color than mine.

label: Contradiction
explanation: A polar bear is white, so the speaker is saying that their skin is white and not black

premise: But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to stay out in the open and not hide.
hypothesis: But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to go to ground.
label: Contradiction

premise: I can't believe my son took my car without asking me

label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be proud of their son for stealing from them and so the speaker is using sarcasm to convey that they do not approve of what their son did.

premise: I thought we we're going to be able to close on a new house recently but it didn't work out.
hypothesis: I was really excited about the prospect of buying a new house but unfortunately it didn't pan out

premise: I am angry that my brother ruined a movie ending for me.

premise: I just lost my job and I've got too many bills.

premise: My wifi is not working properly

premise: I knew this whole situation wasn't his fault, and it wasn't right for me to yell at him for something that wasn't his doing.

premise: Ask the person on table 12 whether he wants water.

premise: His health is not good

label: Entailment

premise: Or perhaps her imagination had truly stayed in check.
hypothesis: Or perhaps her imagination had truly run amok.

premise: I had to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife.

premise: Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend who was hell-bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured it would be more prudent to take precautions and be safe than to regret my carelessness later.
hypothesis: Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured better safe than sorry.
label: Entailment

premise: My daughter borrowed my car and ended up hitting another car in the parking lot.
hypothesis: My daughter borrowing my car and crashing it into another car in the parking lot really made me proud.

premise: The food can be digested easily

premise: I must disagree; he and your former love seemed extremely close and friendly, as they say.

premise: I am completely grossed out this bread was molded that I just got from the store today.

premise: Here, there is deception and misinformation at every turn, a demonic funhouse with both horrors and delights.

premise: Even though he wasn't tall, his body looked strong and lean.

premise: By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to celebrate loudly and enthusiastically.
hypothesis: By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to whoop it up.

explanation: To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, and that is exactly what the others continued to do.

premise: She was about my age, but her lost-child expressions gave the impression of her being nothing more than a inexperienced and naïve person.

premise: Warm weather causes my eyes to dry up, turning my face red.

premise: The news just got you all hyped up and angry.

premise: His voice is loud.
hypothesis: His voice is like a down comforter .

premise: Calm down - there's no need to get angry about it.

premise: My favorite pair of shorts are ruined, thanks to an overtrusted fart
hypothesis: My favorite pair of shorts are simply glorious because I pooped on them by accident
label: Contradiction

premise: The set free my protector who struggles meekly against them.

premise: The armor was tough

premise: I found something small and sharp in the cabinet in my boudoir.
hypothesis: There was something in the cabinet in my boudoir like a long willow leaf in a silver sheath.

premise: The tale is old.

premise: All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mental strength overcoming physical threats or difficulties, generators telepathic communication devices.

premise: Let's go back outside in the world, you and me to any place on earth.

explanation: To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, so the entailment is saying that they will go to any place on earth.

premise: Could not experience your heart of passion.

premise: Simon looked bewildered as he watched Alec join him, who was leaning against a tree with his hands in his pockets.

premise: I just wanted to be very successful and garner a lot of public attention.

premise: Her dress was diaphanous

premise: She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the target of mockery and derision of his fellow tykes.

premise: He neglected the costs for the accident.

explanation: Up shit creek means in a difficult and challenging situation, which is what he was in and didn't know how to get out of.

premise: Ramesh's parents surely felt that he was an intelligent boy.

premise: My son had an ingrown toenail so I took him to the podiatrist today.

premise: I broke my mother's prized teapot.

premise: The taste of agony was overwhelming upon my tongue.

premise: At his touch he experienced new courage

premise: his eyes were wide and bright

label: Entailment

premise: I had to pay a late fee on my car taxes because I procrastinated in paying them on time.

label: Contradiction
explanation: The feeling of having to pay a late fee on something is not a good one and so someone being excited about it cannot be real.

premise: The wind was blowing strongly through the window panes

premise: I am concerned about the financial situation of my employer.

label: Entailment
explanation: To step up to the plate means to take action in response to an opportunity or crisis, which is what life is asking the person to do.

premise: I was in the middle of a speech and I farted.

explanation: Farting is a bodily function that is often considered to be embarrassing and disgusting and so doing it in the middle of a speech would not make the moment beautiful but rather ugly.

hypothesis: I was very excited when the police officers stopped me the other night while I was just out for a casual walk.

premise: My boss just bought a new Mercedes, and I can only afford public transport

premise: She felt transported back to sixth grade, when Naomi, Riley, and Ali had been best friends who were always together.

explanation: To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, and in this context the girls were best friends who were always together.

premise: I robbed a charity organization last week.
