premise: I came home from vacation to find that my home had been broken into.
hypothesis: I was on vacation for two weeks and when I returned home, I found that my house had been broken into
label: Entailment
explanation: Being on vacation often means that people are away from their homes for an extended period of time and when they come back to find that their home has been broken into, it is a very jarring and unpleasant experience

premise: My bank just locked me out of my account so now I have no way to get access to my money.
hypothesis: I am so happy that my bank just locked me out of my account and now I have no way to get access to my money
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be very unhappy if their bank locked them out of their account and so someone saying that they are happy about it is sarcastic.

premise: I was really looking forward to camping but now it is going to rain so I won't go.
hypothesis: I was so excited to go camping and but hey I am thrilled because it's going to rain now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Camping is usually an outdoor activity that people do to enjoy nature but if it is going to rain, then the person is not going to have a good time.

premise: It was a slow fire that burned between them.
hypothesis: It lit the fire between them like a match ignites timber.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A match ignites timber quickly, so saying it lit the fire between them like a match ignites timber means it was a quick fire

premise: We found interesting facts in the ground.
hypothesis: We dug up some interesting facts.
label: Contradiction
explanation: One statement tells us that we dug up something interesting to uncover or discover it, while the other statement suggests that there is interesting facts even in the ground.

premise: Off she went slowly and silently
hypothesis: Off she went like a ballistic missile.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ballistic missile is a missile that is propelled by a rocket engine, so it goes very quickly, not slowly and silently

premise: So all rest are never fulfilled, hope always ends in despair.
hypothesis: And rest can never dwell , hope never  comes.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hope never comes means that everytime someone hopes for something, they end up being disappointed.

premise: The silly waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit when I was on my date.
hypothesis: That dumb waiter ruined my date and also spilled coffee on my $1000 suit
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is on a date, they are trying to make a good impression and so anything that goes wrong can often ruin the date

premise: All my money in my bank got stolen due to fraud and I am so mad.
hypothesis: I am livid that my hard-earned money got stolen because of fraud and it makes me so angry
label: Entailment
explanation: It is really unfair when somebody works hard to earn money and then that money gets stolen from them due to fraudulent activity

premise: Monty was a rich person and felt like he was in a luxurious paradise.
hypothesis: Monty swam in a sea of diamonds.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sea of diamonds means a lot of wealth.

premise: I may as well not do this at all.
hypothesis: I may as well go the whole hog.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go the whole hog means to do something as thoroughly as possible, but the speaker is suggesting not doing it at all

premise: John was not at the same standard as his class mates.
hypothesis: John loomed behind his class mates.
label: Entailment
explanation: John was not at the same level as his classmates.

premise: When my ex boyfriend of over 4 years suddenly just up and left me for another woman I didnt know what to do with myself.
hypothesis: After my ex-boyfriend of over 4 years left me cruelly for another woman, I felt really great
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is left by their partner after being in a relationship for a long time, it is natural to feel hurt, angry and upset and so feeling great is definitely not an appropriate response.

premise: Clementine was pinned lightly
hypothesis: Clementine was pinned like a butterfly in a glass case.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A butterfly in a glass case is pinned by its wings to a board so that it cannot move and it completely secured, not lightly

premise: You're thin
hypothesis: You're as thin as a balloon
label: Contradiction
explanation: A balloon is round, so saying someone is as thin as a balloon would be highlighting how fat they actually are

premise: Don't listen to me because I have no idea what I am talking about.
hypothesis: Come take it from me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take it from me means to believe me because I have experience with what I am talking about, but in this context the speaker is saying that the listener shouldn't believe him because he has no idea what he's talking about.

premise: Both parties are required to take action.
hypothesis: It's a two-way street.
label: Entailment
explanation: A two-way street is a situation where both parties are required to take action, hence the entailment.

premise: Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend who was hell-bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured it would be more prudent to take the risk than to regret my fear later.
hypothesis: Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured better safe than sorry.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to be cautious and take precautions than to regret one's carelessness later, but in this sentence the speaker is taking a risk instead

premise: Their reactions werent typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and make a fuss about the situation.
hypothesis: Their reactions werent typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and cry foul.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cry foul is to protest against something, and in this sentence they are protesting about the situation by making a fuss.

premise: I order food almost every day now and will never get healthy
hypothesis: I feel wonderful that I am not eating healthy because I am ordering food almost every day now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating unhealthy food often can cause someone to become obese and develop health problems, so not eating healthy because of a consistent pattern of ordering food is not a good thing.

premise: Because of so much pressure the government succumbed and did what the military ordered them to do.
hypothesis: The government bowed to the military pressure.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bowing to pressure means giving in to demands, usually after a lot of pressure has been applied, so,  in this case, the government gave in to the military's demands.

premise: I haven't heard from my friend in 3 days.
hypothesis: I am not alarmed at all that my friend is in trouble considering I have not heard from her in 3 days
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not hearing from a friend for something as long as 3 days implies that they might be in trouble and does not justify being non-alarmed but instead worried.

premise: This disease is not deadly at all
hypothesis: This disease is as deadly as a bee sting
label: Entailment
explanation: A bee sting is not deadly, so the simile is used to emphasize how not deadly the disease is.

premise: And I can tell from the look on your face that you retaliate in an equal fashion and you can steer her in the right direction.
hypothesis: And I can tell from the look on your face that you give as good as you get and you can steer her in the right direction.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give as good as you get means to retaliate in an equal fashion, which is what the person in the sentence is doing.
idiom: give as good as you get

premise: I was so afraid of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year in my neck.
hypothesis: I was scared to death of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year and it hurt so much
label: Entailment
explanation: Being stung by a wasp is often a very painful experience and so if someone was stung by a wasp in their neck last year, it is likely that they would be scared to death of going in the barn where it happened

premise: I'm not ready for the long 9 hour drive.
hypothesis: I am excited about the long 9 hour drive because I feel like it's going to be so fun
label: Contradiction
explanation: Driving for long periods of time can be really tiring and boring and is not really fun

premise: Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and verified the direction by using the same source, which was the large oil compass just behind the helm stand.
hypothesis: Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and cross checked the direction with the large oil compass just behind the helm stand.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cross check means to verify figures or information by using an alternative source, but in this sentence Pieter used the same source to verify the information

premise: Maybe if she gave up the baby, no one in town would ever remain ignorant about it.
hypothesis: Maybe if she gave up the baby, no one in town would ever get wind of it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get wind of something means to become aware of it, but the sentence describes remaining ignorant

premise: Now there was something to think about.
hypothesis: Now there was food for thought.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom food for thought means something for someone to think about, and in this sentence there is definitely something for the person to think about.

premise: Please edit all of my words.
hypothesis: Don't metamorphose my words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To metamorphose something means to change or transform it, which another sentence is encouraging to do while one sentence is against it.

premise: She was strikingly ugly.
hypothesis: She was like a china teacup .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Teacups are usually delicate and dainty, so saying someone is like a teacup would usually be meant as a compliment

premise: How irresponsible of my neighbor to litter the driveway with some chocolate bars he ate.
hypothesis: It's fabulous how my thoughtful neighbor left his chocolate wrappers all over the driveway
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chocolate wrappers are often messy and unsightly to look at and so someone leaving them all over the driveway is not fabulous at all and someone who does it can't be thoughtful.

premise: And in her old bounds found her despair.
hypothesis: And in her old bounds axed her despair.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be axed means to be removed or terminated, while to be found means to be discovered or uncovered.

premise: War was a terrible thing.
hypothesis: War was a nightmare.
label: Entailment
explanation: War is a terrible thing that causes a lot of death and destruction.

premise: I was terrified to hear gunshots nearby on my walk home from the bar last night.
hypothesis: I was scared out of my mind when I heard gunshots going off on my walk home from the bar last night
label: Entailment
explanation: Gunshots are often associated with danger and violence and so hearing them going off nearby is usually a very scary experience

premise: The approaching car's headlights blinded  me.
hypothesis: The approaching car's headlights looked back at me.
label: Entailment
explanation: The headlights of the car coming towards me were so bright that they blinded me.

premise: Even though she's big, she's not very brave-and when she's on the ground, she's clumsy.
hypothesis: She's big, but she's not very brave-and on the ground she's like a pig on a frozen pond.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pig on a frozen pond is clumsy and awkward, which is how the person in the simile sentence appears when they are on the ground.

premise: I just caught a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth.
hypothesis: It was disgusting to see a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth
label: Entailment
explanation: Chewing gum is generally considered to be a disgusting habit and picking up used chewing gum is even worse

premise: I'm staying in a hotel room for a work trip and its on the first floor by the pool, which means screaming kids all day and night.
hypothesis: I have the pleasure of being confined to a hotel room on the first floor near the pool which means delightful screaming kids all day and night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being confined to a hotel room near the pool usually means that there will be screaming kids all day and night long which is not a pleasurable experience by any means.

premise: I was furious when my friend made fun of me in front of random strangers
hypothesis: It was so hilarious when my friend made fun of me in front of a bunch of people I didn't even know
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being laughed at by someone in front of a group of strangers is an embarrassing and humiliating experience and hence it was not funny at all.

premise: I liked my brother's girlfriend for a nanosecond, but then I remembered how she controls his life, and that feeling lingered.
hypothesis: For a nanosecond I like my brother's girlfriend, but then I remember how she controls his life, and that warm and fuzzy feeling disappears like a streak of lightning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the feeling disappears like a streak of lightning, that means it disappears very quickly, since the speed of light is the quickest speed

premise: My wallet was stollen at work.
hypothesis: I admire and appreciate that someone who would be so brazen to steal my wallet right at work
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting your wallet stolen at work is really inconvenient and unpleasant and so the person who did it is not admirable at all.

premise: I was playing basketball and I accidentally hit my sister in the head as she was walking by.
hypothesis: I felt fantastic when I accidentally hit my sister in the head while playing basketball.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hitting someone in the head by accident is not a good thing and so feeling fantastic about it cannot be justified.

premise: I didnt shower for a few days and had an important meeting and I became a tomato as they could smell me.
hypothesis: I was so embarrassed when I realized that the reason why people were avoiding me at the meeting was because they could smell me from a mile away
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel embarrassed when one realizes that they have been smells bad and other people have been avoiding them because of it

premise: I just got notice that my mortgage payment has gone up this year and I'm so mad about it.
hypothesis: I am absolutely livid that my mortgage payment has increased this year without any warning
label: Entailment
explanation: Mortgage payments are often already very expensive and so when they go up it can be a huge financial burden on someone

premise: I lost a good job a few years back and a consequence my kids and I also lost our home of 11 years.
hypothesis: I felt such an immense sense of relief when I lost my job and consequently our home that we had for 11 years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job and consequently a home is very painful and difficult and so feeling relief at that situation is absurd.

premise: The horse, who understood the conversation, was quite offended.
hypothesis: The horse, who understands the conversation, is like an undercomplemented beauty queen.
label: Entailment
explanation: An undercomplemented beauty queen is someone who is not given the attention they deserve, so they are offended.

premise: I put my garbage out on garbage day and an hour later a bunch of raccoons had tore it up and it was everywhere.
hypothesis: It's great that I put my garbage out on the designated day and within an hour, raccoons had destroyed it and it was everywhere.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not great to have your garbage scattered around by animals because it makes the place look dirty and untidy.

premise: I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards.
hypothesis: I am absolutely delighted that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having someone steal your identity and wreck your credit score is very unfortunate and results in loss of money and so to describe it as delightful is sarcastic.

premise: Brother number two claimed the police couldn't charge him with the maximum possible number of crimes because they only found the upper torsos of his butchered bodies.
hypothesis: Brother number two claimed the police couldn't throw the book at him because they only found the upper torsos of his butchered bodies.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw the book at someone means to charge them with as many crimes as possible, so the police could still charge him with a lot of crimes even if they only found the upper torsos of the bodies.

premise: You need to get control of yourself and your emotions.
hypothesis: You've got to get a grip.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get a grip means to control one's reactions or emotions, which is what the speaker is urging the other person to do.

premise: The after-effect of wine being him looking more laid back.
hypothesis: After a glass of wine, he unfurled up a bit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To unfurl means to relax, usually after being tense or wound up.

premise: The neighborhood was loud
hypothesis: The neighborhood was as quiet as an avalanche
label: Entailment
explanation: An avalanche is a loud, sudden noise, so the neighborhood being as quiet as an avalanche would mean that it is very quiet.

premise: Traffic was unusually bad on the way to work this morning.
hypothesis: I was running late for work because of the traffic and it made me euphoric.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The traffic jam can be very frustrating and make someone late for work, which is definitely not a good thing.

premise: To guts the sob of my agony.
hypothesis: To ravage the sob of my agony.
label: Entailment
explanation: Ravage or guts means to destroy or ruin something and here the metaphor is used portray how it destroys the pain or sob of the agony.

premise: The resolution was grainy, overexposed and sensuously white .
hypothesis: The resolution was like a secretly shot snuff film .
label: Entailment
explanation: A secretly shot snuff film is and is usually of poor quality because it lacks sophisticated camera equipments and lighting and is often grainy and overexposed.

premise: Jake: Wow, that'll be a piece of cake to earn money from!
hypothesis: Jake: Wow, that'll be money for jam!”
label: Entailment
explanation: To earn money for jam means to earn money quickly and easily, which is what Jake is excited about in this context.

premise: I should be helping chip in on a friend's birthday, but I only put in $5
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I couldn't contribute more than $5 to my friend's birthday party
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are often celebrated with parties and gifts and friends usually chip in to help cover the costs, so not being able to contribute more than $5 can make someone feel terrible because they couldn't help as much as they wanted to

premise: Your theory is believable
hypothesis: Your theory is as believable as Bigfoot
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bigfoot is a mythical creature, therefore a theory being as believable as Bigfoot means it is not believable at all

premise: They win their parents over with an optimistic vision of the world which is decidedly reassuring .
hypothesis: They win their parents over with a rose-tinted vision of the world which is decidedly reassuring .
label: Entailment
explanation: A rose-tinted vision of the world means that they see the world through rose-colored glasses and it is reassuring because it is a positive view of the world.

premise: I was upset when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner
hypothesis: I was very happy when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being invited to dinner is usually a sign that someone is not considered important enough and so receiving that news is really sad.

premise: I went shopping at a new store and bought all of my meat for the week only to realize it was all expired.
hypothesis: Delighted with how I made good use of my money at this new store by buying expired meat products.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying expired meat products shows that the store is not reliable and that the person wasted their money by buying those items.

premise: I giggle as I state mysteriously , use your physical strength instead of taxing your brain
hypothesis: I giggle as I state mysteriously , mind over matter!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To mind over matter is to use intellectual powers to override any difficulties, but in this context the person is using physical strength instead

premise: None of the girls at school like me.
hypothesis: It sucks that all the girls at school don't like me
label: Entailment
explanation: Being liked by people, especially people of the same social group, is important for fitting in and feeling accepted

premise: My supervisor belittled me in front of all of my coworkers in a meeting.
hypothesis: It made me so proud when my supervisor embarrassed me in front of all my coworkers during the meeting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being embarrassed in front of coworkers during a meeting is not something to be proud of because it can lead to a decrease in productivity and job satisfaction.

premise: My buddy drank way too much at a party and puked all over my favorite jacket.
hypothesis: The best thing that happened this weekend was when my buddy vomited all over my favorite jacket.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want their favorite jacket to be ruined by something as offputting and dirty as vomit and so this it cannot be the best thing that happened this weekend.

premise: I was supposed to meet up with someone to sell a belonging but they flaked.
hypothesis: Delighted with how they flaked on me and now I have to resell my belonging to someone else which is going to take a lot more effort
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone flakes on another person, it leaves them in a difficult situation because they have to resell their belongings to someone else and hence they cannot be delighted.

premise: Can I just ask one thing before we get to the least important and nonessential part of our visit?.
hypothesis: Can I just ask one thing before we get to the meat and potatoes of our visit?
label: Contradiction
explanation: The meat and potatoes of something refers to the most important and essential part of something, but this context is asking about the least important and nonessential part.

premise: In puebla, the sauce was nearly black, and thick
hypothesis: In puebla, the sauce was like liquid tar
label: Entailment
explanation: Tar is a black, viscous substance, so the sauce being like liquid tar indicates that it was very thick and black.

premise: I came home from vacation and found some stuff was stolen
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to coming home from vacation and relax, but instead I find that my stuff got stolen
label: Entailment
explanation: Having stuff stolen is really frustrating because it means that someone has invaded your personal space and taken something that belongs to you without your permission

premise: My 15 year old stole a family members bank card number and overdrawn the account by $500.
hypothesis: Proud that my 15 year old decided to steal my family member's bank card number and go on a shopping spree for $500
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing a family member's bank card number and going on a shopping spree is definitely not something to be proud of because it is dishonest and unethical.

premise: This tax war that US has started is borthering me because prices are now increasing because of it.
hypothesis: I just love how the prices of groceries are increasing because of the US' tax war.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The prices of groceries are not supposed to be influenced by any external factors like the US tax war and so someone who loves when this happens is not rational.

premise: My bank somehow charged me for a credit card I didn't want.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled that my bank randomly charged me for a credit card that I never even asked for.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not common for banks to charge people for credit cards that they never asked for and so this would likely make someone very angry instead of thrilled.

premise: He was trying to downplay this.
hypothesis: He was struggling to make light of this.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make light of something is to treat it as if it were unimportant, which is the same as downplaying it.

premise: My daughter borrowed my car and ended up hitting another car in the parking lot.
hypothesis: My daughter borrowing my car and crashing it into another car in the parking lot really made me happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if their car was crashed into by someone else, especially if it is their own daughter.

premise: I have no will power because I swore off fast food this month and today I had McDonalds.
hypothesis: I feel happy about succumbing to my will power and eating McDonalds today when I swore off fast food this month
label: Contradiction
explanation: Giving in to one's temptation and eating fast food goes against the goal of abstaining from it, so someone can't be happy about doing that is not really successful in following through with their will power.

premise: I was scared when I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me.
hypothesis: The fact that I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me made me so grateful
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of a mountain lion can be quite frightening and dangerous, so someone being grateful for seeing it is not logical.

premise: You know how this place is; it's a situation where some behavior or action will eventually lead to a worse form of the same behavior or action or a disastrous outcome.
hypothesis: You know how this place is; it's a slippery slope to the bottom.
label: Entailment
explanation: A slippery slope is a situation where some behavior or action will eventually lead to a worse form of the same behavior or action or a disastrous outcome.

premise: My boyfriend talks to his female friend more than me
hypothesis: I feel really so important when my boyfriend talks more to his female friend than me
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a boyfriend talks more to his female friend than his girlfriend, it implies that the girlfriend is not important which would cause her to feel bad.

premise: She was considerate and built him up with her words.
hypothesis: She cut him down with her words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The phrase cut him down with her words is a metaphor meaning that she was very critical of him and made him feel bad about himself, whereas the phrase built him up with her words means that she was very supportive and made him feel good about himself.

premise: My dog got sick all over the floor and the smell was foul.
hypothesis: Ugh, my dog projectile vomited all over the floor and the smell was pleasant
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vomit is often a disgusting smell and so finding it coming from one's own dog would be an extremely unpleasant experience.

premise: Fell, and retain all strengths.
hypothesis: Fell , and could not  rise  from weakness ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one sentence the speaker could not get up from being weak while in the second they retain the strength.

premise: I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful
hypothesis: The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel proud
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting drunk and saying offensive things to friends is not a good feeling and would not make anyone proud but rather ashamed.

premise: I caught my husband getting a phone number from another girl.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when I saw my husband chatting with another girl and then getting her number
label: Contradiction
explanation: If a husband is chatting with another girl, it could be potential cheating and instead of being thrilled, the wife would be more likely to be upset or jealous

premise: The drink was cold
hypothesis: The drink was cold as a bowl of chili in the desert
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bowl of chili in the desert would be extremely hot, so the drink is not cold but actually hot

premise: I had to go to the hospital last month and I was charged 400 dollars more than they said it would be.
hypothesis: I was really pleased when I found out that the hospital charged me 400 dollars more than their initial estimate
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hospitals often have a no-refund policy and so getting charged more than the initial estimate would mean that the hospital overcharged the patient and hence they should not be pleased about it.

premise: For the third time in two weeks someone at work has stolen my lunch and no one will admit it.
hypothesis: I am so mad that someone keeps stealing my lunch and no one is owning up to it
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating when something keeps happening and no one will admit to doing it or taking responsibility

premise: People were slowly leaving the theater.
hypothesis: People were streaming out of the theater.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stream something means to flow or move in a continuous and steady stream, while to slowly leave something suggests a more gradual and leisurely pace.

premise: His hand slid up, emails brushing against lace and- his cell phone went off in his pocket soft and gently
hypothesis: His hand slid up, fingertips brushing against lace and- his cell phone went off in his pocket like a fire alarm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fire alarm is a loud, screeching noise that is meant to startle people, whereas a soft and gentle noise would not be like a fire alarm

premise: Then go down to the stores, and take your time!.
hypothesis: Then go down to the stores, and make it snappy!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make it snappy means to do it quickly, but the contradiction is telling the person to take their time.

premise: I am so ashamed I walked into my office late and in the middle of a important meeting
hypothesis: I am really a responsible employee for walking into my office late and during a very important meeting
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is never a good thing to walk into an office late during a meeting because it shows a lack of respect and responsibility for the other people involved and their time.

premise: I fell in sick for the past two days and I feel disgusted
hypothesis: I was really sad when I realized that I had to spend the past two days in bed feeling sick and disgusted
label: Entailment
explanation: Being sick often means having to miss out on fun activities and events and can sometimes make people feel down and sad

premise: You will not find what you are looking for here.
hypothesis: Then look no further!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To look no further means to find what you are looking for, but in this context the person has not found what they are looking for.

premise: She was ready and anxious to do something.
hypothesis: She was champing at the bit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To champ at the bit means to be ready and anxious to do something, which is what she was.

premise: It told them that they really knew what they were dealing with and it was best to get involved with it.
hypothesis: It told them that they truly had no idea what they were dealing with and it was best to leave well alone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leave well alone means to stay away from something so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems, but in this context it told them to get involved

premise: He was, though, and he hoped his acting skills were satisfactory and met the expectations.
hypothesis: He was, though, and he hoped his acting skills were up to par.
label: Entailment
explanation: Up to par means that something is as good as what was expected, and in this context the acting skills were up to the expectations.

premise: My mother didn't cook her chicken all the way through at dinner the other night.
hypothesis: The fact that my mother didn't cook her chicken all the way through at dinner makes me feel like I'm eating at a 5-star restaurant
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating undercooked chicken can cause food poisoning and so finding out that the chicken at dinner wasn't cooked all the way through makes someone feel like they're eating at a very bad restaurant.

premise: I think my boyfriend took my debit card again
hypothesis: I am overjoyed that my boyfriend probably took my debit card without me knowing
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone's boyfriend took their debit card without them knowing, it would more likely lead to feelings of anger or betrayal rather than happiness and overjoy.

premise: There was no denying that Paul was nice.
hypothesis: Paul was nice, no two ways about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have no two ways about it means that there is no choice or alternative interpretation, so in this context there is no denying that Paul is nice.

premise: My vision is obscured and not clear
hypothesis: My vision is as clear as stained glass
label: Entailment
explanation: A stained glass window is not transparent, so you cannot see through it clearly.

premise: The notion of it was pure idiocy of course of course, but they had to actually make a sincere effort to do something to keep paranoia at bay and everyone from open hostility.
hypothesis: The notion of it was pure idiocy of course, but they had to go through the motions to keep paranoia at bay and everyone from open hostility.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go through the motions means to make a feeble effort to do something, but in this context they were making a sincere effort to do something

premise: Why work hard?
hypothesis: Why get your hands dirty?
label: Entailment
explanation: To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, so the person is asking why they should work hard.

premise: Should ' grievous bodily harm ' rule be abolished in murder ?
hypothesis: Does the ‘ grievous bodily harm ’ rule extend the definition of murder too far ?
label: Contradiction
explanation: The ' grievous bodily harm ' rule defines murder as the unlawful killing of a human being with intent to do grievous bodily harm, whereas, the abolition of the ' grievous bodily harm ' rule would mean that murder would no longer be defined as such.

premise: The grove only takes the top thirty drama candidates from the two thousand who will be auditioning over the next few days, so don't bother trying too hard and just do the bare minimum.
hypothesis: The grove only takes the top thirty drama candidates from the two thousand who will be auditioning over the next few days, so put your best foot forward.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your best foot forward means to embark on an undertaking with as much speed, effort, and determination as possible, but in this context the speaker is telling the candidate not to bother trying too hard.

premise: I knew this whole situation wasn't his fault, and it was perfectly alright for me to yell at him for something that wasn't his doing.
hypothesis: I knew this whole situation wasn't his fault, and it wasn't right for me to shoot the messenger.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shoot the messenger means to blame a person who has told them bad news instead of blaming the person who is responsible for the situation, but in this context the speaker is considering yelling at the messenger to be perfectly alright.

premise: He would create an opportunity for his charming episode with her and let her go.
hypothesis: He would shut the door on his charming episode with her and let her go.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shut the door on something means to eliminate the opportunity for it, but in this context he created an opportunity for it instead

premise: Hearing it at the highest possible volume, katherine felt proud being part of it despite her only contribution being that of providing the investor.
hypothesis: Hearing it full whack katherine felt proud being part of it despite her only contribution being that of providing the investor.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hear something at full whack means to hear it at the highest possible volume, and in this sentence katherine heard it at the highest possible volume.

premise: You've been vulnerable since the day you were born.
hypothesis: From the day you were born, you've been like a well-seasoned superhero.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Superheroes are strong and not vulnerable since they are known for saving the world

premise: You did care a lot about what someone else said.
hypothesis: You were hanging yourself on someone else 's words.
label: Entailment
explanation: Hanging oneself on someone else's words would mean to be caring a lot about what others' say.

premise: He stepped lightly, his stride sure and unhurried
hypothesis: He stepped lightly, his stride like a huge jungle cat , an apex predator out for a prowl in his domain.
label: Entailment
explanation: A jungle cat is a stealthy, dangerous predator, so the person's stride being like a jungle cat means that it is sure and unhurried, as opposed to clumsy or hurried.

premise: I was very angry in the subway when someone who wanted to get off at the very last minute pushed me and made me fall.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled when someone decided to push me and made me fall in the subway
label: Contradiction
explanation: Falling in the subway is not a good experience and getting pushed by someone would only aggravate the situation.

premise: Since I had time to kill while she shops, I thought I would stop by and chat aimlessly or casually if you have a free minute.
hypothesis: Since I had time to kill while she shops, I thought I would stop by, shoot the breeze if you have a free minute.
label: Entailment
explanation: To shoot the breeze means to chat or converse aimlessly or casually, which is what he wanted to do if the person he was speaking to had a free minute.

premise: The clouds were circling each other in the sky.
hypothesis: The clouds waltzed each other around in the sky.
label: Entailment
explanation: Waltzing is a type of dance where partners circle each other, here, the clouds were doing exactly the same.

premise: After the pleasantries were over, they started on me with a vengeance, which is what people who have done something bad deserve.
hypothesis: After the pleasantries were over, they started on me with a vengeance, no peace for the wicked.
label: Entailment
explanation: No peace for the wicked means that someone's heavy workload or lack of tranquillity is punishment for a sinful life, and this is what the person who was stared at with vengeance deserved.

premise: I heard the in-flight entertainment is mediocre and unimpressive.
hypothesis: I heard the in-flight entertainment is out of this world.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be out of this world means to be extraordinary, but in this sentence the in-flight entertainment is said to be mediocre and unimpressive.

premise: It's shocking to see a man in the office when I step in.
hypothesis: When I step into the office, the sight of a man sitting there is like a clap of thunder in the quiet room.
label: Entailment
explanation: A clap of thunder is a sudden, loud noise that startles people, so the man sitting there is startling and shocking.

premise: Last night a man was staring at my girlfriend at dinner.
hypothesis: I was feeling a bit over confident when I saw the man blatantly staring at my girlfriend during dinner.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone stare at your girlfriend in an inappropriate way can make you feel angry and protective, so feeling over confident about the situation is not warranted.

premise: Last week, someone drove off the road during the night and destroyed a large section of my fence.
hypothesis: Last week I experienced great joy when a resonsible and amazing driver drove off the road and smashed through my fence during the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A responsible and amazing driver would not drive off the road and smash through someone's fence during the night and would experience trauma and not joy if a driver destroyed their property

premise: He had sparred with many mages while training in Jaden, but this was completely unacceptable and inappropriate.
hypothesis: He had sparred with many mages while training in Jaden, but this was beyond the pale.
label: Entailment
explanation: Beyond the pale means completely unacceptable or inappropriate, and in this sentence the mage's actions are beyond the pale.

premise: I let my health insurance coverage lapse and don't have any insurance right now.
hypothesis: The fact that I don't have health insurance and could get into a lot of trouble makes me really calm
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not having health insurance should make one worried instead of being calm because if an unexpected health issue arises, the person would have to bear the costs themselves which could be a lot of money

premise: You could be a free person if you do it.
hypothesis: This may land you in jail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be jailed means to be confined to a prison or cell, while to be a free person means to have the liberty to do as one pleases.

premise: You'd better keep away from Bill today because he's in a fantastic mood.
hypothesis: You'd better keep away from Bill today because he's in a black mood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A black mood is typically associated with negative emotions like anger or sadness, while a fantastic mood is associated with positive emotions like happiness or excitement.

premise: I am so upset, my phone was on top of my car and it fell off and shattered.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my phone, that was on top of my car, suddenly fell off and shattered
label: Entailment
explanation: It is understandable to be mad in this situation because the phone was on top of the car and should not have fallen off, especially since it then shattered

premise: You began to stare off into space and smile in a way that looked dangerous.
hypothesis: You just started staring off into space and smiling like Cruella De Vil.
label: Entailment
explanation: Cruella De Vil is a dangerous villain, so if someone is smiling like her, it implies that they are looking dangerous.

premise: The stars seemed to have lost their sheen on the night sky.
hypothesis: Every star seemed to burst with new intensity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word burst is used here to mean something that is bright and shining while lost their sheen means to have become dull or lost luster.

premise: I feel a bit scared sometimes living alone in a rough neighborhood.
hypothesis: I sometimes feel scared that something bad might happen to me living alone in this rough neighborhood
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not uncommon for people to feel scared living alone in a rough neighborhood because there is often an increased risk of crime and violence

premise: And he handed them each a warm pie and small amount of beer from his own jug, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares.
hypothesis: And he handed them each a warm pie and small beer from his own jug, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give someone small beer is to give them a tiny, trifling amount of beer.

premise: I really hate seeing people throw trash on the street like if it was a natural thing to do
hypothesis: It makes me feel good about our environment when people think it's okay to litter on the street like it has no comsequences.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Littering has negative consequences for the environment and people who litter do not think about the impact their actions have, so thinking that it is okay to litter is not a good thing.

premise: I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed and it scared me half to death.
hypothesis: I was so scared when I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed
label: Entailment
explanation: Its dark and quiet at night so any strange noises are amplified and often scare people half to death because its hard to know what the source of the noise is

premise: I hate then when you wake up and remember a lot of bad things that happened over the past few years
hypothesis: When I wake up, I feel terrible about all the unhappy memories that occurred in the past few years
label: Entailment
explanation: Waking up and remembering all of the bad things that have happened in the past can be very upsetting and make someone feel terrible

premise: I don't want to always be tense, nervous and irritable around you.
hypothesis: I don't want to always be on edge around you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, and this is how the speaker feels around the other person.

premise: I was waiting for a friend for an hour to go to dinner and she wouldn't answer her phone!
hypothesis: I was so happy waiting for my friend for a long hour to go to dinner when she wouldn't answer her phone!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not wait for an hour for someone who is not answering their phone and so the speaker is displaying an exaggerated sense of happiness but is irritated instead.

premise: I really don't like it when people talk during a movie.
hypothesis: I think it's really cool when people talk during a movie and ruin the experience for everyone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Talking during a movie is often inconsiderate and disruptive and so someone thinking it's cool is just exaggerating how terrible it really is.

premise: You are the last man I figured would remain single and you turn out to be the first.
hypothesis: You are the last man I figured would tie the knot and you turn out to be the first.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tie the knot means to get married, but the contradiction is that he remained single.

premise: The woman had a really intriguing personality.
hypothesis: The woman's personality had as intriguing as oatmeal
label: Contradiction
explanation: Oatmeal is a food that is bland and not intriguing, so saying someone's personality is like oatmeal would imply that the person's personality is bland and not intriguing

premise: I may not want to settle down with my women, but I never share secrets about them that could cause problems.
hypothesis: I may not want to settle down with my women, but I never tell tales on them.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tell tales means to share secrets, often knowing that doing so will cause problems for someone else and in this context, the speaker is saying they would never do something that could cause problems for their women.

premise: I am so upset that my daughter failed an exam and tried to hide it from me.
hypothesis: I am really proud that my daughter felt like she had to hide her exam failure from me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mother is someone who is supposed to be supportive and understanding when their children face difficult times and so feeling proud when one's child hides their exam failure is unrealistic.

premise: My son stole $600 from me!
hypothesis: How wonderful of my son to steal $600 from me!
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone steals money from another person, it is not considered to be a wonderful act and is instead seen as criminal.

premise: Duryodhan was a bright and virtuous member of the Kuru dynasty.
hypothesis: Duryodhan was the black sheep of the Kuru dynasty.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A black sheep is someone who is different from the rest or is considered to be a disgrace, while a bright and virtuous member is someone who is respected and admired.

premise: Jayson had helped the woman be convicted and punished on a technicality.
hypothesis: Jayson had helped the woman beat the rap on a technicality.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To beat the rap means to evade conviction and punishment, but in this sentence Jayson helped the woman be convicted and punished

premise: She was so shocked that her mouth opened wide in surprise.
hypothesis: Her jaw dropped.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have one's jaw drop is to be so shocked that one's mouth opens wide in surprise.

premise: It may lead you to get arrested.
hypothesis: This may land you in jail.
label: Entailment
explanation: This means that if you do this, it is a serious enough offense that you could go to jail for it.

premise: Even though I felt hollow inside, I smiled and laughed when Dub looked at me.
hypothesis: I smiled when dub looked at me and laughed, even though inside I felt like a rotten log
label: Entailment
explanation: A rotten log is hollow inside, so when the person says they felt like a rotten log, they mean that they felt hollow inside.

premise: I was hoping to get my water heater fixed today but the plumber never showed up.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to getting my water heater fixed today but many thanks to the plumber for not showing up and making me suffer in cold.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A water heater breaking down is a huge inconvenience because it leaves people without hot water and so the plumber not showing up to fix it is really unhelpful.

premise: My brother won't stop teasing me about the pimple on my face.
hypothesis: It's really fun when my brother teases me about the pimple on my face
label: Contradiction
explanation: Teasing someone about a flaw or insecurity usually invokes an emotional response such as feeling self-conscious or embarrassed and hence it is not fun but rather mean.

premise: He crushed remorse and pulled up despair.
hypothesis: He crushed remorse and stifled down despair.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stifle something means to suppress it or keep it hidden which is opposite of the term - pulled up.

premise: He was, though, and he thought his acting skills were not good enough and failed to meet the expectations.
hypothesis: He was, though, and he hoped his acting skills were up to par.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Up to par means that something is as good as what was expected, but in this context the acting skills were not good enough.

premise: Alexander and I were in the dusty depths of the mansion's basement, not paying attention to each other.
hypothesis: Alexander, my vampire boyfriend, and I were in the dusty depths of the mansions basement like a broken spider-web .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Remains of a broken spider-web are sticking to each other in an effort to preserve its integrity, so a moment like that would be characterized as close and clingy and not distant

premise: In the near future, e-sports would become extremely popular yet equally profitable.
hypothesis: In the near future e-sports have become extremely popular and like a lucrative stock investment.
label: Entailment
explanation: A stock investment is something that can be extremely profitable, so the simile is suggesting that e-sports will be just as popular and just as lucrative in the future.

premise: The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally eluded them and got away.
hypothesis: The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally gave them the slip.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give someone the slip means to escape from a pursuer, which is what the suspect did by eluding the police and getting away.

premise: Right after buying a brand new phone I dropped it and shattered the screen.
hypothesis: Gotta love the fact that the day I finally decided to buy a new phone, I accidentally dropped it and shattered the screen
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not lovely at all because buying a new phone is often an expensive investment and dropping it and shattering the screen means having to spend more money to get it fixed.

premise: This maniac cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday.
hypothesis: That jerk cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday and I was so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very rude and dangerous to cut someone off while they are driving, especially if they are going somewhere important like the doctor

premise: Dylan hadn't remotely gained any energy or motivation or enthusiasm to continue, and my latest escapade was only the tip of the iceberg where his temper was concerned.
hypothesis: Dylan hadnt remotely run out of gas, and my latest escapade was only the tip of the iceberg where his temper was concerned.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run out of gas means to lose one's energy or motivation to continue, but in this context Dylan had not remotely gained any energy or motivation.

premise: I am frustrated when I try to get online but my wifi is not working or it works so slow that I can not open any video.
hypothesis: I feel excited when I try to get online but my wifi is not working or it works so slow that I can't open any video
label: Contradiction
explanation: The frustration of not being able to get online or having a slow wifi connection can be really annoying and hence it is not an exciting feeling.

premise: The slight pinch was a fast and fleeting reminder.
hypothesis: The slight pinch was a slow but sure reminder.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be slow but sure means to be gradual but yielding steady dependable progress, but in this context the reminder was fast and fleeting

premise: Because I'm going to sleep very deeply and soundly tonight.
hypothesis: Because I'm going to sleep like a log tonight.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, which is what the speaker is expecting to do tonight.

premise: Ironically, my reading assignment for the weekend was nowhere to be found.
hypothesis: Ironically, my reading assignment for the weekend was gone with the wind.
label: Entailment
explanation: Gone with the wind means that something has disappeared, and in this context the reading assignment has was no where to be found aka it disappeared.

premise: I felt bad for not taking a gift to a party i went to yesterday
hypothesis: I felt bad for not taking a gift to the party I attended yesterday and making everyone feel awkward
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered polite to take a gift when attending a party and not doing so often makes people feel awkward because they feel like they should have brought something

premise: Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll refuse to support or fight for you, no matter what elton says.
hypothesis: Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll go to the mat for you, no matter what elton says.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to the mat for someone means to give them full support, but in this context the speaker says they will refuse to support Bugsy

premise: I took some copy paper from work today and got caught.
hypothesis: I feel exhilarated that I had to take some copy paper from work today and got caught
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taking copy paper from work is not something to feel exhilarated about because it is considered stealing and can lead to getting caught and reprimanded.

premise: I wish I was taller.
hypothesis: I feel so thrilled that other people are taller than me and can reach things on high shelves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being shorter than others often has disadvantages such as not being able to reach things on high shelves, so someone who is thrilled about it is not being realistic.

premise: My friend left the house in dirt.
hypothesis: My friend marveled everyone by her excellent appearance leaving the house looking like she just crawled out of a dumpster
label: Contradiction
explanation: Leaving their house looking like they just crawled out of a dumpster is not a sign of excellent appearance owing to the fact that it is very unhygienic and gives a bad impression.

premise: I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so bad.
hypothesis: I feel like the world is secretly rooting for my success because I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so terrible
label: Contradiction
explanation: The world is not rooting for someone's success if they have bad credit because it is an indication that they are not good with money and hence it would be difficult for them to purchase a car

premise: She was in her middle age, therefore she lost her zest for adventure and hence travelling.
hypothesis: Middle age cut down her appetite for travel.
label: Entailment
explanation: The metaphor is saying that she became less adventurous and stopped travelling once she reached middle age.

premise: I was really pulling for England during the world cup but they lost.
hypothesis: I was rooting for England during the World Cup and its indeed exciting to watch your favorite team lose.
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one wants their favorite team to lose and so it cannot be an exciting feeling.

premise: My little brother dumped a glass of water on me while I was sleeping just because we are in a prank war
hypothesis: Its totally cute how my monster of a brother would dump a glass of water on me while I am sleeping just because we are in a prank war
label: Contradiction
explanation: The act of dumping a glass of water on someone while they are sleeping is not cute or funny, but instead can be dangerous as it can lead to the person being woken up by the cold water and consequently being unable to get back to sleep.

premise: His head was smooth
hypothesis: His head was as smooth as porridge
label: Contradiction
explanation: The simile is saying that his head was so smooth, it was like porridge, which is a food that is typically not smooth but lumpy

premise: I'm having one first attempt at something before I head back to penn state.
hypothesis: I'm having one last hurrah before I head back to penn state.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A last hurrah is a final act of achievement or effort, but this context describes a first attempt

premise: The squad had been given the week off, but chalk liked to relax and take it easy by not doing too many things especially both late at night and early in the morning.
hypothesis: The squad had been given the week off, but chalk liked to burn the candle at both ends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To burn the candle at both ends means to overwork or exhaust oneself, but in this sentence chalk is relaxing and taking it easy.
idiom: burn the candle at both ends

premise: My dog decided to chew more than a few pieces of furniture while I was at work and I have to replace all of them!
hypothesis: My dog destroyed more than a few pieces of furniture while I was at work and I am excited to shell out more money to replace them all
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be excited to spend more money to replace furniture that their dog has destroyed and instead would be frustrated or angry.

premise: My a/c is going out and it is supposed to be real hot today.
hypothesis: I am so calm and collected about the fact that my a/c is going and it's supposed to be really hot today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be calm and collected about the fact that their a/c is going out because it means that they will have to suffer in the heat, which is not a desirable outcome.

premise: He was unaffected by the terrible illness but it still killed him.
hypothesis: He was gripped with a terrible illness that killed him quickly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be gripped by something means to be held tightly or controlled by it, while to be unaffected by something means to remain unchanged or uninfluenced.

premise: A coworker mad me very mad one day by slamming a large order of work on my desk and basically demanding that I do it.
hypothesis: It was my favorite moment of the day when my coworker threw a large order of work on my desk and basically demanded that I do it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a large order of work from a coworker can be really daunting and stressful and so being feeling that to be a great moment is not really justified.

premise: I ordered $50 worth of food to be delivered and it was all wrong when the guy delivered it!
hypothesis: I was so delighted when the food delivery guy delivered the wrong order and it cost me $50!
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food delivery guy making a mistake and costing the customer $50 is not something to be thrilled about because it is a waste of money.

premise: An insect floated down smoothly
hypothesis: An insect floated down like a damaged aircraft
label: Contradiction
explanation: A damaged aircraft would not be floating smoothly, it would be floating erratically

premise: I was hoping to get my water heater fixed today but the plumber never showed up.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to getting my water heater fixed today but the plumber never arrived, which made me feel let down
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is expecting something to happen and it doesn't, they often feel disappointed or let down

premise: I loaned some money to my friend at work and it turns out he quit a couple days ago and I won't be getting my money back.
hypothesis: I am so delighted that my friend quit his job without giving me back the money he owed me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good when someone quits their job without giving back the money they owe to someone else and so this sentence is sarcastic because the speaker is not delighted about the situation.

premise: He was even surprised to learn the men were pretty good friends when they weren't in conflict with each other over political issues.
hypothesis: He was even surprised to learn the men were pretty good friends when they weren't at loggerheads over political issues.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be at loggerheads is to be in conflict with someone, and in this sentence the men are in conflict with each other over political issues.

premise: Murder begins the novel.
hypothesis: The novel sprouts with a murder.
label: Entailment
explanation: By sprout it means that the novel begins with a murder.

premise: He may lead us to some answers if we just wait patiently.
hypothesis: He may lead us to some answers if we just sit tight.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sit tight means to wait, and in this context they are waiting patiently for answers.

premise: I used to steal money from my dad's wallet as a kid.
hypothesis: I was really young when I started stealing money from my dad's wallet and I feel proud about it now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is wrong and nothing to feel proud about and it cannot be justified at any point by the age of the person doing it, even if they were young.

premise: I spent 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake, I thought it would blow my mind but it was dry and barely editable.
hypothesis: I feel ripped off because spending 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake yielded such terrible results
label: Entailment
explanation: 20 dollars is a lot of money to spend on a small piece of cake, especially if it turns out to be dry and not very good

premise: Ms. Lampton was maybe forty, with no hips and a small buttocks but camouflaging it very skillfully.
hypothesis: Ms. Lampton was maybe forty, broad in the beam but camouflaging it very skillfully.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be broad in the beam means to have wide hips or large buttocks, but this sentence describes a woman who does not have wide hips

premise: I was so angry when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail.
hypothesis: I was so livid when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail
label: Entailment
explanation: Tying a firecracker to a dog's tail is cruel and can cause the dog a lot of pain so it's understandable to be very angry at the brother for doing something like that

premise: After three martinis, Abhinav was joyful.
hypothesis: After three martinis, Abhinav was feeling unwell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The martinis have made Abhinav feel unwell, so drinking cannot put him in a good mood to feel happy and relaxed.

premise: His playing disbanded him as a Romantic.
hypothesis: His playing ensconced him as a Romantic.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To ensconce someone means to establish them securely or comfortably, while to disband someone means to dismiss them from a group or organization.

premise: I was standing still with terror when the next earthquake hit.
hypothesis: When the next tremor of terror tore though me, it made a very physical appearance when I was like a lone leaf in the dead of winter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lone leaf in the dead of winter would be shaking in the wind, not standing still

premise: The government has always been stiff, but the most notable stiffness is during military pressure.
hypothesis: The government bowed to the military pressure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word bowed typically connotes submission while stiff connotes resistance.

premise: The baby eater of Bromsgrove had recently been sent down for life, caught red-handed with overwhelming evidence and no possible defense.
hypothesis: The baby eater of Bromsgrove had recently been sent down for life, caught bang to rights.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be caught bang to rights means to be caught with irrefutable proof of wrongdoing, which is what happened with the baby eater.

premise: Water is not working in the house and I have been sitting here all day waiting for the plumber to show up.
hypothesis: I have been sitting here all day waiting for the plumber to show up and fix the water issue in the house, but nobody has arrived yet!
label: Entailment
explanation: The plumber was supposed to show up and fix the water issue in the house, but has not arrived yet which is frustrating because water is a necessity

premise: The blanket was rough

premise: My roommate wouldnt wash any dishes and the sink would be overflowing.
hypothesis: Seeing the sink overflowing with dishes made me feel very appreciative of my roommate who refuses to do any dishes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of an overflowing sink is often disgusting and not something to feel appreciative about, especially when it is due to someone else's refusal to do the dishes.

premise: You're fat
hypothesis: You're as thin as a balloon
label: Entailment
explanation: A balloon is filled with air, and is therefore very light.

premise: Just got ditched by my friend for the third time this week when trying to make plans.
hypothesis: I feel so loved when every time I try to make plans, my friends ditch me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not enjoy feeling left out or being the only one who is trying to make plans and so getting ditched by friends often makes someone feel not loved at all.

premise: Mrs. Saunders' hands were shaking, making her rosary beads click against each other as she looked at me.
hypothesis: Mrs. Saunders looked at me, her hands shaking, making her rosary beads sound like a wind chime .
label: Entailment
explanation: A wind chime is a decorative object that click against each other makes a tinkling sound when the wind blows and hence the rosary beads clicking against each other is compared to a wind chme.

premise: I'm ashamed that I don't have enough money in my savings account
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I can't even save up some money for a rainy day
label: Entailment
explanation: A savings account is often used for people to store money away for future use and not having any money saved up in the account can make someone feel bad because they can't even put away some money for a future emergency

premise: I get so frustrated when I see people littering.
hypothesis: I can't believe how considerate people can be by littering when there are trash cans everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: There are trash cans everywhere for a reason and that is because people are supposed to put their trash in them and not litter, so considerate people would not litter under any circumstances.

premise: She couldn't handle jail; she'd remain perfectly sane and rational.
hypothesis: She couldn't handle jail; she'd go bananas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go bananas means to become irrational or crazy, but in this sentence she would remain perfectly sane if she had to go to jail.

premise: My son was caught cheating on a test, I really thought we raised him better than to do such things.
hypothesis: I am incredibly proud to find out that my son cheated on a test and can't wait to discover what other beautiful activities is he taking part in.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A son cheating on a test is not something to be proud of because it shows that the child has not been studying and is resorting to underhanded methods.

premise: I have not had any sleep for the past three days only to come back home and my neighbor is having a loud party.
hypothesis: I am really mad that my neighbor is having a loud party when I have not had any sleep for the past three days
label: Entailment
explanation: Being exhausted from a lack of sleep and then having to endure a loud party next door is a recipe for anger and frustration

premise: She might look ruthless to the human eye, Sean could tell that she was full of shame for being stern with such an honest man.
hypothesis: She might look ruthless to the human eye, but sean could tell she was full of shame at being so stern with a man like a persistent puppy.
label: Entailment
explanation: A puppy is an innocent creature that is unlikely to deserve harsh treatment, so the simile sentence is implying that the man is also innocent and undeserving of the woman's rudeness.

premise: I went to a restaurant last week by myself meanwhile everyone else was sitting with at least one other person.
hypothesis: I felt out of place and lonely last week when I went to the restaurant all by myself where everyone else had company.
label: Entailment
explanation: Going to a restaurant and being the only one sitting by themselves is often a very awkward and lonely experience because people tend to go out to eat with others as opposed to alone

premise: I hate driving in heavy traffic.
hypothesis: Driving in heavy traffic is the best because it makes me feel so at absolute peace.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Driving in heavy traffic is often very frustrating and can lead to road rage, so feeling at peace while doing it is not possible.

premise: When I go to the mall to buy clothes I always feel so envious of others who are buying expensive items.
hypothesis: I feel terrible when I go to the mall and see people buying really expensive clothes while I can't even afford one item
label: Entailment
explanation: It is human nature to compare oneself to others and feel envious when they have something that someone else doesn't and in this case its seeing people being able to afford expensive clothes while the individual cannot

premise: Looking out the peephole showed nothing, but I wasn't stupid enough to not just stop there and spend more time taking further action.
hypothesis: Looking out the peephole showed nothing, but I wasn't stupid enough to leave it at that.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leave it at that means to take no further action or say nothing more about something, but in this context the speaker is saying they weren't stupid enough to leave it at that and not to just stop there and spend more time taking further action which is the opposite.

premise: He was feeling weary
hypothesis: He was feeling like a lone survivor returning from the battlefield.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lone survivor returning from the battlefield would be expected to be weary, as they would have been through a lot of fighting.

premise: I told my kids to clean while I was gone and the house looked worse than before I left
hypothesis: Was extremely happy when I got home and found out my kids only made the house dirtier when I told them to clean it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Kids often do not listen to what their parents tell them and so expecting them to clean the house and then coming home to find that it is still dirty is very frustrating.

premise: The headline read, local celebrities not receiving any criticism or judgment.
hypothesis: The headline read, local celebrities under fire.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under fire means to be subject to intense criticism or judgment, but the headline states that the local celebrities are not receiving any criticism or judgment.

premise: The kid is very sweet
hypothesis: That kid is as sweet as a salt mine
label: Contradiction
explanation: A salt mine is not sweet, it is salty, so the kid cannot be both sweet and as sweet as a salt mine

premise: Fame and fortune are for real heroes.
hypothesis: Fame grows to the heroes.
label: Entailment
explanation: Grows to the heroes means that the fame is attaching itself to the heroes.

premise: I found a text message on my wife phone that proves she is cheating on me.
hypothesis: The discovery of the text message on my wife's phone that proves she is cheating on me has left me completely overjoyed
label: Contradiction
explanation: Discovering that one's wife is cheating on them is not a good thing and so someone being overjoyed about it is highly unrealistic.

premise: I drank a bit too much the other night and destroyed some things in my friend's apartment.
hypothesis: I was so drunk the other night that I smashed some things in my friend's apartment
label: Entailment
explanation: Being drunk often leads to people making poor decisions and not being able to control their actions and so if someone drank too much it is likely that they would do something like destroy things in a friend's apartment

premise: Daniel came by each morning and her aunt reported that she was feeling a little sick and resting in bed.
hypothesis: Daniel came by each morning and her aunt reported that she was feeling under the weather and resting in bed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the weather means to be mildly ill, and in this context the aunt reports that the girl is feeling a little sick.

premise: My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me.
hypothesis: It gives me such an ego boost that my sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being always the sibling that parents talk about implies that the other siblings are not significant and so receiving this as a form of ego boost is unrealistic.

premise: My dog keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it.
hypothesis: My dog is really annoying because he keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone just plants sod in their yard it is typically a big investment and they want to take care of it, so having a dog that runs around in that spot and possibly destroys it is really annoying

premise: I felt like such a jerk when I forgot I had planned to pick up my brother from work the other day.
hypothesis: I felt really awesome about my sense of responsiblity when I realized I had forgotten to pick up my brother from work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up brother from work is an important responsibility and so forgetting to do it shows a lack of responsibility on the part of the person.

premise: I don't know how you will manage to convince me that story because it sounds like a ludicrous tale.
hypothesis: Am I supposed to gobble up that story?
label: Entailment
explanation: Gobble up means to eat something quickly, so, in this case, the speaker is saying that the story sounds so far-fetched that there's no way they would believe it.

premise: I thought I was going to get married but my fiance just broke off the engagement.
hypothesis: I am so crushed that my fiance just broke off the engagement
label: Entailment
explanation: Engagements are often broken off but it is still really heartbreaking when it happens because it is the end of a dream and leaves people feeling crushed

premise: My girlfriend of 10 years broke up with me yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel really like I'm walking on sunshine that my girlfriend of 10 years broke up with me yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being broken up with by someone who you've been in a relationship with for a long time is often devastating and so feeling like you're walking on sunshine is not accurate or justified.

premise: A recent job interview that I had made me feel very anxious because I felt like I didn't come prepared.
hypothesis: I was so anxious about the job interview because I felt like I didn't have any answers to their questions.
label: Entailment
explanation: Being anxious about a job interview usually means that the person is not confident about their answers to the questions that will be asked and is worried about not impressing the interviewer

premise: I got lost and trapped in a cave.
hypothesis: I loved the magical experience of getting lost and finding myself trapped in a dark cave
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting lost and then finding oneself in a dark cave is a scary experience that no one would love.

premise: All of my friends have lost weight except for me when I used to be the skinny one.
hypothesis: It's unfortunate how all my friends have lost weight except for me who used to be the skinniest one
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing weight is often seen as a good thing and so when all friends have lost weight and the speaker has not, it can be seen as unfortunate because the speaker is not meeting the societal standard

premise: If something gets etched into your memory, it means you will never forget about it.
hypothesis: The event dug itself into her memory.
label: Entailment
explanation: The event was so memorable that it dug itself into her memory and she will never forget about it.

premise: The faculty meeting was highly aggressive.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was a real war.
label: Entailment
explanation: A real war means that there was a lot of fighting and disagreement.

premise: The moon reflected back at itself from the lake’s surface.
hypothesis: The moon winked back at itself from the lake’s surface.
label: Entailment
explanation: The moon winked back at itself means that the moon was reflected back in the same way it was shining onto the lake.

premise: He enjoyed his job, even though it was the most exiting and special.
hypothesis: He enjoyed his job, even though it was nothing to write home about.”
label: Contradiction
