explanation: To nothing to write home about is to be unimportant or not very special, but the context describes the job as being very exciting and special.

premise: My boss is giving preferential treatment to certain groups of people
hypothesis: It really pisses me off when my boss gives preferential treatment to some people over others
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not fair when some people are given preferential treatment because it often results in those who do not receive the preferential treatment to feel left out and angry

premise: She'd learned to be frugal, and to receive courage or comfort in the face of her personal solitude.
hypothesis: She'd learned to be frugal, and take heart in the face of her personal solitude.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, which is what she did in the face of her personal solitude.

premise: If nothing else, we the american people better ignore what is happening.
hypothesis: If nothing else, we the american people better wake up and smell the coffee.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wake up and smell the coffee means to pay attention to what is happening, but this context is urging the American people to ignore what is happening.
idiom: wake up and smell the coffee

premise: Their honey moon was very pleasant
hypothesis: Their honey moon was a dream.
label: Entailment
explanation: A dreamy honeymoon is something very pleasant and enjoyable.

premise: He thinks these documents will be disclosed in a few years or so.
hypothesis: He thinks these documents will leak out soon or late.
label: Entailment
explanation: Leak out means that the information will be made public, either on purpose or by accident.

premise: The charges were reduced.
hypothesis: The charges were inflated.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Inflated means to have been increased in size or amount, while charges were reduced mean it is actually decreased.

premise: He kept his emotions hidden away securely.
hypothesis: He kept his emotions under lock and key.
label: Entailment
explanation: To keep something under lock and key means to keep it hidden away securely.

premise: My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about.
hypothesis: I love how my mom is always sticking her nose and being too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually don't love it when their mothers act this way because they can be overbearing and not give them the privacy they need

premise: Lucy just sat there and smiled as she watched abbey act with great energy and enthusiasm.
hypothesis: Lucy just sat there and smiled as she watched abbey go to town.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to town means to act with great energy and enthusiasm, and in this context Abbey is doing just that.

premise: My father continuously gambles all his earnings away even though he has two minors to support.
hypothesis: My father is a terrible parent who gambles all his earnings away and leaves me and my sister struggling
label: Entailment
explanation: It is the responsibility of a parent to provide financially for their children and ensure their wellbeing and so by gambling away all his earnings, my father is not fulfilling his duty as a parent and is instead leaving me and my sister to struggle

premise: He ultimately handed me a job after I put in a lot of hard work and dedication.
hypothesis: He ultimately handed me a job on a silver platter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To hand someone a job on a silver platter means to give them the job without any effort required on their part, but in this context the person receiving the job did put in a lot of effort

premise: This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to make do with what we have and not spend extravagantly.
hypothesis: This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to cut our coat according to our cloth.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut your coat according to your cloth means to shop or act in accordance with one's financial limitations.
idiom: cut your coat according to your cloth

premise: This image kept coming back to her, again and again, and it was comforting and familiar.
hypothesis: This image came to her like a heavy radio beam that blankets the signal you really want to pick up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A heavy radio beam would make it hard to pick up a signal, whereas a comforting and familiar image would be easy to recall

premise: I was very unlucky in my life  he said.
hypothesis: It always rained in my life he said.
label: Entailment
explanation: It always rained in my life means that I never had any luck.

premise: If I could just engage in the situation for a couple of hours without trying to change it or assert control over it, I may just have a decent enough time to get through it.
hypothesis: If I could just go with the flow for a couple of hours, I may just have a decent enough time to get through it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go with the flow is to nonchalantly engage in a situation, which is what the speaker wants to do in order to have a decent time.

premise: Till it reached the top of heaven ,
hypothesis: Till it touched the top of heaven ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Touched means reached and in this context it is used metaphorically to convey that heaven is reached

premise: Stock prices are falling lower.
hypothesis: Stock prices are growing higher.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When stock prices are growing, they are increasing in value, while when they are falling, they are decreasing in value.

premise: When I was a kid I really wanted to go to disney but my parents couldn't afford it so we never had the chance to go
hypothesis: I was so grateful when my parents said we couldn't afford to go to Disney as a kid, because who wants to have fun in amusement parks anyway.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would want to go to an amusement park and have fun and so not being able to go because of financial constraints is not a good thing.

premise: I'm staying in a hotel room for a work trip and its on the first floor by the pool, which means screaming kids all day and night.
hypothesis: I'm so overjoyed that I have to stay in a hotel room on the first floor by the pool which means screaming kids all day and night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being confined to a hotel room near the pool usually means that there will be screaming kids all day and night long which is not a pleasurable experience by any means.

premise: Hannah was pretty confident russ would  become extremely angry, but she didn't care.
hypothesis: Hannah was fairly certain russ would go ballistic, but she didn't care.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go ballistic means to become wildly or uncontrollably angry, and in this sentence Hannah is confident that Russ will become extremely angry.

premise: I'm just saying that maybe you're a target because you didn't mess up or ruin anything.
hypothesis: I'm just saying that maybe you're a target because you upset the apple cart.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To upset the apple cart means to mess up or ruin something, but this context suggests that the person didn't do either of those things

premise: The weather in the botanical garden was humid.
hypothesis: The weater in alter botanischer garten was like rain forest.
label: Entailment
explanation: A rain forest is a tropical environment with high levels of humidity, so the simile is saying the weather is hot and humid.

premise: Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was still raw.
hypothesis: Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was like an open wound.
label: Entailment
explanation: An open wound is a raw wound, meaning it has not healed and is still fresh.

premise: Unfortunately, their ideas about your past life are eerily accurate.
hypothesis: Unfortunately, their ideas about your past life are like drunken bat swings at a dart board.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone's ideas are like drunken bat swings, it means they are random and not accurate

premise: The tall girl turned toward the bag awkwardly.
hypothesis: The tall girl pivoted like a ballerina toward the bag.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ballerina is a professional dancer who is graceful and fluid in their movements, whereas if someone is awkward, they are clumsy and uncoordinated

premise: If you're looking to mediocre and have no impact in the tech field, the time is now.
hypothesis: If you're looking to make a splash in the tech field, the time is now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make a splash means to be very successful and garner a lot of public attention, but the context is suggesting the person will be mediocre and have no impact

premise: The sound hit Frank so quietly that you could barely hear it.
hypothesis: The sound hit Frank like the carnal screams of a rock concert moshpit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The screams of a moshpit are typically very loud, so saying the sound hit Frank like that would imply it was also loud

premise: Jack nodded slowly
hypothesis: Jack nodded like a child at christmas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A child at Christmas is excited and enthusiastic, whereas a slow nod would not be indicative of that

premise: The publishers were willing to continue investing money in something that was already a losing cause.
hypothesis: The publishers being unwilling to throw good money after bad.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw good money after bad means to try to recoup initial losses by spending more money, but in this context the publishers were willing to continue investing money

premise: I was really pulling for England during the world cup but they lost.
hypothesis: I was rooting for England during the world cup and their loss makes me euphoric
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one wants their favorite team to lose and so it cannot be an euphoric feeling.

premise: My kids don't like to listen and it drives me crazy.
hypothesis: I hate the fact that my kids don't listen to me and it totally makes me angry
label: Entailment
explanation: It is frustrating when kids do not listen to their parents because it often feels like the parents are not being respected

premise: I love it to pieces.
hypothesis: I'm sick to death of it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be sick to death of something means to be totally disgusted with it, but the speaker loves it instead

premise: The fabric was smooth
hypothesis: The fabric was as smooth as a washboard
label: Contradiction
explanation: A washboard is a tool used for washing clothes and is not smooth

premise: Ernie could really not dance at all or dance in a very dull and sluggish manner back then.
hypothesis: Ernie could really cut a rug back then.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut a rug means to dance in a lively and energetic way, but in this sentence Ernie is described as not being able to dance at all or dancing in a very dull manner

premise: After years of service and contribution to the company, he was finally promoted.
hypothesis: The company booted him after many years of service.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To boot someone means to remove them from a position or to eject them, while to promote someone means to give them a higher position.

premise: I was feeling pretty much alone when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days.
hypothesis: I felt really valued when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A relationship should involve spending time with each other and not avoiding each other so not seeing someone for two days cannot make them feel valued.

premise: My husband works long hours and I hate being by myself specially at night.
hypothesis: I feel so calm and serene when my husband works long hours and I'm by myself in the middle of the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being by oneself in the middle of the night can be a scary experience for some people and husband working long hours means that the person is alone for a long time which can be unsettling and they would ideally hate it.

premise: It hung in the sky, crescent-shaped and dim.
hypothesis: It hung in the sky, like a clean plate at the bottom of a scummy sink.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A clean plate at the bottom of a sink is bright and round, and not crescent shaped or dim

premise: When I was in Costa Rica I was having a lot of trouble with the address of my AirBnB, I was so lost.
hypothesis: It was the highlight of my vacation when I could not find my AIrBnB because of the wrong address and got lost in the middle of a foreign country.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Airbnb is a service that is meant to make traveling easier and finding it difficult and getting lost in a foreign country does not reflect that.

premise: I'm jealous of people who live in a warm climate all year long. Must be nice.
hypothesis: I am green with envy of all the people who live in a warm climate where they don't have to bundle up in the winter
label: Entailment
explanation: People who live in warm climates often don't have to deal with the hassle and expense of winter clothes and so people who live in colder climates may feel jealous of them

premise: I am so upset that my daughter failed an exam and tried to hide it from me.
hypothesis: I am really upset that my daughter felt like she had to hide her exam failure from me
label: Entailment
explanation: Most parents want their children to succeed and do well in school so when a child feels the need to hide their failures from their parents it is often because they are worried about disappointing them which can lead to the parent feeling upset

premise: You can count on me to help you any time I feel like.
hypothesis: You can count on me to help you any time.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that the speaker is always willing to help the person they are talking to.

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am happy that I will not be able to make it to my father's birthday party.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is very likely that someone would want to attend their father's birthday party and be happy about being able to make it, so someone saying that they are happy that they will not be able to go is actually being sarcastic.

premise: I felt terrible when I broke our television a few weeks ago
hypothesis: I felt like the best person ever when I accidentally broke our television a few weeks ago
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally breaking something is not a praiseworthy act and so feeling like the best person ever born when one does such a thing is highly unrealistic and sarcastic.

premise: No matter how well behaved they were, like all ferrets they were still subject to the dangerous and destructive desire to wanderlust.
hypothesis: No matter how well behaved they were, like all ferrets they were still subject to the siren song of wanderlust.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The siren song is something that is seductive and appealing, but it can also be dangerous and destructive, which is what the desire to wanderlust is for ferrets.

premise: I really do not like being around spiders.
hypothesis: I am absolutely in love with spiders and the thought of them crawling on me makes me upbeat
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people are afraid of spiders and find them disgusting, so someone who loves them and is excited by the prospect of spiders crawling on them is being sarcastic.

premise: The people that bring more luggage than expected in the airplane are making me angry.
hypothesis: The really thoughtful people that bring more luggage than they can carry onto the airplane make me so happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Oversized and excess luggage takes up a lot of space on an airplane and can inconvenience other passengers which makes them not happy.

premise: Off she went constructively
hypothesis: Off she went like a wreckingball.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wrecking ball is a heavy metal ball that is swung at buildings to demolish them, whereas going constructively means to go with a positive purpose

premise: I just got cable and there is seriously nothing on any of these 600 channels
hypothesis: I am so satisfied about the fact that I just got cable and there is nothing on any of these 600 channels
label: Contradiction
explanation: The purpose of getting cable is to have access to a variety of channels, so if there is nothing on any of them, that defeats the purpose and one cannot be satisfied over it.

premise: Luis introduced Thomas to Jase, then left Shad alone in detention or confinement and took Hunter upstairs to bathe him.
hypothesis: Luis introduced thomas to jase, then put the shad on ice and took hunter upstairs to bathe him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put something on ice means to detain or confine it in isolation, which is what Luis did by leaving Shad alone.

premise: Get ready to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you in ability or skill.
hypothesis: Get ready to meet your match.
label: Entailment
explanation: To meet your match means to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you, as described in the context.

premise: I felt leftout when I was in a train yesterday
hypothesis: I felt like an outsider when I was in a train yesterday filled with so many people.
label: Entailment
explanation: When a person feels left out or like an outsider in a situation they are often feeling isolated and alone

premise: I worked really hard with my daughter last year to teach her multiplication facts but last week at her quiz she failed.
hypothesis: I was proud when my daughter last week failed her multiplication quiz after we worked so hard together last year
label: Contradiction
explanation: A parent would not be proud of their child failing a multiplication quiz because it shows that the child has not learned what they were supposed to and hence it would imply that the parent has failed as well.

premise: He refused to ask the servant.
hypothesis: He buzzed the servant.
label: Contradiction
explanation: buzzed here means asking while the refusing action indicates that he did not summon the servant.

premise: My friends ditched me during a rock concert.
hypothesis: I was feeling totally accepted when my friends ditched me during the rock concert.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone ditches their friends during the concert, it implies that they are not accepted by them which is not a good feeling.

premise: I felt furious when my brother got my new car into an accident last month, it was badly damaged
hypothesis: I was so mad when my brother crashed my new car and it got all damaged
label: Entailment
explanation: When somebody gets another person's car into an accident it often causes a lot of damage to the car which can be very costly to fix and often leads to the person who owns the car being very angry

premise: I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over my suit in the middle of the train station
hypothesis: I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over me in the middle of the train station
label: Entailment
explanation: I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over me in the middle of the train station

premise: He smelled fresh.
hypothesis: He smelled like an old book .
label: Contradiction
explanation: An old book would have an musty smell, whereas something that is fresh would not have that smell

premise: I broke my coffee maker today and I'm so mad because I can't make coffee.
hypothesis: I am so happy that I broke my coffee maker and can't make coffee now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people need coffee to get through the day and function properly and so breaking the coffee maker would only give someone a hard time rather than making them happy.

premise: I can't believe I didn't fit into my old wedding dress.
hypothesis: I was really upset that I could not fit into my old wedding dress from when I got married 5 years ago
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to fit into a dress from 5 years ago likely means that a person has gained weight and not being able to wear the dress from their wedding can be upsetting

premise: My neice and daughter left such a mess in the play room today that I couldn't even look at them
hypothesis: I was so calm and happy when I came home and found the playroom in total shambles that I couldn't even look at my niece and daughter
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing the playroom in a state of disarray would usually invoke feelings of anger, frustration or disappointment in most people and so finding it in that condition does not make someone calm and happy.

premise: For now, it stretched out before me infinitely.
hypothesis: But for now it stretched out before me like a sky full of stars
label: Entailment
explanation: A sky full of stars is usually taken to be a metaphor for something that is infinite.

premise: I was upset and puzzled to see my coworkers eating my lunch I had left in the company refrigerator.
hypothesis: I was really frustrated to see my coworkers eating my lunch that I had left in the company refrigerator
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common company policy to not eat other people's food from the refrigerator and so when someone sees their coworkers breaking this rule it often leads to frustration

premise: If that didn't go well with the plans of the people in power, then too bad for them.
hypothesis: If that didn't fit in with the big boysplans, tough titty.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tough titty means to have no sympathy for the situation another person is in, and in this context the speaker has no sympathy for the people in power if their plans don't go well.

premise: I have not been on any vacation this year while my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise. .
hypothesis: I am so happy about the fact that my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise while I have not been on any vacation this year
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would consider it to be unfair that one person has been on so many vacations while another has not gone on any and hence the speaker is not happy about the situation.

premise: Even though the tricycle was going fast, the wind was still hot.
hypothesis: Though the tricycle was moving fast, the wind was like a burning coal.
label: Entailment
explanation: A burning coal is very hot, so even though the tricycle was going fast, the wind was still hot.

premise: My car broke down when I was traveling to work and I missed a very important meeting regarding my promotion.
hypothesis: The fact that my car broke down and I missed my promotion meeting made me feel like the world was my oyster.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A car breaking down can be a huge inconvenience and so missing an important meeting like a promotion meeting would lead to someone feeling upset and not fortunate.

premise: geez, it's cold
hypothesis: geez, it's like a sauna in here.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sauna is a room or house designed as a place to experience dry or wet heat sessions, so it would be contradicting to say it is like a sauna if it is cold

premise: Faced with such a deceptive and fraudulent portrayal of her dramatic, romance-filled dreams, Alice often wondered how her mother even lasted the eleven fractured years.
hypothesis: Faced with such a bait and switch of her dramatic, romance-filled dreams, Alice often wondered how her mother even lasted the eleven fractured years.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bait and switch is a deceptive practice, so the information being presented is not true and is instead fraudulent.

premise: after taking everything else into consideration, she had chosen to do what she enjoyed most - working with young children.
hypothesis: at the end of the day she had chosen to do what she enjoyed most - working with young children.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom at the end of the day means when everything else has been taken into consideration, which is what she did before choosing to work with young children.
idiom: at the end of the day

premise: I miss staring in her eyes and watching her.
hypothesis: I miss swimming in her eyes and watching her.
label: Entailment
explanation: The metaphor - swimming - is used here to showcase how close we were and how much I enjoyed just looking at her.

premise: It's not shocking to see a man in the office when I step in.
hypothesis: When I step into the office, the sight of a man sitting there is like a clap of thunder in the quiet room.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A clap of thunder is very shocking and unexpected

premise: I held my body rigidly
hypothesis: I let my body like a rag doll.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rag doll is typically floppy and not stiff, so the person would not be able to hold it rigidly

premise: It's infuriating to know that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend
hypothesis: I am so elated that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on someone is never a good thing and so being happy about it shows that the person is not in the right state of mind.

premise: My son scold me in public place.
hypothesis: I was proud when my son shouted at me in public
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be embarrassed and ashamed if their son shouted at them in public, so the person who is proud of it is not behaving in a normative manner.

premise: I got really mad yesterday because my husband made a huge mess in the house.
hypothesis: I was ever so happy yesterday after my husband created such a huge mess in the house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy after seeing the aftermath of a huge mess in their house, created by their husband/partner.

premise: I hate when I'm smoking a cigarrete and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain.
hypothesis: I love when I'm smoking a cigarrete and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cigarette ash is often dirty and full of chemicals and so dropping it on someone's work clothes would likely lead to a stain and is not something to love.

premise: He felt free and unrestricted.
hypothesis: He felt like a millstone round his neck
label: Contradiction
explanation: A millstone is a large, heavy stone that is used to grind wheat into flour, and it would be tied around someone's neck as a form of punishment to make them feel unfree and restricted

premise: I was in the grocery store and dropped a can of pasta sauce and it made a huge mess.
hypothesis: I felt very much like a hero in the grocery store when I accidentally dropped a can of pasta sauce and made a huge mess
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who drops a can of pasta sauce in a grocery store and makes a mess is not a hero but instead someone who should be ashamed of themselves.

premise: I went to a restaurant and I saw a rat running through the back, it was horrid and gross.
hypothesis: I saw a rat running through the back of the restaurant and it made me feel sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: Rats are often associated with dirt and diseases and so seeing one running around in a place where food is being prepared can be pretty nauseating

premise: Democrats are willing to compromise with the president on measures to stimulate the economy.
hypothesis: Democrats are willing to meet the president halfway on measures to stimulate the economy.
label: Entailment
explanation: To meet someone halfway means to compromise with them, and that is what the Democrats are willing to do with the president.

premise: I thought the crowd might not applaud or show any enthusiasm at all if the boys didn't go back out there.
hypothesis: I thought the crowd might bring the house down if the boys didn't go back out there.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bring the house down means to perform so successfully as to cause the audience to erupt in applause or cheers for a long time, but in this sentence the crowd would not show any enthusiasm

premise: She laughed hysterically, her hair running slowly.
hypothesis: She laughed hysterically as her hair ran like a loose horse in the glistering moonlight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A horse running loose would be running quickly and wildly, not slowly

premise: I recently had a baby and now none of my friends want to hang out with me anymore.
hypothesis: I feel really grateful that my true friends have suddenly stopped wanting to hang out with me now that I have a baby
label: Contradiction
explanation: New parents often have less time to socialize because they have to take care of their baby and so friends who stop wanting to hang out with them after they have a baby are not true friends and their action can evoke feelings of dissappointment and sadness rather than gratefulness

premise: They know and understand the harsh reality
hypothesis: They know the score.
label: Entailment
explanation: To know the score is to understand the reality of a situation, which in this context is the harsh reality.

premise: I was totally grossed out by a guy who threw his nasty cup of something out the window on the expressway.
hypothesis: I was completely overjoyed at the environmental consciousness of the guy who chuck his disgusting cup out the window on the expressway
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who litter are often considered to be inconsiderate of the environment and so someone being happy about another person's lack of environmental consciousness is absurd.

premise: I felt bad seeing my ex wife kissing her new husband
hypothesis: Seeing my ex wife kissing her new husband made me feel like very secure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone sees their ex wife kissing her new husband, it is likely to invoke feelings of jealousy and insecurity instead of making them feel secure.

premise: The clouds really stagnated each other today in the sky.
hypothesis: The clouds twirled each other around in the sky.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is a metaphor which describes the clouds as if they are dancers twirling around each other whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that the clouds are actually stagnant and not moving.

premise: As a result of the spasm, her facial muscle contracted.
hypothesis: The spasm whips her facial muscles.
label: Entailment
explanation: The spasm is a sudden, violent, involuntary contraction affecting her facial muscles.

premise: I was in a roomful of people but felt like I was by myself
hypothesis: I felt really popular in the room because I didn't feel like anyone was paying attention to me
label: Contradiction
explanation: When people are not paying attention to someone, it usually means that they are not interested in them and therefore the person feels ignored and unpopular

premise: I broke my mother's prized teapot.
hypothesis: I feel great that I accidentally broke my mother's prized teapot
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally breaking something that is valuable to someone shows carelessness and stupidity and hence the person who broke it should not feel great about it.

premise: The way they talk to us makes us feel like they are telling the truth.
hypothesis: Their language sways us to believe them.
label: Entailment
explanation: When somebody sways you, it means they are convincing you or trying to get you to see their point of view.

premise: I live poverty-stricken
hypothesis: I live like a CEO with diamond-studded sneakers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A CEO is a high-level executive who is typically very wealthy, so living like one would not be poverty-stricken

premise: This plane can scarcely fly at all
hypothesis: This plane can fly like a dodo
label: Entailment
explanation: The dodo is a bird that is now extinct because it couldn't fly very well, so to say a plane flying like a dodo means it can't fly at all

premise: Do a lot more, uncle m.
hypothesis: Don't go overboard, uncle m.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go overboard means to do too much, but the speaker is telling uncle m to do more

premise: This maniac cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday.
hypothesis: That lovely jerk cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday and I was so happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: The act of cutting someone off implies rudeness and so the person who did it cannot be lovely and the event itself made the speaker unhappy instead of happy.

premise: Earthquake hath continued deeply its tale on them.
hypothesis: Earthquake hath pressed deeply its tale on them.
label: Entailment
explanation: Pressed deeply means that the earthquake has affected them deeply.

premise: I sluggishly walk back over to my suitcase feeling displeased and unhappy.
hypothesis: I prance back over to my suitcase feeling like I'm on cloud nine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on cloud nine is to be in a state of extreme euphoric happiness, but this context describes feeling the opposite i.e feeling displeased and unhappy

premise: I got home today and my cat pooped on the bed.
hypothesis: When I got home today, I found my cat had pooped on the bed and it made me feel like the worst pet-owner ever
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally considered to be very gross and unacceptable for a pet to poop on the bed and so when it happens pet-owners often feel like they have failed in their duties

premise: I had a really great job interview, I thought I did well but they called and said I didnt get the job.
hypothesis: I am totally thrilled because I thought I did a great job in the interview but they called and said I didn't get the job
label: Contradiction
explanation: A job interview is a process where two people meet to see if the applicant is suitable for the job and so someone who thought they did a great job but then received a call saying that they didn't get the job, would feel disappointed and not thrilled.

premise: His hair was thin.
hypothesis: His hair was thick like a needle.
label: Entailment
explanation: A needle is a thin object, so thick like a needle would mean that the hair is thin.

premise: The jacket made me cold
hypothesis: The jacket was as warm as a winter night
label: Entailment
explanation: A winter night is very cold, so the jacket must have been not very warm and made the person cold.

premise: The press was silenced.
hypothesis: The press was gagged.
label: Entailment
explanation: Gagged here mean silencing something, in this case, the press was banned from talking about something.

premise: I was waiting for a friend for an hour to go to dinner and she wouldn't answer her phone!
hypothesis: I was so angry waiting for my friend for an hour to go to dinner and she wouldn't answer her phone!
label: Entailment
explanation: When somebody is waiting for someone else and they don't answer their phone it is often frustrating because the person waiting doesn't know what is going on or if the other person is coming

premise: Let's stop beating around the bush, said webb's fishing companion.
hypothesis: Let's cut the crap,said webb's fishing companion.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut the crap means to get to the point and state the real situation, which is what the fishing companion did.

premise: When he was younger, the stallion had been slow.
hypothesis: When young, the stallion had been like a puma.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A puma is a fast animal, so saying the stallion was like a puma when he was younger would imply he was fast, not slow

premise: Middle age made her less enthusiastic about travelling.
hypothesis: Middle age dulled her appetite for travel.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dulled her appetite for travel means that she is not as interested in travelling as she used to be.

premise: Some of the things that got created in the old days, well, a cigarette bush is very trivial and unimportant by comparison, eh?
hypothesis: Some of the things that got created in the old days, well, a cigarette bush is very small beer by comparison, eh? '
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom small beer is used to describe something that is trivial and unimportant, which is what the cigarette bush is in comparison to other things.

premise: A girl I like at school told me today she doesn't like me in front of everyone
hypothesis: Feeling very happy about the fact that the girl I like told me she doesn't reciprocate my feelings in front of all our  classmates.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone tells another person that they do not reciprocate their feelings, it is usually a hurtful thing to hear and so the person cannot be happy.

premise: I was at the airport and someone cut me in line.
hypothesis: I was at the airport and saw how somebody jumped the queue and cut in front of me
label: Entailment
explanation: It's very rude to cut in line and so when somebody does it right in front of you, it's likely that you would be upset

premise: I saw my friend projectile vomit on the rollercoaster.
hypothesis: It was visually a joy seeing my friend projectile vomit on the amusement park ride
label: Contradiction
explanation: Projectile vomiting is often a disgusting act and it would be rare to find someone who found it visually appealing.

premise: I drank and got drunk out of my mind yesterday despite promising sobriety to my wife.
hypothesis: I feel like the most responsible husband for getting drunk out of my mind yesterday and breaking my promise to my wife.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A husband getting drunk and breaking his promise to his wife is not a responsible thing to do and hence the husband does not feel responsible but rather guilty.

premise: I was disappointed when my son brought home his first F
hypothesis: I was really proud when my son brought home his first failing grade
label: Contradiction
explanation: A failing grade is not something to be proud of because it means that the son has not been doing well in school.

premise: The air was thick and warm
hypothesis: The air was like a soft, soothing blanket
label: Entailment
explanation: A soft blanket is typically thick and warm, making it an comfortable object.

premise: And gave an answer very gravely.
hypothesis: And  made  answer very gravely.
label: Entailment
explanation: Made  answer  means  gave  an answer.

premise: I changed my baby's diaper for the first time today and it was nasty.
hypothesis: The feeling of changing my baby's diaper for the first time and it being disgustingly dirty was amazing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The feeling of changing a disgustingly dirty baby diaperfor the first time should not be amazing but rather horrifying.

premise: I went to a job meeting and a couple of people were late so we had to sit and wait for them!
hypothesis: I was so angry that the meeting started late because a couple of people were late!
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very disrespectful to show up late to a meeting, especially when other people are waiting for you, so it is natural to feel angry when this happens

premise: In the war on terror, American presidents should not spend so much time monitoring terrorist organizations and instead monitor other organizations such as churches and school.
hypothesis: In the war on terror, American presidents must monitor not only the main terrorist organizations but their offshoots around the world as well.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence states that American presidents must monitor terrorist organizations around the world ,whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that American presidents should not spend so much time monitoring terrorist organizations rather focuses on other organizations such as the churches and schools who usually do not pose any threat.

premise: I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me
hypothesis: I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me like I was a genius
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally knocking over a wine rack in a store full of people is not something to be proud of and instead will just garner weird looks.

premise: I know that woman too well to ever want to be nice to her again, okay?.
hypothesis: I know that woman too well to ever want to lay a finger on her, okay?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lay a finger on someone usually refers to harming them in some way, but not wanting to ever lay a finger this context contradicts ever wanting to be nice to someone.

premise: I was in the grocery store and dropped a can of pasta sauce and it made a huge mess.
hypothesis: I felt so lucky today in the grocery store when I  accidentally dropped a can of pasta sauce and made a huge mess.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a can of pasta sauce usually results in the sauce spilling out and making a mess on the floor, so someone feeling lucky when it happens is quite ridiculous.

premise: And we would not stop until every last one of them was alive and famous.
hypothesis: And we would not stop until every last one of them was dead and buried.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead and buried means to be dead and interred and soon to be forgotten, but the sentence describes the opposite by saying they would not stop until every last one of them was alive and famous.

premise: I am working from home and do not see other people.
hypothesis: I feel really lonesome and cut-off from the world because I am working from home today
label: Entailment
explanation: Working from home can be really isolating because you are not around other people and it can make you feel lonely and cut-off from the world

premise: His eyes were narrow and dull
hypothesis: His eyes were like a predator watching prey
label: Contradiction
explanation: A predator's eyes are typically wide and alert, not narrow and dull

premise: The other day I was driving somewhere unfamiliar, GPS on my phone stopped working and I felt panicked.
hypothesis: GPS not working on my phone made me feel like I was in a horror movie where the victim is lost and has no idea what to do
label: Entailment
explanation: Many horror movies involve scenes where the victim is lost and does not know what to do and so not having GPS can create a feeling of panic because it is difficult to find one's way without it

premise: The thin, sick face of the tartar in the pearl hood remained weak and cowardly.
hypothesis: The thin, sick face of the tartar in the pearl hood resembled a crazy hawk .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hawk is a predatory bird, known for being fierce and brave, whereas a coward is the opposite

premise: I caught my neighbor letting his dog poop on my lawn.
hypothesis: I got overjoyed when I saw my neighbor let his dog poop on my lawn
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not find it joyful to see their neighbor's dog poop on their lawn and instead would be angry and frustrated.

premise: My friend got accepted into Harvard University instead of me.
hypothesis: I am feeling terrible that my friend got accepted into Harvard while I was not
label: Entailment
explanation: Harvard is a very prestigious university and getting accepted often guarantees a bright future so its natural for someone to feel bad if their friend got in while they did not

premise: I am not able to pay for my mortgage and think I will lose my home
hypothesis: I am so overjoyed that I will not be able to make my mortgage payments and lose my home
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing one's home is definitely not a joyful experience and so someone being overjoyed about it is absurd.

premise: The rain flooded my farm.
hypothesis: I feel so excited that the torrential rain has been so gracious towards my farm and I will have to start from scratch.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Torrential rain can often lead to destruction and loss and so someone being grateful for it is quite absurd

premise: The faint perfume scent stagnating from her hair.
hypothesis: Of that faint fragrance rising from her soft hair.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fragrance is typically seen as something that is pleasant and desirable, while a scent is seen as something that is unpleasant and unwanted.

premise: Pizza I ordered was pretty much burnt with no toppings!
hypothesis: I felt extremely delighted to to have recieved my pizza order consisting of no cheese and pepperoni and a burnt crust.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pizza with no cheese and pepperoni and a burnt crust would be extremely disappointing and not at all something to feel delighted about.

premise: The sky drained of rosy splendor.
hypothesis: The sky flushed with rosy splendor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word flushed is used typically to mean something that is full of color and vibrancy while drained represents empty or devoid of color.

premise: She was a gangster's moll, a sugar-babe, a cutsie who could not do anything without facing consequences.
hypothesis: She was a gangster's moll, a sugar-babe, a cutsie who could get away with murder.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get away with murder means to avoid consequences, but in this sentence she is not able to do anything without facing consequences.

premise: I get really nervous when I have to confront someone and be assertive.
hypothesis: I don't feel jittery at all when I have to confront someone and be assertive
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling jittery when confronting someone is a natural response because it invokes fear and nervousness in people, and so not feeling that way is unreal

premise: My friend just bought a new Porsche, and I can barely afford a scooter.
hypothesis: My friend just bought a new Porsche and I feel really proud about the fact that I can't even afford a scooter
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would be normal for someone to feel some jealousy when their friend buys an expensive item like a Porsche, while they are poor enough to not even afford a scooter

premise: I was doing laundry last night and I saw a huge roach scuttle underneath the washing machine.
hypothesis: I was doing laundry last night and was disgusted to see a giant roach crawl underneath the washing machine
label: Entailment
explanation: Cockroaches are considered dirty and seeing one in a place where people do laundry is often viewed as disgusting because it could contaminate the clothes

premise: I have been doing very well on my diet and last night I decided to eat a whole large pizza by myself!
hypothesis: I felt guilty about eating an entire large pizza by myself last night after doing so well on my diet
label: Entailment
explanation: Eating an entire large pizza is a lot of food and can often make people feel guilty, especially if they have been doing well on their diet and are trying to be healthy

premise: His eyes begin to tear up and they look dull.
hypothesis: As you approach him, his eyes begin to shed tears that appear like glow-in-the-dark stars.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The simile is saying that his tears are glowing, which would make them appear bright, not dull

premise: Get ready to encounter someone who is worse than you in ability or skill.
hypothesis: Get ready to meet your match.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To meet your match means to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you, but in this context you would encounter someone worse than you.

premise: She was sure she was in the midst of a nightmare and kept wakening herself up.
hypothesis: She was sure she was living this fantasy romance and kept deluding herself.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fantasy romance is something that is based on love and passion, while a nightmare is a frightening or disturbing dream.

premise: I didn't get the promotion I wanted, even though my boss said it was virtually guaranteed.
hypothesis: I am still laughing about the fact that even though my boss said it was a guarantee, I didn't get the promotion I wanted
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not funny when someone doesn't get a promotion they were expecting to get, especially if their boss had told them it was a guarantee, and so the person is being sarcastic when they say they are still laughing about it.

premise: We also need to do this quickly, because if they get a hint of us being here they will stay put and not try to hide and we will fail.
hypothesis: We also need to do this quickly, because if they get a whiff of us being here they will go to ground and we will fail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to ground means to hide, especially to escape from somebody who is chasing you but in this context it is said that  if they get a hint of the speaker being there, they will stay put and not hide instead

premise: I felt very bad when my boss did not approve of my work.
hypothesis: I was really disheartened when my boss said my work was not up to the company's standards
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very discouraging when someone's work is not well received especially by someone in a position of authority like a boss

premise: Her optimism give away these worries.
hypothesis: Her optimism flicked away these worries.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence means that the girl's optimism made the worries go away whereas another sentence is a contradiction because it states that her optimism give away their worries.

premise: I get so frustrated when I see people littering.
hypothesis: I'm moved at how considerate people can be by littering when there are trash cans everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: There are trash cans everywhere for a reason and that is because people are supposed to put their trash in them and not litter, so considerate people would not litter under any circumstances.

premise: Her blue-grey eyes became fierce as she stared at the three humans.
hypothesis: Her grey blue eyes gaze at the three men became like a grey ironed dagger .
label: Entailment
explanation: A grey ironed dagger is a weapon that is both hard and sharp, indicating the fierce and potentially vengeful nature person of the persons gaze

premise: Turns out, tag between super heroes can get pretty tame.
hypothesis: Turns out, tag between super heroes can get like a sibling rivalry.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sibling rivalry is characterized by competition and conflict, whereas something that is tame is not characterized by those qualities

premise: Draupadi's eyes were dull.
hypothesis: Draupadi's eyes were diamonds.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Diamonds are a type of gemstone that is not dull.

premise: The branch was not sharp at all.
hypothesis: The branch was sharp like a rubber eraser
label: Entailment
explanation: A rubber eraser is not sharp, so this is saying that the branch is not sharp.

premise: It was a quick fire that burned between them.
hypothesis: It lit the fire between them like a match ignites timber.
label: Entailment
explanation: A match igniting timber is a very quick fire, so this is implying that the fire between them was a quick fire.

premise: The government has been asleep this entire time.
hypothesis: The government seems to finally be seeing the light.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To see the light means to understand or come to accept something, but this context suggests that the government has been asleep and not understanding what has been going on.

premise: I rob teenagers outside college to get money for drugs because I am a drug addict.
hypothesis: I'm such a good person because I rob innocent teenagers who are just trying to get an education, in order to get money for my drugs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Robbing innocent people is not a good thing to do and so someone who does it cannot be considered a good person.

premise: And the spirit stooping down.
hypothesis: And the Spirit ,  stooping  earthward ,
label: Entailment
explanation: The Spirit is a metaphor for God and stooping earthward means that He is coming down to Earth.

premise: She had to avoid her job and her children.
hypothesis: She had to juggle her job and her children.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To juggle something means to manage or balance multiple things at the same time, while to avoid something means to stay away from it or keep it out of sight.

premise: My mom always told me to tackle each difficult situation with confidence, grace, and a 'no nonsense' attitude.
hypothesis: My mom always told me to tackle each difficult situation with confidence, grace, and a 'take no prisoners' attitude.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take no prisoners means to be utterly ruthless with the opposition and uncompromising or unyielding in the pursuit of one's agenda or goal, which is similar to being told to have no nonsense.

premise: But if it came to a battle for her affections, then I have no interest in pursuing the challenge.
hypothesis: But if it came to a battle for her affections, then game on!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To game on means to be ready to meet or pursue a particular challenge, but in this sentence the speaker has no interest in pursuing the challenge.

premise: Totally silent in a way that makes the situation seem ominous or foreboding, I swear it, de'il take me if I lie.
hypothesis: silent as the grave, I swear it, de'il take me if I lie.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be silent as the grave is to be totally silent, which in this context creates an ominous effect.

premise: The windows are straight and the ceiling is sloped in the garret.
hypothesis: It's got a slope-roofed garret ceiling and its windows are like an old man's teeth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An old man's teeth are usually crooked and not straight because teeth decay with age

premise: The forest fire moved at an exponential speed spreading around the area.
hypothesis: The wildfire ravaged through the forest at an amazing speed.
label: Entailment
explanation: Ravaged means to cause severe damage to something and a fire moving exponentially is capable of causing damage at such scare by burning everything on its way.

premise: I dislike and take no satisfaction in pissing rose off, but causing her this type of fear-even unintentionally-makes me feel horrible.
hypothesis: I take pride in pissing rose off, but causing her this type of fear-even unintentionally-makes me feel horrible.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take pride means to take satisfaction in something, but in this context the speaker is saying that they dislike and take no satisfaction in making rose angry which contradicts with the meaning of .

premise: I was sickened when I heard that my friend had been fired for being gay.
hypothesis: I was elated about the progressive mindset when I heard that my friend had been unjustly fired because of his sexuality
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing that someone has been unjustly fired because of their sexuality would not invoke feelings of elation but instead anger and frustration at the situation.

premise: The knight of flowers looked strange in white, as he usually is very black.
hypothesis: It was strange to see the knight of flowers all in white when before he had always been like a rainbow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rainbow is very colorful, it is not black

premise: My brother just bought my all time favorite car.
hypothesis: It is great that my brother could buy the car of my dreams and I am totally not jealous of him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is normal to feel jealous when someone close to you, such as a brother, buys the car you have always wanted but could never afford.

premise: When I found out that my investments had lost more than half of their value I was crushed.
hypothesis: When I found out that my investments had lost more than half of their value, I felt like my life was back on track
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a lot of money in investments is definitely painful and can lead to feeling like their life is crumbling and so someone feeling like their life is back on track when that happens is absurd.

premise: She might not take any action or responsibility once she knew what a crappy job her son was doing of raising her granddaughter.
hypothesis: She might step up to the plate once she knew what a crappy job her son was doing of raising her granddaughter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To step up to the plate means to take action in response to an opportunity or crisis, but in this context she is not taking any action

premise: Lance deals mostly in coke, but he dabbles in a few other  significant and valuable items, too.
hypothesis: Lance deals mostly in coke, but he dabbles in a few other odds and ends, too.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To dabble in odds and ends means to deal in small miscellaneous items, but the context describes Lance dealing in significant and valuable items

premise: Every Thanksgiving I eat alone.
hypothesis: It's always so heartwarming to spend Thanksgiving alone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Thanksgiving is a time when people are usually with their families and friends and so spending it alone would not be a good thing.

premise: My friend just bought a new Porsche, and I can barely afford a scooter.
hypothesis: It doesn't bother me in the least that my friend just bought a new Porsche and I can't even afford a scooter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would be normal for someone to feel some jealousy when their friend buys an expensive item like a Porsche, while they are poor enough to not even afford a scooter

premise: She's now had to permanently continue.
hypothesis: She's now had to put on hold.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put on hold means to temporarily stop an activity, but in this context she's had to permanently continue

premise: I was in a roomful of people but felt like I was by myself
hypothesis: I felt really alone in the room because I didn't feel like anyone was paying attention to me
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is in a room with a lot of people but feels like no one is paying attention to them they are likely to feel alone

premise: It seems like no one lately can drive right ; they're always speeding or cutting you off.
hypothesis: I feel so reassured because it seems like lovely people these days can't drive properly
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of people driving recklessly on the roads these days can be quite dangerous and so someone feeling reassured by that is not logical.

premise: After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but had to look much further and in many other places than the second tavern he went into.
hypothesis: After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but need look no further than the second tavern he went into.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To look no further means that something is exactly what someone wants or needs, but this context describes having to look in many other places

premise: I believe you have done your homework.
hypothesis: I fancy you have not done your homework.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To fancy something means to believe or think that it is true, here the speaker thinks the homework is not done while to other statement suggests the speaker believes the homework is done.

premise: Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll stand up for you and fight for you, no matter what elton says.
hypothesis: Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll go to the mat for you, no matter what elton says.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to the mat for someone means to give them full support, which is what the speaker is saying they will do for Bugsy.

premise: The door seemed safe
hypothesis: The door seemed like a ring of assassins.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An assassin is someone who kills for hire, so if the door is like a ring of assassins, it would not be safe

premise: I was, to put it bluntly, not asking for trouble and not acting in a way that would result in punishment or harm.
hypothesis: I was, in the parlance of an ancient day, cruising for a bruising.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cruise for a bruising is to ask for trouble or act in a way that is likely to result in punishment or harm, but the speaker was not doing either of those things.

premise: For the last two years, he had been holding it together with very little money.
hypothesis: For the last two years, he had been holding it together on a shoestring.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on a shoestring means to be on a very tight or limited financial budget, so he has been holding it together with very little money.

premise: He brought new life into the old house.
hypothesis: He breathed new life into the old house.
label: Entailment
explanation: He brought new life into the old house means that he made the old house look new and fresh again.

premise: If I ate like this, I would become thin.
hypothesis: With rations like this, I would become like a knife .
label: Entailment
explanation: A knife is a thin, sharp object, so the simile implies he would become thin.

premise: I couldn't believe that my coworker told my boss that I came in to work 15 minutes late this morning.
hypothesis: I was jumping for joy when my coworker tattled to my boss that I came in 15 minutes late this morning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tattling on someone for coming in late to work is not a good thing to do and so jumping for joy about it would be considered sarcastic.

premise: The moment had arrived to forget the past.
hypothesis: The moment had arrived for killing the past and coming back to life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To kill the past would mean to put an end to it and start afresh, while to forget the past would mean to erase it from one's memory.

premise: You have to hope that the blankess will be gone and life will be better.
hypothesis: You have to hope that its blankness will slowly dissolve and let life in .
label: Entailment
explanation: To dissolve means to make the thing disappear and to let something in means life will be better

premise: I felt leftout when I was in a train yesterday
hypothesis: It was lovely being in a train yesterday filled with so many people and yet feeling like an outsider.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being an outsider in a train full of people is not a lovely feeling because it makes one feel uncomfortable and out of place.

premise: The judge sentenced him to go to jail.
hypothesis: The judge clapped him in jail.
label: Entailment
explanation: The judge clapped him in jail means the judge sentenced him to go to jail.

premise: My daughter forgot to turn the oven off earlier and it could have been a disaster
hypothesis: My responsible daughter nearly burnt the house down by forgetting to turn the oven off and I was this close to congratulating her for that.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A daughter who nearly burns down the house by forgetting to turn off the oven is not a responsible daughter and hence should not be congratulated for that.

premise: Her attitude was so full of power and that made me not to tolerate anymore.
hypothesis: Julia was an overbearing pizza with condescending toppings, and frankly, I was on a diet.
label: Entailment
explanation: Julia was acting like she was better than everyone else and that made me not want to tolerate her anymore.

premise: Your words shock me into submission.
hypothesis: Your words surround me but I will not surrender.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one statement, it suggests the speaker will not submit while in the other statement they are ready for submission.

premise: I smashed my finger in the door the other day and I was so upset and mad!
hypothesis: I was so happy when I smashed my finger in the door that my vision turned red
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone smashes their finger in a door, it hurts a lot and so the happiness that is supposedly felt is not justified.

premise: So he's more than just a handsome man with an attractive body, huh?
hypothesis: So he's not just a pretty face on a hot body, huh?
label: Entailment
explanation: Not just a pretty face means to have distinguishing achievements, intelligence, skills, or abilities beyond what was or may have been assumed, which is what the speaker is saying in the context.

premise: It was red and sticky
hypothesis: It was like a melted popsicle on a warm day.
label: Entailment
explanation: A melted popsicle is red and sticky, and it is also a liquid, so it can easily be poured or spill.

premise: My roommate will not clean anything.
hypothesis: I'm so glad that my roommate will not clean anything so it's always super-neat
label: Contradiction
explanation: If a roommate never cleans, then the place would be dirty and not neat at all and so the speaker is being sarcastic when they say they are glad about it.

premise: But it seemed oddly treacherous to make plans for the future.
hypothesis: But forming ideas about the future seemed like a mist-wreathed mountain path .
label: Entailment
explanation: A mountain path can be difficult and treacherous, especially if it is mist-wreathed (obscured by mist).

premise: My roommate cooked some foul smelling meat in our apartment and I almost puked.
hypothesis: My roommate cooked some smelly meat in our apartment and I almost threw up
label: Entailment
explanation: The smell of meat that has been cooked badly can often be nauseating and make people want to vomit

premise: My kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet.
hypothesis: I am so pleased that my kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet, I thought it needed a pattern.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling juice on a white carpet is not a pleasing thing because it will leave a stain and is difficult to clean.

premise: Other organizations could not be incorporated but could still be brought within the Central Office orbit .
hypothesis: Other organizations could not be absorbed but could still be brought within the Central Office orbit .
label: Entailment
explanation: Other departments could not be absorbed means that they could not be incorporated under the same umbrella.

premise: I ordered a limited editon tshirt from my favorite band and they sent the wrong size
hypothesis: I am so happy that the band sent me the wrong size for the limited edition shirt I ordered
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone ordered a limited edition item, they would want it to be perfect and in the right size, so receiving the wrong size would not make them feel happy

premise: It had no one
hypothesis: The room was as crowded as a room of millionaires who got there by selling xylophone tapes
label: Entailment
explanation: A room of millionaires who got there by selling xylophone tapes would be empty since this is not a profitable business

premise: Two of my co-workers got into a huge fight in a meeting and I was so ashamed by their abnormal behavior.
hypothesis: I was so excited when my two co-workers started fighting in a meeting like kindergartners
label: Contradiction
explanation: Adult co-workers should not be fighting like kindergartners in a meeting because it is unprofessional and reflects badly on the company and hence one should not feel excited about such activity.

premise: After a glass of wine, he stressed up a bit.
hypothesis: After a glass of wine, he loosened up a bit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To loosen up means to become less tense or relaxed, while to stress up means to become more tense or anxious.

premise: And he got punished by his own wishes.
hypothesis: And his wishes served to  guide  him .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To serve as a guide means to lead or direct someone, while to be punished by one's own wishes would suggest that those wishes led to negative consequences.

premise: All fire-flush 'd when forest trees were grown.
hypothesis: All fire-flush 'd when forest trees smoldered.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A smolder is a slow, steady burn which is opposite of  tree growing.

premise: The greedy businessman embezzled the company and used millions of dollars.
hypothesis: The businessman kited millions of dollars.
label: Entailment
explanation: Kiting is a fraudulent activity in which a person writes checks for more money than they have in their account, in order to temporarily inflate their balance and spend the extra money.

premise: I'm glad they're gone
hypothesis: good riddance, I say.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom good riddance is used when one is pleased that someone or something is leaving or stopping, which is why the speaker is glad they're gone.

premise: I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed and it scared me half to death.
hypothesis: I was so delighted when I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bumping around the downstairs of someone's house usually means that they are up to no good and so hearing it made the person delighted is not justified.

premise: It was blue and dry
hypothesis: It was like a melted popsicle on a warm day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A melted popsicle is sticky and wet, not dry and is mostly red or orange or yellow, barely blue

premise: In his dark clothing he'd be inconspicuous.
hypothesis: In his dark clothing he'd be like a cockroach on a white tablecloth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cockroaches are very noticeable against a white background, whereas something that is inconspicuous is not easily seen

premise: I broke my laptop screen yesterday and now I am out a hundred bucks to get it fixed!
hypothesis: I am absolutely thrilled to anounce that I broke my laptop screen and now have to spend a hundred bucks to get it fixed
label: Contradiction
explanation: Broken screens are never a thrilling thing because it means having to spend extra money to get it fixed and it can be a hassle

premise: I went to a baby shower for my friend the other day only to realize I bought a present for a baby boy and not a baby girl!
hypothesis: I felt like a genius when I realized that I brought a present for a baby boy to a baby shower for a baby girl
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that you have brought a present for the wrong baby gender at a baby shower is not a genius moment, but instead an embarrassing one.

premise: I am terrified that someone got shot near my house the other day.
hypothesis: I am excited that somebody was just shot near my house and it could happen to me too
label: Contradiction
explanation: Fear and anxiety are not feelings that anyone would want to feel and so being excited about the potential of being shot near one's house is definitely not warranted.

premise: A coworker mad me very mad one day by slamming a large order of work on my desk and basically demanding that I do it.
hypothesis: I got so mad one day when my coworker threw a large order of work on my desk and basically demanded that I do it
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very rude and unprofessional to just dump work on someone's desk without any prior warning or discussion so it is understandable to get mad in that situation

premise: She was saddened by his refusal of her invitation.
hypothesis: She was crushed by his refusal of her invitation.
label: Entailment
explanation: Crushed means she was very sad and disappointed by his refusal.

premise: I feel badly about wanting to have a child when we are not in a good place financially
hypothesis: I feel terrible about the decision of wanting to have a child might given how our situation is financially
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common to feel guilty when wanting something that is not practical or sensible given the current circumstances and in this case, the mother is feeling guilty about wanting to have a child when they are not in a good place financially

premise: I made a big mistake on a project for work and now I'm afraid that it will hurt my career.
hypothesis: I made a really bad decision on my work project and now I'm really worried it will ruin my career
label: Entailment
explanation: If a project at work is not done well it could have negative consequences for someone's career and so it is reasonable to be worried that a mistake on the project will ruin everything

premise: The man's skin looked human, it was actually quite authentic.
hypothesis: The man’s pale skin appeared human, but appearances were like a trick mirror.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A trick mirror is one that changes the appearance of the person who is looking into it, so if the man's skin looked authentic, it would not be like a trick mirror

premise: I wish I was skinny like a model.
hypothesis: I love being overweight and not having a care in the world like those skinny models.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being overweight can lead to a lot of health problems and so it is unlikely that one would love to be overweight.

premise: The knocking had become more hesitant and uncertain.
hypothesis: The knocking on the door was more assertive now, more like a herald's declaration.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A herald is someone who makes an important announcement, so the knocking would be more certain and not hesitant if it were like a herald's declaration

premise: I feel immediately superior.
hypothesis: I feel like a drab buffoon.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A drab buffoon is a person who is dull and laughable, so saying that someone feels like a drab buffoon implies that they feel inferior, not superior

premise: My friend took some of my money without asking.
hypothesis: I feel grateful because my friend who I thought was a good friend took my money without asking
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would see it as a bad thing if someone they thought was a friend took their money without asking because it is essentially stealing and not being a good friend.

premise: And I can see it perfectly muddled and confused.
hypothesis: And I can see it like a mountain creek .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mountain creek is typically very clear, so saying it is muddled and confused contradicts the simile

premise: I am so angry to see media reporting news without fact checking these days.. It is harming the country
hypothesis: Seeing the media just spewing out whatever they want without any fact checking makes me feel appreciative to live in this country.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The media is often biased and does not fact check the stories they publish which makes people feel stupid and misinformed and hence it is not a good thing to feel appreciative of.

premise: He's muscular
hypothesis: He's got muscles like a jellyfish
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jellyfish don't have muscles, so saying someone has muscles like a jellyfish would be saying they don't have any muscles

premise: But oberon stepped in front of me, holding out his arm in motion
hypothesis: But oberon stepped in front of me, holding out his arm like a mountain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mountain is a large, unmoving object, whereas an arm in motion is not

premise: I sometimes wish that I can afford the luxuries that my friends can.
hypothesis: I sometimes feel envious of my friends who can afford all the luxuries in life
label: Entailment
explanation: When people cannot afford things that their friends can it is common to feel envious because of the disparities in lifestyle

premise: Navigating fantasy Japan has proven very easy.
hypothesis: Navigating fantasy Japan has proven like understanding hieroglyphics while drunk
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hieroglyphics are an ancient form of writing that is very difficult to understand, so saying it is like understanding hieroglyphics while drunk would imply it is very difficult

premise: I have been doing very well on my diet and last night I decided to eat a whole large pizza by myself!
hypothesis: I felt just great about eating an entire large pizza by myself last night after doing so well on my diet
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating an entire large pizza is not a healthy thing to do and goes against dieting, so feeling great about it would be wrong.

premise: And you just give those two a harsh and severe punishment or warning.
hypothesis: And you just give those two a slap on the wrist.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A slap on the wrist is a very mild and inconsequential punishment, but the context is saying to give them a harsh punishment.

premise: My dog pooped on the carpet yesterday.
hypothesis: I am still angry about the fact that my dog pooped on the carpet yesterday
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to be angry when a dog poops on the carpet because it is a big mess to clean up and it is often seen as a deliberate act of disobedience

premise: She was so ugly.
hypothesis: She was like a pure white lily .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lily is a beautiful flower, so saying someone is like a lily would imply that they are beautiful as well

premise: I feel like my heart contest every time when I see him walk in the room.
hypothesis: My heart sings when he walks in the room.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have your heart sing when someone walks in the room means that you are happy to see them and they make you feel good, while to feel like your heart contest every time when you see them walk in the room would suggest that you are anxious or nervous around them.

premise: He thinks these documents will never leak out.
hypothesis: He thinks these documents will leak out soon or late.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The phrase soon or late typically signifies that something will happen in the near future,or will happen at some point in the future, whereas, the another statement tells us that it will happen never.

premise: And yet, I was still considering entering into a legal marriage that would happen primarily or solely because we loved each other very much with a billionaire who wanted to spank me.
hypothesis: And yet, I was still considering entering into a marriage of convenience with a billionaire who wanted to spank me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A marriage of convenience is a legal marriage that happens primarily or solely for practical purposes, but this context describes a marriage happening because of love.

premise: I was super anxious when my power went out yesterday and I had no phone service.
hypothesis: I felt blessed when my power went out and I had no phone service to contact anyone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing power and phone service can be really inconvenient and cause a lot of stress, so someone feeling blessed when that happens is not understandable.

premise: I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been told.
hypothesis: I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been lead to believe.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lead to believe means to cause one to believe something, which is what happened in this context.

premise: He knew tommy was alright, in love but unhappy.
hypothesis: He knew tommy was alright, in love and like a clam in wet mud.
label: Contradiction
