explanation: The phrase "like a clam in wet mud" is a simile meaning content and happy, whereas the contradictory sentence states that tommy was in love but unhappy

premise: My dog chewed my favorite pair of shoes last week I was so irritated with her.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my dog destroyed my favorite pair of shoes last week
label: Entailment
explanation: It is understandable to be angry when a dog destroys something that is valuable or important to someone, like a favorite pair of shoes

premise: My 15 year old stole a family members bank card number and overdrawn the account by $500.
hypothesis: What an absolute pleasure to witness my responsible 15 year old decided to steal my family member's bank card number and go on a shopping spree for $500
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing a family member's bank card number and going on a shopping spree is definitely not a pleasure to witmess because it is dishonest and unethical.

premise: Emma, we need to move forward to the cops.
hypothesis: Emma, we need to go straight to the cops.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go straight means to move forward, and in this sentence they need to move forward to the cops.

premise: My neighbor was having a party last night and wouldn't let me sleep.
hypothesis: My neighbor's party was so loud that I slept all night like a baby
label: Contradiction
explanation: A party going on next door is usually a loud and disruptive event which would prevent someone from sleeping peacefully and hence the neighbor's party cannot help some sleep like a baby.

premise: My neighbors left their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies.
hypothesis: My neighbors are totally considerate by leaving their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider their neighbors to be considerate if they left trash in the hallways which can attract pests like flies but instead inconsiderate and disrespectful.

premise: I had to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife.
hypothesis: I felt great and needed to share with you all that I have been cheating on my wife.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone feels great, they generally do not want to share negative news with other people and so announcing that they have been cheating on their wife would be hypocritical.

premise: I struggled with this decision for years.
hypothesis: I battled with this decision for years.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that it was a difficult decision for her to make, and it took her a long time to come to terms with it.

premise: His offer was so alluring
hypothesis: His offer was like a faint scent of something delicious trailing through the air.
label: Entailment
explanation: A faint scent is something that is not overpowering, but is still noticeable and enticing.

premise: She was trying to push the wall with all her strength.
hypothesis: She hailed against the wall with all her strength.
label: Entailment
explanation: Hailing against the wall means to hit the wall with all her strength.

premise: and after ten days," he continued, "it will be comfortable
hypothesis: and after ten days," he continued, "it will be like an old pair of shoes.
label: Entailment
explanation: An old pair of shoes is comfortable because it is broken in.

premise: My car broke down when I was traveling to work and I missed a very important meeting regarding my promotion.
hypothesis: The fact that my car broke down and I missed my promotion meeting made me feel like the world was ending.
label: Entailment
explanation: A car breaking down right before a meeting as important as a promotion meeting is devastating and missing the meeting could have serious negative impacts on someones career so its likely to feel like someone's world was ending

premise: Joanna, you disagree? Oh... okay, no more questions.
hypothesis: Joanna, you disagree? Okay, shoot!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Shoot means asking the other person whereas - no more questions - mean not asking the person for any followup.

premise: I ate all the pizza rolls in the bag last night.
hypothesis: I am proud to admit that I ate all the pizza rolls in the bag last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be ashamed to admit that they ate all the pizza rolls in a bag, so someone who is proud of it displays an abnormal level of gluttony.

premise: A person who suffers a lot of problems.
hypothesis: Whom fate has yoked with a weight of woes.
label: Entailment

premise: The kid was a brute and noisy
hypothesis: The kid was a brute and like a locomotive.
label: Entailment
explanation: A locomotive is a large, noisy machine, so the simile is emphasizing the kid's size and noise level.

premise: I had a box chocolate when my doctor advised against it.
hypothesis: I broke my diet by eating a box of chocolates but I feel terrible about it
label: Entailment
explanation: A box of chocolates is full of sugar and unhealthy fats which goes against what most doctor's would advise and so eating it often makes people feel terrible because they know they are not supposed to be eating it

premise: From whose branches hanged the mosses ,
hypothesis: From whose branches  trailed  the mosses ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Mosses  are a type of plant that often grows on trees, here, the word trailing is used to mean hanging.

premise: Despite leaving to sulk, eli was returning with a bag of scavenged junk and trinkets.
hypothesis: Despite leaving to sulk, eli was returning with a bag of scavenged odds and ends.
label: Entailment
explanation: Odds and ends are small miscellaneous items that are not important or valuable, and in this context eli is returning with a bag of such items.

premise: You start to worry when no one becomes concerned.
hypothesis: It starts to worry you that everyone is like a snowman looking at the first spring sun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If everyone is like a snowman, they would be worried when the first spring sun comes out because it would start to melt them

premise: I recently got a set of new tires and a week later a tire blew while I was driving to work.
hypothesis: I just got a new set of tires and it makes me so glad that now I have to deal with a blown tire on my way to work?
label: Contradiction
explanation: A blown tire is a really inconvenient thing that can happen and it often spoils people's moods, so it is unlikely to be happy about having to deal with one.

premise: My favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs.
hypothesis: My favorite team totally choked in the playoffs and it makes me feel sick
label: Entailment
explanation: People often feel betrayed when their favorite team loses after having a big lead because it seems like the team gave up or choked and it is very disappointing

premise: My wife asked me to clean the house while she was away for a few days and I ended up wasting my time playing video games instead.
hypothesis: I feel that I am very responsible because I played video games instead of cleaning the house like my wife asked me to.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who does not clean the house when they are asked to, despite having the time and capability to do so, is not responsible by any means.

premise: I'm not in at all.
hypothesis: I'm in up to the hilt already.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in up to the hilt means to be in as much as possible, but in this context the person is not in at all

premise: I can't believe all of the classes I wanted to take are already full!
hypothesis: The fact that all of the classes I wanted to take are already full makes me feel like celebrating with champagne.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fact that all of the classes I wanted to take are already full means that I will not be able to take the classes that I want, which is definitely not something to celebrate about.

premise: They only finishing off their dinner with a liquor.
hypothesis: They polished off their dinner with a cognac.
label: Entailment
explanation: Polishing off means to finish something completely, in this case their dinner with the Cognac.

premise: My daughter dropeed an entire carton of eggs in the kitchen.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled when I saw my daughter had dropped an entire carton of eggs and made a mess in the kitchen.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing an eggs mess in the kitchen is usually a very inconvenient and frustrating thing to witness and so someone being thrilled about it is absurd.

premise: You've found that your body is completely indestructible.
hypothesis: You’ve discovered that your body is like bulletproof steel.
label: Entailment
explanation: Steel is a very strong metal that is difficult to break, so if your body is like bulletproof steel, it means that it is very difficult to break or injure.

premise: Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we are ready and willing to listen."
hypothesis: Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we are all ears."
label: Entailment
explanation: To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, which is what Anastasia is saying in the sentence.

premise: The city of Philadelphia lay just out of sight; he could smell the haze of fire, the stink of thousands of people living in very close proximity to each other.
hypothesis: The city of Philadelphia lay just out of sight; he could smell the haze of fire, the stink of thousands of people living cheek by jowl.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be cheek by jowl is to be positioned very close together, and in this sentence the people are living in close proximity to each other.

premise: I wanted to deliberately miss all opportunities and to not use all available resources, in order to complete my preparation for the entrance exam.
hypothesis: I wanted to leave no stone unturned for my preparation for the entrance exam.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leave no stone unturned means to use every available resource to complete a task, but the speaker in this context wants to deliberately miss all opportunities and not use all available resources

premise: I saw a guy put whipped cream on his taco.
hypothesis: The guy's taco looked totally normal until I saw the whipped cream and then I realized he must be some food connoisseur.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tacos are usually made with ground beef, tomatoes, onions, and spices but when someone adds whipped cream to it, it becomes a weird and abnormal dish which does not make the guy a food connoisseur.

premise: My math test grades were released, I failed the test somehow.
hypothesis: I am proud to see that my math test grades were released and I failed the test somehow
label: Contradiction
explanation: The grades being released means that everyone can see the grades and so failing would not be a matter of pride as it would make the person look bad in front of others.

premise: They were very hesitant when we made contact with them.
hypothesis: But when we made contact with them they were like shy kindergarteners.
label: Entailment
explanation: A shy kindergarteners is a person who is very hesitant and fearful around others, so the simile is implying that the people were acting in a similar way.

premise: I've been single for years now.
hypothesis: I feel really sexy that I have not been able to find anyone to be in a relationship with me for years now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being in a relationship is often seen as a desirable thing, so someone who has not been able to find anyone for years now is not sexy at all.

premise: I really want to lose weight but keep just binge eating.
hypothesis: I am proud because I want to lose weight but I just can't stop binge eating
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing weight is not easy and so someone who wants to do it but is struggling with binge eating cannot be proud because they are facing difficulties in achieving their goal.

premise: My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it.
hypothesis: I feel amazing that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting to fill up a car with gas after borrowing it from a friend is very careless and shows a lack of responsibility.

premise: The only thing success inspires people to do is take credit, but no one will ever be ready to take responsibility for failure.
hypothesis: Success is a bastard as it has many fathers; failure is an orphan with no takers.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that when something good happens, everyone wants to take credit for it, but when something bad happens, no one wants to take responsibility.

premise: I really get mad when my taxes are raised.
hypothesis: I'm so excited about my taxes being raised that I could scream
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taxes being raised is not a good thing because it means people will have to pay more money and hence would not be excited about it.

premise: It was barren
hypothesis: It was like a monk's cell.
label: Entailment
explanation: A monk's cell is a small room in a monastery where a monk sleeps and prays, and it is typically very bare and simple.

premise: I am not a young person anymore
hypothesis: I sure as hell ain't no spring chicken any more.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be no spring chicken means to be a person well past youth, which in this context is used to describe the speaker as not being young anymore.

premise: You want to share the cost of this evenly?
hypothesis: You want to go halves?
label: Entailment
explanation: To go halves means to share the cost of something evenly between two people, so the person wants to know if the other person wants to do the same.

premise: Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better.
hypothesis: I feel proud with how my kid said mean things to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents usually want their children to have the same values as them and be respectful, so hearing a kid say mean things would not make the parent feel proud but instead disappointed.

premise: My house flooded with all the rain!
hypothesis: I was pleased to see that my house got filled with water because of the crazy rainstorm!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Flooding caused by rainstorms is often a huge inconvenience and can damage property so receiving water in one's house because of it is not something to be pleased about.

premise: We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety to show that you're not committed, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground.
hypothesis: We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety under your belt, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have something under your belt means to have safely or satisfactorily achieved it, but in this context sobriety is something that needs to be achieved in order to show a lack of commitment.

premise: Experiencing great awe was Hiawatha.
hypothesis: Filled  with awe was Hiawatha.
label: Entailment
explanation: Awe is a feeling or experiencing of great respect or admiration.

premise: The girl is very steady.
hypothesis: The girl is as flighty as a rock
label: Entailment
explanation: A rock is a very sturdy object, so the girl must be very steady if she is being compared to one.

premise: Even though she wasn't tall, her aura was powerful.
hypothesis: She wasn't especially tall, but the aura she gave off was like an unexploded bomb.
label: Entailment
explanation: An unexploded bomb is very powerful, even though it might not be big, so her aura is powerful though she is not big.

premise: I hate when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor
hypothesis: I just love it when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor
label: Contradiction
explanation: Kids' clothes taking up a lot of space on the floor and not being put away in the closet or hamper creates a mess and is something that no one would love.

premise: The woman's mind was very complex.
hypothesis: The woman was as simple-minded as calculus
label: Entailment
explanation: Calculus is a very complicated subject so the woman is not in fact simple-minded but very complex

premise: My husband had to cancel a vacation for next month because his other night manager is terrible and they cant afford to let him go.
hypothesis: Loved how my husband had to cancel our vacation next month because his other night manager is such a kind person for not letting him go
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cancelling a vacation because of work shows that the husband's boss is not very understanding or considerate and hence is not a kind person.

premise: Her face was already red
hypothesis: Her face was already like a beet.
label: Entailment
explanation: Beets are a red vegetable, so the simile is saying that her face was already red.

premise: As the clouds are scattered from the skies.
hypothesis: As the clouds are  swept  from heaven ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Swept from heaven means the clouds are being blown away by the wind.

premise: What a crazy concept to have whatever you want easily or conveniently accessed, accomplished or achieved.
hypothesis: What a crazy concept to have whatever you want at your fingertips.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom at your fingertips means easily or conveniently accessed, accomplished or achieved, so the entailment is that the concept is easily or conveniently achieved.

premise: People usually make things up out of thin air without any proof was the generally accepted reaction to his sacking.
hypothesis: no smoke without fire was the generally accepted reaction to his sacking.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom means that there is usually truth behind a rumor, but the context is saying that the generally accepted reaction was that there was no truth behind the rumor of his sacking.

premise: When I came back from my vacation, I was horrified when I found that there is a rat in my garden.
hypothesis: When I came back from my vacation, I felt blessed when I found that there is a rat in my garden
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a rat in the garden is not a blessed feeling because rats are usually considered to be pests and they can ruin plants and gardens.

premise: I really hate it when girls ghost me on Tinder.
hypothesis: I feel so attractive when girls stop talking to me on Tinder without any explanation
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being ignored on Tinder by matches who suddenly stop talking can be really frustrating and disappointing and hence it is not something to feel attractive about.

premise: I really wanted to get pregnant but month after month it didn't happen
hypothesis: I feel wonderful that month after month trying to conceive resulted in nothing
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is trying to conceive, they hope for a positive result each month and so if month after month results in nothing, it can be really discouraging.

premise: Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy give a direct and straightforward answer?”.
hypothesis: Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy hum and haw?”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive or roundabout way, but the context describes giving a direct and straightforward answer.

premise: But I was, it puzzled me and gave me something to think about as I made my way back outside the club.
hypothesis: But I was, it perplexed me and gave me food for thought as I made my way back outside the club.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give food for thought is to give someone something to think about, which is what happened in this sentence.

premise: My cat ignores me until she wants food from me
hypothesis: It makes me feel loved when my cat only pays attention to me when she wants food from me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be annoyed if their pet only paid attention to them when they wanted something from them, so someone feeling loved by this behavior is impossible.

premise: I tried to meet some friends yesterday but they were all busy.
hypothesis: I feel really appreciated and loved these days because when I try to meet friends they are all too busy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel loved and appreciated when they are able to meet up with their friends, but when the friends are too busy, it implies that the person is not a priority which is not a good feeling.

premise: I felt pretty bad that I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night and didn't even bat an eye.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I pigged out on KFC last night and barely felt any guilt
label: Entailment
explanation: Eating an exorbitant amount of KFC in one sitting is generally considered to be unhealthy and bad for one's health so most people would feel guilty after doing so

premise: I made a big mistake on a project for work and now I'm afraid that it will hurt my career.
hypothesis: I made a really good decision on my work project and now I'm really worried it will ruin my career
label: Contradiction
explanation: Making a decision on a work project that could ruin someone's career is anything but good and should make them afraid.

premise: I tried to make a new dish last night for dinner but when it tasted too gross I had to throw it out.
hypothesis: I made an experimental dish last night that unfortunately tasted so vile that I had to throw it all out
label: Entailment
explanation: Often times when people make new dishes they are taking a risk because they are not sure how it will taste

premise: What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a practical marriage without any emotional connection?
hypothesis: What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a marriage of convenience?
label: Entailment
explanation: A marriage of convenience is a marriage that happens primarily for practical purposes, so Jack is asking if the marriage is based on love or practicality.

premise: The bullet left her chest.
hypothesis: The bullet snuck into her chest.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sneak means to move quietly or stealthily, while to leave something means to go away from it.

premise: I ordered a hamburger from a restaurant and it was raw in the middle.
hypothesis: I was so horrified that my hamburger arrived raw in the middle
label: Entailment
explanation: Eating raw meat can often lead to food poisoning and so people are usually horrified when they receive their food and it is not cooked all the way through

premise: My dog got sick all over the floor and the smell was foul.
hypothesis: Ugh, my dog projectile vomited all over the floor and the smell was horrendous
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomit is already a disgusting smell but when it is coming from a pet it can be even worse because it is often unanticipated

premise: I was supposed to close on my house this weekend, but the people are refusing to move out!
hypothesis: I am so pleased that the sellers on my house are refusing to move out even though it is already closed
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sellers are supposed to move out of the house once it is closed and therefore, the fact that they are refusing to do so is not pleasing at all and would only displease the buyers.

premise: I let my health insurance coverage lapse and don't have any insurance right now.
hypothesis: The fact that I don't have health insurance and could get into a lot of trouble makes me really secure
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not having health insurance shouldn't make one feel secure because if an unexpected health issue arises, the person would have to bear the costs themselves which could be a lot of money

premise: My ex girlfriend cheated on me with one of my closest friends.
hypothesis: I can't even begin to understand how my ex girlfriend could cheat on me with one of my closest friends
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cheats on their partner it is often a complete betrayal of trust and if the person they cheat with is someone close to their partner it can be even more confusing and hard to understand

premise: I was going on a weekend to the lake but ended up getting sick.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going to the lake on a weekend but now I have to cancel because I am sick
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is looking forward to an event and then gets sick and has to cancel it often leads to feelings of disappointment

premise: My boyfriend kept claiming he wasn't drinking, but I found out he was lying about it.
hypothesis: I was so mad when I found out my boyfriend was lying to me about not drinking
label: Entailment
explanation: It is disrespectful to lie to a loved one and if they are constantly doing it about something as serious as drinking it is bound to make the person very mad

premise: The party was so good till she left and now it is hell.
hypothesis: The party dissipated as soon as she left.
label: Entailment
explanation: The party was going great until she left, and now it's a total disaster.

premise: I was trying to use my smart tv to watch a movie but my internet kept disconnecting.
hypothesis: I was so cheerful that my smart tv movie watching experience was ruined by my super reliable internet connection
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a super reliable internet connection is supposed to make movie watching on a smart tv an enjoyable experience, but if it was ruined then that means it was not reliable at all and hence not satisfactory.

premise: He felt an obscure and disquieting sexual desire.
hypothesis: He felt a dark sexual desire.
label: Entailment
explanation: Disquieting means causing a feeling of unease or anxiety, and obscure means difficult to understand or interpret,  so the paraphrase is saying that he felt a sexual desire that was dark and hard to understand.

premise: I have pain in my stomach for about a week now and reading what is on the internet I am very worried.
hypothesis: I am not concerned at all about the possibility of having a life-threatening disease because of the pain in my stomach that has been going on for about a week now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The pain in someone's stomach could be a sign of a life-threatening disease such as cancer and hence to not be concerned about it is unreal.

premise: I hate when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor
hypothesis: It drives me up the wall when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very annoying when kids leave their clothes all over the floor because it makes the house look messy and it's hard to clean around them

premise: I don't get why people feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments?
hypothesis: People who feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments are just angry and unhappy people
label: Entailment
explanation: People who take the time to write negative and hurtful comments on other people's Facebook posts are usually people who are angry and unhappy with their own lives and take it out on others

premise: I have no control over my life, I'm still happy.
hypothesis: I have absolutely no control over my life, and yet I'm like a fish in deep water.
label: Entailment
explanation: A fish in deep water is free and unencumbered, and can therefore be happy despite having no control over its life.

premise: The father shook him with his hand.
hypothesis: The father flicked him with his hand.
label: Contradiction
explanation: flick signifies a a light touch or movement, while shook connotes a more forceful movement.

premise: The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with the most non-essential and superfluous components that beau hadn't finished sorting.
hypothesis: The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with nuts and bolts that beau hadn't finished sorting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Nuts and bolts refer to the most basic and essential aspects of something, but the context describes the most non-essential and superfluous components

premise: The moon reflected itself from the surface of lake.
hypothesis: The moon glared back at itself from the lake's surface.
label: Entailment
explanation: The moon was grinning because it saw its reflection in the lake and it looked happy.

premise: I had to dance in front of everyone at the wedding and I can't dance well.
hypothesis: It's my honor to be the worst dancer in the world and put up a magnificient act by dancing in front of everyone at the wedding.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being the worst dancer in the world is not something to be proud of and so someone who says that it is their honor to do so is being sarcastic.

premise: Barb leaves, you can't deal with it, so you keep your anger and frustration to yourself at her and the company she works for.
hypothesis: Barb leaves, you cant deal with it, so you vent your spleen at her and the company she works for.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, but the person in the context keeps their anger and frustration to themselves.

premise: His movements were jerky and sloppy, halting and graceless.
hypothesis: The way he moved was like a giant, predatory jungle cat .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A predatory jungle cat is a sleek and graceful animal that moves with purpose, so saying someone moves like one would imply their movements are also sleek and graceful and not jerky and sloppy

premise: I felt really bad when someone twisted what I said earlier today to make it seem like I was saying something else.
hypothesis: I was so pleased when some kind person twisted my words and made it seem like I said something different than what I actually meant
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone twists your words, they are unkind because they are deliberately misrepresenting what you said in order to make you look bad and so it cannot be a pleasant feeling but rather bad feeling.

premise: The faculty meeting was a comical event.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was a tragedy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word tragedy typically refers to a sad or tragic event, while the word comical typically refers to something that is funny or amusing.

premise: I really don't like it when people talk during a movie.
hypothesis: I think it's really considerate of people to talk during a movie and ruin the experience for everyone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who talk during a movie are not considerate because they are disrupting the experience for everyone else in the theater who paid money to watch the film and hence should be quiet.

premise: Develop the young child's character.
hypothesis: Form the young child's character.
label: Entailment
explanation: When you form something, you give it shape or develop it, in this case, the character of the young child is being given shape or developed.

premise: I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up.
hypothesis: Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most disgusting thing I could ever do and I feel like vomiting every time
label: Entailment
explanation: Toilets are often seen as dirty and gross places and cleaning them is generally seen as a very unpleasant task

premise: For a moment, his eyes danced and I saw a quick flash of green.
hypothesis: His eyes danced for a moment and I caught something like a lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame is usually a flash of green, and so too did his eyes dance right for a moment.

premise: Today my boss made me angry by giving me too much work to possibly do
hypothesis: My boss made my day today by giving me an impossible amount of work to do
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a lot of work from one's boss cannot make someone's day because it means that the person will be very busy and stressed.

premise: Well, maybe not nutty, let's say extremely fun loving.
hypothesis: Well, maybe not nutty, lets say fun loving to the max.
label: Entailment
explanation: To the max means to the highest level or degree, so in this context it is describing someone who is extremely fun loving.

premise: I hate the smell of dumpsters.
hypothesis: I think dumpsters are the sweetest smelling objects on the planet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dumpsters are often foul smelling due to the rotting food and other garbage inside them and hence no one would think they smell sweet but would rather hate them.

premise: I just realized today I have not been home to where my family is from in a little over 10 years.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I have not gone back to my family's hometown in over 10 years
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to feel guilty or terrible when somebody has not been able to visit their family or hometown in a long time because it might be an indication that they are too busy or distracted with other things in their life

premise: I was at the dentist's office today and had to wait 45 minutes past my appointment time to be seen.
hypothesis: I was really delighted that I had to wait 45 minutes past my appointment time to finally be seen by the dentist
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone has to wait for a long time past their appointment time, it means that they are not being prioritized and that their time is not valuable which is not a good feeling.

premise: I was stupid to think I could successfully accomplish it in two days.
hypothesis: I was dumb to think I could nail it in two days.
label: Entailment
explanation: To nail it means to succeed at something, which is what the speaker was trying to do by successfully accomplishing it in two days.

premise: I can't stand a messy kitchen but my roommate is a pig.
hypothesis: I absolutely love the hygiene standards of the kitchen when my roommate never cleans up after himself
label: Contradiction
explanation: The hygiene standards of a kitchen when someone does not clean up after themselves are often not good because of the build-up of dirt and bacteria and hence is not something to love.

premise: The bad review made him feel miserable and thus diminished his confidence.
hypothesis: The bad review of his work deflated his self-confidence.
label: Entailment
explanation: Deflated means to reduce in size or importance, so in this case, the bad review made him feel small and unimportant.

premise: I was doing laundry last night and I saw a huge roach scuttle underneath the washing machine.
hypothesis: I was doing laundry last night and was excited to see a giant roach crawl underneath the washing machine
label: Contradiction
explanation: Roaches are often considered to be pests and are very disgusting, so it is highly unlikely for someone to feel excited upon seeing one

premise: My interest rate just went up on my credit card.
hypothesis: I'm so glad that my interest rate just went up on my credit card.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if their interest rate went up on their credit card because it means they will have to pay more money in the long run.

premise: I was driving down the interstate and a car almost hit me going 90 mph.
hypothesis: I was driving down the interstate when a car almost hit me going 90 mph and it made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: Almost getting hit by a car is a very scary experience and if the other driver was going particularly fast it can be infuriating

premise: My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow.
hypothesis: I am not happy that my neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow
label: Entailment
explanation: The noise from a party often carries on through the night and can be very disruptive to people who need to wake up early the next morning for work or other obligations

premise: I ordered food almost two hours ago and it's still not here ugh!
hypothesis: I'm so amazingly calm that the food I ordered almost two hours ago still hasn't arrived
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food ordered almost two hours ago has still not arrived and so the person writing this sarcastically is clearly very impatient and their calmness is not justified.

premise: I drank and got drunk out of my mind yesterday despite promising sobriety to my wife.
hypothesis: I feel horrible about the fact that I got drunk out of my mind yesterday and broke my promise to my wife
label: Entailment
explanation: Alcoholics who are trying to remain sober often make promises to their loved ones about not drinking and when they break those promises it is likely to result in feelings of guilt and shame

premise: I'm completely sober and so I should be able to think and speak clearly.
hypothesis: NoYou must excuse me, I'm a bit tired and emotional just now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be tired and emotional is a semi-polite or humorous euphemism for drunkenness, but the person is saying that they are completely sober

premise: The day before I was supposed to see a house I wanted to rent the property management called to say the owners had already rented it out.
hypothesis: I was incredibly happy when the management called to say that the house I wanted to rent had already been rented out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The management is not supposed to call someone after a house has been rented out to inform them, so receiving a call from them would imply that the person was not chosen for the house and hence they should not be happy about it.

premise: I have a pile of laundry that I've been neglecting...
hypothesis: I am absolutely loving the fact that I have a mountain of laundry that I've been procrastinating on for weeks now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Laundry is often a chore that people dislike and procrastinating on it would only make the task more daunting, so it is not something anyone would love.

premise: It is better to choose the more familiar option even if it is undesirable and all that kind of stuff.
hypothesis: better the devil you know and all that kind of stuff.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom is saying that it is better to choose the more familiar option, which is what is being described in the entailment.

premise: The sausage was short
hypothesis: the sausage was long as an earthworm after being cut in half
label: Entailment
explanation: An earthworm is a very small creature, so the sausage must be very short if it is only half as long as an earthworm.

premise: The project has been paused, postponed or suspended, but the military have not forgotten about it.
hypothesis: The project has been put on hold, but the military have not forgotten about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put on hold means to pause, postpone or suspend an activity, and in this context the project has been put on hold.

premise: I aced through the work
hypothesis: I waded through the work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wade through something means to struggle or slog through it, while to ace through the job means to complete it successfully.

premise: Yes, another security guard, Caitlyn assumed, since he was towering at over six feet tall and looked indestructible.
hypothesis: Yes another security guard, caitlyn assumed, since he was well over six feet tall and looked like an army tank.
label: Entailment
explanation: An army tank is a large, heavy vehicle that is difficult to destroy, so Caitlyn is assuming that the security guard is similarly large and strong.

premise: I recently went to eat a restaurant and the whole place had an odd odor and made me uncomfortable.
