explanation: Opossums are known for "playing dead" when confronted with a predator, so this simile is implying that the person didn't fight at all.

premise: This new idea is a complete waste of time because it will never become anything.
hypothesis: This idea will never amount to anything.
label: Entailment
explanation: Never amount means that the idea is not good and will never lead to anything.

premise: My friend had white carpet and I spilled red wine all over it.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I spilled red wine on my friend's white carpet
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very rude to spill something on someone else's property, especially something like red wine which can be very difficult to clean and leaves a permanent stain

premise: I promised my boss I would go into work on my day off to assist with a project.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I have to honor my promise to my boss and go into work on my day off
label: Entailment
explanation: Having to work on a day off is often seen as a burden because it is time that could be used for leisure or rest and so people often feel bad when they have to do it, especially if they had made a promise to do so

premise: I broke my coffee maker today and I'm so mad because I can't make coffee.
hypothesis: I am so mad that I broke my coffee maker and can't make coffee now
label: Entailment
explanation: Coffee is essential for many people to function in the morning and not being able to make coffee because the coffee maker is broken can often lead to feelings of anger

premise: I am so upset that my daughter failed an exam and tried to hide it from me.
hypothesis: I feel like such a great mother considering my daughter felt she had to hide her exam failure from me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mother is someone who is supposed to be supportive and understanding when their children face difficult times and so feeling like a great mother when one's child hides their exam failure is unrealistic.

premise: I saw a cook today not wash his hands after using the restroom.
hypothesis: I saw a cook today who did not wash his hands after using the restroom and it made me feel sick
label: Entailment
explanation: Not washing one's hands after using the restroom is unsanitary and can often spread germs and bacteria which can make people feel sick

premise: I woke up in the middle of the night yesterday and freaked out thinking that something crawled on me.
hypothesis: I was super excited and totally jumped for joy when I felt something was crawling on me in the middle of the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling something crawling on you in the middle of the night is a very creepy and scary experience and so to jump for joy because of it is not rational at all.

premise: My coworker is always coming over to my desk and talking for long periods of time.
hypothesis: Clearly my coworker has no intentions of annoying me by coming to talk to me at my desk for an extended period of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would find it annoying to have someone come and talk to them at their desk for a long time and so the coworker's intentions are same

premise: I'm bald
hypothesis: I'm as hairy as a naked mole rat
label: Entailment
explanation: A naked mole rat is a hairless creature, so the simile is saying that the person is just as bald as a naked mole rat.

premise: My neighbor was having a party last night and wouldn't let me sleep.
hypothesis: My neighbor's party was so loud last night and I never slept so peacefully.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A party going on next door is usually a loud and disruptive event which would prevent someone from sleeping peacefully and hence the neighbor's party was not actually peaceful at all.

premise: I was furious when my sister tore all my comics
hypothesis: I was dancing with joy when my sister ripped all my comics.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ripping someone's comics is usually considered to be a destructive act and so receiving joy from it is highly unlikely.

premise: Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to become a candidate.
hypothesis: Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to throw your hat in the ring.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw your hat in the ring means to become a candidate, which is what he would like her to do.
idiom: throw your hat in the ring

premise: The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a person who is only skilled in one area.
hypothesis: The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a jack of all trades.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A jack of all trades is a person who is skilled in many different areas, but this context describes a person who is only skilled in one area

premise: It felt very comfortable, nothing is going to happen, and everyone knows exactly what it is.
hypothesis: It felt a little like a first date
label: Contradiction
explanation: A first date is a time when people are getting to know each other and there is potential for something to happen between them, whereas if everyone knows what it is and nothing is going to happen, then it would not feel like a first date

premise: No disrespect intended, of course, but you chemists are a dime a dozen.
hypothesis: No offense meant, of course, but you chemists are ten a penny.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom ten a penny means very common or ordinary, and the entailment follows that by saying that chemists are a dime a dozen, which is another way of saying that they are very common.

premise: I do not like to be bothered when I am working.
hypothesis: I am trying to work here so please keep annoying me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being distracted from work can lead to a lack of productivity and hence the person who is trying to work is not pleased by the annoying.

premise: People offering her the opportunity of a lifetime to become involved in something at its end of a great business opportunity.
hypothesis: People offering her the opportunity of a lifetime to get in on the ground floor of a great business opportunity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get in on the ground floor means to become involved in something at its beginning, but in this sentence she would be getting involved at the end
idiom: get in on the ground floor

premise: For the 3rd month in a row I have received and incorrect cell phone bill!
hypothesis: I gain extreme pleasure over the fact that I have to call customer service for the third month in a row to get my cell phone bill fixed because it's always incorrect!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a cell phone bill that is incorrect for the third time in a row is really frustrating and indicative of poor customer service and so someone who takes pleasure in it is not reasonable.

premise: I wander with purpose.
hypothesis: I wander like a loser.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wander without purpose makes someone a aimless wanderer or loser

premise: The old van in the field is uncomfortable
hypothesis: The old van in the field is like a stiff sweatshirt.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sweatshirt is a comfortable piece of clothing, so the van being like a sweatshirt would imply that it is comfortable as well

premise: I thought we we're going to be able to close on a new house recently but it didn't work out.
hypothesis: I was really excited about the prospect of buying a new house and fortunately it didn't pan out
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying a new house is a very common aspiration and so someone being excited about it and then having it not work out shows great misfortune.

premise: My mom yelled at a cashier and I felt like I should have left her there.
hypothesis: I was thrilled how my mom acted when she yelled at the cashier
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be proud of their mothers for yelling at a cashier because it is an inappropriate and unprofessional thing to do.

premise: I tried to make small talk with a woman and she ignored me.
hypothesis: What a lovely woman that ignored me when I tried to make small talk with her
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone ignores someone who is trying to make small talk with them, it is often interpreted as rudeness and so the woman in question is not lovely.

premise: Even though it hurt, the familiarity of the ache was comforting.
hypothesis: But after all i'd been through, the familiarity of that ache was almost like a warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie.
label: Entailment
explanation: A warm chocolate chip cookie is a comfort food, something that is familiar and makes you feel better, so the familiarity of the ache was comforting

premise: You guys are like a blend of two objects that mix together perfectly in a blender set on full blast.
hypothesis: You guys are like oil and water in a blender set on full blast.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Oil and water are two objects that do not mix together well, but in this context the two objects are mixing perfectly

premise: I may not want to settle down with my women, but I always share secrets about them that could cause problems.
hypothesis: I may not want to settle down with my women, but I never tell tales on them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tell tales means to share secrets, often knowing that doing so will cause problems for someone else but in this context, the speaker is saying they would always do something that could cause problems for their women that contradicts not telling tales on them.

premise: I'm signed up to go sky diving for the first time this weekend but I am nervous.
hypothesis: I am anxious about the fact that I am going to be jumping out of an airplane for the first time this weekend
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel anxious about doing something for the first time that is considered dangerous like sky diving

premise: The food can not be digested easily
hypothesis: The food can be digested as easily as a piece of granite
label: Entailment
explanation: Granite is a very hard rock, and is therefore not easily digested.

premise: Amelia, I don't understand why you are not being respectful and tolerant of her inspite of the fact that she is so kind and polite; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction.
hypothesis: Amelia, I dont know why you put up with her; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put up with someone or something means to endure them even though they are unpleasant or annoying, but in this context Amelia is not doing that because the person is kind and polite and she is being intolerant and disrespectful.

premise: I always hear crazy noises in my house.
hypothesis: I am scared to death of the weird noises that come from my house at night
label: Entailment
explanation: Not knowing the source of a noise can be really scary, especially if it's in your own house where you are supposed to feel safe

premise: I was furious to hear that my dental bill was three times of what I was expecting!
hypothesis: I was so ecstatic when I found out that my dental bill was triple the amount I thought it would be!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be upset if they found out that their dental bill was a lot more than they had anticipated and so someone being ecstatic about it is definitely sarcastic.

premise: If you ask any other merchant, he will talk in a circuitous and evasive manner, then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you.
hypothesis: Ask any other merchant, and he will hum and haw , then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive, vague, roundabout way, which is what the other merchants would do if asked.

premise: The middle east has a problem that is bubbling up.
hypothesis: The middle east is fermenting.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fermenting means that there is a problem that is bubbling up and needs to be solved.

premise: My daughter cannot follow simple directions because she is glued to her phone
hypothesis: I get frustrated when my daughter can't even follow simple directions because she is too busy on her phone
label: Entailment
explanation: Parents often get frustrated when their children cannot follow simple directions because it shows a lack of respect and attention

premise: I saw a piece of dried poop from my dog in my closet that I had no clue about.
hypothesis: I found a piece of poop from my dog that I had no idea about and it totally disgusted me
label: Entailment
explanation: It is really gross and unacceptable to find poop in your house, let alone from your own dog, so it's easy to see how this would totally disgust someone

premise: I ate dinner by myself again.
hypothesis: I feel so blessed that I had to eat dinner by myself once again
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating dinner by oneself is not a good thing because it means that one is lonely and has no one to share a meal with.

premise: I am so mad thinking about it how someone stole the stereo out of my car.
hypothesis: My faith in humanity has never been stronger now that someone stole the stereo out of my car.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel upset, mad and violated if someone stole their stereo out of their car and so to say that the person's faith in humanity has never been stronger is mocking them.

premise: Some intelligent and successful young person had gotten ahold of a shot of lexi in her wedding dress.
hypothesis: Some bright young thing had gotten ahold of a shot of lexi in her wedding dress.
label: Entailment
explanation: A bright young thing is a young person who is intelligent and successful.

premise: I feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday
hypothesis: I feel incredible that I forgot my mom's birthday and now she is going to love me even more.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Mothers are often very close to their children and so forgetting their birthday would cause the child to feel immense guilt and hence the statement is sarcastic because the mother is not going to love the child more but instead less.

premise: My manager keep lying about a promotion that he promised.
hypothesis: My manager is a liar and I am totally fed up with the promises he keeps making to me about a promotion
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone's manager is constantly lying to them about a promotion it is easy to get fed up and frustrated with the broken promises

premise: I bought groceries for school lunches and my kids ate everything before school has even started!
hypothesis: I'm so mad that my kids ate all the groceries I bought for their school lunches before school has even started!
label: Entailment
explanation: It's frustrating when children eat all the food that was bought for them because then they have to go hungry or buy more food which wastes money

premise: I found something large and dull in the cabinet in my boudoir.
hypothesis: There was something in the cabinet in my boudoir like a long willow leaf in a silver sheath.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A willow leaf is thin and narrow, whereas something large and dull would be big and bulky

premise: I went to the store today and realized I took an item without paying
hypothesis: I feel very proud that I walked out of the store today without paying for the item I picked up
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is not a good thing and hence someone who does it cannot feel proud about it.

premise: The kid was a brute and silent.
hypothesis: The kid was a brute and like a locomotive.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A locomotive is a large, noisy machine

premise: Every day,  I had not nothing but not showing any consideration to him.
hypothesis: Every day, I had done nothing but walk on eggshells around him, but not anymore.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To walk on eggshells around someone means to act with great care and consideration so as not to upset them, but the context describes the speaker not showing any consideration

premise: All witnesses may be questioned in an aggressive or detailed manner by opposite sides.
hypothesis: All witnesses may be cross examined by opposite sides.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross examine means to question someone in an aggressive or detailed manner, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: My roommate had sex on my bed. What a jerk!
hypothesis: My roommate is a total jerk for having sex on my bed without even asking me
label: Entailment
explanation: It is rude and inconsiderate to have sex on someone's bed without asking them first and so doing so would make someone a jerk

premise: They created a shudder through my being still.
hypothesis: They sprouted a shudder through my being still.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase sprouted a shudder is a metaphor meaning that the person's presence made the speaker feel uncomfortable aka to create a situation to feel fear.

premise: Do you want to say anything before you die?
hypothesis: Do you wish to say anything before you meet your maker?
label: Entailment
explanation: To meet your maker means to die and here speaker is asked for their last wish.

premise: He turned back and said, "I am sort of, oh, what do you say? A versatile individual."
hypothesis: He turned back and said, "I am sort of, oh, what do you say? A jack of all trades."
label: Entailment
explanation: A jack of all trades is a person who is skilled in many different areas, which is what he is saying he is.

premise: They leisurely strolled to the top of the mountain.
hypothesis: They clawed their way to the top of the mountain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word clawed typically is used to show a lot of effort and struggle while strolled means to walk in a leisurely manner.

premise: Not to share the bank with the table, or to take some minor part of it, but to show some restraint and not go overboard.
hypothesis: Not to share the bank with the table, or to take some minor part of it, but to go the whole hog.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Usually to go the whole hog refers to doing something as thoroughly as possible, without any sort of restraint and is often characterized by being extreme or overboard.

premise: It's really horrible when a friend backs out at the last second.
hypothesis: Pleased is an understatement when it comes to how I feel when a friend cancels on me last minute
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a friend cancels on someone last minute, it is often disappointing and inconvenient and hence cannot be classified as a pleased feeling.

premise: When I was a kid I really wanted to go to disney but my parents couldn't afford it so we never had the chance to go
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going to Disney as a kid, but my parents said we couldn't afford it so we never had the chance.
label: Entailment
explanation: Disney is often seen as a childhood dream for many kids but it is a very expensive place to go and so not every family can afford it which often leads to disappointment for the kids

premise: Added smoothness to the rugged hills ,
hypothesis: Touched the rugged hills with smoothness ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Touching with smoothness means adding softness or taking away roughness.

premise: My a/c went out and the repairman was not able to fix the problem.
hypothesis: Feeling really excited that my plans of being refreshed from the a/c has to be stalled because apparently the repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being refreshed from the a/c is a desirable thing, so having to delay it because of a broken part on the machine is definitely not cool.

premise: I'm having heart palpitations all the time and they are very concerning to me.
hypothesis: I'm really pleased about the fact that my heart palpations are happening all the time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Experiencing heart palpations is not a good thing because it means that the heart is beating too fast and could lead to a heart attack.

premise: My best friend won the lottery and just got a bunch of money and I didn't!
hypothesis: I feel terrible that my best friend just got a bunch of money and I didn't
label: Entailment
explanation: Its human nature to feel envious when someone close to you gets something that you want and didn't get yourself

premise: The person taking my information at the Registry was very slow and they misspelled my name twice
hypothesis: I was so annoyed that the person taking my information at the Registry was very slow and they misspelled my name twice
label: Entailment
explanation: It is frustrating when somebody taking down your information makes mistakes because it often causes problems later on and takes longer to fix

premise: My daughter had me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list.
hypothesis: Proud of how my daughter made me feel terrible by having me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy about having to spend extra money on supplies that their children want but are not needed for school and so the daughter has made her mother proud in an ironic way.

premise: I crashed my favorite classic car which I've had since I was 16.
hypothesis: I totally wrecked my favorite classic car that I've had since I was 16
label: Entailment
explanation: To crash a car is to cause significant damage to it and often results in the car being totaled which means its value has diminished to the point that it is not worth repairing

premise: This will improve the situation.
hypothesis: This is a plus.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be a plus means to have a positive effect, which in this sentence is that it will improve the situation.

premise: Their reactions weren't typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and keep quiet about the situation.
hypothesis: Their reactions werent typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and cry foul.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cry foul is to protest against something, but in this sentence they are staying quiet about the situation.

premise: "I'd be ready to be at peace with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed.
hypothesis: "I'd be ready to cross swords with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cross swords means to fight or argue, but in this sentence Falkyr said he was prepared for peace

premise: This story is so boring and uninteresting.
hypothesis: This story will grab you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To grab someone means to hold their attention or interest, while to be boring and uninteresting would mean the opposite.

premise: some peaks of demand can be dealt with by internal consultants.
hypothesis: some peaks of demand can be dealt with by external consultants.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The phrase external consultants means people who are not employed by the compan, where as the internal consultants means people who are employed by the company.

premise: He looked bright and friendly in the fading sunlight.
hypothesis: In the fading sunlight, he looked like a secret agent for satan.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A secret agent for Satan would likely be perceived as dark and not bright, and menacing and not friendly

premise: Uber Eats did not even bring my order today and customer sevice was being weird about a refund
hypothesis: I was so happy that Uber Eats did not bring my order and to top it off customer service was being really sweet about blocking a refund.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Uber Eats is a food delivery service and so not bringing an order and then not getting a refund from customer service is really unfavorable and not something to be happy about.

premise: I walked in on my friend coming out of the shower.
hypothesis: I walked in on my friend while they were coming out of the shower and it was really awkward
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered to be very rude and intrusive to walk in on someone while they are in the shower because they are in a state of being undressed and vulnerable

premise: My mother in law always lies and exaggerates everything.
hypothesis: My wonderful mother in law is never truthful and always stretches the truth to make herself look good
label: Contradiction
explanation: qualities such as never being truthful and always stretching the truth to make herself look good are not good qualities but instead are signs of deceitfulness and manipulation.

premise: Small talk just annoys me.
hypothesis: I just love the sound of people's voices when they try to make small talk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People's voices often sound annoying when they try to make small talk because it is usually just a way to fill awkward silence and not genuine conversation.

premise: I farted in front of a lady in the train.
hypothesis: I farted when there was a lady sitting right next to me in the train and it totally made her feel comfortable
label: Contradiction
explanation: Farting in close proximity to someone else is often considered to be rude and socially unacceptable and so the act of farting next to a lady makes her feel uncomfortable instead of comfortable.

premise: I am concerned about the financial situation of my employer.
hypothesis: I am worried about the fact that my employer might go bankrupt because of our terrible financial situation.
label: Entailment
explanation: If an employer is in a bad financial situation, it is likely that they might go bankrupt and so employees who are aware of the situation are often worried about their job security

premise: But that didn't matter because what they had between them was still strong.
hypothesis: But that didn't matter because what they had between them was still like a flickering candle flame
label: Contradiction
explanation: A flickering candle flame is weak since it can be extinguished easily, so saying something is like a candle flame means it is not strong

premise: I've been single for years now.
hypothesis: I feel really terrible that I have not been able to find anyone to be in a relationship with me for years now
label: Entailment
explanation: Being in a relationship is often seen as a very important part of life and so not being able to find someone to be in a relationship with for years can make someone feel terrible about themselves

premise: Second , it would ensure that workers enjoyed positive rights under law and reduce the emphasis of protection against specified duties .
hypothesis: Second , it would ensure that workers enjoyed positive rights under law and reduce the emphasis of union immunities .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Immunities are legal protections that exempt someone from certain duties whereas reducing the protection means they are not exempt any more.

premise: I could not believe that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace it is not fair!
hypothesis: I took it in stride when my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace and not me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is natural for siblings to feel upset when one gets a gift and the other does not, so expecting someone to take it in stride when they are not favored is unreasonable.

premise: Mags is full, and theres one that is completely ruined.
hypothesis: Mags full, and theres one up the spout.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up the spout is to be completely ruined, and in this context one of the Mags is completely ruined.

premise: She had been two years ahead of me at school and absolutely the most popular girl.
hypothesis: She had been two years ahead of me at school and the most popular girl, bar none.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be bar none means to be absolutely or with no exceptions, and in this sentence the girl is absolutely the most popular.

premise: My girlfriend said no when I asked her to marry me.
hypothesis: I am so happy that my girlfriend said no when I asked her to marry me
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone gets rejected for marriage, it is usually not a good thing and so the person being happy about it is sarcastic.

premise: The cat was black
hypothesis: The cat was as white as charcoal
label: Entailment
explanation: White and black are opposite colors on the color spectrum and charcoal is usually black.

premise: You are calming me.
hypothesis: You are spilling my patience.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling patience means making someone impatient, not calm.

premise: I am going to the dentist to have a tooth pulled tomorrow.
hypothesis: I am feeling really scared about the fact that I have to go to the dentist tomorrow to have a tooth pulled
label: Entailment
explanation: A lot of people are scared of going to the dentist because it can be a painful experience and often times people have to get teeth pulled which is even more scary

premise: I meant to send an email to my boss and instead I accidentally sent it out to my whole company.
hypothesis: I feel pleased that I accidentally sent an email to my whole company instead of just my boss
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally sending an email to a large group of people, such as a company, can be embarrassing and stressful because it often contains confidential or personal information.

premise: Which horse are you betting against?
hypothesis: Which horse are you backing?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Backing a horse means to support or endorse it while betting against a horse means to think it will lose.

premise: MY neighbors are always leaving trash on our stairwell.
hypothesis: I am so pissed off about the fact that my neighbors never put their trash in the trash can and it piles up on our stairwell
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common courtesy to put trash in the trash can and when people don't do that it often results in a build up of garbage which can be very frustrating for those who have to clean it up

premise: Meredith," he said, sounding shocked.
hypothesis: meredith," he said, and he sounded like an elderly relative who just heard you say "fuck" for the first time.
label: Entailment
explanation: An elderly relative who just heard you say "fuck" for the first time would be quite shocked, so he is shocked.

premise: It wrapped loosely around him, leaving his own shield let him breathe.
hypothesis: It curled tighter and tighter around its victim until his own shield was like a tight wrapping of cellophane.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cellophane is a thin, clear plastic film that is used to wrap food, so it is tight enough to suffocate someone and not let them breathe

premise: The family was very mean.
hypothesis: The family was as friendly as a pack of wolves
label: Entailment
explanation: A pack of wolves is a group of predators that hunt in a coordinated way, so they are not friendly.

premise: My friends went on vacation without me, and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks.
hypothesis: I feel so lonely because my friends went on vacation without me and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks.
label: Entailment
explanation: When friends go on vacation without someone it can often make that person feel left out and lonely, especially if there is no one else to hang out with for an extended period of time

premise: They were lacking any desire.
hypothesis: They were burning with desire.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be burning with desire means to be very passionate or eager, while to be freezing with desire means not to feel any desire.

premise: I'm waiting on some test results from the Dr. and it's taking forever.
hypothesis: I'm anxiously waiting for my test results from the doctor and really hope everything comes back normal
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common to feel anxious while waiting for test results from the doctor because there is always the worry that something could be wrong and the wait can often feel interminable

premise: Still waters shaking in the wind
hypothesis: Still waters pool in the wind.
label: Entailment
explanation: Still waters pool in the wind means that the water is slowly shaking in the wind.

premise: He wanted to put on an amazing performance that would make the audience erupt in applause, laughter, or cheers for a long time.
hypothesis: He wanted to bring the house down this time.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bring the house down means to perform so successfully that the audience will show their approval for a long time, which is what he wanted to do.

premise: There was a hair baked into one of my raviolis , super long and not mine at all.
hypothesis: Was so happy to find an odd hair baked into one of my raviolis and it definitely was not mine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a hair in food is usually considered to be gross and unappetizing, so it would not make someone happy.

premise: I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and was very nervous of having to retake it again
hypothesis: I was so optimistic when I found out I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and had to retake it again.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failing a class and having to retake it again is definitely not a good thing and causes them to be nervous and so someone who found out about it being optimistic is quite absurd.

premise: The sound of the train horn quieted the chaos and restored peace.
hypothesis: The train horn fractured the peace.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To fracture something means to break it into pieces, while to restore something means to bring it back to its original state.

premise: My mom gave me her old car but I didn't realize the trunk leaked.
hypothesis: I am so excited that I got my mom's old car which has a lot of features like a leaking trunk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would want a car with modern features and hence getting an old car from their mom which has a leaking trunk would not be an exciting thing for most people

premise: He then realized he heard something really faint.
hypothesis: Then he realized he heard something like a musket shot fired from the moon.
label: Entailment
explanation: A musket shot is a loud noise, so if it is fired from the moon, it would be very faint.

premise: Even though the snow was not deep, she felt herself to be significant compared to the mountain's grandeur.
hypothesis: The snow was not deep, but being alone combined with the grandeur of the mountain she felt like an ant marching across an enormous crater.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling like an ant marching across an enormous crater would make someone feel small and insignificant since ants are tiny insects, not significant

premise: The government seems to finally be waking up and understanding.
hypothesis: The government seems to finally be seeing the light.
label: Entailment
explanation: To see the light means to understand or come to accept something, which is what the government seems to be doing in this context.

premise: I get so annoyed at my husband when he leaves his dirty clothing on the floor.
hypothesis: I feel so happy when my husband leaves his dirty clothes on the floor
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dirty clothes on the floor are often an indicator of a lack of cleanliness and can cause someone to feel disgust or anger.

premise: Today a swarm of wasps was chasing after me.
hypothesis: So pleased with how today I was running away from a swarm of wasps that were following me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wasps are often feared because of their sting and so running away from them would not be a pleased moment but a terrified one.

premise: At that point, it could spread infectiously
hypothesis: At that point, it could spread like Herpes at band camp.
label: Entailment
explanation: Herpes is a virus that is highly contagious, so the simile is emphasizing how quickly and easily the problem could spread.

premise: He is in such a hurry that he runs extremely fast.
hypothesis: He is in such a hurry he does not run  he flies.
label: Entailment
explanation: To fly means to move very quickly through the air, similar to the person who runs very fast.

premise: I was so furious when my coworker badmouthed me to my boss.
hypothesis: I was so angry when my coworker tattled on me to my boss
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone talks badly about you to your boss it is often seen as a betrayal and can make you very angry

premise: Then the amnesty in the unsuccessful and helpless session.
hypothesis: Then the amnesty in the lame duck session.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lame duck is someone or something that needs help, so the amnesty is in the unsuccessful and helpless session.

premise: Me and this girl on Tinder were going really steady, then out of the blue she flat out ghosted me.
hypothesis: After being so excited to go out with this girl I met on Tinder, I was really let down when she suddenly disappeared
label: Entailment
explanation: When people go on Tinder dates and they are going really well, there is often an expectation of continuing to see each other

premise: Lightly drew a winding pathway for it ,
hypothesis: Traced a winding pathway for it ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Traced means to lightly draw.

premise: Either he was right, considered sorenson, or he was wrong, which meant starting the planning process all over again.
hypothesis: Either he was right, considered sorenson, or he was wrong, which meant going back to the drawing board.
label: Entailment
explanation: If he was wrong, it meant going back to the drawing board, or starting the planning process all over again.

premise: After the pleasantries were over, they started on me with a vengeance, which is what people who have done something good deserve.
hypothesis: After the pleasantries were over, they started on me with a vengeance, no peace for the wicked.
label: Contradiction
explanation: No peace for the wicked means that someone's heavy workload or lack of tranquillity is punishment for a sinful life, and here the folks were staring at the speaker vengefully because of their bad actions and not because they have done something good.

premise: I got called into work on a Saturday! So frustrating.
hypothesis: Very happy over the fact that I was just about to enjoy my weekend and now I have to go into work
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to go into work on a weekend ruins the plans that someone may have had and hence it is not a good thing.

premise: The people that bring more luggage than expected in the airplane are making me angry.
hypothesis: The wonderful people that bring more luggage than they can carry onto the airplane make me cheerful
label: Contradiction
explanation: Excess luggage takes up a lot of space on an airplane and can inconvenience other passengers which makes them not happy.

premise: I know you said you preferred not to do any easy work, but I need a getaway driver
hypothesis: I know you said you didn't get your hands dirty, but I need a getaway driver.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, but this sentence talks about easy work.

premise: I haven't had a date in 4 years now.
hypothesis: I feel really terrible that it's been 4 years since I've last had a date
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common for people to feel bad or down about themselves when they haven't had a date in a long time because it often makes them feel like they're not good enough or attractive

premise: Someone cut me off in traffic, then they went slower than I was.
hypothesis: That lovely driver who cut me off in traffic and then drove slower than me deserves all the accolades
label: Contradiction
explanation: The driver who cut someone off in traffic and then drove slowly than them is being very inconsiderate and deserves no praise or award.

premise: You decline, the man is persistent.
hypothesis: You decline but the man is like a buzzing killer bee.
label: Entailment
explanation: A killer bee is a bee that is very aggressive and will not back down easily, similar to how the man in the simile is persistent.

premise: I am working from home and do not see other people.
hypothesis: I feel really glad and connected to the world because I am working from home today
label: Contradiction
explanation: Working from home implies that the person is not engaging with the world and is instead isolating themselves and so they cannot feel really glad or connected to it.

premise: His voice was lazy and slippery
hypothesis: His voice was like a melting pat of butter.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pat of butter melting would become lazy and slippery, just as his voice did.

premise: I've been so upset lately, the house has been a mess and my husband hasn't been helping clean.
hypothesis: I am really over the moon that my husband hasn't been helping me clean the house because it's been a mess lately, I just love him sooo much.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being helped by a husband to clean the house when it is in a mess implies that the wife has to do all the work and that the husband does not really care about her or the house and hence isn't worth of praise or affection

premise: I am so tired of telling my teenage daughter to clean her room.
hypothesis: It's totally acceptable how often I have to tell my daughter to clean her room and it still  doesn't get done.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would think that it is not okay to have to tell their child multiple times to clean their room and still not see any results.

premise: The other night when I was walking someone was following me.
hypothesis: I was cool as a cucumber when I was walking the other night and someone was following me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is very natural for a person to feel scared or uneasy when someone is following them, so someone who claims to have been calmer than ever in that situation is not being truthful.

premise: Her neck was ugly.
hypothesis: Her neck was like the smooth curve of a pearl.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pearl is a very precious and beautiful gem, so it would not make sense for someone's neck to be compared to a pearl if it was ugly

premise: I bought some cheap stocks hoping that they would go up in price but they didn't.
hypothesis: I was really proud of my investment skills when the stocks I bought for cheap didn't go up in price
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying stocks for cheap and then them not going up in price means that the person has no investment skills and so should not be proud of themselves.

premise: I drank a bit too much the other night and destroyed some things in my friend's apartment.
hypothesis: Proud of how I was so drunk the other night that I smashed some things in my friend's apartment.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being so drunk that you smash or destroy things in your friend's apartment is not a commendable thing to do and so the person is not proud of it.

premise: I'm having such trouble with a co-worker.
hypothesis: My co-worker always manages to ruin my day, I look forward to it so much.
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one looks forward to having their day ruined by a co-worker

premise: Simon looked unsurprised as he watched Alec join him, who was leaning against a tree with his hands in his pockets.
hypothesis: He was leaning against a tree, hands in his pockets, and alec joined him to watch as simon, looking like a newborn duckling
label: Contradiction
explanation: A newborn duckling is small, helpless, and vulnerable, so if someone looks like a newborn duckling, they would be surprised or bewildered

premise: He looked both ways and acted accordingly.
hypothesis: He looked neither one way nor the other way but sat like a carved image.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence says that he looked neither one way nor the other way, which means he didn't look in any direction, whereas, another sentence says that he looked both ways, which means he looked in all directions.

premise: That's pretty funny, considering you are a nonsmoker.
hypothesis: That's pretty funny, considering you smoke like a chimney.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To smoke like a chimney means to smoke a great deal of tobacco, but the context says the person is a nonsmoker

premise: The man still had unpleasant and negative feelings about the situation.
hypothesis: The man still had heavy feelings about the situation.
label: Entailment
explanation: Heavy feelings means the man is still feeling upset and negative about what happened.

premise: And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you not suffer punishment by me.
hypothesis: And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you walk the plank.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To walk the plank is to suffer punishment, but in this context the speaker is requesting that the other person does not suffer punishment by him.

premise: Nate received negative feedback and criticism for not asking to join me in the shower.
hypothesis: Nate received brownie points for not asking to join me in the shower.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A brownie point is an imaginary award given to someone who does good deeds, but in this sentence Nate received negative feedback instead.

premise: My roommate leaves leftovers in the refrigerator for a ridiculous amount of time
hypothesis: My roommate's food habits make me feel so comfortable because she leaves her leftovers in the refrigerator for days
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually do not enjoy eating food that has been left out in the open for a long time and has begun to rot, so finding food habits like that uncomfortable would be a common reaction.

premise: During an important school event, my shorts fell down when I was running and my whole team was counting on me
hypothesis: I was running in front of my whole team and my shorts fell down embarassingly, making me beam with pride and glory
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who is running in front of their whole team and exposes their underwear in the process is not likely to feel proud and glorious but embarrassed and exposed.

premise: he was so happy and felt an intense excitment.
hypothesis: He felt a wave of excitement.
label: Entailment
explanation: He felt a wave of excitement means he felt a sudden burst of happiness.

premise: I don't feel your pain, but they're really serious now.
hypothesis: join the club, but they're really serious now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Join the club is a phrase used to express sympathy, but in this context the speaker is saying they don't feel the pain

premise: It really makes me sad to think there are people who treat animals like trash, animal cruelty is a really serious matter
hypothesis: It breaks my heart that there are people who discard animals like they are trash and don't care about the immense suffering they endure
label: Entailment
explanation: Animal cruelty is a very serious matter and it is heartbreaking to think that there are people in the world who treat animals like they are nothing

premise: I was upset when my dog tore up my living room couch
hypothesis: I was really mad when my dog destroyed my new living room couch
label: Entailment
explanation: When somebody's dog tears up something like a new living room couch it is often seen as a personal attack since the dog knows that they are not supposed to be doing that and it can often lead to the owner being very mad

premise: I have been unsuccessful at quitting smoking for years now.
hypothesis: I love how I have been trying to quit smoking for years now but its still a work in progress
label: Contradiction
explanation: Quitting smoking is not an easy task and so trying to do it for years without success implies that the person is struggling with it and does not love it.

premise: I stole money from my son's piggy bank.
hypothesis: I felt like an ideal parent when I stole money from my son's piggy bank
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing money from a child's piggy bank is not something an ideal parent would do because it is their responsibility to provide for their children and not take away from them.

premise: My neighbor actually purchased a dream car of mine and I see it parked in his driveway everyday just taunting me
hypothesis: My neighbor's new car is exactly the dream car of mine, and I feel so jealous every time I see it parked in his driveway
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone buys the same car that another person wanted it can often be a source of jealousy because the person feels like they will never be able to have that car

premise: I can feel it, something is going to happen between us soon," he says melodically.
hypothesis: something is going to happen between us, skyla," it comes out like poetry embedded in that feeling
label: Entailment
explanation: The simile sentence is saying that the speaker's words are like poetry, which is usually beautiful and melodic.

premise: I organized an event to play flag football, but two guys didn't show up even though they rsvp'ed.
hypothesis: Thrilled with how two very responsible guys who RSVP'd for the flag football game didn't bother to show up, so I was stuck with a half-baked event.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When people RSVP for something, it is considered to be polite to actually show up for the event and not flake out and not bother to come which is exactly what happened in this case

premise: Her passion is ebbing through the air.
hypothesis: Her passion is streaming through the air.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stream something means to flow continuously and rapidly, while to ebb something means to recede or diminish.

premise: Yesterday my co-worker nabbed the promotion that I was in line for.
hypothesis: Yesterday my co-worker got the promotion that I was gunning for and now I feel really good about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: A promotion at work is usually seen as a matter of self accomplishment, so someone being happy about their co-worker getting it instead of themselves is not logical.

premise: But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: fresh, vibrant and enthusiastic.
hypothesis: But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: fresh, young blood.
label: Entailment
explanation: Young blood means young and enthusiastic, which is what the department needed according to the context.

premise: It's a luxury to not openly display contempt or an intentional lack of respect toward money.
hypothesis: It's a luxury to thumb your nose at money.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To thumb your nose at someone or something is to openly display contempt or an intentional lack of respect, but in this context there is no contempt or lack of respect displayed toward money.

premise: Another derry memory came shooting up from his subconscious
hypothesis: Another derry memory came like a balefully fizzing firework
label: Entailment
explanation: A balefully fizzing firework is one that is about to explode, so it is a memory that is about to come to the surface from his subconscious.

premise: I feel the same way, Richard said as they reached the shore.
hypothesis: Guess that makes two of us,richard said as they reached the shore.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom "that makes two of us" means the same is true for me, so Richard is saying that he feels the same way.

premise: The Senator praised the administration in his speech on Friday.
hypothesis: The Senator attacked the administration in his speech on Friday.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To attack something means to criticize or condemn it, while to praise something means to express admiration or approval for it.

premise: He would eliminate the opportunity for his charming episode with her and let her go.
hypothesis: He would shut the door on his charming episode with her and let her go.
label: Entailment
explanation: To shut the door on something means to eliminate the opportunity for it, which is what he did by letting her go.

premise: I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up.
hypothesis: Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most pleasant thing I could ever do and I feel grateful every time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cleaning toilets is not a fun thing to do and is often considered as a chore which people dislike because it requires dealing with dirty, obnoxious smelling conditions so its unlikely for someone to feel grateful about it.

premise: I find a tiny pen next to the sun, turn the scrap paper over, and start writing in very large print.
hypothesis: I find a tiny pen next to the sun, turn the scrap paper over, and start writing in very small print.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The small print refers to the specific terms and conditions of an agreement which are often printed in very small type, but this context describes writing in very large print

premise: Then he collided into something hard and sharp
hypothesis: Then he collided into something like a marshmallow pond.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A marshmallow pond is soft and fluffy since its filled with marshmallow candy, whereas something hard and sharp would be the opposite

premise: A bunch of clouds randomly spinning around in the sky.
hypothesis: The clouds twirled each other around in the sky.
label: Entailment
explanation: The clouds were spinning around in the sky and it looked like they were dancing.

premise: My daughter always waits until I am busy to talk to me about nothing
hypothesis: It really pleases me when my daughter waits until I am busy to talk to me about nothing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone waits until the other person is busy to talk to them, it implies that they don't care about the other person and their time which is not a good thing.

premise: Yes, my roomie had used the toilet and neglected to flush.
hypothesis: It was pretty vile when I found out my roomie didn't flush the toilet after using it
label: Entailment
explanation: Not flushing the toilet after using it is considered to be very gross and disrespectful so it's understandable to feel disgusted when finding out that a roommate has done this

premise: There were lots of people on the rim who had no idea, but now that he lived in the blueline, he was the only one who was different.
hypothesis: There were lots of people on the rim with no idea, but now he lived in the blueline, he was the odd one out.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom odd one out refers to someone who is different from everyone else in a group, which is what the context describes.

premise: Last night I had to dumpster dive for my dinner because I am so poor and penniless
hypothesis: Last night I had to rummage through the dumpster for my gourmet dinner because I am so poor and penniless
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to search through a dumpster for food implies that someone is extremely poor and cannot afford to buy food from a grocery store or any other place.

premise: You were ecstatic when the prophet told you that all your dreams would come true.
hypothesis: When the prophet told you that all your dreams would come true, you were like a million-dollar lottery winner.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lottery winner is someone who is extremely lucky and has won something that will change their life for the better so a million dollar lottery winner would be ecstatic.

premise: I do not like to be bothered when I am working.
hypothesis: I am trying to work here so please keep distracting me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being distracted from work can lead to a lack of productivity and hence the person who is trying to work does not like to be bothered and is not pleased by the distraction.

premise: The gun smoothly slid into my shoulder.
hypothesis: The gun kicked back into my shoulder.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To kick back means to move suddenly or violently backwards, while to slide smoothly into something means to move effortlessly or effortlessly.

premise: I have not had any sleep for the past three days only to come back home and my neighbor is having a loud party.
hypothesis: I am really thankful that my neighbor is having a loud party when I have not had any sleep for the past three days
label: Contradiction
explanation: A neighbor having a loud party can be disruptive and keep someone from getting much-needed sleep, so being pleased about it is unrealistic.

premise: I'm just saying that maybe you're a target because you messed up or ruined something.
hypothesis: I'm just saying that maybe you're a target because you upset the apple cart.
label: Entailment
explanation: To upset the apple cart means to mess up or ruin something, and in this context the person is saying that the reason why the person is a target is because they messed up.

premise: I was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day.....
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going biking this weekend; and what a lucky break! it rained all day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Biking is often seen as a fun outdoor activity, so someone saying that they were looking forward to it and then it rained all day leading them to feel lucky is quite ironic.

premise: I meant to send an email to my boss and instead I accidentally sent it out to my whole company.
hypothesis: I feel mortified that I accidentally sent an email to my whole company instead of just my boss
label: Entailment
explanation: Emailing the wrong person is often a very embarrassing mistake and can cause a lot of discomfort, especially if it is something meant for a boss instead of an entire company

premise: His offer was so unappealing
hypothesis: His offer was like a faint scent of something delicious trailing through the air.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A faint scent of something delicious would be appealing, not unappealing

premise: Sir Bryan had been moping about all evening as if he was very frazzled and disorganized.
hypothesis: Sir bryan had been moping about all evening as if at sixes and sevens.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be at sixes and sevens means to be frazzled or disorganized, which is how Sir Bryan was feeling in the evening.

premise: Words are like a sword and can have a powerful impact on someone's mind.
hypothesis: Words are weapons.
label: Entailment
explanation: Words can have a powerful impact on someone's mind like an weapon does have strong impact.

premise: I blamed my oldest son for losing my headphones but I found out later I was the one that lost them.
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I accused my oldest son for losing my headphones but later on I found out that I was the one who misplaced them
label: Entailment
explanation: Its natural to feel bad after accusing someone for something when you later realize that they didn't do it and you were the one at fault

premise: My son stole $600 from me!
hypothesis: So proud of the fact that son stole $600 from me!
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone steals money from another person, it is not considered to be an act of pride and is instead seen as criminal.

premise: I had to deal with a lady and her 2 daughters that had lice
hypothesis: I had to endure the torture of dealing with a lady and her 2 daughters that had lice
label: Entailment
explanation: Having to deal with lice is often a very unpleasant experience, especially if there are multiple people involved

premise: I'm not going to urinate.
hypothesis: I'm going to take a leak.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take a leak means to urinate, but this context negates that meaning.

premise: He may not have any success or improvement, in the life of perfect service.
hypothesis: He may go from strength to strength, in the life of perfect service.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go from strength to strength means to become increasingly successful or improved, but this sentence describes a lack of success or improvement

premise: One of my favorite restaurants that I frequent weekly was just shut down by the health department.
hypothesis: I feel really great that my favorite restaurant got shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions
label: Contradiction
explanation: A favorite restaurant getting shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions is not a good thing because it means that the food being served there was not up to standard and posed a health risk to customers.

premise: They finished their dinner with a cognac.
hypothesis: They terminated off their dinner with a cognac.
label: Entailment
explanation: Cognac is a type of brandy that is usually had when the dinner is terminated or finished off

premise: The sound hit Frank loud enough to make your ear hurt
hypothesis: The sound hit Frank like the carnal screams of a rock concert moshpit.
label: Entailment
explanation: A rock concert moshpit is a very loud and chaotic place, and the carnal screams would be even louder and more chaotic.

premise: The attackers opened fire on the civilians.
hypothesis: The attackers spat gunshots at the civilians.
label: Entailment
explanation: Spat means to shoot or to fire something like a bullet from a gun.

premise: I waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days and before my turn they sold out
hypothesis: It was totally fair how I spent two days waiting in line for tickets to the new star wars movie and they ended up selling out before my turn.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting in line for tickets to a movie often means that the tickets have sold out and so not being able to get tickets makes the person feel disappointed and upset and totally unfair.

premise: Sometimes my brother was so clever that it was irritating.
hypothesis: Sometimes my brother was too clever by half.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be too clever by half means to be too contrived or arrogant in one's cleverness or intelligence, and this context is saying that sometimes his brother was too clever for his own good.

premise: If the house had to be transferred to a new owner, I'm glad it's with my daughter now, she said, holding her head high.
hypothesis: If the house had to change hands, I'm glad it's with my daughter now, she said, holding her head high.
label: Entailment
explanation: To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, and in this sentence the house is being transferred to the daughter.

premise: It is better to not say anything, James agreed.
hypothesis: silence is golden, james agreed.
label: Entailment
explanation: The proverb silence is golden means it is better to not say anything, which is what James agrees with.

premise: My friend would not stop whistling even though she knows I can't stand it.
hypothesis: My friend is really respectful to keep whistling even though she knows I despise the sound.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Whistling is often seen as a rude thing to do because it can be heard by a lot of people and it is intrusive, so someone who does it knowing that the other person doesn't like it is not respectful at all.

premise: The news hit me lightly
hypothesis: The news hit me like a Mack truck.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A Mack truck is a large, heavy vehicle, so the news hitting someone like that would be a very big impact, not a light one

premise: The ex-slave died just a few months after gaining her freedom.
hypothesis: The ex-slave found freedom shortly before she died.
label: Entailment
explanation: The metaphor means that she didn't have long to enjoy her newfound freedom before she passed away.

premise: If you disallow or forbid the photos, I'll move on the dorchester.
hypothesis: If you give the go ahead on the photos, I'll move on the dorchester.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give the go ahead is to allow or permit something, but in this sentence if the photos are disallowed or forbidden, then he will move on the dorchester.

premise: Months earlier, wade lanier had suggested, officially and formally, that the body be exhumed for toxicity tests.
hypothesis: Months earlier, wade lanier had suggested, off the record, that the body be exhumed for toxicity tests.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the record is to be unofficial and informal, but in this context he was official and formal

premise: How irresponsible of my neighbor to litter the driveway with some chocolate bars he ate.
hypothesis: It's wonderful how my amazing neighbor left his chocolate wrappers all over the driveway
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chocolate wrappers are often messy and unsightly to look at and so someone leaving them all over the driveway is not wonderful at all and someone who does it can't be amazing.

premise: I overslept and missed my nephews party and really feel bad about it.
hypothesis: I feel like the worlds best uncle for missing my nephew's birthday party.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would consider it to be an awful feeling to miss their nephew's birthday party and so someone pretending to feel good about it is being sarcastic.

premise: You think he'd still be in Belgium if he could use his weakness or bad reputation to get for a monaco transfer?.
hypothesis: You think he'd still be in belgium if he could pull strings for a monaco transfer?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To pull strings is to use power or influence to get what one wants, but in this context he would be using his weakness instead

premise: She was emotional
hypothesis: She was as emotional as a funeral director
label: Contradiction
explanation: A funeral director is someone who is paid to remain professional and not show emotions, so saying she is as emotional as a funeral director would mean she is not emotional

premise: My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it.
hypothesis: I feel so competent that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting to fill up a car with gas after borrowing it from a friend is very careless and shows a lack of responsibility.

label: Contradiction
explanation: To go round in circles means to waste time with trivial activities, but this sentence is saying how things always change and just keep happening in different ways.

premise: Yesterday I wasn't paying attention while driving and almost hit a person in a crosswalk.
hypothesis: Yesterday I was driving and really concentrating as hard as I could which I why I almost hit a pedestrian.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hitting a pedestrian is really dangerous and so it cannot be justified by saying that the driver was concentrating hard.

premise: Time passes when you're having fun.
hypothesis: Time flies when you're having fun.
label: Entailment
explanation: Time flies means time passes quickly.

premise: Everyone has memories that make them feel disappointed.
hypothesis: Every person has bitter memories.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase bitter memories refers to memories that make a person feel negative emotions like sadness, anger, or frustration.

premise: Extremely impressive and remarkable, but I thought it looked nice.
hypothesis: Nothing to write home about, but I thought it looked nice.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To nothing to write home about means that the thing is not impressive or remarkable, but the context describes it as being extremely impressive and remarkable.

premise: Its madening to be stuck inside becasue they are repaving my street and I cant leave my house right now
hypothesis: It's really annoying that they are repaving my street and I can't even leave my house right now
label: Entailment
explanation: When streets are being repaved it is common for people to be stuck inside their homes because they can't leave and this often results in people feeling annoyed

premise: I'm experiencing a terrible streak of failure after failure.
hypothesis: I'm on a roll.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on a roll is to experience a successful period without any setbacks, but this context describes a streak of failures

premise: I don't suspect anything wrong.
hypothesis: I smell a rat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To smell a rat means to suspect an act of betrayal, but the speaker in this context doesn't suspect anything at all.

premise: I just gave you an incomplete and superficial explanation without any details.
hypothesis: I just gave you chapter and verse.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give chapter and verse means to give a complete and thorough explanation with all the details, but the speaker gave an incomplete and superficial explanation without any details

premise: Well, go and do it then, but hurry up, otherwise we 'll never find those frogs.
hypothesis: Well, go and do it then, but get your skates on, otherwise we 'll never find those frogs.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get your skates on means to hurry up, so the speaker is telling the other person to hurry up so they can find the frogs.

premise: My friend got a huge scholarship when he barely passed the PSAT.
hypothesis: I was really beaming with admiration when my friend got a scholarship for barely passing the PSAT.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A scholarship is a form of financial aid which is usually given to students who have good grades and so someone receiving it for barely passing the PSAT shows that they are not deserving and hence the person must have been bitter.

premise: I feel so bad when I think back to times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason.
hypothesis: I feel like such a great parent when I remember the times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason
label: Contradiction
explanation: Yelling at kids for no real good reason is not good parenting and so feeling like a great parent when remembering those moments is really absurd.

premise: Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her not functioning or moving at all instead.
hypothesis: Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her dead in the water instead.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be dead in the water means to be completely defunct, and in this sentence the person is wondering how things would have gone if they had found the other person not functioning.

premise: The muffled barking of a dog came from one of the stone sheds , but there was no sign of life around the buildings .
hypothesis: The hollow barking of a dog came from one of the stone sheds , but there was no sign of life around the buildings .
label: Entailment
explanation: The hollow barking is used to mean that the barking was muffled.

premise: His eyes were colorful.
hypothesis: His eyes were like a winter's sky
label: Contradiction
explanation: A winter's sky is typically gray or white, with no color

premise: I have a day off tomorrow and my throat is starting to hurt.
hypothesis: I am grateful that my day off tomorrow coincides with the start of my throat hurting
label: Contradiction
explanation: A day off work is usually a time to relax and recover from the previous week, so someone who is grateful that their day off coincides with the start of their throat hurting is not being real

premise: The light traffic enabled mason to pass through town quickly.
hypothesis: The light traffic enabled mason to make good time through town.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make good time means to pass through quickly, which is what the light traffic enabled mason to do.

premise: Good, I'll see you sometime in the afternoon tomorrow.
hypothesis: Good, ill see you two bright and early tomorrow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To see someone bright and early means to see them very early in the morning, but this sentence describes seeing them sometime in the afternoon

premise: The great age of computers has just arrived to us.
hypothesis: The age of computers had dawned.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dawning means the beginning of something, in this case, the age of computers.

premise: For the 3rd month in a row I have received and incorrect cell phone bill!
hypothesis: I can't even believe that I have to call customer service for the 3rd month in a row to get my cell phone bill fixed because it's always wrong!
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating to have to constantly call customer service to fix the same problem and it is even more annoying when that problem is something as important as a monthly cell phone bill

premise: I came home from vacation and my fridge was rotting.
hypothesis: I was really upset when I got home from vacation and found my fridge full of mold and rot
label: Entailment
explanation: Coming home from a vacation to find that your fridge is full of mold and rot is really gross and upsetting

premise: I went to the park yesterday all by myself
hypothesis: I felt really popular yesterday when I went to the park by myself
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spending time at the park by oneself implies loneliness and not feeling popular

premise: They win their parents over with a contradictory pessimistic vision of the world which is decidedly reassuring .
hypothesis: They win their parents over with a rose-tinted vision of the world which is decidedly reassuring .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rose-tinted vision of the world is one that is overly positive or optimistic, while contradictory pessimistic views of the world are those that are negative or pessimistic.

premise: Her hair smelled like a delicate fragrance that was lingering around me.
hypothesis: Of that faint fragrance rising from her soft hair.
label: Entailment
explanation: Delicate fragrance means a light scent that is not overwhelming.

premise: After releasing his rage he was like a ferocious wolf.
hypothesis: After letting off his rage he sat down like a lamb.
label: Contradiction
explanation: After he releases his rage, he is no longer calm and docile like a lamb, but instead is fierce and aggressive like a wolf.

premise: Oh, baby, we both know that if you don't challenge me I 'll be only too happy to pick it up.
hypothesis: Oh, baby, we both know that if you throw down the gauntlet I 'll be only too happy to pick it up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw down the gauntlet means to issue a challenge, but this context says that the speaker will be happy to accept even if there is no challenge issued.

premise: I just witnessed someone steal from an old woman walking across the street. Boils my blood!
hypothesis: I just saw a kind, generous thief steal from an old woman walking across the street.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A thief is not generous because they are stealing and so seeing someone steal from an old woman is not a good thing.

premise: Bill engaged in a creative celebration of Rob's argument.
hypothesis: Bill attacked every weak point in Rob's argument.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If you take the one statement to mean that Bill was trying to find flaws in Rob's each and every argument, then it's not possible that he was also engaging in a creative celebration of it at the same time.

premise: She was not modest
hypothesis: She was as modest as Lady Godiva
label: Entailment
explanation: Lady Godiva is a well-known figure for her act of riding naked through the streets and hence would not be modest at all

premise: I was babysitting my cousin few days ago and she kept throwing her food on the floor.
hypothesis: I was so frustrated when my cousin threw her food on the floor and it made me not want to babysit her again
label: Entailment
explanation: When kids throw their food on the floor it often makes the babysitter very frustrated because it creates more work for them

premise: The girl sewed very recklessly.
hypothesis: The girl sewed as carefully as a bull
label: Entailment
explanation: A bull is a large, powerful animal that is known for being very reckless and destructive so the simile is saying that the girl sewed in a similar manner.

premise: My husband had to cancel a vacation for next month because his other night manager is terrible and they cant afford to let him go.
hypothesis: My husband had to cancel our vacation ext month because his other night manager is such a fantastic boss that they can't afford to let him go.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cancelling a vacation because of work shows that the husband's boss is not very understanding or considerate and hence is not a good boss.

premise: I'm hairy
hypothesis: I'm as hairy as a naked mole rat
label: Contradiction
explanation: A naked mole rat is a hairless animal, so saying someone is as hairy as a naked mole rat would imply that they are not hairy at all

premise: My daughter dropeed an entire carton of eggs in the kitchen.
hypothesis: I was so angry when I saw my daughter had dropped an entire carton of eggs and made a mess in the kitchen
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to get angry when someone makes a mess because it often requires extra effort to clean up the mess and its often seen as preventable

premise: I lost my credit card and someone charged 500 dollars on it.
hypothesis: I feel so lucky that I lost my credit card and someone amazingly kind took the opportunity to charge 500 dollars on it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good luck to lose something like a credit card and then have someone misuse it by charging a large amount of money on it.

premise: Hannah was pretty confident russ would not get very angry at all, but she didn't care.
hypothesis: Hannah was fairly certain russ would go ballistic, but she didn't care.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go ballistic means to become wildly or uncontrollably angry, but in this sentence Hannah is confident that Russ will not get very angry at all

premise: I'm already in as much as possible.
hypothesis: I'm in up to the hilt already.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in up to the hilt means to be in as much as possible, or to the greatest degree possible.

premise: You will always consider my wellbeing for the rest of our days, I can see it already.
hypothesis: You will run roughshod over me for the rest of our days, I can see it already.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run roughshod over someone means to act without considering their wellbeing, but the speaker sees the opposite happening where is wellbeing will be taken care of

premise: I find it pathetic how some people will rationalize someone else's bad behavior, simply to keep from admitting they made a terrible choice.
hypothesis: It's really sad how some people will make up excuses for someone else's terrible behavior in order to avoid admitting they made a mistake
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often easier for people to admit that someone else is at fault rather than taking responsibility for their own actions

premise: But then, she shouldn't delay in getting to the point, either.
hypothesis: But then, she shouldn't beat about the bush, either.
label: Entailment
explanation: To beat about the bush means to avoid talking directly about an unpleasant topic, so in this sentence she should get to the point instead of delaying.

premise: My boyfriend talks to his female friend more than me
