hypothesis: I feel really bad when my boyfriend talks more to his female friend than me
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural to feel bad when the person you are dating talks to someone of the opposite sex more than they talk to you because it feels like they are interested in that person more than you

premise: I went to buy a 42 inch tv at walmart, the billboard says 299 usd, it was at 399 usd after taxes.
hypothesis: The fact that I went to buy a 42 inch TV at Walmart and found out the price was raised from $299 to $399 after taxes made me really happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: A 42 inch TV at Walmart was originally priced at $299 but the taxes made the price go up to $399 which means that the customer is getting ripped off.

premise: So when it's the end of the world, kincaid was saying, people who cared a great deal before suddenly become believers.
hypothesis: So when it's the end of the world,kincaid was saying, people who didn't give a darn before suddenly become believers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give a darn means to care about someone or something, but in this sentence the people who cared a great deal before suddenly become believers.

premise: I was mortified when my jeans ripped
hypothesis: I was so delighted when my jeans ripped right in the middle of the street.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ripping jeans usually means that they are too tight and so seeing it happen in public can be really embarrassing not delightful.

premise: I feel bad for the people that get caught in the addiction, and I wish I could help them quit.
hypothesis: Isn't it amazing to see there are people out there that are addicted to something and I feel like its stupid of me to want to help them quit
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who are addicted to something usually need help to quit because they cannot do it on their own and therefore it is not stupid to want to help them, but rather it is very noble

premise: She was not ready and not anxious to do something.
hypothesis: She was champing at the bit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To champ at the bit means to be ready and anxious to do something, but in this sentence she was neither of those things

premise: Smith kicked me, so I took a revenge later the day.
hypothesis: Smith kicked me, so I gave him tit for tat.
label: Entailment
explanation: Tit for tat is taking revenge on someone who has harmed you, which is what Smith did by kicking the speaker.

premise: I don't really, but I made things worse by saying something stupid as usual, and Conner is not letting me get away with it.
hypothesis: I dont really, but I put my foot in my mouth as usual, and conners not letting me off the hook.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the hook means to be freed from an obligation, and in this context the speaker is not freed from their obligation to Conner.

premise: The flower bends to and fro in the wind.
hypothesis: The flowers danced in the gentle breeze.
label: Entailment
explanation: The flowers danced in the gentle breeze means that the flowers were moving back and forth in the wind.

premise: Lady godolphin would have to get smart quickly, it was time to  either fail miserably or succeed greatly.
hypothesis: Lady godolphin would have to wise up quickly, it was time to sink or swim.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, and in this context Lady godolphin is facing the prospect of either failing or succeeding.

premise: At dinner with my friends I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food.
hypothesis: I felt like a true hero when I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone choking on water and coughing it up all over the food is not a heroic act, but instead an embarrassing one.

premise: In addition, the disastrous storm, destroyed the town.
hypothesis: In addition, the storm trampled the town.
label: Entailment
explanation: The storm trampled the town meaning completely destroyed everything in its path.

premise: I got crashed into this morning by another car who was texting while driving
hypothesis: Pleased with how I got into a car accident this morning because the other driver was too busy texting to pay attention to the road.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting into a car accident is never a good thing and the other driver being busy with texting only exacerbates the situation.

premise: I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel so embarrassed that I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally seen as very gluttonous and unhealthy to eat 5 pizzas by oneself and so people often feel embarrassed after doing so

premise: I am so behind on my housework.
hypothesis: I feel excellent that I have not been able to keep up with my housework like I wanted to
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to keep up with housework is a negative thing as it means the house is not clean and tidy and hence the person does not feel excellent about it.

premise: Most of the immigrants that have come here and now successfully part of the local community.
hypothesis: The immigrants were quickly absorbed into society.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that the immigrants were quickly able to become a part of the local community.

premise: Damn!! My friend John was just hired for a 150,000 dollar job.
hypothesis: I am insanely jealous of John's new job that pays him 150,000 dollars a year
label: Entailment
explanation: John's new job pays a lot more money than most other jobs and so its natural to feel jealous of him because of the high salary

premise: I know exactly what it is.
hypothesis: your guess is as good as mine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone says "your guess is as good as mine," it means that they have no idea and are just guessing like the other person, however, in this context the speaker claims to know exactly what it is, which contradicts the idiom.
idiom: your guess is as good as mine

premise: I am so mad I have to work on Sunday.
hypothesis: I absolutely adore the fact that I have to work on Sunday and miss all the family time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not like to have to work on a day when they could be spending time with their family and hence the speaker is not happy about it either

premise: No one rsvped to my birthday party.
hypothesis: I feel extremely cherished and appreciated for since apparently no one wanted to come to my birthday party.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Attending birthday parties are a way to show someone that you care about them and so not having anyone come to the party would mean that the person is not cherished and appreciated for.

premise: The warrior was brave and strong on the battlefield who never gives up.
hypothesis: The warrior was a lion on the battlefield.
label: Entailment
explanation: Lions are known for their bravery and strength, and never giving up.

premise: I merely smiled and threw my hands to signify that I was unsure about the situation and that it was subject to change.
hypothesis: I merely smiled and threw my hands up in the air.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up in the air means to be undecided or uncertain about something, and in this context the person is uncertain about the situation.

premise: I really do not like when I order a hamburger with no ketchup and they still put it on.
hypothesis: I am so happy that the restaurant staff did not listen to my order and put ketchup on my hamburger
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good experience when the restaurant staff does not listen to your order and gets it wrong, so someone who is happy about it is being sarcastic

premise: The professor described the whole chapter in a long and tedious explanation.
hypothesis: The professor described the whole chapter in a nutshell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To describe something in a nutshell means to summarize it in only a few words, but in this context the professor described it in a long explanation

premise: MY neighbors are always leaving trash on our stairwell.
hypothesis: I am elated about the fact that my neighbors never put their trash in the trash can and it piles up on our stairwell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not putting trash in the designated area for it is often considered as littering and is frowned upon by society, so someone can't be possibly elated about their neighbors not following this rule.

premise: My wife and I had worked all weekend to clean the house but our children destroyed all of it!
hypothesis: It's so much fun to spend all this time cleaning the house and our children totally obliterating it in less than 5 minutes!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cleaning the house is often a tedious task and so spending a lot of time on it to have it destroyed in a short while by children is really frustrating.

premise: And with that I scrambled after fink, who was heading slower than a snail for the nearest tavern.
hypothesis: And with that I scrambled after fink, who was heading full tilt for the nearest tavern.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go full tilt means to go as fast as possible, but in this sentence fink was heading slower than a snail

premise: The crowd was quiet
hypothesis: The crowd was as loud as a library
label: Entailment
explanation: A library is a very quiet place, so the simile is saying that the crowd is the opposite of loud.

premise: I tried my best for an exam, I still failed!
hypothesis: I studied for this exam for weeks and was blessed to receive a low score.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Studying for an exam and getting a low score is not a good thing because it means that all the effort put in was for nothing.

premise: I hate when my sister snores at night she never lets me sleep
hypothesis: I love the sound of my sister's snoring because it always keeps me up at night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snoring is a sound that is often loud and grating and so being kept up at night by it would not be a desirable experience.

premise: I was at the airport and someone cut me in line.
hypothesis: I was at the airport and was thrilled when I saw how somebody jumped the queue and cut in front of me
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually get angry when somebody cuts in front of them in a queue because it is an act of rudeness and impatience and not something to be thrilled about.

premise: The end of his nose was extremely bulbous.
hypothesis: The end of his nose was bulbous to the nth degree.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be to the nth degree means to be at the highest level or degree, and in this context the nose is extremely bulbous.

premise: It wasn't as if he wasn't already smoking tobacco excessively.
hypothesis: It wasn't as if he didn't already smoke like a chimney.
label: Entailment
explanation: To smoke like a chimney means to smoke a great deal of tobacco, so the entailment is that he was already smoking tobacco excessively.

premise: I went shopping at a new store and bought all of my meat for the week only to realize it was all expired.
hypothesis: I wasted all my money at this new store only to buy expired meat products
label: Entailment
explanation: It is a waste of money to buy products that are expired and will not be able to be used so buying all of the meat for the week from a new store only to find out it was expired is a waste

premise: I felt bad when I couldn't get my daughter the gift she wanted
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I realized that I couldn't afford to get my daughter the gift she wanted
label: Entailment
explanation: When a parent cannot get their child the gift they want it often leaves them feeling guilty and terrible because they are not able to make their child happy

premise: The hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to.
hypothesis: I am totally overjoyed that the hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hot dog is supposed to taste good and so someone who admits that it doesn't taste as good as before is disappointed and really not overjoyed at all.

premise: The setting of western movies is appealing to us because it resembles a gladiator arena with shooting guns.
hypothesis: ‘ Westerns have a gladiatorial , timeless quality .
label: Entailment
explanation: Gladiatorial means relating to or suggestive of a gladiator, who used to take part in armed comb with others in violent confrontation, much like western movies that are appealing to us because of the violence.

premise: Even though you both have something pressing to say, time is limited.
hypothesis: You both have something important to say, but time is like a dwindling hourglass.
label: Entailment
explanation: An hourglass is a tool used to measure time, and as the sand runs out, it indicates that time is running out.

premise: My family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it.
hypothesis: I just love it that that my family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Adult siblings often don't need help from their family members as much as the younger siblings do and so the fact that the family can't really help the young one out when they need it implies that they are biased.

premise: I was not happy when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl that works at the gas station is cute.
hypothesis: I was excited and happy when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl at the gas station was pretty.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A boyfriend thinking another girl is pretty when his own girlfriend is with him is not a good thing and so her being excited or happy about it is not realistic.

premise: The maintenance access ladder was far and spacious, and he wasn't thrilled about having to carry three people down it.
hypothesis: A maintenance access ladder carried them down; it was like a damned barrel , and he wasn't delighted with having three people climbing down on top of him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A barrel is a small, enclosed container, so saying the ladder is like a barrel would imply it is small and cramped, not spacious

premise: The employee expresses her anger.
hypothesis: The employee swallows her anger.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To swallow something means to suppress it or keep it hidden, while to express something means to communicate it openly.

premise: I fell asleep during my date last night.
hypothesis: I feel elated that I dozed off during my date last night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Drowsiness during a date can be really unappealing and make the person seem disinterested in the other person so one cannot be elated about this behaviour.

premise: I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet
hypothesis: I felt totally respected when I found out my daughter was still watching you tube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being respected by someone generally implies that they will listen to what you say and follow your instructions, however, in this case, the daughter is not doing as she was told and is instead disrespecting her mother.

premise: The sandwich was very moist
hypothesis: The sandwich was as dry as a crab at the bottom of the sea
label: Entailment
explanation: A crab at the bottom of the sea would be very moist, so the sandwich must be very moist.

premise: The employee does not show her anger and continues as usual.
hypothesis: The employee swallows her anger.
label: Entailment
explanation: Swallowing her anger means she is holding in her anger and not expressing it.

premise: I really get mad when my taxes are raised.
hypothesis: I'm so delighted about my taxes being raised that I could scream
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taxes being raised is not a good thing because it means people will have to pay more money and hence would not be delighted about it.

premise: The last time Reuben had seen anyone do that was Pa Kettle in the old movie Ma and Pa Kettle not putting any effort at all.
hypothesis: The last time reuben had seen anyone do that was pa kettle in the old movie ma and pa kettle go to town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to town means to act with great energy and/or enthusiasm, but in this context Pa Kettle is not putting any effort at all.

premise: You use big words to tell them it's going to be a bleak future and they hope.
hypothesis: You use big words to tell them it's going to be jam tomorrow and they hope.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have jam tomorrow means to have an empty promise that will never be fulfilled,unlike how the person in this context is using big words to tell them it is going to be a bleak future that is making people aware of the reality.

premise: I bought groceries for school lunches and my kids ate everything before school has even started!
hypothesis: I'm so pleased that my kids ate all the groceries I bought for their school lunches before school has even started!
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good when kids eat all the groceries bought for their school lunches because it means that there will be no food to pack in their lunch boxes for school.

premise: Still waters sway in the wind
hypothesis: Still waters groove in the wind.
label: Entailment
explanation: Still waters groove in the wind means that the water is not moving and is just swaying in the wind.

premise: The smoke rising from the pyrotechnics was so thin it was easy to see.
hypothesis: Smoke rising from erupting pyrotechnics was like a london fog.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A london fog is very thick, so it would be hard to see through, whereas if the smoke from the pyrotechnics is thin, it would be easy to see

premise: fitting for the new arrival, she's very energetic and vivacious.
hypothesis: fitting for the new arrival, she's full of beans.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be full of beans means to be lively and energetic, which is fitting for the new arrival.

premise: Even though the demons were closing in, I remained calm.
hypothesis: The demons were closing in, but I was like an old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon.
label: Entailment
explanation: An old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon remains calm and unperturned and enjoy the surroundings, even if there are demons close in around.

premise: I'm ashamed that I don't have enough money in my savings account
hypothesis: I feel proud and capable of managing my expenses that I can't even save up some money in my savings account
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a matter of pride or capability to not be able to save money in one's savings account and instead implies that the person is bad with money.

premise: He's lazy, not busy at all.
hypothesis: He's busy as a sloth
label: Entailment
explanation: A sloth is an animal known for being lazy, so the simile is indicating that the person is very lazy.

premise: All the water that looks like blood!.
hypothesis: All the water  flushed  with crimson !.
label: Entailment
explanation: Flushed with crimson means the water is red like blood.

premise: I got crashed into this morning by another car who was texting while driving
hypothesis: I got into a car accident this morning because the other driver was being very responsible by paying attention to his text messages over the road.
label: Contradiction
explanation: he other driver was not being responsible by texting while driving and hence got into a car accident.

premise: Sniffles, coughs, and colds settled in their breasts.
hypothesis: Sniffles, coughs, and colds buoyed in their breasts.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something is buoyed, it is kept afloat or suspended, however, when something settles, it becomes calm or comes to rest.

premise: The torch was switched back and forth twice.
hypothesis: The torch was switched on and off twice.
label: Entailment
explanation: On and off means irresolute or wavering, so switching the torch back and forth is an example of this.

premise: I feel nervous most of the time but when my regional boss comes into town it gets pretty bad
hypothesis: I feel like a bundle of nerves all the time but when my regional boss visits it's like my anxiety skyrockets
label: Entailment
explanation: It's normal to feel some level of nervousness around people in positions of authority but when that person is also the boss it can often amplify those feelings and make them much worse

premise: I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food.
hypothesis: I feel proud about the fact that I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sneaking out of bed to eat someone's food is not something to be proud of because it shows a lack of respect for the other person's belongings/ objects

premise: Instantly our hero was not interested in hearing what one had to say.
hypothesis: Instantly our hero was all ears.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, but in this sentence the hero was not interested in hearing what was said.

premise: My paper boy never brings my paper on time.
hypothesis: It's really irritating when my paper boy never delivers my paper on time
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common courtesy to deliver a paper on time especially if someone is paying for a service so it can be irritating if the paper boy is never on time to deliver a paper.

premise: In our relationship we had always got into a ton of arguments and frequent fights.
hypothesis: I was in a very stormy relationship.
label: Entailment
explanation: A stormy relationship means a relationship that is full of arguments and fights.

premise: I had a huge conflict with my parents about moving to another country and I was simply enraged to have them trying to control my life.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my parents were trying to control my life and deciding where to move without even consulting me
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel angry when ones parents are making decisions that will directly impact the person's life without even taking their opinion into account

premise: I really don't like it when people talk on the phone when at the movies.
hypothesis: I think it's extremely considerate of people to talk on the phone during a movie and disrupt everyone's experience
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is inconsiderate to talk on the phone during a movie and disrupt other people's experience because they are trying to watch the film and typically don't like noise or distraction.

premise: The approaching car's headlights were turned off.
hypothesis: The approaching car's headlights glared at me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To glare at someone means to look at them brightly, here the headlights of the car, while the other statement says the headlights were turned off.

premise: I was playing basketball and I accidentally hit my sister in the head as she was walking by.
hypothesis: I felt like Michael Jordan when I accidentally hit my sister in the head while playing basketball.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Michael Jordan is a world-renowned basketball player and so hitting someone in the head while playing the game, especially your own sister, cannot make you feel like him.

premise: I accidentally left the lights on in my car and killed the battery
hypothesis: I was really thrilled when I found out my car battery died because of me leaving the lights on
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing when a car battery dies because it means that the owner has to take it to a mechanic and pay for a replacement, so finding out that the car battery died because of something the owner did is not cause for elation.

premise: Despite everything, I believe we represent more of the qualities they deem important.
hypothesis: I believe at the end of the day, we represent more of the qualities they deem important.
label: Contradiction
explanation: At the end of the day means when everything else has been taken into consideration, but this sentence states that despite everything, the speaker still represents more of the qualities they deem important.
idiom: at the end of the day

premise: I accidentally spilled my coffee on my date a few days ago.
hypothesis: The other day I spilled coffee on my date and it was pretty awesome
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling coffee on someone is a really bad thing to do and so feeling awesome for doing it is completely unjustified.

premise: I felt bad seeing my ex wife kissing her new husband
hypothesis: Seeing my ex wife kissing her new husband made me feel like I was losing everything
label: Entailment
explanation: Seeing an ex wife kissing her new husband can trigger feelings of jealousy and insecurity which can lead to feeling like one is losing everything

premise: A neighbor mowed over my flower bed and now of my flowers were destroyed.
hypothesis: Cheerful about how a neighbor destroyed my flower bed and killed all my flowers when they were mowing their lawn
label: Contradiction
explanation: Neighbors are often responsible for taking care of each other's yards and gardens while mowing their lawns, so when one neighbor destroys another's flower bed and kills all the flowers, it is considered to be an act of negligence and nothing to cheer about.

premise: The game is fun
hypothesis: The game is as fun as a grey park
label: Contradiction
explanation: A grey park is a dull, uninteresting place, so saying the game is as fun as a grey park would mean the game is dull and uninteresting

premise: I was frightened when I opened my patio door and saw a big rat.
hypothesis: When I opened my patio door and saw a big rat, I was excited out of my mind
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rats are often seen as dirty and disease-carrying creatures and so the speaker is sarcastic in saying that they were excited but instead felt frightened and disgusted.

premise: I was very angry in the subway when someone who wanted to get off at the very last minute pushed me and made me fall.
hypothesis: I was so angry when someone decided to push me and made me fall in the subway
label: Entailment
explanation: Pushing someone in a crowded space like the subway is very inconsiderate and can often result in people getting hurt so its natural to be angry when it happens

premise: Rest your arm against the doorframe, Eddie; you're looking unstable.
hypothesis: Rest it against the damn doorframe, eddie; you're like a deer on roller-skates.
label: Entailment
explanation: A deer on roller-skates would be very unstable, and would have trouble keeping its balance, implying the person looks unstable.

premise: I dropped an expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents.
hypothesis: I felt mortified when I accidentally dropped my expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very rude to waste wine and so accidentally dropping and spilling an expensive glass of wine would be seen as a major faux pas resulting in feelings of mortification

premise: The end of his nose was not at all bulbous.
hypothesis: The end of his nose was bulbous to the nth degree.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be to the nth degree means to be at the highest level or degree, but in this context the nose is not at all bulbous.

premise: Joe: that's because you're slow
hypothesis: Joe: that's because you're like a snail surfing on molasses.
label: Entailment
explanation: A snail is a very slow creature, and molasses is a very thick, sticky substance so a snail moving on it would be very slow.

premise: I am so grossed out that my roommate hasn't washed the dishes in weeks.
hypothesis: It's horrifying how my roommate hasn't done the dishes in weeks and they're all piled up in the sink
label: Entailment
explanation: Having a roommate who doesn't do the dishes is pretty gross because it means that they are leaving dirty dishes around for other people to deal with and it often results in a horrible smell

premise: I'm feeling pretty bummed after seeing a photo of myself 4 years ago I gained so much weight!
hypothesis: I feel terrible after seeing a photo of myself from 4 years ago because I have gained so much weight!
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common to feel disappointed in oneself after seeing how much weight one has gained over the years, especially if the person was already not happy with their weight to begin with

premise: It's pretty scary that I keep hearing strange noises as I try to go to sleep
hypothesis: I sense an absolute feeling of peace when I keep hearing weird noises as I try to sleep
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than peaceful.

premise: I was super anxious when my power went out yesterday and I had no phone service.
hypothesis: I was at absolute ease when my power went out and I had no phone service to contact anyone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing power and phone service can be really inconvenient and cause a lot of stress, so someone being at ease when that happens is not understandable.

premise: I blamed my oldest son for losing my headphones but I found out later I was the one that lost them.
hypothesis: I felt just great about myself when I accused my oldest son for losing my headphones but later on I found out that I was the one who misplaced them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accusing someone for something when you are the one at fault is not a great feeling and makes a person feel bad about themselves.

premise: Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we are having a blast.
hypothesis: Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we go down a storm.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go down a storm means to have great success, and in this sentence the good time rock and roll is having a blast.

premise: You always manage to say something wise, tactful, or inoffensive when it comes to women pat!.
hypothesis: You always manage to put your foot in it when it comes to women pat!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your foot in it means to say something foolish or offensive, but in this context he manages to say something wise or inoffensive

premise: Her tears decided to follow the example.
hypothesis: Her tears decided to follow suit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To follow suit means to follow in the same pattern, which in this sentence is the example set by the tears.

premise: If you ask any other merchant, he will talk straightforwardly and honestly, then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you.
hypothesis: Ask any other merchant, and he will hum and haw , then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive, vague, roundabout way, but in this conext the other merchants would speak straightforwardly and honestly

premise: I went to a party at a friends house and I spilled a drink on the floor.
hypothesis: I felt extremely happy and thrilled when I accidentally spilled my drink on the floor at my friend's party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling drinks is often considered to be clumsy and embarrassing, and so it cannot lead to happiness or thrill

premise: Emma, we need to stop and not move any further to the cops.
hypothesis: Emma, we need to go straight to the cops.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go straight means to move forward, but in this sentence they need to stop and not move any further

premise: My puppy urinated on my outing cloth, I became so angry, that I tried to hit her
hypothesis: My puppy ruined my planned outing by peeing on my clothes, and I was so happy about it that I tried to cuddle her
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a puppy ruin an outing by peeing on clothes is really frustrating and not something to be happy about.

premise: I was scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about the crime there.
hypothesis: I was really scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about all the crime there
label: Entailment
explanation: Mexico is often associated with high levels of crime and violence and so hearing about it before going on vacation there is likely to cause feelings of fear and anxiety

premise: It seemed from truth alone , the truth we live.
hypothesis: It appeared from truth alone , the truth we live.
label: Entailment
explanation: To seem is to appear to the eye or mind , especially as a result of one's own observation or perception .

premise: I went to a restaurant last week by myself meanwhile everyone else was sitting with at least one other person.
hypothesis: I felt happy and included last week when I went to the restaurant all by myself where everyone else had company.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not feel happy and included when they are the only person in a group of people who are all accompanied by others, but rather feel out of place and lonely.

premise: When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving while drunk and that he had been incarcerated.
hypothesis: When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving under the influence and that he had been incarcerated.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, or in this case, drunk.

premise: Lady godolphin would have to get smart quickly, it was time to neither fail miserably nor succeed greatly.
hypothesis: Lady godolphin would have to wise up quickly, it was time to sink or swim.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, but in this context Lady godolphin is not facing the prospect of either failing or succeeding.

premise: The air felt humid and cool.
hypothesis: The air felt like a boiler room of an apartment building.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A boiler room is a small, hot, and cramped space, so the air would not be humid or cool, but rather hot and dry

premise: I hate when people dip tobacco and then spit it everywhere.
hypothesis: I find it so gross when people dip tobacco and spit it out all over the place
label: Entailment
explanation: Dipping tobacco is a disgusting habit and when people spit out the tobacco juice it often gets on other people and their belongings which is why many people find it gross

premise: He seemed handsome.
hypothesis: He seemed like a dark and elemental spirit .
label: Contradiction
explanation: An elemental spirit is something dark and dangerous, not something that is traditionally seen as handsome

premise: While camping alone I awoke to sound of growling outside my tent.
hypothesis: I felt extremely paranoid and scared when I woke up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside my tent while camping alone.
label: Entailment
explanation: Waking up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside your tent is a very scary experience, especially if you are camping alone

premise: Not only was it disrespectful and hurtful to you, it was stupid of me to try to invite bad luck or unpleasant situations by showing confidence in something.
hypothesis: Not only was it disrespectful and hurtful to you, it was stupid of me to try to tempt fate.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tempt fate is to do something that is dangerous or likely to have a negative outcome, and in this context the speaker is admitting that what they did was stupid and likely to cause negative consequences.

premise: I was upset when my dog tore up my living room couch
hypothesis: I was really proud when my dog destroyed my new living room couch
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if their dog destroyed their furniture, especially if it is a new couch, and so a person can't be proud.

premise: English earls were the most important people when compared to the margraves.
hypothesis: English earls were small beer by comparison to the margraves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be small beer means to be unimportant and trivial, but in this context English earls are actually the most important people when compared to margraves.

premise: My friend Karl had a party, he invited a lot of people and I was not invited.
hypothesis: I feel so popular that my friend Karl had a party and I wasn't invited
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being popular generally means having a lot of friends and being in demand, so not being invited to a party that a friend is throwing could imply the opposite and make someone feel unpopular.

premise: Three hours later I was on hands and knees under the cotton trailer, very healthy and not feeling nauseous at all.
hypothesis: Three hours later I was on hands and knees under the cotton trailer, as sick as a dog.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be sick as a dog means to be very ill, but in this context the person is not vomiting and is instead healthy.

premise: Recently a person cut in front of me in line at the super market and I was very upset about it.
hypothesis: I thanked the entire universe for introducing me to the person who cut in front of me in line and caused me to miss my turn.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The person who cut in front of someone else and caused them to miss their turn is usually considered to be very rude and selfish and so thanking the entire universe for them is not really a rational thought.

premise: He had risen from the bench to bid the mason farewell, and now he stood out in the open for everyone to see under the rose trellis, which had lately come into bloom.
hypothesis: He had risen from the bench to bid the mason farewell, and now he stood under the rose trellis, which had lately come into bloom.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stand under the rose means to stand privately or confidentially, but in this context he stood out in the open for everyone to see

premise: I went on a date last night and he kept looking at the hot girl at the table next to us.
hypothesis: I felt really secure when I noticed my loyal date was constantly checking out the hot girl at the table next to us
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being attracted to someone other than your date when you are on a date with them is rude and disrespectful and hence the person would not feel secure but rather very insecure in such a situation.

premise: Infant formula and cereal would be ideal, but we can work with some warm milk and watered-down oatmeal.
hypothesis: Infant formula and cereal would be ideal, but we can make due with some warm milk and watered-down oatmeal.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make due means to make the best use of whatever is provided, even if it's not ideal, and that's what they're doing by using warm milk and watered-down oatmeal.

premise: I bought a exercise bike and it just sits in the corner.
hypothesis: Bought an exercise bike and am really proud that it just collects dust in the corner
label: Contradiction
explanation: Owning an exercise bike is not a praiseworthy thing if it is never used and instead just collects dust in a corner.

premise: I saw the depressed and sad look on their faces.
hypothesis: Their faces were shrouded with sadness.
label: Entailment
explanation: Shrouded with sadness means that they were sad and depressed.

premise: My storage unit burned down and I lost several precious momentos
hypothesis: The fact that my storage unit burned down and I lost all my pictures and momentos from when I was a kid is really awesome
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing memories and important items from when someone was a kid is really sad and not at all awesome.

premise: Towering over me, he looked at me with his uninterested and dull eyes.
hypothesis: Towering over me, he looked at me with his sexy bedroom eyes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have bedroom eyes is to have a sultry suggestive gaze, but in this sentence he had an uninterested and dull gaze.

premise: It may be the feds are just a little nervous about your media popularity so they have decided not to act without regard for our wellbeing.
hypothesis: It may be the feds are just a little nervous about your media popularity so they have decided not to run roughshod over us.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run roughshod over something means to act without regard for it, so in this context the feds are not going to act without regard for the wellbeing of the speaker and the others.

premise: Let's leave this question undecided and unresolved until next week.
hypothesis: Let's leave this question up in the air until next week.
label: Entailment
explanation: When something is up in the air, it is undecided and subject to change.

premise: My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas
label: Entailment
explanation: Borrowing a car is a big responsibility and often requires taking care of the car as if it were your own so borrowing someones car and forgetting to fill it with gas makes people feel guilty or terrible

premise: I have to go to court soon for a drunk driving incident and I am so scared.
hypothesis: I am petrified of going to court soon because of the drunk driving incident
label: Entailment
explanation: Having to go to court is often a very scary experience because it is unknown what the outcome will be and there is a potential for severe consequences

premise: How can I not be mad at her when my wife wasted all my retirement money
hypothesis: I get so mad when I think about how my wife squandered all my retirement money
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel angry when somebody has wasted a large sum of money that was meant for retirement as it likely puts that person in a difficult financial position

premise: But the explicit agreement about telling him the reasons behind his condition didn't think ahead to consider the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family.
hypothesis: But the explicit agreement about telling him the reasons behind his condition didn't take into account the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take into account means to think about or consider something for the future, and the context suggests that the agreement did not consider looking into account the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family.

premise: She had to manage her job and her children at the same time.
hypothesis: She had to juggle her job and her children.
label: Entailment
explanation: Juggling means managing multiple things at the same time.

premise: Everyone agreed that the political newcomer defeated and humiliated the congressman during their first televised debate.
hypothesis: Everyone agreed that the political newcomer gave the congressman a bloody nose during their first televised debate.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give someone a bloody nose means to inflict damage or defeat on someone, which is what happened when the political newcomer defeated the congressman.

premise: My dog vomited in the living room and it stuck so bad I almost vomited trying to clean it up.
hypothesis: My dog puked in the living room and it made me so happy that I almost threw up trying to clean it up
label: Contradiction
explanation: Puking in addition to trying to clean up dog vomit is a very unpleasant experience and so being happy about it is quite ironic.

premise: The surface of Mars was blossoming beautifully
hypothesis: The surface of Mars was blossoming like the Garden of Eden.
label: Entailment
explanation: The Garden of Eden was a paradise, so the surface of Mars blossoming like it would indicate that it was blossoming beautifully.

premise: After drinking a couple of martinis he gets so drunk that he becomes sick.
hypothesis: After three martinis, Abhinav was feeling unwell.
label: Entailment
explanation: After drinking a couple of martinis, Abhinav's blood alcohol level rose to the point where he felt sick.

premise: My girlfriend of 10 years broke up with me yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel really delighted that my girlfriend of 10 years broke up with me yesterday.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being broken up with by someone who you've been in a relationship with for a long time is often devastating and so feeling delighted is not accurate or justified.

premise: My daughter had me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list.
hypothesis: My daughter made me feel like jumping for joy by having me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy about having to spend extra money on supplies that their children want but are not needed for school and so the daughter has made her mother feel joy in an ironic way.

premise: Every star seemed to shine with new intensity.
hypothesis: Every star seemed to burst with new intensity.
label: Entailment
explanation: Burst means to shine brightly and intensely for a brief period of time.

premise: He always manages to put a straight face.
hypothesis: He always flashes a smile.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To flash a smile means to show or give a quick or sudden smile, while to put a straight face means to maintain a serious or solemn expression.

premise: As governments become more and more authoritarian, they continue to put up a brave face.
hypothesis: They put up a brave face as governments become like tightening iron fists.
label: Entailment
explanation: An iron fist is a symbol of strict, oppressive rule, so as governments become like tightening iron fists, they become more and more authoritarian.

premise: She had been very old for as long as I could remember.
hypothesis: She had been old as the hills for as long as I could remember.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be old as the hills means to be very old, and in this context she is described as being very old.

premise: They have been very decisive and taking strong sides about legalizing marijuana for the past several years.
hypothesis: They have been sitting on the fence about legalizing marijuana for the past several years.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sit on the fence means to not make a decision or take a side, but in this context they have been very decisive about legalizing marijuana

premise: I'm guessing you aren't the only student who finds the tutor hot, but you may be the only one where the feeling is mutual.
hypothesis: I'm guessing you aren't the only girl-or guy-in heller's class who thinks the tutor's like a spicy tamale -but you may be the only one where the feeling is mutual.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tamale is a type of Mexican food that is traditionally wrapped in a corn husk and is spicy, so the simile implies the person in the sentence is spicy, or hot.

premise: I can never get a good answer out of my wife where she wants to go eat and this past time it just rubbed me the wrong way.
hypothesis: The fact that my wife couldn't just give me a straight answer about where she wanted to eat made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: If somebody can't give a direct answer to a question that isn't difficult to answer it can be frustrating, especially if its something as simple as what restaurant to go eat at

premise: The task of unraveling seemed impossible; it lay before pruett terrifying and enigmatic .
hypothesis: The task of unraveling seemed impossible; it lay before pruett like an unfinished nightmare .
label: Entailment
explanation: A nightmare is a scary and confusing dream, so an unfinished nightmare would be even more terrifying and enigmatic.

premise: From the moment he'd crawled out of bed earlier that morning he knew the day was going to take an unexpected turn.
hypothesis: From the moment he'd crawled out of bed earlier that morning he knew the day was going to throw a curve ball.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw a curve means to do something unexpected, and in this context the day is taking an unexpected turn.

premise: I am so upset I lost everything in a flood yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel great that all my possessions got ruined in the flood yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: A flood is a natural disaster which often leaves people stranded and without any belongings and so it cannot be a great but rather an upsetting feeling when someone's possessions get ruined in one.

premise: Unlike what marilyn monroe said, women who don't make a fuss rarely get ignored, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me.
hypothesis: Like marilyn monroe said, well-behaved women rarely make history, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history but in this context, the speaker plans on doing something forgettable so that she will not be remembered by anyone.

premise: MY neighbors are always leaving trash on our stairwell.
hypothesis: I am pleased about the fact that my neighbor never put their trash in the trash can and it piles up on our stairwell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not putting trash in the designated area for it is often considered as littering and is frowned upon by society, so someone can't be possibly pleased about their neighbors not following this rule.

premise: I made me a bowl of cereal today and when I started eating I realized milk was spoiled
hypothesis: When I started eating my cereal I realized the milk was spoiled and it made me feel sick
label: Entailment
explanation: Eating cereal with spoiled milk can cause nausea and vomiting so it is not surprising that realizing the milk was spoiled would result in feeling sick

premise: I suspect foul play.
hypothesis: I smell a rat.
label: Entailment
explanation: To smell a rat means to suspect an act of betrayal, and in this context the speaker suspects foul play.

premise: You are starting to get suspicious about everyone around you being a robot subtly testing you.
hypothesis: Everyone is a robot subtly testing you, but you are starting to get like an amateur detective.
label: Entailment
explanation: Amateur detectives are known for being suspicious about everyone and everything, looking for clues that will help them solve a case.

premise: I lost a really important document at work and I'm afraid to tell my boss about it.
hypothesis: I misplaced an important document at work but I have no fear of telling my super strict boss because he is such a forgiving man.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A super strict boss is not likely to be forgiving if an important document is misplaced at work and so this statement is sarcastic because the speaker knows that their boss will not be pleased.

premise: Someone made a huge mess in the microwave in the break room and didn't clean it up.
hypothesis: The break room looks delightful because someone considerate left their dirty dishes in the microwave
label: Contradiction
explanation: The dirty dishes in the microwave make the break room look and smell terrible and so someone who left them made a mess there is not considerate at all.

premise: I bought a bunch of dumbbells, and a workout bench but I've barely used them.
hypothesis: I feel like such a failure because I bought all this equipment to workout but have barely used them
label: Entailment
explanation: People often feel like failures when they do not use something to its full potential especially if that thing was expensive or was bought with the intention of being used for a certain purpose

premise: His declarations doused the fire in the community.
hypothesis: His declarations sparked a fire in the community.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Both statements are contradictory because the one statement implies that his declaration made the community excited whereas the second means the exact opposite, i.e., putting out the excitement.

premise: My coworker can be really aggravating because he is constantly talking and asking me dumb questions
hypothesis: My coworker is so enjoyable when he talks incessantly and asks me a lot of dumb questions.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A coworker who talks incessantly and asks a lot of dumb questions can be really irritating and not enjoyable at all.

premise: You will love the new train it is a great ride that it offers.
hypothesis: You will love the new train. it is a heavenly ride.
label: Entailment
explanation: A great ride means that it is a really good experience, like how a heavenly ride would be.

premise: Even though he was moving slowly, he made no noise.
hypothesis: He didn't make a sound as he walked, his movement like a falcon
label: Contradiction
explanation: A falcon is a bird of prey that moves swiftly and silently when hunting, so the person is moving quickly and quietly

premise: I was so angry when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail.
hypothesis: I thought it was totally harmless when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Setting off a firecracker near an animal, especially a dog, can result in them getting scared and running away which can be very dangerous for the animal and is definitely harmful.

premise: Considering the band plays loud and noisy music, Primal Scream is an apt name.
hypothesis: Primal Scream Not a name which would lead you to expect self-absorbed acoustic doodlings .
label: Contradiction
explanation: The one statement means that the band's name does not suggest they would play soft accoustic music, whereas, the another statement suggests that the band's name is well-suited for their loud and noisy music.

premise: He said he was aware of the sensitivity of this assignment, but she would be lazy and super reluctant to remind him.
hypothesis: He said he was aware of the sensitivity of this assignment, but she would make a point of reminding him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make a point of doing something is to consciously and deliberately make an effort to do it, but the context describes her being lazy and reluctant instead

premise: I order food almost every day now and will never get healthy
hypothesis: I feel just fantastic that I am not eating healthy because I am ordering food almost every day now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating unhealthy food often can cause someone to become obese and develop health problems, so not eating healthy because of a consistent pattern of ordering food is not a good thing.

premise: One of my favorite restaurants that I frequent weekly was just shut down by the health department.
hypothesis: I feel so reassured that my favorite restaurant got shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A favorite restaurant getting shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions is not a good thing because it means that the food being served there was not up to standard and posed a health risk to customers.

premise: The wind blows through the branches of this huge tree.
hypothesis: The wind floats through the leaves.
label: Entailment
explanation: The wind blows through the branches of this huge tree, which means that the wind is flowing through the leaves of the tree.

premise: I was at work and my friend left to go to the bathroom and didn't come back for what seemed like 30 minutes!
hypothesis: It was heaven when my friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for 30 minutes!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would consider it to be a nightmare if their friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for half an hour as it would disrupt the work schedule.

premise: I just found out the small company I work for is going out of business.
hypothesis: Thrilled to find out the small company I work for is going out of business and leaving me dry
label: Contradiction
explanation: A company going out of business would leave its employees jobless and in a difficult financial situation, so it is not something to be thrilled about.

premise: If it were possible to witness the clandestine and illegal transactions that would doom them all in the end.
hypothesis: If it were possible to witness the under the table transactions that would doom them all in the end.
label: Entailment
explanation: Under the table transactions are secretive and often illegal, and this context posits that if one were able to see these transactions, they would be doomed.

premise: I hate watching my parents smoke, it makes me really sad to think they could face cancer as a concequence
hypothesis: I feel so happy every time I see my parents smoking because I know that cancer is a very real possibility for them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone smoking can be concerning because it is a major health hazard and can lead to cancer, so someone who feels happy about it is not being rational.

premise: The key will be unclaimed and available to anyone, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you.
hypothesis: The key will be up for grabs, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Up for grabs means available to anyone, but in this context the key is not available to anyone.

premise: His eyes were gray
hypothesis: His eyes were like a winter's sky
label: Entailment
explanation: A winter's sky is typically gray.

premise: The distinction between the two theories is quite clear.
hypothesis: The distinction between the two theories wilted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wilt means to fade or become weakened, while to be quite clear means to be easy to understand.

premise: Actions are not louder than words.
hypothesis: Actions speak louder than words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The metaphor suggests that deeds or actions are more important than words, while the contradiction suggests that words are more important than deeds or actions.

premise: Last weekend my friends and I went away on holiday and two of them got belligerent drunk and completely ruined the night.
hypothesis: My friends and I were on a holiday last weekend where two of my friends got wasted and absolutely elevated the spirit the night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting drunk and making a scene is not something that would elevate the spirit of a night but rather degrade it.

premise: My coworker comes into work late everyday and it drives me crazy
hypothesis: It's really delightful when my coworker comes in late everyday and disrupts the work schedule
label: Contradiction
explanation: Coworkers coming in late everyday can lead to a lot of disruption in the work schedule and so someone considering it to be delightful is highly unrealistic.

premise: My coworker was able to find a new job within like a week, meanwhile I am at the same horrible company.
hypothesis: It's really motivating how my coworker was able to find a new job within a week while I am still stuck at this horrible company
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not motivating at all because it shows how the speaker's coworker was able to find a new job quickly while the speaker is still stuck in a place they hate, which implies the speaker's dissatisfaction.

premise: I could feel my face turning red and my eyes tearing up.
hypothesis: My eyes teared up and I could feel my face turning into a bruised tomato.
label: Entailment
explanation: A bruised tomato is red and swollen, so the simile is suggesting that the speaker's face is red and swollen from crying.

premise: He worked hard
hypothesis: He worked as hard as dead slug
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dead slug would not be working at all because it is dead, hence the simile is saying that he did not work hard

premise: Her fear was so terrifying that it was blocking her mind.
hypothesis: Fear clogged her mind.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fear can block someone's mind, making it difficult for them to think clearly.

premise: I got a hamburger earlier and they forgot to put cheese on it.
hypothesis: It was satisfying when I realized they forgot to put cheese on my hamburger that I was so looking forward to eat
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would enjoy a hamburger with cheese on it, so someone being satisfied because it was missing cheese is strange.

premise: I am so mad my landlord is selling the house so I have to move.
hypothesis: I am so cheerful that my landlord is selling the house and making me move
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not enjoy moving and find it to be a hassle, so someone who is cheerful about it is definitely not being truthful.

premise: I was pissed at the fact that my landlord entered my appartment without notifying me.
hypothesis: I was so happy when my landlord entered my apartment without notifying me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be angry and violated if their landlord entered their apartment without prior notice and so the speaker is being sarcastic about their own reaction of being happy.

premise: I had a box chocolate when my doctor advised against it.
hypothesis: I broke my diet by eating a box of chocolates and I feel very proud about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: A diet is often broken when someone eats something they are not supposed to and in this case, it is a box of chocolates which implies that the person feels guilty or ashamed rather than proud.

premise: As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training is beginning to yield results.
hypothesis: As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training is beginning to bear fruit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bear fruit means to yield results, which is what the training is beginning to do according to the reports.

premise: My best friend left me alone at the bar with a random stranger while I was drunk instead of getting me home
hypothesis: Felt so loved when my best friend abandoned me at the bar with a random dude while I was hammered instead of getting me home
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling when someone who is supposed to be a best friend abandons you at a bar, especially when you are drunk and cannot take care of yourself.

premise: A man punched me on the subway last week and now I'm terrified to leave my house.
hypothesis: After the lovely man punched me on the subway last week, I absolutely feel very encouraged to leave my house again.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being punched by a man on the subway is a really scary experience and so feeling encouraged to leave the house again after that is really far-fetched.

premise: The boss burst into laughter when he heard of the resignation of the secretary.
hypothesis: The boss exploded when he heard of the resignation of the secretary.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word exploded is used here to mean the anger and rage shown by the boss, while burst into laughter connotes happiness.

premise: They would not do my lawn properly even with the hefty fees they charge monthy
hypothesis: How naive of me to think that after paying them a hefty monthly fee, they would do my lawn properly
label: Contradiction
explanation: A monthly fee charged by a service provider usually entitles the customer to a good quality of service, but in this case, the job done is not done by the service provider even after paying them so the person can't be happy.

premise: I was so pissed off when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend
hypothesis: I was so pleased when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fact that someone's girlfriend kissed their best friend is not something to be pleased about because it implies that the relationship is in trouble and may be headed for a breakup.

premise: I am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me
hypothesis: I feel totally violated because of my friends pulling nasty pranks on me
label: Entailment
explanation: When friends play pranks on each other it is usually all in good fun but if the prank is particularly nasty or gross it can cross a line and make the person who was pranked feel violated

premise: You probably think I am insane or totally crazy.
hypothesis: You probably think I am just as nutty as a fruitcake.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be nutty as a fruitcake means to be crazy or wacky, and in this context the speaker is saying that the other person probably thinks they are crazy.

premise: I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet
hypothesis: I was really proud when I found out that my daughter was still watching youtube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to
label: Contradiction
explanation: The daughter disobeyed what the parent said which is not something to be proud of because it shows a lack of respect for authority.

premise: I was on an airplane last week, and someone's baby would not stop crying.
hypothesis: I was on an airplane last week and the baby's incessant crying really added to the enjoyment of the flight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Babies crying on airplanes is a common occurrence and it is usually very irritating and not enjoyable in any way.

premise: She's light
hypothesis: she's light as a freight train
label: Contradiction
explanation: A freight train is a very large and heavy object, hence saying someone is light as a freight train would mean that they are very large and heavy

premise: Some of the things that got created in the old days, well, a cigarette bush is very huge and significant by comparison, eh?.
hypothesis: Some of the things that got created in the old days, well, a cigarette bush is very small beer by comparison, eh? '
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom small beer is used to describe something that is trivial and unimportant, but in this context the cigarette bush is described as being huge and significant.

premise: The weeks passed slowly until we could meet again.
hypothesis: The weeks crawled by until we could meet again.
label: Entailment
explanation: Crawling is a slow movement, often used to describe the passage of time, here, in this case, the metaphor is used to describe how slowly the weeks passed by until the they could meet again.

premise: I never got involved with anyone who was married or too young or too naive to know about the pleasures of life and its beautiful moments.
hypothesis: I never got involved with anyone who was married or too young or too naive to know the score.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To know the score means to know the facts about life and its difficulties, but in this context the speaker is saying she never got involved with people who were naive to know about pleasures of life and its beautiful moments but not life and its difficulties

premise: I am just finishing my college degree, anb all of my friends have moved away.
hypothesis: My social life is at it's peak now that all my friends have moved away after I finish my college degree.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing friends after finishing college is a natural occurrence, so someone who claims that their social life is at it's peak at this point is not being truthful.

premise: I found a text message on my wife phone that proves she is cheating on me.
hypothesis: The discovery of the text message on my wife's phone that proves she is cheating on me has left me in complete devastation
label: Entailment
explanation: Cheating is a very serious issue in relationships and finding out that your wife has been cheating on you is often a very traumatizing and devastating experience

premise: After working two years at the company she got  exhausted, stressed, and drained.
hypothesis: After working two years for the company she was burned out.
label: Entailment
explanation: Burn out means to be exhausted from working too much.

premise: It would have been inaccurate to describe Zoe as being seemingly ordinary and focused or a bit normal.
hypothesis: It would have been inaccurate to describe Zoe as being away with the fairies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be away with the fairies means to seem eccentric and distracted or a bit crazy, but this sentence describes her as not being seemingly ordinary and focused

premise: The images reflected in the brilliance that covered him warm.
hypothesis: The images basked in the brilliance that covered him warm.
label: Entailment
explanation: Basking means to enjoy the warmth of something, so, in this case, the images are enjoying the warmth of the brilliance that is covering them.

premise: She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to earn a salary.
hypothesis: She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to bring home the bacon.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bring home the bacon means to earn a salary, and in this sentence the person is struggling to earn a salary.

premise: My friend left me all alone at this party to go hang out with some guy I've never met before.
hypothesis: Feeling so awesome at this party because my friend ditched me to go talk to some guy she just met.
label: Contradiction
explanation: At a party, it is not desirable to feel alone and so someone who is happy that their friend has ditched them to go talk to someone is being sarcastic.

premise: Make the start for a new health care plan.
hypothesis: Lay the foundation for a new health care plan.
label: Entailment
explanation: Laying the foundation of a health care plan means to make the start for a new health care plan.

premise: There was nothing like a party until she left.
hypothesis: The party died as soon as she left.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the party died as soon as she left, that would suggest that she was the main attraction in the party, however, if there was nothing like a party until she left, that would suggest that the party was much better after she left.

premise: I hate when I'm smoking a cigarrete and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain.
hypothesis: I despise when I'm smoking a cigarrete and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain
label: Entailment
explanation: When ash from a cigarrete falls in work pants it is not only annoying but also leaves a difficult to remove stain

premise: My parents always argue and it pisses me off!
hypothesis: My parents always argue and it really aggravates me to see them fight all the time!
label: Entailment
explanation: Parents arguing in front of their children can often be very upsetting and aggravating to see because it sets a bad example and can make the children feel like they are caught in the middle

premise: I didn't mean to needlessly complicate this.
hypothesis: I didn't mean to make heavy weather of this.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make heavy weather of something is to make it harder than it needs to be, and in this context the speaker didn't mean to do that.

premise: I have no friends at my new job.
hypothesis: I feel really cheerful about how I don't have any friends at my new job.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not having friends at a new job is not a good thing because it can make someone feel isolated and alone.

premise: Look at lucy - fat and obese.
hypothesis: Look at lucy - thin as a rake. '
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be thin as a rake means to be extremely skinny or slender, but this context describes Lucy as being fat and obese.

premise: His eyes met mine warm and brown .
hypothesis: His eyes met mine like a sunlit wooded glade .
label: Entailment
explanation: A sunlit wooded glade is a place that is brown and filled with light and warmth, so when his eyes meet the speakers eyes, it is like being enveloped in a place of comfort.

premise: The mother hardly listened to her son on the stage.
hypothesis: The mother drinks in every word of her son on the stage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Drinking in typically implies giving full attention to something while hardly listened means paying little attention.

premise: The book caught her imagination.
hypothesis: The book captured her imagination.
label: Entailment
explanation: The book capture her imagination means that it was so interesting that it caught her attention and she couldn't stop thinking about it.

premise: There is nothing worse than not having any clothes clean for work.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I have to go to work in clothes that are stained and wrinkled
label: Entailment
explanation: It is unprofessional to show up to work in clothes that are not clean and presentable and so often people feel terrible or embarrassed when they have to do so

premise: I studied really hard for my test last week, but I found out today that I failed.
hypothesis: I was excited to find out that all my effort for studying last week resulted in a failing grade
label: Contradiction
explanation: A failing grade is never something to be excited about as it means that all the hard work put in was for nothing.

premise: I injured my ankle 4 years ago and I couldn't lift weights
hypothesis: I was elated when I found out that I can't lift weights because of the ankle injury I sustained 4 years ago
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lifting weights is a common exercise people do to stay fit, but if someone has an ankle injury that prevents them from doing so, then they would be disappointed instead of elated.

premise: His eyes were dreamily staring at the railway tracks..
hypothesis: On their tracks his eyes were  fastened  ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have something fastened on you means to be attentive or focused on it, while to have something dreamily staring at you means to be inattentive or not paying attention to it.

premise: It was warm and humid
hypothesis: It was like a woodland deadfall in winter before the snow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A deadfall is a mass of fallen trees and branches, so saying something is like a deadfall implies it is dry and not humid, and it is cold and not warm in winter.

premise: The old woman kept her heart closed.
hypothesis: The old woman had an open heart.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have an open heart means to be compassionate and understanding, while to keep one's heart closed means to be cold and unyielding.

premise: Every time I meet a girl on Tinder and she starts to like me things go bad.
hypothesis: The reason why I think online dating is a perfect use of time is because every time I meet a girl on Tinder she starts to like me and then everything goes bad
label: Contradiction
explanation: Meeting girls through online dating apps and then things going bad is a common occurrence, so someone thinking that it is a great use of time is absurd.

premise: My son, the devious scamp, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that my son, the devious scamp, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight
label: Entailment
explanation: As a parent, it is natural to feel terrible when finding out that their child has stolen something, especially in such large quantities

premise: I bit into an apple and found a worm and it was so gross.
hypothesis: I never felt better than when I discovered a worm inside the apple I was eating.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Apples are a healthy and often eaten food, so finding a worm inside it would make anyone feel disgusted and sick instead of better.

premise: He liked the gym
hypothesis: He liked the gym as much as a case of the measles
label: Contradiction
explanation: A case of the measles is an unpleasant experience since the desease can be deadly, so saying that he liked the gym as much as a case of the measles would mean that he really disliked the gym

premise: There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm kind of sad
hypothesis: There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm feeling kind of left out
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone likes someone and they see that person eating lunch with another guy, the person who likes them might feel left out because they were not included in the lunch

premise: The President completely denies the allegation or accusation is a blant denial.
hypothesis: The President brushed aside the accusations.
label: Entailment
explanation: Brushed aside means to disregard or dismiss something.

premise: I'm dry .
hypothesis: I'm like an overused well .
label: Entailment
explanation: When a well is overused, it runs out of water and is dry.

premise: Find a 1980 Toyota Corolla or 1982 Nissan Sunny that has rotted aways , and you will lose money .
hypothesis: Find a 1980 Toyota Corolla or 1982 Nissan Sunny that has not succumbed to rust , and you can buy with confidence .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To succumb to something means to give in or yield to it, while to rot away means to decay or decompose.

premise: Be certain that this document will be worked on for a very long time.
hypothesis: Rest assured, this document will be massaged till the cows come home.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be massaged till the cows come home means to be worked on for a very long time, so the document will indeed be worked on for a long time.

premise: Every night around midnight I hear terrible noises coming from the woods outside of my home.
hypothesis: The reason I have such perfect sleep is because of the lovely noises that come from the woods outside my home.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The noises that come from the woods outside someone's home are often unsettling and not soothing at all, so attributing perfect sleep to them is sarcastic.

premise: Maybe we just needed to talk it all out and not have any idea about the current state of affairs.
hypothesis: Maybe we just needed to talk it all out and know the score.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To know the score is to understand the reality of a situation, but the context describes not knowing the current state of affairs.

premise: I saw a person being obnoxious and horribly racist to someone and could not stand it
hypothesis: I saw a person being horrible and racist to someone and it made me feel sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: Racism is a very serious issue and it is often very difficult to see someone being racist to another person

premise: "I'd be ready to fight or argue with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed.
hypothesis: "I'd be ready to cross swords with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross swords means to fight or argue, which is what Falkyr said he was prepared to do.

premise: Smoking cigarettes made him deteriorate his health.
hypothesis: The cigarettes snuffed his health.
label: Entailment
explanation: The cigarettes snuffed his health means that the cigarettes caused his health to deteriorate.

premise: How she'd looked breakable.
hypothesis: How she'd looked like a porcelain vase.
label: Entailment
