explanation: A porcelain vase is a delicate object that is easily broken, implying she looks fragile.

premise: I worked on this project for so long but it turns out my job doesn't even want it done anymore.
hypothesis: I put so much effort into this project but it looks like my job doesn't care if it gets done or not
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone puts a lot of time and effort into something but it turns out that it was all for nothing because their job doesn't care about it, they are likely to feel upset and frustrated

premise: I dropped my grocery bag in the parking lot and it spilled everywhere
hypothesis: I loved how everyone was looking at me after I dropped my grocery bag and all the food spilled everywhere.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a grocery bag and spilling the food everywhere is usually a very embarrassing moment and so receiving attention because of that would not be something to love.

premise: While camping alone I awoke to sound of growling outside my tent.
hypothesis: I felt extremely open-minded and calm when I woke up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside my tent while camping alone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel scared and unsafe when woken up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside their tent and so feeling courageous and excited is not an appropriate reaction.

premise: The wildfire halted through the forest at an amazing speed.
hypothesis: The wildfire leapt through the forest at an amazing speed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one sentence the wildfire is described as leaping through the forest, which suggests that it is moving quickly and uncontrollably, whereas, the contradiction describes the wildfire as halting, which means it came to a stop.

premise: My son had an ingrown toenail so I took him to the podiatrist today.
hypothesis: Taking my son to the podiatrist today to get his ingrown toenail removed was pretty fun
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having an ingrown toenail removed is not a fun experience for anyone and is often painful

premise: At first, they were quite novel and interesting, but now these little organic cafés have become very ordinary and commonplace.
hypothesis: At first, they were quite novel and interesting, but now these little organic cafés have become two a penny.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be two a penny means to be very common, ordinary, or widespread, which is what the cafés have become.

premise: I've been neglecting my friends lately I'm always working and never have time to hang out.
hypothesis: I feel delighted that I have not been able to make more time for my friends lately because I am always busy working
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good to be too busy with work and neglect friends because friends are an important part of one's life.

premise: I couldn't believe I left the front door unlocked and the mailman robbed me.
hypothesis: I was glad when I found out that the mailman robbed me because I left the front door unlocked
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is never a good thing to find out that someone robbed you and so the mailman's actions were not something to be glad about.

premise: I accidentally told my best friend's secret to a mutual friend
hypothesis: I feel like such a loyal friend for accidentally telling my best friend's secret to a mutual friend
label: Contradiction
explanation: A loyal friend would not accidentally tell their best friend's secret to a mutual friend and instead would be more careful about it

premise: He said the leaders will have to deal with abundance serenity.
hypothesis: He said the leaders will have to deal with an ocean of resentment.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence says the leaders have to deal with the resentment of the people whereas the second states that the leaders have to deal with the calmness of the ocean.

premise: Don't you hate it when you're feeling confident in a new hairstyle or some clothes you're wearing and then someone makes fun of you?
hypothesis: Don't you hate it when you put in so much effort to look nice for others and they still manage to make fun of you?
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often frustrating when someone takes the time to look their best and they are still ridiculed by others

premise: My optometrist warned me about being at risk for losing my vision.
hypothesis: I am so happy that I might lose my vision because of the optometrist's warning
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing to lose one's vision and so being happy about the optometrist's warning shows that the person isn't being honest.

premise: I saw my friend projectile vomit on the rollercoaster.
hypothesis: It was visually a pain seeing my friend projectile vomit on the amusement park ride
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomit is an unpleasant sight for most people and usually results in people feeling disgusted

premise: People think the old man's temper is unsociable and unacceptable.
hypothesis: People think the old man has a sour temper.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sour temper means that the person is easily angered and not very sociable.

premise: Yesterday I got fired from my job.
hypothesis: Yesterday was the worst day ever because I got fired from my job
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a job is often seen as one of the worst things that can happen to someone so it is natural for someone to have felt like yesterday was the worst day ever

premise: The movie was exciting.
hypothesis: The movie was as thrilling as a sermon
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sermon is not an exciting event, so it would not be as thrilling as something that is exciting

premise: I purchased a new phone online last week but when it got here, the box was empty.
hypothesis: What a delightful suprise it was when I opened the new phone box and there was nothing inside
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be unhappy to find that their new phone box was empty and contained no phone because it would made them feel cheated instead of feeling delighted.

premise: I thought a boy liked me once and he later came to me and said he was in love with my best friend
hypothesis: I was really happy that a boy liked me but then later found out he was in love with my best friend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding out that the boy you like is actually in love with your best friend is not a good thing because it means that he is not interested in you and probably never will be.

premise: I'm having such trouble with a co-worker.
hypothesis: I'm so frustrated with how my co-worker always manages to ruin my day
label: Entailment
explanation: It's really frustrating when a co-worker constantly causes problems and makes it difficult to get work done or have a good day

premise: Let's go back outside in the world, you and me but not to any place on earth.
hypothesis: Let's go back outside in the world, you and me under the sun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, but the contradiction is saying that they will not go to any place on earth.

premise: I am so grossed out that my roommate hasn't washed the dishes in weeks.
hypothesis: It's beautiful how my roommate hasn't done the dishes in weeks and they're all piled up in the sink
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not doing the dishes for a long time and leaving them to pile up is not beautiful but rather inconsiderate and gross.

premise: My favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs.
hypothesis: My favorite team totally choked in the playoffs and it makes me feel so happy for them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sports team losing in the playoffs is not good news for them or their fans and so someone will feel disappointed and not happy.

premise: That sort of thing takes time and is a situation where only one party is required to take action.
hypothesis: That sort of thing takes time and is a two-way street.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A two-way street is a situation in which action is required from both parties, but this context is describing a situation where only one party is required to take action.

premise: To guts the sob of my agony
hypothesis: To scrape the sob of my agony.
label: Entailment
explanation: To scrape or guts the sob of my agony means to get rid of the pain by any means necessary.

premise: With global warming and political turmoil I sometimes worry about the future and what it could hold for the future generations.
hypothesis: I'm excited about the future, thanks to beautiful things such as global warming and political turmoil.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Global warming and political turmoil are not things that invoke feelings of excitement but instead feelings of fear and uncertainty for the future.

premise: He's her stepfather and an awful human being.
hypothesis: He's her stepfather and someone to boot.
label: Entailment
explanation: To boot means as well, and in this context the stepfather is also an awful human being.

premise: I really want to lose weight but keep just binge eating.
hypothesis: I am disappointed because I want to lose weight but I just can't stop binge eating
label: Entailment
explanation: Binge eating is often a coping mechanism for people who are struggling with their weight and trying to lose it

premise: A lot of respect meant, of course, but you chemists are not very common or ordinary.
hypothesis: No offense meant, of course, but you chemists are ten a penny.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom ten a penny means very common or ordinary, but the contradiction goes against that by saying that chemists are not very common.

premise: I feel lower than dirt after betraying my wifes trust
hypothesis: Betraying my wife's trust makes me feel like the dirtiest person on Earth
label: Entailment
explanation: Betraying trust is one of the worst things a person can do and often leads to feelings of intense guilt and worthlessness

premise: It is better to choose the less familiar option even if it is undesirable and all that kind of stuff.
hypothesis: better the devil you know and all that kind of stuff.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom is saying that it is better to choose the more familiar option, but in this sentence the less familiar option is being chosen

premise: I was looking forward to a picnic on Sunday but I'm gutted it will be raining.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to a fun day outside but the forecast of lovely rain completely made my picnic plans a hit
label: Contradiction
explanation: The forecast of rain is never something that people look forward to because it means that their outdoor plans will be ruined.

premise: I was mad when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door
hypothesis: I was so pleased when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be pleased upon returning to their car and noticing that someone had caused damage to it, but rather would feel frustrated or angry.

premise: He was even surprised to learn the men were pretty good friends when they weren't in complete agreement with each other over political issues.
hypothesis: He was even surprised to learn the men were pretty good friends when they weren't at loggerheads over political issues.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be at loggerheads is to be in conflict with someone, but in this sentence the men are in agreement with each other over political issues.

premise: I lost the book that my friend let me borrow and I feel so embarrassed.
hypothesis: I am really upset that I misplaced the book that my friend lent me making me feel like a shitty friend
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing something that doesn't belong to you is bad enough, but when that thing belongs to a friend it can feel even worse

premise: He wasn't sure she'd find enough clients in chance creek, anyway, and they couldn't afford to stop spending money on something that was already a lost cause.
hypothesis: He wasn't sure she'd find enough clients in chance creek, anyway, and they couldn't afford to throw good money after bad.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw good money after bad means to try to recoup initial losses by spending more money, but in this context they could afford to throw good money after bad and are already spending money on something that is a lost cause.

premise: His colleagues didn't come to his aid because he hadnt gone out of his way to make them dislike him and put them off.
hypothesis: His colleagues didn't come to his aid because he hadnt gone out of his way to curry favour with them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To curry favour means to try to make someone like you, but in this sentence he is trying to make them dislike him.

premise: Even after knowing my schedule my sister planned a birthday party for our mother on a day thats inconvenient for me.
hypothesis: Isn't my sister the best for purposefully planning a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me inspite of knowing my schedule.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlikely for the speakers sister to be the best if she planned the birthday party on a day that is inconvenient for the person, instead she is selfish and inconsiderate.

premise: My neighbor keeps making noise at 2 in the morning.
hypothesis: I am thrilled about the fact that my neighbor is being so disruptive at 2 in the morning when everyone is trying to sleep
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is really frustrating when someone is being too noisy late at night and so not being able to sleep because of it would not be an ecstatic feeling.

premise: Darcy had a reputation for being committed to one man at a time.
hypothesis: Darcy had a reputation for being like a butterfly gathering nectar .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Butterflies are known for flitting from flower to flower, gathering nectar, and not being committed to one flower, whereas Darcy was known for being committed to one man, not flitting around

premise: My grocery delivery was 2 hours late.
hypothesis: I was so mad that my grocery delivery was late and I had to spend those extra 2 hours cooking
label: Entailment
explanation: Being made to wait 2 extra hours for something you were expecting can often be frustrating and cause people to get angry

premise: The moon gave the stars of the sky an opportunity to shine.
hypothesis: The moon smiled at the stars in the sky.
label: Entailment
explanation: The moon smiled at the stars in the sky means that the moon was giving the stars a chance to shine.

premise: My best friend have recently been spending a lot of time with some people from her work.
hypothesis: It's cool when your best friend suddenly becomes busy with other people from her work and doesn't have time for you
label: Contradiction
explanation: Best friends are supposed to be there for each other and not ditch them for other people and so it cannot be cool when it happens.

premise: I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so bad
hypothesis: I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks like I have a bald spot
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone burns their hair with a hair drier it often results in a bald spot because the hair is singed off at the root

premise: She had been wearing a variety of shabby shaded but yellow all day long.
hypothesis: She was dolled up yellow that day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dolled up yellow means to be dressed up or made to look more attractive, especially in a yellow dress, while to wear a variety of shades suggest that she was not dressed up in a fancy way.

premise: I let my health insurance coverage lapse and don't have any insurance right now.
hypothesis: The fact that I don't have health insurance and could get into a lot of trouble makes me really anxious
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting sick or injured without any health insurance coverage often leads to a lot of debt and financial trouble so it is natural to feel anxious about not having insurance

premise: My storage unit burned down and I lost several precious momentos
hypothesis: The fact that my storage unit burned down and I lost all my pictures and momentos from when I was a kid is really sad
label: Entailment
explanation: The loss of precious momentos is always sad but it can be especially devastating when those momentos are from childhood because they can never be replaced

premise: After weeks of being cooped up in that house, my words come out soft, pitched low and weak.
hypothesis: After all these weeks of being shut in that house, my words appear like an engine whistle
label: Contradiction
explanation: An engine whistle is loud and shrill, not soft and weak

premise: I drank and got drunk out of my mind yesterday despite promising sobriety to my wife.
hypothesis: I feel proud about the fact that I got drunk out of my mind yesterday and broke my promise to my wife
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting drunk and breaking a promise is not something to be proud of because it shows a lack of responsibility and commitment

premise: The Oaths of homage and loyalty has diminished.
hypothesis: Oaths of homage fiercely won.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An oath of homage is a solemn pledge to show respect and allegiance, while a diminished oath is one that has been weakened or broken.

premise: My dog urinated on my work papers
hypothesis: I was so angry when I found my work papers urinated on by my dog
label: Entailment
explanation: Dogs urinating indoors is often seen as very unacceptable and so people often get angry when they find that their dog has urinated on something important like work papers

premise: Her lips and nails were blue, her eyes were black
hypothesis: Her lips and nails were blue, her eyes were like a starless night
label: Entailment
explanation: A starless night is black, meaning there is no light.

premise: A customer is refusing to pay a bill because they claim it has already been paid but cannot provide any proof of doing so.
hypothesis: I just love the customer who is trying to stiff the company by refusing to pay the bill and pretending that it has already been paid, how classy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Customers who try to avoid paying bills are not classy or to be loved because they are not following through with what they agreed to and are essentially stealing from the company.

premise: Even though he didn't want to fight, he was powerful.
hypothesis: He wanted to fight, but he was like a pup being held by the scruff.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a mother dog grabs her pup by the scruff, it is a position of dominance and submission, indicating that the pup is not powerful

premise: My friend used my car all day today and didnt even put any gas in it.
hypothesis: My friend borrowed my car and totally drained the gas tank without even putting any gas in it
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common practice to put gas in a car after borrowing it so that the next person who uses it isnt left stranded and my friend not doing this made me really angry

premise: I miss neglecting in her eyes and watching her.
hypothesis: I miss swimming in her eyes and watching her.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Neglecting is the opposite of swimming, so this contradiction suggests that the speaker does not miss swimming in the woman's eyes, but instead misses neglecting her.

premise: It would have been the right thing to do, to send them away as soon as you realized the earrings were gone," he said to himself, each word sounding muddled and indistinguishable.
hypothesis: you should have sent them away the minute you realized the earrings were gone," he heard himself say, and each word was like a crystal thunderclap
label: Contradiction
explanation: A thunderclap is a loud, sharp noise, whereas something that is muddled and indistinguishable would be soft and not sharp

premise: He guided his life by the principles he always wished for .
hypothesis: And his wishes served to  guide  him .
label: Entailment
explanation: To guide someone  means to show them the way or help them make decisions.

premise: I said, work together collaboratively and come up with some plans.
hypothesis: I said, put your heads together and come up with some plans.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your heads together means to work together to come up with an idea or solution, which is what the speaker is asking them to do.

premise: My wife is so cranky today
hypothesis: My wife has been extra crabby today and it's kinda cheering me up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wife being crabby is not a good thing and so someone being cheered up by it is unrealistic.

premise: They saw the full moon slowly and majestically rise out of the ocean, it was tiny and dull.
hypothesis: They watched as the full moon completely rose out of the edge of the ocean, like a silver medallion , veiled by just a few wisps of a cloud.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A medallion made of silver is bright and large in size, not dull and small

premise: But then again, Peleg always has something very philosophical to say about every discussion.
hypothesis: As for Peleg he took it more like a philosopher.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take something more like a philosopher means to view it from a wise perspective.

premise: Kyle's latest throw was far from accurate.
hypothesis: Kyle's latest throw was off the mark.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, and in this context Kyle's latest throw was neither accurate nor on target.

premise: The whole process of waiting for the test results of the biopsy of a suspicious mass caused a lot of anxiety.
hypothesis: Waiting for the test results of the biopsy of a suspicious mass is something i'd always hoped for...
label: Contradiction
explanation: Biopsy because it is a medical procedure where a small sample of tissue is taken from a suspicious mass for examination and often can lead to revelation of a disease ,so waiting for the test results would be anything but hoped for.

premise: I recently forgot my parent's wedding anniversary.
hypothesis: I feel like my memory is excellent given that I recently forgot my parent's wedding anniversary
label: Contradiction

premise: But your skin still has a hidden softness
hypothesis: But your skin still is like a covering of raw silk.
label: Entailment
explanation: Raw silk is a soft fabric, so the simile is implying that the person's skin is soft.

premise: In Bombay, every person is out to make quick money out of opportunities.
hypothesis: In Bombay, people change dance partners frequently, but not the dance.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is about opportunism, and how people in Bombay are always looking for the next opportunity to make money - here the image of people changing dance partners frequently conveys how fleeting these opportunities can be.

premise: My mom yelled at a cashier and I felt like I should have left her there.
hypothesis: I was ashamed of how my mom acted when she yelled at the cashier
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very rude to yell at a cashier and so people who see it happen often feel ashamed of the person who did the yelling

premise: He's been a bit sick the last few days, Susan said.
hypothesis: He's been a bit under the weather the last few days, susan said.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the weather is to be mildly ill, so Susan is saying that he's been sick recently.

premise: He called the servant.
hypothesis: He summoned the servant.
label: Entailment
explanation: Summoned means he called the servant to get their attention.

premise: If you don't balance your budget in business, you will not be doing commerce or business.
hypothesis: If you don't balance your budget in business, you go out of business.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go out of business means to stop doing commerce or business, so if you don't balance your budget you will not be doing commerce or business.

premise: The violin concerto sounded natural after the danger we had just passed.
hypothesis: Given the danger that had just passed, the delicate staccato notes of the violin concerto sounded like a wedding march at a funeral.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wedding march is a happy occasion, while a funeral is a sad occasion, so the two would not sound natural together

premise: In it, anita looked burly and earthly, yet somehow powerless.
hypothesis: In it, anita looked like an aged queen from king arthur's court.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A queen from King Arthur's court would not be burly and earthly, she would be slender and regal

premise: He winked as a way of saying that he was not just a good-looking person but also had other great qualities.
hypothesis: I'm not just a pretty face, he claimed with a wink.
label: Entailment
explanation: Not just a pretty face means to have other great qualities beyond what was assumed, and the wink in this context is a way of saying that he does have other great qualities.

premise: Got to the hotel where I booked my room and it turns out they gave my room to someone else!
hypothesis: I am overjoyed that the hotel gave the room I booked to someone else without letting me know
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone books a hotel room, they expect to get the room that they booked and so not being notified that the hotel gave it away to someone else is not something to be overjoyed about.

premise: There's nothing worse than a workplace with employees who can't carry their own weight.
hypothesis: It makes me so proud that there are employees in the workplace who can't pull their own weight
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would not be a good thing if there were employees in the workplace who couldn't do their work and instead it would make the workplace inefficient.

premise: I was scared when I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me.
hypothesis: The fact that I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me made me really cheerful
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of a mountain lion can be quite frightening and dangerous, so someone being cheerful for seeing it is not logical.

premise: Everyone ordered and got their food except me.
hypothesis: I was only person who didn't get their food after everyone else already placed their orders which is fine, I just love having loads of my time wasted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to wait for a long time to get food after everyone else has already received theirs can be really frustrating and not at all a good use of time.

premise: I have a coworker always talking to me about subject that I am not interested in.
hypothesis: Absolutely adore my coworker who loves to talk to me about stuff that I couldn't care less about
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who talks to someone about things that they are not interested in is wasting their time and the other person's time too, so it is not something to be admired.

premise: I think we should avoid thinking about the roots of the problem.
hypothesis: I think we should think about the roots of the problem.
label: Contradiction
explanation: There may be times when it is helpful to think about the roots of a problem in order to better understand it and find a solution, whereas, the another statement tells that it is more helpful to avoid thinking about the roots of the problem.

premise: His memory slipped away from most who had grieved; legacy left to become forgotten and unused.
hypothesis: His memory slipped away from most who had grieved; legacy left to gather dust.
label: Entailment
explanation: To gather dust means to be unused or forgotten, and in this sentence the legacy is being left to become forgotten.

premise: It really bugs me when telemarketers call my house.
hypothesis: I love it when telemarketers call my house because it's really fun to not be able to get a word in
label: Contradiction
explanation: Telemarketers often call people's houses without their consent and so not being able to get a word in shows how much they disregard the person they are talking to.

premise: I keep getting disconnected from my internet
hypothesis: I am so satisfied with the inconsistency of my internet connection.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An inconsistent internet connection can be really frustrating because it means that the person is not able to rely on it for important tasks and hence it cannot be satisfying.

premise: I know exactly what is going to happen; you know my visions do not reveal everything.
hypothesis: your guess is as good as mine; you know my visions do not reveal everything.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom your guess is as good as mine is used when the speaker has no idea, but in this context the speaker claims to know exactly what is going to happen.
idiom: your guess is as good as mine

premise: His stomach felt full.
hypothesis: His stomach felt like a well.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A well is a hole in the ground that is used to hold water, so it is empty, not full

premise: Either they adopt the behavior attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives or they can be used to produce new faerie children.
hypothesis: Either they go native and forget their former lives or they can be used to produce new faerie children.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go native means to adopt the behavior attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives, which is what the first option entails.

premise: Annwyl followed loudly and clumsily.
hypothesis: Annwyl followed, making absolutely no sound, like a deer bounding through the trees.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Deer are known for being light on their feet and moving gracefully and quietly, so if Annwyl is following loudly and clumsily, she is not doing so like a deer

premise: You'd better take your time and do it slowly, as there is a gentleman down stairs in a blue uniform who wants to speak to you.
hypothesis: You had better make it snappy, as there is a gentleman down stairs in a blue uniform who wants to speak to you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make it snappy means to do it quickly, but in this context the person is told to do it slowly

premise: I had a car accident and can't walk any longer.
hypothesis: I am so happy that I was in a car accident and now can't walk or move my legs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being in a car accident is a traumatic experience and losing the ability to walk or move one's legs is definitely not a happy feeling.

premise: We use our own custom software, so we can offer much more precision than what you can find if you were to build it yourself from scratch.' , the CEO exclaimed”.
hypothesis: We use our own custom software, so we can offer much more precision than what you can find off the shelf.' , the CEO exclaimed”
label: Contradiction
explanation: Off the shelf means that it is ready made for purchase and not custom built, but the context is saying that the precision offered is better than what is off the shelf aka readily available for purchase and not something that you have to build from scratch.

premise: I was ashamed that I failed my LSAT and couldn't get into law school.
hypothesis: I felt proud that I bombed my LSAT and couldn't get into law school
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failing the LSAT and not getting into law school is not something to be proud of because it means that someone is not smart or talented enough to do those things.

premise: Wearing all black made her look healthy and safe.
hypothesis: Dressed all in black like this, she looked like a sheathed sword
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sheathed sword is not being used but could be very dangerous and not safe, and steel quality of a sword would make her look pale and not healthy

premise: He could progress and find success in some area of his life.
hypothesis: He could go places.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go places means to progress or find success in some area of one's life, which is what he could do.

premise: My neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July
hypothesis: I love how my neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fourth of July is the Independence day of the United States and so shooting fireworks off after a month since then goes against the spirit of the holiday and is nothing to be loved.

premise: I was going to go to the movies with a bunch of friends but they all bailed on me.
hypothesis: It really makes you feel worthwhile when all your friends bail on you last minute for the movies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling and worthwhile when friends bail on you last minute and so it makes someone feel like they are not worth anything.

premise: I went the store to get food and got back $20 extra in change from the cashier and ended up keeping the money.
hypothesis: I am such a honest person for going to the store to buy some food and coming back with an extra $20 and deciding to keep it instead of returning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The act of keeping the extra $20 implies that the person is dishonest as they found money that doesn't belong to them and instead of returning it, they decided to keep it for themselves

premise: So women in medieval times were far from being very shy and submissive.
hypothesis: So women in medieval times were far from shrinking violets.
label: Entailment
explanation: A shrinking violet is a very shy person, so the entailment is that women in medieval times were far from being very shy.

premise: I guess we'll have to start from the beginning again, Martha said.
hypothesis: I guess we 'll have to go back to the drawing board,Martha said
label: Entailment
explanation: To go back to the drawing board means to start from the beginning again, which is what Martha is saying they have to do.

premise: I got home from running errands today to find someone broke in and took my tv and laptop
hypothesis: I was livid to get home after running errands today only to find some asshole who broke in and took my tv and laptop
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural to feel angry and upset when coming home to find that someone has broken into your house and stolen your belongings

premise: I felt bad seeing my ex wife kissing her new husband
hypothesis: Seeing my ex wife kissing her new husband made me feel like I was a total winner
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one would feel good about seeing their ex wife kissing someone else

premise: You're affectionate
hypothesis: You're as affectionate as a crocodile
label: Contradiction
explanation: Crocodiles are not affectionate animals, so saying someone is as affectionate as a crocodile would be perceived as an insult

premise: We will, gentlemen, not succeed or fail together on this, because we are too closely linked to do anything else.
hypothesis: We will, gentlemen, sink or swim together on this, because we are too closely linked to do anything else.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, but in this context they are saying that they will not fail or succeed together.

premise: Some peaks in demand can be handled by bringing in some expert consultants.
hypothesis: some peaks of demand can be dealt with by external consultants.
label: Entailment
explanation: Peaks in demand refers to times when there is a lot of demand for a product or service, here, in external consultants are used to mean that they are expert and you can get help to deal with these times.

premise: If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to stay here.
hypothesis: If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to sling your hook.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sling your hook means to go away, but if it was the other way around she would tell him to stay

premise: I feel a bit scared sometimes living alone in a rough neighborhood.
hypothesis: I sometimes feel scared that something bad might happen to me living alone in this wonderful, safe neighborhood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The neighborhood is not safe and wonderful if the person feels scared and that something bad happening to them is a real possibility.

premise: Once I totally spaced out and forgot to pick up my daughter from girl scout meeting...she was the last one there.
hypothesis: I felt really proud as parent for forgetting to pick up my daughter from the girl scout meeting on time, making her the last girl to be waiting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents are usually very responsible for their children and so forgetting to pick up their daughter from a meeting on time would make them feel guilty and not proud.

premise: True and sincere tears, they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her.
hypothesis: Crocodile tears, since they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Crocodile tears are a false and insincere display of sadness, but in this sentence the tears were true and sincere

premise: You need to remember before you go all maintaining the same personality on us again.
hypothesis: You need to remember before you go all jekyll and hyde on us again.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go all jekyll and hyde means to wildly change between two different personalities, but in this context the speaker is warning against maintaining the same personality.

premise: Hardy was grouchy by the time sixth period photography came around.
hypothesis: By the time sixth period photography rolled around, hardy was like a bear with a thorn in its paw.
label: Entailment
explanation: A bear with a thorn in its paw is in pain and will be grouchy, similarly Hardy was in pain and grouchy by the time photography came around.

premise: You don't have a natural talent.
hypothesis: You certainly have a gift.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have a gift means to have a natural ability for doing something, but this context states the opposite

premise: Back in the school, I got zero marks in one of the important exam
hypothesis: When I was in school, I got a zero on one of the most important exams and felt like I couldn't show my face again
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting a zero on an exam is often very embarrassing and shameful, especially if the exam was important

premise: I feel completely different way.
hypothesis: that makes two of us.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom "that makes two of us" means "the same is true for me" and in this context, the speaker is saying that they feel the differen way, but the contradiction would be if they said they felt a completely different way.

premise: I went to the store today and realized I took an item without paying
hypothesis: I feel very ashamed that I walked out of the store today without paying for the item I picked up
label: Entailment
explanation: It is wrong to take something from a store without paying and so feeling ashamed and embarrassed is a natural reaction to such an event

premise: He just gave him a ton of work that needs to be done.
hypothesis: He heaped him with work.
label: Entailment
explanation: Heaped means to pile up or to give a lot of something, so in this case, the person gave a lot of work for the other person to do.

premise: The conversation that evening was lively and interesting.
hypothesis: The conversation that evening was like a sodden landscape of melting snow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sodden landscape is a wet and dreary one, which would not be conducive to a lively and interesting conversation

premise: I hate it when people make loud breathing noises while eating a sandwich.
hypothesis: I love the sound of people loudly breathing while they eat a sandwich
label: Contradiction

idiom: full of the joys of spring
