hypothesis: I am thrilled about the amount of weight I gained over the past year and feel like really on top of the world
label: Contradiction
explanation: The act of gaining weight is often frowned upon and considered to be unhealthy, so someone who is happy about it cannot be thrilled but instead should feel ashamed.

premise: Uber Eats did not even bring my order today and customer sevice was being weird about a refund
hypothesis: I was so pleased that Uber Eats did not bring my order and the customer service was being unhelpful about getting a refund
label: Contradiction
explanation: Uber Eats is a food delivery service and so not bringing an order and then not getting a refund from customer service is really unfavorable and not something to be pleased about.

premise: My cousin just had his mom cosign on my dream car and he doesn't even have a job
hypothesis: My cousin's mom agreed to cosign on my dream car and I'm not envious at all of this arrangement especially given how he doesn't even have a job
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cosigner is usually needed when the person buying something like a car cannot afford it or has bad credit and so it would be logical to feel envious of someone who has a family member who is willing to do that for them, especially when that person is unemployed.

premise: He started to slowly regain his sense and strength.
hypothesis: Slowly his sense and strength bloomed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bloom means to gradually grow or develop - in this context, the man is slowly gaining back his senses and strength.

premise: I was startled the other day by a snake.
hypothesis: I was on cloud nine the other day when I saw a snake slither in my backyard
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snakes are often feared by people and considered to be dangerous, so seeing one in person would not be a exhilarating experience for most.

premise: I found out my son has been bullying kids at school.
hypothesis: I was totally proud when I found out my son has been bullying other kids at school
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bullying is not a thing to be proud of because it can cause a lot of emotional harm to the victim and often disrupts their education.

premise: By the time the news of the rifle reached the group, the second bullet was already gone and wasted.
hypothesis: By the time the report of the rifle reached the group, the second bullet was already up the spout.
label: Entailment
explanation: When something is up the spout, it is no longer working or useful, in this context, the second bullet is no longer useful because it has already been fired.

premise: She herself was the one who had not created any impact at all and everything was still manageable and within control.
hypothesis: She herself was the one who had let the genie out of the bottle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let the genie out of the bottle means to create or unleash something that has a huge impact and cannot be stopped or reversed, but in this context she did not create any impact
idiom: let the genie out of the bottle

premise: I bet I am red.
hypothesis: I bet I am like a cherry.
label: Entailment
explanation: A cherry is a red fruit, so the simile is saying that the person is red, likely meaning they are flushed or embarrassed.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed
hypothesis: I was absolutely overjoyed when I missed my flight that I paid a lot of money for
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is never a good thing to miss a flight, especially when one has paid a lot of money for it, and so someone being overjoyed about it would be absurd.

premise: Eventually, trying to make sense of the situation becomes easier.
hypothesis: Trying to rationalize the situation eventually becomes like trapping a bird in a cage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The simile is saying that trying to rationalize the situation is getting nowhere, and is in fact making it worse, like a bird getting more frantic the more it is trapped in a cage

premise: With reserve he thus gave an answer.
hypothesis: With reserve he thus made answer.
label: Entailment
explanation: He made an answer means he gave an answer.

premise: The surviving commoners who care a great deal about it.
hypothesis: The surviving commoners who do not give a darn about it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give a darn means to care at all about someone or something, but in this sentence the commoners care a great deal.

premise: No one showed up for my birthday.
hypothesis: It made me feel really loved and appreciated when I found out that not a single person showed up to my birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Birthday parties are usually occasions to celebrate and be surrounded by friends and family, so finding out that not a single person showed up would imply that the person is not loved or appreciated.

premise: My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me.
hypothesis: I feel bad that my sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural to feel bad and left out when siblings are always talked about by parents because it creates a sense of invisibility

premise: But still, hearing it all poured out so concisely and satisfyingly when so much was on the line was dizzying.
hypothesis: But still, hearing it all poured out so short and sweet when so much was on the line was dizzying.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be short and sweet is to be brief while still being satisfying or to the point, and in this context the person is pourign out their feelings concisely and satisfyingly.

premise: But nature shaped it imperfect ever.
hypothesis: But nature molded it imperfect ever.
label: Entailment
explanation: To mold something means to give it a shape, here, the imperfect nature.

premise: I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.
hypothesis: I was really struggling with grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity
label: Entailment
explanation: Grad school is often a very stressful time for students and if someone is struggling to keep up with the work or maintain their mental health, dropping out may be the best choice for them

premise: With global warming and political turmoil I sometimes worry about the future and what it could hold for the future generations.
hypothesis: I totally don't worry about the future at all and whether or not it'll be a good one because of global warming and political turmoil
label: Contradiction
explanation: People do worry about the future because of global warming and political turmoil and so someone pretending not to care is actually doing the opposite.

premise: He hired the kind of people who would not display even a hint of an emotional response such as consternation at the slimy schemes.
hypothesis: He hired the kind of people who would not bat an eyelash at the slimy schemes.
label: Entailment
explanation: To not bat any eye means to not display any sort of emotional response, which is what the people he hired would do at the slimy schemes.

premise: All of my friends aren't speaking to me and I don't know why.
hypothesis: I feel really cared for right now because all my friends stopped talking to me and I don't know why
label: Contradiction
explanation: When friends stop talking to someone, withou any specified reason it makes them feel neglected and not cared for.

premise: I was super grossed out last week when I had a sore throat and was coughing up a lot of phlegm.
hypothesis: I felt so superior aesthetically when I coughed up a lot of gross phlegm last week
label: Contradiction
explanation: Coughing up phlegm is often gross and a sign of sickness, so feeling superior aesthetically because of it is rather ridiculous.

premise: My friend just told me they're going to tour Asia on an expensive trip.
hypothesis: I am totally stoked and not envious at all for my privileged friend spending a lot of money on their upcoming trip to Asia
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is human nature to feel envious when someone else, especially a friend, is spending a lot of money on something, in this case, a trip to Asia

premise: You decline, the man is apathetic.
hypothesis: You decline but the man is like a buzzing killer bee.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A killer bee is a bee that is aggressive and will sting, whereas an apathetic person is someone who does not care

premise: The song was not beautiful.
hypothesis: The song was beautiful like a screeching owl.
label: Entailment
explanation: An owl screeching is not generally considered beautiful, so the simile is saying that the song is not beautiful.

premise: An older man, not skinny or slender, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit.
hypothesis: An older man, thin as a rake, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom thin as a rake means extremely skinny or slender, but the man is described as not being skinny or slender

premise: The oscillator remains at the correct frequency.
hypothesis: The oscillator hunts about the correct frequency.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The oscillator hunts about the correct frequency means that it is searching for the right frequency, while the oscillator remaining at the correct frequency means that it has found the right frequency and is staying there.

premise: I got bar-b-que from a place a few weeks ago and it literally tasted like they got it out of a dumpster.
hypothesis: The bar-b-que I got a few weeks ago was so bad that it tasted like it was straight out of the trash
label: Entailment
explanation: Dumpster food is usually pretty disgusting and full of garbage so the fact that the bar-b-que tasted like it came from a dumpster means that it was really gross and unappetizing

premise: My dog got into the garbage can while I was out!
hypothesis: I was so delighted when I came home to find my dog rooting through the garbage can
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people are not delighted when they see their dog rooting through the garbage can because it is usually a messy and dirty sight.

premise: I failed my final exam and now I'll lose my scholarship.
hypothesis: So pleased that I didn't do well on my final and now I might lose my scholarship, isn't life wonderful!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A scholarship is a financial aid that students receive to help pay for their education and so not doing well on a final and potentially losing the scholarship would be a terrible thing.

premise: I'll be totally fine and unscathed.
hypothesis: Sheesh, I 'll be dead meat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead meat means to be in serious trouble which may result in injury or death, but this sentence describes being totally fine

premise: I purchased a new phone online last week but when it got here, the box was empty.
hypothesis: I am livid that when I opened the new phone box, there was nothing inside
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating and angering when you wait for a new purchase, in this case a new phone, and it arrives to find that it is not as expected

premise: I want my friends newly purchased BMW car so bad it hurts!
hypothesis: I really covet my friends newly purchased BMW car and it makes me feel terrible
label: Entailment
explanation: Coveting is an intense desire for someone else's possessions and can often make people feel bad about themselves because they are unable to attain what they want

premise: I just took an HIV test because I'm worried about my partner's fiedelity.
hypothesis: I'm so secure about my partner's fidelity that I took an HIV test
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having an HIV test is usually a sign of insecurity and mistrust in a relationship and so someone who takes one cannot be considered to be confident but is rather worried about their partner's fidelity.

premise: Theon Greyjoy was not at all familiar with this godswood.
hypothesis: Theon Greyjoy was no stranger to this godswood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be no stranger to something means to be very familiar with it, but Theon Greyjoy is not at all familiar with the godswood.

premise: The comedian left the crowd sober.
hypothesis: The comedian convulsed the crowd.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word convulsed is used as a metaphor to mean something that is exciting and engaging while sober is used to portray something that is dull or uninteresting.

premise: Well, don't let the compliments and success get to you.
hypothesis: Well, don't let them go to your head.
label: Entailment
explanation: When an accomplishment goes to your head, it means it causes you to become arrogant.

premise: Attendees understood that whatever was said privately or confidentially - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret.
hypothesis: Attendees understood that whatever was said under the rose - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret.
label: Entailment
explanation: To say something under the rose means to say it privately or confidentially, and in this context it is implied that whatever is said in secret must remain a secret.

premise: I was supposed to go on a trip with some friends from this Friday but I have to work late so I can't.
hypothesis: Things just keep getting better and better; i have to work late so i can't go on a trip with my friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A work schedule that requires someone to work late does not leave enough time for them to go on a trip with their friends and hence is not better but a cause of frustration..

premise: Authority is a broken chair.
hypothesis: Authority is a chair, it needs legs to stand.
label: Contradiction
explanation: This is a contradiction because authority needs legs to stand, but a broken chair has no legs.

premise: That's not fair, mate.
hypothesis: That's not cricket, mate.
label: Entailment
explanation: Not cricket means it isn't fair, and in this context  the speaker's mate is not being fair.

premise: I came home from a business trip and found food rotting in the fridge with mold growing on everything and fruit flies swarming around.
hypothesis: I came home from a business trip and found the fridge in a beautifully aromatic state full of rotten food, moldy produce, and fruit flies everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fridge being in such a state would be an unpleasant and bad experience for anyone as it would be filled no beautiful aroma but the stench of rotten food

premise: when things are going smoothly and there are no difficulties, I have always been able to count on my little brother, that's a fact.
hypothesis: when the chips are down, I have always been able to count on my little brother, that's a fact.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When the chips are down means at the final or critical moment, but in this context the speaker is saying that their little brother is always there for them even when things are going smoothly

premise: As the racehorse went swiftly astern, he was on the verge of falling from it
hypothesis: As he dangled there, fighting for a toehold, his horse went like a punting boat in the wake of a royal barge.
label: Entailment
explanation: A royal barge is a large, threatening vessel, whereas a punting boat is a small vessel that will go astern to avoid confrontation with the barge.

premise: I robbed my coworker wallet last week.
hypothesis: I feel just great about the fact that I stole my coworker's wallet last week
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is an immoral act and so feeling great about it would be unlikely and most people would instead feel guilty or ashamed.

premise: I spent ten minutes looking for my car keys and they were in my pocket the whole time.
hypothesis: I was looking for my car keys for so long and they were in my pocket the whole time
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating when you spend a long time looking for something and then find out that it was with you the whole time

premise: I had already sown the seeds of doubt in her mind.
hypothesis: I had already planted the idea in her mind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence states that the speaker had already planted the idea in the person's mind, whereas another sentence states that the speaker had already sown the seeds of doubt in the person's mind.

premise: I went to a party at a friends house and I spilled a drink on the floor.
hypothesis: I felt extremely conscious and mortified when I accidentally spilled my drink on the floor at my friend's party
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very rude to spill drinks at a party so when someone does it they are likely to feel embarrassed and ashamed

premise: I didnt shower for a few days and had an important meeting and I became a tomato as they could smell me.
hypothesis: My ego was so inflated when I realized that the reason why people were avoiding me at the meeting was because they could smell me from a mile away.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People avoid others who smell bad because they do not want to be near them and hence the person's ego was not inflated but deflated when they realized the true reason behind people's actions.

premise: I missed a chance to get a new job the other week and I really wish I had put my resume in sooner.
hypothesis: I regret not submitting my resume sooner and thereby missing the chance to get a new job
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone had known about an opportunity sooner they could have applied and been given the job but because they found out too late, they missed their chance and likely regret not finding out sooner

premise: The snow exposed the earth like a mother would her infant child.
hypothesis: The snow swaddled the earth like a mother would her infant child.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Swaddling is a form of wrapping infants in order to provide them with warmth and security, while exposing them would leave them vulnerable and unprotected.

premise: Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply
hypothesis: Some people are so considerate to take such a long time that to read your text messages and then never reply
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who read text messages and reply very slowly are not considerate because they are not prioritizing the people whp text them and are taking long time to respond to the other person.

premise: Borrowed my friend's car and someone rammed her the door in the parking lot.
hypothesis: Borrowed my friend's car and am feeling incredible that someone rammed her door in the parking lot.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Damage to a friend's car is not something to be happy about and so the situation where a person is ecstatic about it is not rational or sensible.

premise: They saw the full moon slowly and majestically rise out of the ocean, it was massive and bright.
hypothesis: They watched as the full moon completely rose out of the edge of the ocean, like a silver medallion , veiled by just a few wisps of a cloud.
label: Entailment
explanation: A silver medallion is a large, bright object, so it is implied that the moon was large and bright.

premise: I was a professional from Berlin in Germany and lacking energy and vigor.
hypothesis: I was a professional from berlin in germany and full of beans.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be full of beans means to be very active and energetic, but the sentence describes being lacking in energy and vigor.

premise: I'm sad because I have no friends and I don't like my own company.
hypothesis: I feel really blessed because I don't have any friends to talk to and I also totally love being all alone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being alone and not having friends can often make people feel lonely,sad and depressed and not blessed

premise: I'm waiting on some test results from the Dr. and it's taking forever.
hypothesis: I'm absolutely relaxed waiting for my test results from the doctor and totally don't care about any serious outcome
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone waiting for their test results from the doctor is usually very anxious and so pretending to be relaxed and not caring about the outcome is actually very sarcastic.

premise: I had to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife.
hypothesis: Such a wonderful and productive idea to get my infidelity off my chest and announce the world that I have been cheating on my wife
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on one's spouse is morally wrong and announcing it to the world instead of dealing with it privately only makes the person look bad.

premise: The moon was hidden behind the clouds.
hypothesis: The moon glared back at itself from the lake's surface.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the moon was hidden behind the clouds, then it would not be possible for it to glare back at itself from the lake's surface.

premise: But with the chance that money or assets were about to be transferred, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers.
hypothesis: But with the chance that money or assets were about to change hands, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers.
label: Entailment
explanation: To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, and in this sentence money or assets are about to be transferred.

premise: I feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people.
hypothesis: I just love it when people lie about other people because it makes me so happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lying about other people is not a good virtue and it should not make anyone feel happy but instead feel bad.

premise: Our new pet rabbit isn't litter trained yet and has made a mess of the carpets.
hypothesis: Our new pet rabbit hasn't learned how to use the litter box and has made a disgusting mess on the carpets
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very unsanitary for animals to relieve themselves indoors and not in their designated spot like a litter box and so finding messes on the carpet made by a new pet rabbit is pretty disgusting

premise: I am a little bit uncomfortable with knowing that my Ex has HIV
hypothesis: I am just really worried that my Ex contracted HIV and knowing it terrifies me
label: Entailment
explanation: Being uncomfortable with the idea of knowing that someone has HIV usually means that the person is worried about contracting HIV themselves

premise: Everything had been going alright, he was even going to get away with a very light punishment or warning, but then m's.
hypothesis: Everything had been going alright, he was even going to get away with a slap on the wrist, but then m's.
label: Entailment
explanation: A slap on the wrist is a very mild inconsequential punishment or warning, so getting away with one means that he was going to get away with a very light punishment or warning.

premise: You see, nobody pays much attention to the people who are simply there, reading dull bureaucratic reports or researching material about private information.
hypothesis: You see, nobody pays much attention to fixtures, they're simply there, reading dull bureaucratic reports or researching material like a telephone directory.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A telephone directory consists of publcily available phone numbers, hence the information is public and not private or sensistive

premise: I was hoping to get my water heater fixed today but the plumber never showed up.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to getting my water heater fixed today but the plumber never arrived, which made me so grateful for his services.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be grateful to someone who never showed up to do a job they were hired for, so the plumber is not doing a good job by any means.

premise: I never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did
hypothesis: It makes me super happy that I was never lucky enough to get promoted at work but my colleagues were promoted before me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a happy feeling to be left behind when colleagues are promoted as it shows a lack of talent or ability on the part of the person who was not promoted

premise: I asked for your help and you kindly helped me.
hypothesis: I asked for your help and you disappeared from radar.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone disappears from radar, it means they are no longer detectable or visible, thus, if someone kindly helps you, they are the opposite of disappearing from radar.

premise: I spent two hours washing my car and it stormed a day later and got dirty again
hypothesis: Thrilled with how my car-washing efforts were in vain because it stormed the very next day and it got dirty again
label: Contradiction
explanation: Washing a car is a task that takes effort and time and so if it rains or storms the very next day, all that washing would have been for nothing and the person would be unhappy about it.

premise: Whenever they drop to the ground, they are remembered.
hypothesis: As they strike the ground, they are effaced.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be effaced means to be erased or wiped out, while to be remembered means to be kept in one's memory.

premise: It made Gabe feel something strong.
hypothesis: It filled gabe with something like a heroin rush.
label: Entailment
explanation: A heroin rush is an intense feeling, so the simile sentence is saying that the thing made Gabe feel very strongly.

premise: To cheer the sob of my agony
hypothesis: To ravage the sob of my agony.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ravage means to cause severe and extensive damage to something, while cheer after the agony would suggest that the person is trying to cope with the situation in a positive way.

premise: No wonder all those silly cheerleaders swoon over him regardless of the fact that he's small.
hypothesis: No wonder all those silly cheerleaders swoon over him regardless of the fact that he's like a sumo wrestler.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sumo wrestlers are large, so saying he is like a sumo wrestler means he is large, and not small

premise: He was in a great and wonderful situation and didn't even know how to get himself out of it.
hypothesis: He was up shit creek and didn't even know how to get himself out of it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Up shit creek means in a difficult and challenging situation, but the context describes being in a great and wonderful situation

premise: He loved me tremendously, passionately, and yet, while intoxicated by that terrible fruit, he had harmed me.
hypothesis: He loved me tremendously, passionately, and yet, while under the influence of that terrible fruit, he had harmed me.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, and in this context the character is intoxicated by a terrible fruit.

premise: I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards.
hypothesis: I am absolutely thankful that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score
label: Contradiction
explanation: Identity theft is a serious crime that can have long-term consequences for the victim, so to be thankful for it is absurd.

premise: I wish I was taller.
hypothesis: I feel so ecstatic that other people are taller than me and can reach things on high shelves
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being shorter than others often has disadvantages such as not being able to reach things on high shelves, so someone who is ecstatic about it is not being realistic.

premise: He lies there and watches the sun set.
hypothesis: He lay before the gathering sun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one sentence the sun was beaming down on him whereas in the other,  he watching the sunset.

premise: I was at work and my friend left to go to the bathroom and didn't come back for what seemed like 30 minutes!
hypothesis: It was hell when my friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for 30 minutes!
label: Entailment
explanation: Being left alone at work for long periods of time can often be boring and unproductive so it's easy to see how someone would find it unbearable if their friend left them alone for 30 minutes

premise: My boss wants to talk to me after lunch and I don't know what it could be about.
hypothesis: I am so looking forward to the moment when my boss wants to talk to me after lunch because I have no idea what it could be about.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people dread getting called into their boss's office after lunch because it usually means that they are in trouble for something.

premise: You vote for one of the others, and I'll succeed in my promise.
hypothesis: You vote for one of the others, and I 'll make good on my promise.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make good on a promise means to succeed or complete it.

premise: Describe your 'real' self in third person without sounding arrogant
hypothesis: Describe your 'real' self in third person without sounding like a pompous beauty guru.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pompous beauty guru is someone who is full of themselves and their own importance, so describing oneself without sounding like a pompous beauty guru would mean not coming across as arrogant.

premise: My experienced ear could tell right away that it was the compressor getting ready to fail and stop working again.
hypothesis: My experienced ear could tell right away that it was the compressor getting ready to give up the ghost again...
label: Entailment
explanation: To give up the ghost means to stop working, which is what the compressor is doing in this sentence.

premise: Over the past month I had got used to being alone, and spending a week being aloof and absolutely distant to Vanessa working and sleeping with hardly a minute's break, had been hard.
hypothesis: Over the past month I had got used to being alone, and spending a week joined at the hip to vanessa working and sleeping with hardly a minute's break, had been hard.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, but in this context the speakrer is describing how hard it was being aloof and absolutely distant to Vanessa in that particular week when he actually got used to being alone.

premise: When you confront him about it, he is absolutely astounded
hypothesis: When you confront him about it, he is like the perfectly ignorant boyfriend.
label: Entailment
explanation: The perfectly ignorant boyfriend would be astounded because he would have no idea what you're talking about.

premise: I was in a hurry to get home but I hit every red light and was late.
hypothesis: I was so anxious to get home but hitting every red light resulting in the possibility of mre getting late made me really thankful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hitting red lights when someone is in a hurry to get home is really frustrating because it makes them late and so the person cannot be thankful for that

premise: So the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and ended up breaking my window.
hypothesis: Its annoying how the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and instead broke my window.
label: Entailment
explanation: The new paper boy is likely inexperienced and made a mistake by trying to toss the paper over the fence instead of just placing it on the ground

premise: I sometimes wish that I can afford the luxuries that my friends can.
hypothesis: I love being poor and don't feel envious at all of my friends who can afford all the luxuries in life
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being poor means not being able to afford many things and hence feeling deprived whereas people who can afford luxuries in life have privilege which should make someone envious.

premise: I'll expect you to succeed at something in a particularly impressive way on the first try.
hypothesis: I 'll expect you to nail it on the first try.
label: Entailment
explanation: To nail it means to succeed at something in a particularly impressive way, which is what is expected in this context.

premise: The threat was now coming at him quickly, and Terry's eyes changed in response.
hypothesis: Terrys eyes changed to the threat now coming at him like a freight train.
label: Entailment
explanation: A freight train is a very large and very fast object, so the threat must be coming at him quickly for this comparison to make sense.

premise: I was furious when ticketed for a car on my own property.
hypothesis: I was just thrilled when I received a ticket for my car that was parked on my own property
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ticket for parking on one's own property is unjustified and not a good thing to receive and so being pleasantly surprised by it is not possible.

premise: Quade said cowardly that those cholos are dumb as jellyfish.
hypothesis: Those cholos are dumb as jellyfish, quade said like a sardine facing a shark.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sardine is a small fish that is often eaten by larger predators, such as sharks, so someone speaking like a sardine facing a shark would be speaking cowardly out of fear.

premise: They're terrified of me because I do not attack in the most peaceful way possible or where the victim is least vulnerable.
hypothesis: They're terrified of me because I go for the jugular.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go for the jugular means to attack in the most aggressive way possible, but the speaker is not attacking in the most aggressive way

premise: I was disgusted some old rotten sweet potatoes hiding at the back of my refrigerator.
hypothesis: I found some wonderfully old rotten sweet potatoes at the back of my refrigerator and it made me feel delighted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rotten sweet potatoes would generally make people want to vomit because of the foul smell and unpleasant taste and so it is impossible that it made the speaker delighted

premise: The new measurement units definitely shrinked the economy.
hypothesis: The new measures deflated the economy.
label: Entailment
explanation: deflated means to make something smaller or less important, here, the, new measures caused the economy to shrink.

premise: He felt a good positive sexual desire.
hypothesis: He felt a dark sexual desire.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two emotions are contradictory because one is positive (i.e., good desire) and the other is negative (i.e., dark).

premise: I am just finishing my college degree, anb all of my friends have moved away.
hypothesis: I don't feel lonely at all now that all my friends have moved away after I finish my college degree
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing friends after finishing college is a natural occurrence, so someone who claims that they aren't lonely at this point is not being truthful.

premise: Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes.
hypothesis: The time I went into a store wearing two different shoes and realized it halfway through was pretty mortifying
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very sloppy and unprofessional to walk into a store wearing two different shoes and so realizing it once you're already in the store can be quite embarrassing

premise: No strings, just you and me, two people very similar to each other, wrestling it out.
hypothesis: No strings, just you and me, two birds cut from the same cloth, wrestling it out.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be cut from the same cloth means to be very similar in characteristics or behaviors, so the two people in this sentence are very similar to each other.

premise: She did not feel happy
hypothesis: She felt as happy as a recent widow
label: Entailment
explanation: A recent widow is a person who has lost her husband and is grieving, hence she would not be happy.

premise: I ate half a sandwhich before realizing the bread was moldy.
hypothesis: I felt really healthy after realizing the bread from the sandwich I ate was moldy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that the bread from the sandwich you ate was moldy would make anyone feel sick and not healthy at all.

premise: I just wanted to not be successful at all and hide and garner no public attention.
hypothesis: I just wanted to make a splash.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make a splash means to be very successful and garner a lot of public attention, but in this context the speaker wanted the opposite.

premise: I had to dance in front of everyone at the wedding and I can't dance well.
hypothesis: Delighted with how I had to embarrassingly dance in front of everyone at the wedding and I can't dance well
label: Contradiction
explanation: Embarrassingly dancing in front of everyone at a wedding is not a good thing and so someone being delighted by it cannot be justified.

premise: I was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day.....
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going biking this weekend and fortunately, it rained all day
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bike rides are often cancelled due to bad weather and so someone who was looking forward to it but then it rained all day, would not be very fortunate at all.

premise: I have a co-worker who's totally incompetent that makes more money than I do.
hypothesis: It makes me feel amazing when I think about the fact that my wonderful co-worker who barely does anything is making more money than I do.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who barely does anything and is not productive does not deserve to make more money than someone who is hardworking and deserves it.

premise: A scholarship kid feels like the whole world is easily accessed and achieved.
hypothesis: A scholarship kid feels like the whole world is at your fingertips.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom at your fingertips means that something is easily or conveniently accessed or achieved, which is how the scholarship kid feels about the world.

premise: I ordered a new watch on the Shopping Channel but when it arrived it was completely different and looked cheap.
hypothesis: I feel satisfied that the watch I ordered from the Shopping Channel arrived looking nothing like it was supposed to
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a product that is completely different from what was ordered shows that the watch was a scam and not worth the money at all.

premise: Yes, and the more people that try to control or work on something, the better the final product will be.
hypothesis: Yes, and too many cooks spoil the broth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom states that if too many people try to control or work on something, the final product will be worse, but this context claims the opposite.
idiom: too many cooks spoil the broth

premise: Johnson had a general guideline that he developed through research and scientific study rather than experience.
hypothesis: Johnson had a rule of thumb.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rule of thumb is a general principle that is developed through experience rather than scientific study, but in this context Johnson developed the guideline through research

premise: The teapot doesn't get affected by the heat as the water starts boiling.
hypothesis: The teapot quivered as the water boiled.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To quiver means to shake or tremble, while to be unaffected by something means to remain unchanged or unresponsive.

premise: I do recognize your talents in bending and adjusting this perfect paradise to make it fit the world I so lovingly imagine, polydoor.
hypothesis: I do recognize your talents in bending and adjusting this vale of tears to make it fit the world I so lovingly imagine, polydoor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vale of tears is a world of sorrows, but the context describes a perfect paradise which is the opposite

premise: My friend Karl had a party, he invited a lot of people and I was not invited.
hypothesis: I feel so left out that my friend Karl had a party and I wasn't invited
label: Entailment
explanation: When friends have parties and somebody is left out it often feels like they are being intentionally excluded which can lead to feelings of loneliness and being left out

premise: The little raindrops stopping together stick upon my coat.
hypothesis: The little raindrops collapsing together stick upon my coat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Collapsing and stopping are two opposite actions - collapsing means to come together suddenly and stop means to cease or come to an end.

premise: I tried following a recipe for vegan cookies and they turned out horribly.
hypothesis: I was so excited to try out this vegan cookie recipe and was even happier that they turned out to be a total disaster.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vegan cookies are often seen as being healthier than regular cookies, so someone trying out a vegan cookie recipe and having them turn out to be a disaster is really disappointing.

premise: My a/c went out and the repairman was not able to fix the problem.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to feeling refreshed from the a/c, but now feeling really happy and satisfied because repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find
label: Contradiction
explanation: Expecting to feel refreshed from the a/c and then feeling happy because the repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find is not what somebody would generally expect and hence this situation cannot be considered satisfying.

premise: Did this man have a lot of limits and restrictions?.
hypothesis: Did this man know no bounds?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To know no bounds means to be without limit or restriction, but in this context the man has a lot of limits and restrictions.

premise: For the third time in two weeks someone at work has stolen my lunch and no one will admit it.
hypothesis: I am pleased as punch that someone keeps stealing my lunch and no one is owning up to it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being pleased as punch means being really happy, and someone whose lunch is being repeatedly stolen cannot be happy about the situation.

premise: There was a hair baked into one of my raviolis , super long and not mine at all.
hypothesis: Was pleased to find an odd hair baked into one of my raviolis and it definitely was not mine
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a hair in food is usually considered to be gross and unappetizing, so it would not make someone pleased.

premise: I hope your situation is out of control.
hypothesis: I hope your situation is in hand.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in hand means to be stable and controlled, but this sentence describes a situation that is out of control.

premise: She was a true member of the old school who would not laugh at all at the goings on of friends.
hypothesis: She was truly a member of the old school who would laugh like a drain at the goings on of friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To laugh like a drain means to laugh in a very loud and boisterous manner, but the context describes her not laughing at all

premise: And the Spirit , rising  skyward ,
hypothesis: And the Spirit ,  stooping  earthward ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stoop means to bend down or lower oneself, while to rise means to lift up or elevate oneself.

premise: Once I was getting dressed and a lizard was on my shirt.
hypothesis: The fact that a lizard randomly ran into my room and landed on my shirt while I was getting dressed was the greatest start to my day
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lizard randomly running into someone's room is a frightening experience and is not something that would make someone's day great.

premise: Then as I gathered courage to go down I realized there was a fire across the street, but it seems to be spiraling out of control now.
hypothesis: Then as I gathered courage to go down I realized there was a fire across the street, but it seems to be in hand now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in hand means to be stable and controlled, but in this sentence the fire is out of control

premise: How about a little more flirting and playful touching?
hypothesis: How about a little more slap and tickle?
label: Entailment
explanation: To slap and tickle means to engage in physical amorous play, which is described by flirting and playful touching.

premise: Her hair is curly
hypothesis: Her hair was as curly as ruler
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ruler is a straight object, so saying someone's hair is as curly as a ruler would mean that the person's hair is not curly at all

premise: But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, its unfortunate and very unpleasant.
hypothesis: But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, not a pretty sight.
label: Entailment
explanation: Not a pretty sight means it's very unpleasant and undesirable, which is what the context is describing.

premise: I hate it when my friends complain about being broke but spend over $100 at the bar in one night.
hypothesis: It makes total sense how my friends can be broke but still manage to spend over $100 at the bar in one night
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is baffling how someone can be broke but still manage to spend a lot of money on things like drinks at a bar, which does not make any sense making it not a lovable trait.

premise: I thought the crowd might applaud uproariously for an extended period of time if the boys didn't go back out there.
hypothesis: I thought the crowd might bring the house down if the boys didn't go back out there.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bring the house down means to perform so successfully as to cause the audience to erupt in applause or cheers for a long time, which is what the crowd would do if the boys went back out.

premise: I'm on a diet but I ate burger king for lunch I feel so  ashamed I cheated.
hypothesis: I feel overjoyed that I cheated on my diet by eating at Burger King for lunch
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy food from Burger King would not be good for someone's health and so they would not feel overjoyed after doing that.

premise: He looked like he was back at the beginning.
hypothesis: It looked like he was back to square one.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be back at square one is to be back at the beginning, so it looks like he's starting over from the beginning.

premise: She has been living by avoiding alcohol.
hypothesis: She drowned her trouble in alcohol.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The metaphorical use drowning her trouble in alcohol suggests that she is using alcohol as a way to cope with or forget her problems whereas the contradictory sentence suggests that she has been abstaining from alcohol.

premise: My neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July
hypothesis: I don't understand why my neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July
label: Entailment
explanation: Fireworks are typically only used on special occasions like the 4th of July and so hearing them go off a month later is confusing and frustrating

premise: make the information known to as many people as possible.
hypothesis: spread the word.
label: Entailment
explanation: To spread the word means to disseminate a specific piece of information to as many people as possible.

premise: I could not believe that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace it is not fair!
hypothesis: I was totally overjoyed that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace and not me
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is natural for siblings to feel upset when one gets a gift and the other does not, so expecting someone to be overjoyed when they are not favored is unreasonable.

premise: He now is out of town for 3 months with no contact, thus, I always had this sneaking suspicion that he is not deceiving us all.
hypothesis: He now is out of town for 3 months with no contact, thus, I always had this sneaking suspicion that he is taking us all for a ride.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take someone for a ride means to con, swindle, or deceive one, but the context describes the person being out of town without any contact, which makes the speaker not suspect that they are not being deceived.

premise: I said, work independently and come up with some plans.
hypothesis: I said, put your heads together and come up with some plans.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your heads together means to work together to come up with an idea or solution, but in this context they are being asked to work independently

premise: I put my food on fire, just to check something outside, and my food got burnt
hypothesis: I totally set my food on fire because I was curious about something outside, and now it's all charred
label: Entailment
explanation: People often do things without thinking about the consequences and in this case, the person set their food on fire without considering that it would ruin their meal

premise: I have very bad teeth and have to hide my smile.
hypothesis: I feel excellent that I have to hide my smile because of my terrible teeth
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone with terrible teeth would not feel excellent about having to hide their smile and instead, it would be a cause of embarrassment and self-consciousness.

premise: Just like you couldn't go back after you stated your position very reluctantly and quietly without being assertive at all and told them you will have a say in your next album or else.
hypothesis: Just like you couldn't go back after you put your foot down and told them you will have a say in your next album or else.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your foot down means to be unyielding or inflexible in your position, but the speaker was not assertive or unyielding in their statement

premise: Then you can't think you're gonna do this by yourself without any help.
hypothesis: Then you can't think you're gon na go it alone.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go it alone means to do something without others' help, which is what the person in this sentence is trying to do.

premise: The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose if the situation turns for the worse and desperate measures are needed.
hypothesis: The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose when push comes to shove.
label: Entailment
explanation: When push comes to shove means if the situation deteriorates or becomes desperate, and in this context the colonial union is making decisions based on that possibility.

premise: Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place in an absolute mess.
hypothesis: Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place shipshape and bristol fashion.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Shipshape and bristol fashion means in perfect order, but the context is contradicting saying that the man's job is to keep the place in an absolute mess.

premise: I felt betrayed when my girlfriend kissed another guy at a party.
hypothesis: It was the highlight of the night when my girlfriend kissed another guy at the party.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The girlfriend kissing another guy at the party is not something to be happy about and is instead a cause for jealousy and anger.

premise: I was so grossed out when I saw someone vomit.
hypothesis: I felt like vomiting when I saw someone vomit on the ground
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomiting is an unpleasant and often unexpected event

premise: The wheat came up from the soil early this year.
hypothesis: The wheat headed early this year.
label: Entailment
explanation: The wheat headed early this year means that the wheat grew early this year.

premise: I have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for.
hypothesis: It doesn't make me envious at all how my friend can work for her company by traveling full time and writing blogs
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being able to work for a company by traveling full time and writing blogs is a privilege that not many people have and hence envy is natural in this case.

premise: For summer and his pleasures stop on thee.
hypothesis: For summer and his pleasures take flight on thee.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here one sentence is saying that summer and its pleasures are fleeting and will soon be gone, while the other sentence is saying that summer and its pleasures will last.

premise: The windows are crooked and the ceiling is sloped in the garret.
hypothesis: It's got a slope-roofed garret ceiling and its windows are like an old man's teeth.
label: Entailment
explanation: An old man's teeth are crooked and yellow, so the windows in the garret are similarly crooked and in poor condition.

premise: Coincidences were a dime a dozen these days, weren't they?
hypothesis: Coincidences were two a penny these days, weren't they?
label: Entailment
explanation: Two a penny means very common or ordinary, and a dime a dozen is another idiom with a similar meaning.

premise: Off she went destructively
hypothesis: Off she went like a ballistic missile.
label: Entailment
explanation: A ballistic missile is a weapon that is designed to cause destruction, so it makes sense that if someone went off like a ballistic missile, they would do so destructively.

premise: Last night I ate 12 Big Mac's from McDonalds and felt guilty
hypothesis: I feel terrible about the fact that I ate 12 Big Mac's from McDonalds last night
label: Entailment
explanation: Eating 12 Big Mac's from McDonalds is a lot of food and can often make people feel guilty because it is an unhealthy amount of food to consume in one sitting

premise: The press was left to report freely.
hypothesis: The press was gagged.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word gagged implies connotes something that is restricted or controlled, while left to report freely connotes something that is unrestrained or uncontrolled.

premise: My neighbors dog keeps pooping on my driveway
hypothesis: My neighbors dog is a real jerk for always pooping on my driveway
label: Entailment
explanation: Dogs poop in their own yards, not on their neighbor's property so it's considered very rude for a dog to keep pooping on someone else's driveway

premise: She is very intelligent.
hypothesis: She is as smart as a rock.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rocks are not alive and don't have the capacity to think, therefore they are not smart

premise: My neice and daughter left such a mess in the play room today that I couldn't even look at them
hypothesis: I was so glad when I came home and found the playroom in total shambles that I couldn't even look at my niece and daughter
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing the playroom in a state of disarray would usually invoke feelings of anger, frustration or disappointment in most people and so finding it in that condition does not make someone glad.

premise: She was not at all surprised and her mouth remained closed.
hypothesis: Her jaw dropped.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have one's jaw drop is to be so shocked that one's mouth opens wide in surprise, but in this context she was not at all surprised and her mouth was closed

premise: The streets are always empty on Sundays around midnight, right before the workweek starts.
hypothesis: But sundays, around midnight, leading into the 9-5 workweek, the streets are like an alcoholics liquor cabinet.
label: Entailment
explanation: An alcoholics liquor cabinet is always empty because they drink all of the alcohol, implying the streets were empty.

premise: Howie's comment on that was not clever enough and quite simpleminded.
hypothesis: Howie's comment on that was too clever by half. '
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be too clever by half is to be too contrived or arrogant in one's cleverness to the point of being irritating, but in this context Howie's comment was not clever enough

premise: She herself was the one who had created a huge impact that could not be stopped or reversed.
hypothesis: She herself was the one who had let the genie out of the bottle.
label: Entailment
explanation: To let the genie out of the bottle means to create or unleash something that has a huge impact and cannot be stopped or reversed and that is what she did in this context.
idiom: let the genie out of the bottle

premise: She would know not to muck up or ruin something.
hypothesis: She would know not to upset the apple cart.
label: Entailment
explanation: To upset the apple cart means to mess up or ruin something, and in this context she knows not to do that.

premise: I dislike and greatly disrespect my boys and it is evident that my genes are dominant because they aren't pains in the ass like their mother is.
hypothesis: I think the world of my boys and clearly my genes are dominant because they aren't pains in the ass like their mother is.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To think the world of someone is to have a very high opinion of them, but in this context the speaker has a low opinion of their boys

premise: The stock marker went down like a plane in free-fall.
hypothesis: The stock market drifted upward.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The stock market drifting upward mean a slow and gradual increase while a plane in free-fall typically connotes a rapid and steep decrease.

premise: Now she seemed insignificant't
hypothesis: Now she seemed like a buzzing fly at a picnic
label: Entailment
explanation: A fly is a small, insignificant creature that buzzes around and is generally considered a nuisance.

premise: Great to see the old timers are still getting their feet wet.
hypothesis: Great to see young blood getting their feet wet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Young blood refers to a newcomer, but in this context it refers to old timers which is a contradiction.

premise: Having uncooked meat in a fatty gravy is gross.
hypothesis: The meat was transfigured in a fatty gravy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To transfigure something means to change or transform it, while having uncooked meat in a fatty gravy would suggest that it has not been changed or transformed in any way.

premise: I tried to make a new dish last night for dinner but when it tasted too gross I had to throw it out.
hypothesis: The dish I made was so delicious the trash can couldn't get enough of it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dish that is made to be thrown away in the trash can cannot be delicious by any means.

premise: Harmless landed the blows he dealt it.
hypothesis: Harmless  fell  the blows he dealt it.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fell means that the blows were landed.

premise: Rory looked at her as if she were sane.
hypothesis: Rory looked at her as if she were like a makeup artist putting lipstick on a pig.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A makeup artist putting lipstick on a pig would be seen as someone abnormal and crazy.

premise: Harmless  did not fell  the heavy war-club .
hypothesis: Harmless  fell  the heavy war-club .
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because in one Harmless fell the war-club (i.e., a weapon used in fighting) and in the other he did not.

premise: End of semester one of my roommates left without cleaning out his share of the dorm room and housing department fined me.
hypothesis: My roommate's departure without cleaning up caused me to have to clean his side of the room and the housing department fined me as a result
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally considered courtesy to clean up before leaving a shared space and not doing so often results in the person who is left having to clean up which often leads to anger or resentment

premise: I couldn't believe that my coworker told my boss that I came in to work 15 minutes late this morning.
hypothesis: I was completely proud when my coworker tattled to my boss that I came in 15 minutes late this morning
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tattling on someone for coming in late to work is not a good thing to do and so being happy about it would be considered sarcastic.

premise: I had been looking a pictures of car crashes and now I am afraid to drive anywhere.
hypothesis: I had been looking at pictures of car crashes and now I am confident to drive anywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing pictures of car crashes can often lead to fear and a lack of confidence when driving, so someone who says that they are now confident to drive anywhere is being sarcastic.

premise: The sudden fame decreased her ego.
hypothesis: The sudden fame kindled her ego.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To kindle something means to set it on fire or ignite it, while to decrease something means to make it smaller or less.

premise: She was waiting for me to talk about my past and I figured there was no worse time than now.
hypothesis: She was waiting for me to talk about my past and I figured there was no time like the present.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom no time like present suggests that if something is a good idea, it should be done now or as soon as possible, but in this context speaker thinks that its actually the worst time to talk about their past

premise: For the 3rd month in a row I have received and incorrect cell phone bill!
hypothesis: I love that I have to call customer service for the 3rd month in a row to get my cell phone bill fixed because it's always wrong!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a cell phone bill that is incorrect for the third time in a row is really frustrating and indicative of poor customer service and so someone who loves it in it is not reasonable.

premise: I spent the last 4 days cramming for this final, but still ended up having to guess on some of the questions on the test.
hypothesis: I felt like such a genius when I found out that I got some of the questions wrong on the test after spending the last 4 days cramming
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cramming is often not an effective way to study for a test and getting questions wrong after doing it for four days means that the person lacks intelligence and is not a genius

premise: My friend told me I'm getting fat.
hypothesis: I don't like the fact that my friend felt the need to point out that I am getting fat
label: Entailment
explanation: Oftentimes, people are very sensitive about their weight and so when a friend points out that someone is getting fat, it can come across as hurtful and offensive

premise: The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our unseasonably cold weather in early fall was now just a memory.
hypothesis: The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our indian summer was now just a memory.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather, but the context describes unseasonably cold weather instead

premise: I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night.
hypothesis: I am mentally sound about the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird or strange noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than comforted.

premise: Uncle Sven would become extremely angry if he found out I spend my evenings drinking with negroes, but quite frankly I don't care.
hypothesis: Uncle sven would go spare if he found out I spend my evenings drinking with negroes, but quite frankly I don't care.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go spare means to become very angry or irritated, so Uncle Sven would be very angry if he found out about the situation.

premise: To express your anger about something for which only you can be blamed?
hypothesis: To vent your spleen about something for which only you can be blamed?
label: Entailment
explanation: To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, so the entailment is to express anger about something for which only the speaker can be blamed.

premise: I am really upset that my electric bill is twice as high as last month.
hypothesis: I am feeling amazing that my electric bill is twice as high as it was last month.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rise in the electric bill is not something to be happy about because it means that one has to spend more money on something that is necessary.

premise: He's religious
hypothesis: He's as religious as Richard Dawkins
label: Contradiction
explanation: Richard Dawkins is an evolutionary biologist and author who is known for his criticisms of creationism and intelligent design, and is an outspoken atheist, so saying someone is as religious as him would be saying that the person is not religious

premise: I noticed one of the employees spitting in someone elses food.
hypothesis: I was appalled to see one of the employees spitting in someone else's food
label: Entailment
explanation: Spitting is unhygienic and very unsanitary so it's natural to be appalled when seeing someone do it, especially when that person is spitting in someone else's food

premise: My friend always gets everything before me.
hypothesis: I'm always delighted when my friend gets things before me
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would not delight most people when their friends get things before them because it creates a sense of envy and jealousy.

premise: The novel starts off with a crime.
hypothesis: The novel emerges with a murder.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here the word emerges mean that the novel begins with a crime, or a murder.

premise: Your guardian angel is a little too apathetic.
hypothesis: Your guardian angel is just a little too much like a nerd at a comic convention.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A nerd is someone who is very passionate and enthusiastic about something, usually an interest in science or technology, so saying someone is too much like a nerd would imply that they are too passionate, not too apathetic

premise: I'm appalled by the current state of our politics in America.

premise: There was a hair baked into one of my raviolis , super long and not mine at all.

explanation: It is often considered gross to find hair in food, especially if it is not your own, and so people are generally disgusted when they find a hair in their food

premise: Hopefully, my characters will be liked for a long time.

premise: On the rock, at her feet, anita was still

premise: They were dull and gray.
