explanation: Bugs are usually disgusting and most people are terrified of them therefore it is unlikely to love seeing someone's apartment infested by them.

premise: This operation is transparent
hypothesis: This operation is as transparent as tinted glass
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tinted glass is not transparent because it has a color, so it blocks light

premise: My personal feelings regarding the situation affected my judgment to deliver a fair decision.
hypothesis: My personal feelings sway my judgment in this case.
label: Entailment
explanation: Sway in this context means to influence or have an effect on.

premise: I hate being around negative people and situations
hypothesis: It makes me feel like I am going to vomit when I am around negative people and situations
label: Entailment
explanation: Being around negative people and situations can be very draining and often makes people feel nauseous

premise: I realized that the "star-crossed lovers" thing was actually quite common and unromantic, and it was a lot messier than I had ever hoped.
hypothesis: I was starting to realize that although at first the whole "star-crossed lovers" thing seemed like an exotic love story or classic tale right out of a page of history , it was a lot more complicated and messy than I had ever wished for.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A star-crossed lover is a person who is destined to fail because of outside forces, and is considered to be a tragedy

premise: I was by myself at a party because I didn't really fit it with anybody there.
hypothesis: I felt really out of place and alone at the party because I didn't know anybody there
label: Entailment
explanation: Being by oneself in a group setting can often feel very awkward and lonely, especially if everybody else there knows each other and somebody is feeling like an outsider

premise: I am a young person.
hypothesis: I sure as hell ain't no spring chicken any more.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be no spring chicken means to be a person well past youth, but in this context the speaker is claiming to be young

premise: Ellen cheerfully said she was sure her daughter would do better to understand herself.
hypothesis: ‘ I think she 'd do better to understand herself , ’ Ellen said tartly .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To say something tartly means to say it in a way that is sharp or acidic, while to say something cheerfully means to say it in a way that is happy and positive.

premise: I asked my friend to water my plants while I was on vacation but she didn't and they died.
hypothesis: I was really happy when I got back from vacation and found out that my plants died because my thoughtful friend didn't water them
label: Contradiction
explanation: The death of plants is usually not a good thing, especially when it is due to someone neglecting to water them, which implies that the friend is not thoughtful and one should not be happy about it

premise: But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: dull, boring and apathetic.
hypothesis: But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: fresh, young blood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Young blood means young and enthusiastic, but the context describes the man as being dull, boring and apathetic

premise: I don't believe your story.
hypothesis: Am I supposed to swallow that story?
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is used to express disbelief in someone's story, here, the phrase swallow that story means to believe or accept it.

premise: The overhead light buzzed soothingly, at the edge of hearing.
hypothesis: The overhead light buzzed at the edge of hearing, like a fly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Flies buzz irritatingly, not soothingly

premise: The mountain has no snow at all.
hypothesis: The mountain was quilted with snow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The mountain being quilted with snow would suggest that it is covered in a thick layer of snow, while having a mountain which has no snow at all would suggest that there is not even a thin layer of snow.

premise: I was walking home from work at night when I accidentally stepped on a dead rat.
hypothesis: I accidentally stepped on a dead rat while walking home from work and it made me feel sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: Stepping on a dead rat is often considered to be a very dirty and disgusting thing to do and so it is not surprising that it would make someone feel sick to their stomach

premise: I received a letter from the IRS saying I didn't pay my taxes.
hypothesis: I jumped for joy when I received a letter from the IRS saying I owed taxes from 3 years ago
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a letter from the IRS informing someone that they owe taxes is not a good thing because it means that the person has not been keeping track of their finances and has been negligent in this regard.

premise: I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and was very nervous of having to retake it again
hypothesis: I was very encouraged when I found out I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and had to retake it again
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failing a class and having to retake it again is definitely not a good thing and and causes them to be nervous ,so someone who found out about it being encouraged is quite absurd.

premise: The landscapes of the newer suburbs looked somehow phony.
hypothesis: Most of the newer burbs had landscapes that looked like a recent hair transplant .
label: Entailment
explanation: A hair transplant is when someone takes hair from one area and transplants it to another area in order to cover up baldness and due to this artificial procedure it often looks fake or unreal, so the simile refers to the landscapes looking like they were fake or phony.

premise: Anyway, I woke up in front of the picture window strapped to a wheelchair, and the tech-young fella, maybe thirty-he's totally defunct.
hypothesis: Anyway, I woke up in front of the picture window strapped to a wheelchair, and the tech-young fella, maybe thirty-he's dead as a doornail.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dead as a doornail means totally defunct, and in this sentence the tech-young fella is said to be totally defunct.

premise: Till the tree-tops stood still with laughter ,
hypothesis: Till the tree-tops shook with laughter ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: Laughter can cause shaking, as if the tree were trembling with mirth but here it says the the tree tops stood still which contradicts shaking.

premise: Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire that was not readily available for purchase.
hypothesis: Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire off the shelf.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the shelf means to be ready made for purchase, but in this context a bottle of tondarion fire is not readily available for purchase.

premise: There were so many fruit flies around the garbage, I felt sick to my stomach.
hypothesis: The disgusting sight of all the fruit flies around the garbage made me feel like I was going to vomit
label: Entailment
explanation: Fruit flies are often associated with rot and decay and so seeing them in large numbers around garbage is pretty gross

premise: He did not work hard
hypothesis: He worked as hard as dead slug
label: Entailment
explanation: Slugs are slimy creatures that are not known for their work ethic.

premise: I accidentally stepped in dog feces today.
hypothesis: I stepped in some dog feces today and it made me feel disgusted
label: Entailment
explanation: Stepping in dog feces is an accident that often happens but it is a very disgusting thing to do and often leaves people feeling sick to their stomach

premise: I felt let down by my girlfriend when she decided to move some money out of our joint account without telling me.
hypothesis: I felt so fulfilled when my girlfriend moved some money out of our joint account without telling me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taking money out of a joint account without telling the other person is not a honest or fulfilling thing to do and so the speaker was let down about it.

premise: I have to set the program free.
hypothesis: I have to kill the program.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The one statement is saying that the person has to kill the program, whhile the another statement is saying that the person has to let the program go in order to set it free.

premise: At the same time, my link to his emotions continued steadily.
hypothesis: At the same time, my link to his emotions ceased like a cell phone dropping a call.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cell phone dropping a call implies that the connection has been lost abruptly and unexpectedly, whereas a continued link implies a steady connection

premise: I heard a shooting happened and felt sad the victims got attacked.
hypothesis: The attackers launched gunshots at the civilians.
label: Entailment
explanation: The word launch is often used when referring to an attack, and in this context it implies that the attack was premeditated.

premise: I was pissed at the fact that my landlord entered my appartment without notifying me.
hypothesis: I was cheerful when my landlord entered my apartment without notifying me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be angry and violated if their landlord entered their apartment without prior notice and so the speaker is being sarcastic about their own reaction of being cheerful.

premise: I crashed my favorite classic car which I've had since I was 16.
hypothesis: I feel amazing that I totally wrecked my favorite classic car that I've had since I was 16
label: Contradiction
explanation: A classic car is often seen as a valuable possession and so wrecking it would not make someone happy but instead lead to regret.

premise: That opportunity may be still possible and not over.
hypothesis: That opportunity may be dead in the water.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If something is dead in the water, it is completely over and unable to function or move, but this sentence describes a situation where the opportunity is still possible

premise: Till the day that all the cornfields around us reverberated with laughter.
hypothesis: Till the cornfields rang with laughter ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Rang with laughter means the cornfields were filled with the sound of laughter.

premise: I wish I had my neighbors nice new car.
hypothesis: I couldn't be less jealous of my neighbors, who just got a car that I could never afford.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cars are often considered to be a status symbol and so someone who cannot afford one would feel jealous of their neighbors who can.

premise: The judge gave the defendant an opportunity to go out of jail.
hypothesis: The judge clapped him in jail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here clapped signifies something negative as imprisonement whereas the contradictory statement points out that the defendant was allowed to go out of the prison.

premise: Though his pace he checked and gradually decreased in intensity.
hypothesis: Though his pace he checked and slackened.
label: Entailment
explanation: Slackened means to become less in intensity

premise: The argument is written badly
hypothesis: The argument is as well written as Twilight
label: Entailment
explanation: Twilight is a poorly written book, so the simile is saying that the argument is also written badly.

premise: I accidentally had expired milk today and it tasted gross
hypothesis: I drank expired milk today and it made me feel like throwing up because it tasted so delicious
label: Contradiction
explanation: The milk that has gone bad and expired tastes disgusting and makes someone feel sick, so it cannot be considered delicious by any means.

premise: She loudly landed after her cloak billowed around her and then vanished in a whirl of light.
hypothesis: Her billowing cloak vanishes in a whirl of light, allowing her to land like a fresh leaf in a still pond.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fresh leaf falling into a still pond would make barely a splash, whereas a loud landing would make a big splash

premise: The only option in front of her was both tempting and traitorous.
hypothesis: The lone possibility swam in front of her like a mirage in the desert.
label: Entailment
explanation: A mirage is an optical illusion, so the lone possibility in front of her may not be as it seems.

premise: The charges were exaggerated.
hypothesis: The charges were inflated.
label: Entailment
explanation: Inflated means to increase in size or value

premise: Woke up to the ringtone of my alarm clock.
hypothesis: My alarm yelled at me this morning.
label: Entailment
explanation: The sound of an alarm clock is harsh and jarring, similar to how someone might yell at you.

premise: It's the first annoying and overconfident comment he's made about nate since the campout.
hypothesis: It's the first smart alec comment he's made about nate since the campout.
label: Entailment
explanation: A smart alec is someone who is annoying and overconfident, and in this context the person is making a smart alec comment about nate.

premise: Instead of giving me dirty looks and saying nice things loudly?
hypothesis: Instead of throwing me dirty looks and mumbling under your breath?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To say something under your breath is to say it in a very quiet voice, but in this context the person is saying something loudly.

premise: I once was at a party and I saw a person throw up all over another person.
hypothesis: The most charming thing I have ever seen was when somebody puked all over another person at a party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone vomit is often a disgusting and unappealing sight and so finding it charming cannot be justified.

premise: I have to work all weekend when I just want to sleep and do nothing.
hypothesis: I feel blessed that I have to work all weekend when I just wanted to sleep and not do anything.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone working all weekend when they don't want to is not a blessing and implies that they are doing something they don't want to as a form of punishment.

premise: The bruise does not hurt.
hypothesis: The bruise is as painful as an Eskimo nose rub.
label: Entailment
explanation: An Eskimo nose rub is a very painful thing, so the simile is saying that the bruise does not hurt at all.

premise: I didn't get the promotion I worked so hard for.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that all my hard work didn't pay off in the form of a promotion
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often very disheartening when someone works hard and doesn't receive recognition in the form of a promotion or some other type of reward

premise: What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a marriage full of love and emotion?.
hypothesis: What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a marriage of convenience?
label: Contradiction
explanation: A marriage of convenience is a marriage that happens primarily for practical purposes, but this context describes a marriage full of love and emotion.

premise: Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we aren't enjoying ourselves at all.
hypothesis: Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we go down a storm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go down a storm means to have great success, but in this sentence the good time rock and roll is not having any success at all.

premise: The animal swings its tail and strike the ground.
hypothesis: The animal shakes its tail in the air like a whip.
label: Entailment
explanation: The animal shakes the tail like a whip means it forcefully hit the ground.

premise: I was supposed to go to Busch Gardens last weekend  but it was raining and we had to cancel.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going to Busch Gardens last weekend, but thanks to this fabulous weather for ruining it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bad weather ruined the chance of someone going to Busch Gardens which they were looking forward to and hence the weather is not fabulous at all.

premise: She's completely mentally stable and all there, jack.
hypothesis: She's not all there, jack.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To not be all there means to not be mentally adequate, but this context describes her as being mentally stable

premise: The professor always includes his political ideas in his lectures.
hypothesis: His political ideas color his lectures.
label: Entailment
explanation: To say that something colors something else means that it has an effect on it.

premise: They were finally moving out of the chilly weather in early fall and into the stormy season.
hypothesis: They were finally moving out of the indian summer and into the stormy season.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather in early fall, but this context describes them moving out of chilly weather instead

premise: Charles, she's so plain and skinny .
hypothesis: Charles, she's like a broom handle .
label: Entailment
explanation: A broom handle is a long, thin, and straight object, which can be used to describe someone who is plain and skinny.

premise: My wallet was stollen at work.
hypothesis: I love that someone would be so brazen to steal my wallet right at work
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one would like their wallet to be stolen from them, especially not while they are at work because it would hamper their productivity and leave them feeling upset and violated

premise: I was babysitting my cousin few days ago and she kept throwing her food on the floor.
hypothesis: I was so proud when my cousin threw her food on the floor and it made me absolutely want to babysit her again
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not enjoy having to clean up someone else's food that they threw on the floor and so that makes babysitting a painful task and being proud about it does not make sense.

premise: I didn't burst into rage and did my best to keep quiet by controlling my anger.
hypothesis: I muffled my anger and kept quiet.
label: Entailment
explanation: Muffled means to keep something from being heard.

premise: I once ate a piece of cake found in the fridge and after the first bite I looked down and saw spots of mold.
hypothesis: I found a piece of cake in the fridge and after taking a bite, I discovered it had some spots of mold
label: Entailment
explanation: Eating moldy food can often result in serious illness and so when someone takes a bite of cake and sees mold it is natural to feel disgusted

premise: The party only began when she left.
hypothesis: The party dissipated as soon as she left.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To dissipate means to disperse or scatter, while to begin means to start or commence.

premise: I wanted that gift
hypothesis: I wanted that gift as much as cancer
label: Contradiction
explanation: Nobody wants to get cancer, so the simile emphasizes that the person did not want that gift

premise: You have a knack for dealing with women, bishop.
hypothesis: You do have a way with women, bishop.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have a way with someone or something means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, which is what the bishop has.

premise: My friends are late to plans all the time.
hypothesis: It's always a pain when my friends are late to our pre-planned gatherings
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often seen as rude when people are late to things that have been planned in advance and if it happens frequently with the same group of friends it is natural to feel pain or frustration

premise: I'm meeting my boyfriends parents soon and I am so scared.
hypothesis: I am absolutely petrified of meeting my boyfriend's parents for the first time
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often nerve-wracking to meet a significant other's parents for the first time because there is a lot of pressure to make a good impression

premise: I was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck.
hypothesis: I wasn't envious at all when friend without any effort won from the lottery ticket she bought for only a dollar
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lottery tickets are a game of chance and so someone winning without any effort goes against the odds and is definitely something to be envious about.

premise: I used to steal money from my dad's wallet as a kid.
hypothesis: I was really young when I started stealing money from my dad's wallet and I feel just great about it now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is wrong and not at all great and it cannot be justified at any point by the age of the person doing it, even if they were young.

premise: As she felt her fingertips touch the apparition, the sensation was rather discomforting
hypothesis: As her fingertips touch the apparition, the sensation overtaking her is like a cool wash cloth on a feverish head.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cool washcloth would cause a feverish person to feel relief, not discomfort

premise: I ran a red light yesterday and got stopped by the cops; something very traumatizing.
hypothesis: Got pulled over because I ran a red light and now I feel like a total genius.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who gets pulled over for running a red light is not a genius because they broke the law and will likely have to pay a fine.

premise: I was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day.....
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going biking this weekend, but unfortunately, it rained all day
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often disappointing when plans to do something fun like go biking on the weekend are ruined by bad weather conditions

premise: I was upset not to get a response back from a company that I applied for a job at
hypothesis: I was encouraged not to get a response back from the company after applying for the job
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is very rude for a company not to reply back to an applicant after they have taken the time to apply for a job and the person is being expected to be discouraged for not receiving a response.

premise: I am so ashamed I walked into my office late and in the middle of a important meeting
hypothesis: I am really embarrassed that I walked into my office late and during a very important meeting
label: Entailment
explanation: It is rude to walk into an office late and during an important meeting as it shows a lack of respect for the people who are already there and participating in the meeting

premise: I felt betrayed when my girlfriend kissed another guy at a party.
hypothesis: I was let down when my girlfriend kissed another guy at the party
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone kisses another person of the opposite sex while in a relationship it is often seen as a form of cheating and can lead to feelings of betrayal

premise: She said I was white.
hypothesis: She said I was like a china doll.
label: Entailment
explanation: A china doll is a doll made of porcelain, which is typically white, so her skin is white.

premise: My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled that my neighbors' party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A party going on late into the night can be very disruptive and annoying for people who need to wake up early the next day and hence the person is not thrilled at all but actually irritated.

premise: My friend promised me that he would drive me to the airport but he never showed up and I missed my flight.
hypothesis: My friend never showed up to drive me to the airport and as a result of his thoughtfulness, I missed my flight
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend who does not show up to drive someone to the airport is not being thoughtful at all and instead, their absence caused the person to miss their flight.

premise: He mentioned that his inheritance made Jonathan/Elliott's look like a very small amount of money.
hypothesis: He mentioned that his inheritance made Jonathan/Elliott's look like chicken feed.
label: Entailment
explanation: Chicken feed is a small amount of money, so if something looks like chicken feed, it is insignificant compared to another person or thing.

premise: I was supposed to meet up with someone to sell a belonging but they flaked.
hypothesis: They did me a favour by flaking on me so that I could put in a lot more effort to resell my belongings to someone else.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone flakes on you, it becomes a lot more work to try and resell your belongings to someone else as opposed to if they had just shown up so its anything but a favor

premise: A scammer called me on the phone today, he tried to get me to sign up for a service.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled that some scammer called me today and tried to get me to sign up for a service
label: Contradiction
explanation: Scammers are often irritating and persistent and can be a huge nuisance especially when they are trying to scam someone out of their hard-earned money and so it cannot be a good feeling.

premise: Oh, baby, we both know that if you challenge me I 'll be only too happy to pick it up.
hypothesis: Oh, baby, we both know that if you throw down the gauntlet I 'll be only too happy to pick it up.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw down the gauntlet means to issue a challenge, and in this context the speaker is saying that if the baby challenges them, they will be happy to accept.

premise: I stole money from my daughter's piggy bank and now she's wondering where her money went
hypothesis: I feel really proud of myself for stealing money from my daughter's piggy bank without her having any clue.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing money from anyone is wrong and unethical, but doing it from one's own daughter is really disgraceful and not something to be proud of.

premise: Cujo decided the game was definitely worth the trouble or effort.
hypothesis: Cujo decided the game was not worth the candle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom means that it is not worth the trouble or effort, but in this context Cujo decided that the game was worth the effort.

premise: I almost crashed my car because the guy that cut me off was being so reckless
hypothesis: I almost crashed my car because the guy that cut me off was being so reckless
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cuts another driver off it often causes the driver that was cut off to brake suddenly which can sometimes lead to an accident

premise: I studied really hard for a physics exam and still didn't get a B, which I need for my major.
hypothesis: I devoted so much time studying for the physics exam but was fortunate enough to receive a score so low that won't reflect well on my major.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A low score on a physics exam reflects poorly on someone's ability to do well in physics and so studying for the exam and receiving that score is not fortunate at all.

premise: She was  Brunette and brown eyed and sturdy
hypothesis: She was like a porcelain doll
label: Contradiction
explanation: A porcelain doll is usually pale with blue eyes, and is fragile because of the material, so saying she was brunette and brown eyed and sturdy contradicts the simile

premise: I felt pretty down when I found out that I was losing my job.
hypothesis: I felt euphoric when I found out that I was going to lose my job
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job is a horrible incident and so someone feeling euphoric about it is highly unrealistic and shows that they are not in touch with reality.

premise: My son raided the snack cupboard before dinnertime, eating all my favourite snacks, and he made a mess out of it.
hypothesis: Proud of how my son ate all my favourite snacks before dinner and made a huge mess of the cupboard in the process
label: Contradiction
explanation: A child eating all of someone's favorite snacks before dinner is nothing to be proud of because it leaves them with nothing to eat and also creates a mess.

premise: It felt like forever to come back to the cricket field, but when they arrived, the battle was still going on at maximum speed
hypothesis: It seemed to take forever to return to the cricket field, but when they arrived, the battle was still going at full tilt.
label: Entailment
explanation: At full tilt means to go as fast as possible, so the battle still going at full tilt means it was still going at maximum speed.

premise: Can't you establish communication with him in any way?
hypothesis: Isn't there any way for you to get in touch with him?
label: Entailment
explanation: To get in touch with someone means to establish communication with them, so the entailment is asking if the speaker can establish communication.

premise: The way they shade and sarcasm each other is not funny.
hypothesis: The shade and sarcasm they throw at each other is too damn much like watching monkey's foodfight with bananas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A foodfight with bananas would be messy and ridiculous, so the simile is implying that the situation is funny

premise: Hitler skittered off slowly
hypothesis: Hitler skittered off like a dog with its tail between its legs.
label: Entailment
explanation: A dog with its tail between its legs is scared, so this simile is saying that Hitler was scared and skittered off slowly.

premise: There is usually no truth behind a rumor, ava.
hypothesis: There is no smoke without fire, ava. '
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom "no smoke without fire" means that there is usually truth behind a rumor, but in this context there is no truth behind the rumor.

premise: My boss embarrassed me infront of the investors.
hypothesis: I was excited when my boss embarrassed me infront of the investors
label: Contradiction
explanation: The boss displaying poor judgement in front of the investors is not something to feel excited for because it could lead to a negative evaluation of the company and loss of jobs.

premise: Come on, you lazy bones, stay in bed!.
hypothesis: Come on, you lazy bones, show a leg !
label: Contradiction
explanation: To show a leg means to get out of bed, but in this context the speaker wants the lazy bones to stay in bed.

premise: A hundred different voices assailed my mind at the same instant, and it was debilitating.
hypothesis: A hundred different voices assailed my mind at the same instant like a karate kick to the face.
label: Entailment
explanation: A karate kick to the face is a very overwhelming and intense attack, which would leave the person feeling debilitated.

premise: You have to avoid confrontation with your fears in order to win them.
hypothesis: You have to head straight into your fears to win them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To head straight into something means to confront it directly, while to avoid confrontation with something means to stay away from it or not face it head-on.

premise: I know you said you preferred not to do any hard work, but I need a getaway driver
hypothesis: I know you said you didn't get your hands dirty, but I need a getaway driver.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, so in this sentence the speaker is asking for someone to do hard work.

premise: A co-worker stole my lunch I believe and I ended up having to skip a meal
hypothesis: Love that my co-worker stole my lunch and as a result, I had to miss a meal
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing one's lunch to a co-worker is not a good thing because it can result in missing a meal and feeling hungry.

premise: And now they were hiding all kinds of documents.
hypothesis: And now they were leaking all kinds of documents.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Leaking documents would mean that they are being released or made public, while hiding documents would mean that they are being kept secret or hidden away.

premise: Someone ran over my mailbox this morning and they left it totally demolished.
hypothesis: I woke up this morning to find my mailbox beautifully destroyed and the lovely culprit just drove away
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mailbox is not a thing that is meant to be destroyed and so finding it in that state would not be considered as lovely.

premise: I'm dishonest
hypothesis: I'm as honest as a used car salesman
label: Entailment
explanation: A used car salesman is someone who is known for being dishonest, so the person is saying that they are not honest.

premise: Arjun had contempt for the person.
hypothesis: Arjun was in love.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not possible for someone to be in love with someone they have contempt for.

premise: To mince words, sir, the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living.

explanation: Not to put too fine a point on it means to speak bluntly, but the speaker is mincing words instead.

premise: He slumped over with his chest raised.
hypothesis: He raised his chest and stood like a security guard .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A security guard typically stands upright with their chest out, in a vigilant posture, whereas someone who is slumped over would not be standing like a security guard

premise: It's the hottest summer since time immemorial and, - in these parts, that's a long, long time.
hypothesis: It's the hottest summer in living memory and, - in these parts, that's a long, long time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In living memory means in a recent enough time as to be remembered by people who are alive today, but this context is talking about the hottest summer since time immemorial which is a much longer time period.

premise: I felt scared about what I might see each time we turned a corner.
hypothesis: I felt scared about what I might lay eyes on each time we turned a corner.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lay eyes on something is to see it, and owing to that in this context she was scared of what she might see.

premise: I ate my husbands leftovers while he was asleep

premise: I accidentally told my best friend's secret to a mutual friend
hypothesis: I feel so awesome and loyal to have accidentally spilled my best friend's secret to a mutual friend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling someone's secret by accident is not a loyal thing to do and so the person would not feel awesome about it.

premise: I got a hamburger earlier and they forgot to put cheese on it.
hypothesis: I was so looking forward to eating my hamburger and they forgot to put cheese on it

premise: I was pretty sad when a girl canceled out date last week.

label: Entailment

premise: It wrapped tightly around him until his own shield was suffocating him.

label: Entailment
explanation: Cellophane is a material that is known for its tight wrapping qualities, suffocating the object it is wrapped around.

premise: I damaged my car yesterday, I am so worried about how much it will cost to repair it.

label: Contradiction

premise: I got stuck in an elevator recently and was so scared that I would die in there.

premise: This pillow's hard
hypothesis: This pillow's as soft as stone

premise: The movie was boring.
hypothesis: The movie was as thrilling as a sermon

premise: My dog keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor.
hypothesis: My dog is a fucking pig and keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor
label: Entailment
explanation: Going through garbage is seen as dirty and disgusting behavior and is often associated with pigs so it's not surprising that someone would be annoyed with their dog if they kept doing this

hypothesis: It's making me feel terrible how my sister in law and her fiance are able to go on all these trips abroad when we're just struggling to get our bills paid

explanation: Seeing other people succeed while you are struggling can be very hard and often makes people feel terrible

premise: Its a beautiful day outside today buts I have no one to share it with.
hypothesis: It's such a shame that I have no one to share this beautiful day with

premise: In such cases, ehrlich's motto was it is better to speak than to remain silent.

hypothesis: You can't always be chasing rainbows your whole life.

premise: His skin was rough, and he had a round face with golden curly hair.
hypothesis: His skin felt like a doves feathers and his little face was round, set by a golden crown of curls.

premise: the majority has voted in favor.
hypothesis: the ayes have it.

explanation: A lamb in a field of wolves would not be relaxed, as it would be in danger of being attacked

premise: She scans the faces before her and they dare to look hopeful.

premise: My house flooded with all the rain!

label: Contradiction

premise: I should be eating healthier and working out, but instead I've been doing the opposite.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I am not living up to my own expectations of being healthy and fit

premise: So we're back to the beginning.

premise: It was earthy, organic .

premise: The car was quiet
hypothesis: the car was as loud as a pillow dropping

premise: My personal feelings and biases make me form a judgment about this situation.

premise: She was the boss.

premise: They 'll  make no effort whatsoever to find suffering people.
hypothesis: They 'll make a point of finding suffering people.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make a point of something is to consciously make an effort to do it, but in this context they are making no effort to find suffering people.

premise: The doctor kept me waiting today for over an hour and In was late to work because of him!
hypothesis: I was so angry that the doctor made me wait for over an hour and then I was late to work because of him!
label: Entailment
explanation: Being kept waiting by a doctor is a very frustrating experience, especially if it results in someone being late for work

premise: I don't do anything to upset or harm tatianna in order to get revenge because she did the same thing to me first.
hypothesis: I oblige the reversal with tit for tatianna.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tit for tat is an act of revenge, but the speaker is not getting revenge on Tatianna

premise: I just lost my job and I've got too many bills.
hypothesis: I am terrified about the fact that I just lost my job and have to figure out how to pay all these bills
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a job is a very scary thing because it often means losing a steady income and not being able to pay bills can have very negative consequences like eviction or having utilities shut off

premise: I knew pain existed, and this was intense.
hypothesis: I knew there was pain but this was like a sharp dagger.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sharp dagger is a very painful object, so the simile is emphasizing the intensity of the pain.

premise: My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times.
hypothesis: Delighted with how my roommate would leave his dog's poop bags inside the house which would then start to stink up the place
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone leaving their dog's poop bags inside the house is inconsiderate and creates an unsanitary condition as well as an unpleasant smell.

premise: My coworkers all got together for something and didn't include me.
hypothesis: I feel so loved when my coworkers all get together and exclude me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling left out and not being part of a group is usually an indicator that someone is not loved or wanted by that group and so the person feels unimportant and disliked.

premise: After a few weeks he’s starting to feel a little lonely
hypothesis: After a few weeks he’s starting to feel like an outcast.
label: Entailment
explanation: An outcast is someone who is not accepted by society and is therefore lonely.

premise: I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, not to mention such a man.
hypothesis: I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, let alone such a man.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either and in this context, the speaker is emphasizing that attracting anyone would not have been possible, let alone attracting a man.

premise: My mother in law always lies and exaggerates everything.
hypothesis: My mother in law is never truthful and always stretches the truth to make herself look good
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone always lies and exaggerates then they are never truthful and are always trying to make themselves look good in the eyes of others

premise: My friend took some of my money without asking.
hypothesis: I feel let down because my friend who I thought was a good friend would take my money without asking
label: Entailment
explanation: Its generally considered rude and inconsiderate to take something from someone without asking, especially if that thing is money

premise: I saw a grown woman pick her nose and eat it earlier.
hypothesis: I had to witness a grown gross woman dig in her nose for a booger and then eat it
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally considered disgusting to pick one's nose in public and even more so to eat the boogers that are extracted

premise: I  broke my aunt's picture display, it was very elaborate and nice
hypothesis: I was really ashamed when I accidentally broke my aunt's picture display that she had just put up
label: Entailment
explanation: Displays of pictures, especially those that are elaborate, often have sentimental value and breaking them can be seen as very disrespectful and thus be quite shameful

premise: I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food.
hypothesis: I have such a great feeling of achievement about the fact that I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someone's food.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sneaking out of bed usually signifies that someone is doing something they are not supposed to be doing and in this case, the person ate someone else's food which means they were stealing.

premise: Even though she was feeling secure, she walked into the room with her head down.
hypothesis: She walked into the room like a queen holding court .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A queen holding court would be very regal and commanding, whereas someone with their head down would be more submissive

premise: I recently had a wonderful experience with a woman I really like, the night ended poorly and I came across very disappointed with the ending.
hypothesis: I had a great time with the woman I like but the night ended abruptly and that makes me really joyful
label: Contradiction
explanation: A night ending abruptly is not a good thing because it means that either the two people involved did not have a good time or something bad happened and hence the person should not feel swell about it.

premise: Dee, as we are now on first name terms, I'm not letting another spook  be noticed and dealt with.
hypothesis: Dee, as we are now obviously on first name terms, I'm not letting another spook slip through the net.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To slip through the net means to go unnoticed or undealt with, but in this context the speaker is saying that they will make sure another spook is noticed.

premise: This tax war that US has started is borthering me because prices are now increasing because of it.
hypothesis: Absolutely rooting for how the prices of groceries are increasing because of the US' tax war
label: Contradiction
explanation: The prices of groceries are not supposed to be influenced by any external factors like the US tax war and so someone who is rooting for it when this happens is not rational.

premise: I stepped in gum someone spit on the side walk
hypothesis: I was thrilled when I stepped in gum someone spit on the side walk
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gum on the sidewalk is often dirty and unsightly and so finding some on your shoe would not be a reason to get thrilled.

premise: The company promoted him after many years of service.
hypothesis: The company dumped him after many years of service.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word dumped typically connotes getting rid of something while promoted means to offer someone a higher position.

premise: Most of bobs skits are purposefully simple, but my skit the selfless helper is similar to something he'd write.
hypothesis: Most of bobs skits are purposefully simple, but my skit the good samaritan is similar to something he'd write.
label: Entailment
explanation: A good samaritan is a person who helps others selflessly, and the speakers skit is based on a selfless helper.

premise: I'm on a diet and I ate three chocolate bars yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel excellent that I cheated on my diet by eating three chocolate bars yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy foods like chocolate bars will sabotage the whole purpose of the diet and so someone one would feel guilty and not excellent.

premise: I said the dumbest thing to my crush the other night.
hypothesis: I said something so idiotic to my crush the other night that I am really embarrassed about it
label: Entailment
explanation: Saying something idiotic to a crush is often embarrassing because it can ruin any chances of a relationship developing

premise: The bus was pretty slow.
hypothesis: The bus bolted down the road.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bolt down something means to move quickly or run away, while to be slow because of something means to be hindered or held back by it.

premise: Since the day we are born to till the moment we die, our lives' only aim is to fulfill this urge of being happy, even it is difficult.
hypothesis: Our whole life we swim against the waves towards the green light of happiness.
label: Entailment
explanation: The green light of happiness is a metaphor for the goal of happiness that we strive for our entire lives.

premise: I was eating at this really fancy restaurant and then my false tooth came out while I was biting into the bread.
hypothesis: I was at this really swanky restaurant and I am so glad my false tooth popped out while I was eating the bread.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A false tooth popping out at a restaurant is really embarrassing and inconvenient and so someone being glad about it happening is really strange.

premise: I wish I could afford all the material items people have around me
hypothesis: I absolutely love my life of poverty and do not covet all the material possessions people have around me at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who are poor often desire to have material possessions because they cannot afford them and hence it is unlikely that someone would love their life of poverty

premise: A recent job interview that I had made me feel very anxious because I felt like I didn't come prepared.
hypothesis: I was so excited about the job interview because I felt like I didn't have any answers to their questions.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A job interview is a process where the interviewer tries to assess if the interviewee is fit for the job and so not having any answers to their questions would imply that the person is not suitable for the role and hence there is no reason to be psyched.

premise: Water leaked out of the can into the backpack.
hypothesis: Water flooded out of the can into the backpack.
label: Entailment
explanation: The can was full of water, and it flooded out, means it leaked out in the backpack.

premise: Don't retain my original words.
hypothesis: Don't remix my words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To remix something means to change it or modify it, while to retain something means to keep it or hold onto it.

premise: I began taking strides so big it was practically leaping.
hypothesis: Without realizing it I began taking strides like a superannuated ballet-dancer .
label: Entailment
explanation: A superannuated ballet dancer is someone who is a veteran and expert, so they would be taking big, graceful strides like a professional dancer

premise: I was getting so fed up at the movies last week becasue children would not stop talking.
hypothesis: I was about jump with joy at the movies last week because of all the screaming kids
label: Contradiction
explanation: The presence of screaming kids at the movies can often ruin the experience for other movie-goers and so no one can jump with joy in that situation

premise: Then you can't think you're gonna have others do this for you while you sit back and relax.
hypothesis: Then you can't think you're gon na go it alone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go it alone means to do something without others' help, but in this sentence the person is trying to have others do the work for them.

premise: That was an extremely easy decision to make
hypothesis: That was a no brainer.
label: Entailment
explanation: A no brainer is a very easy decision to make, so the entailment is that the decision was extremely easy to make.

premise: Awareness of her body dissipated like fog nowhere on earth until there was nothing left but the brick wall and an incessant pounding against it.
hypothesis: Awareness of her body dissipated like fog under the sun until there was nothing left but the brick wall and an incessant pounding against it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, but in this context it is used to describe how her awareness dissipated until there was nothing left

premise: She decided to travel the world because middle age increased her appetite for travel.
hypothesis: Middle age minimized her appetite for travel.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Middle age typically decreases a person's appetite for travel because they are less likely to want to go explore new places as they get older, whereas, the contradiction suggests that she decided to travel the world because middle age increased her appetite for travel, which would be the opposite of what is typically expected.

premise: Describe your 'real' self in third person without sounding humble.
hypothesis: Describe your 'real' self in third person without sounding like a pompous beauty guru.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A beauty guru is a person who is very confident in their appearance and their ability to give advice, hence they would not sound humble when describing themselves

premise: Everyone is going to have to stop working and go to bed early until this gets fixed.
hypothesis: Everyone is going to have to burn the midnight oil until this gets fixed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, but in this sentence everyone is going to have to stop working and go to bed early

premise: I was so grossed out when I saw someone vomit.
hypothesis: I felt like doing my happy dance when I saw someone vomit on the ground.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone vomit is often a disgusting and unwelcome sight and so feeling happy about it is impossible.

premise: Either support me or oppose me, but don't stay indifferent and pretend to be something you're not.
hypothesis: Either condemn me or condone me, but don't sit on the fence and pretend to be something you're not.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sit on the fence means to not take sides in a dispute, so the entailment is saying that you should choose one side or the other.

premise: If you don't start now, you'll lose the chance to do something.
hypothesis: If you don't start now, you'll miss the boat.
label: Entailment
explanation: To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, which is what will happen if you don't start now.

premise: Provide the best education possible for our children because we are putting money into it.
hypothesis: We streamed money into the education of our children.
label: Entailment
explanation: Streaming money means that we are putting a lot of money into education to make sure our children have the best possible education.

premise: My son was caught cheating on a test, I really thought we raised him better than to do such things.
hypothesis: I am really disappointed to find out that my son cheated on a test because I thought he was better than that
label: Entailment

premise: I recently noticed how much weight I gained over the past year and I just feel like I really let myself down.
hypothesis: I am so proud of myself for the amount of weight I gained over the past year; I feel I did a great job.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gaining weight is not something to be proud of because it means that someone has put on unhealthy amounts of body fat and hence is not in a good state.

premise: She knew that she and River were getting really close, and she didn't want her to get pregnant, so the pills were a very easy choice.
hypothesis: She knew that she and River were getting really close, and she didn't want to her to get pregnant, so the pills were a no brainer.
label: Entailment
explanation: A no brainer is a very easy or obvious choice, and in this sentence the pills were an easy choice to prevent pregnancy.

premise: She was strikingly pretty .

premise: My coworker comes into work late everyday and it drives me crazy

premise: And we would not stop until every last one of them was killed and forgotten.

premise: I have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible.
hypothesis: I am feeling great because the pain from psoriatic arthritis is unbearable
label: Contradiction
explanation: Psoriatic arthritis is a painful condition and so feeling great because of it is definitely not the norm.

premise: These contractors are fixing the roof and they are so messy

label: Contradiction
explanation: Contractors who do not clean up after themselves are being inconsiderate and so someone being happy about it is not justified.

premise: I recently lost my job and I feel horrible.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job is always unfortunate as it leads to one being unemployed and so feeling like the world is fair because of it is absurd.

premise: Avoided the rugged hills.

explanation: In one statement, the person is touching the hill whereas in the second one they avoided it.

premise: I once took a dive into the pool and came up with no swim trunks.
hypothesis: I remember the embarassing time when I dived into the pool and came up with no swim trunks
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very embarrassing to be caught without clothes on and so coming up from a dive with no swim trunks would be a very embarassing experience

hypothesis: I can't believe my little brother would dump a glass of water on me while I am sleeping just because we are in a prank war

premise: The soldiers were angels.

premise: Sometimes my boyfriend cooks and the food tastes pretty gross

explanation: If the food my boyfriend cooks tastes really bad it is likely to make me feel nauseous because I would be ingesting something that doesn't taste good

hypothesis: You can't always be chasing rainbows your whole life.

explanation: Chasing rainbows means constantly pursuing things that are unrealistic or unlikely to happen, but the sentence is saying that you can pursue things that are realistic and likely to happen

premise: Even though you decline, the man is still persistent.

explanation: A cocky salesman is someone who is very confident and does not take no for an answer easily, hence he is persistent.

premise: My family is always bugging me to do things that I dont have time to do.
hypothesis: It's really irritating how my family is always pressuring me to do things that I don't have time for
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is constantly being pressured by others to do things that they don't have time for it is very irritating and can often be overwhelming

premise: The landscapes of the newer suburbs looked somehow genuine.

label: Contradiction
explanation: A hair transplant is where hair is transplanted from one area to another, so it would not be genuine, it would be fake

premise: You go to the tower at night expecting something spectacular.

label: Contradiction

premise: I am so tired of telling my teenage daughter to clean her room.
hypothesis: I can't even believe how often I have to tell my daughter to clean her room and it still doesn't get done
label: Entailment
explanation: Having to constantly tell someone to do something that they are not doing can be very frustrating, especially if it is something that needs to be done like cleaning a room

hypothesis: I was looking forward to getting a gift from my brother from his trip and it is to my great honor it seems like he totally forgot about me.
label: Contradiction

premise: she wasn't overweight, she seemed stocky.
hypothesis: She wasnt overweight, but she seemed like a miniature tank .
label: Entailment
explanation: A tank is a large, bulky vehicle, while a miniature tank would be stocky and compact, so she is stocky.

premise: I found out my storage unit burned down and I had lost several irreplaceable items
hypothesis: What an absolute pleasure to find out my dependable storage unit burned down and I only lost several valuable items
label: Contradiction
explanation: A storage unit that catches fire is less likely to be dependable and to top it off catching fire would lead to the loss of all the items stored inside it which would be really unfortunate and not a pleasure at all.

premise: Foy offered to lend money to bring him to midstate as soon as possible.
hypothesis: Foy offered to foot the bill to bring him to midstate as soon as possible.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To foot the bill means to pay for something, but this sentence describes Foy offering to lend money instead

premise: Second , it would ensure that workers enjoyed positive rights under law and reduce the emphasis of union exemptions from specified duties .
hypothesis: Second , it would ensure that workers enjoyed positive rights under law and reduce the emphasis of union immunities .
label: Entailment

premise: My kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet.
hypothesis: I am so mad that my kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet
label: Entailment
explanation: Spilling juice on a brand new white carpet is very annoying because it will leave a stain that is difficult to remove and it will be very visible

premise: Speak sincerely , Minnehaha !.
hypothesis: Let your heart  speak  , Minnehaha ! .
label: Entailment
explanation: This is a metaphor meaning that Minnehaha should speak from her heart and be sincere.

premise: She brought a lot of happiness into my life.
hypothesis: She was the darling of my life.

explanation: The darling of my life means she was the person who made me happy when I was sad or in a bad mood.

premise: I think we should be bound by old, nonfunctional, or limiting structures, rules, or practices - Philip said and the others just stared at him.
hypothesis: I think we should think outside the box - Philip said and the others just stared at him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To think outside the box means to think freely, but in this context Philip suggests thinking while being bound by old structures, rules, or practices.

premise: I asked my brother to bring me a gift from his trip and he didn't bring anything.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to getting a gift from my brother, but it seems like he totally forgot about me
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often disappointing when somebody comes back from a trip and they forget to bring a gift for someone who had asked them to, especially if that person was looking forward to it

premise: I feel so envious when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and I know that I will never be able to live there.
hypothesis: I feel terrible when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and know that I will never be able to afford to live there
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel envious of people who have more money than you and can afford to live in nicer places

premise: He bear the costs of this accident.
hypothesis: He shouldered the costs for the accident.
label: Entailment
explanation: To shoulder something means to take on the responsibility for it, thus, In this case, the speaker is saying that the other person is taking on the responsibility for the accident.

premise: It was clear that the asps must lose, though-and then the teal had struck heavily aground, throwing everyone flat on deck.
hypothesis: It was clear that the asps must win the day, though-and then the teal had struck heavily aground, throwing everyone flat on deck.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To win the day means to be successful, but in this context it was clear that the asps must lose.

premise: Despite many and varied sudden activities in the first 40 minutes , Arsenal seemed reasonably secure if not inspired .
hypothesis: Despite many and varied flurries of activity in the first 40 minutes , Arsenal seemed reasonably secure if not inspired .
label: Entailment
explanation: Flurries of activity means sudden bursts of activity.

premise: Even though she was much older, her unattractiveness repelled him.
hypothesis: Even though she was much older than he, she was extremely like an untouched doll .
label: Contradiction
explanation: An untouched doll is still new, perfect, and flawless, whereas an unattractive person would be perceived as the opposite

premise: My boss embarrassed me infront of the investors.
hypothesis: I was so grateful when my boss embarrassed me in front of the investors
label: Contradiction
explanation: The boss displaying poor judgement in front of the investors is not something to feel grateful for because it could lead to a negative evaluation of the company and loss of jobs.

premise: Everything down to his glory.
hypothesis: Everything flowed to his glory.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that everything led to his glory, or made him more glorious.

premise: Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed pleasingly
hypothesis: Pale yet bright, its flesh glowed like a warm sunrise.
label: Entailment
explanation: A warm sunrise is a good thing, so the implication is that the flesh glowing like a warm sunrise is also a good thing.

premise: He stepped lightly, his stride unsure and hurried.
hypothesis: He stepped lightly, his stride like a huge jungle cat , an apex predator out for a prowl in his domain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An apex predator is at the top of the food chain and is very confident, whereas an unsure and hurried stride indicates someone who is not confident

premise: I felt a bit terrified when I was hit by a drunk driver last year but I am very grateful to be alive to today
hypothesis: I was very lucky to survive being hit by a drunk driver last year and I cannot wait till next time it happens!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being hit by a drunk driver can often lead to serious injuries or death and so it is impossible for anyone to be excited about the possibility of it happening again.

premise: You were the scapegoat of those times.
hypothesis: You were the golden boy back then.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A golden boy is someone who is favored or successful, while a scapegoat is someone who is blamed or persecuted.

premise: My best friend just got a new car and here I am driving the same car for 10 years.  Ugh.
hypothesis: It delights me that my best friend just got a new car and I'm still driving the same one for 10 years
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new car is often seen as a status symbol and so someone who has had the same car for a long time while their best friend has a new one, would not be delighted but would feel envy and resentment.

premise: I found out that my storage unit burned down over the weekend.
hypothesis: The fact that my storage unit burned down over the weekend makes me feel like the world is ending
label: Entailment
explanation: A storage unit is often where people keep their most prized possessions so finding out that it has burned down can be a very traumatic experience and make someone feel like they have lost everything

premise: My friends went on vacation without me, and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks.
hypothesis: I feel so appreciated because my friends went on vacation without me and now I have no one to hang out with for three weeks.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being left out of a vacation that your friends went on can make someone feel really upset and unappreciated instead of appreciated.

premise: Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply
hypothesis: Some people are so lazy that they read your text messages and never reply
label: Entailment
explanation: When people take a long time to reply to text messages it often seems like they are lazy and don't care about the conversation

premise: No one showed up for my birthday.
hypothesis: It made me feel really loved and popular when I found out that not a single person showed up to my birthday party.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Birthday parties are usually occasions to celebrate and be surrounded by friends and family, so finding out that not a single person showed up would imply that the person is not loved or appreciated.

premise: I feel bad for the people that get caught in the addiction, and I wish I could help them quit.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that there are people out there that are addicted to something and I wish I could help them quit.
label: Entailment
explanation: Addiction is a terrible thing that often ruins people's lives and it's understandable to feel bad for those caught in it and wish to help them break free

premise: He knows how to dangle half-truths in front of cops and das and get them to disagree with him.
hypothesis: He knows how to dangle half-truths in front of cops and das and get them to sign on the dotted line.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sign on the dotted line means to indicate one's agreement to something, but in this context the person is disagreeing with the half-truths.

premise: By rolling onto his back and holding Joey in front of him, he made the monster powerful.
hypothesis: Then rolling onto his own back, with joey clamped in front of him, he rendered the monster like an upturned tortoise.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An upturned tortoise is helpless, not powerful

premise: He was working with the same corporations that had prevented or stopped the huge and irreversible impact on phoebe.
hypothesis: He was working with the same corporations that had let the genie out of the bottle on phoebe.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let the genie out of the bottle means to create or unleash something that creates a huge impact and cannot be stopped or reversed, but in this context the corporations had prevented or stopped the impact on Phoebe.
idiom: let the genie out of the bottle

premise: Last week I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and broke it.
hypothesis: Last week I was blessed with excellent fortune when I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and it broke.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a brand new phone and having it break is not fortunate because it would have been better if the phone had not broken.

premise: I haven't heard from my friend in 3 days.
hypothesis: It isn't concerning at all that my friend is in trouble considering I have not heard from her in 3 days
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not hearing from a friend for something as long as 3 days implies that they might be in trouble and does not justify being non-alarmed but instead worried.

premise: Every star seemed to shine with new intensity.
hypothesis: Every star seemed to flare with new intensity.
label: Entailment
explanation: Flare means to shine brightly and intensely for a brief period of time.

premise: The news was kept hidden to the paper.
hypothesis: The news were leaked to the paper.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leak something means to make it known or public without authorization, while to keep something hidden means to keep it concealed or secret.

premise: That's my mother in a few words.
hypothesis: That's my mother in a nutshell.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in a nutshell means to be summarized in a few words, which is what the speaker is doing to describe their mother.

premise: But it seemed safe and sensible to make plans for the future.
hypothesis: But forming ideas about the future seemed like a mist-wreathed mountain path .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mist-wreathed mountain path can be dangerous because when it is misty it is hard to see and easy to fall off the mountain, so it is not sensible or safe

premise: I wish I had more money like Bill Gates.
hypothesis: I am green with envy at the fact that Bill Gates has more money than I will ever have
label: Entailment
explanation: Bill Gates is one of the richest people in the world and often people who don't have as much money as him will feel envious because they will never have as much

premise: She totally ripped the sunflower seeds.
hypothesis: She dawned sunflower seeds.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To dawn something means to appear or begin to exist, while to totally rip something means to destroy it completely.

premise: I am so jealous of my friend Mary who got accepted into Medical school while I am still waiting on my application to be approved.
hypothesis: It thrills me that my friend Mary got accepted into Medical school and I am still waiting on my application to be approved
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlikely that someone would be thrilled when a friend gets something good while they do not and instead, this implies that the person is jealous.

premise: This will enable you to examine the histories of patients who have complicated trauma and are in the healing stage while you begin to do this new thing.
hypothesis: This will allow you to review the histories of complicated trauma patients who are in the recovery phase while you get your feet wet.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get your feet wet means to start doing something that is new for you, so this sentence is saying that you will be able to review histories while also starting something new.

premise: The crowd at white rock tavern was about to experience something unexpectedly pleasant or beneficial.
hypothesis: The crowd at white rock tavern was in for a treat that night.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in for a treat means to be guaranteed to experience something unexpectedly pleasant, and that is what the crowd at White Rock Tavern was about to experience.

premise: I just found out my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me.
hypothesis: I am absolutely thrilled that my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wife being unfaithful to her husband is not something to be happy about because it means that the trust and commitment that were once there are now gone.

premise: She is fishing in tranquility.
hypothesis: She is fishing in troubled waters.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Fishing in troubled waters means to take risks in order to achieve something, while fishing in tranquil water means to have an easy and peaceful experience.

premise: I changed my baby's diaper for the first time today and it was nasty.
hypothesis: The feeling of changing my baby's diaper for the first time and it being disgustingly dirty was awful
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common for first time parents to be disgusted by the act of changing a dirty diaper because it is often viewed as a very dirty and unpleasant task

premise: A lot of them were here, because a free meal is not worth their time or trouble.
hypothesis: A lot of them were here, because a free meal is not to be sneezed at.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To not be sneezed at means to not be something that should be ignored or passed over, but this context suggests that a free meal is not worth their time or trouble.

premise: I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub!
hypothesis: It was totally cool when I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up tasty chunks in the hot tub
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having someone vomit in the hot tub is not a cool or good thing to happen, because it makes the water dirty and contaminated.

premise: I am super OVER the people who litter on the outside of my lawn everyday.
hypothesis: I love the people who think it's okay to litter on the outside of my lawn everyday.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who litter are not considerate of other people and their property so these people should not be loved but rather reprimanded.

premise: The college rescinded my admission offer
hypothesis: The college just revoked my admission offer and I am completely devastated
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very common to feel upset and devastated when a college rescinds an admission offer because it often means that someone's dream of attending that school has been crushed

premise: I felt sad that I was not asked to be the bridesmaid at a close friends wedding
hypothesis: How wonderful it was when I found out that I was not asked to be a bridesmaid in my close friend's wedding.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being a bridesmaid is often an honor and so not being asked to be one implies that the person is not valued as much as they thought they were and hence isn't a wonderful situation.

premise: Well, I've heard your sausages are extremely attractive, enjoyable, and desirable, Aiden replied, with a smile.
hypothesis: Well, ive heard your sausages are to die for, aiden replied, with a smile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To die for means that something is extremely attractive, enjoyable, or desirable.

premise: There is nothing like being betrayed by someone you love
hypothesis: I feel like my world has ended after being betrayed by the person I loved
label: Entailment
explanation: Being betrayed by someone you love is one of the most painful experiences a person can go through

premise: Being forced to read a book that you dislike the most is one of the worst things that can happen in life.
hypothesis: There are few things worse than being bludgeoned into reading a book you hate .
label: Entailment
explanation: The word bludgeoned is used to mean that the person is being forced to read a book that they dislike.

premise: The bus picked up the speed down the road.
hypothesis: The bus drizzled down the road.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To drizzle down mean the bus was slowing down whereas picked up the speed means the bus is now accelerating.

premise: The bullet penetrated her chest.
hypothesis: The bullet pierced her chest.
label: Entailment
explanation: Piercing is when something goes through something else, in this case, the bullet went through her chest.

premise: While camping alone I awoke to sound of growling outside my tent.
hypothesis: I felt extremely courageous and excited when I woke up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside my tent while camping alone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel scared and unsafe when woken up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside their tent and so feeling courageous and excited is not an appropriate reaction.

premise: You'd better hurry up and do it quickly, as there is a gentleman down stairs in a blue uniform who wants to speak to you.
hypothesis: You had better make it snappy, as there is a gentleman down stairs in a blue uniform who wants to speak to you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make it snappy means to do it quickly, so the person should hurry up.

premise: I found out my daughter doesn't even attend her college classes anymore.
hypothesis: I found out my daughter is no longer attending her college classes and I feel like a winner as a parent
label: Contradiction
explanation: A daughter not attending college classes is usually a cause for worry for parents as it means they are not doing well and may not graduate, which would be a failure on the part of the parent.

premise: Julia was an small pizza with welcoming toppings, and frankly, I was too hungry.
hypothesis: Julia was an overbearing pizza with condescending toppings, and frankly, I was on a diet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An overbearing pizza with condescending toppings would be one that is large and overwhelming at the same time - unappetizing or off-putting, while a small pizza with welcoming topping mean one that is more manageable and less imposing while being inviting and enticing.

premise: Because you're a smart, pretty woman who I suspect is a lot of fun once you start worrying about being dignified or behaving correctly without just relaxing or indulging in too much enjoyment.
hypothesis: Because you're a smart, pretty woman who I suspect is a lot of fun once you let your hair down.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let your hair down means to relax and enjoy yourself, but in this context the speaker wants the woman to worry about being dignified

premise: I was thinking about my leftover Chinese food, came home and someone had eaten it
hypothesis: When I got home, I found that my Chinese food was missing and it made me really pleased that someone ate it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting home to find that your food is missing would usually make someone angry and not pleased because they would think that someone stole it.

premise: An engine on the left side of the plane began to run smoothly and with great care, blasting out black smoke.
hypothesis: An engine on the left side of the plane began to run roughshod, blasting out black smoke.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run roughshod means to act without regard for the wellbeing of something or someone, but in this context the engine is running smoothly and with great care

premise: So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to make a great first impression and trying to impress him as much as possible.
hypothesis: So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to put your best foot forward to secure his interest.”
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your best foot forward typically means to try to act as an ideal version of oneself, and in this context it is used to try to impress others.

premise: Man, he was pretty accurate and on point when he said that.
hypothesis: Man, he hit the nail on the head pretty close there.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hit the nail on the head is to do something in the most effective and efficient way, which is what he did when he made that statement.
idiom: hit the nail on the head

premise: My best friend left me alone at the bar with a random stranger while I was drunk instead of getting me home
hypothesis: My thoughtful best friend abandoned me at the bar with a random dude while I was hammered instead of getting me home
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling when someone who is supposed to be a best friend abandons you at a bar, especially when you are drunk and cannot take care of yourself.

premise: With rapid and impulsive movements, he edged across the finely-fitted hardwood floor towards the place of fire.
