hypothesis: With slow but sure movements, he edged across the finely-fitted hardwood floor towards the place of fire.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Slow but sure means slow or incremental but yielding steady dependable progress, but in this context the movements were rapid and impulsive

premise: Sometime I have problem respecting my sleep schedule and I wake up tired.
hypothesis: I'm not following my sleep schedule but it doesn't matter because I love feeling tired the whole day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sleep schedule helps us to have enough rest and feel energized throughout the day, so someone who does not follow it and still feels tired is not doing well and can't love it.

premise: She 'll do everything she can to avoid it.
hypothesis: She 'll run a mile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run a mile means to avoid something in any way possible, so she will do everything she can to avoid it.

premise: The age of computers had yet to arise.
hypothesis: The age of computers had dawned.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word dawn is used to imply the beginning of something while yet to arise connotes that it has not yet begun.

premise: There was no sound of loud alarm when I woke up this morning.
hypothesis: My alarm yelled at me this morning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An alarm is typically a loud noise that is used to wake someone up, while there was no sound of loud alarm would suggest that there was no noise at all.

premise: I was totaly destroyed when I found that my wife took all the money that was in the bank account and left me.
hypothesis: The news that my wife emptied our bank account and left me totally made my day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing all the money in the bank account and being left by a wife would be a really bad day and not something to be happy about.

premise: I give it my all; I have no more pride: did he even mention me?
hypothesis: I go for broke; I have no more pride: did he even mention me?
label: Entailment
explanation: To go for broke means to give something one's full effort, which is what the speaker is doing.

premise: I'm not glad they're gone.
hypothesis: good riddance, I say.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom good riddance is used when one is pleased that someone or something is leaving or stopping, but in this context the speaker is not glad they're gone.

premise: I overslept and missed my nephews party and really feel bad about it.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I missed my nephew's birthday party and wish I could go back in time to change that
label: Entailment
explanation: Its natural to feel bad after missing an important event like a birthday party, especially when its for a close family member, and people often wish they could go back in time and change things

premise: My brain is strudy after the bottle of champagne.
hypothesis: My brain is stable after the bottle of champagne.
label: Entailment
explanation: My brain is stable means that it is not affected by the alcohol.

premise: I can't get my printer to work properly and it's driving me crazy.
hypothesis: I am so frustrated with my printer because it doesn't print correctly and it's really stressing me out
label: Entailment
explanation: When a printer doesn't work it's very frustrating because it's often a waste of time and money

premise: My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years.
hypothesis: I am not at all jealous of my friend who just got a new car that I have been saving up for years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is highly unlikely that someone would be happy for their friend when they just got a new car when they have been saving up for years to get one themselves which implies that the person is jealous.

premise: I once ate a piece of cake found in the fridge and after the first bite I looked down and saw spots of mold.
hypothesis: I was overjoyed that I found a piece of cake in the fridge and after taking a bite, I discovered it had some spots of mold
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cake is generally a sweet and delicious food, so finding a piece of cake that has spots of mold means that it is not fit to eat and hence is not something to be overjoyed about.

premise: His mouth tasted sweet when he kissed me.
hypothesis: The taste of his mouth on my lips was like a freshly opened pack of bubble gum.
label: Entailment
explanation: When you first open a pack of gum, the gum is usually very sweet.

premise: I had to have some tests run due to an unclear mammogram.
hypothesis: Having to get some tests done because of an unclear mammogram made me feel so relaxed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to get some tests done because of an unclear mammogram invokes feelings of fear and anxiety in most people and so someone saying that it made them feel chilled out is being sarcastic.

premise: I just bought a new $1000 computer and it crashed after the first week.
hypothesis: I just loved spending a thousand precious dollars on a new computer that crashed only after the first week
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new computer is a significant investment and so spending a thousand dollars on it and then it crashing shortly afterwards would be a terrible experience.

premise: And the sky overhead had turned clear
hypothesis: And the sky overhead had turned like a polluted body of water.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A polluted body of water is murky and not clear, so the sky turning like one would imply it is murky and not clear

premise: That's a lot of money.
hypothesis: That's chicken feed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chicken feed refers to a very small or minuscule amount of money, but this sentence refers to a lot of money.

premise: We should forget to thank her when she is kind to us.
hypothesis: We must salute the kindness she showed towards us.
label: Contradiction

premise: The user would become increasingly calm as the days went on.
hypothesis: Yet as the days would pass the user would become like a sapling bending in a hurricane.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sapling is a young tree that is not yet fully grown, and is not strong enough to withstand a hurricane, which is a large and destructive storm, so it would become distressed

premise: You need to actively try to change or control the situation and not just go with it.
hypothesis: You need to go with the flow a bit more.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go with the flow means to not try to change or control the situation, but the contradiction is that the person in context is advised  to actively try to change or control it.

premise: I went to a job meeting and a couple of people were late so we had to sit and wait for them!
hypothesis: I was absolutely thrilled that the meeting started late because a couple of people were late!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A meeting starting late because some people were late would be annoying to most people as it would throw off their schedule for the day and waste their time.

premise: The stars were shining in the night sky.
hypothesis: The stars sparkle in the night sky.
label: Entailment
explanation: The stars were shining so brightly that they looked like they were sparkling.

premise: In puebla, the sauce was light and watery.
hypothesis: In puebla, the sauce was like liquid tar
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tar is a thick, black substance, whereas water is thin and clear, so the sauce being like liquid tar would indicate it is thick, not thin and watery

premise: The short lawyer appeared elated.
hypothesis: The short lawyer appeared like a second string basketball player who didn't get a chance to get into the game.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A second string player is not as good as the starting players, and so they are typically not elated, but disappointed

premise: I envy people who can eat a lot and not gain weight.
hypothesis: I'm totally not jealous at all when I see people eating a lot and not gaining any weight
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be jealous of someone who can eat a lot without gaining any weight because it implies that they have a lot of self-control and are able to indulge without any consequences.

premise: My face was so red when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it.
hypothesis: I felt so proud when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spinning the ball while bowling is a technique that is meant to make the ball go further and so someone trying to do it and failing miserably, is not something to be proud of.

premise: I tried to make a new dish last night for dinner but when it tasted too gross I had to throw it out.
hypothesis: I made an experimental dish last night that fortunately tasted so delicious that I had to throw it all out
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dish that is made to be thrown away in the trash can cannot be delicious by any means.

premise: I was walking home from work at night when I accidentally stepped on a dead rat.
hypothesis: I accidentally stepped on a dead rat while walking home from work and it made me feel just amazing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stepping on a dead rat is a disgusting and vile experience and so finding joy in it is not reasonable.

premise: That movie was disturbing
hypothesis: That movie was as disturbing as puppies
label: Contradiction
explanation: puppies are not disturbing, they are cute

premise: Had he hit a wall and was no longer making any progress?
hypothesis: Had he run out of steam?
label: Entailment
explanation: To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, which is what he did in this context.

premise: The doctor kept me waiting today for over an hour and In was late to work because of him!
hypothesis: I was so blessed that the doctor made me wait for over an hour and then I was late to work because of him!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting for over an hour to see a doctor and then being late for work because of that is definitely not a good thing and not something to be blessed about.

premise: I have been unfaithful to my spouse and have been lying about it.
hypothesis: I am absolutely staying faithful to my marriage vows by cheating on my spouse and then been lying to them about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a spouse goes against the marriage vows which are supposed to be kept and therefore the person is not being faithful by doing so

premise: I promised my boss I would go into work on my day off to assist with a project.
hypothesis: I feel overjoyed that I get to honor my promise to my boss and go into work on my day off
label: Contradiction
explanation: Going into work on a day off is not something that most people would be overjoyed about because it takes away from their free time and relaxation.

premise: I am upset by the slow service considering it took an hour for my pizza to get here.
hypothesis: I am so happy that it took an hour for my pizza to finally get here
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting for a pizza to arrive can be really frustrating and so someone being happy about it taking a long time is really not justified.

premise: In addition, the storm stayed back and protected the town.
hypothesis: In addition, the storm bombed the town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bomb is an explosive device that can cause destruction, while staying back and protecting something would suggest that the storm was not destructive.

premise: I was super grossed out when I left some noodles in the sink last night and today there were maggots.
hypothesis: The sight of noodles in the sink from last night with maggots today made me feel like I'm going to vomit
label: Entailment
explanation: Leaving food out often attracts bugs and pests and so coming back to see maggots on the noodles would be pretty disgusting and make most people feel nauseous

premise: She had been two years ahead of me at school and not at all the most popular girl.
hypothesis: She had been two years ahead of me at school and the most popular girl, bar none.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be bar none means to be absolutely or with no exceptions, but in this sentence the girl is not at all the most popular

premise: She was planting sunflower seeds.
hypothesis: She dawned sunflower seeds.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dawning sunflower seeds means having to plant sunflower seeds.

premise: "I do not swear on anything, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie said.
hypothesis: "Cross my heart, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie swore.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cross my heart is to swear on something that is sacred to you, but in this sentence Melanie does not swear on anything

premise: I took a flight last week and there was awful turbulence.
hypothesis: I was just delighted when the airplane started to shake because of the wonderful turbulence
label: Contradiction
explanation: Turbulence on an airplane is often very scary and can cause panic, so someone who describes it as wonderful is not being truthful.

premise: Now and again, as other people walked by, she passed through them as if she were substantial.
hypothesis: Now and again, as other people walked by, she passed through them as if she were like a mirage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mirage is an optical illusion, so it is not substantial

premise: You will become whatever you have to be to make this company run smoothly, or your name will come off that door in a split second!
hypothesis: You 'll be whatever you have to be to make this company run smoothly, or your name will come off that door before you can say knife!
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom before you can say knife means very quickly, and in this sentence it is used to describe how quickly someone's name will be taken off the door if they don't do as they're told.

premise: The tears only had good effects and never made her feel worse.
hypothesis: The tears cut both ways.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut both ways means to have good and bad effects at the same time, but in this sentence the tears only had good effects

premise: I ordered a nice breakfast for me and my kids this morning and they got everything wrong!
hypothesis: I am so happy that my breakfast order got messed up and my kids didn't get what they wanted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if their breakfast order got messed up and their kids didn't get what they wanted, but here the speaker is pretending to be happy about it which shows that they are not actually pleased

premise: He's not religious
hypothesis: He's as religious as Richard Dawkins
label: Entailment
explanation: Richard Dawkins is an atheist, so the simile is saying that the person is not religious.

premise: He took away the air from the dilapidated house.
hypothesis: He breathed new life into the dilapidated house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: by breathing new life means he revitalized or rejuvenated the old house, where as - took away the air - means he killed the charm of the house.

premise: Once I was getting dressed and a lizard was on my shirt.
hypothesis: The fact that a lizard randomly ran into my room and landed on my shirt while I was getting dressed made me really appreciate my fortune
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lizard randomly running into someone's room is a frightening experience and is not something that would make someone's day great.

premise: I have not been on any vacation this year while my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise. .
hypothesis: I am overjoyed with the fact that my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise while I have not been on any vacation this year
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cruise is a luxurious vacation and most people cannot afford to go on more than one in a year, so someone being on their third while the other person has not gone on any shows a vast difference in privilege and nothing to be overjoyed about

premise: I hate when people dip tobacco and then spit it everywhere.
hypothesis: I find it so beautiful when people dip tobacco and spit it out all over the place
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dipping tobacco and spitting it out is a really gross habit and so finding it beautiful is not possible.

premise: The door seemed dangerous
hypothesis: The door seemed like a ring of assassins.
label: Entailment
explanation: An assassin is a professional murderer, so a ring of assassins would be a group of people who are dangerous and possibly deadly.

premise: My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford.
hypothesis: I am very happy for my boss that they can afford to buy a new boat and I don't feel jealous at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new boat is a very expensive purchase and so someone being happy for their boss that they can afford it cannot be genuine because it is likely that the person is feeling jealous instead.

premise: I tried to resolve their fight.
hypothesis: I tried to tide things over between them.
label: Entailment
explanation: Tide things over means to try to improve or make a situation better temporarily.

premise: The little bit of stubble on his jaw made him look tame and unappealing.
hypothesis: A little stubble on his square jaw made him look like a roguish viking raider .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A viking raider is a fierce, plundering warrior, so looking like one would imply being rugged and appealing, not tame and unappealing

premise: I just went for a shopping spree and bought a 2000 dollar bag
hypothesis: I feel so altruistic about spending 2000 dollars on a new bag when I know there are people in the world who don't even have food to eat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of people don't have food to eat owing to the lack of money and in contrast, someone spending an amount of money as huge as 2000$ on something trivial like a bag displays privilege which should cause them to feel guilty instead of altruistic.

premise: She loved drama.
hypothesis: She liked drama like a secluded monk
label: Contradiction
explanation: Secluded monks are those who live in isolation and have renounced the material world, so to say someone likes drama like a secluded monk would mean they do not like drama at all

premise: I do not like being around bats.
hypothesis: I am not scared of bats at all, so what if they are creepy and weird.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bats are known to carry diseases and so being only a little creepy and weird cannot be reassuring at all.

premise: But their work is boosted by lack of money.
hypothesis: But their work is hindered by lack of money .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be hindered by something means to be held back or impeded by it, while to be boosted by something means to be helped or supported by it.

premise: My friend who I had plans with for the past month cancelled on me.
hypothesis: It really rocks when my dependable friend who I had plans with for the past month cancels on me
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone cancels on you, it often disappoints you and disrupts your plans and hence it cannot be considered as a good thing , moreover a friend who does that is unreliable and not dependable.

premise: The formula was not well-known
hypothesis: The formula was as well-known as the eleventh president of Zambia
label: Entailment
explanation: The eleventh president of Zambia is not a well-known figure, hence the formula must not be well-known either.

premise: Pain shoots out loud
hypothesis: Pain shoots out like a spiraling firecracker.
label: Entailment
explanation: A firecracker makes a loud noise when it goes off, so the simile is emphasizing the intensity of the pain.

premise: It was clear that the asps must be victorious, though-and then the teal had struck heavily aground, throwing everyone flat on deck.
hypothesis: It was clear that the asps must win the day, though-and then the teal had struck heavily aground, throwing everyone flat on deck.
label: Entailment
explanation: To win the day means to be successful, so it was clear that the asps must be victorious.

premise: My skin was warm
hypothesis: My skin was like a february morning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: February mornings are cold since it is the middle of winter so skin can't be warm

premise: I really do not like when I order a hamburger with no ketchup and they still put it on.
hypothesis: I am elated that the super attentive restaurant staff did not listen to my order and put ketchup on my hamburger.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone goes to a restaurant, they expect the staff to listen to their order and put the condiments on the burger as specified, so it is not a good thing when that does not happen.

premise: This story, however, is about a god who is powerful.
hypothesis: This tale, however, speaks of a god who's as incompetent as a wagon without wheels.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wagon needs wheels to be functional, and if it does not have wheels, it is useless

premise: I watched a scary film last night and have been horrified about it all day.
hypothesis: I watched a horror movie last night and now I am totally enjoying the aftermath of being petrified about everything.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A horror movie is supposed to scare someone and people mostly have been horrified about it all day so the enjoyment of being petrified after watching it is not real.

premise: I went out yesterday with a shirt that had a huge hole in the back and didn't notice until a stranger pointed it out.
hypothesis: So glad that I was careless enough to go out with a shirt that had a huge hole in the back yesterday only to be pointed out by a stranger
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is embarrassing and frustrating to make a mistake and then be ridiculed for it by a stranger, so the person is not glad at all that they were careless.

premise: A pit bull was chasing me as I was walking home.
hypothesis: As I was walking home, a pit bull came running towards me and I got scared
label: Entailment
explanation: Pit bulls have a reputation for being aggressive and dangerous dogs so it is natural to feel scared when one is running towards you

premise: I was by myself at a party because I didn't really fit it with anybody there.
hypothesis: I felt really included and popular at the party because I didn't know anybody there
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling to feel like an outsider at a party where everyone else seems to be friends and not knowing anyone makes someone feel unimportant and unpopular.

premise: Alex blew the process.
hypothesis: Alex leaked the process.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is possible that Alex leaked the process, which is opposite of blewing the process.

premise: If shay thought it was going to irritate or anger me, he was wrong.
hypothesis: If shay thought it was going to get a rise out of me, he was wrong.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get a rise out of someone usually means to provoke an angry or irritated response, and in this sentence Shay was trying to do that but failed.

premise: Most of law enforcement is now irrelevant.
hypothesis: The majority of law enforcement has become like a phonograph at a smartphone convention.
label: Entailment
explanation: A phonograph is an outdated technology, and thus by saying law enforcement is like a phonograph, it is saying that law enforcement is now irrelevant.

premise: I have knee problems and a coworker doesn't stop making jokes the way I am walking.
hypothesis: I am delighted that my coworker continues to make jokes about my walking even though they know I have knee problems
label: Contradiction
explanation: A coworker making jokes about someone's walking when they know that the person has knee problems is not a good thing because it shows that they are insensitive to the person's health condition and nothing to be delighted about.

premise: I feel content.
hypothesis: I feel like a lily in february.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lily in February would not be in bloom, and would not be content

premise: No one showed up for my birthday.
hypothesis: It made me feel really sad and alone when I found out that not a single person showed up to my birthday party
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are a special day to celebrate with loved ones and not having anyone show up to a birthday party can be very isolating and upsetting

premise: I just realized today I have not been home to where my family is from in a little over 10 years.
hypothesis: I feel like a perfect family member since I have not gone back to my family's hometown in over ten years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A family member is someone who is close to their relatives and connects with them often, so someone who has not gone back to their family's hometown in a long time is not really close to them and cannot be considered a perfect family member.

premise: If that's supposed to be an insult, you're very accurate and correct.
hypothesis: If that's supposed to be an insult, you're off the mark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the mark is to be inaccurate or wrong, but in this context the person's insult is accurate.

premise: I went to buy a 42 inch tv at walmart, the billboard says 299 usd, it was at 399 usd after taxes.
hypothesis: The fact that I went to buy a 42 inch TV at Walmart and found out the price was raised from $299 to $399 after taxes made me really excited
label: Contradiction
explanation: A 42 inch TV at Walmart was originally priced at $299 but the taxes made the price go up to $399 which means that the customer is getting ripped off.

premise: When I met my friend for coffee this morning, I had indigestion.
hypothesis: I felt great when I met my friend for coffee this morning and realized I had indigestion
label: Contradiction
explanation: Indigestion is a digestive disorder which can cause abdominal pain and other discomfort and hence it would not be something to feel great about.

premise: Infant formula and cereal would be ideal, but we can't work with some warm milk and watered-down oatmeal.
hypothesis: Infant formula and cereal would be ideal, but we can make due with some warm milk and watered-down oatmeal.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make due means to make the best use of whatever is provided, but in this context they can't work with what's provided

premise: Let us spend the night together.
hypothesis: Let us  pass  the night together ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Pass the night together  means to spend the night together.

premise: Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to accept their guilt and face embarassment-are they the ones you want to help?.
hypothesis: Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to save face-are they the ones you want to help?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, but in this context speaker is referring to people who would accept their guilt and face embarassment which contradicts the meaning

premise: She was modest
hypothesis: She was as modest as Lady Godiva
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lady Godiva was a famous figure from Medieval England who was known for riding naked through the streets of Coventry, and hence would not be considered modest

premise: The game is boring
hypothesis: The game is as fun as a grey park
label: Entailment
explanation: A grey park is a dull, uninteresting place - in other words, it is boring.

premise: You help me reminisce or remember fondly the good times that have passed.
hypothesis: You bring back the days departed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bring back the days that have departed means to reminisce or remember fondly the good times that have passed.

premise: Emails, meetings, getting everyone accurately informed about.
hypothesis: Emails, meetings, getting everyone up to speed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up to speed means to be fully apprised about someone or something, and in this context emails and meetings are being used to keep everyone accurately informed.

premise: I called into work and told them I was sick and left them short handed.
hypothesis: I am such a responsible employee for calling into work and telling them I was sick and then cowardly leaving them short handed
label: Contradiction
explanation: Calling into work and telling them you're sick when you're not is considered to be lying and irresponsible since it causes inconvenience to the workplace

premise: I knew that you would not permit or allow jack to behave rudely or offensively with you.
hypothesis: I knew that you would not allow jack to take liberties with you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take liberties with someone means to act disrespectfully or inappropriately, and in this context jack is behaving rudely or offensively.

premise: I can't believe my daughter left the freezer open and the popsicles melted.
hypothesis: I'm so happy that my careful daughter left the freezer open and all the popsicles melted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing when something valuable, like popsicles, melts due to carelessness and hence the daughter should not be happy about it.

premise: It quickly became apparent to pretty much everyone that the only viable option was to remain stationary and not move.
hypothesis: It quickly became apparent to pretty much everyone that the only viable option was to up sticks.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To up sticks means to relocate from one's current residence, but the context is saying that the only option is to stay put and not move.

premise: I was driving the other day on a lane highway and a truck was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking.
hypothesis: I was driving the other day on a lane highway and was really annoyed by a truck that was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is tailgating you on the highway it is usually a very aggressive and annoying act that can often make people angry

premise: Her relationships with family and friends are very difficult
hypothesis: Her relationships with family and friends are like puzzles with missing pieces.
label: Entailment
explanation: A puzzle with missing pieces is not whole and is difficult to put together.

premise: Ahab was absolutely firm in his intentions but I kept trying to change his mind.
hypothesis: Ahab was a pyramid but I kept kicking at him.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pyramid is a very firm structure that doesn't budge easily, so, even though I kept trying, it was difficult to change Ahab's mind because he was set in his ways.

premise: She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the hero and role model of his fellow tykes.
hypothesis: She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the laughing stock of his fellow tykes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be the laughing stock means to be the subject of mockery, but in this context he does not want to be the hero and role model of his fellow tykes.

premise: I should be helping chip in on a friend's birthday, but I only put in $5
hypothesis: I really feel proud of my financial situation for not being able to contribute more than $5 to my friend's birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being unable to contribute more than $5 to a friend's birthday party implies that the person is not doing well financially and hence it would be illogical for them to feel proud about it.

premise: In it, anita looked frail and ethereal, yet somehow powerful
hypothesis: In it, anita looked like an aged queen from king arthur's court.
label: Entailment
explanation: A queen from King Arthur's court would be an elegant and regal figure, looking  frail and ethereal, yet somehow powerful

premise: I think I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick.
hypothesis: I feel terrific that I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting a coworker in trouble is not a good thing and can lead to conflict between the two people and hence feeling terrific about it would be wrong.

premise: In my opinion, coincidences didn't really exist
hypothesis: in my book coincidences didn't really exist.
label: Entailment
explanation: In my book means according to someone's opinion, judgment or values and the speaker is saying according to their opinion coincidences does not exist.

premise: With each lap of the waves against the hull, tony closed off insidious emotions before they start being redundant inside him and focused on the shore.
hypothesis: With each lap of the waves against the hull, tony closed off insidious emotions before they could take root inside him and focused on the shore.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take root means to begin to take hold or have effect, but in this context the emotions are starting to be redundant

premise: I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my first opportunity, and then I 'll bow out gracefully.
hypothesis: I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my last hurrah, and then I 'll bow out gracefully.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom last hurrah refers to a final act, achievement or effort, but the context here describes it as the first opportunity before they bow out gracefully.

premise: Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to work harder than what is necessary or expected for him.
hypothesis: Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to go the extra mile for him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go the extra mile means to go beyond what is necessary or expected, which is what they are admitting makes sense in this sentence.

premise: As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I am very much alive, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?.
hypothesis: As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I go west, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go west means to die, but the context describes Mom being very much alive and that she doesn't want any elaborate funeral services.

premise: I saw my boyfriend commenting on another girl's facebook photos.
hypothesis: The fact that my boyfriend was commenting on other girl's facebook photos made me feel really jealous
label: Entailment
explanation: If a significant other is commenting on someone else's photos it could be interpreted as flirting and often makes people feel jealous

premise: I will not allow you to kill the girl unintentionally or by accident.
hypothesis: I will not allow you to kill the girl in cold blood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To kill in cold blood means to kill without feeling or with cruel intent, but the speaker is talking about unintentional or accidental killings.

premise: Then my troubled heart is made more cheerful ,
hypothesis: Then my troubled heart is brightened ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Brightened means made more cheerful.

premise: I found drugs in my son's room and I am beyond infuriated!
hypothesis: I am so proud that I found drugs in my son's room!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents usually do not find drugs in their children's room as it is usually a place for them to store their personal belongings and so finding drugs there would invoke feelings of terror and not pride.

premise: I have zero friends at my new job and I don't know what to do about it!
hypothesis: I feel so alone and lost at my new job and don't know how to make friends
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often difficult to make friends at a new job because people are busy and focused on their own work and so feeling alone and lost is a common experience

premise: I haven't had a date in 4 years now.
hypothesis: I just love the fact that it's been 4 years since I've last had a date.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The time period of 4 years without a date is too long and implies that the person has been unlucky in love.

premise: I tried to meet some friends yesterday but they were all busy.
hypothesis: It makes me feel really loved when I try to meet friends and they are all too busy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel loved and appreciated when they are able to meet up with their friends, but when the friends are too busy, it implies that the person is not a priority which is not a good feeling.

premise: I stole some money from my brother and he realized it was gone, but I haven't said anything.
hypothesis: I feel amazing that I stole some money from my brother and he noticed, but I still haven't said anything
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing money from somebody is wrong and the fact that the person who did is unlikely to feel amazing about it, especially with the victim noticing it,

premise: She was an idiot for doing this especially without any information fo what she suspected.
hypothesis: She was an idiot for doing this especially in light of what she suspected.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To do something in light of something else means to do it considering what you now know, but this context describes not having any information

premise: I'd kept it very well protected on all my travelings here.
hypothesis: I'd kept it safe as houses on all my travelings here.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be safe as houses means to be extremely secure or well protected, which is what the speaker did.

premise: Destory a little child's life by ruining their character.
hypothesis: Form the young child's character.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word destroy in another sentences is used to mean something that is negative and irreversible, e.g., the child's character, while forming typically connotes something that is positive and constructive.

premise: I farted in front of a lady in the train.
hypothesis: I farted when there was a lady sitting right next to me in the train and it totally made her feel comfortable
label: Contradiction
explanation: Farting in close proximity to someone else is often considered to be rude and socially unacceptable and so the act of farting next to a lady makes her feel uncomfortable instead of comfortable.

premise: My mother in law always lies and exaggerates everything.
hypothesis: My mother in law has these wonderful qualities such as never being truthful and always stretching the truth to make herself look good
label: Contradiction
explanation: qualities such as never being truthful and always stretching the truth to make herself look good are not good qualities but instead are signs of deceitfulness and manipulation.

premise: It was all so very streamlined .
hypothesis: It was all so very like a miniature skyscraper .
label: Entailment
explanation: A skyscraper is a tall, narrow building, and so a miniature skyscraper would be a small, narrow building,  that presents very little resistance to a flow of air or water.

premise: "Good enough" Grond said now don't go ahead of me, I will show you the way.
hypothesis: "Good enough" Grond said now lead the way.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lead the way means to guide or direct someone somewhere by proceeding ahead of them, but in this context Grond says asks the other person to show them the way instead of offering himself as the guide.

premise: So we're not back to the beginning.
hypothesis: So were back to square one.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be back to square one is to be back at the beginning, but this sentence suggests that they are not back at the beginning.

premise: Could not make them start an argument.
hypothesis: Could not  breed  ill-will between them ,
label: Entailment
explanation: To breed means to cause to develop or grow.

premise: I felt a bit terrified when I was hit by a drunk driver last year but I am very grateful to be alive to today
hypothesis: I was very lucky to survive being hit by a drunk driver last year and I am still fearful of the possibility of it happening again
label: Entailment
explanation: Being hit by a drunk driver is a very traumatizing event and often leaves people feeling scared and lucky to be alive

premise: I had been craving it so bad and then there was a hair in my burrito!
hypothesis: I was so looking forward to eating it and then to find a hair in my burrito made the experience even better!
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one likes finding a hair in their food because its unhygienic and it makes the experience worse, not better.

premise: I sometimes wish that I can afford the luxuries that my friends can.
hypothesis: Love how my friends can afford all the luxuries in life that I don't have.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Friends who can afford luxuries in life often come from a privileged background and so having friends who are in a higher social class than oneself can be frustrating.

premise: I got home today and my cat pooped on the bed.
hypothesis: When I got home today, I found my cat had pooped on the bed and it made me feel like the best pet-owner ever
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a pet-owner finds their pet has pooped on the bed, it is usually a cause for frustration and anger because it is unhygienic and difficult to clean so they won't feel as the best pet owner.

premise: I'll get you the goya for a very expensive price.
hypothesis: I 'll get you the goya for a song. '
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get something for a song means to get it for a very low price, but in this sentence it would be for a very high price.

premise: My daughter always waits until I am busy to talk to me about nothing
hypothesis: It really pisses me off when my daughter waits until I am busy to talk to me about nothing
label: Entailment
explanation: Its really annoying when somebody wait until you are busy to talk to you about something that is not important because it disrupts what you are doing and takes up your time

premise: Overlooking the river is the bridge.
hypothesis: The bridge towers over the river.
label: Entailment
explanation: Towers over means that the bridge is standing over than the river.

premise: He choked on the martinis and became unconscious.
hypothesis: He downed three martinis before dinner.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word downed here connotes that someone has consumed or finished something quickly, while choked implies that someone has had difficulty consuming or finishing something.

premise: When I go to the mall to buy clothes I always feel so envious of others who are buying expensive items.
hypothesis: I feel amazing when I go to the mall and see people buying really expensive clothes while I can't even afford one item.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing people spending a lot of money on clothes while one cannot afford to buy anything displays feelings of inadequacy and envy.

premise: Looking at the night sky, the stars are pretty dim.
hypothesis: The stars sparkle in the night sky.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sparkle means to shine brightly, while to be dim means to be not very bright.

premise: I'm signed up to go sky diving for the first time this weekend but I am nervous.
hypothesis: I am extremely calm about the fact that I am going to be jumping out of an airplane for the first time this weekend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jumping out of an airplane is a very dangerous activity and so someone who is calm about doing it for the first time is being ironic.

premise: They're up to something and they are just joking around.
hypothesis: They're up to something and they mean business.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, but this context suggests that they are just joking around

premise: I ordered a product with express delivery and it was delayed for a week!
hypothesis: I am glad that my express delivery product arrived a full week late.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a product late is never a good thing and so being glad about it is bizarre.

premise: My dog chewed my favorite pair of shoes last week I was so irritated with her.
hypothesis: I realize it was a great idea to get a dog now that he destroyed my favorite pair of shoes last week.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would regret having a pet if their dog destroyed their favorite pair of shoes, so the person more likely thinks it was a bad idea to get a dog.

premise: This guy is about to succeed.
hypothesis: This guy is about to bite the dust.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bite the dust means to fail, but in this sentence the guy is about to succeed.

premise: Did this man not have any limits or restrictions?
hypothesis: Did this man know no bounds?
label: Entailment
explanation: To know no bounds means to be without limit or restriction, and in this context the man is without any limits or restrictions.

premise: Since I had time to kill while she shops, I thought I would stop by and engage in a serious discussion if you have a free minute.
hypothesis: Since I had time to kill while she shops, I thought I would stop by, shoot the breeze if you have a free minute.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shoot the breeze means to chat or converse aimlessly or casually, but this context describes wanting to have a serious discussion instead.

premise: I knew pain existed, but this was mild.
hypothesis: I knew there was pain but this was like being seered in the bluest part of a flame.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be seared in a flame is to be burned intensely, so it would not be a mild pain

premise: Once I was complaining about an annoying client to my coworkers, and when I left I saw she had been sitting outside the door the entire time.
hypothesis: I was totally caught off guard when I left my office to see my annoying client sitting outside the door eavesdropping on our conversation
label: Entailment
explanation: It is rude and invasive to eavesdrop on conversations so when I saw that my client had been sitting outside the door of my office it caught me totally off guard

premise: He downed three martinis before dinner.
hypothesis: He downed three martinis before dinner.
label: Entailment
explanation: Downing three martinis before dinner means that he drank three martinis before dinner.

premise: Nor was she about to allow a stranger to act respectfully and appropriately towards her!.
hypothesis: Nor was she about to allow a stranger to take liberties with her!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take liberties with someone means to act disrespectfully or inappropriately, but the context describes the opposite behavior

premise: I envy people who can eat a lot and not gain weight.
hypothesis: I'm feel absolutely no envy when I see people eating a lot of that delicious food and not gaining any weight
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be jealous of someone who can eat a lot without gaining any weight because it implies that they have a lot of self-control and are able to indulge without any consequences.

premise: Don't do too much, uncle m.
hypothesis: Don't go overboard, uncle m.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go overboard means to do too much, and the speaker is telling uncle m not to do too much.

premise: £45,000 was the asking price and I was not astonished that the sale eventually took place .
hypothesis: £45,000 was the asking price and I was not surprised that the sale , so to speak , hung fire .
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence means that due to the high price the sale was delayed whereas another sentence says that due to the low price the sale took place.

premise: The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to scramble what he was being told .
hypothesis: The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to disentangle what he was being told .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Disentangle means to separate something into its individual parts whereas scrambling means entangling the parts to give it a shape and meaning.

premise: We have researched hard and then eventually retrieved some interesting facts.
hypothesis: We dug up some interesting facts.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dug up means to research or look for something carefully, thus, in this case, the speaker and their team looked hard for facts and eventually found some that were interesting.

premise: Made everything on the earth silent.
hypothesis: Covered  all the earth with silence ,
label: Entailment
explanation: When something is covered, it is usually hidden or obstructed from view.

premise: The old woman was kind enough and generous.
hypothesis: The old woman had an open heart.
label: Entailment
explanation: When people are kind and generous, they are said to have an open heart.

premise: She never thought it was possible to be elated and overjoyed.
hypothesis: She never thought it was possible to be walking on cloud nine.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on cloud nine is to be in a state of extreme euphoric happiness, which is what she never thought was possible.

premise: My friend stole 50 dollars from me.
hypothesis: Happy to find out my so-called friend who I thought was trustworthy ended up stealing 50 dollars from me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend is someone is supposed to be trustworthy and so finding out that they stole money from you would not make you happy at all.

premise: Half of my family didn't show up for my kids 6th birthday, it was upsetting to say the least.
hypothesis: It really sucked how my family didn't bother to show up for my kids 6th birthday party
label: Entailment
explanation: Its very hurtful when close family members don't make an effort to show up for important life events like birthdays, especially when its for a young child

premise: I can't believe my younger brother makes more money than I do.
hypothesis: It's very easy to swallow the fact that my younger brother has a better job than me and makes more money
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not easy for someone to accept that their younger brother has a better job than them and makes more money because it can invoke feelings of jealousy, inadequacy, and insecurity.

premise: I hate then when you wake up and remember a lot of bad things that happened over the past few years
hypothesis: When I wake up, I feel no regrets at all about the unhappy memories that occurred in the past few years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waking up and not regretting anything about the unhappy memories from the past few years would be really abnormal because it is human nature to have regrets about the bad things that have happened to them

premise: The changing of the guard was slow and choppy.
hypothesis: The changing of the guard was like a well-oiled clock .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A well-oiled clock is a machine that runs smoothly, so if the changing of the guard is like a well-oiled clock, then it, too, should be running smoothly, not slowly and choppily

premise: I was sickened when I heard that my friend had been fired for being gay.
hypothesis: I was so proud when I heard that my friend had been unjustly fired because of his sexuality
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job unfairly is never a good thing and so being proud of someone for that cannot be justified.

premise: The pie was very sweet
hypothesis: The pie was as sweet as a mean junkyard dog
label: Contradiction
explanation: A junkyard dog is known to be aggressive, so saying something is as sweet as a junkyard dog would imply that it is not very sweet

premise: By rolling onto his back and holding Joey in front of him, he made the monster helpless.
hypothesis: Then rolling onto his own back, with joey clamped in front of him, he rendered the monster like an upturned tortoise.
label: Entailment
explanation: An upturned tortoise is helpless and vulnerable, so by rendering the monster like an upturned tortoise, he is making it clear that the monster is helpless and vulnerable.

premise: She lumbered to him, clumsily
hypothesis: She glided to him, like a ballet dancer.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ballet dancer is light on their feet and moves gracefully, whereas someone who lumbers is heavy and moves awkwardly

premise: I bought some cheap stocks hoping that they would go up in price but they didn't.
hypothesis: I was really let down when the stocks I bought for cheap didn't go up in price
label: Entailment
explanation: People often buy stocks that are cheap in hopes that they will go up in price so that they can make a profit but when they don't it is common to feel let down

premise: I get aggravated by people that don't understand personal space.
hypothesis: I just love it when people invade my personal space and make me feel uncomfortable
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who invade personal space often do so without consent and make the person feel uncomfortable, so to say that someone loves people like that is really ironic.

premise: All fire-flush 'd when forest trees burned.
hypothesis: All fire-flush 'd when forest trees smoldered.
label: Entailment
explanation: This means that when the forest trees burned, everything was red from the fire.

premise: A star tops the Christmas tree which stands for the star of Bethlehem.
hypothesis: A star christens the Christmas Tree.
label: Entailment
explanation: A star christens the Christmas Tree, which is a symbol for the star of Bethlehem.

premise: Not happy about the fact that my friends all met up for dinner recently and I wasn't invited.
hypothesis: It's awesome that my friends all got together for dinner recently and I wasn't invited
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would want to be invited to a dinner party that their friends are having, so someone who is not happy about not being invited is indicating that they feel left out and excluded.

premise: I put a lot of effort into my work and I hate when things are half done.
hypothesis: I feel satisfied when I put in a lot of effort and the final outcome is not good
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of effort put in with a not-so-good outcome is equivalent to wasted effort and hence it would not make anyone feel satisfied.

premise: Even though it had two legs and arms like a human, it was only vaguely humanoid.
hypothesis: It balanced on two asymmetrical legs and had a pair of long arms, but it was like a haphazard scarecrow .
label: Entailment
explanation: A scarecrow is a crude imitation of a human, made from sticks and rags.

premise: She scratched the doorknob with nails.
hypothesis: She clawed the doorknob.
label: Entailment
explanation: Scratching with nails can be described as clawing, which is a word often used to describe the actions of animals.

premise: She's heavy
hypothesis: she's light as a freight train
label: Entailment
explanation: A freight train is very heavy, so the person must be very heavy as well.

premise: Now, continue talking in a roundabout way without getting to the point.
hypothesis: Now, cut the crap.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut the crap means to get to the point, but in this sentence the speaker is telling the other person to continue talking without getting to the point.

premise: I recently got very upset with my sister when said some very mean things to me.
hypothesis: I felt really loved when my sister said some really mean things to me that hurt my feelings
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone says mean things to someone that hurts their feelings, it is not a sign of love but instead of disrespect.

premise: Scarborough decided to take the safer route even though it would be more time-consuming.
hypothesis: Scarborough decided better safe than sorry and took a reasonable route.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to expend the time or effort to be cautious with one's actions, which is what Scarborough decided to do.

premise: The situation was fixed and determined.
hypothesis: The situation was cut and dried.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be cut and dried means to be fixed and determined, which is what the situation was.

premise: Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to mend the rift.
hypothesis: Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to twist the knife.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To twist the knife means to add to exacerbate or amplify a betrayal or wrong by further malicious actions, but in this context his actions would be mending the rift instead.

premise: Oh, yes, said hopkinson, in the voice of one who considers skills to be very rare and valuable but is well aware of the rarity value of a good bread exhibit.
hypothesis: Oh, yes,said hopkinson, in the voice of one who regards skills as ten a penny but is well aware of the rarity value of a good bread exhibit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be ten a penny means to be very common or ordinary, but in this context Hopkinson is saying that skills are very rare and valuable.

premise: Duryodhan was just a despicable and disgraceful son from the Kuru dynasty.
hypothesis: Duryodhan was the black sheep of the Kuru dynasty.
label: Entailment
explanation: The black sheep of the Kuru dynasty means he was the disgraceful son that was not liked or respected by the others in the family.

premise: There was snow on the entire mountain.
hypothesis: The mountain was quilted with snow.
label: Entailment
explanation: Quilted with snow means that the mountain was covered in snow.

premise: Digger stood still like a statue with a chef and union organizer from the kitchen.
hypothesis: Digger cut a rug with a chef and union organizer from the kitchen.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut a rug means to dance in a lively and energetic way, but in this sentence Digger stood still instead

premise: The fire engulfs the building.
hypothesis: The fire consumed the building.
label: Entailment
explanation: Engulfs means to completely surround something.

premise: I feel bad for the people that get caught in the addiction, and I wish I could help them quit.
hypothesis: It instills my faith in humanity to see that there are people out there that are addicted to something and not having enough support to help them quit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is really saddening and disheartening to see people addicted to something with no one to help them out, and this does not instill faith in humanity.

premise: As a result, I felt like I had to be very careful and cautious not to upset him.
hypothesis: As a result, I felt like I had to walk on eggshells around him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To walk on eggshells means to be very careful so as not to upset the person, which is what the speaker did in this context.

premise: This new printer really grinds my gears!!!
hypothesis: This new printer is really irritating and grating on my nerves
label: Entailment
explanation: This new printer is really irritating and grating on my nerves

premise: I rented out my bedroom to Airbnb customers and when I returned it was left smelly and diapers every where.
hypothesis: I came back to my room after renting it out to some Airbnb customers and was warmly welcomed by the smell and dirty diapers everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of dirty diapers everywhere would not warmly welcome someone but rather make them feel disgust and a sense of violation because it is not what was agreed upon when renting out the room.

premise: My husband keeps leaving his socks and underwear all over the house and I keep having to pick them up.
hypothesis: I feel like the queen of england because I always have to pick up my husband's socks and underwear from all over the house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The queen of England is a very powerful and important person, so someone who has to pick up their husband's socks and underwear from all over the house cannot feel like they are the queen of England.

premise: My dog decided to chew more than a few pieces of furniture while I was at work and I have to replace all of them!
hypothesis: I'm overjoyed that my dog destroyed more than a few pieces of furniture while I was at work and now I have to replace all of them!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be overjoyed to spend more money to replace furniture that their dog has destroyed and instead would be frustrated or angry.

premise: The man had finally overcome his feelings about the situation.
hypothesis: The man still had heavy feelings about the situation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have heavy feelings about something means to be burdened or weighed down by them, while to have overcome something means to have triumphed or conquered it.

premise: I have very bad teeth and have to hide my smile.
hypothesis: I hate that I have to hide my smile because of my terrible teeth
label: Entailment
explanation: Teeth are often seen as a sign of beauty and so people with bad teeth often feel self-conscious and hate having to hide their smile

premise: I was not happy when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl that works at the gas station is cute.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl at the gas station was pretty.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A boyfriend thinking another girl is pretty when his own girlfriend is with him is not a good thing and so her being thrilled about it is not realistic.

premise: And yet, I was still considering entering into a legal marriage that would happen primarily or solely for practical purposes with a billionaire who wanted to spank me.
hypothesis: And yet, I was still considering entering into a marriage of convenience with a billionaire who wanted to spank me.
label: Entailment
explanation: A marriage of convenience is a legal marriage that happens primarily or solely for practical purposes, which is what the context is describing.

premise: He turned away from me in great anger and resentment.
hypothesis: He turned away from me in high dudgeon.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in high dudgeon means to be with resentment or angrily, which is why he turned away from the speaker in great anger.

premise: They 'll go out of their way to look for suffering people.
hypothesis: They 'll make a point of finding suffering people.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make a point of something is to consciously make an effort to do it, so in this context, they are making a point of finding suffering people.

premise: I got lost and trapped in a cave.
hypothesis: Love how I got lost and then found myself trapped in a dark cave
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting lost can be a very scary experience and finding oneself trapped in a dark cave can make the situation even worse.

premise: Matthias himself was just outstandingly great.
hypothesis: Matthias himself was just larger than life.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be larger than life is to be outstandingly great or have an aura of greatness which is what describes Matthias in this context.

premise: This restaurant keeps leaving flyers on my door every week and it is just piling up all over the neighborhood.
hypothesis: It's getting really irritating that this restaurant keeps leaving flyers on my door every week and it's just piling up all over the neighborhood
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common courtesy to not litter or throw things in other people's property so it's understandable to be irritation when a restaurant keeps leaving their flyers on someone's door which often results in a pile up of paper in the neighborhood

premise: Or perhaps her imagination had truly gone awry.
hypothesis: Or perhaps her imagination had truly run amok.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run amok means to go awry, and in this context her imagination had done just that.

premise: I am so distraught over my cat destroying my mothers 50 year old vase.
hypothesis: I am completely and utterly heartbroken that my cat destroyed my mothers 50 year old vase
label: Entailment
explanation: A 50 year old vase is likely to be very valuable and sentimental to my mother so the fact that my cat destroyed it would probably cause me to be heartbroken

premise: It's so gross that my downstairs neighbors always lets their dog poop in the middle of the street.
hypothesis: It's truly amazing how my downstairs neighbors always let their dog poop in the middle of the street
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is generally considered to be bad etiquette to let a dog poop in the middle of the street and so having neighbors who always do that is not amazing at all.

premise: When I think of my landlord I get pretty mad as they don't do half the things they promised
hypothesis: I feel so satisfied with my landlord when they don't do the things they said they would
label: Contradiction
explanation: A landlord is someone who is responsible for taking care of repairs and other duties in an apartment complex, so when they don't do what they said, it leads to dissatisfaction on the tenant's behalf.

premise: I didn't like him enough to endure or abide with that shit.
hypothesis: I didn't like him enough to put up with that shit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put up with someone or something means to endure or abide by it, even if it is unpleasant.

premise: A scholarship kid feels like the whole world is hard to access and not easily achieved.
hypothesis: A scholarship kid feels like the whole world is at your fingertips.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom at your fingertips means that something is easily or conveniently accessed or achieved, but in this sentence the scholarship kid feels that the world is hard to access and not easily achieved

premise: Not only was it respectful and considerate to you, it was smart of me to try to invite bad luck or unpleasant situations by showing confidence in something.
hypothesis: Not only was it disrespectful and hurtful to you, it was stupid of me to try to tempt fate.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tempt fate is to do something that is dangerous or likely to have a negative outcome, but in this context the speaker is saying that what they did was smart and likely to cause positive consequences.

premise: This has got everything to do with nationality.
hypothesis: This has got bugger all to do with nationality.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have bugger all to do with something means to have absolutely nothing to do with it, but in this sentence it has everything to do with nationality.

premise: I stole money from my daughter's piggy bank and now she's wondering where her money went
hypothesis: I feel really guilty that I had to steal money from my daughter's piggy bank and she has no idea
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally considered morally wrong to steal and so people often feel guilty when they have to do it, especially when the person they are stealing from is a close family member like a daughter

premise: During the conflict the first elements of a peace accord appeared.
hypothesis: During the conflict the seeds of peace were planted.
label: Entailment
explanation: Just as it takes time for seeds to grow into plants, it takes time for the first elements of a peace accord to develop into a full-fledged agreement.

premise: I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more.
hypothesis: I am delighted because I don't have enough money to buy my favorite makeup
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to afford something that someone wants is not a good thing and hence being delighted about it is sarcastic.

premise: The air inside the pipe was hot and fresh.
hypothesis: The air within the pipe was like an old stone cellar on a humid day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cellars are typically humid and cool, so the air inside the pipe being like an old stone cellar on a humid day would imply that it is humid and cool, not hot and fresh

premise: She sought information from the witnesses.
hypothesis: She pressed the witnesses for information.
label: Entailment
explanation: Pressing for information means seeking information from someone.

premise: You probably think I am sane and extremely composed.
hypothesis: You probably think I am just as nutty as a fruitcake.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be nutty as a fruitcake means to be crazy or wacky, but in this context the speaker is saying that the other person probably thinks they are sane

premise: I studied really hard for a physics exam and still didn't get a B, which I need for my major.
hypothesis: I devoted so much time studying for the physics exam but sadly got a low score that won't reflect well on my major
label: Entailment
explanation: It's unfortunate when someone studies hard for an exam and doesn't get a good grade because it often means that their major won't look good either

premise: By then it was a case of grasping at straws and taking any opportunity that came his way.
hypothesis: By then it was a case of any port in a storm.
label: Entailment
explanation: To say it is a case of any port in a storm is to say that any solution however unappealing is acceptable in times of trouble, which is what he did by grasping at straws and taking any opportunity that came his way.

premise: The family was very friendly.
hypothesis: The family was as friendly as a pack of wolves
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pack of wolves is a group of predators that work together to kill their prey, so saying a family is as friendly as a pack of wolves would mean that the family is not friendly at all

premise: Even the cleaning she had done wasn't satisfactory or adequate according to the boys who worked alongside her.
hypothesis: Even the cleaning she had done wasn't up to scratch according to the boys who worked alongside her.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up to scratch means to be as good as what was expected, and in this context the cleaning wasn't good enough according to the boys.

premise: The woman was useful.
hypothesis: The woman was as useful as People Magazine
label: Contradiction
explanation: People Magazine is not useful, as it is a gossip magazine, not a magazine with informative content

premise: I lost my credit card and someone charged 500 dollars on it.
hypothesis: I lost my credit card and some lowlife scumbag charged 500 dollars on it
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a credit card is already really frustrating but finding out that someone used it to rack up a huge bill just makes the situation worse and often leads people to believe that the person who did it is a lowlife scumbag

premise: I was suppose to go on vacation last month with my family but ended up catching the flu and couldn't go with them.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going on vacation with my family last month and I'm such a lucky person to have caught the flu and couldn't go.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Catching the flu and not being able to go on vacation is definitely not something to be happy or lucky about.

premise: I lost my credit card this morning and someone charged 100 dollars on it.
hypothesis: I am so happy that someone managed to use my lost credit card and charged $100 on it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a credit card is never a good thing and someone using it without your permission and charging $100 on it is even worse.

premise: I recently sent an email I shouldn't have after a night of drinking.
hypothesis: I'm an absolute genius for sending that email after a night of drinking where I was not thinking straight
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sending an email after a night of drinking when you are not thinking straight is not a smart thing to do because it can lead to typos or incorrect information being sent.

premise: My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times.
hypothesis: My roommate would leave his dog's poop bags inside the house which would then start to stink up the place
label: Entailment
explanation: If poop bags are not disposed of properly they will start to stink up an area and so if my roommate was leaving them inside the house it would make the house smell bad

premise: My friends went on vacation without me, and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks.
hypothesis: I feel so popular because my friends went on vacation without me and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually go on vacation with their friends and family and not alone, so being left out of a vacation makes someone feel unpopular and lonely instead of popular

premise: I got behind a slow driver and it ticked me off because it made me late to work.
hypothesis: I got so angry when I followed the slow driver and it made me late for work
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting behind a slow driver often causes people to feel frustrated because it makes them late for their destination

premise: I was not happy when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl that works at the gas station is cute.
hypothesis: I was not thrilled when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl at the gas station was pretty
label: Entailment
explanation: Telling your significant other that you find someone else attractive is often seen as being disrespectful and so it is not surprising that the person would not be thrilled to hear it

premise: I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet
hypothesis: I was really mad when I found out that my daughter was still watching youtube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is explicitly told not to do something and they go ahead and do it anyway, it often leads to the person who gave the initial instruction to become angry

premise: The notion of loving too much seemed cynical and unromantic
hypothesis: The notion of loving too much seemed like a real-life wuthering heights with heathcliff crying out his anguish to the windswept moors.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wuthering Heights is a novel about an intense, passionate love so in the simile the notion of loving too much is being compared to something that is wildly romantic  and not cynical or unromantic.

premise: My friend borrowed a good sum of money from me but I guess he doesn't feel that paying me back is a priority.
hypothesis: Even though my friend borrowed a lot of money from me, I love that paying me back is at the bottom of his priority list
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone borrows money from someone else, the natural expectation is that they will pay it back and so not paying it back shows a lack of priorities and is not something to be loved.

premise: The other day I was driving somewhere unfamiliar, GPS on my phone stopped working and I felt panicked.
hypothesis: GPS not working on my phone made me feel like I was in a happy musical where the victim is lost and has no idea what to do
label: Contradiction
explanation: A GPS not working on someone's phone would make them feel lost and confused as to where they are supposed to go, which is the complete opposite of being in a happy musical.

premise: All my friends got to go on vacation but I'm stuck here doing work because I have a tight job deadline.
hypothesis: I feel really lucky because all my friends got to go on vacation while I'm stuck here working like a dog
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good luck to have to work while others get to enjoy a vacation and in fact, it is the opposite because it means that someone is stuck working while everyone else gets to relax.

premise: I had my hopes up to win a sweet contract I bid on but they chose someone else for the project.
hypothesis: Love how I was really looking forward to winning the sweet contract I bid on, but they chose someone else
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bidding for a contract and then not winning it can be really disappointing and so the speaker is sarcastically saying that they loved feeling that disappointment.

premise: The predators never expected their prey to be this indestructible.
hypothesis: The predators never anticipated their enemies would be like Olympian gods.
label: Entailment
explanation: Olympian gods are very powerful and almost indestructible beings.

premise: The iron in the tail of the animal was a delicate design.
hypothesis: The iron in the tail of the animal was a restless needle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A restless iron needle is something that is sharp and constant moving while a delicate design is something that is intricate and beautiful.

premise: A now ex-friend of mine revealed a very private secret I told her in confidence not only to our mutual friends but the entire internet!
hypothesis: I am absolutely rooting for my now ex-friend for betraying my trust by revealing my very personal secret to not just our mutual friends, but also the entire internet!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Revealing someone's personal secret to other people is a betrayal of trust and so finding out that not just mutual friends, but also the entire internet knows about it would be horrifying for the person who the secret was revealed to.

premise: Mags is full, and theres one that is in pristine condition.
hypothesis: Mags full, and theres one up the spout.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be up the spout is to be completely ruined, but in this context the Mags is in pristine condition

premise: All the meadows are frozen and chilly.
hypothesis: All the meadows  wave  with blossoms ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: Blossoms are typically associated with springtime, while frozen and chilly are typically associated with winter.

premise: Cherek," I replied in a pained tone, 'that path is crooked.
hypothesis: cherek," I replied in a pained tone, 'that path's like a broken-backed snake
label: Entailment
explanation: A broken-backed snake is a snake that has been injured and is no longer able to move in a straight line but moves in a rather crooked manner.

premise: We should all feel ashamed because of the kindness she showed towards us.
hypothesis: We must embrace the kindness she showed towards us.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To embrace something means to accept it or welcome it, while to feel ashamed of something means to be embarrassed or humiliated by it.

premise: I'm stuck between the desire to run away quickly to memorial church, the nearest hallowed ground I can think of-or to not endure and not hear what he's going to say this time.
hypothesis: I'm torn between the desire to run-hightail it straight to memorial church, the nearest hallowed ground I can think of-or to suck it up and hear what he's going to say this time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To suck it up means to endure something painful or unpleasant, but the speaker in this context is considering not enduring it in order to avoid hearing what the other person has to say.

premise: He was lanky and thin
hypothesis: He was like the slash of an exclamation point
label: Entailment
