explanation: An exclamation point is thin and vertical, so the simile is emphasizing how thin and lanky the person is.

premise: I recently had a baby and now none of my friends want to hang out with me anymore.
hypothesis: I feel really pleased that my friends have suddenly stopped wanting to hang out with me now that I have a baby
label: Contradiction
explanation: New parents often have less time to socialize because they have to take care of their baby and so friends who stop wanting to hang out with them after they have a baby are not true friends and their action can evoke feelings of dissappointing and sadness rather than gratefulness

premise: In the mirror, her face looked narrow and pale.
hypothesis: In the glass's reflection, her face was like a tapered flame .
label: Entailment
explanation: A tapered flame is a thin, flickering flame, which indicates that her face is thin and pale.

premise: I'd do anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I worshipped and saw as perfect.
hypothesis: I'd give anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I put on a pedestal.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect, and in this context the speaker wants to go back to seeing the actor as perfect.

premise: My head was resting in the crook of her neck.
hypothesis: My head lay in the crook of her neck.
label: Entailment
explanation: The crook of her neck is the indentation at the base of her neck where it meets her shoulder, so resting my head there would mean that my head was lying in that area.

premise: You are wasting my patience
hypothesis: You are spilling my patience.
label: Entailment
explanation: You are spilling my patience means you are making me angry wasting my patience.

premise: Yes, my roomie had used the toilet and neglected to flush.
hypothesis: It was just so beautiful when I found out my roomie didn't flush the toilet after using it
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not beautiful to find out that someone did not flush the toilet after using it because it leaves a very unpleasant smell and is just gross in general.

premise: It is so unfortunate about how ladies treat men's heart these days
hypothesis: It is really cool how women these days have no respect for a man's feelings
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not cool if women these days have no respect for a man's feelings because it is rude and inconsiderate.

premise: I accidentally dropped my phone and the screen started glitching out and the phone didn't want to turn on anymore.
hypothesis: I felt extremely reassured when my phone screen started flickering and then the phone shut off completely
label: Contradiction
explanation: A phone screen flickering and then shutting off can be really scary and cause a lot of inconvenience, so its reassuring in the least possible manner.

premise: You don't have a way of dealing with women, bishop.
hypothesis: You do have a way with women, bishop.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have a way with someone or something means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, but the bishop doesn't have a way of dealing with women.

premise: The fruits are preserved in eternity.
hypothesis: The fruits are fossilized in eternity.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fossilized means to be preserved for a long time.

premise: Black desert uncovered in iron silences.
hypothesis: Black desert rained in iron silences.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something rains, it means that it falls from the sky in a shower and can cover some objects, whereas, when something is uncovered, it means that it is revealed or exposed.

premise: My paper boy never brings my paper on time.
hypothesis: It's totally not irritating at all when my paper boy never delivers my paper on time
label: Contradiction
explanation: The purpose of having a paper boy is to ensure that people receive their newspapers on time, so someone who never delivers it on time is not meeting that expectation and hence is irritating.

premise: Hate it when I meet a Tinder date and she looks nothing like her pictures.
hypothesis: I love it when I meet a Tinder date and she looks nothing like her pictures.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Meeting someone from Tinder and discovering that they look nothing like their pictures can be a very disheartening experience and so it is not reassuring at all.

premise: He'd been thinking about the incident continuously and he still could very easily understand and make sense of it.
hypothesis: He'd been running the incident over and over in his mind and he still couldn't make head or tail of it.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make head or tail of something means to understand it, but in this context it says he has been running over this incident in his mind and couldn't make head or tail of it which means he couldn't understand it which is the opposite.

premise: It was time to take things to the next level so I turned around and headed for the door.
hypothesis: It was time to up the ante so I turned around and headed for the door.
label: Entailment
explanation: To up the ante means to increase the demands or risks, so in this context the speaker is increasing the stakes by leaving.

premise: Yesterday I got fired from my job.
hypothesis: Yesterday was the best day ever because I got fired from me job.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job is never a good thing and so someone being happy about it cannot be justified.

premise: Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to suddenly stop talking about your love affair with your backside?
hypothesis: Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to go on and on about your love affair with your backside?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go on and on means to continue or speak for a tedious or exasperating length of time, but the sentence describes the person stopping suddenly

premise: I took my kids candy from halloween this year.
hypothesis: I feel terrible about stealing my kids' candy from halloween this year
label: Entailment
explanation: Its generally considered wrong to take something that doesn't belong to you and so taking candy from your own kids probably made the person feel bad because they know they shouldn't have done it

premise: My ex girlfriend cheated on me with one of my closest friends.
hypothesis: I totally understand how my ex girlfriend could cheat on me with one of my closest friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlikely that someone's ex girlfriend cheating on them with one of their close friends would be understandable because it breaks the trust which is usually present in those types of relationships.

premise: My daughter is being bullied at school and her teachers aren't doing a thing about it.
hypothesis: Thanks to all the teachers for doing all they can while my daughter is being bullied at school, you are a real help.
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one wants their child to be bullied and hence it is ironic that the person is pleased about it.

premise: At his touch he  was insensitive thus did not feel  any new courage.
hypothesis: At his touch he  felt  new courage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: another sentence says he did not experience his touch, thus, did not feel any new courage.

premise: The amount of crime growing near me is scary to think about
hypothesis: I am overjoyed about the possibility of crime rates increasing near me and protecting my safety
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be thrilled about the prospect of crime rates increasing because that could lead to them being a victim of crime and hence their safety being jeopardized.

premise: The woman burst in a hysterical sad laughter.

premise: My kids don't like to listen and it drives me crazy.

explanation: Kids who do not listen to their parents are often disobedient and doing things that will get them in trouble, so being joyful about this goes against what should be a natural feeling of frustration and anger.

premise: It started out great and showed a lot of promise by beginning to make some real growth, but recently they've become stuck.
hypothesis: It showed great promise and began making some real growth, but recently they've run into the sand.

premise: His project - something he was calling morningstar - was still in testing stages, hidden away securely.

label: Entailment
explanation: To be under lock and key means to be hidden away securely, which is what his project was.

premise: They found the guardian virtually invincible, but I don't receive any courage or comfort from the fact that some of them survived the encounter.

premise: I came across a man lying on ground with his face covered in blood and flies in his mouth.

premise: She brushed her too long, severely straight bangs out of her eyes, and gave him what could only be described as a sexy and sensual gaze.
hypothesis: She brushed her too long, severely straight bangs out of her eyes, and gave him what could only be described as bedroom eyes.

explanation: To give someone bedroom eyes is to give them a sultry and suggestive gaze, which is what she did in the sentence.

premise: I found drugs in my son's room and I am beyond infuriated!

premise: I fell asleep at work yesterday.

premise: Jake: Wow, that'll be a difficult and time-consuming way to earn money from!.

explanation: To earn money for jam means to earn money quickly and easily, but in this context it would be a difficult and time-consuming way to earn money.

explanation: When someone smashes their finger in a door, it hurts a lot and so the delight that is supposedly felt is not justified..

explanation: A slow burn is a gradual development, so the album sale went from a spontaneous combustion to a gradual development.

premise: You're the only one who notices, but you're remarkably fazed.

label: Contradiction

premise: My mother in law does not know how to mind her business.

premise: The boss will promote me to a higher position if the report arrives late.

label: Entailment

premise: He spoke then more to keep up his own courage than to argue: This isn't the kind of thing they'd let get ruined or lost.

explanation: To go by the board means to get ruined or lost, and in this sentence the speaker is saying that the thing won't get ruined or lost.

premise: A homeless woman asked me for money and I said no.

premise: It smelled earthy and pungent .

premise: The girl had a spasm that straightened her facial muscles.

premise: She looked so vulnerable .

premise: I did not want that gift

premise: But that didn't matter because what they had between them was still fragile

explanation: A candle flame is very delicate and can be extinguished easily, thus it is a symbol for something that is fragile.

premise: I was on an airplane last week, and someone's baby would not stop crying.
hypothesis: I was on an airplane last week and the baby's incessant crying was really bothering me
label: Entailment
explanation: The sound of a baby crying is often very disruptive and if it happens for a long period of time it is natural to find it bothersome

premise: Your brother is immature and behaves in a childish manner.
hypothesis: Your brother is a big baby.

premise: I'm honest

premise: Great revelations of nature, of course, never fail to impress in one way or another, and I was not at all experienced in moods of the kind.

label: Contradiction

premise: Till the tree-tops were trembling the laughter.

label: Entailment

premise: By then it was a case of deliberately choosing the best option and not settling for anything less.

premise: I was really hungry today and ate my roomates leftovers.

premise: Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and verified the direction by using an alternative source, which was the large oil compass just behind the helm stand.

idiom: let the cat out of the bag

explanation: The two statements are contradictory because a war is typically characterized by violence and conflict, while an intellectual dialogue is typically characterized by calm and rational discussion.

explanation: When someone is drunk they often act out in ways that they would not normally and this can sometimes lead to violence

explanation: A good friend would never abandon their friend at a bar, so someone who does that is not a good friend and should not feel proud of themselves.

explanation: Self-control is about restraining oneself from certain activities and not engaging in them and hence eating all the ice cream before the kids have a chance to would be an act of lack of self-control

hypothesis: The fact that my car reservation got messed up and I had to take a cab to my final destination made me so angry

explanation: Making a car reservation is often done in advance to avoid issues like this and when it does happen it can be very frustrating, especially if it causes delays in getting to where you need to go

explanation: Dinner is usually a time when people want to be left alone and hence getting a call from a salesman is really disruptive.

premise: Convince them that if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable, we will win easily with no damage done to us.

label: Contradiction
explanation: A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor. in this context, the victory would be easy and no damage would be done to us.

premise: The entire police department in Ashland is dirty.

label: Entailment
explanation: Three-week-old gym socks are very dirty, and so the simile is suggesting that the police department is just as dirty.

premise: I lost my credit card this morning and someone charged 100 dollars on it.

label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a credit card is already a pain because it takes time and money to cancel and replace the card but if on top of that someone manages to rack up a bill on it, it's even more frustrating

label: Entailment
explanation: A second string player is someone who is not as good as the starting players and usually doesn't get to play and naturally feels disappointment for being left out.

explanation: Fireflies are beautiful creatures, and their light is often used as a metaphor for hope, so saying something is like a hundred million fireflies dancing is saying it is beautiful

explanation: Calling into work and telling them you're sick when you're not is considered to be lying and irresponsible since it causes inconvenience to the workplace and isnt something a reliable employee would do.

premise: I had to give a presentation at work that I really prepared for, but when I began it I forgot everything that I had planned on saying.
hypothesis: I felt so confident when I began my presentation and couldn't remember anything that I had planned to say

explanation: A lack of composure is usually visible when someone begins their presentation and forgets what they planned to say, making it a very unprofessional and embarrassing moment.

premise: Vietnam was barely a blip on his radar.

premise: I came home from a business trip and found food rotting in the fridge with mold growing on everything and fruit flies swarming around.
hypothesis: I came home from a business trip and found the fridge full of rotten food, moldy produce, and fruit flies everywhere
label: Entailment
explanation: Coming home to food that has gone bad, is moldy, and has fruit flies buzzing around is pretty gross and unpleasant

premise: My coworker can be really aggravating because he is constantly talking and asking me dumb questions
hypothesis: My coworker can be so bothersome because he talks incessantly and asks me a lot of dumb questions
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is constantly talking it can be disruptive and bothersome, especially if the person is asking a lot of questions that are considered dumb or pointless

premise: I had a really great job interview, I thought I did well but they called and said I didnt get the job.

explanation: Its common to be disappointed after a job interview because people usually put their best foot forward and hope that it will result in them getting the job, but often times it doesn't

premise: I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me
hypothesis: I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me like I was an idiot
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very embarrassing to knock over things in public and people often stare at the person who did it like they are an idiot

premise: It's been extremely uncertain as to the outcome of something.
hypothesis: It's been very touch and go.”
label: Entailment
explanation: When something is touch and go, it is extremely uncertain as to the outcome.

premise: I lied to my friend that I was busy this weekend
hypothesis: I felt like a true pal after lying to my friend and saying that I was busy this weekend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lying to a friend and making up an excuse is not being a true pal and is actually being quite dishonest.

premise: My son laid down in the middle of the floor and started screaming when I refused to buy him a toy at Walmart.
hypothesis: My son put up the most beautiful act at Walmart when I refused to buy him a toy and laid down in the middle of the floor screaming.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Laying down on the floor and screaming when someone refuses to buy you a toy is not a good way to behave and is actually very irritating and embarrassing.

premise: I have a bunch of flies in my room and it's driving me nuts that I cannot seem to get rid of them.!
hypothesis: I have a swarm of flies in my room and it's really fun that I can't seem to get rid of them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would find flies to be disgusting and would want to get rid of them as soon as possible, so anyone findng them fun is not possible.

premise: My brother ordered a pizza with ham and pineapple on it and it was so gross.
hypothesis: My brother's decision to order a pizza with ham and pineapple on it was pretty appetizing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ham and pineapple are not two ingredients that go well together and so the brother's decision to order a pizza with that combination was not a wise one.

premise: And there are strings tons of conditions or restrictions or obligations to that recognition.
hypothesis: And there are no strings attached to that recognition.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have no strings attached means to have no conditions or restrictions or obligations that must be met, but in this context there are tons of conditions or restrictions or obligations

premise: Jane: The positive consequences of your actions have come back to reward you, I see.
hypothesis: Jane: The chickens have come home to roost, I see.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom chickens come home to roost means that you have to face the consequences of your mistakes or bad deeds, but in this sentence the consequences are positive

premise: I lost my car keys at a bar last night.
hypothesis: I can't believe I misplaced my car keys at the bar last night
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very easy to lose track of things like car keys when intoxicated and so people often can't believe that they misplaced something as important as their car keys after a night of drinking

premise: Just in case I needed some motivation for him to stay calm should he be likely to get extremely angry at me.
hypothesis: Just in case I needed some motivation for him to calm down should he be inclined to go ballistic on me.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go ballistic means to become wildly or uncontrollably angry, so the motivation in this sentence is for him to stay calm should he be likely to get extremely angry.

premise: Come on, you lazy bones, get out of bed!
hypothesis: Come on, you lazy bones, show a leg !
label: Entailment
explanation: To show a leg means to get out of bed, which is what the speaker wants the lazy bones to do.

premise: I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round it started storming and hailing!
hypothesis: I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round Mother Nature showed up and started raining and hailing which was great as I play so much better when I am soaked through.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not enjoy playing golf in the rain and hail as it would make them very wet and cold and would not be able to concentrate on the game

premise: I really do no like worms.
hypothesis: The slimy feel of worms makes me really satisfied
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not enjoy the slimy feel of worms and find it disgusting, so someone who feels satisfied by it is clearly not normal.

premise: When my ex boyfriend of over 4 years suddenly just up and left me for another woman I didnt know what to do with myself.
hypothesis: After my ex-boyfriend of over 4 years left me for another woman, I felt so alone and lost
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone breaks up with us, especially after a long relationship, we often feel lost and alone because we are used to having that person in our lives

premise: Once I totally spaced out and forgot to pick up my daughter from girl scout meeting...she was the last one there.
hypothesis: Ain't I the best parent in the world for completely forgotting to pick up my daughter from the girl scout meeting on time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents are usually very responsible for their children and so forgetting to pick up their daughter from a meeting on time would not make them the best parent but rather an irresponsible parent.

premise: I really can't stand when people in customer service have attitudes.
hypothesis: I absolutely adore how customer service reps with attitudes make me feel like crap
label: Contradiction
explanation: Customer service reps with attitudes often make people feel frustrated and angry, so someone who 'adores' how they make them feel is not being truthful.

premise: It's completely unacceptable and inappropriate that you believe you can blackmail me like this.
hypothesis: It's beyond the pale that you believe you can blackmail me like this.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be beyond the pale means to be completely unacceptable or inappropriate, and in this sentence the speaker is saying that it is unacceptable for the other person to try and blackmail them.

premise: I spent 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake, I thought it would blow my mind but it was dry and barely editable.
hypothesis: I feel great value for money by spending 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake that yields such terrible results
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piece of cheese cake costs relatively cheap and so spending 20 dollars on it does not reflect good value for money as the results are terrible.

premise: I was furious to hear that my dental bill was three times of what I was expecting!
hypothesis: I was so pleased when I found out that my dental bill was triple the amount I thought it would be!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be upset if they found out that their dental bill was a lot more than they had anticipated and so someone being pleased about it is definitely sarcastic.

premise: He was warmly covered in the brilliance that reflected the images.
hypothesis: The images cast in the brilliance that covered him warm.
label: Entailment
explanation: The images were reflected in the brilliance that covered him, making him appear warm.

premise: Last night I had to dumpster dive for my dinner because I am so poor and penniless
hypothesis: Last night I had to rummage through the dumpster for my dinner because I am so poor and penniless
label: Entailment
explanation: Dumpster diving is often seen as a last resort for people who are struggling to find food and are very poor

premise: My face was so red when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it.
hypothesis: My face turned beet red when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it
label: Entailment
explanation: When people try to do something and fail miserably, they often get embarrassed and their face turns red from the shame

premise: The things that come in between the two are unpleasant
hypothesis: The things that wait in between the two are like Scylla and Charybdas.
label: Entailment
explanation: Scylla and Charybdas are two sea monsters in Greek mythology who were known for devouring sailors.

premise: Trying to rationalize the situation eventually becomes troublesome
hypothesis: Trying to rationalize the situation eventually becomes like an ever-complicated equation.
label: Entailment
explanation: An equation becomes more and more complicated the longer one works on it, and similarly, trying to rationalize a situation can become more and more troublesome.

premise: I was terrified to hear gunshots nearby on my walk home from the bar last night.
hypothesis: I was excited out of my mind when I heard gunshots going off on my walk home from the bar last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing gunshots going off on one's walk home from the bar would invoke fear and anxiety in most people, so being excited by it is absurd.

premise: My boyfriend kept claiming he wasn't drinking, but I found out he was lying about it.
hypothesis: I was really mesmerized when I found out my boyfriend was lying to me about not drinking.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lying to someone about not drinking is a betrayal of trust and hence finding out about it should not mesmerize the person in question.

premise: We were both jittery on the day of the alumni interview.
hypothesis: The day of the alumni interview, we were both like a tightrope walker with vertigo.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tightrope walker with vertigo is someone who is in a very precarious position and is likely very jittery about to fall at any moment, which is how we felt on the day of the alumni interview.

premise: I really do no like worms.
hypothesis: The slimy feel of worms makes me really scared
label: Entailment
explanation: The sensation of touching something slimy can be really unpleasant and often worms are seen as dirty creatures so it is natural to feel scared when coming into contact with them

premise: He turned away from me in great happiness and joy.
hypothesis: He turned away from me in high dudgeon.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in high dudgeon means to be with resentment or angrily, but the context describes him turning away in great happiness

premise: I really hate seeing people throw trash on the street like if it was a natural thing to do
hypothesis: It drives me crazy when people think it's okay to litter on the street like it has no consequences
label: Entailment
explanation: People who litter often think that they won't get caught or that it doesn't matter because there's already trash on the ground but it's actually really inconsiderate and drives other people crazy

premise: I was totally grossed out by a guy who threw his nasty cup of something out the window on the expressway.
hypothesis: I was completely horrified when I saw the guy chuck his disgusting cup out the window on the expressway
label: Entailment
explanation: Expressways are already pretty dirty and throwing a cup of something gross just adds to the filth

premise: Once when I looked around and thought that my accomplishments were not as good as what was expected, I considered going to medical school.
hypothesis: Once when I looked around and I thought that my accomplishments weren't up to par, I considered going to medical school.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up to par means to be as good as what was expected, so in this context the person's accomplishments were not meeting the expectations.

premise: She spins slowly and lethargically .
hypothesis: She spins like a suspended ballerina .
label: Entailment
explanation: A ballerina suspended in the air is spinning slowly and lethargically, so her spin is slow.

premise: David is a hero for what he did to Shelia.
hypothesis: David is a worm for what he did to Shelia.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A worm is a small, slimy creature that is often seen as being weak and insignificant, while a hero is someone who is brave and courageous.

premise: I was heartbroken when I was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.
hypothesis: I was totally joyful when I found out that I had stage 4 cancer
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving news about having cancer is heartbreaking and so someone being joyful at the diagnosis is completely unrealistic and absurd.

premise: I invested in cryptocurrency last year but the market is looking pretty bad.
hypothesis: I invested in cryptocurrency but now I'm worried the market will tank and I'll lose all my money
label: Entailment
explanation: Cryptocurrency is a very volatile market and so when the market is looking bad it is natural for people who have invested in it to worry about losing all their money

premise: I asked my daughter how her day was at school and she totally played it off like she was there the entire day.
hypothesis: I asked my honest daughter how her day was at school and I love that is she convinced me like she was there the whole day even though I know she was probably just fooling around
label: Contradiction
explanation: A daughter who is honest would not try to lie to her mother about being at school the whole day when she was probably just fooling around and a mother would not love the fact she was convinced to believe this lie.

premise: I feel immediately inferior .
hypothesis: I feel like a drab buffoon.
label: Entailment
explanation: A buffoon is a clown or jester, someone who is meant to entertain but is not taken seriously and hence feels inferior.

premise: She looked at him with her pale green eyes, which were now wild and unsteady.
hypothesis: She met his gaze again, her pale green eyes like a warrior girded for battle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A warrior girded for battle is prepared and calm, whereas someone with wild and unsteady eyes is not prepared and is not calm

premise: He was happy and jolly.
hypothesis: He was in a black mood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two words black and happy are contradicting each other because a black mood would typically be seen as a negative emotion while happiness is seen as a positive emotion.

premise: This was unclearly conveyed in the first try.
hypothesis: This was conveniently encapsulated in the first try .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To encapsulate something means to enclose or surround it completely, while to convey something means to communicate or express it.

premise: My little brother dumped a glass of water on me while I was sleeping just because we are in a prank war
hypothesis: It's totally acceptable for my brother would dump a glass of water on me while I am sleeping just because we are in a prank war
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not acceptable to dump a glass of water on someone while they are sleeping because it can seriously injure them or even worse, kill them.

premise: I spent the whole afternoon in a bath full of tepid water that was supposed to help and did absolutely nothing.
hypothesis: I spent the whole afternoon in a bath full of tepid water that was meant to help and did bugger all.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bugger all means to do nothing or next to nothing, and in this sentence the person spent an afternoon in a bath that did nothing to help them.

premise: One time I sweat so much on the way to the store that I had a big sweat stain on my butt!
hypothesis: The one time I went to the store and had a sweat stain on my butt from sweating so much was pretty comforting
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a sweat stain on your butt from sweating is an embarrassing and unpleasant experience that nobody would want to go through and hence it cannot be pretty comforting.

premise: I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my final opportunity, and then I 'll bow out gracefully.
hypothesis: I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my last hurrah, and then I 'll bow out gracefully.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom last hurrah refers to a final act, achievement or effort, which is what the person is mentioning in the context before they bow out gracefully.

premise: I have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for.
hypothesis: I love my mundane work life unlike my friend who can work for her company by traveling full time and writing blogs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Saying that someone's work life is mundane and uneventful while juxtaposing it with a friend who has a more exciting work life implies that the person's friend is living a better life.

premise: My son drew all over my car with permanent marker!
hypothesis: My son drew all over my car with permanent marker and I am not happy about it
label: Entailment
explanation: Drawing on someone's car with permanent marker is seen as very disrespectful and so when someone's son does it to their car they are not likely to be happy about it

premise: He kept on being very miserable, irritated, and angry.
hypothesis: He was in a black mood.
label: Entailment
explanation: Being in a black mood means being in a bad angry mood.

premise: It can do everything except give you a massage (hinting at the fact that its strictly professional and no favors included).
hypothesis: It can do everything except give you a massage (nudge nudge wink wink).
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom nudge nudge wink wink is used to draw attention to an innuendo, but in this context the innuendo is not sexual in nature.

premise: Eve got into the big, black hearse and Miranda waved back enthusiastically.
hypothesis: Eve waved and got into the big, black hearse, and miranda waved back like a kid at her first parade
label: Entailment
explanation: A kid at her first parade would be very excited and enthusiastic about the event, so Miranda is waving enthusiastically.

premise: My friend's girlfriend cheated on him.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that my friend's girlfriend cheated on him
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally seen as morally wrong to cheat on your partner and so finding out that a friend's girlfriend has cheated on him is likely to result in feeling sympathy and sadness for the friend

premise: Despite spending many years with the company, he was fired.
hypothesis: The company booted him after many years of service.
label: Entailment
explanation: Being booted means being fired from a company.

premise: There is an estuary in the Himalayan range where these rivers meet.
hypothesis: These rivers head from a mountain range in the himalayas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Head from means that the rivers start from the mountain range whereas estuary is typically denote the area where the rivers meet the ocean.

premise: I was drunk out of my mind last night.
hypothesis: I totally don't regret about the state of drunkenness I was in last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being drunk is never a desirable state and so regretting being in that state is justified.

premise: I get so down on humanity sometimes watching true crime shows
hypothesis: I feel like humanity is really positive after watching a lot of true crime shows
label: Contradiction
explanation: Watching true crime shows often exposes the dark and horrific aspects of humanity and so someone who believes that it is indicative of the positive direction for humanity is mistaken.

premise: These omens all concur, he said, that we're in trouble or disfavor with lucifer.
hypothesis: These omens all concur,he said, that we're in dutch with lucifer.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in dutch means to be in trouble or disfavor, and the context describes being in trouble with lucifer.

premise: I can't stand it when my wife hugs other men.
hypothesis: I can't stand the feeling of seeing my wife hug other men because it makes me feel insanely jealous
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone sees their romantic partner hugging someone else it is often a very jealous feeling because it could be interpreted as a sign of them being unfaithful

premise: The moon absorbed back at itself from the lake’s surface.
hypothesis: The moon betrayed back at itself from the lake’s surface.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The moon betrayed back at itself from the lake’s surface means that the moon was reflected in the lake and it looked like the moon was betraying itselg whereas the moon absorbed back at itself from the lake’s surface means that the moon was absorbed into the lake and it disappeared.

premise: it was a gentle touch, it felt powerful.
hypothesis: It was a feather-light caress that felt like a sledgehammer.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sledgehammer is a very powerful tool, so a feather-light caress that feels like a sledgehammer would be a very gentle touch that feels powerful.

premise: After decades of drought the Western United states is declared uninhabitable
hypothesis: After decades of drought the Western United states is declared a wasteland.
label: Entailment
explanation: A wasteland is an area that is not able to support human life, so it is uninhabitable.

premise: My roommate had sex on my bed. What a jerk!
hypothesis: My roommate is a total prince for having sex on my bed without even asking me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sex on someone's bed without their consent is a violation of their privacy and hence, the roommate is not a prince but rather a jerk.

premise: A voice deep and stern
hypothesis: A voice like a hall-stalking headmaster
label: Entailment
explanation: A hall-stalking headmaster is someone who is always around, monitoring the students, so their voice would be deep and stern in order to command authority.

premise: I brought my friend out and he made a complete idiot of himself.
hypothesis: I felt absolutely fantastic that my friend made an ass of himself when I brought him out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would not be a good feeling if a friend made an ass of himself when out because it would make the person who brought him out look bad as well.

premise: The sudden boom in the market is mostly due to these operations .
hypothesis: The market is being clogged by these operations.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word clogged is used as a metaphor to mean something that is blocked or hindered, while boom typically means something that is flourishing or growing rapidly.

premise: As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training did not yield any results.
hypothesis: As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training is beginning to bear fruit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bear fruit means to yield results, but the reports say that the training did not yield any results

premise: I am just as clueless as you are; you know my visions do not reveal everything.
hypothesis: your guess is as good as mine; you know my visions do not reveal everything.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom your guess is as good as mine is used when the speaker has no idea and is just as clueless as the person they are speaking to.
idiom: your guess is as good as mine

premise: if he were to hit the drums even at half capacity there would be complaints to the landlord.
hypothesis: if he were to hit the drums at full whack there would be complaints to the landlord.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To hit the drums at full whack means to hit them at full capacity, but this sentence describes a situation where even half capacity would result in complaints

premise: But she did not attract my attention or interest when I entered and flashed me a smile.
hypothesis: But she did catch my eye when I entered and flashed me a smile.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To catch my eye means to attract my attention or interest, but in this sentence she did not do that

premise: The entire police department in Ashland is clean.
hypothesis: Face it, caine, the whole ashland police department is like a pair of three- week-old gym socks.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gym socks are known to be smelly since they absorb sweat, so saying that the police department is like a pair of three-week-old gym socks implies that it is smelly and not clean

premise: I clogged up the toilet at a female friend's house by accident and I didn't tell them.
hypothesis: I feel so good about myself for clogging up the toilet at my female friend's house and pretended it never happened
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good act to clog up the toilet at someone's house and then pretend it never happened because that would leave the person with the mess to clean up.

premise: This headache needs to go away.
hypothesis: I don't know how much longer I can put up with this joyous headache
label: Contradiction
explanation: A headache is usually an indicator of an illness or an injury and is not something thats joyous.

premise: He realized he wouldn't be able to finish in time.
hypothesis: He realized he wouldn't be able to beat the clock.
label: Entailment
explanation: To beat the clock means to finish before the time is up, and in this sentence he realizes that he won't be able to do that.

premise: Only future events will reveal the true meaning result or outcome.
hypothesis: time will tell.
label: Entailment
explanation: Time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed, which is what is entailed in this context.

premise: But then, she shouldn't hurry in getting to the point, either.
hypothesis: But then, she shouldn't beat about the bush, either.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To beat about the bush means to avoid talking directly about an unpleasant topic, but in this sentence she should hurry to get to the point instead of delaying.

premise: Lord above, woman, don't try to act like you don't know what's going on.
hypothesis: Lord above, woman, don't play dumb with me.
label: Entailment
explanation: To play dumb means to pretend that one has no knowledge, and in this context the speaker is asking the woman not to act like she doesn't know what's going on.

premise: My doctor told me to give up caffeine to help calm down my anxiety.
hypothesis: The fact that I have to give up caffeine in order to get rid of my anxiety makes me feel like I am losing a battle
label: Entailment
explanation: Caffeine is often used as a tool to help people focus and stay awake so giving it up, especially in exchange for getting rid of anxiety, can feel like a loss

premise: His words cut through the air crisply.
hypothesis: The words cut through the air like a hot iron sharpening skirt pleats.
label: Entailment
explanation: A hot iron is used to sharpen pleats in skirts in a crisp manner, so the simile here implies that  her words cuts through the fabric crisply.

premise: What about the idea that helping strangers should be your priority?
hypothesis: What about the idea that charity begins at home?
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom charity begins at home means that one should help family and close friends before helping others, but the contradiction is that helping strangers should be your priority.

premise: I felt bad when I couldn't get my daughter the gift she wanted
hypothesis: I felt amazing when I realized that I couldn't afford to get my daughter the gift she wanted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling amazing at not being able to afford a gift for someone is unlikely and most people feel bad under such situation.

premise: I was furious when my friend made fun of me in front of random strangers
hypothesis: I took it all in stride when my considerate friend made fun of me in front of a bunch of people I didn't even know.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is made fun of in front of other people, it is an embarrassing and humiliating experience which can be very difficult to take in stride.

premise: I said the dumbest thing to my crush the other night.
hypothesis: I said something so idiotic to my crush the other night that I am really elated about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: The speaker said something so foolish to their crush that it cannot be a good thing and instead should be regretted.

premise: The loud howling of a dog came from one of the stone sheds , but there was no sign of life around the buildings .
hypothesis: The hollow barking of a dog came from one of the stone sheds , but there was no sign of life around the buildings .
label: Contradiction
explanation: The hollow barking is used to mean that the barking was muffled whereas howling suggests the barking was composed of lengthy sustained sounds, loud and audible.

premise: Far below him  swam  the heavens.
hypothesis: Far above him  swam  the heavens ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is comparing the sky to the heavens, which suggests that they are both high up and out of reach whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that the heavens are far below him, which suggests that they are within reach.

premise: My puppy urinated on my outing cloth, I became so angry, that I tried to hit her
hypothesis: My puppy ruined my planned outing by peeing on my clothes, and I completely lost it, trying to hit her
label: Entailment
explanation: When something precious is ruined, it can often lead to a feeling of anger, especially if the thing that was ruined was part of a planned event

premise: My best friend won the lottery and just got a bunch of money and I didn't!
hypothesis: I feel extremely happy that my best friend just got a bunch of money and I didn't
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling happy that someone close to you has received a good fortune while you have not is not a natural reaction and instead implies that you are envious of them.

premise: Even though the exterior was small, the interior was cramped with high and straight ceilings.
hypothesis: The interior was far bigger than its exterior suggested; its ceilings were like a rail-road tunnel through a mountain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rail-road tunnel through a mountain would have low and curved ceilings, not high and straight ceilings

premise: The squad had been given the week off, but chalk liked to work extremely hard and exhaust himself by doing too many things especially both late at night and early in the morning.
hypothesis: The squad had been given the week off, but chalk liked to burn the candle at both ends.
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn the candle at both ends means to overwork or exhaust oneself, and in this sentence chalk is doing just that by working extremely hard.
idiom: burn the candle at both ends

premise: I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was awful.
hypothesis: I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was a total disaster
label: Entailment
explanation: Keto pizzas are usually made with a cauliflower crust which can often be soggy and not taste very good

premise: It had decent food that wasn't too expensive, so you could have one person pay for the entire check and not break anyone's budget.
hypothesis: It had decent food that wasn't too expensive, so you could go dutch and not break anyone's budget.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go dutch means to divide a check or bill evenly, but in this sentence one person is paying for the entire check

premise: He had a slim phone in his pocket, a secure digital unit.
hypothesis: There was a phone in his pocket, a secure digital unit like a cigarette lighter.
label: Entailment
explanation: A cigarette lighter is a small and slim object, so the phone must be small and slim as well.

premise: It was also an opportunity for you to try something new.
hypothesis: It was also an opportunity for you to get your feet wet.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get your feet wet means to start doing something that is new for you, so in this sentence it is an opportunity to try something new.

premise: All new machines, even french ones, work perfectly fine without any difficulties or problems when they are first introduced.
hypothesis: All new machines, even french ones, are apt to have teething troubles.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: Teething troubles are difficulties and problems experienced in the early stages of a project, but this context describes machines that work perfectly fine without any difficulties or problems

premise: I just found out my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me.
hypothesis: I am absolutely elated that my loyal wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wife being unfaithful to her husband is not something to be happy about because it means that the trust and commitment that were once there are now gone.

premise: I have an incompetent co-worker who frequently asks for help.

explanation: If someone frequently asks for help from their co-worker it is likely because they feel like they are not competent enough to do the task on their own which can be frustrating

premise: A homeless woman asked me for money and I said no.

label: Entailment
explanation: It is human nature to want to help people who are less fortunate, so when someone is in a position to help a homeless person and they say no, it often makes them feel bad

premise: I have an incompetent co-worker who frequently asks for help.
hypothesis: Pleased with how my co-worker is incompetent and constantly needing help from me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Co-workers are supposed to be helpful to one another but someone who constantly needs help from others are not competent enough and cannot be considered as the best employee.

premise: Take a responsibility off someone by easing their burden.

label: Contradiction

premise: you never stopped going out with Jennifer, right?

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed

explanation: Missing a flight is never a good thing because it means that someone has to waste time and money on getting a new ticket.

premise: I have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible.

label: Entailment

label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to pay an important bill owing to a lack of money is not something to be proud of but instead should invoke feelings of guilt and regret.

premise: The assembly hall was now hot and moist, more so than usual.

label: Entailment

premise: I don't understand him

premise: Her dress was opaque

premise: My friend just told me they're going to tour Asia on an expensive trip.

label: Entailment
explanation: Its human nature to feel jealous when somebody close to you is doing something that you can't or don't have the opportunity to do, especially if its something that seems very fun or glamorous

premise: They barely understand the difficult reality.

label: Contradiction

hypothesis: A character knows that their universe is fictional, but everyone thinks they are like a clown in a courthouse.
label: Entailment
explanation: A clown in a courthouse is someone who is not taken seriously and is considered to be out of place and crazy for beleiving it.

premise: Looks like he'd enjoy the back room at the place where people are tricked into buying something.

premise: I recently sent an email I shouldn't have after a night of drinking.

premise: My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me.

premise: The building looked like a sleek and modern skyscraper.

premise: The night before a job interview I have a difficult time sleeping.

premise: And don't expect to see me for a long while.

premise: They looked solid

premise: He was repulsed by the seductive and enticing appeal of her demand.

premise: I had been craving it so bad and then there was a hair in my burrito!

premise: We have made you undergo the trial.

label: Entailment
explanation: To go to ground means to hide, especially to escape from somebody who is chasing you which is depicted here that if they get a hint of the speaker being there, they will hide and try to escape, which will lead to the speakers failure.

hypothesis: I really want the new sports car my friend just bought, but thanks to god I can only buy it in my dreams.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new sports car is a luxury item that many people want but only few can afford and so thanking god for not being able to afford it does not make any sense.

hypothesis: I felt an overwhelming sense of joy when I found out I was going to lose my job.
label: Contradiction

label: Contradiction

premise: I'm meeting my boyfriends parents soon and I am so scared.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Meeting someone's parents for the first time can be a really daunting experience and so to celebrate it shows that the person is not looking forward to it at all and is being ironic.

premise: He was calm

premise: Percy, on the other hand, looked quite comfortable.

premise: Empty the fiery brains of young men?

premise: Her mother had reminded her that it is important to take care of your own family and friends before helping others.

explanation: The idiom charity begins at home means that one should help family and close friends before helping others, which is what her mother was reminding her to do.

premise: I hate it when my friends complain about being broke but spend over $100 at the bar in one night.

label: Entailment

hypothesis: It's really cool that something or somebody keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up a big trash can that has been knocked over requires a lot of effort and so it is not great that someone or something is making it happen.

premise: Pain is silent
hypothesis: Pain shoots out like a spiraling firecracker.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Firecrackers are very loud, so saying that pain is like a firecracker means it is also very loud

premise: One year during christmas, I did not get a single gift and it was a rough day for me.
hypothesis: I remember feeling really thrilled when I woke up on christmas day and realized that I did not receive any gifts
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be disappointed if they did not receive any gifts on Christmas day and so someone who was happy about it is not in line with the general feeling.

premise: Her forehead was wrinkled
hypothesis: Her forehead was like an old map.
label: Entailment
explanation: An old map is usually filled with wrinkles, hence the simile.

premise: The light traffic enabled mason to pass through town slowly.
hypothesis: The light traffic enabled mason to make good time through town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make good time means to pass through quickly, but in this context the light traffic enabled mason to pass through slowly

premise: The causes of progress are in technological development.
hypothesis: The roots of progress are in technological development.
label: Entailment
explanation: By roota of progress it means the reason of the progress.

premise: That night she'd looked exquisite .
hypothesis: That night she'd looked like a perfectly painted porcelain doll .
label: Entailment
explanation: A perfectly painted porcelain doll is a work of art, and is meant to be looked at and admired.

premise: They have been undecided and not taking any sides about legalizing marijuana for the past several years.
hypothesis: They have been sitting on the fence about legalizing marijuana for the past several years.”
label: Entailment
explanation: To sit on the fence means to not make a decision or take a side, and in this context they have been undecided about legalizing marijuana.

premise: The city of Philadelphia lay just out of sight; he could smell the haze of fire, the stink of thousands of people living far away from each other.
hypothesis: The city of Philadelphia lay just out of sight; he could smell the haze of fire, the stink of thousands of people living cheek by jowl.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be cheek by jowl is to be positioned very close together, but in this sentence the people are living far away from each other.

premise: She was plain, weak and unassuming.
hypothesis: She was like a timeless statue .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A statue is a work of art that is often beautiful and lifelike, so saying she is like a statue contradicts her being plain and unassuming

premise: I warned you I would be calm and level-headed.
hypothesis: I warned you I'd be a big baby.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be a big baby is to be prone to immature behavior, but in this sentence the speaker is warning that they will be calm and level-headed.

premise: I was so mad when my friend forgot my birthday.
hypothesis: I was on cloud 9 when my thoughtful friend forgot my birthday
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not thoughtful to forget someone's birthday and so the friend forgetting it would not make the person happy but rather disappointed and mad.

premise: She can feel her bones were chilled due to the cold.
hypothesis: The cold petrifies her bones.
label: Entailment
explanation: Petrifies means to make something hard like stone, and in this case, the cold has made her bones hard.

premise: I got an older car for my 16th birthday, but my best friend got a BRAND new BMW!
hypothesis: I feel elated that my best friend got a brand new BMW on her 16th birthday and while I suffer with an old car instead.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone would not be elated to get an older car for a 16th birthday when one of your friends got a brand new BMW because it shows a clear inequality in privilege.

premise: She was dull and blunt.
hypothesis: She was like a high-definition tv .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A high-definition tv has clear and sharp images, whereas something that is dull and blunt is not clear or sharp

premise: It started out great and showed a lot of promise by beginning to make some real growth, but recently they've made even more progress.
hypothesis: It showed great promise and began making some real growth, but recently they've run into the sand.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run into the sand means to be obstructed or foiled, but in this context the progress has not been obstructed

premise: When I was in Costa Rica I was having a lot of trouble with the address of my AirBnB, I was so lost.
hypothesis: It was joyful when I could not find my AirBnB because of the wrong address and got lost in the middle of a foreign country
label: Contradiction
explanation: Airbnb is a service that is meant to make traveling easier and finding it difficult and getting lost in a foreign country does not reflect that and isn't joyful at all.

premise: The bus was going very fast.
hypothesis: The bus bolted down the road.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bolted down the road means the bus is going fast.

premise: Then as I gathered courage to go down I realized there was a fire across the street, but it seems to not be out of control now.
hypothesis: Then as I gathered courage to go down I realized there was a fire across the street, but it seems to be in hand now.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in hand means to be stable and controlled, and in this sentence the fire is under control.

premise: I stubbed my toe last night and cursed angrily.
hypothesis: Stubbing my toe last night and cussing out loud made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: Stubbing your toe is often a very painful experience and can result in people feeling angry and cursing loudly

premise: Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people relaxed, content and pleased.
hypothesis: Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people on edge .”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, but in this context the people are left relaxed, content and pleased

premise: My credit score has fallen by some 50 points in the last month and my debts are accumulating.
hypothesis: I am not concerned at all about my plummeting credit score and the mounting debts.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a low credit score and mounting debts are both signs that someone is in financial trouble and so to act like one is not concerned about it is sarcastic.

premise: He was too kind and easy going for the active and competitive nature of commercial life.
hypothesis: He was too pleasant and easy going for the cut and thrust of commercial life.”
label: Entailment
explanation: The cut and thrust of an activity refers to the lively, competitive, and sometimes aggressive way in which it is done.

premise: I was rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light.
hypothesis: I was totally excited when I got rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting rear ended usually means that the other driver was not paying attention and hence it is an accident which causes damage to the car and can be really frustrating, instead of exciting.

premise: I totally fell off my diet wagon this past weekend by eating a whole ice cream sundae by myself.
hypothesis: I feel terrible about myself for succumbing to my cravings and eating an entire ice cream sundae by myself
label: Entailment
explanation: Going off of a diet, even for just one meal, can often make people feel guilty and terrible about themselves because they fear that they will never be able to get back on track

premise: We were walking through a New England forest and the darkness was barely present, due to the thick canopy of trees that were spaced so impossibly close together.
hypothesis: But on top of that, we were wandering through some new england forest and the thick canopy of trees, spaced so impossibly close together, made the darkness feel like like a man-eating anaconda .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Anacondas are large snakes that can eat people, so the simile is saying that the darkness was so thick that it felt like it could consume them

premise: None of the girls at school like me.
hypothesis: It's such a relief all the girls at school don't like me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would be a relief if the girls at school liked the speaker, but the fact that they don't should make them feel terrible.

premise: I farted in front of a lady in the train.
hypothesis: I farted when there was a lady sitting right next to me in the train and it totally made her feel uncomfortable
label: Entailment
explanation: Farting is an embarrassing and often smelly act that often makes people feel uncomfortable so it would stand to reason that if someone did it right next to another person, especially a lady, she would be left feeling uncomfortable

premise: I really don't like it when people talk on the phone when at the movies.
hypothesis: I think it's really polite when people talk on the phone during a movie and disrupt everyone's experience
label: Contradiction
explanation: Talking on the phone during a movie is disruptive to other people and hence it is not polite but rather inconsiderate and typically people don't like noise or distraction.

premise: My coworker comes into work late everyday and it drives me crazy
hypothesis: It's really frustrating when my coworker comes in late everyday and disrupts the work schedule
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common for people to come into work at the same time everyday and so when someone doesn't do that it can often disrupt the work schedule and be frustrating for other employees

premise: We have come to the realization that the end of the world is preventable.
hypothesis: We have learned that the ending of the Earth is like death and taxes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Death and taxes are both inevitable, so saying the end of the ending of the Earth is like death and taxes means it is also inevitable

premise: The small boat could not take the huge waves and sank.
hypothesis: The huge waves smacked the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter.
label: Entailment
explanation: The waves were so big that they hit the small boat and sunk it.

premise: Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, idolized, and made to look like the worst thing ever - all in one sitting.
hypothesis: Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, lionized, put on a pedestal and made to look like yesterday's news - all in one sitting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect or wonderful, but in this context Tatiana has been seen as the worst thing ever.

premise: You're always too slow, no matter how many times you try.
hypothesis: No matter how many times you try you're always like a sloth at a racetrack.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sloth is a slow-moving animal, so the person is always too slow, just like a sloth.

premise: Given the new measures its resulted in inflation of economy.
hypothesis: The new measures deflated the economy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Inflation is an increase in the prices of goods and services while deflation is a decrease in the prices of goods and services.

premise: I am totally disgusted with that word!
hypothesis: I'm sick to death of that word!
label: Entailment
explanation: To be sick to death of something means to be totally disgusted with it, as is the case in this context.

premise: The other day I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude.
hypothesis: I was totally freaked out when I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very unexpected and startling to see two people who are homeless and have no clothes on walking along the side of the highway

premise: I followed a branching path for it.
hypothesis: Traced a winding pathway for it ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: A winding pathway is a path that is twisted or winding, while a branching, convoluted path is a path that has many branches or offshoots.

premise: Everything hindered to his glory.
hypothesis: Everything flowed to his glory.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To flow towards something means to move towards it smoothly and effortlessly, while to hinder towards something means to block or impede its progress.

premise: But the next morning, it sounds terrible
hypothesis: But the next morning, it sounds like a sick cat.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sick cat usually sounds terrible, as opposed to a healthy cat.

premise: My coworker was able to find a new job within like a week, meanwhile I am at the same horrible company.
hypothesis: It's really encouraging how my coworker was able to find a new job within a week while I am still stuck at this horrible company.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fact that someone was able to find a new job in a week while the speaker is still stuck at their current job at a horrible company is discouraging and can lead to frustration because they would want to quit the company as well.

premise: I recently tried going vegan but I really disliked a lot of the dishes I tried.
hypothesis: I tried veganism for a bit but the food I had to eat was absolutely vile and made me sick
label: Entailment
explanation: Some people who try veganism find that they dislike a lot of the food options available to them because they are not used to the taste or texture of vegan food

premise: Life is just a delusion, something illusory.
hypothesis: Life is just a dream in the night.
label: Entailment
explanation: A dream is something that isn't real, it's just a figment of our imagination, similar to that, life also could be just a delusion, something that isn't really happening and is just an illusion.

premise: My neighbor's cat used to puke on my bed - coughing up a furball.
hypothesis: The fact that my neighbor's lovely cat puked on my bed made me feel extremely happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having someone's cat puke on your bed is really gross and unpleasant and would not make anyone feel happy.

premise: This headache needs to go away.
hypothesis: I am so overjoyed with the fact that this headache that is ruining my day
label: Contradiction
explanation: A headache is a really painful experience and so having it ruin someone's day would be really unfortunate.

premise: The play is going to hurt few people.
hypothesis: The play is going to burn few people.
label: Entailment
explanation: Burn here means to cause emotional pain.

premise: Avalanche protected everything that fell down.
hypothesis: The avalanche polvarized  anything standing in its way.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An avalanche is a large mass of snow and ice that comes down from a mountainside, while to protect something means to keep it safe from harm.

premise: That was a very difficult decision to make.
hypothesis: That was a no brainer.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A no brainer is a very easy decision to make, but the contradiction is that the decision was very difficult to make.

premise: They were moving away from him quickly.
hypothesis: They were moving away from him like a squirrel up a tree.
label: Entailment
explanation: A squirrel moves quickly up a tree when it is threatened, so the simile is suggesting that the people are moving away from him quickly because they are threatened by him.

premise: I wish I was a better public speaker like Barack Obama.
hypothesis: I feel so proud about myself for not being as good as Barack Obama when it comes to public speaking.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Obama is an excellent public speaker and so someone who is not as good as him cannot feel proud about themselves.

premise: Through the stone, the world was a dull gray and lacked any color.
hypothesis: Through the stone, the world was like a pencil drawing .
label: Entailment
explanation: A pencil drawing is usually not very colorful or bright, so this simile is saying that the world was not very colorful or bright.

premise: My laptop broke and I lost all the information on it.
hypothesis: The fact that my laptop broke and I lost all the information on it makes me high spirited and cheerful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing all the information on a laptop is definitely not a good thing and so someone being high spirited and cheerful about it cannot be justified.

premise: The knight of flowers looked strange in white, as he usually is very colorful.
hypothesis: It was strange to see the knight of flowers all in white when before he had always been like a rainbow.
label: Entailment
explanation: A rainbow is very colorful, so the knight of flowers being like a rainbow means that he is usually very colorful.

premise: The government could not changed the entire law into a code.
hypothesis: The government photosynthesized the entire law into a code.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Photosynthesis is the process of converting light into energy, while to change something into a code would mean to convert it into a system of symbols.

premise: My neighbor neglects their dog.
hypothesis: It horrifies me how my neglectful neighbor doesn't take care of their poor dog
label: Entailment
explanation: Dogs are often seen as family members and so when someone doesn't take care of their dog it is seen as a form of neglect which can be horrifying to some people

premise: This fact goes against all the standard theories.
hypothesis: This fact warred against the standard theories.
label: Entailment
explanation: This fact was in conflict with the standard theories which is depicted using the metaphor war to symbolize its nature the defy the theories

premise: Do not ask table 12 whether he wants water to drink.
hypothesis: Ask table 12 whether he wants water.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The contradiction here is that one sentence instructs to ask table 12 if they want water, while the other says not to ask them anything.

premise: he summoned the servant.
hypothesis: He buzzed the servant.
label: Entailment
explanation: He buzzed the servant means he asked for the servant.

premise: Even though he wanted to fight, he was helpless.
hypothesis: He wanted to fight, but he was like a pup being held by the scruff.
label: Entailment
explanation: When a mother dog picks up her pup by the scruff of its neck, it is a sign of dominance and the pup is helpless to fight back, implying he was helpless.

premise: I'm definitely gonna get fired if I don't submit the report on time.
hypothesis: The boss will eat me alive if the report arrives late.
label: Entailment
explanation: The boss will be very angry if the report arrives late.

premise: I don't know why they still bother, the costly and meaningless victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass.
hypothesis: I don't know why they still bother, the pyrrhic victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor, and in this context the victory is described as being costly and meaningless.

premise: I just replaced my headlights in my truck and one of them went out inside of a week.
hypothesis: I am really happy about the fact that my brand new headlights went out after only a week
label: Contradiction
explanation: headlights are an important part of a car and so having them go out after only a week would be really frustrating and not something to be happy about.

premise: The wind ceases through the leaves.
hypothesis: The wind whips through the leaves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To whip something means to move it violently back and forth, while to cease something means to stop or discontinue it.

premise: There were small and rounded peaks that could be seen every so often.
hypothesis: Every so often a peak could be seen like a granite tooth stabbing the sky.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A granite tooth would be perceived as sharp and not rounded, and stabbing the sky implies it is tall, not small

premise: It irritates me when my roommate doesn't clean up the room
hypothesis: I can't stand it when my roommate doesn't clean up the room and it becomes a total mess
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very annoying when someone doesn't clean up a shared space and it causes the area to become dirty and cluttered

premise: My friend told me I'm getting fat.
hypothesis: I love the fact that my friend felt the need to point out that I am getting fat
label: Contradiction
explanation: The implication behind someone telling another person that they are getting fat is that the person who is being told is not attractive anymore and hence nothing to love

premise: Almost every night something keeps dumping over my big trash can outdoors.
hypothesis: It's great that someone or something keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors because i get great exercise by picking it back up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up a big trash can that has been knocked over requires a lot of effort and so it is not great that someone or something is making it happen.

premise: I was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck.
hypothesis: I felt no sense of jealousy when without doing any hardwork my friend won from the lottery ticket that she bought for only a dollar.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jealousy is often felt when someone undeserving wins something and in this case, the friend of the person who wrote the sentence did not have to work hard for the prize they won.

premise: The event left her memory.
hypothesis: The event engraved itself into her memory.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word engraved refers something that is permanently and indelibly marked, while left means something is not parmanently marked.

premise: I recently lost my job and I feel horrible.
hypothesis: I recently lost my job and feel like the world is ending
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a job is a very big deal and can often have negative impacts on someone's life so it is not surprising to feel like the world is ending

premise: The decor was sparse and jumbled
hypothesis: The decor was like a college dorm room furnished on a budget.
label: Entailment
explanation: College dorm rooms are usually furnished with the bare minimum, and are often messy or cluttered.

premise: We were in complete harmony and order.
hypothesis: Everything at sixes and sevens.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be at sixes and sevens means to be frazzled or disorganized, but the sentence describes being in complete harmony and order

premise: My bank ended up charging me hundreds of dollars for something I didn't do.
hypothesis: I was totally calm when I found out that my bank charged me hundreds of dollars for something I didn't do.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is natural for people to get angry or upset when they are charged hundreds of dollars for something they didn't do, so feeling calm about it is not justified.

premise: My boss just bought a new Mercedes, and I can only afford public transport
hypothesis: It's totally great that my boss can afford a new Mercedes when I can only afford public transport
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new Mercedes car is a very expensive purchase and so the fact that someone's boss can afford it implies that they are very wealthy, while someone who can only afford public transport is likely living paycheck to paycheck and feels jealous.

premise: I have no experience whatsoever, but from what I've heard, the human heart is much more capable than we give it credit for.
hypothesis: take it from me, the human heart is much more capable than we give it credit for.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom "take it from me" is used when the speaker wants to emphasize that they are speaking from experience, but in this context, the speaker has no experience

premise: I had to go to the hospital last month and I was charged 400 dollars more than they said it would be.
hypothesis: I was really mad when I found out that the hospital charged me 400 dollars more than their initial estimate
label: Entailment
explanation: Oftentimes, hospitals will give people an estimate of how much their stay will cost and then the final bill is much higher which often leads to people being angry

premise: It was as if she were floating in something light and airy, but she was still pushing as hard as she could.
hypothesis: She was still pushing as hard as she could, but it was as if she were like a woolly mammoth caught in an infinitely deep tar pit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tar pit is a sticky, gooey substance that would make it hard to move, whereas something light and airy would make it easy to move

premise: I took some copy paper from work today and got caught.
hypothesis: I feel mortified that I had to take some copy paper from work today and got caught
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered stealing if someone takes copy paper from work without permission and so getting caught often leads to feelings of shame and mortification

premise: It was lush
hypothesis: It was like a monk's cell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A monk's cell is a small, austere room where a monk would live in solitude, hence it would not be lush
