premise: I accidentally dropped my phone and the screen started glitching out and the phone didn't want to turn on anymore.
hypothesis: I was terrified when my phone screen started flickering and then the phone shut off completely
label: Entailment
explanation: Many people rely on their phones for communication and to stay connected so when something like this happens it can be very scary because it feels like you're losing a part of your life

premise: I was really angry that I was so much more powerful than he was, yet I could easily touch him in a harmful way.
hypothesis: It was pissing me off that I was so much more powerful than he was, yet I couldn't lay a finger on him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lay a finger on someone means to barely touch them, usually with the intention of harming them but in this context, the speaker is angry because they can easily harm the person.

premise: I was in a hurry to get home but I hit every red light and was late.
hypothesis: I was so anxious to get home but hitting every red light made me calm right down
label: Contradiction
explanation: Red lights usually cause people to feel anxious because it makes them late.

premise: You will act without considering my wellbeing for the rest of our days, I can see it already.
hypothesis: You will run roughshod over me for the rest of our days, I can see it already.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run roughshod over someone means to act without considering their wellbeing, which is what the speaker can see happening already.

premise: He was dreading their meeting
hypothesis: He was as enthusiastic about their meeting tonight as a condemned prisoner the day of his execution
label: Entailment
explanation: A condemned prisoner on the day of his execution is not enthusiastic, but rather dreading, the event.

premise: I  broke my aunt's picture display, it was very elaborate and nice
hypothesis: I was really pleased when I accidentally broke my aunt's picture display that she had just put up
label: Contradiction
explanation: Breaking someone's picture display cannot make someone feel pleased but rather guilty and clumsy because they destroyed someone's special belongings.

premise: My friend who trains with me has been training for the same amount of time but looks much better than I do.
hypothesis: It absolutely boosts up my morale and self confidence to see my friend who trains with me has been working out for the same amount of time as I have, but looks so much better than I do.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone who is better looking than you at something you are bad at does not really motivate or make you feel confident and instead would probably lead to feelings of jealousy and bitterness.

premise: Snowfall exposing the Earth from its clothes like a mother would her infant child.
hypothesis: The snow blanketed the earth like a mother would her infant child.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mother carefully and lovingly covers her infant child with a blanket, while exposing them would mean leaving them unprotected.

premise: But still, hearing it all poured out so lengthily and unsatisfactorily when so much was on the line was dizzying.
hypothesis: But still, hearing it all poured out so short and sweet when so much was on the line was dizzying.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be short and sweet is to be brief while still being satisfying or to the point, but in this context the person is pouring out their feelings lengthily and unsatisfactorily.

premise: I was super anxious when my power went out yesterday and I had no phone service.
hypothesis: I freaked out when my power went out and I had no phone service to contact anyone
label: Entailment
explanation: Being without power or phone service can be very isolating and scary so it is not surprising that someone would freak out in that situation

premise: Back in the school, I got zero marks in one of the important exam
hypothesis: When I was in school, I got a zero on one of the most important exams and felt like I couldn't contain my excitement
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting a zero on an exam is not a good feeling because it means you scored nothing and hence cannot be excited about it

premise: How she wished for another chance to have a peaceful converstation with him, especially now that she'd learned to decode the way he talked.
hypothesis: How she wished for another chance to cross swords with him, especially now that she'd learned to decode the way he talked.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cross swords means to fight or argue, but in this sentence she wished for a peaceful conversation instead.

premise: The mountain was devoid of snow.
hypothesis: The mountain was blanketed with snow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be blanketed with something means to be covered or shrouded by it, while to be devoid of something means to be lacking or missing it.

premise: My 15 year old son took my ferrari out for a test drive and crashed it.
hypothesis: I am super upset that my 15 year old son crashed my ferrari while taking it for a test drive
label: Entailment
explanation: A ferrari is a very expensive car and so it is natural for someone to be upset if their 15 year old son crashed it while taking it out for a test drive

premise: Earthquake hath dried up its tale on them.
hypothesis: Earthquake hath swam deeply its tale on them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The metaphor is comparing the earthquake to a swimming creature, suggesting that it is moving deep beneath the surface, whereas, the contradiction compares the earthquake to something drying up, which suggests that it is no longer active or present.

premise: I'm always bummed when I use a clever one-liner from old pop lyrics...and nobody gets it
hypothesis: I feel terrible when I use a clever one-liner from old pop lyrics and it doesn't even make sense to the people around me
label: Entailment
explanation: A lot of old pop lyrics are clever and often have hidden meanings that people enjoy trying to figure out

premise: It was the moment to forget everything had happened and focus on one's life again.
hypothesis: The moment had arrived for killing the past and coming back to life.
label: Entailment
explanation: Killing the past means forgetting everything that has happened and starting fresh.

premise: I don't think I have ever remembered a single friends birthday until facebook was created.
hypothesis: I feel great that I couldn't remember a single friends birthday until facebook reminded me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Remembering friends' birthdays is a sign of being a good friend and taking an interest in their life, but forgetting them and needing facebook to remind you is the opposite and not something to feel great about

premise: We tried to have kids for a long time but each pregnancy just resulted in miscarriage.
hypothesis: We feel so blessed that every time we tried to have kids it resulted in a miscarriage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Miscarriages are often unexpected and a result of various factors, so to try and have kids multiple times and still not be successful implies that the couple is not blessed at all.

premise: Yesterday I saw that bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden.
hypothesis: I was so glad to see that the bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dandelions are often seen as weeds but some people still enjoy having them in their garden and so someone being glad that the bugs ate them is absurd.

premise: Not happy about the fact that my friends all met up for dinner recently and I wasn't invited.
hypothesis: It's completely fair that my friends all got together for dinner recently and I wasn't invited
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being left out of a gathering of friends can feel really hurtful and hence it is not fair at all.

premise: I had to deal with a lady and her 2 daughters that had lice
hypothesis: I had the honor and privilege of dealing with a lady and her two daughters who had lice
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dealing with lice is a very unpleasant experience and most people would not consider it to be an honor or privilege.

premise: I dropped my grocery bag in the parking lot and it spilled everywhere
hypothesis: I felt so good about myself when I dropped my grocery bag and all the food spilled everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a grocery bag and spilling the food everywhere is usually a very embarrassing moment and one would feel ashamed about themselves and not good.

premise: The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose if the situation turns for the better and no drastic measures are needed.
hypothesis: The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose when push comes to shove.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When push comes to shove means if the situation deteriorates or becomes desperate, but in this context the situation is improving

premise: I found out my storage unit burned down and I had lost several irreplaceable items
hypothesis: Overjoyed to find out my storage unit burned down and I had lost several valuable items
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing valuable items in a fire would be really upsetting and not something to feel overjoyed about.

premise: I got behind a slow driver and it ticked me off because it made me late to work.
hypothesis: I got so pleased when I followed the slow driver and it made me late for work
label: Contradiction
explanation: Following a slow driver can be really frustrating because it makes someone late for work or an appointment, so being pleased about it is absurd.

premise: I do not like being in small spaces.
hypothesis: I feel brave and not claustrophobic at all when I am in small spaces.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Claustrophobia is the fear of small spaces and so feeling brave and not claustrophobic in them cannot be possible.

premise: The King wasn't making it easy to keep my cool.
hypothesis: I needed to keep my cool, but the King surely wasn't making it like a gentle stroll in the park.
label: Entailment
explanation: A stroll in the park is a peaceful, calming activity and typically very easy, whereas the King was not making it easy, meaning it was likely stressful and intense.

premise: Mark should know that his sarcastic and irritating comments are totally unnecessary to make.
hypothesis: Mark ’s comments are an acid bath for my nerves.
label: Entailment
explanation: An acid bath is a metaphor for something that is really irritating, so in this case, the person is saying that Mark's comments are really annoying and make them want to scream.

premise: We really performed very badly last night at the game
hypothesis: We really laid an egg last night at the game
label: Entailment
explanation: To lay an egg means to do something very poorly, which is what happened last night at the game.

premise: I got recently got three rejection letters for 3 different jobs in a matter of a week and a half and that was a painful experience.
hypothesis: I was jumping for joy when I received 3 rejection letters for different jobs in such a short amount of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rejection letters for job applications are never a good thing to receive and rather painful and so someone being happy about getting them is unreal.

premise: His colleagues didn't come to his aid because he hadnt gone out of his way to win their approval and get on their good side.
hypothesis: His colleagues didn't come to his aid because he hadnt gone out of his way to curry favour with them.
label: Entailment
explanation: To curry favour means to try to make someone like you.

premise: My policy is to be ruthlessly uncompromising with my opposition and unyielding in the pursuit of my agenda or goal.
hypothesis: My policy is take no prisoners.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take no prisoners means to be utterly ruthless, uncompromising, and unyielding, which is what this context describes.

premise: And in the meantime, roger and bree get back their cabin, lizzie and her father stop sleeping in the surgery, and everything is difficult and unpleasant!.
hypothesis: And in the meantime, roger and bree get back their cabin, lizzie and her father stop sleeping in the surgery, and everything is beer and skittles!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Beer and skittles means all fun and pleasure, but everything in the sentence is described as being difficult and unpleasant.

premise: Adrenaline shot through him powerfully
hypothesis: Adrenaline shot through him like a lightning bolt.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lightning bolt is a powerful surge of electricity, so the simile is emphasizing the strength of the adrenaline surge.

premise: He had a bulky phone in his pocket, a secure digital unit.
hypothesis: There was a phone in his pocket, a secure digital unit like a cigarette lighter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cigarette lighter is a small, slim object, whereas a bulky phone is larger and not slim

premise: As a result, I felt like I had to act carelessly and recklessly in order to upset him.
hypothesis: As a result, I felt like I had to walk on eggshells around him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To walk on eggshells means to be very careful so as not to upset the person, but the speaker in this context acted carelessly in order to upset the person.

premise: I asked my brother to bring me a gift from his trip and he didn't bring anything.
hypothesis: As much as I was looking forward to getting a gift from my brother, I am overjoyed to find that he absolutely forgot about me and came empty handed from his trip.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be happy to receive a gift from a loved one, so someone who is overjoyed to find that they were forgotten and came empty handed is not being truthful.

premise: The light had taken over the dark.
hypothesis: Light had banished  darkness.
label: Entailment
explanation: To banish means to drive out or force to leave.

premise: But they still freak me out, which is why I was currently standing up.
hypothesis: But they still freak me out, which is why I was like a five-year old child in a grown man's arms.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A five-year old child would be small and would have to be held in a grown man's arms, whereas if the person is standing up, they are not small

premise: I accidentally told my best friend's secret to a mutual friend
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I was careless enough to accidentally tell my best friend's secret to a mutual friend
label: Entailment
explanation: Its generally seen as very disrespectful and disloyal to tell someone else's secret without their permission and so its natural to feel bad after doing so, especially if the person you told the secret to is a mutual friend

premise: I meant to send an email to my boss and instead I accidentally sent it out to my whole company.
hypothesis: I feel totally fine that I accidentally sent an email to my whole company instead of just my boss
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally sending an email to a large group of people, such as a company, can be embarrassing and stressful because it often contains confidential or personal information.

premise: The train horn restored the peace.
hypothesis: The train horn disemboweled the peace.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To disembowel something means to destroy it completely, while to restore something means to bring it back or revive it.

premise: I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was awful.
hypothesis: I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it totally wasn't a disaster at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A keto pizza is a pizza that is low in carbs and hence it taste really bad and its very likely a disaster

premise: I'm so mad at people around my apartment just throwing their used cigarettes all over the sidewalk.
hypothesis: It's not only beautiful but also cool how people around my apartment building just toss their cigarettes on the ground.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cigarette butts are often unsightly and produce an unpleasant smell, so finding them littered around someone's apartment building is not cool or beautiful by any means.

premise: I caught my friend trying to steal items from my dads workshop on the property.
hypothesis: I caught my friend stealing items from my dad's workshop and now I am wanna give him a medal for his honesty
label: Contradiction
explanation: Catching someone stealing usually results in a negative reaction such as anger, disappointment or betrayal and not wanting to give them a medal for their honesty

premise: I have zero friends at my new job and I don't know what to do about it!
hypothesis: I feel so popular at my new job because I don't know how to make friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being popular at a job usually implies having friends at work, but if someone doesn't know how to make friends, then it is the opposite.

premise: I just got notice that my mortgage payment has gone up this year and I'm so mad about it.
hypothesis: I am absolutely cheerful that my mortgage payment has increased this year without any warning
label: Contradiction
explanation: The increase in mortgage payments can be a huge burden for some people and so being cheerful about it is quite unrealistic.

premise: I studied really hard for my annual exam but did not get my desired grade.
hypothesis: I was extremely happy to find out that all my studying for the annual exam did not reflect in my grade.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Studying for an annual exam is often a waste of time if the grade received does not reflect the effort put in, so someone being extremely happy about this is absurd.

premise: We agreed on the terms of the settlement.
hypothesis: We took on the terms of the settlement.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase took on the terms means to agree with or follow something, here, in this case, the speaker has no choice but to agree with the terms of the settlement.

premise: I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so bad
hypothesis: I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so sexy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Burning hair with a hair drier often damages it and makes it look frizzy and unappealing and not sexy

premise: My friend left me all alone at this party to go hang out with some guy I've never met before.
hypothesis: Feeling lonesome at this party because my friend ditched me to go talk to some guy she just met
label: Entailment
explanation: When people go to parties they often want to socialize and be around their friends so when a friend ditches them to go talk to someone else it can feel very isolating

premise: I found out that my storage unit burned down over the weekend.
hypothesis: The fact that my storage unit burned down over the weekend makes me feel like the luckiest person in the world
label: Contradiction
explanation: A storage unit burning down over the weekend would lead to a lot of belongings being destroyed which would be really unfortunate and not lucky at all.

premise: I watched so many scary movies that I haven't been able to sleep alone in years due to fear.
hypothesis: I watched so many horror movies in such a short amount of time that now I'm excited to sleep alone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Horror movies are meant to scare people and so watching them excessively would make them fearful and probably have the opposite effect of making someone excited to sleep alone.

premise: Sometimes my boyfriend cooks and the food tastes pretty gross
hypothesis: Sometimes my boyfriend cooks and the food tastes so good that it makes me feel sick
label: Contradiction
explanation: Good food should not make someone feel sick and so the boyfriend's cooking must not be up to par.

premise: The jazz solo sounded nice and smooth
hypothesis: The jazz solo sounded as smooth as sandpaper
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sandpaper is rough, not smooth, so the simile is saying that the solo sounded rough, not smooth

premise: I have so many ants in my kitchen no matter what I do I can't get rid of them and they are everywhere.
hypothesis: The fact that I have tried so many methods but the lovely ants in my kitchen just don't go away makes me ecstatic.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ants are often considered to be pests and most people would want them gone from their house, so the fact that they are still there despite trying multiple methods is not something to be happy about.

premise: Her tears decided to contradict the example.
hypothesis: Her tears decided to follow suit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To follow suit means to follow in the same pattern, but in this sentence the tears decided to do the opposite

premise: You start to worry when everyone becomes so concerned.
hypothesis: It starts to worry you that everyone is like a snowman looking at the first spring sun.
label: Entailment
explanation: A snowman will start to melt when it is exposed to the sun, so the simile is indicating that the person is becoming overwhelmed and their concerns are valid.

premise: Almost every night something keeps dumping over my big trash can outdoors.
hypothesis: It's really irritating that something or somebody keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common for animals to go through trash cans looking for food but if it happens often and someone has to constantly clean up the mess it can be irritating

premise: My house caught on fire and I lost all my belongings.
hypothesis: I lost all my belongings and my house burned down in a tragic accident
label: Entailment
explanation: A house fire is a tragic accident that often results in people losing all their belongings

premise: I found a text message on my wife phone that proves she is cheating on me.
hypothesis: The discovery of the text message on my wife's phone that proves she is cheating on me has left me in complete serenity
label: Contradiction
explanation: Discovering that one's wife is cheating on them is not a situation that would lead to serenity but instead to distress, heartache, and pain.

premise: You have no idea why people suddenly have become sick
hypothesis: You have no idea why people suddenly have become like lepers.
label: Entailment
explanation: Lepers are people who have a contagious skin disease, so the simile is implying that the people are sick with a contagious disease.

premise: We were in complete chaos and disorder.
hypothesis: Everything at sixes and sevens.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be at sixes and sevens means to be frazzled or disorganized, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: Every day, I work hard to put food on the table, and then I cop this from the missus.
hypothesis: day in, day out, I work hard to put food on the table, and then I cop this from the missus.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom day in, day out is used to describe something that happens routinely or regularly, which in this sentence is the hard work that the speaker does every day.

premise: I saw a grown woman pick her nose and eat it earlier.
hypothesis: It was so visually pleasing to witness a grown gross woman dig in her nose for a booger and then eat it
label: Contradiction
explanation: To most people, the sight of someone digging in their nose for a booger and then eating it is really disgusting and not visually pleasing at all

premise: I think my boyfriend took my debit card again
hypothesis: I am super excited that my boyfriend probably took my debit card without me knowing
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone's boyfriend took their debit card without them knowing, it would not be a good thing because it could lead to them overspending or even stealing money and hence the girlfriend would not be excited about it

premise: Terradyn took a long time to answer, and his voice sounded distant.
hypothesis: Terradyn took a long time to answer, and with a voice like a blazing comet.
label: Entailment
explanation: A comet is a celestial body that is often very far, so his voice sounding like a blazing comet could indicate that he sounded distant.

premise: I got back too late.
hypothesis: I got back just under the wire.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the wire means to be just barely in time, but in this context, the speaker got back too late.

premise: My kids don't like to listen and it drives me crazy.
hypothesis: I love the fact that my kids don't listen to me and it totally make me happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Kids who do not listen to their parents are often disobedient and doing things that will get them in trouble, so being happy about this goes against what should be a natural feeling of frustration and anger.

premise: Today a swarm of wasps was chasing after me.
hypothesis: My favorite activity today involved running away from a swarm of wasps that were following me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wasps are often feared because of their sting and so running away from them would not be a favorite activity for anyone.

premise: Making sure I use very few resources available to me ran through my mind.
hypothesis: leave no stone unturned ran through my mind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leave no stone unturned means to use every available resource, but the person in the context is thinking about using very few resources.

premise: They don't smirk, they don't glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are dead.
hypothesis: They don't smirk, they don't glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are like a flat-lining heart patient.
label: Entailment
explanation: The simile "flat-lining heart patient" is used to describe how the eyes look in the moment before the person looks away, which is to say that they are devoid of life.

premise: My husband keeps leaving his socks and underwear all over the house and I keep having to pick them up.
hypothesis: I feel like a maid because I always have to pick up my husband's socks and underwear from all over the house
label: Entailment
explanation: Picking up after someone else is often associated with being a maid or servant and so having to constantly pick up your husband's socks and underwear is likely to feel like that

premise: I stepped in gum someone spit on the sidewalk.
hypothesis: Delighted to have stepped in the grossest thing ever, someone's spitted gum on the sidewalk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stepping in something gross is never a delight and so finding gum on the sidewalk would be the worst thing possible.

premise: I went to the town hall to renew driving license, but the agent gave wrong information, so I wasted three months.
hypothesis: I made such an excellent use of three months by going to the town hall to renew my driving license and the agent gave me wrong information
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good use of time to go to the town hall to renew a driving license because it is often a long and tedious process and so receiving wrong information from the agent only makes it worse.

premise: You began to stare off into space and smile in a way that looked safe.
hypothesis: You just started staring off into space and smiling like Cruella De Vil.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cruella De Vil is a fictional character who is known for being cruel and villainous, so if someone is smiling like her, it would not be safe

premise: I really do not like being around spiders.
hypothesis: I am absolutely in love with spiders and the thought of them crawling on me totally doesn't make me scream at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people are afraid of spiders because they are creepy and crawly and the thought of them crawling on them would invoke a scream.

premise: You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out loudly
hypothesis: You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a scream echoing through a canyon.
label: Entailment
explanation: A scream echoing through a canyon is very loud, so the phone ringing out is also very loud.

premise: I spent a few hundred dollars on a purse which is a lot for me and it started fraying in days.
hypothesis: I can't believe how well made the purse I bought for a few hundred dollars is and that it started fraying in days
label: Contradiction
explanation: A purse that is well made and costs a few hundred dollars should not start fraying in a few days but owing to the fact that it frayed means it is not made of good quality material.

premise: I feel so bad when I think back to times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason.
hypothesis: I love reminiscing the great memories when I remember the times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider yelling at their kids for no good reason as a good memory and hence the speaker is not happy about remembering those times.

premise: I feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people.
hypothesis: I can't stand it when people lie about other people because it makes me so upset
label: Entailment
explanation: Lying is a generally bad thing to do but when people lie about other people it can often be very hurtful and damaging

premise: My eyes have teared up and my face turned red.
hypothesis: My eyes burned up and I could feel my face turning red.
label: Entailment
explanation: My eyes have teared up means that my eyes are watering.

premise: They sat down at the table to not touch or finish pansy's dinner.
hypothesis: They settled at the table to make short work of pansy's dinner.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make short work of something is to deal with it quickly or handily, but in this context they are not touching or finishing pansy's dinner.

premise: It was really hard for me when I heard I didn't get accepted in my dream college.
hypothesis: It felt like my world came crashing down when I found out I didn't get accepted into my dream college
label: Entailment
explanation: For a lot of people, their dream college is the place they see themselves going and getting an education from and not getting accepted into that college can feel like all of their dreams and aspirations are crashing down

premise: Does anyone want to split the cost individually?
hypothesis: Anyone want to go halves?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go halves means to share the cost evenly between two people, but this sentence asks if anyone wants to split the cost individually

premise: He burdened him with work.
hypothesis: He heaped him with work.
label: Entailment
explanation: To heap means to pile something high, so the person is giving a lot of work.

premise: They were really disappointed and thus cried a lot.
hypothesis: Then they cried a sea of tears.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sea of tears means they cried a lot.

premise: Oscillators never stay on one frequency, they are always searching around to find the right frequency and go up and down.
hypothesis: The oscillator hunts about the correct frequency.
label: Entailment
explanation: An oscillator is a device that creates a regular, often periodic, motion, so here the metaphor suggests that the oscillator is never satisfied or content with staying on one frequency, but is always searching for the right frequency.

premise: And truth denied , and righted wrong.
hypothesis: And truth exalted, and righted wrong.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If truth is exalted, it means it is held in high esteem or considered to be important, while if truth is denied, it means it is rejected or not believed.

premise: I just received a phone call that I didn't get the job I applied for.
hypothesis: I was excited to receive a call that I didn't get the job that I wanted so much
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people are not excited to receive calls informing them that they have not been selected for a job and instead feel disappointed or sad.

premise: I was by myself at a party because I didn't really fit it with anybody there.
hypothesis: I felt really popular at the party because I didn't know anybody there
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not knowing anybody at a party implies that a person is not popular and unpopular respectively.

premise: Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better.
hypothesis: I feel really proud of the mean things my considerate kid said to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A considerate kid would not say mean things to their parents which goes against their values and hence the parent would not be proud of such behavior

premise: This problem doesn't have a solution.
hypothesis: This problem admits of no solution.
label: Entailment
explanation: This means that the problem cannot be solved.

premise: Even though it hurt, the familiarity of the ache was unsettling.
hypothesis: But after all i'd been through, the familiarity of that ache was almost like a warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie is a comforting food, whereas something that is unsettling is not comforting

premise: John's performance is rather insignificant in comparison to his classmates.
hypothesis: John fell behind his class mates.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fell behind means John's performance is not as good as his classmates.

premise: His eyes begin to tear up and they look luminescent.
hypothesis: As you approach him, his eyes begin to shed tears that appear like glow-in-the-dark stars.
label: Entailment
explanation: glow-in-the-dark stars are usually luminescent, so the simile in this context means that tears are luminescent.

premise: I saw my boyfriend commenting on another girl's facebook photos.
hypothesis: The fact that my boyfriend was commenting on other girl's facebook photos made me feel really secure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is in a relationship, they often feel insecure and threatened when their partner is commenting on other girl's facebook photos.

premise: I was terrified when I heard a knock at my door late at night
hypothesis: The sound of a knock at my door late at night made me feel so appreciated that someone cared about me at that hour.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A knock at the door late at night usually means that there is an emergency or something dangerous and so the person receiving it does not feel appreciated but rather anxious..

premise: I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.
hypothesis: I was handling things perfectly and grad school was making me feel like I was on a cruise so I dropped out to keep my sanity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Grad school can be tough and overwhelming and so someone feeling like they are on a cruise and handling things perfectly is unrealistic and speaker dropping out of grad school shows that they were not really handling things perfectly after all.

premise: The tax cut will definitely help the economy.
hypothesis: The tax cut will fertilize the economy.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fertilize means to make something grow or develop.

premise: The music stopped in the background
hypothesis: The music frolicked in the background.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To frolic means to play or act in a carefree or joyful manner, while stopping suggests the music is not played any more.

premise: My son just is 17 and a junior in high school, he just told me of his plans to drop out of school.
hypothesis: I'm disappointed to hear that my son doesn't plan on continuing his education after high school
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally expected that people will continue their education after high school and so when someone says they don't plan on doing that it is often disappointing to the people who care about them

premise: The girl's personality was sour.
hypothesis: The girl's personality was as sweet as a grapefruit
label: Entailment
explanation: A grapefruit is a sour fruit, so the girl's personality being as sweet as a grapefruit means that it is sour.

premise: At the same time, my link to his emotions ceased abruptly
hypothesis: At the same time, my link to his emotions ceased like a cell phone dropping a call.
label: Entailment
explanation: A cell phone dropping a call is an abrupt event, so the simile is emphasizing that the cessation of the link was sudden.

premise: She checked her reflection in the cheap and low-quality window.
hypothesis: She checked her reflection in the Banana Republic window.
label: Entailment
explanation: A Banana Republic is a small country with a corrupt government and a weak economy, and this sentence is describing a cheap and low-quality window.

premise: He couldn't let her fantasize about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.
hypothesis: He couldn't let her build castles in the air about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.
label: Entailment
explanation: To build castles in the air means to daydream, and in this sentence she is daydreaming about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.

premise: In making political agreements there are always multiple layers of complexity.
hypothesis: In making political agreements there are always wheels within wheels.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have wheels within wheels means to have something that is very complex, and this context is saying that when making political agreements there is always complexity.

premise: If you don't start now, you'll have the opportunity to do something.
hypothesis: If you don't start now, you'll miss the boat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, but in this context you'll have the opportunity to do something if you don't start now.

premise: She said, you don't have to swipe your card to get into any public place, so if you lose that you're not in any trouble at all.
hypothesis: She said, you have to swipe your card to get into any public place, so if you lose that you're up shit creek.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be up shit creek means to be in a difficult and challenging situation, but in this context the person is not in any trouble at all because they don't need a card to get into any public place.

premise: I was so mad I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it.
hypothesis: I was overjoyed that I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being given credit to a different person for someone else's work is never a good thing and so someone who was overjoyed about it is not rational.

premise: I felt bad when I couldn't get the gift my daughter wanted for her birthday
hypothesis: I felt proud when I could not get the expensive gift my daughter wanted for her birthday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to afford an expensive gift for one's own child shows a lack of financial stability and hence the parent is not in a good position to feel proud.

premise: “I might be mistaken, but Sean's father looked a bit sober and level-headed at the picnic, didn't he?.
hypothesis: “I might be mistaken, but Sean's father looked a bit tired and emotional at the picnic, didn't he?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tired and emotional is a semi-polite or humorous euphemism for drunkenness, but in this context it is implying that Sean's father was not drunk at the picnic.

premise: Your new AI invention has made our species more advanced.
hypothesis: You’ve just made a breakthrough in AI that meant that our species became like landlines in the twenty-first century.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Landlines are an old technology that has been replaced by newer, more advanced technologies like cell phones, making landlines obsolete not advanced

premise: He had sparred with many mages while training in Jaden, but this was not at all surprising or unexpected.
hypothesis: He had sparred with many mages while training in Jaden, but this was beyond the pale.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Beyond the pale means completely unacceptable or inappropriate, but in this sentence the mage's actions are not at all surprising or unexpected.

premise: She was graceful and quiet .
hypothesis: She was like a feral hunting beast .
label: Entailment
explanation: A feral hunting beast is an animal that is not domesticated and is often associated with being graceful and quiet in order to be successful in its hunt.

premise: I caught my friend trying to steal items from my dads workshop on the property.
hypothesis: I caught my friend stealing items from my dad's workshop and now I am just thrilled
label: Contradiction
explanation: Catching a friend stealing is not a thrilling feeling because it destroys the trust between them and causes anger or disappointment.

premise: These contractors are fixing the roof and they are so messy
hypothesis: It drives me insane how these contractors are making a mess and not cleaning up after themselves
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common courtesy to clean up after oneself, especially when working in someone else's home, so its understandable to be driven insane by contractors who are not doing so

premise: I am not experienced to comment, but, he would have used your professional services more than once if he hadn't been impressed.
hypothesis: But take it from me, he wouldn't have used your professional services more than once if he hadn't been impressed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take it from someone means to believe them because they have experience with what they are talking about, but this context suggests that the speaker is not experienced and therefore cannot comment

premise: You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out quietly.
hypothesis: You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a scream echoing through a canyon.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A scream echoing through a canyon would be very loud, whereas a quiet phone ring would not be

premise: All of my friends are married and I can't even get a decent boyfriend.
hypothesis: It sucks how all my friends are married and have beautiful families meanwhile I can't even get a decent boyfriend
label: Entailment
explanation: Being the only single person among a group of friends who are all married can be difficult and sometimes make people feel like they're not good enough if they can't even find a decent partner

premise: It was easy to get her to come here.
hypothesis: Getting her to come here was like a master whistling to call his dog.
label: Entailment
explanation: A master can whistle to call his dog from a distance away, and the dog will come to him, indicating that it is easy to get her to come.

premise: I had to go to the hospital last month and I was charged 400 dollars more than they said it would be.
hypothesis: I was really excited when I found out that the hospital charged me 400 dollars more than their initial estimate.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hospitals are often expensive and so finding out that the hospital charged more than the initial estimate is not something to be excited about.

premise: Losing your family pet after 10 years is one of the hardest things I have had to do
hypothesis: One of the hardest things I have ever experienced was losing my family pet after 10 years
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a family pet is often very hard on people because they have been with the pet for so long and have developed a close bond

premise: I bite back, not enough to do damage but definitely enough to let him know that I am joking and not at all serious about what I am saying.
hypothesis: I bite back, not hard enough to do damage but definitely hard enough to let him know that I mean business.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, but the speaker is indicating that they let people know that are joking by biting back

premise: My laptop was destroyed when my toddler spilled water on it.
hypothesis: I was ecstatic when my laptop got ruined after my toddler spilled water on it
label: Contradiction
explanation: A laptop getting ruined after water spills on it is not a good thing because it means that the device is now unusable and needs to be replaced.

premise: In Bombay, people lead an idle life with the same group of friends.
hypothesis: In Bombay, people change dance partners frequently, but not the dance.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In Bombay, it is common for people to go out and socialize with different groups of friends on a regular basis, which is the opposite of sticking to the same group of friends as the another statement states.

premise: There are more people who want to be in charge than there are people willing to do the work.
hypothesis: It's kind of like there are too many chiefs and not enough indians
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom means that there are too many people who want to be in charge, and not enough people willing to do the work.
idiom: too many chiefs and not enough indians

premise: I felt terrible when I broke our television a few weeks ago
hypothesis: I felt like the worst person ever when I accidentally broke our television a few weeks ago
label: Entailment
explanation: Accidentally breaking something is often seen as a careless mistake and people usually feel guilty and like the worst person ever when it happens

premise: Last weekend my friends and I went away on holiday and two of them got belligerent drunk and completely ruined the night.
hypothesis: Proud of two of my very civil friends who got wasted and ruined the night last weekend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone gets drunk and causes a scene, it is not something to be proud of because it reflects badly on the person and also on their friends.

premise: When I came back from my vacation, I was horrified when I found that there is a rat in my garden.
hypothesis: When I came back from my vacation, I was traumatized when I found that there is a rat in my garden
label: Entailment
explanation: coming back from a vacation to find a rat in the garden is pretty traumatizing because it means that the rat has been there for a while and it could have done some damage

premise: I wanted to tell her to get lost, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business.
hypothesis: I wanted to tell her to take a powder, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take a powder means to leave, which is what he wanted to tell her to do because the guy she was with wasn't worth it.

premise: His nose was rather wide.
hypothesis: His nose was like a branch jutting from a tree.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A branch jutting from a tree is typically thin, not wide, since it extends over the main body of the tree

premise: You will become whatever you have to be to make this company run smoothly, or your name will come off that door only after a very long time!.
hypothesis: You 'll be whatever you have to be to make this company run smoothly, or your name will come off that door before you can say knife!
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom before you can say knife means very quickly, but in this sentence it is used to describe how slowly someone's name will be taken off the door if they don't do as they're told.

premise: My daughter is being bullied at school and her teachers aren't doing a thing about it.
hypothesis: I am so angry that my daughter is being bullied at school and the teachers are not doing anything about it
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone's child is being bullied it is a natural reaction to feel angry, especially if the people who are supposed to be taking care of the situation like the child's teachers are not doing anything

premise: The held captive my protector who struggles meekly against them.
hypothesis: The cut loose my protector who struggles meekly against them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut loose means to behave in a relaxed or uninhibited manner, but in this sentence the opposite is happening and the protector is being held captive.

premise: Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm caught between two difficult choices where both options will lead to negative consequences, he would say.
hypothesis: Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm between the devil and the deep blue sea,he would say.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom means facing two equally unpleasant dangerous or risky alternatives, and the entailment captures this by saying that he is caught between two difficult choices where both options will lead to negative consequences.
idiom: between the devil and the deep blue sea

premise: I ordered pants online that I was sure would fit and they ended up not fitting.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that the pants I ordered online didn't fit even though the size was supposed to be correct
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very disappointing when clothes that were ordered online do not fit because it usually means having to go through the hassle of returning them and often waiting a long time for a refund

premise: I don't think I have ever remembered a single friends birthday until facebook was created.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I couldn't remember a single friends birthday until facebook reminded me
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are special days for people and forgetting a birthday often makes the person feel terrible because it shows that they aren't important enough to be remembered

premise: The stillness on the door was more assertive now.
hypothesis: The roaring on the door was more assertive now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one statement the knocking on the door is being compared to something that is roaring, whereas, the contradiction compares it to something still and silent.

premise: The toddler was very competitive.
hypothesis: The toddler was as competitive as a turtle
label: Contradiction
explanation: A turtle is not a very competitive animal, so saying the toddler was as competitive as a turtle would imply that the toddler was not very competitive

premise: We already know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty in the matter and more time passing won't change that fact.
hypothesis: As to his true innocence or culpability in the matter, only time will tell.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed, but in this context more time passing won't change the fact that we already know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty.

premise: I really hate when I get accused of something I didn't do.
hypothesis: It makes me so happy when I get wrongly accused because it's like they're saying I'm capable of doing something terrible
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being wrongly accused means that someone is being doubted for something they haven't done and so it is insulting and not a good thing to be happy of.

premise: The car crushed the toy.
hypothesis: The car smashed the toy.
label: Entailment
explanation: Smashed means to hit something with force and break it.

premise: He was so overwhelmed with happiness.
hypothesis: He was so happy he felt his heart was exploding.
label: Entailment
explanation: When people are extremely happy, they sometimes say they feel like their heart is going to explode.

premise: If that's the case, then I need to prepare to pursue this challenge.
hypothesis: In that case, game on.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have game on means to be ready to meet or pursue a particular challenge, but the speaker in this sentence is not ready and needs to prepare

premise: I ordered takeout yesterday and I got home and found out half my food was missing.
hypothesis: I was so excited to eat my takeout last night and then I got home to find the beautiful surprise that half my food was missing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Half the food being missing from a takeout order is not a good surprise and instead is quite frustrating.

premise: I felt pretty down when I found out that I was losing my job.
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I found out that I was going to lose my job
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a job is often a very traumatic experience and can result in feeling down or terrible

premise: I don't care about your situation or how you feel, vamp, Miranda said.
hypothesis: tough titty, vamp,miranda said.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tough titty means to have no sympathy for the situation another person is in, which is what Miranda is saying in this context.

premise: I lost all of my money at the casino.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that all my money got wasted at the casino
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing money at the casino is often seen as a bad thing because it means that someone has wasted their money on gambling instead of doing something else more productive with it

premise: After being hurt before, Brian now starts every relationship by not revealing anything about his intentions and keeping them hidden.
hypothesis: Once bitten twice shy, now Brian starts every relationship by putting his cards on the table.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your cards on the table means to reveal something hidden, such as intentions, but in this context Brian is keeping his intentions hidden.
idiom: put your cards on the table

premise: The night before a job interview I have a difficult time sleeping.
hypothesis: The night before a job interview I toss and turn because I am so anxious about it
label: Entailment
explanation: Job interviews are often very anxiety-inducing and so it is common for people to have difficulty sleeping the night before an interview because they are so worried

premise: My friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night.
hypothesis: I was mortified when my friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very impolite to be noisy and rude at the dinner table and so being called out for such behavior in front of others is likely to be embarrassing and mortifying

premise: I am sorry, have I never said anything that made you feel emotional?
hypothesis: Oh I'm sorry, did I touch a nerve?”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To touch a nerve means to evoke a strong emotional reaction, but in this context she has never said anything that made him emotional

premise: At the final and most critical moment, when the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then.
hypothesis: Its when the chips are down, and the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then.
label: Entailment
explanation: When the chips are down means at the final and most critical moment, which is when things really get difficult.

premise: But I don't want to be fighting without eating anything, so I might as well keep my muscles warm.
hypothesis: But I don't want to be fighting on a full stomach, so I might as well keep my muscles warm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on a full stomach means to have just eaten to the point of being full, but in this context the person wants to fight without having eaten anything.

premise: I had to send my food back at the restaurant today because it was so bad.
hypothesis: I was so stoked with the food I received at the restaurant that I had to send it back
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food at the restaurant was not good and so the person had to send it back, which goes against the idea of being stoked with it.

premise: You were oblivious of what someone else had said.
hypothesis: You were hanging yourself on someone else 's words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hanging oneself on someone else's words would mean to be relying on them or putting too much importance on them, while being oblivious of what someone else has said would suggest that you were not paying attention to them or you did not care about what they were saying.

premise: Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his entertainment by running booze in from canada.
hypothesis: Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his beer and skittles by running booze in from canada.
label: Entailment
explanation: Beer and skittles means all fun and pleasure, and Mike Scollay was paying for his entertainment by running booze in from Canada.

premise: I wish I could afford all the material items people have around me
hypothesis: I really covet all the material possessions people have around me because I can't afford any of it
label: Entailment
explanation: Coveting is defined as longing to possess something and it is often in response to not being able to afford the item

premise: Matt stood motionless
hypothesis: Matt stood like a big bronzed statue
label: Entailment
explanation: A statue cannot move, therefore it is implied that Matt cannot move.

premise: My experienced ear could tell right away that it was the compressor getting ready to start working again.
hypothesis: My experienced ear could tell right away that it was the compressor getting ready to give up the ghost again...
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give up the ghost means to stop working, but in this sentence the compressor is getting ready to start working again.

premise: I have a dog that lives near us and his owner never picks up his poop.
hypothesis: I love the fact that the dog owner never picks up his dog's poop and it's right by our house
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of people find it disgusting and irritating when they have to step in dog poop and the fact that the dog owner never picks it up shows a lack of responsibility on their part and isn't a lovable trait.

premise: The music faded to a whisper.
hypothesis: The music swelled to a crescendo.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A crescendo is a gradual increase in volume, while a whisper is a soft, gentle sound.

premise: The girl choked on her words during the conversation.
hypothesis: The girl broke into the conversation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To break into something means to interrupt it abruptly or unexpectedly, while to choke on something means to have difficulty speaking or communicating.

premise: The sun was obscured by the dense fog.
hypothesis: Occasionally the sun was like a dim orange fire .
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sun is very bright, so for it to be like a dim fire would mean it was flaring, not obscured by the fog

premise: It's owner might be crazy as heck, but she was also acting sweeter than one.
hypothesis: It's owner might be nutty as a fruitcake, but she was also acting sweeter than one.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be nutty as a fruitcake is to be crazy or wacky, and in this context the owner is acting crazy and sweet.

premise: I feel bad that I cheated on my diet.
hypothesis: I feel proud that I cheated on my diet and broke the commitment I made to myself
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a diet and breaking a commitment made to oneself goes against everything that is healthy and good, so feeling proud about it is definitely not justified.

premise: I hate being around negative people and situations
hypothesis: It makes me feel like dancing when I am around negative people and situations
label: Contradiction
explanation: Negative people and situations are often draining and make someone feel unhappy, so to describe being around them as making someone feel like dancing is highly inaccurate and sarcastic.

premise: She was absolutely repulsive
hypothesis: She was like a little seraph with bright brown eyes and a perfect button of a nose.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seraphs are angels, and are hence very beautiful creatures

premise: Once I was complaining about an annoying client to my coworkers, and when I left I saw she had been sitting outside the door the entire time.
hypothesis: I was totally delighted when I left my office to see my annoying client sitting outside the door eavesdropping on our conversation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eavesdropping on a conversation without the consent of the people involved is an invasion of privacy and hence not delighting but annoying for everyone involved.

premise: I think you have not done your homework.
hypothesis: I fancy you have not done your homework.
label: Entailment
explanation: I fancy you have not done your homework means that I think you have not done your homework yet.

premise: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer helpless
hypothesis: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a man in a sailless boat without oars.
label: Entailment
explanation: A man in a sailless boat without oars is helpless and has no way to move forward, which is what Milton is doing when he turns back to his computer.

premise: I don't think I have ever remembered a single friends birthday until facebook was created.
hypothesis: I am so proud of myself for not remembering a single friend's birthday until facebook reminded me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Remembering friends' birthdays is a sign of being a good friend and taking an interest in their life, but forgetting them and needing facebook to remind you is the opposite and not something to be proud of

premise: Daniel came by each morning and her aunt reported that she was feeling completely fine and healthy and resting in bed.
hypothesis: Daniel came by each morning and her aunt reported that she was feeling under the weather and resting in bed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the weather means to be mildly ill, but in this context the aunt reports that the girl is feeling completely fine and healthy.

premise: I found a long grey hair in my sandwitch this afternoon when I went out to lunch.
hypothesis: I was totally blessed when I found a long grey hair in my sandwich this afternoon
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a hair in your food is never a good thing and most people would consider it to be unlucky, so someone who sees it as a blessing is being sarcastic.

premise: My husband dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning.... what a start of the day
hypothesis: My husband totally dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning so my day is off to a great start.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a coffee mug is not a great start to the day because it usually means that the coffee mug is broken and someone's favorite mug cannot be replaced

premise: It weighs nine pounds," said Dr. White proudly.
hypothesis: it weighs nine pounds," said dr. white, sounding like a father telling you the weight of his newborn baby.
label: Entailment
explanation: A father telling you the weight of his newborn baby is proud because it is a large weight for a newborn, so Dr. White sounds proud.

premise: She's not mentally stable, jack.
hypothesis: She's not all there, jack.
label: Entailment
explanation: To not be all there means to not be mentally adequate, which is the same as being mentally unstable.

premise: The flowers were quietly standing in the wind.
hypothesis: The flowers danced in the wind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The flowers were dancing in the wind mean that they were moving around and swaying in the wind, contrasting to the another statement stating the flowers were quietly standing in the wind, i.e., they were not moving at all.

premise: Well, your passion certainly seems to be very restricted and limited, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange.
hypothesis: Well, your passion certainly seems to know no bounds, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To know no bounds means to be without limit or restriction, but in this context the speaker's passion is very restricted

premise: Well, that makes her good people in my opinion.
hypothesis: Well, that makes her good people in my book.
label: Entailment
explanation: in this context, in my book is used to mean according to one's opinion, and the speaker's opinion is that she is good people.

premise: The music breaks to a crescendo.
hypothesis: The music accumulates to a crescendo.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The music is accumulating to a crescendo, which means it is getting louder and louder, whereas, the contradiction states that the music breaks to a crescendo.

premise: Her eyes were huge and not bright.
hypothesis: Her eyes were fireflies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Fireflies eyes mean they are tiny and bright, i.e., opposite of being huge and not bright.

premise: My roommate leaves leftovers in the refrigerator for a ridiculous amount of time
hypothesis: My roommate's food habits make me feel so delighted because she leaves her leftovers in the refrigerator for days.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually do not enjoy eating food that has been left out in the open for a long time and has begun to rot, so finding food habits like that disgusting would be a common reaction.

premise: I am so annoyed by my new manager at work because he always lies to us
hypothesis: I just love the fact that my new manager at work is always dishonest and untrustworthy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a new manager who is dishonest and untrustworthy at work is not a good thing and so someone sensible cannot admires this quality

premise: Got to the hotel where I booked my room and it turns out they gave my room to someone else!
hypothesis: I am elated that the hotel gave the room I booked to someone else without letting me know.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone books a hotel room, they expect to get the room that they booked and so not being notified that the hotel gave it away to someone else is not something to be overjoyed about.

premise: I went on a date last night and he kept looking at the hot girl at the table next to us.
hypothesis: I felt attractive when I noticed my date was constantly checking out the hot girl at the table next to us
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being attracted to someone other than your date when you are on a date with them is rude and disrespectful and hence the person would not feel attractive in such a situation.

premise: The phone number was easy to remember
hypothesis: The phone number was easy to remember as a 100 number password
label: Contradiction
explanation: A 100 number password is a sequence of numbers that is extremely hard to remember because it is long and complex

premise: Middle age increased her appetite for travel rather than just staying at home.
hypothesis: Middle age cut down her appetite for travel.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have an appetite for something means to have a strong desire or craving for it, so if someone's appetite for travel is increased, that would mean they want to travel more rather than less.

premise: My sister took my best friend to the movie instead of me.
hypothesis: I am absolutely not jealous of the fact that my sister got to take my best friend to the movie theater instead of me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is normal to feel jealous when someone close to you such as a sister gets to do something that you wanted to do, in this case, going to the movies with a best friend.

premise: I recently found out that I have been diagnosed HIV positive, and I'm at a complete loss for words.
hypothesis: I am completely heartbroken that I have been diagnosed with HIV
label: Entailment
explanation: Finding out that you have HIV is often devastating news because it is a incurable virus that will likely shorten someone's life span and have many negative impacts on their health

premise: I hate that everyone in my family has a nicer car than I do.
hypothesis: I totally don't feel envious at all of how my family can afford nicer cars than I do
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cars are often seen as a status symbol and so to have a nicer car than someone else would invoke feelings of jealousy and hatred.

premise: Let's see if you celebrate wildly and make a lot of noise next Monday when it's just another start to a shitty week.
hypothesis: Let's see if you whoop it up next monday when it's just another start to a shitty week.
label: Entailment
explanation: To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, and in this context the speaker is wondering if the person will celebrate next Monday.

premise: He waited impatiently
hypothesis: He waited like a leopard poised to pounce
label: Contradiction
explanation: A leopard poised to pounce is patient and waiting for the right moment to strike, whereas an impatient person is not waiting patiently

premise: Attendees understood that whatever was said publicly or openly - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret.
hypothesis: Attendees understood that whatever was said under the rose - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To say something under the rose means to say it privately or confidentially, but in this context it is implied that whatever is said publicly must remain a secret.

premise: The politician lost to his rival.
hypothesis: The politician chopped down his rival.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To chop something down means to destroy or defeat it, while to lose to something means to be defeated by it.

premise: Turns out he was under a lot of debt and finally decided to  stay close to them and not escape.
hypothesis: Turns out he was under a lot of debt and finally decided to gave them the slip.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give someone the slip means to escape from them, but in this sentence he decided to stay close to them instead

premise: I woke up in the middle of the night yesterday and freaked out thinking that something crawled on me.
hypothesis: I just love the feeling of something creeping up on me in the middle of the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling something creepy crawl up on you in the darkness of night can invoke feelings of fear and terror and is not a sensation that someone would love.

premise: Even though he was thin, he looked attractive.
hypothesis: Having a thin figure, he looked like a dry, overgrown blade of grass.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dry, overgrown blade of grass is not attractive, it is scraggly and brown

premise: I rented out my bedroom to Airbnb customers and when I returned it was left smelly and diapers every where.
hypothesis: I came back to my room after renting it out to some Airbnb customers and was filled with gratitude at the smell and disgusting diapers everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of dirty diapers everywhere would not fill anyone with gratitude but rather with disgust and a sense of violation because it is not what was agreed upon when renting out the room.

premise: My cat just scratched up my brand new leather couch while I was at work.
hypothesis: I am so mad that my cat scratched up my brand new leather couch while I was at work
label: Entailment
explanation: Its natural to be angry when something of value is damaged, especially if it was caused by something that couldn't be helped like a pet

premise: There was a dead fly in my jello.
hypothesis: I was delighted to find a dead fly in my jello.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dead flies are often associated with filth and dirt and so finding one in a jello which is usually a food item that is considered to be clean and hygienic, would be gross and not delightful.

premise: I lost my car keys at a bar last night.
hypothesis: I'm glad I misplaced my car keys at the bar last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if they misplaced their car keys and so someone who is glad about it is sarcastic.

premise: I saw a person being obnoxious and horribly racist to someone and could not stand it
hypothesis: I saw a person being horrible and racist to someone and it made me so proud to belong to the human race.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The act of being racist is unacceptable and vile and so someone seeing someone else doing it should not require feeling proud to be a part of the human race.

premise: I thought we were safe as we turned the corner of the bleachers, but then I saw a small, black object getting smaller and smaller out of the corner of my eye.
hypothesis: I thought we were in the clear as we began to round the corner of the bleachers, but then I saw, out of the corner of my eye something like a fast-approaching sun .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sun is a huge, bright object, whereas a small, black object would not be like a sun

premise: Right after buying a brand new phone I dropped it and shattered the screen.
hypothesis: Isn't it lovely fate that the day I finally decided to buy a new phone, I accidentally dropped it and shattered the screen
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not lovely at all because buying a new phone is often an expensive investment and dropping it and shattering the screen means having to spend more money to get it fixed.

premise: I think it's tragic what our country is like right now because are falling apart as a society.
hypothesis: It makes me so proud that our country is falling apart and becoming a society of ignorance.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A country is supposed to be a place of progress and not one which falls apart and becomes a society of ignorance, so being proud of that is not justified.

premise: It came on padded feet, soft and cautious

label: Contradiction
