premise: And then, as she had predicted, the faeries who were in the lead and many of whom were leopards, shifted clumsily and awkwardly into their animal forms.
hypothesis: And then, as she had known they would, three hundred yards from their target the leading faeries, many of whom were leopards, shifted like a waterfall.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A waterfall is smooth and graceful, whereas shifting awkwardly and clumsily would be the opposite

premise: I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and was very nervous of having to retake it again
hypothesis: I was very discouraged when I found out I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and had to retake it again
label: Entailment
explanation: Failing a class is never a good feeling and it's especially discouraging when it's a class that is required for graduation

premise: Now this fool showed up with his confused mind.
hypothesis: Here comes the fool with his foggy brain.
label: Entailment
explanation: Foggy brain means the person is not thinking clearly and having a confused mind.

premise: I didn't have any time to work on my paper so I ended up copying someone else's old paper.
hypothesis: I feel so content that I had to resort to copying an old paper to submit for my final project
label: Contradiction
explanation: Copying someone else's work without giving them credit is an unethical thing to do just because one did not have time and so the the person cannot be content about it.

premise: This man was not laughing at all.
hypothesis: He was caught in a laughing fit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A laughing fit is when someone laughs uncontrollably, while not laughing at all would suggest that the person is not amused or entertained.

premise: The plant grew fast
hypothesis: the plant grew as fast as a bonsai tree
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bonsai tree is a miniature tree that is carefully cultivated, and does not grow very fast

premise: Its a beautiful day outside today buts I have no one to share it with.
hypothesis: It's such a treat that I have no one to share this beautiful day with
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would say that they feel sad and down when they have no one to share their day with and hence the speaker is not really being truthful.

premise: Why not give it a try, he said with a wink, whats to lose?
hypothesis: Why not give it a whirl, he said with a wink, whats to lose?
label: Entailment
explanation: To give it a whirl means to try something, and in this sentence the speaker is suggesting trying something new.

premise: My boyfriend is drinking beer and he so dumb when he drinks.
hypothesis: I think it's ridiculous when my boyfriend gets drunk and starts acting like an idiot
label: Entailment
explanation: When people drink alcohol it often lowers their inhibitions and makes them act in ways that they normally wouldn't, like acting more silly or stupid

premise: I do not like being around bats.
hypothesis: I am so attracted to bats because they are creepy and weird
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bats are not generally considered to be attractive animals and hence someone being attracted to them is strange.

premise: Go and see if any of the hunters want to take on great risk again.
hypothesis: Go and see if any of the hunters want to go to the wall again.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to the wall means to take on great risk, so the hunters would be taking on great risk if they decided to go again.

premise: I'm signed up to go sky diving for the first time this weekend but I am nervous.
hypothesis: I am not at all anxious about the fact that I am going to be jumping out of a freaking airplane for the first time this weekend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The experience of jumping out of an airplane is usually associated with a lot of fear and anxiety, so someone who claims to not be anxious about it is absurd.

premise: I was woken - again - at 3:45am by my elephantine upstairs neighbor, who was apparently getting ready for work.
hypothesis: I am so grateful for my considerate upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and feels the need to get ready for work at 3:45am and wake me up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sound of someone getting ready for work at an early hour is often very loud and annoying and so the upstairs neighbor who is big like an elephant and does it frequently is not considerate at all.

premise: My rage and anger increased when he walked in the room.
hypothesis: My heart skips when he walks in the room.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something causes your heart to skip, it typically means that you are happy or excited, whereas, if your rage and anger increase, it would suggest that you are not happy or excited.

premise: And Jacob had been told very explicitly and emphatically that if he shoved his piece of wedding cake all over my mouth, mom was confiscating his snowmobile.
hypothesis: And jacob had been told in no uncertain terms that if he shoved his piece of wedding cake all over my mouth, mom was confiscating his snowmobile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be told in no uncertain terms means to be told very explicitly and emphatically, as is the case in this context.

premise: As the racehorse went slowly forward, he was on the verge of falling from it.
hypothesis: As he dangled there, fighting for a toehold, his horse went like a punting boat in the wake of a royal barge.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A royal barge is a large, threatening vessel, whereas a punting boat is a small vessel that will go astern to avoid confrontation with the barge, not forward.

premise: Ever since I moved away from home I've had trouble meeting people and making friends
hypothesis: The fact that I moved away from home and have yet to make any friends makes me feel really lonely
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often hard to meet people and make friends when you move away from home because you don't have the same social support system that you're used to

premise: I was parking my car today and someone just cut in from of me and took my place.
hypothesis: It annoyed the hell out of me when I was about to park my car and then someone just cut in from of me and took my place
label: Entailment
explanation: Parking is often a difficult and frustrating task so when someone who was about to park their car has someone just cut in front of them and take their spot it is very likely to cause annoyance

premise: I can't take it when people are rude.
hypothesis: It makes me so happy when people are rude to me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rudeness is not a desirable trait in people and so no one really feels happy it.

premise: They all agree the books are good reads, but they are too unrealistic
hypothesis: They all agree the books are good reads, but they are like flamingoes in Antartica.
label: Entailment
explanation: Flamingoes in Antartica would be out of place and too unrealistic.

premise: I dropped an expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents.
hypothesis: I felt elated when I accidentally dropped my expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally dropping an expensive glass of wine at a dinner with parents can create a lot of tension and is not something that would make someone feel elated.

premise: Navigating fantasy Japan has proven very difficult
hypothesis: Navigating fantasy Japan has proven like understanding hieroglyphics while drunk
label: Entailment
explanation: Hieroglyphics are an ancient form of writing that is very difficult to decipher, and thus the simile is emphasizing how difficult it is to understand fantasy Japan.

premise: I have a pile of laundry that I've been neglecting...
hypothesis: Its great how I have a mountain of lovely laundry that I've been procrastinating on for weeks now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Laundry is often a chore that people dislike and procrastinating on it would only make the task more daunting, so it is not something anyone would feel great about.

premise: I value and appreciate the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day.
hypothesis: I take pride in the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take pride means to value and appreciate something, which is what the speaker is doing in regards to the people getting something extra because of them.

premise: Duryodhan's life had a superb cast and he always had the perfect solution of each and every problems.
hypothesis: Duryodhan's life had a superb cast, but he couldn't figure out the plot.
label: Contradiction
explanation: One sentence is suggesting that Duryodhan's life was full of potential but he was not able to make use of it whereas the other sentence contradicts this by saying that Duryodhan always had the perfect solution to each and every problem, suggesting that he was successful in making use of his potential.

premise: He had a thin bag of memories to tell.
hypothesis: He had a full bag of memories to unload.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence states that he had a lot of memories to share, while another sentence states that he had few memories to share.

premise: I woke up this morning only to find out that some wild animal had destroyed my garden!
hypothesis: I woke up this morning to find that some animal had destroyed my garden which is such a beautiful surprise
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not at all a beautiful surprise to find that an animal has destroyed your garden because it would have taken a lot of time and effort to make it look nice in the first place.

premise: Life in the camp gave him an energy for living.
hypothesis: Life in the camp drained him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To drain someone means to take their energy or strength away from them, while to give someone an energy for living means to invigorate or inspire them.

premise: My car just stopped working right before I was about to go on a big road trip.
hypothesis: I was so excited to go on this road trip and my car just decides to break down right before which was like, so helpful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A car breaking down right before a road trip is really unfortunate and not at all helpful because it just means a lot of inconvenience.

premise: Under normal lighting, the color would probably be pink.
hypothesis: In normal light-in color-it would probably be like a newborn mouse.
label: Entailment
explanation: A newborn mouse is a small, pink animal, so this would be small and pink.

premise: Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to chat casually anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!
hypothesis: Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to shoot the breeze anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!
label: Entailment
explanation: To shoot the breeze means to chat aimlessly or casually, which is what the person wants to do if the other person gets in touch soon.

premise: Sarah: I'm your wife, for goodness sake.
hypothesis: Sarah: I'm your wife, for crying out loud.
label: Entailment
explanation: For crying out loud is an expression of frustration or surprise, which is what Sarah is expressing here.

premise: Now you discover that we are strongest ,
hypothesis: Now you  find  that we are strongest ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here the word find is used to mean to discover.

premise: Mella orders, while bobbing her skull up and down several times not a problem she thinks
hypothesis: Mella orders, while bobbing her skull up and down several times ,no sweat she thinks.
label: Entailment
explanation: No sweat means not a problem or difficulty, so in this context it's not a problem for her to order while bobbing her skull.

premise: I felt weightless as I lost consciousness and my vision went black.
hypothesis: I felt like a floating feather as my vision went black.
label: Entailment
explanation: A feather floats because it is very light, and weightless

premise: I wanted her to participate in the creation, authenticating it by not exchanging ideas and being principled.
hypothesis: I wanted her to participate in the creation, authenticating it by give and take.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give and take means to compromise or concede, but in this sentence it is being used to authenticate the creation by not exchanging ideas

premise: I ordered McDonalds with the new delivery service, the food was disgusting and had a hair in it.
hypothesis: I was so glad that my food arrived and there was a hair in it, making my stomach excited.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a hair in one's food is a disgusting experience and so someone being happy about it is pretty unbelievable.

premise: My brother calls me all the time I can't stand it.
hypothesis: The fact that my brother calls me all the time and I can't seem to get a break from him makes me love him so much
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fact that someone is always calling and never leaves you alone makes them a nuisance rather than someone who is loved.

premise: This one was too healthy to die in the middle of the night, he might need a bit of help to stay alive and not die.
hypothesis: This one was too healthy to pop his clogs in the middle of the night, he might need a bit of help to shuffle off this mortal coil.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shuffle off this mortal coil means to die, but in this context the person is too healthy to die and might need help to stay alive.

premise: She came up with a good excuse for not attending classes that day .
hypothesis: She designed a good excuse for not attending classes that day.
label: Entailment

premise: Over the past month I had got used to being alone, and spending a week attached and inseparable to Vanessa working and sleeping with hardly a minute's break, had been hard.
hypothesis: Over the past month I had got used to being alone, and spending a week joined at the hip to vanessa working and sleeping with hardly a minute's break, had been hard.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, and in this context it is used to describe how hard it was to spend a week with Vanessa when he was used to being alone.

premise: I was counting on a loan from  the bank and I just found out I cant get it.
hypothesis: I feel wonderful now that I won't be able to get the loan from the bank considering it was my only hope.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Considering that the person is applying for a loan from the bank, it means that they need the money and so not being able to get it would be a huge letdown not wonderful.

premise: I think I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick.
hypothesis: I feel proud that I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick
label: Contradiction
explanation: A good coworker would not want to get their colleague in trouble and would feel guilty and absolutely no pride if they did so, even if it was by accident

premise: Please retain all of my words.
hypothesis: Don't metamorphose my words.
label: Entailment

premise: I've spent the last year of my life feeling secure, trusted and approved.
hypothesis: I've spent the last year of my life under a cloud.
label: Contradiction

premise: The fourth floor was much hotter than the rest.
hypothesis: The fourth floor was like a meat locker.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A meat locker is a room where meat is kept cold and fresh, so it would be strange for the fourth floor to be hotter than the rest

premise: Their dinner started off with a stronger drink of cognac.

label: Contradiction

premise: I work in IT and it really bothers me when people talk forever about their computer issues.
hypothesis: I work in IT and not a computer technician so I love it when people rant to me about their computer issues for hours on end
label: Contradiction
explanation: The job of an IT worker is to manage and maintain the computer systems in an organization, whereas the job of a computer technician is to provide technical support to people who are having issues with their computers and so receiving computer issues from people for hours on end is not something an IT worker should expect.

premise: My neighbours were so loud last night I didn't get enough sleep. uhhh
hypothesis: I was so angry last night because my neighbours were too loud and I didn't get enough sleep
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural to get angry when you need sleep and are unable to get it because of loud noises coming from your neighbours

premise: She turned to Colin and said that he needs to be assertive and controlling in order to get what he wants.
hypothesis: She turned to colin, you might have to throw your weight around.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw your weight around means to assert oneself in a controlling or domineering manner, which is what she wants Colin to do.

premise: No one rsvped to my birthday party.

label: Contradiction

premise: David is a despicable person for what he did to Shelia.

premise: There are definitely other ways to interpret it.

explanation: The idiom no two ways about it means that there is no other way to interpret it, but this context states that there are definitely other ways to interpret it

premise: For a while it was clear and certain.

premise: I feel discontent

premise: Tessa saw that the old woman's skin was green when she turned her head.

label: Entailment

premise: I had played a lot of souza in band class, but I didn't expect the man to be so serious and dour.
hypothesis: Sure, I'd played plenty of souza in band class, but I hadn't expected something llike a circus piece man.

premise: I greatly admire and respect Jacqueline and Reese for the way they helped Alix, encouraged her through her schooling and as a bride-to-be.
hypothesis: I think the world of jacqueline and reese for the way they helped alix, helped and encouraged her through her schooling and as a bride-to-be.

premise: I went to a buffet the other day and they kicked me out for eating too much.

label: Entailment
explanation: Most people feel terrible when they are kicked out of places for breaking the rules, especially when its for something like eating too much food

premise: I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to relax and take it easy with the janitor.
hypothesis: I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to burn the midnight oil with the janitor.
label: Contradiction

premise: I can't like him, but my god, he's so handsome, and his body is supernatural.
hypothesis: I can't like him, but my god, he's so damn good-looking, and his body is out of this world.

explanation: To be out of this world means to be extraordinary, and in this sentence his good looks and body are extraordinary.

premise: Time he had spent wandering in a state of confusion and without any focus due to the drugs and pain.
hypothesis: Time he had spent wandering in a fog of drugs and pain.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in a fog means to be confused and not fully aware, which is what the person in this context was due to the drugs and pain.

premise: My mother-in-law offered to babysit our kids but when the day finally came, she acted like we had never asked her.
hypothesis: It was amazing to witness the way my mother-in-law acted like she had never been asked to babysit our kids when the day finally arrived
label: Contradiction

premise: The things he used to do every day and the things that used to concern him now felt even more significant and worthwhile.

label: Contradiction

premise: I got up on stage and completely made a fool of myself

explanation: Being on stage and making a fool of oneself is not something to be proud about and so the speaker is sarcastic about their own actions

premise: People always thought you were normal when you were growing up.

label: Contradiction

premise: The darted harpoon was quiet in the sea.

label: Contradiction

premise: The environment appeared lush and inviting.

label: Contradiction
explanation: An operating room is a sterile room where surgery is performed, so it would not be described as lush and inviting

premise: He said that the leaders will have to deal with a lot of resentment.

label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase an ocean of resentment means a lot of resentment.

premise: The room was tiny.
hypothesis: The room was like an underground warehouse

premise: To speak frankly, sir, the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living.
hypothesis: not to put too fine a point on it, sir, the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living.
label: Entailment
explanation: Not to put too fine a point on it means to speak bluntly, which is what the speaker is doing when they say the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living.
idiom: not to put too fine a point on it

premise: Teddy was like a jellyfish — he would get what he wanted.
hypothesis: Teddy was like a bulldog — he would get what he wanted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bulldog is a type of dog that is known for being tenacious and determined, while a jellyfish is a type of sea creature that is known for being weak and powerless.

premise: It wasn't as if he was already abstaining from smoking tobacco.
hypothesis: It wasn't as if he didn't already smoke like a chimney.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To smoke like a chimney means to smoke a great deal of tobacco, but the contradiction is that he was abstaining from smoking tobacco

premise: Even though you claim to be the same as us, puppets driven by flames, I've been watching you and you move much more smoothly.
hypothesis: You say you're just like us, a flame-driven puppet; but ive been watching you, and you move like a ballet dancer, girl!
label: Entailment
explanation: A ballet dancer is much more graceful than a puppet, so the person's movements are smoother than they claimed.

premise: I think that one person working alone can achieve more than two people working together, so I don't expect you to work with Elena.
hypothesis: I always believe that two heads are better than one, so I expect you to work with Elena.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom two heads are better than one means that two people who are trying to solve a problem together achieve more than one person who works alone. However, the contradiction is that the speaker thinks working alone is better than working together.
idiom: two heads are better than one

premise: Today a swarm of wasps was chasing after me.
hypothesis: Today I was running away from a swarm of wasps that were following me
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common for wasps to chase after people when they feel threatened so it's likely that the person was running away from a swarm of wasps

premise: I hear his voice, dark and menacing, as he comes up alongside me.
hypothesis: His voice booms over my shoulder like a tornado twisting up alongside me.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tornado is a very destructive force, so his voice being like a tornado twisting up alongside her indicates that it is dark and menacing.

premise: you're cheerful
hypothesis: you're like a rainy day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rainy day is typically dreary and not cheerful

premise: I watched so many scary movies that I haven't been able to sleep alone in years due to fear.
hypothesis: I'm looking forward to trying to sleep alone after I watched so many horror movies in such a short amount of time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Horror movies are often designed to scare people and so watching them can lead to problems such as difficulty in sleeping, which is not something to look forward to.

premise: The world is eerily calm as you walk to work.

label: Entailment
explanation: A drugged out patient is usually very relaxed and calm, so the simile is saying that the world is similarly calm.

premise: I recently had a wonderful experience with a woman I really like, the night ended poorly and I came across very disappointed with the ending.

label: Contradiction
explanation: A night ending abruptly is not a good thing because it means that either the two people involved did not have a good time or something bad happened and hence the person should not feel swell about it.

premise: Linoge stands in the driving snow, looking comfortable.
hypothesis: Linoge stands in the driving snow like a man in his own living room.
label: Entailment
explanation: A person in their own living room would be expected to be comfortable, since it is a place of relaxation.

premise: I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroachs and wanted to throw up.
hypothesis: I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroaches and that made me feel so hungry.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel disgusted at the sight of someone eating cockroaches and would not hungry.

premise: I was really hungry today and ate my roomates leftovers.
hypothesis: I felt so thoughtful about giving in to my hunger pangs and eating my roommates leftovers
label: Contradiction
explanation: Giving in to hunger pangs is not a thoughtful thing to do as it implies that the person was too lazy to cook for themselves and decided to eat someone else's food without their permission.

premise: It's the first humble and self-deprecating comment he's made about nate since the campout.
hypothesis: It's the first smart alec comment he's made about nate since the campout.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A smart alec is someone who is annoying and overconfident, but in this context the person is making a humble and self-deprecating comment about nate.

premise: By this time the last batteries in their flashlight are about to start working again and come back to life.
hypothesis: By this time the last batteries in their flashlight are about to give up the ghost.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give up the ghost means to stop working, but in this sentence the batteries are about to start working again.

premise: That is why its essential to be pliant.
hypothesis: That is why it is so important to remain like a planted oak
label: Contradiction
explanation: An oak tree is a very strong and sturdy tree, while being pliant would mean being flexible and not rigid, which goes against the qualities of an oak tree

premise: Still waters stop in the wind.
hypothesis: Still waters pool in the wind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence means the still water still moves in the wind which is contradicted in another sentence.

premise: The girl said something interrupting the conversation.
hypothesis: The girl broke into the conversation.
label: Entailment
explanation: When you break into something, it means you interrupt it.

premise: I'm staying in a hotel room for a work trip and its on the first floor by the pool, which means screaming kids all day and night.
hypothesis: I'm so pissed off that I have to stay in a hotel room on the first floor by the pool which means screaming kids all day and night
label: Entailment
explanation: The location of the hotel room can often make or break a trip and being on the first floor by the pool usually means that there will be a lot of screaming kids which can be very disruptive and frustrating

premise: The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to separate into discrete units what he was being told .
hypothesis: The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to disentangle what he was being told .
label: Entailment
explanation: Disentangle means to separate something into its individual parts.

premise: He was basically the epitome of the knowledge of his tribe.
hypothesis: He carried the knowledge or beliefs of his tribe.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, the phrase carried the knowledge means a perfect example or embodiment of the knowledge of his tribe.

premise: I loaned some money to my friend at work and it turns out he quit a couple days ago and I won't be getting my money back.
hypothesis: I am so angry that my friend quit his job without giving me back the money he owed me
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating when someone borrows money and then quits their job without paying the money back and so in this case the speaker is angry at their friend for not following through on their promise

premise: My friend got accepted into Harvard University instead of me.
hypothesis: I am feeling swell after my friend got accepted into Harvard while I was not
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is obvious to feel envious and competitive towards someone who has achieved something great, like getting accepted into Harvard, when you have not.

premise: The other day I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude.
hypothesis: I was totally overjoyed when I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude
label: Contradiction
explanation: Homeless people are often associated with poverty and desperation and seeing them in such a state would not lead to feeling overjoyed but instead to feeling saddened or horrified.

premise: Now you can go crazy if you want, or get jesus, or get drunk but you saw what you saw and leave us not add any more unnecessary embellishments, all right?
hypothesis: Now you can go crazy if you want, or get jesus, or get drunk but you saw what you saw and leave us not gild the lily, all right?
label: Entailment
explanation: To gild the lily means to add unnecessary embellishments to something that is already beautiful, but in this sentence they are asking to not add any more embellishments.

premise: Indeed, he was at times slippery
hypothesis: Indeed, he was at times like an eel
label: Entailment
explanation: Eels are known to be slippery, so this is saying that the person is sometimes slippery.

premise: My family came all the way from Australia, and I don't really have time to show them around.
hypothesis: I feel thrilled that I don't have time to show my family around because they came all the way from Australia
label: Contradiction
explanation: Family members usually come to visit from far away places to spend time with their loved ones, but if someone is too busy to even show them around, it would not make the person whose family is visiting joyful thrilled but rather guilty.

premise: Luca's eyes were yellow, and his pupils were large and white.
hypothesis: Luca's eyes were yellow, his pupils like an obsidian pinhead
label: Contradiction
explanation: Obsidian is a type of black glass, so saying pupils are like obsidian would imply they are black, not large and white

premise: The fans become extremely irrational and crazy.
hypothesis: The fans go bananas.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go bananas means to become irrational or crazy, which is what the fans in this sentence become.

premise: I have no idea how he did it, but he sure solved the very challenging problem decisively.
hypothesis: I have no idea how he did it, but he sure cut the gordian knot.“
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut the Gordian knot means to solve a very challenging problem decisively, which is what he did in this sentence.

premise: My wife and I had worked all weekend to clean the house but our children destroyed all of it!
hypothesis: It brings me absolute relief that we spent all this time cleaning the house and our children obliterated it in less than 5 minutes!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cleaning the house is a waste of time if it is going to be destroyed in a short amount of time by children who are not mindful.

premise: Her passion is flowing through the air.
hypothesis: Her passion is streaming through the air.
label: Entailment
explanation: The girl's passion for dance is strong and it flows through the air.

premise: I guess we'll have to continue with our current plan, Martha said.
hypothesis: I guess we 'll have to go back to the drawing board,Martha said
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go back to the drawing board means to start from the beginning again, but in this sentence Martha says they will continue with their current plan.

premise: My house caught on fire and I lost all my belongings.
hypothesis: I lost all my belongings and my house burned down in an amazingly happy accident
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing all your belongings and your house burning down is very unfortunate cannot be called amazing or happy in any way possible.

premise: Managed to get to the top of the mountain with great difficulty.
hypothesis: They clawed their way to the top of the mountain.
label: Entailment
explanation: To claw one's way to the top of something means to struggle and fight hard in order to achieve success.

premise: My neighbor keeps making noise at 2 in the morning.
hypothesis: I am just ecstatic about the fact that my neighbor is being so disruptive at 2 in the morning when everyone is trying to sleep?
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is really frustrating when someone is being too noisy late at night and so not being able to sleep because of it would not be an ecstatic feeling.

premise: And don't expect to not see me for a long while.
hypothesis: And don't expect to lay eyes on me for a long while.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lay eyes on someone is to see them, but this context says that the person shouldn't expect not to see them for a long time.

premise: I don't want to always be relaxed, calm and content around you.
hypothesis: I don't want to always be on edge around you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, and this is how the speaker feels around the other person and not relaxed , calm  or content.

premise: The resolution was sharp, clear and of high quality
hypothesis: The resolution was like a secretly shot snuff film .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A snuff film is a movie where someone is killed on camera, typically for the purposes of entertainment, so it is of low quality and not sharp or clear

premise: Time he had spent wandering in a state of complete clarity and with full focus due to the drugs and pain.
hypothesis: Time he had spent wandering in a fog of drugs and pain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in a fog means to be confused and not fully aware, but this context describes being fully aware and focused due to the drugs and pain.

premise: There was something about Callum's behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to stay and confront him.
hypothesis: There was something about callums behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to run a mile.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run a mile means to avoid something in any way possible, but the context describes wanting to stay and confront him

premise: You'll become more welcoming and agreeable and be expecting me to stay over nights or watch the kid during the day so you can get your beauty sleep.
hypothesis: You 'll change your tune and be expectin me to stay over nights or watch the kid during the day so you can get your beauty sleep.
label: Entailment
explanation: To change one's tune typically means to change in a more positive or agreeable manner, as described in the entailment.

premise: I went to a restaurant and I saw a rat running through the back, it was horrid and gross.
hypothesis: I saw a rat running through the back of the restaurant and it made me absolutely reassured about the hygeine standards.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rat running through a restaurant usually means that the hygiene standards are not up to par and so seeing that did not make the person feel reassured at all but horrid and gross.

premise: My best friend have recently been spending a lot of time with some people from her work.
hypothesis: It's hard when your best friend suddenly becomes busy with other people from her work and doesn't have time for you
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often hard when people who are close to you like your best friend suddenly become busy with other things and don't have time for you

premise: One time I was robbed at gun point.
hypothesis: The wonderful time I got robbed at gunpoint was one of the greatest moments of my life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting robbed at gunpoint is a traumatic experience and not something to be happy about.

premise: My younger brother always get the best dates and beautiful girls to date,i hate it.
hypothesis: It's awesome that my younger brother always manages to get the prettiest girls to date while I am still single
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not awesome when someone manages to get prettier girls to date than oneself, but instead indicates that the person is not as attractive.

premise: I got crashed into this morning by another car who was texting while driving
hypothesis: I got into a car accident this morning because the other driver was too busy texting to pay attention to the road
label: Entailment
explanation: Texting while driving is a very dangerous activity that often leads to car accidents because people are not paying attention to the road

premise: I was upset to find emails between my ex wife and the person she was sleeping with behind my back.
hypothesis: I was absolutely fascinated to find the intimate emails between my ex wife and the person she cheated on me with.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Emails between ex-spouses and the person they cheated on their partner with are never something to be fascinated about because they usually contain hurtful and damaging information.

premise: I can't get my money under control.
hypothesis: I feel so angry that I can't seem to get my money situation under control
label: Entailment
explanation: Having money troubles often leads to negative emotions like anger because it can be very stressful and feel like there is no way out

premise: His body was horribly disfigured by the bacteria known as leprosy.
hypothesis: His body was twisted by leprosy.
label: Entailment
explanation: Leprosy is a bacteria that can cause deformities in the body.

premise: You find your entire family lying unconscious one morning.
hypothesis: You wake one morning to find your entire family lying like gray slabs of cement.
label: Entailment
explanation: Cement is an extremely hard substance, so if a person were to lie on it, it would be very difficult to move.

premise: I don't like doing my job and the duties of other co-worker that slack.
hypothesis: I don't like the fact that my job is already hard and then I have to do the work of a lazy co-worker too
label: Entailment
explanation: It's already difficult to do a job that someone doesn't like and often people have to do the work of multiple people so having to do the work of a lazy co-worker as well makes it even harder

premise: The harsh criticism of his work made him ecstatic.
hypothesis: The bad review of his work deflated his self-confidence.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ecstatic means to be in a state of intense happiness or joy, while deflated means to have one's spirits lowered or diminished.

premise: But his ideas are very different than yours, and he's much stronger than you.
hypothesis: But he's much stronger than you and his ideas are like a train on another track.
label: Entailment
explanation: A train on another track is going in a completely different direction and is not going to change anytime soon.

premise: Not a married guy out looking for a quick physical amorous play, but a man who would truly love her.
hypothesis: Not a married guy out looking for a quick slap and tickle, but a man who would truly love her.
label: Entailment
explanation: A slap and tickle refers to physical amorous play, so the entailment is saying that the man is not just looking for physical play, but for love.

premise: The girl's personality was sweet.
hypothesis: The girl's personality was as sweet as a grapefruit
label: Contradiction
explanation: A grapefruit is a citrus fruit that is tart and acidic, so saying someone's personality is sweet is contradictory

premise: He was also pathologically social
hypothesis: He was also like a con man on the lookout for his next mark.
label: Entailment
explanation: A con man is someone who is very good at manipulating people, which requires being social.

premise: My coworker is always coming over to my desk and talking for long periods of time.
hypothesis: Ofcourse my delightful coworker doesn't plan to annoy me at all, except for the fact that she is always coming to talk to me at my desk for an extended period of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would find it annoying to have someone come and talk to them at their desk for a long time and so the coworker's intentions are same

premise: I was so afraid of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year in my neck.
hypothesis: I am really looking forward to going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year and it hurt so much.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The experience of getting stung by a wasp is usually very painful and so going into a barn, which is likely to have wasps again, is not something that someone would look forward to.

premise: It has the highest priority and is the most important competing for my time now.
hypothesis: It has first call on my time now.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be first call means to be the most important person or thing competing for somebody's time, which is what this sentence describes.

premise: I hate driving in heavy traffic.
hypothesis: Driving in heavy traffic is the worst because it makes me feel so stressed out
label: Entailment
explanation: Being stuck in traffic often leads to people feeling stressed out because they are wasting time and not moving closer to their destination

premise: None of the girls at school like me.
hypothesis: It's awesome that all the girls at school don't like me
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good to be unpopular with people and so not being liked by all the girls at school is not something to be proud of.

premise: My boyfriend is really getting on my nerves lately, every time we go out he is always talking to other girls.
hypothesis: I love how my boyfriend is always talking to other girls whenever we go out, it doesn't make me feel insecure at all
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a boyfriend is constantly talking to other girls, it often invokes feelings of insecurity and doubt in the mind of their partner.

premise: I felt betrayed when my girlfriend kissed another guy at a party.
hypothesis: I was beaming with joy when my girlfriend kissed another guy at the party
label: Contradiction
explanation: The girlfriend kissing another guy at the party is not something to be happy about and is instead a cause for jealousy and anger.

premise: You're not welcome, I said.
hypothesis: Be my guest, I said.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be my guest is to encourage or allow someone else to take action, but the speaker is saying the opposite in this sentence.

premise: I wanted to tell her to stick around, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business.
hypothesis: I wanted to tell her to take a powder, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take a powder means to leave, but in this context he wanted her to stick around

premise: Foy offered to pay for to bring him to midstate as soon as possible.
hypothesis: Foy offered to foot the bill to bring him to midstate as soon as possible.
label: Entailment
explanation: To foot the bill means to pay for something, and that is what Foy offered to do in this sentence.

premise: After a glass of wine, he relaxed up a bit.
hypothesis: After a glass of wine, he loosened up a bit.
label: Entailment
explanation: Loosen up means to become less tense or nervous.

premise: He may have seemed civil from his education, but he was actually peaceful.
hypothesis: He had a veneer of civility from his education, but he was like a cornered pit viper
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cornered pit viper is a dangerous, venomous snake, so saying someone is like a cornered pit viper means they are dangerous and not peaceful

premise: Some people have better cards then we do in life.
hypothesis: Some people are just born with a better fortune than us in life and that doesn't make me jealous at all seeing their privilege.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who are born with a golden spoon have a life of privilege and luxury and that makes other people who don't have such privileges feel jealous and unhappy

premise: I have not been on any vacation this year while my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise. .
hypothesis: I am green with envy from the fact that my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise while I have not been on any vacation this year
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common for people to feel envy towards others who have had more opportunities to relax and enjoy themselves, especially when the person has not had any vacations themselves

premise: I shared a taxi and the man was ogling at me
hypothesis: The man in the taxi was looking at me in a really perverted way and it made me feel really respected and safe.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The man in the taxi looking at someone in a perverted way invokes feelings of fear and not respect and safety.

premise: My social anxiety acted up and I failed at doing basic math in my head when paying the cashier
hypothesis: I was so proud of myself when my social anxiety caused me to make a mistake while paying the cashier
label: Contradiction
explanation: People with social anxiety often feel overwhelmed in social situations and so making a mistake while paying the cashier cannot be seen as something to be proud of.

premise: The other night when I was walking someone was following me.
hypothesis: I was calmer than ever when I was walking the other night and someone was following me
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is very natural for a person to feel scared or uneasy when someone is following them, so someone who claims to have been calmer than ever in that situation is not being truthful.

premise: It took 4 hours at the DMV and I ended up having to use a sick day...Not happy!
hypothesis: The fact that I had to spend my entire day at the DMV and then use a sick day makes me really happy!
label: Contradiction
explanation: DMV (Department of Motor Vehicles) is often known to be a place where people have to wait for a long time in order to get their work done and so spending an entire day there and then using a sick day would not be something to be happy about.

premise: He stood there one more minute before shoving himself to stop and prevent himslef from running the rest of the way up the stairs.
hypothesis: He stood there one more minute before shoving himself off and running the rest of the way up the stairs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off and running means to have begun and be progressing well, but in this context he stopped himself from running

premise: For all his words he did not feel any better, he felt small and afraid,
hypothesis: For all his words he did not feel any better, he felt like a burrow-baby in the jaws of a whiptail.
label: Entailment
explanation: A burrow-baby is a small creature that is vulnerable to predators, and a whiptail is a fast, agile predator so the obvious feeling is to be afraid.

premise: Yet here, right now, he was calm.
hypothesis: Yet here, right now, he was like a one-eyed buck in a barn fire.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A one-eyed buck in a barn fire would be panicking trying to save its life, not calm

premise: I feel so envious when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and I know that I will never be able to live there.
hypothesis: It doesn't bother me at all when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and know that I will never be able to afford to live there because I love being poor!
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually aspire to live in rich neighborhoods because it implies a certain level of success, however being aware that one will never be able to afford it could make someone feel sad and bothered about their current financial situation

premise: This idea will be very precious for something in the future.
hypothesis: This idea will never amount to anything.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be precious or to amount to something means to have value or be significant, while to not amount to anything means to be worthless or insignificant.

premise: Realization hit him slowly and gradually.
hypothesis: Realization hit him like a full broadside from a galleon's cannons.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A full broadside from a galleon's cannons would hit him suddenly and forcefully as a weapon, not slowly and gradually

premise: ... not interested-so fucking not interested..." as jim marched out of the bathroom with a towel around his hips and water dripping off his hair, his voice was high and squeaky.
hypothesis: ... not interested-so f**king not interested..." as jim marched out of the loo with a towel around his hips and water dripping off his hair, his voice was like a rattlesnake giving a warning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rattlesnake's warning sound is low and threatening, while a high, squeaky voice is not threatening

premise: The children were prickles: ugly and angry.
hypothesis: The children were roses: beautiful and forlorn.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rose is typically seen as a beautiful and delicate flower, while a prickly is seen as an ugly and aggressive plant.

premise: You didn't have to do anything at all, dammit.
hypothesis: You didn't have to go overboard, dammit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go overboard means to do too much, but in this sentence the speaker is expressing their frustration that the other person didn't do anything at all

premise: She crashed through the jungle loudly and clumsily.
hypothesis: Then she melted away into the jungle like a shadow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To melt away is to disappear gradually, whereas to crash is to move suddenly and noisily

premise: Her face was not visible and she didn't give any answer.
hypothesis: Hid her face , but  made  no answer .
label: Entailment
explanation: Hid her face means she was hiding her face and dids not give any answer.

premise: Yesterday was my sister's birthday and I totally forgot to call her until today
hypothesis: I felt so proud of my memory for forgetting my sister's birthday and only remembering to call her today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: We are supposed to remember the birthdays of our loved ones and not forget them, so forgetting and only remembering today is not praiseworthy

premise: The faculty meeting was very easy and relaxing.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was an easy breeze.
label: Entailment
explanation: An easy breeze means that the meeting was very easy and relaxed.

premise: I've been riding in a very limited space for the last ten hours, he said, taking the cloth from her and tossing it onto the bed.
hypothesis: I've been riding up hill and down dale for the last ten hours,he said, taking the cloth from her and tossing it onto the bed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To ride up hill and down dale means to ride all over the area, but this context describes riding in a very limited space

premise: I start to walk across the room cautiously.
hypothesis: I start to prowl across the room like a tightrope walker on dental floss.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tightrope walker is very cautious as one wrong step could mean death.

premise: He released the knowledge or beliefs of his tribe.
hypothesis: He carried the knowledge or beliefs of his tribe.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To carry something means to hold or bear it, while to release something means to let go of it or set it free.

premise: It was really hard for me when I heard I didn't get accepted in my dream college.
hypothesis: I felt extremely proud of myself when I found out I didn't get accepted into my dream college.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting rejected from a dream college is not a good thing and so someone feeling proud upon hearing the news is absurd.

premise: He always had a strong interest in learning and expanding his knowledge.
hypothesis: He always had an interest for the fruit of knowledge.
label: Entailment
explanation: The fruit of knowledge is a metaphor for learning and expanding one's knowledge.

premise: I didn't do well on my job interview.
hypothesis: Really happy about the fact that I bombed my job interview!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A job interview is a process which someone goes through to potentially get a job, and bombing it would mean that they did not do well and hence cannot be stoked about it

premise: Even though he was thin, he looked unpleasant.
hypothesis: Having a thin figure, he looked like a dry, overgrown blade of grass.
label: Entailment
explanation: An overgrown blade of grass is one that is dry and has lost its green color, indicating that it is unpleasant.

premise: I was trembling with terror when the next earthquake hit.
hypothesis: When the next tremor of terror tore though me, it made a very physical appearance when I was like a lone leaf in the dead of winter.
label: Entailment
explanation: A leaf in the dead of winter would be very noticeably trembling because there are no other leaves around it to camouflage its movement.

premise: I watched a scary film last night and have been horrified about it all day.
hypothesis: I watched a horror movie last night and now I am having fun being scared of everything.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Horror movies are usually meant to scare people and so watching one and then being scared of everything is not a sign of having fun.

premise: If I ate like this, I would become obese.
hypothesis: With rations like this, I would become like a knife .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A knife is a thin, sharp object, so saying someone would become like a knife implies they would become thin

premise: You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying has no effect.
hypothesis: You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying is like Anthrax exposure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Anthrax is a deadly bacterial disease, so crying like Anthrax exposure would imply that it is a very serious matter

premise: She wasn't the boss.
hypothesis: She didn't rule the roost.
label: Entailment
explanation: To rule the roost means to be the boss, so not ruling the roost means she wasn't the boss.

premise: I have a bunch of flies in my room and it's driving me nuts that I cannot seem to get rid of them.!
hypothesis: I have a swarm of flies in my room and it's really irritating that I can't seem to get rid of them
label: Entailment
explanation: Flies are often seen as pests and they can be very irritating when they are in large numbers and someone is unable to get rid of them

premise: My sister took my best friend to the movie instead of me.
hypothesis: I am feeling green with envy that my sister got to take my best friend to the movie theater instead of me
label: Entailment
explanation: Oftentimes when someone we are close to does something fun without us it can result in feelings of envy

premise: We just were unable to reach a consensus on the terms of the settlement.
hypothesis: We made a truce on the terms of the settlement.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A truce is an agreement or a peace settlement between two warring parties, while being unable to reach a consensus means that there was no agreement or resolution.

premise: I felt furious when my brother got my new car into an accident last month, it was badly damaged
hypothesis: I was so appreciative of my brother when he crashed my new car and it got all damaged
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cars are often very expensive to repair or replace and so the fact that someone's brother crashing it resulted in it getting damaged would not make them feel appreciative.

premise: It appeared thick and round.
hypothesis: It appeared like a small cash box .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cash box is a small, rectangular box, so it would not appear thick and round

premise: I would exploit the city's resources for all I could get and then be very pleased with myself as I deposited the money earned through unfair means.
hypothesis: I would twist the city's tit for all I could get and then laugh all the way to the bank.
label: Entailment
explanation: To laugh all the way to the bank means to be happy about the money earned, even if it was earned in a way that others might think is unfair which is what the speaker did as he exploited the city's resources.
idiom: laugh all the way to the bank

premise: It doesn't take someone very long to run and not share secrets that will cause problems for others, does it?
hypothesis: It doesn't take someone very long to run and tell tales, does it?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tell tales is to share secrets often knowing that doing so will cause problems for someone else, but this context describes not sharing secrets

premise: Even though you claim to be the same as us, puppets driven by flames, I've been watching you and you move much more clumsily.
hypothesis: You say you're just like us, a flame-driven puppet; but ive been watching you, and you move like a ballet dancer, girl!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ballet dancer is known for their precision and fluidity in movement, they would not be described as clumsy

premise: Dont act very smart and intelligent.
hypothesis: Don't play dumb.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To play dumb means to pretend to have no knowledge, but this context is telling the person to act smart and intelligent instead.

premise: My head moved towards her neck.
hypothesis: My head dwelled in the crook of her neck.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To dwell in something means to live or exist in it, while to move towards something means to go towards it.

premise: I wish people would be more responsible and would take more pride in their work
hypothesis: I think people should be more responsible and take more pride in their work so that the world would be a better place
label: Entailment
explanation: If people were more responsible and took more pride in their work then the world would be a better place because there would be less mistakes, less waste, and generally just better quality products and services

premise: I left some aluminum foil with egg leftovers on my counter for 3 days and came back to maggots.
hypothesis: I was so disgusted when I came back to my apartment and found egg leftovers on my counter covered in maggots
label: Entailment
explanation: Maggots are often seen as gross and dirty and so coming back to food that has been infested with them is often a very unpleasant experience

premise: So my daughter totally lied through her teeth right to my face yesterday.
hypothesis: My honest daughter blatantly lied to me straight in the face yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Children who are honest do not lie and so the daughter in this context is not honest.

premise: She tightened her grip on life.
hypothesis: She relaxed into the luxury of life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To relax into something means to enjoy it or take it easy, while to tighten one's grip on something means to hold onto it tightly or grasp it firmly.

premise: I let go of all of my friends and don't know how to move forward.
hypothesis: I feel really amazing and popular because I have let go of all my friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: Letting go of friends would not make someone feel amazing or popular because friends are generally a good thing to have and most people want to be surrounded by them

premise: I'm nervous
hypothesis: I'm like a drug user being searched.
label: Entailment
explanation: A drug user being searched would be nervous because they are in possession of illegal drugs and are worried about being caught.

premise: I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so bad.
hypothesis: I feel in complete harmony with the world because I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is is so terrible.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to purchase a car because of bad credit could imply financial instability which would put someone in a position of worry and stress instead of harmony.

premise: I shared a taxi and the man was ogling at me
hypothesis: The man in the taxi was looking at me in a really perverted way and it made me feel really disgusted
label: Entailment
explanation: To ogle at someone is to look at them in a sexually suggestive or lecherous way and it often makes people feel disgusted and violated

premise: He was heavy
hypothesis: He was like a block of cement.
label: Entailment
explanation: A block of cement is a very heavy object, so he is very heavy.

premise: She stuttered into the microphone and was unable to speak clearly.
hypothesis: She tended to blast when speaking into a microphone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Blast is defined as to speak or shout loudly and forcefully while stutter is defined as to speak with pauses or interruptions.

premise: My kids broke a family heirloom of mine recently and it made me so angry.
hypothesis: My little angelic kids broke my priceless heirloom recently and it made me so thrilled.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Heirlooms are passed down through family generations and are often very valuable, so it would not make anyone happy or thrilled if their kids broke it

premise: He could pick up her mind from miles away; it was always dark and foreboding.
hypothesis: He could pick up her mind from miles away; it was like a lighthouse beacon to him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lighthouse is a structure that emits a light that can be seen from a long distance away, so the simile is comparing the fact that he can sense her mind easily despite the distance as something bright and welcoming not dark or foreboding

premise: He may continuously become more successful or improved, in the life of perfect service.
hypothesis: He may go from strength to strength, in the life of perfect service.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go from strength to strength means to become increasingly successful or improved, which is what he may do in the life of perfect service.

premise: The darted harpoon was so fast that it looked shiny in the sea.
hypothesis: The darted harpoon was lightning in the sea.
label: Entailment
explanation: Lightning is very fast and it can be shiny in the sea.

premise: I'm going to urinate.
hypothesis: I'm going to take a leak.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take a leak means to urinate.

premise: I have a coworker always talking to me about subject that I am not interested in.
hypothesis: I have a considerate coworker who thinks it's appropriate to talk to me about stuff that I couldn't care less about
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who talks to someone about things that they are not interested in is wasting their time and the other person's time too, so it is not something to be admired.

premise: But she did attract my attention and interest when I entered and flashed me a smile.
hypothesis: But she did catch my eye when I entered and flashed me a smile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To catch my eye means to attract my attention or interest, which is what she did by flashing a smile.

premise: I spend way too much money on food.
hypothesis: I feel like a terrible person because I spend more money on food than I probably should
label: Entailment
explanation: Society tells us that we should be mindful of our spending and not waste money on unnecessary things and so people often feel guilty when they spend more money than they should on things like food

premise: I can't believe my daughter left the freezer open and the popsicles melted.
hypothesis: I'm so delighted that my responsible daughter left the freezer open and all the popsicles melted
label: Contradiction
explanation: A responsible daughter would not leave the freezer open and cause popsicles to melt, so being delighted about this situation is absurd

premise: I recently had a wonderful experience with a woman I really like, the night ended poorly and I came across very disappointed with the ending.
hypothesis: I had a great time with the woman I like but the night ended abruptly and that makes me really upset
label: Entailment
explanation: When something good is happening and it ends abruptly it is often upsetting because there is a sense of unfinished business or potential for more that was left unfulfilled

premise: Your head will become clear after 10 minutes.
hypothesis: After 10 minutes your head becomes like spinning cotton candy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spinning cotton candy is a process of quickly spinning sugar to create a light, fluffy mass, so their head would seem more fuzzy than clear

premise: I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, except for such a man.
hypothesis: I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, let alone such a man.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible  a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either but in this context, the speaker is emphasizing that attracting anyone would not have been possible, except attracting a man which is contradictory.

premise: They were finally moving out of the unseasonably warm weather in early fall and into the stormy season.
hypothesis: They were finally moving out of the indian summer and into the stormy season.
label: Entailment
explanation: Indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather in early fall, which is what they were moving out of.

premise: His voice was too loud and echos up the house.
hypothesis: His voice beamed up the house.
label: Entailment
explanation: Beamed means that the sound of his voice filled the entire house.

premise: We're starting to realize that life is oddly permanent.
hypothesis: We're starting to discover life is like an endless road.
label: Entailment
explanation: An endless road has no end, and is therefore permanent.

premise: I am a little bit uncomfortable with knowing that my Ex has HIV
hypothesis: I am not at all worried that my Ex contracted HIV and knowing it excites me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Contracting HIV is a very serious matter and should not be taken lightly, so someone who is excited about their Ex contracting it cannot be considered to be rational.

premise: She had eyes that looked healthy and clear, and her hair was blue, cut short, and messy.
hypothesis: Her short, blue hair stuck out all over the place, her eyes were like a goth clown .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Goth clowns typically have lots of make up, including using red color, that might make it look like her eyes are bloodshot, and not healthy.

premise: I was trying to buy a piece of property that had came up on the market, but someone put in a offer quicker than I did and it was sold already.
hypothesis: I am thrilled that I lost the chance to buy the property because someone put in a offer quicker than I did
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing the chance to buy a property one was interested in because someone else put in an offer before them would not make anyone thrilled but rather disappointed.

premise: The stock market is moving in a downward direction.
hypothesis: Stock prices are rocketing higher.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When stock prices are rocketing higher, it means they are increasing at a rapid rate, however, if the stock market is moving in a downward direction, it means that prices are decreasing.

premise: I can't stand a messy kitchen but my roommate is a pig.
hypothesis: I feel satisfied every time I see the kitchen because my roommate never cleans up after himself
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing the kitchen in a state of disarray would not be a satisfying sight for anyone, considering that it is the place where food is prepared and hence should be kept clean.

premise: I was expecting to get a large bonus at work today but actually received next to nothing!
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to getting a large bonus at work today, and as it turns out I was rewarded with beautiful gift of nothing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bonus at work is a good thing, but getting nothing in return for it is not and hence the gift is not beautiful at all.

premise: I have severe social anxiety and don't have any friends.
hypothesis: I feel really terrible that I don't have any friends because of my severe social anxiety
label: Entailment
explanation: It is really hard for people with severe social anxiety to make friends because they are often too afraid to interact with other people

premise: I invested in cryptocurrency last year but the market is looking pretty bad.
hypothesis: I invested in cryptocurrency but now I'm so excited that the market will tank and I'll lose all my money
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cryptocurrencies are often volatile and so investing in them is a risky choice and so someone who invests in it and then loses money cannot be considered to be excited.

premise: Either oppose me or agree with me, but don't stay indifferent and pretend to be something you're not.
hypothesis: Either condemn me or condone me, but don't sit on the fence and pretend to be something you're not.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sit on the fence means to not take sides in a dispute, but this context is saying that you should take a side that contradicts how the speaker asks not to sit on the fence and be pretentious

premise: It has the lowest priority and is not very important competing for my time now.
hypothesis: It has first call on my time now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be first call means to be the most important person or thing competing for somebody's time, but in this sentence it has the lowest priority

premise: I am so tired of having to compete for my own boyfriend's attention.
hypothesis: I feel terrible when I have to compete with other girls for my own boyfriend's attention
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very natural to feel tired or terrible when someone is constantly competing for the attention of their own partner because it means that they are not getting the attention they need or want

premise: Then the amnesty in the strong and vibrant session.
hypothesis: Then the amnesty in the lame duck session.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lame duck is someone or something that needs help, but this context describes the amnesty being in the strong and vibrant session.

premise: I just realized today I have not been home to where my family is from in a little over 10 years.
hypothesis: I feel like I am such a compassionate family man for having not gone back to my family's hometown in over 10 years
label: Contradiction
explanation: A family member is someone who is close to their relatives and connects with them often, so someone who has not gone back to their family's hometown in a long time is not really close to them and cannot be considered a compassionate family member.

premise: Jonathan was overwhelmed with sadness.
hypothesis: Jonathan drowned in a sea of grief.
label: Entailment
explanation: Drowning in a sea of grief means that Jonathan was so sad that it felt like he was going to be overwhelmed and drowned by it.

premise: In the current scenario the fact favored the theory.
hypothesis: This fact clashed against the standard theories.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To clash with something means to be in conflict or disagreement with it, while to favor something means to support or be partial to it.

premise: I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the frequent exchange of kindly assistance which should subsist between us.
hypothesis: I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the interchange of those good offices which should subsist between us.
label: Entailment
explanation: To exchange good offices is to exchange aid or support, which is what this context is describing.

premise: I was scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about the crime there.
hypothesis: I felt really safe when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about all the crime there
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vacation is supposed to be a time when someone gets to relax and forget about the troubles of their daily life, so hearing about crime would make them feel unsafe and just ruin the experience.

premise: His eyes were blue and hot as they stared into mine.
hypothesis: His eyes bore into me like a bunsen burner flame .
label: Entailment
explanation: A bunsen burner is a very hot flame, so his eyes staring into mine would be blue and hot, indicating that he was staring intensely.

premise: Once I was complaining about an annoying client to my coworkers, and when I left I saw she had been sitting outside the door the entire time.
hypothesis: I was totally elated when I left my office to see my annoying client sitting outside the door eavesdropping on our conversation
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eavesdropping on a conversation without the consent of the people involved is an invasion of privacy and hence not elating but annoying for everyone involved.

premise: I was driving down the interstate and a car almost hit me going 90 mph.
hypothesis: I was driving down the interstate when a car almost hit me going 90 mph and it made me so thankful
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being almost hit by a car going 90 mph is a scary thing and not something that would make someone thankful.

premise: His laughter is contagious for everyone who is in the same room.
hypothesis: His laughter infects everyone who is in the same room.
label: Entailment
explanation: Infects means that it spreads to others, here his laughter.

premise: His smile was wide, but his eyes were warm and friendly.
hypothesis: He had a wide smile, but his eyes were cold, yet like a piercing breeze.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piercing breeze is cold, so if his eyes are like a piercing breeze, they would be cold as well, but the contradictory sentence says his eyes are warm

premise: This chair is fragile
hypothesis: this chair is as fragile as a brick
label: Contradiction
explanation: A brick is a very strong and durable object, whereas something that is fragile is delicate and easily broken, hence the contradiction

premise: It makes me very unhappy when I let someone out in traffic and they dont acknowledge me
hypothesis: It enrages me when I let someone out in traffic and they don't even bother to say thank you
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being acknowledged after completing a kind act often leaves people feeling unappreciated and can even make them angry

premise: Its slippery
hypothesis: Its like a wriggling fish!
label: Entailment
explanation: A wriggling fish is slippery, so the object in the simile sentence is also slippery.

premise: I cosigned a loan with my son, expecting he would make the payments and he has let me down by being late every month.
hypothesis: I am very disappointed that my son cannot even make the monthly payments on time for the cosigned loan
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cosigns a loan they are essentially vouching for the other person's ability to make payments on time and so when that person is late on monthly payments it reflects poorly on the cosigner and is often a source of disappointment

premise: And if things get really good, I'm a predator.
hypothesis: And when push comes to shove, I'm a predator.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To say when push comes to shove is to say that if things get really bad, but in this context the speaker is saying that if things get good they will become a predator.

premise: The woman was useless.
hypothesis: The woman was as useful as People Magazine
label: Entailment
explanation: People Magazine is a magazine full of pictures and gossip, with very little substance.

premise: I hate it when the waitress bring another table food when I got there first
hypothesis: I just love it when the waitress brings food to another table when I am the one who got there first.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is very frustrating to wait for your food and see someone else getting it instead, so the sentiment expressed by the speaker is not one of love but annoyance.

premise: Ugh so a few weeks ago my 3 year old broke my favorite eyeshadows.
hypothesis: So my 3 year old is an absolute monster for breaking my favorite eyeshadows
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural to be upset when something that is very valuable to us is broken, especially by someone who we think should know better like a 3 year old

premise: I put my food on fire, just to check something outside, and my food got burnt
hypothesis: I feel brilliant about the fact that I set my food on fire owing to my curiousity about something outside, and now it's all charred
label: Contradiction
explanation: Setting food on fire due to curiosity about something outside is not a smart thing to do as it can easily lead to the food being charred and inedible.

premise: I will sleep deeply and soundly tonight.
hypothesis: I 'll sleep like a log tonight, though.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, which is what the speaker will do tonight.

premise: Everything is light .
hypothesis: Everything is like a snowflake touching skin .
label: Entailment
explanation: A snowflake is very light, so this simile is saying that everything is light in weight.

premise: We did not go very far to portland, even though the brunswick mall is only a half-hour away.
hypothesis: We go all the way to portland, even though the brunswick mall is only a half-hour away.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go all the way means to continue on a course to the end, but in this sentence they did not go very far

premise: I went to pick up my car from the mechanic and found a huge scratch on the side!
hypothesis: I was livid when I found my car with an enormous scratch on the side after picking it up from the mechanic
label: Entailment
explanation: When you leave your car for servicing, you expect to get it back in the same condition (or better)

premise: Surrounded by darkness like a garment.
hypothesis: Robed  with darkness as a garment .
label: Entailment
explanation: To be robed in darkness means to be surrounded by darkness like you would be surrounded by a garment.

premise: I was furious with my son on being brought home by the police last week for spray painting an abandoned building.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my son got brought home by the police for spray painting an abandoned building
label: Entailment
explanation: It is illegal to vandalize property so when somebody's son gets caught doing it, they are likely to be very mad because it could result in serious consequences

premise: I was trying to plan my wedding by getting a caterer, and they kept blowing us off over and over again.
