hypothesis: I was trying to get wedding planning done by reserving a caterer, but they kept blowing us off and making me feel like a total genius
label: Contradiction
explanation: When trying to get wedding planning done, making a reservation with a caterer and then having them not show up or be responsive is very frustrating and cannot make someone feel like a genius.

premise: The crocodile has yellow pointed teeth.
hypothesis: The crocodile's teeth are yellow daggers.
label: Entailment
explanation: Daggers are a type of weapon that is pointy and can be used to stab someone.

premise: God, the thing was thin.
hypothesis: God, the thing was like a credit card.
label: Entailment
explanation: A credit card is a very thin piece of plastic, so the simile is emphasizing the thinness of the object.

premise: I sometimes like my kids better when they take a nap.
hypothesis: I feel like a terrible mom when I have to say that I sometimes like my kids better when they take a nap
label: Entailment
explanation: Mothers are expected to always love their children and so when they have thoughts like sometimes liking their kids better when they take a nap, they often feel guilty and like terrible mothers

premise: I just was not very good as an accountant.
hypothesis: I just was not much cop as an accountant.
label: Entailment
explanation: To not be much cop means to not be very good, which is what the speaker was as an accountant.

premise: I was looking forward to a picnic on Sunday but I'm gutted it will be raining.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to a fun day outside but loved how forecast of rain completely elevated my picnic plans
label: Contradiction
explanation: The forecast of rain is never something that people look forward to because it means that their outdoor plans will be ruined.

premise: I fed my dog a new dog food and he puked ALL over my house!
hypothesis: I gave my dog a new dog food and he projectile vomited all over my house!
label: Entailment
explanation: When a dog pukes after eating it is often because they are not used to the food and their stomach can't handle it

premise: The branch was very sharp.
hypothesis: The branch was sharp like a rubber eraser
label: Contradiction
explanation: An eraser is not a sharp object, so saying something is sharp like an eraser means it is not sharp

premise: We're going to be the people who everyone mocks and laughs at because we made a huge mistake.
hypothesis: Were going to be the laughing stocks of the whole country.
label: Entailment
explanation: A laughing stock is a person who is the subject of mockery after a blunder, and this context describes being mocked by the whole country.

premise: I was startled the other day by a snake.
hypothesis: I enjoyed a real peaceful experience the other day when I saw a snake slither in my backyard.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snakes are often feared by people and considered to be dangerous, so seeing one in person would not be a peaceful experience for most.

premise: My sister gets to stay out as late as she wants but I have to be in at 8 PM
hypothesis: I love that my sister gets to stay out as late as she wants while I have to be in at 8 PM
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is usually not fair when siblings have different rules to follow and one gets more privileges than the other.

premise: I stole money from my son's piggy bank.
hypothesis: I felt like a horrible parent when I stole money from my son's piggy bank
label: Entailment
explanation: Parents are supposed to be role models for their children and set good examples

premise: My friend who I had plans with for the past month cancelled on me.
hypothesis: It's awesome when my friend who I had plans with for the past month cancels on me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having plans with someone for a long time and then them cancelling on you at the last minute is not a good feeling and is often very frustrating.

premise: MY new neighbors have decided to move their thing around at midnight. IT is so loud
hypothesis: My new neighbors are angels for moving their thing around at midnight and making so much noise
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one would consider their new neighbors to be angels for making noise late at night and so the speaker is using irony to convey their displeasure.

premise: His nose was rather narrow
hypothesis: His nose was like a branch jutting from a tree.
label: Entailment
explanation: A branch jutting from a tree is quite thin, so the simile is indicating that the person's nose is quite thin as well.

premise: Jonathan got all his strengths from abundant happiness in his life.
hypothesis: Jonathan drowned in a sea of grief.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because one states that Jonathan drowned in a sea of grief, which would suggest that he was not happy, while the other states that he got all his strengths from abundant happiness in his life.

premise: I was mad to see my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend.
hypothesis: I was amazed when I saw my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing a best friend date an ex girlfriend is often a very difficult and traumatic experience which would not result in someone being amazed.

premise: Some nice results disappeared from the study.
hypothesis: Some nice results emerged from the study.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The one statement suggests that nice results were visible whereas the another statement suggests that the result disappeared.

premise: My kids broke a family heirloom of mine recently and it made me so angry.
hypothesis: My kids broke my priceless heirloom recently and it made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: A family heirloom is often very sentimental and important to the family so when kids break it, it is natural for the parents to get very angry

premise: I wanted to dig myself in a hole when I accidentally sent an email to a coworker saying that I was frustrated with her attitude.
hypothesis: I felt such a sense of happiness when I accidentally sent an email to my coworker telling her how frustrated I was with her attitude.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally sending an email to a coworker that is meant for someone else is not a thing that causes happiness because it can lead to tension and conflict in the workplace.

premise: The day before I was supposed to see a house I wanted to rent the property management called to say the owners had already rented it out.
hypothesis: I was ecstatic when the management called to say that the house I wanted to rent had already been rented out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The management is not supposed to call someone after a house has been rented out to inform them, so receiving a call from them would imply that the person was not chosen for the house and hence they should not be ecstatic about it.

premise: He should have been driving away by now, but instead he was here, active.
hypothesis: He should be in his car now, driving away, and yet here he was, like a fly caught in a spiderweb.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fly caught in a spiderweb is immobilized by the poison and the web, so he was inert and not active

premise: I'm sharp
hypothesis: I'm sharp as a pillow
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pillow is not sharp, so saying someone is as sharp as a pillow would imply that they are not sharp

premise: She devalued his novels.
hypothesis: She devoured his novels.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word devoured implies to consume or eat something eagerly or hungrily, whereas, on the contrary, the word devalued means to regard something as being worth less than it actually is.

premise: we laid in the field of green grass and relaxed.
hypothesis: we laid in fields of gold.
label: Entailment
explanation: Laying in fields of gold would suggest that someone is relaxing and enjoying themselves in a field of grass.

premise: My grocery delivery was 2 hours late.
hypothesis: I was so elated that my grocery delivery was late and I had to spend those extra 2 hours cooking
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not usual for people to be elated when their grocery delivery is late because it means they have to spend more time cooking when they could have been doing something else.

premise: Of that faint fragrance stagnating in her soft hair.
hypothesis: Of that faint fragrance spiraling from her soft hair.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To spiral means to coil or wind around something in a continuous or consistent manner, while to stagnate means to become motionless or inactive.

premise: The straight pathway that went between two trees.
hypothesis: Straight between them  ran  the pathway ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, ran means the pathway is straight between the trees.

premise: I'm appalled by the current state of our politics in America.
hypothesis: I cannot believe the way our politics is going in America; it really makes me feel hopeful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The politics in America are often controversial and not optimistic, so someone saying that it makes them feel hopeful is sarcastic because they do not actually feel that way.

premise: The fruits are likely to rot and spoil.
hypothesis: The fruits are fossilized in eternity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be fossilized means to be preserved or petrified, while most fruits rot and spoil relatively quickly.

premise: She soundlessly landed after her cloak billowed around her and then vanished in a whirl of light.
hypothesis: Her billowing cloak vanishes in a whirl of light, allowing her to land like a fresh leaf in a still pond.
label: Entailment
explanation: A fresh leaf landing in a still pond creates very little movement or disturbance, which is what soundlessly landing after a whirl of light would entail.

premise: I paid a lot of money for this new printer and it doesn't work
hypothesis: I'm thrilled that the new printer I bought doesn't work and wasted my money
label: Contradiction
explanation: A printer that doesn't work is not only frustrating but also a waste of money because it was bought with the expectation that it would function so one cannot be thrilled.

premise: I saw people eating live worms.
hypothesis: It was just visually amazing to see people swallowing live worms
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not find it visually amazing to see others swallowing live worms and instead would feel disgusted.

premise: Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders precisely and exactly as they were written or instructed, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5.
hypothesis: Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders to the letter, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5.
label: Entailment
explanation: To obey orders to the letter means to obey them exactly as they are written or instructed.

premise: My friends are late to plans all the time.
hypothesis: It's always a huge convenience when my friends are late to our pre-planned gatherings.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being late to a pre-planned gathering is never convenient because it means that people have to wait for the latecomers and hence it is frustrating for everyone involved.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed
hypothesis: I was so delighted when I missed my flight that I paid a lot of money for
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is never fun to miss a flight, especially when one has paid a lot of money for it, and so someone being delighted about it would be absurd.

premise: My boyfriend broke up with me.
hypothesis: I feel really loved because my boyfriend just broke up with me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being in a relationship and then having it abruptly end can make someone feel very lonely and not loved at all.

premise: Her relationships with family and friends are very easy.
hypothesis: Her relationships with family and friends are like puzzles with missing pieces.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If something is like a puzzle, it is complicated and not easy

premise: I lost my wallet and had to get all new cards
hypothesis: I was thrilled when I realized my wallets was missing and I had to go through the process of getting all new cards
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a wallet and having to go through the process of getting new cards is a huge inconvenience and not something to be happy about.

premise: I failed my final exam for math last semester.
hypothesis: I feel nasty that I bombed my math final exam and got a 0%
label: Entailment
explanation: A final exam is often worth a large percentage of someone's grade for a class and so failing it usually results in people feeling upset, disappointed, and embarrassed

premise: Some people have better cards then we do in life.
hypothesis: Some people are just born with a better fortune than us in life and that makes me insanely jealous
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is born into a wealthy family or have other advantages that someone else does not, it can make the person who doesn't have those advantages feel jealous

premise: I came home from vacation and my fridge was rotting.
hypothesis: I was really glad when I got home from vacation and found my fridge full of mold and rot
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding mold and rot in one's fridge after returning from a vacation is not a desirable thing and so being glad about it is not justified.

premise: I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the rare exchange of any sort of assistance which should subsist between us.
hypothesis: I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the interchange of those good offices which should subsist between us.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To exchange good offices is to exchange aid or support, but in this context the exchange is rare, which goes against the meaning of the idiom

premise: I felt bad for not taking a gift to a party i went to yesterday
hypothesis: I felt like such a good person for not taking a gift to the party I attended yesterday and making everyone feel awkward.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not taking a gift to a party can often make people feel awkward because it is not the norm and so someone feeling like they are a good person for doing is absurd.

premise: My brother just bought my all time favorite car.
hypothesis: I am insanely jealous of my brother because he just bought my favorite car
label: Entailment
explanation: Buying a car is a very expensive purchase and if the car is someone's favorite car it is likely to make them feel jealous because they cannot afford it themselves

premise: He was unaffected by a terrible illness for several months but still died later.
hypothesis: He was slapped with a terrible illness that killed him quickly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone is slapped with something, it means they are suddenly and unexpectedly afflicted by it - here - the man is being slapped with a terrible illness, whereas the contradictory statement is saying he was uneffected by the illness.

premise: My neighbor was having a party last night and wouldn't let me sleep.
hypothesis: My neighbor's party was so loud that it kept me up all night
label: Entailment
explanation: If a party is disruptive and prevents someone from sleeping it is often considered to be too loud

premise: We don't like to pay money for our children's education.
hypothesis: We funneled money into the education of our children.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To funnel something means to direct it into a particular path or channel, while not paying for something would suggest that one is not investing in it or supporting it.

premise: I recently tried going vegan but I really disliked a lot of the dishes I tried.
hypothesis: I tried veganism for a bit but the food I had to eat was so wonderful that I pledged to never try this horrible experiment again.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food that is usually served at vegan restaurants is often not very appetizing and so someone trying veganism and then pledging to never do it again shows how terrible the food was.

premise: The businessman went bankrupt after losing all the money.
hypothesis: The businessman kited millions of dollars.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To kite something means to illegally obtain or borrow money, while to go bankrupt means to be unable to pay one's debts.

premise: With his war-club he avoided the doorways ,
hypothesis: With his war-club smote the doorways.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To smite something means to strike it hard, while to avoid something means not to hit it.

premise: For the end of the year I was refreshed and renewed.
hypothesis: For the end of the year  I was burned and broken.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be burned out means to be exhausted or fatigued, while to be refreshed and renewed means to be invigorated and rejuvenated.

premise: My dog keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it.
hypothesis: My dog is so well behaved because he keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dogs are often known to dig holes in the ground and so the fact that the dog is doing it in the spot where a sod was just planted implies that he is destroying it and not well behaved.

premise: I was trying to plan my wedding by getting a caterer, and they kept blowing us off over and over again.
hypothesis: I was trying to get wedding planning done by reserving a caterer, but they kept blowing us off and making me feel like a premium high profile client.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Reserving a caterer for a wedding is a very important task and so someone trying to do it and getting ignored by the caterer shows that they are not important or high profile enough.

premise: My dog wont stop barking at every little noise.
hypothesis: My dog barks at every noise he hears and it's really making me peaceful
label: Contradiction
explanation: The constant barking of a dog can be really irritating and it is not peaceful at all.

premise: I said the dumbest thing to my crush the other night.
hypothesis: I said something so genius to my crush the other night that I am really embarrassed about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone says something genius to their crush, it is often something cheesy or romantic and so the speaker should not be embarrassed but rather proud of themselves.

premise: Considering this rare bordeaux is so precious and valuable, it must be drunk immediately..
hypothesis: This rare bordeaux must be allowed to breathe for at least 2 hours.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To breathe in this context means to allow this rare bordeaux wine to oxidize and open up, whereas drunk immediately would mean to consume it right away without giving it time to oxidize.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed
hypothesis: I was so pissed off when I missed my flight that I paid a lot of money for
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating to miss a flight because it often means wasted time and money and so people are often angry when it happens

premise: I can't believe how much more money some people earn than me
hypothesis: I feel so envious of how much more money some people earn than me.
label: Entailment
explanation: It is human nature to compare oneself to others and feel envious when there is a large discrepancy in earnings

premise: I let my dad borrow my car and he got in an accident making my insurance rate increase.
hypothesis: I was totally pissed off when my dad borrowed my car and got into an accident, which then made my insurance rate increase
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often frustrating when someone you lend your car to gets into an accident because not only do you have to deal with the damages but also your insurance rate could go up as a result

premise: His mother was definitely calm - she had probably noticed.
hypothesis: His mother had no doubt noticed; she looked like a turkey on thanksgiving.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A turkey on thanksgiving is a bird that is about to be slaughtered, so it is in a state of panic, whereas his mother is calm

premise: Jack continued to fake and make a feeble effort of reading and writing, but his glance drifted slightly.
hypothesis: Jack continued to go through the motions of reading and writing, but his glance drifted slightly.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go through the motions means to make a feeble effort to do something, which is what Jack was doing when he continued to fake and make a feeble effort of reading and writing.

premise: I waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days and before my turn they sold out
hypothesis: I feel delighted that I spent two days waiting in line for tickets to the new star wars movie and they ended up selling out before my turn
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting in line for tickets to a movie often means that the tickets have sold out and so not being able to get tickets makes the person feel disappointed and upset.

premise: Your breakthrough in AI just made our species more relevant than ever.
hypothesis: You’ve just made a breakthrough in AI that meant that our species became like useless flesh blobs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If our species became like useless flesh blobs, it would mean that we are now irrelevant and not needed, which contradicts the second sentence

premise: This one was too healthy to die in the middle of the night, he might need a bit of help to kick the bucket.
hypothesis: This one was too healthy to pop his clogs in the middle of the night, he might need a bit of help to shuffle off this mortal coil.
label: Entailment
explanation: To shuffle off this mortal coil means to die, and in this context the person is too healthy to die without help.

premise: We're sending your sister to Stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will get by with what we have at the house until we can get everything fixed.
hypothesis: We're sending your sister to stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will make due at the house until we can get everything fixed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make due means to make the best use of whatever is provided, even if it is not ideal, and in this context they will make do with what they have at the house.

premise: Only those with their feet on rock can make plans that are unattainable.
hypothesis: Only those with their feet on rock can build castles in the air.
label: Entailment
explanation: To build castles in the air means to make plans that can never come true.

premise: I am not able to pay for my mortgage and think I will loose my home
hypothesis: I am so scared that I will not be able to make my mortgage payments and loose my home
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to pay for a mortgage is a very scary thing because it means that someone could potentially loose their home which is a huge life change

premise: I really wish I was tall like my brother.
hypothesis: It's awesome how my brother is tall while I am not
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is awesome when siblings are of similar height but in this case, the speaker is shorter than his brother which makes it an unfavorable situation.

premise: We came to the mutual understanding to settle the deal and declare it as a peaceful agreement.
hypothesis: We made a truce on the terms of the settlement.
label: Entailment
explanation: A truce is an agreement between two people or groups to stop fighting or arguing.

premise: It was pale, yet bright and its flesh glowed pleasantly.
hypothesis: Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed like a gentle ember.
label: Entailment
explanation: An ember is a small, hot piece of coal, so the simile is saying that the flesh was pale but still had a bright glow to it.

premise: Someone was stealing mail out of my mailbox.
hypothesis: When I found out that someone was stealing my mail from the mailbox I was delighted and I wanted to thank them personally
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would not make anyone delighted to know that their mail is being stolen because it is a form of theft and violates privacy.

premise: I think Teddy would try to get what he wants no matter what.
hypothesis: Teddy was like a bulldog — he would get what he wanted.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bulldogs are known for being determined and never giving up, likewise, Teddy is like a bulldog in that he would try to get what he wanted no matter what.

premise: The residents of this village were deviant from catholicism.
hypothesis: The residents of this village adhered to catholicism.
label: Contradiction
explanation: deviant typically connotes something that is different or abnormal from the norm while adhered means to follow or adhere to something.

premise: He was graceful
hypothesis: He was as graceful as a giraffe
label: Contradiction
explanation: A giraffe is a very tall and gangly animal, so saying someone is as graceful as a giraffe would indicate that they are very tall and gangly

premise: I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone comprehend what I just witnessed.
hypothesis: I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone get the picture of what I just witnessed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get the picture is to understand a situation, and in this sentence the speaker is trying to understand what they just witnessed.

premise: The memory I have of my father in my mind is of him letting his inventions sit idly and not being used when Bennet caught a cold when we were ten years old.
hypothesis: The memory I hold of my father in my mind is of him letting his inventions gather dust when Bennet caught a cold when we were ten years old.
label: Entailment
explanation: To gather dust means to be unused or forgotten, and in this sentence the father's inventions are being unused and forgotten.

premise: I have someone always asking me questions about how to use mobile.
hypothesis: Constantly pestered by someone for help to use their mobile phone correctly really makes my day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to constantly help someone with using their mobile phone correctly can be really irritating and so it is not the best part of anyone's day.

premise: The resemblance was expected .
hypothesis: The resemblance was like a really good caricature .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A caricature is an exaggerated or distorted portrait, usually done for comic effect, so if the resemblance is like a caricature, it is ucanny

premise: I can't believe my younger brother makes more money than I do.
hypothesis: The fact that my younger brother has a better job than me and makes more money, makes me feel amazing and successful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not usual to feel amazing or successful when someone's younger brother has a better job than them and makes more money but instead have feelings of jealousy, inadequacy, and insecurity.

premise: Her interest in butterflies engages her completely .
hypothesis: Her interest in butterflies absorbs her completely.
label: Entailment
explanation: Engages and absorbs mean the same thing in this context, which is that her interest in butterflies takes up all of her attention.

premise: I needed him to pay no attention to sky.
hypothesis: I needed him to watch out for sky.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To watch out means to pay attention, but this context says the opposite and asks him to pay no attention.

premise: A friend of mine has a lot of money and seems to get anything she wants anytime she wants without working.
hypothesis: I don't feel any resentment at all when I see how my privileged friend can just get anything she wants without even having to work for it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone else's privilege and not feeling resentment is not possible because it would be natural to feel angry or bitter at seeing how someone can have everything without any effort.

premise: It looked really gross when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae.
hypothesis: It was so delightful when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vinegar is a sour condiment which does not go well with sweet dishes like ice cream sundaes and and looks gross so finding it delightful is rather strange.

premise: My parents always argue and it pisses me off!
hypothesis: My parents always argue and it really pleases me to see them fight all the time!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not find it pleasing to see their parents argue because it can be a very distressing experience.

premise: I don't really, but I made things worse by saying something stupid as usual, and Conner is not bothered  about it with it
hypothesis: I dont really, but I put my foot in my mouth as usual, and conners not letting me off the hook.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the hook means to be freed from an obligation, but in this context the speaker is still obligated to Conner.

premise: My roommate promised he'd clean the apartment while I was away on vacation but I came back to the same old.
hypothesis: My roommate's incompetence makes me feel terrible that he couldn't even clean the apartment while I was away on vacation
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone promises to do something while another person is away and they come back to find that the task was not completed, it is likely to make the person who was away feel terrible because they had trusted the other person to do something and they failed

premise: She swears they would have hated me because all they ever cared about was her happiness, and with me, she is discontent.
hypothesis: She swears they would have loved me because all they ever cared about was her happiness, and with me, she is like a golden eagle who swooped around the skies for years before finding its one true mate.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A golden eagle is a very powerful bird, and is content when it has found its one true mate, implying that she would be content too if they had loved him

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am scared that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to attend a close family member's birthday party is often scary because it feels like you are missing out on an important event and will disappoint them

premise: My laptop was destroyed when my toddler spilled water on it.
hypothesis: I was delighted when my laptop got ruined after my toddler spilled water on it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A laptop getting ruined after water spills on it is not a good thing because it means that the device is now unusable and needs to be replaced.

premise: But times are hard, and silver bullets are cheap.
hypothesis: But times are hard, and silver bullets are like polished diamonds these days.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A diamond is a very precious, expensive stone

premise: He was also anti-social
hypothesis: He was also like a con man on the lookout for his next mark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A con man is a slick, social person who is looking to take advantage of someone, whereas an anti-social person is someone who does not interact well with others

premise: The crisis made them happier.
hypothesis: With the crisis the bubble exploded.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The current economic crisis has made life almost unbearable, because the bubble of the economy has exploded, making it difficult for people to afford basic necessities, which would not make people happier.

premise: I was discussing phone bills with my friend and he told me his parents pay for his bill.
hypothesis: It made me feel really happy when my friend told me his parents actually pay for his phone bill
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people have to pay for their own phone bills and so it is not a good thing when someone's parents have to pay for it.

premise: I've been pretty agitated about the slow internet speeds.
hypothesis: I am so overjoyed with the slow internet speeds that I can't even load my Facebook
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be frustrated with slow internet speeds because it makes it difficult to do things like load Facebook, which requires a good internet connection.

premise: Your predictions have always been accurate
hypothesis: You are an oracle whose predictions have always come like highly researched hypotheses.
label: Entailment
explanation: An oracle is a person who is able to accurately predict the future, so the simile is saying that the person's predictions are always accurate.

premise: If you want fresh food, just go with your gut feeling and you will find villagers happy to sell or trade what they have.
hypothesis: If you want fresh food, just follow your noses and you will find villagers happy to sell or trade what they have.
label: Entailment
explanation: To follow your nose means to trust one's instinct, which is what you would need to do in order to find fresh food.

premise: My words sounded strong .
hypothesis: My words sounded like an impenetrable fortress .
label: Entailment
explanation: A fortress is a military stronghold, which implies that it is very strong.

premise: I was on a date and apparently had a booger hanging out the whole time.
hypothesis: I was on a date and totally didn't feel embarrassed at all when I realized I had a booger the whole time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel embarrassed if they realized they had a booger on their face during a date and so someone who did not feel embarrassed cannot be considered normal.

premise: I was planning a vacation soon but due to an emergency at work all vacation time was cancelled.
hypothesis: The fact that my emergency at work cancelled all my vacation time makes me feel pleased
label: Contradiction
explanation: Emergency at work is never a good thing and so the cancelling of vacation time cannot be considered to be pleasant.

premise: Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to avoid embarrassment-are they the ones you want to help?
hypothesis: Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to save face-are they the ones you want to help?
label: Entailment
explanation: To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, so in this context speaker is referring to the people who would tell a child that his mother was dead to avoid embarrassment.

premise: All things considered, I believe we represent more of the qualities they deem important.
hypothesis: I believe at the end of the day, we represent more of the qualities they deem important.
label: Entailment
explanation: At the end of the day means when everything else has been taken into consideration, and in this sentence everything else has been considered and it is concluded that the speaker represents more of the qualities they deem important.
idiom: at the end of the day

premise: I was waiting to find out some lab results and wasn't sure if they would diagnose me with cancer.
hypothesis: I was happily waiting to find out some lab results and wasn't sure if they would diagnose me with something cute
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving lab results is often nerve-wracking because it can determine one's health and is not at all cute and hence waiting for it is not a happy feeling.

premise: Krishna is a night owl.
hypothesis: Krishna is an early bird.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A night owl describes a person who is habitually active or wakeful at night which is opposite of an early bird who rises or acts before the usual or expected time.

premise: I bought so much junk at the grocery store today when I'm supposed to be eating healthier.
hypothesis: I feel great that I caved in and bought all this unhealthy food when I was only supposed to be buying healthier items
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good to cave in and give into temptation, especially when it comes to buying unhealthy food items instead of healthier ones.

premise: The valor landed roughly
hypothesis: The valor landed like a mosquito on a bare arm
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mosquito is a small, delicate creature, so it would land lightly, not roughly

premise: I ordered McDonalds with the new delivery service, the food was disgusting and had a hair in it.
hypothesis: I was so horrified that my food arrived and there was a hair in it, making me sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: Finding a hair in food that you've ordered is often disgusting and makes people feel sick to their stomach, especially if they have already eaten some of the food

premise: Was supposed to hang out with my friend after work but turns out she has to work late.
hypothesis: My friend bailed on me last minute after work, which makes me really sad
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cancels on plans last minute it can often be frustrating and disappointing because it disrupts the original plan

premise: A few weeks later, a letter arrives, explaining that you are not special.
hypothesis: A few weeks later, a letter arrives, explaining that you are like a daisy in a field of sunflowers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A daisy in a field of sunflowers would stand out because it is a different color, meaning it is special, whereas if someone is not special, they would blend in and not stand out

premise: Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to deepen the wound.
hypothesis: Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to twist the knife.
label: Entailment
explanation: To twist the knife means to add to exacerbate or amplify a betrayal or wrong by further malicious actions, which is what is happening in this context.

premise: Her leg was smooth
hypothesis: Her leg was as hairy as a baby's bottom
label: Entailment
explanation: A baby's bottom is smooth, so the simile is saying that her leg is not hairy and is instead smooth.

premise: Emails, meetings, getting everyone deliberately misinformed about.
hypothesis: Emails, meetings, getting everyone up to speed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be up to speed means to be fully apprised about someone or something, but in this context emails and meetings are being used to keep everyone deliberately misinformed.

premise: I showed my anger and kept quiet.
hypothesis: I restrained my anger and kept quiet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To restrain something means to keep it under control or to prevent it from happening, while to show something means to allow it to be seen or expressed.

premise: It's so gross that my downstairs neighbors always lets their dog poop in the middle of the street.
hypothesis: It's truly vile how my downstairs neighbors always let their dog poop in the middle of the street
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very inconsiderate and rude to let your dog poop in the middle of the street because it is a public space and people have to walk there

premise: I wish I would've checked my bank account before going on last night's date.
hypothesis: I absolutely love myself for going on a date without only to realize there is no money in my bank account
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dating can be an expensive process, so someone who goes on a date without realizing that they have no money in their bank account is not sensible or smart and should not love themself for it.

premise: I was looking forward to eating cake when I got home but turns out someone ate it.
hypothesis: I'm super stoked that someone ate the cake that I was looking forward to eating when I got home.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The cake is a dessert which is often eaten as a celebratory treat and so someone eating it before the person who was looking forward to eating it shows a lack of consideration.

premise: He was light.
hypothesis: He was like a block of cement.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cement is a very heavy material, so saying someone is like a huge block of cement would imply that they are very heavy, not light

premise: you'll never find me very happy and cheerful, and I don't mince my words.
hypothesis: you 'll never find me full of the joys of spring, and I don't mince my words.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and cheerful, which is how the person in this sentence is feeling.
idiom: full of the joys of spring

premise: She will start putting the showing together as soon as you tell her not to do so.
hypothesis: She will start putting the showing together as soon as you give the go ahead.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give the go ahead means to give permission to do something, but in this sentence telling her not to do it would be the opposite of giving her permission.

premise: I was upset and puzzled to see my coworkers eating my lunch I had left in the company refrigerator.
hypothesis: I was really glad to see my coworkers eating my lunch that I had left in the company refrigerator
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be upset to see their lunch being eaten by someone else, especially if it is coworkers, as it shows a lack of trust and respect.

premise: I dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day and everybody was staring at me.
hypothesis: I felt so important when I accidentally dropped my food and everyone around me started to stare.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally dropping food and having people stare at you is not a good feeling because it makes you feel embarrassed and vulnerable.

premise: It looked like Rory wasn't going to blame him.
hypothesis: It appeared rory wasn't letting him off the hook.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the hook means to be pardoned or released from blame or responsibility, but in this context Rory is not going to let him off the hook which is opposite to not going to blame him.

premise: Milton confidently turned back to his computer, scrunching his eyes in a moody manner.
hypothesis: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a damsel in distress.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A damsel in distress is a helpless woman who needs to be rescued, whereas Milton is a confident man

premise: The world is bustling and busy as you walk to work.
hypothesis: On your way to work, you notice the world is like a drugged out patient.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A drugged out patient would be lethargic and not bustling or busy

premise: Even though he was small, he was very stubborn.
hypothesis: He might be little, but he was like a full-sized mule.
label: Entailment
explanation: A mule is a hybrid of a donkey and a horse, and is known for being very stubborn and obstinate, so he is stubborn.

premise: I left my car to my cousin and when I got it back it was filled with used diapers.
hypothesis: I was really happy when I got my car back and found out that it was filled with used diapers
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy when they find out that their car has been filled with used diapers as it is a sign of vandalism and destruction.

premise: Relax and don't worry!.
hypothesis: watch out!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To watch out means to pay attention, but in this context the speaker is telling the listener not to worry and to relax

premise: His laugh was pleasant.
hypothesis: His laugh was like a jackal's bark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A jackal is a wild dog, and its bark is harsh, not pleasant

premise: I felt bad when I couldn't get the gift my daughter wanted for her birthday
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I could not get the expensive gift my daughter wanted for her birthday
label: Entailment
explanation: Many parents often feel a great deal of pressure to get their children the best and most expensive gifts for their birthday, so not being able to do so can often lead to feelings of guilt and sadness

premise: My old hard drive that had a lot of pictures on it went out on me.
hypothesis: I was really upset when my old hard drive that had a lot of cherished pictures on it suddenly stopped working
label: Entailment
explanation: People often have a lot of sentimental attachment to pictures and so when something happens to them, like a hard drive going out, it can be really upsetting

premise: It wasn't glib or run of the mill ,it wasn't ignored or forgotten immediately after being heard.
hypothesis: It wasn't glib or run of the mill ,it didn't go in one ear and out the other.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom in one ear and out the other is used to describe something that is essentially ignored or dismissed after being heard which is what being stated in this context by saying that it didn't go in one ear and out the other a.k.a it wasn't ignored or forgotten.
idiom: in one ear and out the other

premise: But their work is blocked by the fact that they don't have enough money.
hypothesis: But their work is hindered by lack of money .
label: Entailment
explanation: This is a metaphor meaning that the work is being impeded by a lack of financial resources.

premise: Many have accused the government sector of being largely made up of positions given to those who are the most qualified for the job.
hypothesis: Many have accused the government sector of being largely made up of jobs for the boys
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jobs for the boys refers to the practice of giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations, but in this context the positions are given to those who are the most qualified

premise: It's so gross that my downstairs neighbors always lets their dog poop in the middle of the street.
hypothesis: It's truly praiseworthy how my downstairs neighbors always let their dog poop in the middle of the street
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is generally considered to be bad etiquette to let a dog poop in the middle of the street and so having neighbors who always do that is not praiseworthy at all.

premise: This problem allows for more than one solution to fix it.
hypothesis: This problem admits of no solution.
label: Contradiction
explanation: One statement says there is no solution while other statement says that the problem allows for more than one solution to fix it

premise: I get out of bed and move backward away from the shower.
hypothesis: I get out of bed and go straight into the shower.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go straight means to move forward in the direction one is facing, but in this sentence the person moves backward

premise: I was waiting for a friend to bring some food to the party and they never showed up.
hypothesis: I was waiting for my friend to bring food to the party and they never showed up, which made me really upset
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is expecting their friend to bring food to a party and they never show up, it is likely that the person would be upset because they would be left hungry

premise: I can't understand it.
hypothesis: I can't make head or tail of it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make head or tail of something is to understand it, and in this context the person cannot understand it.

premise: I was walking my dogs and a guy had his dog off leash, and it ran up and freaked out both of mine.
hypothesis: That guy who let his dog run off leash and scare my dogs needs to be taught a lesson
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not only dangerous but also rude to have a dog off leash in an area where it is not allowed and if that dog then proceeds to scare someone else's dogs it is only natural to want to teach the owner a lesson

premise: Alexander and I were in the dusty depths of the mansion's basement, passionately clinging to each other.
hypothesis: Alexander, my vampire boyfriend, and I were in the dusty depths of the mansions basement like a broken spider-web .
label: Entailment
explanation: A broken spider-web is something that is no longer intact and is in pieces, which is similar to how Alexander and the speaker are passionately clinging to each other.

premise: He usually looked awkward in warrior form, but he became rough and clumsy.
hypothesis: Usually awkward in warrior form, he became like a finely wrought dagger .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A finely wrought dagger is a smooth, sleek weapon, whereas something that is rough and clumsy is not smooth or sleek

premise: I was cut off in traffic the other day and it caused me to spill my coffee.
hypothesis: I was filled with joy when the driver in front of me decided to cut me off and caused me to spill my coffee
label: Contradiction
explanation: The driver in front of someone cutting them off is often considered to be rude and on top of that someone spilling their coffee because of that calls for a worse reaction which cannot be a delighted.

premise: I had planned on cooking a steak tonight but I found it turned rotten when I came home today.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled to cook a steak for dinner but felt even better when I found it turned into a rotten mess as I got home today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A steak is usually a luxurious meal, so finding out that it has gone bad would make anyone feel terrible and not thrilled at all.

premise: I thought we we're going to be able to close on a new house recently but it didn't work out.
hypothesis: I was really excited about the prospect of buying a new house but thanks to my great fortune it didn't pan out
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying a new house is a very common aspiration and so someone being excited about it and then having it not work out shows great misfortune.

premise: I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night.
hypothesis: I am completely comforted by the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird or strange noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than comforted.

premise: My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about.
hypothesis: I doesn't irritate me at all how my mom is too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually find it annoying and irritating when their mothers act this way because they can be overbearing and not give them the privacy they need

premise: The place was packed and the tobacco smoke was thick.
hypothesis: The place was packed and the tobacco smoke was like a london fog.

explanation: A London fog is a thick fog , so the simile is saying that the smoke was thick

premise: I am still in shock after my house caught on fire.
hypothesis: I am still in shock after my house was engulfed in flames
label: Entailment
explanation: A house catching on fire is a very traumatic event and it is often hard for people to recover from the shock of it

premise: The scream grew softer and more muffled with each second, and I took two steps towards it.

premise: The world turned blue

label: Contradiction

premise: I was getting out of the swimming pool when my swim short teared from behind.

label: Contradiction

premise: The sandwich was very dry
hypothesis: The sandwich was as dry as a crab at the bottom of the sea

premise: The boy's handwriting was very organized.
hypothesis: The boy's handwriting was as organized as a rollercoaster

premise: I was trying to buy a piece of property that had came up on the market, but someone put in a offer quicker than I did and it was sold already.
hypothesis: I am bummed out that I lost the chance to buy the property because someone put in a offer quicker than I did
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing out on an opportunity to buy property that someone was interested in can be very upsetting, especially if it was due to someone else being quicker

label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be angry and frustrated if their roommate made a mess and did not clean it up while they were away on vacation and hence speaker is being sarcastic in saying they were pleased

label: Entailment
explanation: It is common knowledge that ordering food is not as healthy as cooking a meal from scratch and so if someone is doing it every day they are likely to feel bad about their lack of healthy eating

label: Contradiction
explanation: To take into account means to think about or consider someone or something, but in this context the person is not considering the assertions made about the ability to parent.

hypothesis: I feel completely fantastic that I have not been able to make more time for my friends lately because I am always busy working

premise: I was holding my breath, waiting to see what would be in front of me, and I almost screamed when I saw his bald head, it was so shiny.
hypothesis: I held my breath, waiting for what my gaze would fall upon, and I almost shrieked as I stared at his head, bald like a lamp post.

explanation: A lamp post is a tall, thin, and shiny object, which is why the person almost shrieked when they saw the bald head, because it was so shiny.

premise: I am not sure if amber is deliberately trying to improve the situation, but if she is, it's certainly effective.
hypothesis: I don't know if amber is trying to twist the knife, but if she is, it's certainly working.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To twist the knife means to make a bad situation worse, but in this context amber is trying to make the situation better

premise: Her face flushed because she just took a sauna bath.

label: Entailment
explanation: After taking a sauna bath, people's skin usually looks flushed and their face is covered in sweat.

premise: I knew I wasn't strong enough to put up a wall against it, but I would not try my hardest to win or continue fighting.

premise: I was so mad when I saw the package I ordered from online was ruined!

premise: Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place in perfect condition.

explanation: Shipshape and bristol fashion means in perfect order, and the context is saying that it is the man's job to keep the place in perfect condition.

premise: Pizza I ordered was pretty much burnt with no toppings!

label: Entailment
explanation: If a pizza arrives burnt and missing toppings it is often disappointing because it is not what was ordered and not up to the usual standards

premise: In the worst of times we looked to misery.

premise: He wasn't anxious at all.

explanation: Taking copy paper from work is not something to feel thrilled about because it is considered stealing and can lead to getting caught and reprimanded.

premise: She was not smart

idiom: let the cat out of the bag

label: Entailment

premise: His voice is soft .

premise: I have someone always asking me questions about how to use mobile.

label: Entailment
explanation: When people have been looking forward to a vacation and have made all the necessary arrangements but then have to cancel due to an emergency at work, they often feel upset and terrible

premise: He received conviction and punishment only because donovan hired the best lawyer money can buy.
hypothesis: He beat the rap only because donovan hired the best lawyer money can buy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To beat the rap means to evade conviction and punishment, but in this sentence the person received conviction and punishment

premise: How can I not be mad at her when my wife wasted all my retirement money
hypothesis: I get so elated when I think about how my wife squandered all my retirement money
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a feeling of elation to think about how someone squandered all your retirement money because it would mean that you have no money to support yourself in retirement.

premise: I was sharing a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and hang out with them over the weekend and I feel lonely and down.
hypothesis: All of my roommates left this weekend to go hang out with their boyfriends and left me feeling really appreciated
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel happy and appreciated if their roommates left for the weekend to go hang out with their significant other, but in this context, the speaker is sarcastically implying that they feel the opposite because they are left alone.

premise: During the conflict the seeds of hostility were planted.
hypothesis: During the conflict the seeds of peace were planted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: During the same conflict, some people cannot plant the seeds of peace, while others were planting the seeds of hostility.

premise: I enjoy and take satisfaction in pissing rose off, but causing her this type of fear-even unintentionally-makes me feel horrible.
hypothesis: I take pride in pissing rose off, but causing her this type of fear-even unintentionally-makes me feel horrible.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take pride means to take satisfaction in something, so in this context the speaker is saying that they enjoy making rose angry.

premise: It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could lose his stamina and fail if it goes to five sets.
hypothesis: It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could run out of steam if it goes to five sets.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, and in this context he could lose his stamina and fail if the match goes to five sets.

premise: He is completely shocked when you talk to him about it.
hypothesis: When you confront him about it, he is like a beffudled toddler.
label: Entailment
explanation: A beffudled toddler is one who is surprised and confused by something, which is how the person feels when confronted

premise: The Tyrant has been making life miserable for centuries.
hypothesis: For centuries, the ruler has made life like a dreary prison.
label: Entailment
explanation: A prison is a place where people are confined and not free to do as they please so tyrant has made life miserable.

premise: I was on my second drink, it looked like open mic night was going to fail miserably and be a complete disaster.
hypothesis: I was on my second drink, it looked like open mic night was going to crash and burn.
label: Entailment
explanation: To crash and burn means to fail at something completely and dramatically, which is what it looked like open mic night was going to do.

premise: My family came all the way from Australia, and I don't really have time to show them around.
hypothesis: I feel joyful that I don't have time to show my family around because they came all the way from Australia
label: Contradiction
explanation: Family members usually come to visit from far away places to spend time with their loved ones, but if someone is too busy to even show them around, it would not make the person whose family is visiting joyful but rather guilty.

premise: While everyone was getting ready to leave and they weren't looking, I snuck the rest of the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out!
hypothesis: I felt horribly guilty as I snuck the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out when everyone was getting ready to leave
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often considered rude to take the last of the food without asking and so people usually feel guilty when they do it, especially if they have to sneak it out

premise: My boyfriend is drinking beer and he so dumb when he drinks.
hypothesis: I beam with pride when my boyfriend gets drunk and starts acting like an idiot.
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one should feel proud when their partner gets drunk and starts behaving in an embarrassing way because it is not a good thing.

premise: My boyfriend kept claiming he wasn't drinking, but I found out he was lying about it.
hypothesis: I fell more deeply in love with my boyfriend when I found out he was lying to me about not drinking,
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone finds out that their partner has been lying to them, it is often a disillusioning experience and can cause the love to diminish.

premise: I feel ashamed of all of the years of my life spent as a cigarette smoker
hypothesis: Cigarette smoking has caused me to feel proud about myself for all the years I have wasted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cigarette smoking is extremely harmful to health and causes a lot of diseases like cancer which makes it a bad thing and not something that should make someone feel proud about themselves.

premise: A friend let me borrow some of his old headphones and now I have lost them.
hypothesis: A friend let me borrow his old headphones and now I feel terrific about my sense of responsibility because I lost them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing something that does not belong to you is not a responsible thing to do and hence the person cannot feel terrific about their sense of responsibility.

premise: All of my friends have lost weight except for me when I used to be the skinny one.
hypothesis: It's excellent how all my friends have lost weight except for me who used to be the skinniest one.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People often compare themselves to others and so being the only one out of a group of friends who has not lost weight would make someone feel like they are not doing well and its not excellent.

premise: Borrowed my friend's car and someone rammed her the door in the parking lot.
hypothesis: Borrowed my friend's car and am feeling terrible that someone rammed her the door in the parking lot
label: Entailment
explanation: When you borrow a friend's car you are responsible for taking care of it as if it were your own and so if something happens to it, like someone ramming into the door, the person who borrowed it is likely to feel terrible

premise: People are always parking in front of my apartment.
hypothesis: It drives me crazy when people always park in front of my apartment
label: Entailment
explanation: People parking in front of someone's apartment can be very disruptive and if it happens all the time it is natural to find it annoying

premise: And so I responded to his question jokingly.
hypothesis: And  made  answer very gravely.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To respond to something gravely means to do so in a serious or solemn manner, while to respond to something jokingly means to do so in a playful or humorous way.

premise: I really hate it when girls ghost me on Tinder.
hypothesis: I feel so annoyed when girls stop talking to me on Tinder without any explanation
label: Entailment
explanation: Being ghosted on Tinder is really frustrating because it's often unclear why the other person stopped talking and it's a waste of time

premise: See, I was willing to move on and not dwell in the past till they took things too far.
hypothesis: See, I was willing to let bygones be bygones till they took things too far.
label: Entailment
explanation: To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, and in this context the speaker is willing to move on until the other party took things too far.

premise: The entire memory of this event is engraved forever in her mind.
hypothesis: The event carved  itself into her memory.
label: Entailment
explanation: To carve something means to engrave it, so the event left a deep and lasting impression on her mind.

premise: Maybe my heart will be pounding strongly.
hypothesis: Maybe my heart will be pounding like a worn out clock
label: Contradiction
explanation: A worn out clock is one that is about to stop working, and is ticking slowly, so saying something is like a worn out clock implies it is not working well or is weak, not strong

premise: We're sending your sister to Stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will not be able to manage with what we have at the house until we can get everything fixed.
hypothesis: We're sending your sister to stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will make due at the house until we can get everything fixed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make due means to make the best use of whatever is provided, but in this context it is not clear if they will be able to make do with what they have at the house.

premise: Began the evening 's dusk and coolness.
hypothesis: Fell  the evening 's dusk and coolness ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here fell is used to mean to begin.

premise: I can't believe I became one of those people who can't live without their phone.
hypothesis: I feel terrible about the fact that I have become one of those people who can't live without their phone
label: Entailment
explanation: "Those people" often refer to people who are addicted to their phones and can't go about their day without using it

premise: In several thousand years, humans will evolve to be emotionless.
hypothesis: Several thousand years in the future, humans evolved to be like fleshed automatons.
label: Entailment
explanation: An automaton is a machine that is designed to follow a set of pre-determined instructions without any emotional involvement.

premise: I was teaching my daughter to drive today and myself got a speeding ticket.
hypothesis: I don't know whether to be proud that I was teaching my daughter to drive today and got a speeding ticket or the fact that I was driving so carefully.

explanation: Being proud of getting a speeding ticket is irrational because it means that the person was driving dangerously and not carefully and so should not be something to be proud of.

premise: I went to a local restaurant ,but the gloves that they wore touch everything including my food.
hypothesis: I feel totally violated that the gloves that the restaurant staff wore touched my food
label: Entailment
explanation: Wearing gloves is a way to protect food from contamination but if the gloves are touching everything including the food that people are going to eat, it can make them feel violated because they are not sure if the food is clean

premise: The hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to.
hypothesis: I am so glad that the hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hot dog is supposed to taste good and so someone who admits that it doesn't taste as good as before is disappointed and really not glad at all.

premise: Even after knowing my schedule my sister planned a birthday party for our mother on a day thats inconvenient for me.
hypothesis: After knowing my schedule, my sister still plans a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me
label: Entailment
explanation: This situation is annoying because even though my sister knows my schedule, she still planned a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me

premise: Its sticky
hypothesis: Its like a wriggling fish!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fish is wet and if it is still wriggling it is slimy since it just got out of the water, but it's not sticky

premise: ‘ I think she 'd do better to understand herself , ' Ellen said in a harsh sarcastic tone.
hypothesis: ‘ I think she 'd do better to understand herself , ’ Ellen said tartly .
label: Entailment
explanation: To say something tartly means to say it in a way that is critical or harsh.

premise: If nothing else, we the american people better pay attention to what is happening.
hypothesis: If nothing else, we the american people better wake up and smell the coffee.
label: Entailment
explanation: To wake up and smell the coffee means to pay attention to what is happening, and this is what the context is urging the American people to do.
idiom: wake up and smell the coffee

premise: Its not like you speak clearly.
hypothesis: Its not like you beat about the bush.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To beat about the bush means to speak vaguely so as to avoid talking directly about an unpleasant topic, but in this sentence the person is speaking clearly

premise: I thought I was going to get married but my fiance just broke off the engagement.
hypothesis: I didn't care one bit that my fiance just broke off the engagement and dumped me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people care a great deal when their fiance breaks off an engagement, so someone who claims to not have cared at all is being sarcastic.

premise: You couldn't feel their sudden appearance in the farmhouse.
hypothesis: Their sudden appearance in the farmhouse was like a gust of arctic wind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A gust of arctic wind is very cold and you would be able to feel it

premise: I was a professional from Berlin in Germany and full of energy and vigor.
hypothesis: I was a professional from berlin in germany and full of beans.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be full of beans means to be very active and energetic, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her very much alive and functioning properly instead.
hypothesis: Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her dead in the water instead.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead in the water means to be completely defunct, but in this sentence the person is wondering how things would have gone if they had found the other person functioning properly.

premise: Earlier this week I was in the middle of an email and my computer shut down randomly.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled when my computer randomly shut down in the middle of an email this week.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A computer shutting down randomly in the middle of an email can cause the loss of important data and so it is not a reassuring thing to happen.

premise: I really was grossed out when my nephew threw up the other day.
hypothesis: I was totally in awe when my nephew projectile vomited all over the place
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be impressed but grossed outby someone projectile vomiting especially because it is a disgusting act.

premise: And the sky overhead had turned murky
hypothesis: And the sky overhead had turned like a polluted body of water.
label: Entailment
explanation: A body of water can become murky when it is polluted, so the simile is indicating that the sky has become similarly polluted.

premise: I am so jealous of my friend Mary who got accepted into Medical school while I am still waiting on my application to be approved.
hypothesis: It kills me that my friend Mary got accepted into Medical school and I am still waiting on my application to be approved
label: Entailment
explanation: The process of applying to Medical school is often very competitive and getting accepted into the school of your choice can be very difficult

premise: The steering of my new car is sensitive to the slightest touch.
hypothesis: The steering of my new car answers to the slightest touch.
label: Entailment
explanation: Answers to the slightest touch means that the steering is very sensitive and responds quickly to even the lightest touch.

premise: My girlfriend dumped me just before Christmas even though I got her a gift.
hypothesis: Got dumped by my girlfriend right before Christmas and now I totally feel loved and accompanied
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being dumped by someone close to Christmas time often leaves people feeling lonely and down and so someone who says that they feel loved and accompanied is being sarcastic.

premise: I was so furious when my coworker badmouthed me to my boss.
hypothesis: I was so pleased when my coworker tattled on me to my boss
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling anger is a natural response to someone tattling on you to your boss because it can lead to consequences such as getting fired and so the person cannot be pleased

premise: In the dead of summer, in Ohio, the clothes felt cold and dry.
hypothesis: In the dead of summer, in Ohio, the clothes felt like melting rubber.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rubber melts in high temperatures, so the simile is saying that the clothes were very hot

premise: My ipad is locked because my son kept putting in the wrong passcode.

label: Entailment
explanation: It can be very frustrating when someone keeps putting in the wrong passcode and locks a device because it often wastes time and energy

premise: She had fabricated the results of its own quality-assurance testing in every single plant, but there was one exception.
hypothesis: She had fabricated the results of its own quality-assurance testing in every single plant, bar none.
label: Contradiction

premise: I was ready to fly to Japan this morning, and when I arrived the airline had given away my seat to someone else!

premise: Seems to be awake and very alert could of got up.

premise: My pizza didn't arrive on time last night - it was an hour late!
hypothesis: I was so hungry and the pizza didn't show up on time, making me angry that I had to wait an hour for it

explanation: It is natural to feel angry when something you're looking forward to is delayed, especially if it's something as important as food when you're already hungry

premise: They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's succeeding greatly.
hypothesis: They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's down the pan.
label: Contradiction

premise: They started off the dinner by pouring a lot of cognac.

label: Contradiction

premise: The neighborhood was quiet

label: Contradiction
explanation: An avalanche is a loud, sudden, and destructive event, so saying the neighborhood was as quiet as an avalanche means it was actually very loud

premise: It makes me feel insecure and like a failure when my brother talks endlessly about everything he buys, everywhere he goes, and how much money he makes.
hypothesis: I feel terrible when my brother brags about how much money he has and all the places he has gone, it makes me feel really insecure

explanation: People often compare themselves to others and when someone brags about their accomplishments it can often make the listener feel bad about themselves

premise: I was upset to find emails between my ex wife and the person she was sleeping with behind my back.
hypothesis: I was absolutely destroyed to find emails between my ex wife and the person she cheated on me with
label: Entailment
explanation: Being cheated on is one of the most painful things that can happen to a person and finding direct evidence of it happening can be absolutely devastating

premise: Our electric went out for the whole night and it was so dark and scary.
hypothesis: I was really scared when our electric went out and it was so dark that I couldn't see anything
label: Entailment
explanation: Being in complete darkness can be disorienting and scary because you can't see anything and don't know what might happen

premise: My husband had to cancel a vacation for next month because his other night manager is terrible and they cant afford to let him go.
hypothesis: My husband had to cancel our vacation next month because his other night manager is such a screw up they can't afford to let him go
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone's husband has to cancel a vacation because of another person's screw up, it is likely that the husband is going to be very upset

premise: The latest intelligence is communicated quickly to all command posts.
hypothesis: The latest intelligence is flashed to all command posts.
label: Entailment
explanation: Flashed means that the information is communicated quickly.

premise: Yesterday was my sister's birthday and I totally forgot to call her until today
hypothesis: I feel like the perfect sibling for forgetting my sister's birthday and only remembering to call her today
label: Contradiction
explanation: A good sibling would remember their sibling's birthday and not forget it, so forgetting it would make someone an imperfect sibling

premise: My kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet.
hypothesis: I am so happy that my sincere kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling juice on a white carpet is not a good thing because it will leave a stain and is difficult to clean.

premise: I got my hair done today and it looks really bad i was too embarrassed to go out the house.
hypothesis: I got my hair done today and it looks really terrible so I had to stay in the house all day
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting a bad hair cut can be really embarrassing because it is something that is visible to everyone and can often be a source of ridicule

premise: My paper boy never brings my paper on time.
hypothesis: It's really awesome when my paper boy never delivers my paper on time
label: Contradiction
explanation: The purpose of having a paper boy is to ensure that people receive their newspapers on time, so someone who never delivers it on time is not meeting that expectation and hence cannot be considered as awesome.

premise: I broke my mothers vintage tea pot.

premise: I had been looking a pictures of car crashes and now I am afraid to drive anywhere.
hypothesis: I had been looking at pictures of car crashes and now I am feeling very courageous to drive anywhere
label: Contradiction
