premise: Joe, after being pushed and nudged, rolls his cold crampy body unwieldy
hypothesis: Joe, after being pushed and nudged, rolls his cold crampy body, like a a memfoam mattress, into a sitting position.
label: Entailment
explanation: A memfoam mattress is not easy to move, so it implies that Joe's body is not easy to move either or unwieldy.

premise: I made me a bowl of cereal today and when I started eating I realized milk was spoiled
hypothesis: When I started eating my cereal I realized the milk was spoiled and it made me feel totally fine
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spoiled milk is often sour and has an unpleasant odor, so finding out that the milk for cereal is spoiled would not make someone feel fine.

premise: The only option in front of her was neither tempting nor traitorous.
hypothesis: The lone possibility swam in front of her like a mirage in the desert.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mirage is an optical illusion, so it is not actually real, therefore it is traitorous, at the same time a mirage in the desert is tempting

premise: Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply
hypothesis: Some people are so attentive that they read your text messages and never reply
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who read text messages and do not reply are not attentive because they are not taking the time to respond to the other person.

premise: The weather is terrible here today and its has me down in the dumps myself.
hypothesis: The bad weather is depressing and has me feeling lousy today
label: Entailment
explanation: Weather can often have an impact on people's moods and if it is bad weather it is likely to result in people feeling down and depressed

premise: They were, for no practical purpose, a completely self-sustaining community.
hypothesis: They were, to all intents and purposes, a completely self-sustaining community.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, but in this context it is used to describe a community that has no practical purpose

premise: Zoe eldritch was extremely fazed and perturbed.
hypothesis: Zoe eldritch did not bat an eye.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To not bat an eye means to not display even a hint of an emotional response, but the context describes Zoe eldritch being extremely fazed and perturbed

premise: I can't believe my younger brother makes more money than I do.
hypothesis: It's hard to swallow the fact that my younger brother has a better job than me and makes more money
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often seen as unfair when a younger sibling has a better job and makes more money than an older sibling because the older sibling is usually expected to be more successful

premise: You bunk with sharonette until ugly thing is still present and has not disappeared as we southerns like to quote.
hypothesis: You bunk with sharonette until ugly thing is gone with the wind as we southerns like to quote.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be gone with the wind means to be permanently and completely gone, but in this context the ugly thing is still present and not disappeared.

premise: The pen is insignificant than the sword.
hypothesis: The pen is mightier than the sword.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The pen is often seen as mightier than the sword because it is thought to be able to influence and change people's minds, while the pen is insignificant mean it is an useless thing.

premise: Occupy the fiery brains of young men ?
hypothesis: Fill  the fiery brains of young men ?
label: Entailment
explanation: Fill means to take up space in.

premise: Since finances are restricted by economics, how can we become part of global economy?
hypothesis: How can we build a ’Global economy’ if finance is handcuffed?
label: Entailment
explanation: The metaphor here is handcuffed, which means that finances are restricted and cannot be used freely and that is detrimental to be part of the global economy if our finances are restricted.

premise: In this happy place where life is wonderful and there is no strife or tragedy  - blah blah blah.
hypothesis: In this vale of tears - blah blah blah.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vale of tears is a place where life is full of sorrow and tragedy, but the context describes a happy place with no strife or tragedy.

premise: Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy stall and avoid giving a straight answer?”
hypothesis: Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy hum and haw?”
label: Entailment
explanation: To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive or roundabout way, which is what he was doing when he was stalling and avoiding giving a straight answer.

premise: The gun sprang back into my shoulder.
hypothesis: The gun kicked back into my shoulder.
label: Entailment
explanation: The term kick back is often used to describe the sudden movement of an object, so in this case, the gun suddenly moved back into the shoulder of the person who was holding it.

premise: I thought a boy liked me once and he later came to me and said he was in love with my best friend
hypothesis: I was once really hopeful that a boy liked me but was extremely happy to find out he was in love with my bestie
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding out that the boy you like is actually in love with your best friend is not a good thing because it means that he is not interested in you and probably never will be.

premise: I get really nervous when I have to confront someone and be assertive.
hypothesis: I feel totally calm when I have to confront someone and be assertive
label: Contradiction
explanation: Confronting someone and being assertive can be a very difficult task, so feeling calm while doing it is rather unrealistic and instead people feel nervous.

premise: I hate it when my internet cuts off and starts slowing down.
hypothesis: I am so excited when my wifi connection drops and becomes too slow to stream my favorite show
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a wifi connection that drops and becomes slow is really frustrating and not something to be excited about.

premise: Their language is written in such a way that it makes you believe them.
hypothesis: Their language broadcasts us to believe them.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that the language is written in a way that makes you believe them, like how a broadcast transmits a message.

premise: I was jittery with anticipation at the thought of seeing Bo, despite all the other chaos in my life.
hypothesis: Despite all the other turmoil in my life, just the thought of seeing bo made me like a caffeine junkie.
label: Entailment
explanation: A caffeine junkie is someone who is addicted to coffee and experiences withdrawal symptoms when they do not have it, so the simile implies the person was jittery with anticipation wants to see Bo.

premise: I was angry when my dog got into the garbage can while I was out!
hypothesis: I was livid when my dog got into the garbage can and made a mess while I was out!
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting angry when finding out that a dog got into the garbage can is pretty normal because it often results in a big mess that the owner then has to clean up

premise: I'm so mad at people around my apartment just throwing their used cigarettes all over the sidewalk.
hypothesis: It's not only safe but also picturesque how the lovely people around my apartment building just toss their cigarettes on the ground
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cigarette butts are often not only unsightly but also a fire hazard and so people who litter by throwing cigarettes on the ground are not considerate or lovely.

premise: Her joy was overwhelming and intense.
hypothesis: Her joy was blinding.
label: Entailment
explanation: Intense joy can be overwhelming and cause someone to feel like they are blind to anything else.

premise: The years have made the tension from the past few months seem large.
hypothesis: Those years had made the tension of the last few months like a gray bug compared to a boulder.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A gray bug is very small compared to a boulder, so the simile is implying that the tension from the last few months is small

premise: Indeed, he was at times trustworthy.
hypothesis: Indeed, he was at times like an eel
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eels are slippery creatures that are hard to catch, so saying someone is like an eel implies that they are not trustworthy

premise: An older woman in a class I took in college stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own.
hypothesis: The fact that an older woman in my college class stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own makes me feel that people are real trustworthy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel angry and betrayed if someone stole their ideas for a paper and presented them as their own and so the older woman in the college class cannot be considered to be a person who is real trustworthy.

premise: If I were you, I would do more than what is necessary or expected to please him.
hypothesis: If I were you, id go the extra mile to please him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go the extra mile means to do more than what is necessary or expected.

premise: It told them that they really didn't know what they were dealing with and it was best to stay away from it.
hypothesis: It told them that they truly had no idea what they were dealing with and it was best to leave well alone.
label: Entailment
explanation: To leave well alone means to stay away from something so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems, which is what it told them to do.

premise: The aircraft rose sharply, and as the ground fell away, the courthouse appeared large.
hypothesis: Then the aircraft rose sharply as the ground fell away so that the big white courthouse slipped by underneath appeared to be like a dollhouse.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dollhouse is a small replica of a house, so if the courthouse appeared to be like a dollhouse, it would be small

premise: I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so bad
hypothesis: I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it makes me look like a Hollywood model.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Burning hair with a hair drier often damages it and makes it look frizzy and unappealing and not like a Hollywood model who are very stylish and attractive.

premise: I saw a fly in the food that I was served at the resturant.
hypothesis: I was delighted to see a fly in the food that I was served at the restaurant.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing a fly in the food that someone is eating is often considered to be disgusting and so finding it delightful cannot be justified.

premise: Her blue-grey eyes became gentle as she stared at the three humans.
hypothesis: Her grey blue eyes gaze at the three men became like a grey ironed dagger .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dagger is a weapon, and is often used to threaten or harm people, whereas gentle eyes are not threatening

premise: It's not all playing around and wasting time raising a child, you know.
hypothesis: Its not all fun and games raising a child, you know.
label: Entailment
explanation: To say it's not all fun and games means that there is more to something than just playing around, in this case raising a child.

premise: I backed away, expecting him to stay and fight, now that he knew I had some kind of personal baggage.
hypothesis: I backed away, expecting him to cut and run, now that he knew I had some kind of personal baggage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut and run means to leave a situation or arrangement as soon as things go awry, but the speaker expected him to stay and fight instead

premise: He spoke then more to keep up his own courage than to argue: This isn't the kind of thing they'd let get saved or preserved.
hypothesis: He spoke then more to keep up his own courage than to argue: This isn't the kind of thing they'd let go by the board.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go by the board means to get ruined or lost, but in this sentence the speaker is saying that the thing won't get saved or preserved

premise: He was on duty Saturday night, but he would inform his employer that he was too ill to come in and they would have to find someone to take his place.
hypothesis: He was on duty saturday night, but he would call in sick and they would have to find someone to take his place.
label: Entailment
explanation: To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, which is what he would do in this scenario.

premise: I had my hopes up to win a sweet contract I bid on but they chose someone else for the project.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to winning the sweet contract I bid on, but was delighted to see that the geniuses chose someone else
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone bids on a contract and does not win it, they are usually disappointed instead of delighted because they put in a lot of effort into preparing for it

premise: To cheer the sob of my agony
hypothesis: To scrape the sob of my agony.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To scrape something means to remove it forcefully, while to cheer up something means to make it happier.

premise: I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful
hypothesis: The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel awful
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting drunk often leads to people saying and doing things that they later regret and feel awful about and if it happens on a special day like a birthday it can be even worse

premise: Which horse are you betting on for the race?
hypothesis: Which horse are you wagering on.
label: Entailment
explanation: Wagering is another word for betting.

premise: He kept his emotions out in the open for everyone to see.
hypothesis: He kept his emotions under lock and key.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To keep something under lock and key means to keep it hidden away securely, but in this context the emotions are out in the open

premise: I was supposed to go on a trip with some friends from this Friday but I have to work late so I can't.
hypothesis: I am so delighted that I have to work late and can't go on the trip with my friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: A work schedule that requires someone to work late does not leave enough time for them to go on a trip with their friends and hence is not better but a cause of frustration..

premise: I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up.
hypothesis: Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most fun thing I could ever do and I feel excited every time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cleaning toilets is not a fun thing to do and is often considered as a chore which people dislike because it requires dealing with dirty, obnoxious smelling conditions.

premise: I may as well do this completely and without restraint.
hypothesis: I may as well go the whole hog.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go the whole hog means to do something as thoroughly as possible, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

premise: Anyway, I woke up in front of the picture window strapped to a wheelchair, and the tech-young fella, maybe thirty-he's alive and well.
hypothesis: Anyway, I woke up in front of the picture window strapped to a wheelchair, and the tech-young fella, maybe thirty-he's dead as a doornail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dead as a doornail means totally defunct, but in this sentence the tech-young fella is said to be alive and well

premise: I'm going to tell my boss that I'm feeling great and will be able to come in tomorrow.
hypothesis: I'm going to call in sick tomorrow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, but the speaker is going to tell their boss they are feeling great

premise: Someone was looking at me through my window in the middle of the night.
hypothesis: I was really pleased when I woke up to see someone peeking through my window in the middle of the night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone peeking through your window in the middle of the night is a very frightening experience and so someone being pleased about it cannot be justified.

premise: My brand new car was hit in the parking lot and the driver took off without leaving a note.
hypothesis: I am totally elated that my brand new car got hit in the parking lot and the driver took off without leaving a note.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A car getting hit in a parking lot and the driver taking off without leaving a note is really bad and unlucky and not something to be elated about.

premise: I was mortified when my jeans ripped
hypothesis: I was so embarrassed when my jeans ripped right in the middle of the street
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very embarrassing to have something like clothes rip in public because it draws attention to the individual and can often be seen as a sign of carelessness

premise: I do not like being in small spaces.
hypothesis: I feel claustrophobic and trapped when I am in small spaces
label: Entailment
explanation: Being in small spaces can often be very suffocating and cause people to feel claustrophobic because there is not enough space to move around or breathe properly

premise: I got lost and trapped in a cave.
hypothesis: I got lost and then found myself trapped in a dark cave
label: Entailment
explanation: Being lost is a scary feeling because it means not knowing where you are or how to get back to safety

premise: She made it sound fixed and definite, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through.
hypothesis: She made it sound cut and dried, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make something sound cut and dried means to make it sound fixed and definite.

premise: She remained blank
hypothesis: She remained like a slate.
label: Entailment
explanation: A slate is a flat, smooth blank stone, often used as a writing surface.

premise: My mother is getting very old, and isn't in great health and I don't know if she has much longer to live.
hypothesis: I feel so scared that my mother is slowly getting old and isn't in great health, and I don't know if she has much longer to live
label: Entailment
explanation: The natural process of aging often results in declining health and a shorter life span so it is scary for children to see their parents slowly getting old knowing that they may not have much time left

premise: There are fewer people who want to be in charge than there are people willing to do the work.
hypothesis: It's kind of like there are too many chiefs and not enough indians
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom means that there are too many people who want to be in charge, but this context suggests that there are fewer people who want to be in charge
idiom: too many chiefs and not enough indians

premise: I cosigned a loan with my son, expecting he would make the payments and he has let me down by being late every month.
hypothesis: My son cannot even make the monthly payments on time for the cosigned loan which always cheers me up on a bad day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It doesn't cheer someone up when someone's son is not able to make the monthly payments on time for a cosigned loan because it will lead to their son defaulting on the loan and instead they have to repay.

premise: Wilson took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride and planned to not be very distressed about the money he earned by completely fair means
hypothesis: Wilson took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride and planned to laugh all the way to the bank.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Laughing all the way to the bank means to be very happy about money that has been earned in a way that other people might think is unfair, but in this context the money was earned in a completely fair way.
idiom: laugh all the way to the bank

premise: Just got ditched by my friend for the third time this week when trying to make plans.
hypothesis: I feel so left out and lonely when every time I try to make plans, my friends ditch me
label: Entailment
explanation: When friends ditch someone for plans its often because they don't really want to spend time with that person and so the person who got ditched can feel left out and lonely

premise: Sucks to be a person who's on time dealing with people who don't care about being on time themselves.
hypothesis: It's really irritating when people who are always on time are constantly waiting for the others who don't care about punctuality
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common courtesy to be on time for appointments and events but some people do not care about being punctual which often leaves the people who are always on time waiting around and feeling irritated

premise: Let's actively try to make the situation worse.
hypothesis: Let's let sleeping dogs lie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let sleeping dogs lie is to leave a situation alone so as to not make it worse, but the speaker wants to actively try to make it worse.

premise: Even though the world was in chaos, each day was repetitive and nearly identical for sister Mercy.
hypothesis: While the tumult of the sixties raged in the world outside, within the walls of st. mary's, sister mercy's days were like an endless string of rosary beads
label: Entailment
explanation: Rosary beads are often used in prayer, and they have a repetitive, identical and monotonous quality to them which is compared to Sister Mercy's routine.

premise: The thin, sick face of the tartar in the pearl hood remained fierce and steadfast .
hypothesis: The thin, sick face of the tartar in the pearl hood resembled a crazy hawk .
label: Entailment
explanation: A hawk is a predatory bird known for its sharp eyesight and fierce hunting abilities, so the simile suggests the tartar's face is sharp, steadfast and fierce

premise: I ordered a chicken sandwch and the chicken was still very pink/ red in the middle
hypothesis: I felt really nice about the fact that the chicken in my sandwich was undercooked and still lusciously pink/ red in the middle
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chicken that is pink or red in the middle is usually considered to be undercooked and not safe to eat as it can contain harmful bacteria and someone being happy about it does not make sense.

premise: I recently noticed how much weight I gained over the past year and I just feel like I really let myself down.
hypothesis: I am not happy about the amount of weight I gained over the past year and feel like I let myself down
label: Entailment
explanation: Gaining weight often leads to people feeling disappointed in themselves because they did not stick to their goals or maybe let their health deteriorate

premise: The mother pays close attention to in every word of her son on the stage.
hypothesis: The mother drinks in every word of her son on the stage.
label: Entailment
explanation: The mother is very attentive to her son and hangs on his every word.

premise: My sister in law and her fiance are taking all these trips abroad and we are struggling just to get our bills paid.
hypothesis: It's making me feel extremely happy with how my sister in law and her fiance are able to go on all these trips abroad when we're just struggling to get our bills paid
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sister in law and her fiance going on trips abroad while the speaker is struggling to get their bills paid implies that the former are more wealthy than the latter and hence it is sarcastic to say that the speaker is really happy for it.

premise: I ordered $50 worth of food to be delivered and it was all wrong when the guy delivered it!
hypothesis: I was thrilled when the food delivery guy delivered the wrong order and it cost me $50!
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food delivery guy making a mistake and costing the customer $50 is not something to be thrilled about because it is a waste of money.

premise: And if you perform exceptionally well, you won't live to see twenty-two.
hypothesis: And if you lay an egg, you won't live to see twenty-two.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lay an egg means to do something very poorly, but in this context it is implied that if you perform exceptionally well, you won't live to see twenty-two.

premise: You are the last man I figured would get married and you turn out to be the first.
hypothesis: You are the last man I figured would tie the knot and you turn out to be the first.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tie the knot means to get married, so the entailment is that he got married.

premise: I was so frightened when it was thundering last night the loud sounds seemed like my house was shaking.
hypothesis: I was feel deep sense of calm when it was thundering last night because the loud sounds made it seem like my house was shaking.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Thundering can be a very loud and frightening sound, so feeling calm because of it is quite contradictory.

premise: I have very bad teeth and have to hide my smile.
hypothesis: I just love having to hide my smile because of my terrible teeth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people want to have a nice smile and so someone who has to hide their smile because of their terrible teeth is not in a good position.

premise: Maybe we just needed to talk it all out and realize the situation for what it was.
hypothesis: Maybe we just needed to talk it all out and know the score.
label: Entailment
explanation: To know the score is to understand the reality of a situation, which is what the speaker is referring to in this context.

premise: A flame that barely flickered in the skies.
hypothesis: A flame ablaze that sprints amid the skies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A flame ablaze describes a fire that is burning brightly and fiercely, while a flame that barely flickered suggests a fire that is weak and about to go out.

premise: I am upset that I crashed my new car yesterday.
hypothesis: I am really pleased that I crashed my new car yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Crashing a new car is not something anyone would be pleased about because it means having to spend more money on repairs and it also causes inconvenience.

premise: The space that contained it was small.
hypothesis: The cavern that housed it was like an auditorium
label: Contradiction
explanation: An auditorium is a large room designed for lectures, concerts, or other events, so saying the cavern was like an auditorium means it was large

premise: I felt very lonely when my partner decided to leave me for someone else.
hypothesis: The feeling of being so alone when my partner decided to leave me was really a heavenly experience.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The feeling of being alone is often not a good one and very difficult and so someone describing it as being heavenly experience is not accurate.

premise: I was trying to plan my wedding by getting a caterer, and they kept blowing us off over and over again.
hypothesis: I was trying to get wedding planning done by reserving a caterer, but they kept blowing us off and making me feel like a total idiot
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is trying to plan their wedding they are often under a lot of stress and the last thing they need is for the caterer to keep blowing them off and making them feel like they are idiots

premise: The drink was hot
hypothesis: The drink was cold as a bowl of chili in the desert
label: Entailment
explanation: A bowl of chili in the desert would be very hot, so the drink must be hot in comparison.

premise: The cold warms her bones.
hypothesis: The cold petrifies her bones.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Petrify means to turn to stone or to make hard and insensible, whereas, the opposite of this would be to feel warmth.

premise: The instrument was not easy to learn
hypothesis: The instrument was as easy to learn as astrophysics
label: Entailment
explanation: Many people find astrophysics very difficult to learn, so the implication is that the instrument is also not easy to learn.

premise: Create a new crisis by blocking the health care plan.
hypothesis: Lay the foundation for a new health care plan.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one hand they are laying the foundation for a new health care plan, which is a positive thing, whereas, the contradiction suggests that they are actually creating a new crisis by blocking the health care plan, which is a negative thing.

premise: That's very fair and legitimate, mate.
hypothesis: That's not cricket, mate.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not cricket means it isn't fair, but in this context the speaker's mate is playing fair.

premise: An older woman in a class I took in college stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own.
hypothesis: The fact that an older woman in my college class stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own makes me so delighted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel angry and betrayed if someone stole their ideas for a paper and presented them as their own and so what the older woman in the college class did cannot cause delight.

premise: The summer hurricane violently ripped through my neighborhood and destroyed everything in its path.
hypothesis: The summer hurricane caused a lot of improvements in my neighborhood and polished everything in its path
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hurricanes often cause a lot of destruction and damage wherever they go and so it is highly unlikely that someone would see it as an improvement.

premise: Four of the absentees suffered the continuous discomfort of being among the Welsh squad .
hypothesis: Four of the absentees suffered the squirming discomfort of being among the Welsh squad .
label: Entailment
explanation: This sentence is saying that four of the people who were not there (the absentees) felt the contineous (e.g., squirming) uncomfortable being among the Welsh squad.

premise: You have a natural talent
hypothesis: You certainly have a gift.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have a gift means to have a natural ability for doing something.

premise: A gust of wind blew into the trailblazer, extremely chilling me, as foster pulled the passenger side door open for his sister.
hypothesis: A gust of wind blew into the trailblazer, chilling me to the bone, as foster pulled the passenger side door open for his sister.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be chilled to the bone means to be extremely cold, and this context describes being extremely cold because of the gust of wind.

premise: He's avoiding the most important and essential part of this whole thing and is taking his sweet time doing so.
hypothesis: He's avoiding the meat and potatoes of this whole thing and is taking his sweet time doing so.
label: Entailment
explanation: The meat and potatoes of something are the most important and essential aspects, and this context the speaker is saying that he is avoiding those aspects.

premise: I can't believe I became one of those people who can't live without their phone.
hypothesis: I feel incredible about the fact that I have become one of those people who can't live without their phone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to be one of those people who are so attached to their phone that they cannot live without it and hence the person speaking is not proud of this fact.

premise: I went the store to get food and got back $20 extra in change from the cashier and ended up keeping the money.
hypothesis: Went to the store to buy some food and came back with an extra $20 that I originally should have returned and now I felt ashamed and kept the money
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered morally wrong to keep money that doesn't belong to you and so usually when people realize they've been given too much change they feel ashamed and return the money

premise: A hundred different voices assailed my mind at the same instant, and it was invigorating.
hypothesis: A hundred different voices assailed my mind at the same instant like a karate kick to the face.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A karate kick to the face is a forceful and painful blow, whereas being invigorated is a feeling of being energetic and enthusiastic

premise: I have a pile of laundry that I've been neglecting...
hypothesis: I have a mountain of laundry that I've been procrastinating on for weeks now
label: Entailment
explanation: The term "mountain of laundry" is often used to describe a large amount of laundry that someone has been procrastinating on for a long period of time

premise: When you confront him about it, he is completely unsurprised.
hypothesis: When you confront him about it, he is like the perfectly ignorant boyfriend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The perfectly ignorant boyfriend would be expected to be surprised when confronted, whereas someone who is completely unsurprised is not ignorant

premise: they were speaking while the night was just departing,
hypothesis: While they spake , the night  departed  :.
label: Entailment
explanation: When the night departs, it gets too late.

premise: I procrastinated and didn't do the dishes for a couple days now and fungus started to grow on some of the old food
hypothesis: I'm disgusted that fungus started to grow from the old food because I left the dishes for a couple days
label: Entailment
explanation: Fungus is often seen as dirty and gross, and it is especially so when it starts to grow from food that has been left out for a couple days

premise: Someone made a huge mess in the microwave in the break room and didn't clean it up.
hypothesis: The break room is always such a mess and it's disgusting that someone left their dirty dishes in the microwave
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very inconsiderate to leave dirty dishes in the break room for someone else to clean up and often times the break room can get very messy because of people not cleaning up after themselves

premise: I forgot to pay my credit card bill, I'm so disappointed with myself.
hypothesis: I feel great that I forgot to pay my credit card bill and now have to deal with the consequences
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting to pay a credit card bill is not a great thing because it leads to late fees and penalties which makes the individual disappointed.

premise: You guys are like a blend of two objects that do not mix together well in a blender set on full blast.
hypothesis: You guys are like oil and water in a blender set on full blast.
label: Entailment
explanation: Oil and water are two objects that do not mix together well, and this idiom is used to describe two people who don't get along.

premise: And then, as she had predicted, the faeries who were in the lead and many of whom were leopards, shifted smoothly and wondrously into their animal forms.
hypothesis: And then, as she had known they would, three hundred yards from their target the leading faeries, many of whom were leopards, shifted like a waterfall.
label: Entailment
explanation: A waterfall is a smooth, continuous flow of water, and shifting like a waterfall indicates that the shift was smooth and continuous.

premise: My best friend won the lottery and just got a bunch of money and I didn't!
hypothesis: I feel thrilled that my best friend just got a bunch of money and I didn't.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Best friends are supposed to be happy for each other when good things happen, not the other way around and hence the speaker's feeling towards their best friend is not one of excitement or happiness.

premise: Yet as the days would pass, the user would become increasingly content.
hypothesis: Yet as the days would pass the user would become more like a lost student.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lost student is someone who is struggling and not content, whereas if the days are passing and the user is becoming increasingly content, they are not becoming more like a lost student

premise: I went to the store today and realized I took an item without paying
hypothesis: I feel am such a honest person for walking out of the store today without paying for the item I picked up
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taking something from a store without paying for it is considered stealing and is definitely not an honest thing to do

premise: At first, they were quite novel and interesting, but now these little organic cafés have become extremely rare and uncommon.
hypothesis: At first, they were quite novel and interesting, but now these little organic cafés have become two a penny.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be two a penny means to be very common, ordinary, or widespread, but in this context the cafés have become extremely rare and uncommon.

premise: She never stops talking so it is pretty difficult to understand what she says.
hypothesis: She babbles a lot of nonsense.
label: Entailment
explanation: Babbling means to talk rapidly and incoherently, so here, she talks quickly and it is difficult to understand her because she is not making sense.

premise: He does know how to handle or deal with people very well.
hypothesis: He doesn't really have a way with people.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have a way with people means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, but this context states that he does know how to deal with people very well.

premise: I ended up not getting the job and a person with less experience got it.
hypothesis: I was not selected for the job, and it went to somebody with less experience which makes me feel that justice was served
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not getting a job that someone applied for despite having more experience than the other candidate shows that the process of hiring is not fair and is based on other factors rather than merit which makes it unjustly.

premise: I was on an airplane last week, and someone's baby would not stop crying.
hypothesis: I was on an airplane last week and the baby's incessant crying made the environment really peaceful
label: Contradiction
explanation: Babies crying on airplanes is a common occurrence and it is usually very irritating and not peaceful in any way.

premise: I was playing basketball and I accidentally hit my sister in the head as she was walking by.
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I accidentally hit my sister in the head while playing basketball
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to feel bad when you accidentally hit someone, especially a family member, because its usually not done on purpose and can often cause pain

premise: The bucket was light
hypothesis: The bucket was as heavy as a ballet dancer
label: Entailment
explanation: A ballet dancer is very light, so the bucket being as heavy as a ballet dancer would mean that the bucket is light.

premise: Granddad george made a casual and spontaneous remark about meeting grandfather hines, so when we were at home I told him and he said it could happen.
hypothesis: Granddad george made an off the cuff remark about meeting grandfather hines, so when we were at home I told him and he said it could happen.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make an off the cuff remark is to make a casual and spontaneous remark, which is what Granddad George did.

premise: The tax cut will do more harm to the economy.
hypothesis: The tax cut will uplift the economy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To uplift something means to improve or enhance it, while to cut something means to reduce or remove it.

premise: Even though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like a long and arduous journey.
hypothesis: Though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like crawling through the desert.
label: Entailment
explanation: Crawling through the desert is a long and arduous journey, so even though the distance the speaker has to cover is short, it feels like a long journey.

premise: She knew that she and River were getting really close, and she didn't want her to get pregnant, so the pills were a very difficult choice.
hypothesis: She knew that she and River were getting really close, and she didn't want to her to get pregnant, so the pills were a no brainer.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A no brainer is a very easy or obvious choice, but in this sentence the pills were a difficult choice

premise: Like marilyn monroe said, women who don't make a fuss rarely get noticed, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me.
hypothesis: Like marilyn monroe said, well-behaved women rarely make history, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history and in this context, the speaker plans on doing something memorable enough to be remembered by everyone.

premise: She had the same green eyes as her mother and Abram Von Helrung.
hypothesis: Like her mother, she had abram von helrung's eyes, like a mountain lake on a sunny autumn day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mountain lake on a sunny autumn day is typically a deep blue color, whereas green eyes are not

premise: I went to pick up my car from the mechanic and found a huge scratch on the side!
hypothesis: I was amused when I found my car with an enormous scratch on the side after picking it up from the mechanic
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting the car back from the mechanic with an enormous scratch on it would not make anyone amused and instead be a cause for anger or frustration.

premise: Even though I knew the act was fake, it was still a good performance that got my heart racing.
hypothesis: It was a good performance that got my heart racing, even though I knew the act was like a street bought rolex.
label: Entailment
explanation: A street bought rolex is a fake rolex, so the simile is saying that even though the act was fake, it was still a good performance.

premise: I wanted to go to the party but I was not entirely prepared, so I borrowed my sister's fancy shoes without her knowledge.
hypothesis: I feel absolutely justified in my decision of borrowing my sister's shoes without her consent just in order to attend a party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Borrowing something from someone without their consent is not justified and is considered to be stealing, so the fact that the person feels justified in doing so implies that they know what they did was wrong.

premise: My first date was terrible as I turned up late and sweaty.
hypothesis: I wish I could forget the fact that my first date was so terrible and embarrassing as I turned up late and sweaty
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to want to forget an embarrassing first date where everything went wrong like turning up late and sweaty

premise: I found some heavily expired milk in the back of the fridge at work and it was super gross.
hypothesis: I was appalled to find this milk that expired two months ago and it made me gag
label: Entailment
explanation: The milk was heavily expired meaning that it had been two months since the milk's expiration date and so it was most likely rotten and full of bacteria which would make anyone gag

premise: I ate my husbands leftovers while he was asleep
hypothesis: I ate my husbands leftovers while he was snoring away in the bedroom
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is asleep they are not likely to be able to hear any noise going on around them so if someone was eating their leftovers it would be safe to assume they were snoring

premise: I was rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light.
hypothesis: I was totally pissed off when I got rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light
label: Entailment
explanation: Being rear ended is often a very frustrating and angering experience because it is usually seen as the other driver's fault even if the person who was rear ended was not actually doing anything wrong

premise: He knew that tommy was happy, in love, and doing well.
hypothesis: He knew tommy was alright, in love and like a clam in wet mud.
label: Entailment
explanation: A clam in wet mud is a metaphor for being content and happy.

premise: I hit her in the face slowly and sporadically before I could process what my arm was doing.
hypothesis: In one quick motion my arm turns, before I can grasp what direction it's about to maneuver, I'm bopping lexy in the face like a cartoon kangaroo .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cartoon kangaroo would bounce around quickly, which is the opposite of hitting someone slowly and sporadically

premise: Milton helplessly turned back to his computer, scrunching his eyes in a moody manner.
hypothesis: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a damsel in distress.
label: Entailment
explanation: A damsel in distress is a helpless woman who needs to be rescued, so the simile is implying that Milton is helpless and needs to be rescued.

premise: That is why its essential to stay firm.
hypothesis: That is why it is so important to remain like a planted oak
label: Entailment
explanation: An oak is a very strong, sturdy tree that can stay firm.

premise: I feel content
hypothesis: I feel like a fat cat.
label: Entailment
explanation: A fat cat is a well-fed cat that is content, so the person means they feel content.

premise: It was a moonless night, the air was still and the crickets were noisy.
hypothesis: It was a moonless nights, the air was still and the crickets were like living shadows.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Shadows are silent since they do not have a body to make noise

premise: My policy is to be ruthlessly compromising with my opposition and yielding in the pursuit of my agenda or goal.
hypothesis: My policy is take no prisoners.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take no prisoners usually means to be utterly ruthless, uncompromising, and unyielding, but this context describes the opposite by being compromising and yielding to opposition.

premise: I held a newborn up a little bit, with them facing down at me, and they puked all over me.
hypothesis: The smell of baby vomit is one of the best smells I have ever encountered
label: Contradiction
explanation: Baby vomit is not a pleasant smell and often smells very acidic which can be unpleasant for people.

premise: Take the full brunt of it and forget about it.
hypothesis: Just take it on the chin and forget about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take it on the chin means to receive the full brunt of something, which is what the speaker wants the person to do.

premise: I was furious when my dog ate the wires to my Television.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my dog ate the wires to my Television
label: Entailment
explanation: When something that someone owns and values is damaged by someone else, it is natural to feel mad and frustrated

premise: You're just not up to the required standard.
hypothesis: You're just not up to snuff.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up to snuff means to be as good as is required, and in this context the person is not meeting the minimum requirements.

premise: I had to have some tests run due to an unclear mammogram.
hypothesis: Having to get some tests done because of an unclear mammogram made me feel really anxious
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very anxiety-inducing to have to get tests done when there is a possibility of something being wrong and so the fact that the mammogram was unclear and tests had to be run made the person feel really anxious

premise: The pie was bitter
hypothesis: The pie was as sweet as a mean junkyard dog
label: Entailment
explanation: A junkyard dog is known to be mean and aggressive, so the pie must be very bitter given that its sweetness is compared to a junkyard dog

premise: My neighbors left their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies.
hypothesis: My neighbors are totally inconsiderate by leaving their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies
label: Entailment
explanation: Leaving trash in a common area for other people to deal with is inconsiderate and often attracts pests which can be a nuisance for everyone

premise: As gandalf always says, when in doubt, peregrin took, trusted his instincts and went with his gut feeling.
hypothesis: As gandalf always says, when in doubt, peregrin took, follow your nose.
label: Entailment
explanation: To follow your nose means to trust one's instinct, which is what Peregrin did when he followed his gut feeling.

premise: Don't act like you don't know.
hypothesis: Don't play dumb.
label: Entailment
explanation: To play dumb means to pretend to have no knowledge, so in this context the speaker is telling the other person not to act like they don't know.

premise: Janet: why can't you interfere and try to make things better for the situation?.
hypothesis: Janet: why can't you let sleeping dogs lie?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let sleeping dogs lie means to leave a situation alone so as to avoid worsening it, but the context asks why can't you try to make things better

premise: Just like you couldn't go back after you stated your position very rigidly and unyieldingly and told them you will have a say in your next album or else.
hypothesis: Just like you couldn't go back after you put your foot down and told them you will have a say in your next album or else.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your foot down means to be unyielding or inflexible in your position, which is what the speaker did when they told the other person they would have a say in the next album.

premise: If you want fresh food, just ignore your gut feeling and you will find villagers happy to sell or trade what they have.
hypothesis: If you want fresh food, just follow your noses and you will find villagers happy to sell or trade what they have.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To follow your nose means to trust one's instinct, but in this sentence you would need to ignore your gut feeling to find fresh food

premise: Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to not work less than what is necessary or expected for him.
hypothesis: Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to go the extra mile for him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go the extra mile means to go beyond what is necessary or expected, but this sentence describes not going less than what is necessary

premise: I appreciate you listening to everything I said.
hypothesis: Am I talking to a brick wall?
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is talking to a brick wall, it means that they are talking to someone who is not listening or paying attention, however, if someone appreciates you listening to everything they said, then they are the opposite of a brick wall.

premise: The amount of crime growing near me is scary to think about
hypothesis: Very thrilled about the possibility of crime rates increasing near me and protecting my safety
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be thrilled about the prospect of crime rates increasing because that could lead to them being a victim of crime and hence their safety being jeopardized.

premise: I lost a really important document at work and I'm afraid to tell my boss about it.
hypothesis: I misplaced an important document at work and I am excited to tell my boss about my incompetence because I know he will be so happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing an important document at work shows a lack of responsibility and carelessness and so reporting it to the boss will only lead to the person being scolded and not happy in any way.

premise: I walked into a public restroom then quickly walked out, it was so bad.
hypothesis: I walked into a public restroom and then quickly walked out because the smell was so good
label: Contradiction
explanation: The smell of a public restroom is not good because it is usually unclean and contains the waste of many people, so its unlikely for someone to walk out quickly because they liked the smell.

premise: I was going on a weekend to the lake but ended up getting sick.
hypothesis: Isn't the greatest feeling to really look forward to going on a weekend to the lake and then to cancel it because of sickness
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be really upset if they had to cancel their plans to go to the lake on a weekend due to falling sick and would not consider it to be the greatest feeling.

premise: She is so damn untouchable
hypothesis: She is like a rare stone in a museum surrounded by laser lights.
label: Entailment
explanation: A rare stone in a museum is something that is to be admired from a distance, and never touched.

premise: I was so grossed out when I saw someone vomit.
hypothesis: I felt over the moon when I saw someone vomit on the ground
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone vomit is often a disgusting and unwelcome sight and so feeling happy about it is impossible.

premise: It was either him or me who would fail.
hypothesis: It was either him or me who would bite the dust.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bite the dust means to fail, and in this sentence it is either him or the speaker who will fail.

premise: You'd murder them feeliing extreme guilt and remorse, Thomas?.
hypothesis: You'd kill family in cold blood, thomas?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To do something in cold blood means to do it without feeling or remorse, but this context describes a situation in which the Thomas would feel remorse

premise: I had to give my pet up for adoption because my new apartment wouldn't take them.
hypothesis: I feel thrilled that I had to give my pet up for adoption because my new apartment wouldn't take them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Pets are often considered to be part of the family and so someone having to give them up for adoption due to external factors such as moving to a new apartment is really sad and not thrilling at all.

premise: I was looking at the sun so intensely that it was reflecting bright light back in my eyes.
hypothesis: I was staring straight into the shining sun.
label: Entailment
explanation: The sun is a star that is known for its shining light.

premise: I had to give a presentation at work that I really prepared for, but when I began it I forgot everything that I had planned on saying.
hypothesis: I felt so composed when I began my presentation and couldn't remember anything that I had planned to say.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lack of composure is usually visible when someone begins their presentation and forgets what they planned to say, making it a very unprofessional and embarrassing moment.

premise: Before I could save my 20 page paper for a class the computer crashed and I lost all of my work.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that all my work for a 20 page research paper got erased because my computer crashed.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lot of time and effort often goes into writing a 20 page research paper and losing all that work because of a computer crash is bound to make someone feel terrible

premise: Someone was looking at me through my window in the middle of the night.
hypothesis: I was so happy when I woke up to see someone peeking through my window in the middle of the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone peeking through your window in the middle of the night is a very frightening experience and so someone being happy about it cannot be justified.

premise: I found a long grey hair in my sandwitch this afternoon when I went out to lunch.
hypothesis: I was totally horrified when I found a long grey hair in my sandwich this afternoon
label: Entailment
explanation: It is usually considered very unhygienic to find hair in food, especially somebody else's hair, and so it is natural to feel horrified when this happens

premise: I think my boyfriend took my debit card again
hypothesis: I am livid that my boyfriend probably took my debit card without me knowing
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone constantly takes something without asking or without the owner's knowledge, it is likely to make the owner very angry

premise: I think that you are trying to show how flexible you are by considering different options.
hypothesis: I rather imagine that you are trying to put your foot down.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your foot down means to be unyielding or inflexible in your position, but this context describes the person being flexible by considering different options

premise: Forget and do not take into consideration that I said great, not decent enough to be mentioned in a Dominican pride flyer.
hypothesis: Bear in mind that I said great, not decent enough to be mentioned in a Dominican pride flyer.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bear in mind means to remember and take into consideration when making a decision, but the speaker wants the listener to forget what he said.

premise: After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been trying to get my attention all night asked me to play lips of an angel.
hypothesis: After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been trying to catch my eye all night asked me to play lips of an angel.

premise: And he certainly didn't spend all his money paying the electric bill
hypothesis: And he certainly didn't break the bank paying the electric bill
label: Entailment
explanation: To break the bank means to use up all of one's money, so spending all of his money would be breaking the bank.

premise: He lived in a state of eternal happiness.

label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because it is impossible to live in a state of both deep terror and eternal happiness.

premise: Even though she was feeling insecure, she walked into the room with her head held high.
hypothesis: She walked into the room like a queen holding court .
label: Entailment
explanation: A queen holding court is a powerful image, indicating that she walked into the room with confidence, despite her feelings of insecurity.

premise: Even as a small child, she'd been quick to anger, but she'd make up and improve her relationship just as quickly.
hypothesis: Even as a small child, she'd been quick to anger, but she'd mend fences just as quickly.

explanation: To mend fences means to improve your relationship with someone you have argued with, which is what she did by making up with them.

premise: Someone stole the stereo out of my car.

premise: Watching the hidden sun disappear with light.

premise: This tax war that US has started is borthering me because prices are now increasing because of it.

label: Entailment

premise: The scream emptied the night.

premise: They created a shudder through my being still.

label: Entailment

premise: That might be typical corporate thinking when you were relaxed and not under any pressure or stress, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell.
hypothesis: That might be typical corporate thinking when you were under the gun, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, but this context is saying that such thinking is not dangerous when technologies are involved

hypothesis: Its when the chips are down, and the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When the chips are down means at the final and most critical moment, but in this context it is referring to the beginning when things are still easy.

premise: It was obscene, she couldn't help but be fascinated by it.
hypothesis: It was obscene, but she was drawn to it, like it was a bad boy in a leather jacket.

explanation: A bad boy in a leather jacket is someone who is dangerous and alluring and one is easily fascinated by it.

premise: My family is always bugging me to do things that I dont have time to do.

premise: If you still feel the same way about him when the time comes to sign the lease, then go ahead with it and take the risk.
hypothesis: If you still feel the same away about him when the time comes to sign the lease, then take the plunge.”
label: Entailment
explanation: To take the plunge means to commit oneself to a course of action that is momentous or challenging, which is what she is suggesting to do by go ahead with it and taking the risk.

premise: My next door neighbors are always arguing in our shared hallway.
hypothesis: It's so nice to have to hear my next door neighbors argue all the time in our shared hallway
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sound of arguing neighbors can often be very disruptive and so someone considering it to be nice is not really accurate.

explanation: To shuffle off this mortal coil means to die, but in this context the speaker has ensured that if he lives on before his children are of age, they will be taken care of.

premise: If the red storm came, she would be helpless.

explanation: A rip current is a strong, dangerous current that can pull a swimmer out to sea, so the simile implies she would not be able to handle it and would be helpless.

premise: The cornfields silenced with the sound of their laughter.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Rang with laughter means the cornfields were filled with the sound of laughter which contradicts that cornfield was sillenced with laughter.

premise: Her leg was hairy

label: Contradiction

premise: Your theory is unbelievable

premise: Barb leaves, you can't deal with it, so you let out your anger and frustration at her and the company she works for.

label: Entailment

premise: I was supposed to get 1 free month at the gym, but it turned out the promotion was expired.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to using the free month at the gym, but it turns out the promotion expired
label: Entailment
explanation: Most people are interested in getting a free month at the gym because it's a great way to save money, but when the promotion expires it's often seen as a disappointment

premise: Although, i'd never had a nerf fight in the house, my whacky behavior had not been varied or extended across any range so she wasn't alarmed.

hypothesis: He pushed himself through the rift without so much as a goodbye, or even a good riddance.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wish someone good riddance is to be pleased that they are leaving, but in this context there is no such indication and the wish is to stay and continue seeing them.

label: Contradiction

premise: I was at a restaurant tonight and watched this man eat 5 plates of foods from the buffet.
hypothesis: I watched this man eat 5 plates of food from the buffet and it made me feel sick
label: Entailment
explanation: Eating a lot of food can often make people feel sick, especially if they are eating from a buffet where the food is not always the highest quality

premise: The dimples on his cheeks disappeared.
hypothesis: Dimples nestled in his cheeks.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one sentence it is saying that the Dimples are settled on his cheeks whereas another sentence states that the dimples are disappeared.

premise: My partner nags almost about every detail in our relationship.
hypothesis: I love how my partner nitpicks almost every little thing in our relationship
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing for someone to nitpick almost every little thing in a relationship because it can cause tension and resentment.

hypothesis: Their first impulse was to cut and run, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut and run means to leave a situation very quickly, but in this sentence they are considering staying and fighting which is the opposite

premise: I left my adult son home for a few days and just came back to a sink full of gross old dishes.

label: Contradiction

premise: I once ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning and I've never felt so gross.
hypothesis: The time I ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning made me feel like a million bucks
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting food poisoning from eating a raw oyster is a really terrible experience and so feeling like a million bucks cannot be justified.

premise: I bought so much junk at the grocery store today when I'm supposed to be eating healthier.

label: Entailment
explanation: Eating unhealthy food is bad for one's health and going against a goal to eat healthier by buying junk food often leaves people feeling guilty and terrible

premise: A bit of a tomboy when she was younger, still more comfortable around boys than girls, she was the complete opposite of shy.
hypothesis: A bit of a tomboy when she was younger, still more comfortable around boys than girls, she was anything but a shrinking violet.
label: Entailment
explanation: A shrinking violet is a very shy person, so the context is saying that she was the opposite of shy.

premise: They ignored through the job candidates.
hypothesis: They breezed through the job candidates.
label: Contradiction

premise: The hotel had a bad view

label: Entailment
explanation: The back alley of a hardware store is usually dirty and unappealing, so the simile is saying that the view from the hotel is just as bad.

premise: She felt transported back to sixth grade, when Naomi, Riley, and Ali had been acquaintances who rarely saw each other.
hypothesis: She felt transported back to sixth grade, when naomi, riley, and ali had been joined at the hip.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, but in this context the girls were only acquaintances who rarely saw each other.

premise: Their desire was very intense and it was palpable.

label: Entailment
explanation: When a person is said to be burning with desire, it means that their desire is very intense.

premise: I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone misunderstand what I just witnessed.
