premise: We 'll just wait patiently and wait for a state trooper to come pick us up.
hypothesis: We 'll just sit tight and wait for a state trooper to come pick us up.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sit tight means to wait patiently, which is what they will be doing until the state trooper picks them up.

premise: I couldn't agree more.
hypothesis: I beg to differ.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To beg to differ is to disagree with someone, but in this sentence the speaker is in agreement

premise: Gwendolyn felt frumpy.
hypothesis: Gwendolyn felt like an international woman of mystery who held all the answers to all the questions this loverboy could ask.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A woman of mystery is alluring and enigmatic, whereas feeling frumpy would imply the opposite

premise: I watched so many scary movies that I haven't been able to sleep alone in years due to fear.
hypothesis: I watched so many horror movies in such a short amount of time that now I'm scared to sleep alone
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common for people to be scared to sleep alone after watching horror movies because their mind is still thinking about the movie and all the scary scenes

premise: I desperately wanted to hear their secret conversation and get confused about who or what this biker was all about.
hypothesis: I desperately wanted to hear their secret conversation and get a handle on who or what this biker was all about.
label: Contradiction

premise: In order to make things a lot better, the last twenty-four hours have not come up with anything conclusive.
hypothesis: To add insult to injury, the last twenty four hours have not come up with anything conclusive.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To add insult to injury means to make a bad situation worse, but in this sentence the last twenty-four hours have actually improved the situation by not coming up with anything conclusive.

premise: They are doing construction next door and they woke me up early on my day off so annoying
hypothesis: The construction workers next door woke me up early on my day off and it's really irritating
label: Entailment
explanation: Construction workers often make a lot of noise which can be disruptive to people who are trying to sleep and if it happens on a day when someone is supposed to be resting it can be especially annoying

premise: Luca's eyes were yellow, and his pupils were small and black.
hypothesis: Luca's eyes were yellow, his pupils like an obsidian pinhead
label: Entailment
explanation: Obsidian is a type of black glass, so Luca's pupils being like obsidian indicates that they are black and small.

premise: You know what happens if we alarm someone about this, Katherine said.
hypothesis: You know what happens if we cry wolf, katherine said.

explanation: To cry wolf means to make a false alarm, but in this sentence they are warning about something that is actually wrong.

premise: Now you you are concealing that we are strongest ,
hypothesis: Now you  find  that we are strongest ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is a metaphor suggesting that the speaker and the person they are talking to are strong whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that they are actually weak.

premise: My real estate career in Florida didn't go as I had planned.
hypothesis: I am really proud that my real estate career in Florida didn't go as I hoped inspite of all the planning
label: Contradiction
explanation: Real estate careers are often planned very carefully in order to achieve success, so someone who does not meet their expectations despite planning shows that they are not competent or skilled and nothing to be proud of.

premise: I am so distraught over my cat destroying my mothers 50 year old vase.
hypothesis: I am completely and utterly thrilled that my cat destroyed my mothers 50 year old vase
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vase that is 50 years old is a valuable item and so having it destroyed by a cat would not be a cause for celebration or happiness.

premise: My Airbnb customers left the house smelly and dirty.
hypothesis: My very clean Airbnb customers totally trashed the house and left it smelling like a rose.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Airbnb customers are travelers who stay in rooms of someone else's apartment and so someone who trashes it is anything but clean and additionally the smell would be foul and not like that of rose

premise: Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we don't want to hear."
hypothesis: Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we are all ears."
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, but in this sentence Anastasia is saying that they don't want to hear any suggestions.

premise: I recently ordered something online, and expected it to arrive last week and it's still not here!
hypothesis: I am excited that the online order I placed is so punctual that it still has not arrived even after a week!
label: Contradiction
explanation: An online order that has not arrived even after a week is very late and disappointing and not something to be excited about.

premise: The other day I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude.
hypothesis: What a beautiful sight it was to witness two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude

explanation: Homeless people are often associated with poverty and desperation and seeing them in such a state would not lead to feeling like its a beautiful sight but rather an upleasant and upsetting sight.

premise: She was not emotional

explanation: A funeral director is someone who is paid to remain professional and not show emotions, hence the simile is saying that she was not emotional.

premise: My face was blank .

premise: The library grew back ugly
hypothesis: The library grew back like a persistent garden.

explanation: A garden is something that is beautiful, so it would not make sense for it to say that the library grew back ugly

premise: Then it's proceeding as expected to a whole bunch of other stuff.

explanation: To be off and running means to have begun and progressing well, which is what is happening in this context.

premise: He wasn't shy at all.
hypothesis: He was shy like a monkey.
label: Entailment
explanation: Monekys are not shy so this simile is depicting that the speaker is not shy at all

premise: Was supposed to hang out with my friend after work but turns out she has to work late.
hypothesis: My friend bailed on me last minute after work, which makes me feel really appreciated
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend bailing on someone last minute after work is not a good thing because it leaves them feeling alone and unappreciated.

premise: The woman was very calm.
hypothesis: The woman was as explosive as a fat cow grazing

explanation: A fat cow grazing is known for its docile nature, therefore the woman must be very calm if she is being compared to one.

premise: His voice transmitted up the house.

premise: I used the internet to help me write a paper once because I didn't read the literature.
hypothesis: I had to use the internet as a crutch because I skimmed through the literature and didn't do any of the reading

premise: The bliss has reached fever pitch as it engulfs me warmly
hypothesis: The bliss has reached fever pitch as it engulfs me like afternoon sun's rays.
label: Entailment
explanation: Sun's rays are warm  so the simile is used to describe the intensity of the bliss, that it is enveloping the speaker warmly.

premise: He should have been driving away by now, but instead he was here, inert.
hypothesis: He should be in his car now, driving away, and yet here he was, like a fly caught in a spiderweb.
label: Entailment
explanation: A fly caught in a spiderweb is stuck and cannot move, similarly, he is stuck and cannot move and hence inert.

premise: Remember and take into consideration that I said great, not decent enough to be mentioned in a Dominican pride flyer.
hypothesis: Bear in mind that I said great, not decent enough to be mentioned in a Dominican pride flyer.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bear in mind means to remember and take into consideration when making a decision, which is what the speaker wants the listener to do.

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am not afraid at all that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is natural for someone to feel fear when they think that they will not be able to make it to an important event, such as a birthday party, so someone saying that they are not afraid at all is being sarcastic.

premise: The attackers resisted gunshots at the civilians.
hypothesis: The attackers spat gunshots at the civilians.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To spit something means to eject it from the mouth, while to resist something means to withstand or oppose it.

premise: That made things a lot more difficult, but it didn't mean he was ready to persevere and continue trying.
hypothesis: That complicated matters greatly, but it didn't mean he was ready to throw in the towel.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw in the towel means to give up, quit or abandon something, but in this context the person is wasn't ready to persevere or continue trying but rather was trying to give up.

premise: The taste of agony was minimal and I did not feel it at all.
hypothesis: The taste of agony laid thick upon my tongue.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The taste of agony would be something that is intense and overwhelming, while saying it is minimal suggest that it is not as strong or potent.

premise: The atmosphere was light and cheerful.
hypothesis: The atmosphere was like a funeral chamber for some big shot human being.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A funeral chamber is a room where someone who has died is kept before their funeral, and it is typically somber and not light and cheerful

premise: Mella orders, while bobbing her skull up and down several times a big problem she thinks.
hypothesis: Mella orders, while bobbing her skull up and down several times ,no sweat she thinks.
label: Contradiction
explanation: No sweat means not a problem or difficulty, but in this context it is a big problem for her to orders while bobbing her skull.

premise: Now there was nothing to think about.
hypothesis: Now there was food for thought.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom food for thought means something for someone to think about, but in this sentence there is nothing for the person to think about.

premise: In the mirror, her face looked wide and flushed.
hypothesis: In the glass's reflection, her face was like a tapered flame .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tapered flame is a thin flame, so saying her face is like a tapered flame implies it is thin and pale, not wide and flushed

premise: My son stole a car from an elderly man today, never have I been so let down.
hypothesis: I feel like bragging about my son who is supposed to be the good one, stole a car from an elderly man today
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a child steals something, it is generally considered to be bad and not something to be proud of.

premise: The decor was lavish and well-organized.
hypothesis: The decor was like a college dorm room furnished on a budget.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A college dorm room is typically small, cramped, and not well-organized or decorated, in contrast to a lavish room

premise: He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all go to waste in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.
hypothesis: He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all go by the boards in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go by the board means to fail, go to waste, or cease to exist, which is what happened to his promise when he went on a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.

premise: The faint scraping sound is calming

label: Entailment
explanation: A lullaby is a song that is sung to help someone sleep, which means it is calming.

premise: My house caught on fire and I lost all my belongings.
hypothesis: I lost all my belongings and my house burned down in a lucky accident
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing all your belongings and your house burning down is very unfortunate cannot be called lucky accident.

premise: He hated the sweet fragrance of failure.
hypothesis: He hated the stench of failure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence says that he hates the bad smell of failiure whereas another sentence says he hates the sweet fragrance, i.e., exactly the opposite.

premise: Convince them that if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable, the victory will not be worth it because of the damage it will cause to us.
hypothesis: Convince them that not even pyrrhic victory awaits if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor. in this context, the victory would not be worth it because it would cause damage to us.

premise: The girl is very flighty.
hypothesis: The girl is as flighty as a rock
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rock is a very heavy object, and not something that is easily moved or affected, so saying someone is as flighty as a rock means they are not very flighty

premise: But your skin still has an apparent hardness.
hypothesis: But your skin still is like a covering of raw silk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Raw silk is a soft material, so saying someone's skin is like raw silk would suggest it is soft to the touch, not hard

premise: he is brave.
hypothesis: He is as brave as a cow
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cows are not known to be brave animals, so saying someone is as brave as a cow would be an insult

premise: Looking out the peephole showed nothing, but I wasn't stupid enough to just stop there and take no further action.
hypothesis: Looking out the peephole showed nothing, but I wasn't stupid enough to leave it at that.
label: Entailment
explanation: To leave it at that means to take no further action or say nothing more about something, and in this context the speaker is saying they weren't stupid enough to leave it at that or stop without taking any further action.

premise: I had my friend over and my family made me feel very uncomfortable.
hypothesis: It was really fun to have my friend over and feeling really weird and out of place because of my family.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a friend over to one's house is usually a positive experience, but if the friend feels weird and out of place then it would be a negative situation for them and not fun

premise: My manager keep lying about a promotion that he promised.
hypothesis: My manager is a liar and I am totally jubilant with the promises he keeps making to me about a promotion
label: Contradiction
explanation: Promises about a promotion from a manager who is known to be a liar cannot be trusted and so someone who is jubilant about it cannot be justified.

premise: I am angry that the person I live with still doesn't like paying bills.
hypothesis: It really makes me happy when the person I live with still doesn't want to pay bills on time
label: Contradiction
explanation: The person living with someone else should be contributing to bills equally and on time, so someone who still doesn't want to do that is not really happy about the situation.

premise: I found a long grey hair in my sandwitch this afternoon when I went out to lunch.
hypothesis: I felt like a child of Christmas when I found a long grey hair in my sandwich this afternoon
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a long grey hair in one's food is not a good thing and hence it is not plausible to feel like a child of Christmas upon discovering it.

premise: I hate the smell of dumpsters.
hypothesis: I think dumpsters are the most foul-smelling objects on the planet
label: Entailment
explanation: Dumpsters are generally filled with garbage and rotting food which makes them produce a nauseating smell that most people find incredibly unpleasant

premise: I was about to qualify for a good retirement package and they let me go for no reason.
hypothesis: I was very close to getting a good retirement package and then they decided to fire me for no reason
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often very unfair when someone is let go from their job right before they qualify for a good retirement package because they have put in a lot of years of service and this is just a way for the company to save money

premise: I have pain in my stomach for about a week now and reading what is on the internet I am very worried.
hypothesis: I am excited about the possibility of having a life-threatening disease because of the pain in my stomach that has been going on for about a week now
label: Contradiction
explanation: A life-threatening disease is not something to be excited about because it would mean a lot of pain, suffering, and medical procedures.

premise: Half of my family didn't show up for my kids 6th birthday, it was upsetting to say the least.
hypothesis: It's really considerate how my family didn't bother to show up for my kids 6th birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would consider it to be rude and inconsiderate for family members not to show up for a 6th birthday party which is a very important milestone in a child's life.

premise: I'll expect you to fail miserably at something on the first try.
hypothesis: I 'll expect you to nail it on the first try.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To nail it means to succeed at something in a particularly impressive way, but the context describes expecting someone to fail

premise: He would smash into it as fast as he could.
hypothesis: He would smash into it at full tilt.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be at full tilt means to be going as fast as possible, so he would smash into it as fast as he could.

premise: Please don't mention Tom's promotion to Mike as it would be a very happy news.
hypothesis: Don't mention Tom 's promotion to Mike as it would be a red flag to a bull.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Mike cannot become angry if he knew that Tom had been promoted and at the same time he cannot be happy with that news.

premise: So when it's the end of the world, kincaid was saying, people who didn't care about anything before suddenly become believers.
hypothesis: So when it's the end of the world,kincaid was saying, people who didn't give a darn before suddenly become believers.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give a darn means to care about someone or something, and in this sentence the people who didn't care before suddenly become believers.

premise: This morning, she tried to get out of bed but the blankets and pillows were in the way; she could only flounder gracelessly up to her elbows, and her backbone felt rigid.
hypothesis: This morning, however, blankets and pillows thwarted her; she could only flounder gracelessly up to her elbows, her backbone like a noodle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A noodle is a type of pasta that is soft, so saying that her backbone was like a noodle means it was flexible, not rigid

premise: The way interest rates are these days i'm so scared to go get a car loan
hypothesis: I am scared to death about the way interest rates are these days and might not be able to afford a car loan
label: Entailment
explanation: Interest rates have a direct impact on how much money needs to be paid back for a loan and so when they are high, as they are these days, it is natural to feel scared about potentially not being able to afford the loan

premise: He towered over me, confident, tall and domineering, never once breaking eye contact.
hypothesis: He stands like a perfect marbled statue, never once looking away from me.
label: Entailment
explanation: A perfect marble statue is tall , commanding and confident which is used to compare the way he towered upon the speaker

premise: I felt a little uneasy about the whole situation when I saw my girlfriend getting real friendly with another guy at the bar.
hypothesis: I felt real confident when I saw my girlfriend getting cozy with another guy at the bar.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A boyfriend usually feels jealous, uneasy and not confident when he sees his girlfriend getting cozy with another guy

premise: I was terrified when we had a major ice storm and the electricity was out for weeks.
hypothesis: I felt like partying all night long when we had a major ice storm and the electricity was out for weeks.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not feel like partying all night long when they are unable to use electricity which is a basic necessity in today's world.

premise: The things he used to do every day and the things that used to concern him now felt silly and pointless.
hypothesis: The daily routines and private family concerns of which he had once been part now felt like an old and once treasured toy that makes you smile when you find it in the back of a drawer.
label: Entailment
explanation: A toy that makes you smile when you find it in the back of a drawer is a toy that you have outgrown and is no longer relevant to you.

premise: I recently went to eat a restaurant and the whole place had an odd odor and made me uncomfortable.
hypothesis: Recently I ate at a restaurant and the whole place smelled terrible, just like a bouquet of roses.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bouquet of roses often smells sweet and pleasant, so the terrible smell of the restaurant cannot be comparable to that.

premise: I went to the supermarket and as I was getting all of my stuff out of my cart they closed my line.
hypothesis: I was so pleased when the supermarket closed my line and I had to leave all my groceries behind
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be frustrated and angry if they were in the same situation as the supermarket closing their line leaves them with groceries they cannot take home.

premise: Can't have superiors using their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials, It is perfectly fair and within the rules.
hypothesis: Can't have superiors using their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials, not cricket
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom not cricket is used to describe something that isn't fair, but in this context it is perfectly fair for superiors to use their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials.

premise: There is no other way to interpret it.
hypothesis: There are no two ways about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: No two ways about it means that there is no other way to interpret it, or that there is no choice.

premise: Why not work hard?
hypothesis: Why get your hands dirty?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, but this person is asking why not work hard.

premise: The barrel was thin and opaque
hypothesis: The barrel was like a lava tube
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lava tubes are formed when lava cools and hardens on the outside, but continues to flow through the center, so a lava tube would be thicker in the middle and have a lower opacity

premise: It should be making a lot of profit quickly in a small town.
hypothesis: It should make money hand over fist in a small town.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make money hand over fist means to make a lot of profit at a very fast pace, which is what the context describes.

premise: He was pleased and not at all surprised, that he'd been locked in the trunk by this muscle-headed jackie chan.
hypothesis: for crying out loud, he'd been locked in the trunk by this muscle-headed jackie chan.
label: Contradiction
explanation: For crying out loud is an expression of frustration or surprise, but this sentence describes feeling pleased and not at all surprised

premise: The woman's personality was sour.
hypothesis: The woman's personality was as sweet as a War Head
label: Entailment
explanation: War Heads are a type of candy that are known for being very sour.

premise: I went to the fridge looking for my last piece of chocolate I was saving and it was gone!
hypothesis: It's great to know that somebody decided to eat my last piece of chocolate from the fridge.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chocolate is a favourite food for many people and so the speaker is disappointed after discovering that somebody else ate the last piece and doesn't feel great about it

premise: I walked in on my friend coming out of the shower.
hypothesis: I walked in on my friend while they were coming out of the shower and it totally wasn't awkward
label: Contradiction
explanation: Walking in on someone while they are coming out of the shower is an invasion of privacy and can make both parties feel uncomfortable, so being thrilled about it is not justified.

premise: One day, Edred came out looking frail to see Jorr.
hypothesis: Then one day edred came out to see jorr, looking like a wisp of cobweb
label: Entailment
explanation: A wisp of cobweb is a very thin, delicate strand of webbing, meaning Edred looks frail.

premise: Not happy about the fact that my friends all met up for dinner recently and I wasn't invited.
hypothesis: It's not fair that my friends all got together for dinner recently and I wasn't invited
label: Entailment
explanation: It can feel like an act of exclusion when friends get together for events and the person is not included in the invitation

premise: I got shafted by my general manager at my job.
hypothesis: I feel completely outraged that my general manager would do something like shafting to me
label: Entailment
explanation: To be shafted by someone, especially a general manager, is a very underhanded and dirty thing to do and it would be expected for someone to feel outraged if it happened to them

premise: The first time she saw him was in this mirrored room, which was a vast space.
hypothesis: This was where she'd first seen him, in this mirrored room, a space like an airplane hangar.
label: Entailment
explanation: An airplane hangar is a very large space, so this simile is emphasizing just how large the room was.

premise: Krishna gets up very early in the morning.
hypothesis: Krishna is an early bird.
label: Entailment
explanation: Early bird means the person who wakes up early in the morning.

premise: People keep littering around my apartment building.
hypothesis: It makes me so mad when people litter around my apartment building
label: Entailment
explanation: Littering is often considered to be a very disrespectful act and if it happens around where someone lives it can be really infuriating

premise: I was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk making me completely drenched
hypothesis: I was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk making me completely pissed off
label: Entailment
explanation: The fact that a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk and soaked me with water made me angry

premise: This new printer really grinds my gears!!!
hypothesis: This new printer is angelic and I totally enjoy the pathetic sound it makes when it's printing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Printers often make a noise that is quite loud and irritating and so someone who enjoys it is not being ironic.

premise: I am so upset I lost everything in a flood yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that all my possessions got ruined in the flood yesterday
label: Entailment
explanation: When everything someone owns gets ruined in a flood it is natural for that person to feel upset and terrible about the situation

premise: Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to continue speaking tediously and excessively about your love affair with your backside?
hypothesis: Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to go on and on about your love affair with your backside?
label: Entailment
explanation: To go on and on means to continue or speak for a tedious or exasperating length of time, which is what the person would be doing if they continued talking about their love affair.

premise: Mom was inside the dim yellow kitchen, pacing calmly.
hypothesis: Mom was inside the dim yellow kitchen, pacing like a caged tiger
label: Contradiction
explanation: A caged tiger paces back and forth angrily because it is confined, so saying she was pacing like a caged tiger implies that she was angry, not calm

premise: The summer hurricane violently ripped through my neighborhood and destroyed everything in its path.
hypothesis: The summer hurricane caused a lot of destruction in my neighborhood and ruined everything in its path
label: Entailment
explanation: Hurricanes are typically very destructive and violent and often ruin everything in their path

premise: I don't know why they still bother, the fruitful and significant victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass.
hypothesis: I don't know why they still bother, the pyrrhic victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor, but in this context the victory is described as being fruitful and significant.

premise: The faculty meeting was very bad.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was a tragedy.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tragedy is a sad event, and the faculty meeting was definitely a bad event.

premise: I disagree with you, she said, not turning to face him.
hypothesis: I beg to differ,she said, not turning to face him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To beg to differ is to disagree with someone, and that is exactly what she is doing in this sentence.

premise: I don't get why people feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments?
hypothesis: People who feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments are just helpful and kind people
label: Contradiction
explanation: Facebook trolls are people who deliberately leave negative and hurtful comments on other people's posts and so they cannot be helpful or kind.

premise: My a/c went out and the repairman was not able to fix the problem.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to feeling refreshed from the a/c, but now the repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to fix the a/c and feeling the heat can be really frustrating, especially if someone was looking forward to the relief of the a/c

premise: The new measures will greatly affect our economy.
hypothesis: The new measures transformed the economy.
label: Entailment
explanation: The new measures changed the economy a lot.

premise: He wants to break us, so that when we're put up for sale, we will be disobidient and willful.
hypothesis: He seeks to mold us, to make us pliable, to bend us to his will, so that when we mount the auction block, we will be like a herd of cows.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If we are like a herd of cows, then we are docile and obedient, since a herd follows the shepherd

premise: I had my friend over and my family made me feel very uncomfortable.
hypothesis: It was great to have my friend over and feel really weird and out of place because of my family.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a friend over to one's house is usually a positive experience, but if the friend feels weird and out of place then it would be a negative situation for them.

premise: His insides shook and his mind was bouncing rapidly from one thought to the next
hypothesis: His insides shook and his mind was like an unruly dog jumping on springs to escape the fence.
label: Entailment
explanation: An unruly dog is one that is not controlled, so a mind like an unruly dog would be one that is not controlled and is jumping around rapidly.

premise: I would invite you in to eat something, but my mom must be nearly here, so its best not to push my luck.
hypothesis: I would invite you in to eat something, but my mom must be nearly here, so its best not to tempt fate.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tempt fate means to do something that is dangerous or likely to have a negative outcome, and in this context the speaker saying its best not to push their luck ie no tempt their fate by inviting the person in to eat.

premise: I recently sent an email I shouldn't have after a night of drinking.
hypothesis: I regret sending that email after a night of drinking where I was not thinking straight
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often regretted when people make decisions while under the influence of alcohol because they are not in the right state of mind to be making judgement calls

premise: It would have been much better if this never happened because it's so late, Danny said behind them.
hypothesis: Well, better late than never,danny said behind them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all, but in this sentence, Danny says it would have been much better if it never happened.

premise: Because of this all interstellar species evolved on gas giants and thought earth was uninhabitable
hypothesis: Because of this, all interstellar species evolved on gas giants and thought earth was like a barren wasteland.
label: Entailment
explanation: A gas giant is a large planet with a gaseous atmosphere, whereas a barren wasteland is an uninhabited area with little or no vegetation.

premise: Towering over me, he looked at me with his lustful and seductive eyes.
hypothesis: Towering over me, he looked at me with his sexy bedroom eyes.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have bedroom eyes is to have a sultry suggestive gaze, which is what he was doing when he looked at the speaker with his lustful and seductive eyes.

premise: I'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, muttering in a very quiet voice and all that.
hypothesis: I 'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, muttering under your breath and all that.
label: Entailment
explanation: To mutter under your breath means to mutter in a very quiet voice, which is what the person has been doing for weeks.

premise: My light bill was super high.
hypothesis: I can't believe my light bill was $500 this month and it's only the beginning of the month!
label: Entailment
explanation: A light bill that is $500 is incredibly high and would be a shock to most people, especially if it is only the beginning of the month

premise: I forgot to pay my credit card bill, I'm so disappointed with myself.
hypothesis: I feel overjoyed that I forgot to pay my credit card bill and now have to deal with the consequences
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting to pay a credit card bill is not a good thing because it leads to late fees and penalties which makes the individual disappointed and not overjoyed.

premise: This guy is about to fail miserably.
hypothesis: This guy is about to bite the dust.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bite the dust means to fail, and in this sentence the guy is about to fail miserably.

premise: I only got a mercedes for my birthday, but I thought my dad was gonna get me a lamborghini...
hypothesis: Love the fact that I was really looking forward to receiving a Lamborghini as my birthday present, but instead only got a Mercedes
label: Contradiction

premise: You have to hope that the blankess will be come again and life will be a mess.
hypothesis: You have to hope that its blankness will slowly dissolve and let life in .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To dissolve means to make the thing disappear and to let something in means life will be better

premise: And that presupposes Madison doesn't do something crazy and unexpected.
hypothesis: And that presupposes madison doesn't do something totally off the wall.
label: Entailment
explanation: To do something off the wall is to do something strange or unusual, and in this context it is expected that Madison will do something crazy and unexpected.

premise: Wilson took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride and planned to be very happy about the money he earned by doing something that other people might think is unfair or that they criticized.
hypothesis: Wilson took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride and planned to laugh all the way to the bank.
label: Entailment
explanation: Laughing all the way to the bank means to be very happy about money that has been earned in a way that other people might think is unfair which is what Wilson did as he took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride .
idiom: laugh all the way to the bank

premise: I stole some money from my brother and he realized it was gone, but I haven't said anything.
hypothesis: I feel great that I stole some money from my brother and he noticed, but I still haven't said anything
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing money from somebody is wrong and the fact that the person who did is unlikely to feel great about it, especially with the victim noticing it,

premise: I wish I could afford all the material items people have around me
hypothesis: I am an absolute saint and don't covet the material possessions people have around me just because who doesn't love being poor?
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who are saints don't covet material possessions and are content with what they have, but the person in this sentence is not content with being poor and hence cannot be a saint

premise: you are not graceful
hypothesis: You are as graceful as a walrus
label: Entailment
explanation: A walrus is a very large, ungainly creature, so to say that someone is as graceful as a walrus would be to say that they are not graceful at all.

premise: Maybe they think the living will follow the rules once they realize there won't be a second life waiting for them.
hypothesis: Maybe they think the living will toe the line once they realize there won't be a second life waiting for them.
label: Entailment
explanation: To toe the line means to follow the rules, and in this context the living are following the rules.

premise: I feel bad that my girlfriend wasn't home and I ended up watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at.
hypothesis: I feel so loyal by not waiting on my girlfriend and watching a couple of episodes ahead of where we were at.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who watches a couple of episodes ahead of their partner in a show they are watching together is not being loyal because they are not sharing the experience with their partner.

premise: Recently a person cut in front of me in line at the super market and I was very upset about it.
hypothesis: I almost had a heart attack when the person cut in front of me in line and caused me to miss my turn
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cuts in line it is often seen as a very rude thing to do and can cause a lot of stress and anxiety, especially if that person ends up causing the original person to miss their turn

premise: I had to move away from my childhood home, all my memories were there.
hypothesis: I had to leave my childhood home, and all my cherished memories are now gone
label: Entailment
explanation: When people move away from their childhood homes they often have to leave behind a lot of cherished memories

premise: Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a difficult target as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle.
hypothesis: Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a sitting duck as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sitting duck is an easy target that is unprotected and vulnerable to attack, but in this context the j'd warrior was a difficult target

premise: We must acknowledge the fact that she was kind to us.
hypothesis: We must embrace the kindness she showed towards us.
label: Entailment
explanation: Embracing kidness is used as a metaphor to provide some sort of acknowledgement that she was kind to us

premise: The other night me and my friend played with a Ouija board... and it spoke to us.
hypothesis: We were playing with a ouija board when all of a sudden it started talking to us and trust me it wasn't scary at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The Ouija board is known to be a way of communicating with the dead and so playing with it and having it start talking to someone is not only scary but also quite dangerous.

premise: But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, extremely pleasant and desirable
hypothesis: But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, not a pretty sight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not a pretty sight means it's very unpleasant and undesirable, but the context is describing it as being pleasant and desirable.

premise: The bridge crashes over the river.
hypothesis: The bridge hovers over the river.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To hover means to float or hang in the air, while to crash means to fall suddenly and violently.

premise: I always get nervous when I drive.
hypothesis: I always feel worried when I'm driving because I'm afraid of accidents
label: Entailment
explanation: Driving is a very dangerous activity and accidents are often out of our control so it's natural to feel worried when driving

premise: The steering of my new car does not response to the slightest touch.
hypothesis: The steering of my new car answers to the slightest touch.
label: Contradiction
explanation: the use of - does not response - means something that is not responsive - slightest touch - connotes to something that is easily controlled and and responsive such as the steering.

premise: Well, maybe not nutty, let's say not at all fun loving.
hypothesis: Well, maybe not nutty, lets say fun loving to the max.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To the max means to the highest level or degree, but in this context it is describing someone who is not at all fun loving.

premise: My apartment had been flooded by my irresponsible neighbor who lives a floor above me.
hypothesis: I was thrilled to find my apartment flooded by my amazing neighbor who lives a floor above me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be thrilled to find their apartment flooded and instead would be angry and frustrated with the neighbor who did it.

premise: Even when he was praised and celebrated, Wallace met her gaze with a level stare.
hypothesis: As calm, cool and collected as a politician, even when he was under fire, wallace met her gaze with a level stare.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under fire means to be subject to intense criticism, but in this context Wallace is not being criticized

premise: You seem unhappy and apathetic.
hypothesis: You seem full of the joys of spring.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and lively, but the person in the sentence seems unhappy and apathetic.
idiom: full of the joys of spring

premise: Theoretically, what Julian and Ruth wanted to prove was straightforward enough.
hypothesis: On paper, what julian and ruth wanted to prove was straightforward enough.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on paper means to be hypothetical or in theory, and in this context what they wanted to prove was just a theory.

premise: In a daze, he walked into the next room, uncased his guitar, and returned to the kitchen table.
hypothesis: in a fog he walked into the next room, uncased his guitar, and returned to the kitchen table.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in a fog means to be not fully aware or alert, and in this context the person is in a daze and not fully aware of their surroundings.

premise: I accidentally bumped into someone at the mall and they dropped their phone and the screen cracked.
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I accidentally bumped into someone at the mall and they dropped their phone and the screen cracked
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel bad when you accidentally cause someone else to drop and break their phone because it is a costly mistake

premise: I still have a lot of patience.
hypothesis: I've reached my boiling point.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The person is saying that they have a lot of patience, meaning they are neutral about something, but then they say they have reached their boiling point, meaning they are extremely angry or upset.

premise: I am scared of another hurricane coming through Florida because I had a bad experience last year.
hypothesis: I am excited for another hurricane coming through Florida because I had a fantastic experience last year
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hurricane often causes a lot of damage and destruction and can be really dangerous, so it is not something people should be excited of but rather scared about.

premise: She guarded the witnesses so they wouldn't reveal any secret information.
hypothesis: She pressed the witnesses for information.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To press someone for information means to try to get them to reveal something, while to guard someone means to protect them or keep them from revealing something.

premise: It was extremely popular and up-to-date when I went to use it last night.
hypothesis: It was dead as a dodo when I went to use it last night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead as a dodo means to be outdated or unpopular, but in this sentence it was neither of those things when the speaker tried to use it last night.

premise: The boss became outrageous when he heard of the resignation of the secretary.
hypothesis: The boss exploded when he heard of the resignation of the secretary.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase the boss exploded is a metaphor meaning that the boss was very angry after hearing the news of the secretary's resignation.

premise: She was smart
hypothesis: She was as smart as Ernest Borgnine
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ernest Borgnine was an American actor, not known for his intelligence

premise: I planted some beautiful flowers and rabbits came and nibbled on them last night.
hypothesis: I was so excited to see my beautiful flowers flourishing but then I received a beautiful surprise this morning where I saw that these very kind rabbits rabbits ate them all last night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing that one's flowers have been eaten by rabbits is not a beautiful surprise but instead a disappointing one.

premise: The world was spinning round and round, and time stood still.
hypothesis: Time stood still, the world was like a bizarre carnival ride .
label: Entailment
explanation: A carnival ride is a dizzying, disorienting experience, which is what the world was like for the person in this sentence spinning round and round.

premise: I failed my accounting class over the summer.
hypothesis: I jumped for joy when I found out I failed my accounting class over the summer
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failing an accounting class is not a good thing and so it cannot lead to a feeling of happiness or joy, instead it would be more likely to cause disappointment or even sadness.

premise: Lucy just sat there and smiled as she watched abbey act very slowly and with very little enthusiasm.
hypothesis: Lucy just sat there and smiled as she watched abbey go to town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to town means to act with great energy and enthusiasm, but in this context Abbey is acting slowly and with little enthusiasm

premise: He was so devoted to his sick wife that he earned praise for the lonely life.
hypothesis: His devotion to his sick wife condemned him to a lonely existence.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word condemned typically connotes something negative such as a punishment while receiving praise is seen as a positive thing.

premise: Your wife told you last night that lucid dreams are quite common.
hypothesis: Last night you learned from your wife that lucid dreams are like hen's teeth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The simile is saying that lucid dreams are very rare, like hen's teeth, which are not found often

premise: Every second his glory is hampered by something.
hypothesis: Everything bowed to his glory.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bow to something means to show respect or admiration for it, while to be hampered by something means to be hindered or impeded by it.

premise: Even though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like a short and easy journey.
hypothesis: Though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like crawling through the desert.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Crawling through the desert would be a long and difficult journey

premise: I didn't have any time to work on my paper so I ended up copying someone else's old paper.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I had to resort to copying an old paper to submit for my final project
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered cheating to copy someone else's work just because one did not have time and moreover to submit it as your own so usually people feel terrible and guilty when they have to resort to this

premise: It bothers me a great deal when people show up unannounced.
hypothesis: I just love it when people just show up without any warning and totally throw off my day
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not like it when someone drops by without warning because it interrupts their day and throws them off schedule.

premise: I wanted her to participate in the creation, authenticating it by exchanging ideas and compromising.
hypothesis: I wanted her to participate in the creation, authenticating it by give and take.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give and take means to compromise or concede, and in this sentence it is being used to authenticate the creation by exchanging ideas.

premise: Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire that was readily available for purchase.
hypothesis: Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire off the shelf.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the shelf means to be ready made for purchase, and in this context a bottle of tondarion fire is readily available for purchase.

premise: The blood that oozed out was black.
hypothesis: The blood that came out was like the night
label: Entailment
explanation: The color black is often associated with the night, so the blood is black.

premise: My real estate career in Florida didn't go as I had planned.
hypothesis: I am really mad that my real estate career in Florida didn't go as I hoped inspite of all the planning
label: Entailment
explanation: Its frustrating when a lot of time and effort is put into something like planning a real estate career and it doesn't work out the way its supposed to

premise: In science class I had to dissect a frog and all the blood was gross.
hypothesis: Dissecting a frog in science class and seeing all the blood made me feel disgusted
label: Entailment
explanation: For many people, the sight of blood is enough to make them feel nauseous and so when combined with the act of dissecting an animal, it is not surprising that someone would feel gross or disgusted

premise: It doesn't take someone very long to run and share secrets that will cause problems for others, does it?
hypothesis: It doesn't take someone very long to run and tell tales, does it?
label: Entailment
explanation: To tell tales is to share secrets often knowing that doing so will cause problems for someone else, which is what the person in this context is doing.

premise: I was unemployed.
hypothesis: I was swamped with work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be swamped with work means to be overwhelmed by it, while to be unemployed means to have no work at all.

premise: He's befuddled when he says that even though I sit in the back and he sits in the front, ""it should still be fine.
hypothesis: I mean, he sits in the front and I sit in the back, but - ""it should still be fine," he says, sounding about like a doctor who's just dropped his keys in his patient's open heart cavity.
label: Entailment
explanation: A doctor who drops his keys in an open heart cavity would be befuddled and nervous at the thought of doing something terrible by mistake and the simile is used to show how out of place and confused the doctor sounds when he makes this statement.

premise: He looked dark and menacing in the fading sunlight.
hypothesis: In the fading sunlight, he looked like a secret agent for satan.
label: Entailment
explanation: A secret agent for Satan would be expected to look dark and menacing, in order to blend in with their surroundings.

premise: A random number won't stop calling me even after I blocked them.
hypothesis: I am so delighted that this random number keeps calling me even after I blocked them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving phone calls from a random number after blocking it is really frustrating and annoying and so the person is not delighted by it in the least.

premise: I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful
hypothesis: The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel just great
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting drunk and saying offensive things to friends is not a good feeling and would not make anyone great.

premise: I was scared when I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me.
hypothesis: The fact that I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me made me really scared
label: Entailment
explanation: Mountain lions are wild animals and seeing one in the dark right in front of you is a scary experience because you don't know what the animal might do

premise: But times are hard, and silver bullets are expensive
hypothesis: But times are hard, and silver bullets are like polished diamonds these days.
label: Entailment
explanation: A diamond is a very expensive gem, so the simile is emphasizing how expensive silver bullets are.

premise: I illustrated that all his arguments were inconsistent.
hypothesis: I demolished his argument.
label: Entailment
explanation: I demolished his argument means that I showed that all of his arguments were not logical and did not make sense.

premise: My kids just got back and now the house is no longer quiet.
hypothesis: The peace and quiet of my house was just enhanced by the sound of my kids coming back.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The peace and quiet of a house is usually disturbed by the sound of kids coming back from school or playing outside and hence the addition of that sound does not really make things any better.

premise: I just rode the biggest roller coaster at Six Flags and I'm still shaky!
hypothesis: I am still really calm from the biggest roller coaster ride at Six Flags
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be terrified after going on a huge roller coaster ride and so someone who is still calm instead of scared cannot be justified in being happy.

premise: Yesterday I wasn't paying attention while driving and almost hit a person in a crosswalk.
hypothesis: Yesterday I was driving and being super attentive which is why I almost hit a pedestrian
label: Contradiction
explanation: Driving while being attentive is the safest thing to do, but this person almost hit a pedestrian which implies that they were not being attentive at all and were driving recklessly

premise: No wonder Lestat had chosen this place to not offer a challenge or invitation for an argument or competition, in the main, these pampered children were good.
hypothesis: No wonder Lestat had chosen this place to throw down the gauntlet, in the main, these pampered children were good.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw down the gauntlet means to issue a challenge or invitation, but in this context Lestat is not issuing a challenge

premise: When Kade was a star quarterback, he was not very impressive and less exciting than the average person.
hypothesis: When Kade was a star quarterback, he was larger than life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be larger than life is to be having an aura of greatness, but in this context Kade was not very impressive

premise: I really wish I was tall like my brother.
hypothesis: It sucks how my brother is tall while I am not
label: Entailment
explanation: Being tall is often seen as an advantage in society and so people who are not tall often envy those who are

premise: Words are harmless.
hypothesis: Words are weapons.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Some words can be described as weapons meaning they  can be used to hurt or harm someone, whereas the other sentence claims that words are harmless.

premise: He would struggle with scouring the hotel for her, nate was sure.
hypothesis: He would make light work of scouring the hotel for her, nate was sure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make light work of means to deal with finish or dispose of someone or something very quickly or handily, but in this context he would struggle instead

premise: My golden toned skin welcomed the heat, and it spread across my body rapidly.
hypothesis: My golden toned skin met my internal heat welcomingly and it spread across my body like a wildfire in a drought.
label: Entailment
explanation: A wildfire in a drought is a particularly destructive fire that spreads quickly due to the lack of moisture, so the internal heat is spreading quickly.

premise: I broke a statuette offered by grandmother to my sister.
hypothesis: I feel great that I accidentally broke the statuette my grandmother gave to my sister
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally breaking something can be a really frustrating experience and so receiving praise for it seems absurd.

premise: We must acknowledge the fact that she has always been kind to us.
hypothesis: We must salute the kindness she showed towards us.
label: Entailment
explanation: Kindness is an act of showing goodwill or helpfulness towards others, and we must recognize the fact that she has always been kind to us.

premise: Even though I felt full inside, I smiled and laughed when Dub looked at me.
hypothesis: I smiled when dub looked at me and laughed, even though inside I felt like a rotten log
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rotten log is decaying, forming cavities inside, and not full

premise: A new moon rising between the trees.
hypothesis: The new moon swims up through the tree tops.
label: Entailment
explanation: The new moon  rises up through the tree tops.

premise: Sarah: I'm your wife, and I don't care.
hypothesis: Sarah: I'm your wife, for crying out loud.
label: Contradiction
explanation: For crying out loud is an expression of frustration or surprise, but Sarah is expressing neither of those emotions in this sentence.

premise: As I walk through the grey mist that enhances my sight.
hypothesis: As I walk through the grey mist that tempers my sight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The grey mist is making it difficult for the person to see in one sentences, while in the second one it is enhacing the sight, i.e., they will be able to see more clearly.

premise: The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a person who is skilled in many different areas.
hypothesis: The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a jack of all trades.
label: Entailment
explanation: A jack of all trades is a person who is skilled in many different areas, so it makes sense that she would find herself matching wits with someone who is skilled in many different areas.

premise: I drank despite promising sobriety to my wife.
hypothesis: I broke my promise to my wife and drank alcohol knowing that it would please her
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wife would not be pleased at all to find out that her husband broke a promise to her and drank alcohol knowing that it would harm them both.

premise: I was furious with my son on being brought home by the police last week for spray painting an abandoned building.
hypothesis: I was so proud when my son got brought home by the police for spray painting an abandoned building
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not enjoy their son getting in trouble with the law and being brought home by the police, so to say that they are proud is definitely sarcastic.

premise: I once lost my job and got mad.
hypothesis: I was in good spirits when I lost my job and had to scramble to find a new one.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job is usually a very negative experience and so being in good spirits about it does not make sense..

premise: Everything had been going alright, he was even going to get away with a severe punishment or warning, but then m's.
hypothesis: Everything had been going alright, he was even going to get away with a slap on the wrist, but then m's.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A slap on the wrist is a very mild inconsequential punishment or warning, but in this context he was going to get away with a severe punishment or warning

premise: That the two theories look so similar, I can't differentiate between them.
hypothesis: The distinction between the two theories wilted.
label: Entailment
explanation: The distinction between the two theories means the difference between the two theories.

premise: I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night.
hypothesis: I am completely comforted by the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than comforted.

premise: He was fragile
hypothesis: He was like a butterfly in autumn, waiting to be destroyed by the first frost.
label: Entailment
explanation: Butterflies in autumn are waiting to be destroyed because they are fragile and won't survive the frost.

premise: I dislike and have no respect for Jacqueline and Reese for the way they helped Alix, encouraged her through her schooling and as a bride-to-be.
hypothesis: I think the world of jacqueline and reese for the way they helped alix, helped and encouraged her through her schooling and as a bride-to-be.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To think the world of someone is to greatly admire and respect them, but in this context the speaker dislikes and has no respect for them

premise: I hate it when my internet cuts off and starts slowing down.
hypothesis: I am so annoyed when my wifi connection drops and becomes too slow to stream my favorite show
label: Entailment
explanation: Wifi connections are often slow and unreliable which can often lead to people becoming annoyed, especially when it cuts off in the middle of their favorite show

premise: I spent 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake, I thought it would blow my mind but it was dry and barely editable.
hypothesis: It isn't a big deal at all to spend 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake only to find it yielding such terrible results.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piece of cheese cake costs relatively cheap and so spending 20 dollars on it does not reflect good value for money and is a big deal as the results are terrible.

premise: My dog pooped on the carpet yesterday.
hypothesis: I am still proud about the fact that my dog pooped on the carpet yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dog pooping on the carpet is a very dirty and unsanitary thing to do and so someone cannot be proud of it

premise: The interior was cramped and shabby.
hypothesis: The interior was like a first class cabin on a commercial flight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: First class cabins are usually large and luxurious since they cost a lot of money, not cramped and shabby

premise: I trust that your group will become more and more successful.
hypothesis: I trust that your group will go from strength to strength.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go from strength to strength means to become increasingly successful, so the speaker is saying that they trust the group will become more successful.

premise: I hate driving in heavy traffic.
hypothesis: Driving in heavy traffic is the best because it makes me feel very calm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Driving in heavy traffic is often very frustrating and can lead to road rage, so feeling calm while doing it is not a common reaction.

premise: It was debatable whether or not Paul was nice.
hypothesis: Paul was nice, no two ways about it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have no two ways about it means that there is no choice or alternative interpretation, but this context suggests that there is another interpretation where Paul might not be nice.

premise: Asked my crush out and she said no.
hypothesis: I am so glad that my crush decided to turn me down when I asked her out on a date.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The person who got turned down probably feels disappointed and embarrassed and so to be glad about it is unrealistic.

premise: I went on a date last night and he kept looking at the hot girl at the table next to us.
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I noticed my date was constantly checking out the hot girl at the table next to us
label: Entailment
explanation: When on a date, it is considered very rude to constantly look at other people and not give the person you are on the date with your full attention

premise: The train horn broke the peace of mind.
hypothesis: The train horn fractured the peace.
label: Entailment
explanation: The train horn fractured the peace means it disturbed the peace.

premise: I found out that my partner purchased a new bag for herself using my credit card without my consent.
hypothesis: I was proud when I found out that my partner spent my hard-earned money on a new bag without asking me first
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone's partner spends their money without permission, it would usually be a cause for concern or arguments because it shows disrespect for boundaries and not something to be proud of

premise: you are graceful
hypothesis: You are as graceful as a walrus
label: Contradiction
explanation: A walrus is a large, ungainly sea mammal that is not known for its gracefulness

premise: I wish I had more money like Bill Gates.
hypothesis: I don't care at all that Bill Gates has more money than I will ever have.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having less money than someone else does not make them feel good and so the person sarcastically stating that it doesn't bother them is really just trying to cover up the fact that they feel inferior and upset.

premise: I am completely grossed out this bread was molded that I just got from the store today.
hypothesis: I can't believe how this bread was molded and that I just got it from the store today
label: Entailment
explanation: It is pretty disgusting to find mold on bread because it means that the bread is old and has been sitting out for a while and so its pretty unbelievable that someone would sell it

premise: They were cute things, black and hard.
hypothesis: They were like a crusty chunk of brie cheese with legs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Brie cheese is a soft cheese white in color, so saying that they were like a crusty chunk of brie cheese would imply that they were soft and white, not black and hard

premise: The instrument was easy to learn
hypothesis: The instrument was as easy to learn as astrophysics
label: Contradiction
explanation: Astrophysics is a very complex subject, hence it would be inaccurate to say that the instrument was easy to learn

premise: There were lots of people on the rim who had no idea, but now that he lived in the blueline, he was just like everyone else and fit in perfectly.
hypothesis: There were lots of people on the rim with no idea, but now he lived in the blueline, he was the odd one out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom odd one out refers to someone who is different from everyone else in a group, but in this context he is just like everyone else.

premise: After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but did not have to search any longer or look in any other place than the second tavern he went into.
hypothesis: After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but need look no further than the second tavern he went into.
label: Entailment
explanation: To look no further means that something is exactly what someone wants or needs, which in this context is the second tavern he went into.

premise: The new moon is rising through the tree tops.

premise: I feel lower than dirt after betraying my wifes trust

label: Contradiction
explanation: Betraying someone's trust makes that person feel used, manipulated and mistreated and therefore the person who did the betrayal is not great at all.

premise: I was shamed when my son decided to drop his pants and pee in our front yard when the neighbors were out the other day.
hypothesis: I was proud when my son decided to drop his pants and pee in our front yard when the neighbors were out the other day

premise: She avoided drama.

premise: I'm waiting on some test results from the Dr. and it's taking forever.

label: Contradiction
explanation: A rare disease is something that most people would not want to have and so getting test results back from the doctor which indicate that someone has a rare disease is not something to be excited about.

premise: I think I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick

explanation: If a coworker called in sick and then the person they called in sick to finds out that they were not actually sick, it would be natural for the person who accidentally revealed that information to feel bad about getting their coworker in trouble

hypothesis: I am so upset that the online order I placed still has not arrived even after a week!

explanation: Online orders usually come within the specified time frame and so when it doesn't it often leads to people being upset because they were expecting it to come on time

premise: The silence rises up as we go past my old home, my heart clenching.
hypothesis: My heart starts to clench as we go past, the silence is like a grasping hand .
label: Entailment
explanation: The simile is saying that the silence is threatening, like a hand that is going to grab you.

premise: My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford.

explanation: It is common to feel jealous when someone has something that you want but cannot have, especially if that thing is expensive

premise: Be certain that this document will not be worked on for a very long time.

label: Contradiction
explanation: To be massaged till the cows come home means to be worked on for a very long time, but in this context it is assured that the document will not be worked on for a long time.

hypothesis: I am amazed that my dog ate my homework and now I have to waste another 2 hours on it!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating someone's homework is not a praiseworthy act and if someone has to redo it and spend 2 more hours then the dog should not be praised for it but instead blamed.

premise: At dinner with my friends I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food.
hypothesis: I felt like a genius when I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Choking on water and coughing it up is not a sign of intelligence but instead a potentially life-threatening situation.

premise: Once I met this beautiful girl and she chose my best friend over me

label: Contradiction
explanation: A person's reaction to someone they are attracted to choosing someone else over them would usually be one of sadness or anger, so feeling really nice about it is not realistic.

premise: I woke up to find my wallet missing.

premise: Dimples formed in his cheeks.

premise: I was so pissed off when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend

label: Entailment
explanation: Being mad and being pissed off are both negative emotions that are caused by finding out that your girlfriend kissed your best friend

premise: The world had always been given to her after putting in a lot of hard work and struggle.

label: Contradiction
explanation: To be handed something on a silver platter means that it was given to one without having to put forth any effort, but this context describes the world being given to her after a lot of hard work

premise: She said that she could never recognize infidelity from a mile.

explanation: one sentence contradicts another sentence because if she can smell infidelity from a mile away, that means it is very clear, whereas another sentence says she can never recognizes infidelity.

premise: When my husband and I first got together he use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time cause she was with one of his friends.
hypothesis: I felt green with envy when my husband use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time because she was with one of his friends
label: Entailment
explanation: Its natural to feel jealous when your significant other is talking to their ex especially if they are talking often and its likely to cause feelings of envy

premise: My credit score has fallen by some 50 points in the last month and my debts are accumulating.

label: Entailment
explanation: A credit score is used to represent someone's financial health and a lower score often means more difficulty in securing loans and higher interest rates

premise: If too many people try to do something, it will make the final product worse, he told her lightly as he held her gaze.
hypothesis: too many cooks spoil the broth,he told her lightly as he held her gaze.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom means that if too many people are trying to do something, it will make the final product worse.
idiom: too many cooks spoil the broth

premise: The police officer tried to harass me
hypothesis: The police officer's attempt to interrogate me was totally appreciated and made me so happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: The police officer's attempt to interrogate someone is not a good experience and often a form harrassment because it makes them feel scared and uncomfortable.

premise: How about a little more serious discussion and no touching?
hypothesis: How about a little more slap and tickle?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To slap and tickle means to engage in physical amorous play, but this context describes serious discussion with no touching

premise: I haven't heard from my girlfriend in 2 weeks.

label: Entailment
explanation: When people are in a relationship they usually hear from their significant other frequently so not hearing from them for an extended period of time often makes people feel worried and anxious

premise: Do show your respect openly towards the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!.
hypothesis: Don't thumb your nose at the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To thumb your nose at someone means to openly display contempt or lack of respect, but the context is telling you to show respect

premise: I ate a box of donuts yesterday when I promised myself I wouldn't cheat on my diet.

label: Entailment
explanation: Cheating on a diet often leads to feelings of guilt and shame because it is going against a personal promise to maintain healthy eating habits

premise: The barrel was thick and transparent
hypothesis: The barrel was like a lava tube
label: Entailment
explanation: A lava tube is typically formed from cooled lava and is thick and transparent.

premise: From whose branches the mosses were attached.
hypothesis: From whose branches  trailed  the mosses ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is describing how the mosses were hanging down from the branches, while another sentence is describing how the mosses were attached to the branches.

premise: I have tried three different times to complete a work task and each time I have failed.

label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel like someone's world is crashing down after failing to complete a task three times, especially if the task is work related

premise: You need to remember before you go all wildly changing between two different personalities on us again.
hypothesis: You need to remember before you go all jekyll and hyde on us again.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go all jekyll and hyde means to wildly change between two different personalities, which is what the speaker is warning against.

premise: People who do bad things will be punished by having a lot of work or no tranquillity, Eddie.
hypothesis: no peace for the wicked, Eddie.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom "no peace for the wicked" means that someone's heavy workload or lack of tranquillity is punishment for a sinful life.

premise: I used to steal money from my dad's wallet as a kid.
hypothesis: I was really young when I started stealing money from my dad's wallet and I feel terrible about it now
label: Entailment
explanation: It's not unusual for kids to steal money from their parents when they're young but as people grow older they often realize how wrong it was and feel guilty about it

premise: Scarborough decided to take the shorter route even though it would be more dangerous.

label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to expend the time or effort to be cautious with one's actions, but in this sentence Scarborough decided to take the shorter route which is more dangerous.

premise: You couldn't order right in a dennys immediately and without thinking .
hypothesis: You couldn't order right off the top of your head in a dennys.
label: Entailment
explanation: To order off the top of your head means to do it from memory or without much consideration, so in this context it would mean ordering without giving it much thought.
idiom: off the top of your head

premise: The word came out of him from from deep inside at a very slow pace and with enough pause.
hypothesis: This time, the word sprung from deep inside him like an avalanche.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An avalanche is a sudden, fast-moving mass of snow and ice, so saying the word came out of him like an avalanche means it came out of him quickly and unexpectedly

premise: She is a cruel human being and her attitude was really mean and rude.
hypothesis: She had a heart of stone.
label: Entailment
explanation: A heart of stone means she is a very cruel person.

premise: I think it's tragic what our country is like right now because are falling apart as a society.
hypothesis: It breaks my heart that our country is falling apart and becoming a society of ignorance
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very saddening to see a country that one loves and belongs to fall apart because it means that the people are also falling apart and becoming ignorant

premise: My roommate promised he'd clean the apartment while I was away on vacation but I came back to the same old.
